reviews.review: Bosphorus a truly beautiful sightseeing . I love to see the Bosphorus and a 2 hour cruise tour what a time of my life I really enjoyed and get relaxed with shores of quiet sea with light breezing wind I must say this is one of the best tour of my life

A trip worth taking. There are a variety of cruises down the Bosphorus. The longest is about 6 hours and you stop over at a small fishing village at the entrance to the Black Sea .This is a great adventure for all as you sail down the straits with all the history. You get great views and then you arrive for a 3 hours layover.When you arrive at Anadolu Kavagi pass up the restaurants and head up to Yorus Castle. It's a bit of a hike up but the views are spectacular. Then have lunch and enjoy the views up there. Walk back down and shop for souvenirs and have an ice cream before the boat takes you back.I especially enjoyed watching the shipping come through the passage into the straits.It helps you understand how strategically important the strait still is.
Super Cool. This area is amazing. I could see it from the hotel and also took a boat ride. Just great. A really amazing trip.
Best thing . You must drink tea in the Bosphours strait,,, you can watch istanbul and all important places there and feel the good air

Boat cruise. You can take an hour's boat cruise on the Bosphorus from Ortaköy. It takes about 15-20 tl per person and shows you a major chunk of the Bosphorus upto Rumeli Hisar. A nice activity if you've got your friends or family coming over
Boat trip trhu de Bosphorus.. Boat trip trhu de Bosphorus. A must see and must do in Istanbul. Is not an expensive option but good weather is fundamental to enjoy the this sightseeing tour
A trip which leave you speechless. It is must see attraction! Beautiful nature in combination with unbelievable human creations will not leave you unsatisfied!

great place. Cheap boat trips if touts avoided we paid 12tl for a two hour trip go to the kiosk and get your tickets.Tip have a fish in bread for lunch from one of the three boats on the shoreline at 8tl great value and eat it on the steps.
For great views of Istanbul. The cruise is great to appreciate the views of Istanbul. We took the 2 hours cruise around the Bhosphorus. We thought the 6 hour cruise would be too long.

Boat Tour on the Bosphorus.. We took a boat tour along the Bosphorus to the Black Sea. They provided a great buffet lunch with a tour guide pointing out things of interest along the West side of Turkey and then on the East side on the return trip.

Nothing compares to the Bosphorus. The two straits of Turkey, the Bosphorus and the Dardanelles are rather young compared to the earth's age. They were formed after tons of ice melting after the Ice Age, their birth dating back to 7-8000 BC. The Bosphorus is like a river connecting the Black Sea with the Marmara Sea which is an internal sea between the Aegean and the Black seas. However it is not a river, but a salt water strait with strong currents.It is beautiful and no matter how hard we try, we can't destroy its beauty. It changes color with different weather and can vary from green to gray to dark blue. It is lined with Yali's, which are beautiful wooden mansions by the sea. You can take a special ferry down the Bosphorus all the way to a fishermen's town near the Black Sea and see all the Yali's and the beauties of the strait. There are also many cafes and restaurants all along the Bosphorus.It is possible to swim in the Bosphorus but it isn't as clean as some years ago. Also beware of the strong currents.

Experience the beautiful Bosphorus and get a different view of Istanbul. There are tons of ferries which go back and forth across the Bosphorus. You could take the local ferries, used by over a million people a day, to go to work and back or the more touristy ferries which provide brief commentary about the sites you see along the coastline. Either way, its a great experience and will remain as one of your lasting memories of Istanbul. The ferry ride from Eminonu to Uskudar (or Kadikoy) takes no more than 15-20 minutes. Beware that if you're sitting in an open-air ferry, it can get quite cold during the evenings and freezing during winter time.

What makes Istanbul different. It was interesting to visit this area of Istanbul. We took a boat trip which covered both the Bosphorus strait and the Marmaris sea. Great views of Istanbul from the boat.
Can't get my eyes on her!. Beautiful! Beautiful! Take the cruise and so that you could see her closer. Great view from the cruise.

being in two continents: How cool is that. This boat ride on the strait is a must. This experience enthralls you and stays with you forever. Specially the feeling of being between two continents so close, whoa.

Between two continents. A boat ride on the Bosphorous Strait is a must-do. We did it as passengers on a public boat, and it was an exhilarating experience. One also gets views of the sights along the banks, including the Dolmabahce Palace

One of the true "must dos" of Istanbul.. I took the public ferry based on the helpful advice of the forum members. A return trip was 25 lira, which is for the full day. The cruise out to to the Black Sea is stunningly beautiful. With the help of books I was able to identify the landmarks a lot better. Guides are also available. The full day option requires a 3 hour stay in a fishing village. The village is ok, but 3 hpurs may be too long there ( in my opinion). If I would have done things differently, I would have got a single ticket and travelled back independently.

Worth a visit, especially on the the TurYol boat.. This area is beautiful, and way more fun than Fisherman's Wharf! Don't miss hanging out in this area, which is very easy to get to from the Spice Market.

Scenic Bosphorus Tour. The best part about my Istanbul trip was the boat rides on the Bosphorus Strait. I loved the ferry rides. The 90 mins Bosphorus tour is also amazing. The coastline of both the Asian and European sides is so scenic and beautiful with lovely monuments and architecture on both the sides.
Peaceful scenario. Having a bosphorus boat trip you would able to see the other amazing structures of istanbul. You will see the asia side and europe side which divided by this river.

The Bos. Any trip across, along or even a drive with stunning views of the Bosphorus is special while in Istanbul. There is nothing like being in Istanbul on the Bosphorus between two great continents, Asia and Europe. My recent excursion was on a private yacht at sunset which picturesque views of either side while sipping cocktails accompanied by locally made appetizers and good music, a pre-wedding party event for international guests and family friends.
River cruise. A river cruise is one of the best ways to take in so much information of the Bosphorus strait - there are many cruises leaving from close to Eminonu tram station.

Another OMG!. Whatever I say about Bosphorus Strait, I have not said enough! You have to go there and see it with your own eyes to believe it!As I said in a separate review, the city of Istanbul is empty and hardly you see any tourists because of the recent events! I was there for 3-weeks; and just returned home! I should let you know that at no time, I felt unsafe!All I can tell you is to go there and enjoy it!

Splendid cruise. Bosphorus Strait links the Black Sea with the Sea of Marmara and, with the Dardanelles Strait, separates Europe from Asia. It is a former river valley which was drowned by the sea at the end of the Tertiary period. This is a very busy strait with many commercial ships and oil tankers, as well as local fishing and passenger boats. Very pleasant strait to cruise around, marvellous views and relaxing time.
Use a ferry or take a boat tour!!. Amazing photo opportunities along the water when riding on a boat. Very relaxing. It is nice to see the sites from the water side. Enjoy!

Take the ferry. We took the shorter version of 2.5 hours and at first I thought it'll be too long just being on the ferry. It felt like 30 mins, the boat was clean and comfortable. There are also a audio guide in 2 languages. The view were amazing. Must do in Istanbul
Cruisin'. I took a dinner cruise by myself at the recommendation of the hotel. I enjoyed cruising along the water while taking in the sights of the historic buildings and bridges.

Simply a must do, grab a boat trip for alternative views of the city!. Jumping on a boat on the Bosphorus and sailing down it gives very nice views of Istanbul. You can see virtually all of the city and can take trips down the Bosphorus and visit small islands.

A trip on the bosphorus puts east meets west in context. A trip on the bosphorus gives grand views of ancient fortifications, palaces, new and older bridges as well as stately homes on both the european and asian sides. A boot trip is well worth recommending.
Excellent View. Its an experience of a lifetime and the place is beautiful with the view of water, wharf and the tour by the ferry is great too

Everytime a discovery. Visit during the day, look at it during the night... everytime you see something different. Going from a submarine to a dolphin, from sightviews of cruise ships to tankers and everywhere beautiful and historical buildings.

Istanbul from a different point of view.... If you stay in Istanbul more than 2-3 days, then you have to try the Bosphorus tour by ferry!There are several Companies that organize the tour, we tried the one organized by the Public Transportation Company (Sehir Hatlari).The tour starts every morning at 10.35 from Eminonu pier. It takes two hours to reach Anadolu Kavagi at the edge of the black sea. During the trip you will have nice views of Mosques, Palaces and Villas, you will go under the two Bosphorus Bridges and you will stop in front of the brand new third one. The stop lasts approx. 2 hours. The small village of Anadolu Kavagi is just a bunch of fish restaurants fighting to catch as much turists as possible therefore I suggest to climb up to the castle and take your lunch there, enjoying a beautiful view over the Bosphorus and Istanbul (the Castle itself is not interesting but the view pays back).Price: 25 TL per person (approx. 8 €), in my opinion a fair price for a full day tour.

One of the best water ways in the world. Bosphorus is where history, architecture, food, culture, city meets the sea. Its the heart of Istanbul. Take a vapur tour to see the beauty of both coasts, the historic stunning houses.
Amazing view . Very nice place to take a few pictures and to see the sea. The strait is very wide, and has an awesome view. Definitely a must see in Istanbul.

It's what makes Istanbul so exceptional. To enjoy it, you can:- take the shoreline on the European side- take the shoreline on the Anatolian (Asian) side- go to SuAda which is literally in between Europe and Asia on the Strait itself- take the Bosphorus ferry tour (there are many but my all time favorite is Sehir Hatlari line that travels all the way in the Bosphorus from the south - Marmara sea - to the north - Black sea- mainly from the European side, and then from the north to the south mainly from the Asian side in 6-8 hrs with a 2 hr break at Anadolukavagi - where the Strait meets the Black Sea)In any way, you will ENJOY IT!!

Fantastic . We get there from Eminunu tramv station, then we bought tickets from a kiosk, then they take us to a special ships station by a minibus,it was soooo good, the view was fascinating and we enjoyed alot.

Nice view specially at night. There are lots of city tours that go to the strait but me and my wife decided to buy some normal tickets of local ships that go around the strait every 30 mins. The ticket was about 6 euros per person, the ship had a small indoor cafe but there was no alcoholic drink there.We went there before the sunset, the trip is about 1.5 hour so we saw the strait both in daylight and night.Its a relaxing experience and I recommend it in warmer seasons.

A must-do activity in Istanbul. Definitely take a bosphorus boat trip when visiting Istanbul. it onl costs 12 TL (Turkish Lira) or about 3 USD/PP.You will see a lot of interesting spots from the boat that provide an angle of view that you cannot catch when you pass by foot or by bus.

An essential part of Istanbul trip. Traveling the Bosphorus was amazing. We got a chance to see many historical places that were built nearby. The trip was great especially if the weather is nice. There are many companies offering trip deals and can vary considerably. You do not have to travel with a travel agency. You can reach the shoreline and you will find many boats offering the same trip for really cheap.
Nice place. In Bosphours, there are many restaurants and coffee shops with a good a view and a good walk around Bosphous.
Stunning!. The boat tour was my favorite sightseeing in Istanbul. The views are stunning and I loved seeing all the palaces by the water. Make sure the weather is good and bring your camera!

Wonderful views . This is one of the best locations in Istanbul that must visit. We have visited this lovely location many times for a walk and to enjoy the Bosphorus views. There are many coffee shops around where you can enjoy a cup of coffee or tea.
Perfect location

Worth the trip. A cruise up and down the Bosphorus is a `must see` while in Istanbul. There are more boats than tourists so don't pay over 10 TL - you can easily bargain them down for that. They leave from Eminonu pier. Or, take the 'long' or 'short' tour on the government ferries. The long one goes up to the mouth of the Black Sea, lets you out for a fish meal, and then you come back. The short one doesn't go up that far. There are lovely properties along the Bosphorus, you get to see the first two bridges and maybe a glimpse of the new third one and it's a wonderful things to do on a hot day.
The face of Istanbul. Bosporus gives the real identity to Istanbul. It adds beauty to the historical aspect of Istanbul...

Cruise the Bosphorus. We took the cruise on a wekend. It wa crowded, but the forcast for rain the next day would have spoiled the trip. Try to go on a weekday when it is less crowded. However it is a wonderful cruise, and they have electronic guides in many languages for you to take and listen to the sights along the way. You stay long enough at the turn-around for lunch at one of the fine restaurants.
A Sunset to Remember. If you love sunsets , being out on the open waters, watching people and buildings with the wind blowing .. this is for you

Great trip. A boat trip on the Bosphorus is must on anyone's visit to Istanbul. The city is laid out before you with many interesting historical buildings on the banks as well as famous restaurants, houses and landmarks. Good value.

Amazing experience!!. The view through this wonderful strait is so beautiful. We enjoy a lot the boat trip, so great to learn about the city, the buildings and the bridge in the night looks magnificent!!!!

wonderful day. Just went on the local ferry from eminonu on the long tour. 25TL. 1.5 hours there , three hours for eating and exploring Anadolu Kavağı and then back again. Straits are beaufiful, so much to see watch, even passed by a turkish navy submarine.

cruise down the strait. We took a cruise down the Bosphorus Strait! It was informative. It was great to learn new things about the city and its surroundings. One country two continents. It's pretty interesting.

Not mind blowing. Wandered on board for 12 TL. Not sure what all the fuss is about except if you enjoy screaming children and the fact that you 'officially' crossed the bosphorus by water from europe to asia. Views are just ok. Snacks and drinks are served on board. Toilets are crappy, but really for 12 TL who's complaing. Ok to do if you're sick of walking about aimlessly through the streets of Istanbul, or just want a change of pace.
Nice boat trip . The water is rough There are many boats trips to choose Find what suits you best the views on either side are stunning

must do. One of the best experiences in Istanbul Take the long tour. Climb to the castle (Do not take the taxi). It is little hard but then the experience is nothing like anything and bonus... the views.
Great. Very good cruiseBut don't go at 12:00 PM in the summerSun will hurt youGo 05:00 PM but don't forget ur jacket

Interesting but pick the right boat cruise. Interesting boat cruise, but we went in evening so was lot cooler. Perhaps going at or just before sunset would be nice too. Met some lovely people on board. Our boat cruise was spoiled by owners allowing customers to mix cocktail drinks on board and get partially drunk!! So might be worth checking this kind of thing before you hop aboard

A great way to ease yourself into Istanbul. Having only been in Turkey (Istanbul) about 4 hours after a 15 hour flight, I did a Bosphorus Straits boat cruise to ease myself in and get my bearings. And I am glad I did. The sheer size, strategic importance and beauty of the Straits was a perfect way to ease into taking on Istanbul by foot. (Tip: A lot of the tour boats do a short stop closer to the Black Sea point. While getting an ice cream is wonderful on a hot day, these places are for high volume tourism so don’t expect anything unique. Also, if you are one of those picture taking addicts, you may find yourself fighting for a spot on the large boats given the number of people.)

If you renting a car you really don't need to do this trip. I rented a car in Istanbul so while I am driving around and crossing the bridge between Asia and Europe side I have seen the strait from all angles, better than what I have seen from the boat ride itself.If you must experience the boat ride try what I did, I took the public ferry from Taqsim square to the next stop across the strait and back.That was 40 minutes round trip ride for 2 TL a Pax.Don't waist time and money.C U Around

Beautiful way to rest your feet. What better way to relax your feet and legs than to chill on one of the many cruises. There are many shorter ones available than the 7hour ones. Worth doing good to see the sun setting and the colours change over the beautiful city and the lights emerge as darkness falls.
Nice trip. One week or 4-5 days in Istanbul is very nice expirianceIt's romantic it's something from the past its new and old
OK. Very windy, really blue water, strong currents, has political history since it geographically splits Asia and Europe.
Enjoy a cruise . It was a very nice cruise. Very beautiful seens and good service at the ship. Nice for all types of travellers. You might ride the cruise from Ortakoy.

Bosphorus Strait. The Bosphorus Strait comments the Black Sea and Marmara Sea and this Bosphorus strait also devider of Asia and Europe in Intanbul.
If you take a tour on Bosphorus Strait at night or day you will be charmed to see the beauty of Istanbul.

Beautiful view. I must say I just love to sit here and watch everyone from tourists to nationals stopping by to admire this beautiful place. Such a pretty view and lots of little cafes to keep you occupied.
Energizing. Place that divides Asia from Europe. Enormous strait of serenity, beauty and perfect blue sea. Just great!

Sailing the Bosphorus. Sailing the Bosphorus where the East meets the West. The views from the waterway are outstanding and thinking of all the history. This was the travel point into Europe for the silk and spice routes.

read up before you go. The history of the strait is even more astounding than the river tour. Make sure you read up on this before you go. A key site in world history from ancient to modern times, You will enjoy the cruise even more,

The mighty Bosphorus. Once you are done with the Topkapi, you can take a boat / ferry down the Bosphorus. I highly recommend doing so as yo get a full scope of Istanbul from both the Asia and European side. You will also get to see how highly condensed and big this city is...unofficially having 21 million -you will be able to see why. The get off and walk to the Four Seasons for some lunch and a well deserved drink!
Bosphorus-Most stunning. The most stunning views that I have ever seen in my life.Was sitting for almost 4 hours on the bench facing the bosphorus.Must,must visit without fail.

Great views on board. Bosphorus cruise up & down along the asian & european sides of istanbul gives you beautiful views of bosphorus & its 2 coast with several masterpieces include rumeli fort, dolmabahce palace. I am surprise that our ex-president Musharraf graduated from a college on this coast. Inaddition there are house of rich peoples along the asian coast & it is their hobby to come & sit on bosphorus enjoying its waves. We have taken day cruise to enjoy the coasts, otherwise night dinner cruise also available wtih fun shows.
Bosphorus Strait Art. During our tour ride in the Bosphore sea tour we stop by many location and the tour guide was talking about each location , one of them was the Bosphrus Strait

Bosphorus cruise. If you have a few hours to spare, take a boat cruise up and down the Bosphorus. A quick one will be a straight boat ride, a long one will include dinner. See how the rich and famous live on the banks of the strait, note the sryle and sophistication of their home and gardens. Look for details such as the heritage wooden houses, restaurants in the unlikeliest bukldings, private tram cars up the hillside. It is a glimpse into the eveyday life of th Istanbulus which you will bot see on the streets.

Turkish Baroque. Two years renovation to give birth again to another gem on the Bosporus...A beauty and a good example of Turkish Baroque !!! The view directly on a public boot stop is great and you can eat a snack in little restaurant located around or buy some little souvenirs for not a lot of money in this little shops. You will enjoy... The entrance of the mosque is free.

Just sit and observe. Whether you are on a boat, sitting on shore, or walking a bridge,,,find a spot to just sit and enjoy the two continents in one view. Not just that, but the amount of marine traffic, the buildings, the lights,,,all make for an enjoyable time. My wife and I enjoy "soaking" up the areas we visit, and we cruised, walked, and sat, to view all these goings on. Sitting down and watching may not seem like an exciting vacation, but this is a show you can only see one place.

bosphorus. very live enviroment and many things to doistanbul is one of the best cities i have traveledvery live city and many things to do and eati recommend to take a boat to buyuk ada which is like paradise

A must to try. It cost me 8tl for each of us. you can see the magnificent buildings on both sides. Try to check how far is the trip because some companies reach the second bridge and then return. you can get the ferries from eminuno port.

A wonderful boat ride. Had a boat ride along the Bosphorus sea. It is really worth going, lots of buildings and main points of Istanbul to see whilst you are on the boat. If the weather is good, then it is fabulous
Bosphorus!!. Bosphorus is the part that separates the European side of Istanbul from Asian side. Spending an evening here is really refreshing. There are many restaurants on its side.

Amazing. One of my favorite places. The always changing colors of the water from many clours of blue to green. The flow of water changing sometimes flowing from north to south sometimes south to north. Constant change from calm to sometimes raging flow you can never get bored sitting or walking and watching the Bhosphurus. Be there when the sun is rising or when the full moon is shining on it. If you ever visit Istanbul please take a stroll starting from Kurucesme to Rumeli or you can keep going till Emirgan and further. Keep your eyes open for the gorgeous dolphins swimming. There are many Cafes along the way and check out the view from Starbucks four story building in Bebek. Just one annoying factor the fishermen.

Istanbul's marvel. One of the great pleasures of living in Istanbul is getting to see the Bosphorus every day. It's great to spend time on the ferries steaming up and down the straight. And it's a cheap day out seeing the sights, on a hop on hop off tour.

Amazing Waterway. We took an amazing cruise up and down the Bosporus. The banks on both sides are crammed with beautiful architecture. It is almost too much to take in. Our cruise was during the day, but people who have taken a night cruise say that that is beautiful too with so many buildings lit up. Other cruises include a belly dancer. The waters were calm, but the current was very fast and the sea lanes were packed with all variety of ships going every which way.
Great Boat Ride. The only way to see Istanbul is to take a boat ride up the Bosphorous. You really get a great view of the architecture and why this is such an important city.

Pleasant trip. There are many options for the cruise on the Bosphorus but basically there are two kinds: the public ferry or one with a tour company.We took the cheap option by taking the public ferry from Eminonu dock on the south east side of the Galata bridge. The ferry went up to Cubuklu just past the second bridge on the Bosphorus and then turned back. The whole trip took a couple of hours (starting at 2:30 PM). This particular cruise did not make any long stops. For us, a longer trip may have been boring...perhaps because we did not get off during the trip. It was also nice to mix with the locals and not be herded around with tourists.

Magnificent. The top attraction as far as I am concerned – a “must-do.” This natural waterway divides two continents in the world. You can charter an inexpensive cruise trip on the Bosporus and see history close up: fortresses, waterfront communities, mosques and sheer natural beauty from the water, which is a completely different perspective of this vibrant, exciting city.

Bosphorous trip . Great place to see lot of hotels to sit for food and drink. I spent a lot time here. If u r taking a bosphorous cruise trip then try to take the tour an hour before sunset u will witness a beautiful evening scene.
Amazing Bosphorus !. This is a must do attraction in Istanbul .Take one of the many ( cheap) ferries on the Bosphorus and enjoy the amazing views of what the city has to show !

TAKE A BOAT TRIP AROUND THE BOSPHORUS STRAIT. Take a boat ride along the Bosphorus strait to see a number of the attractions around Istanbul. This could be private or a public one or a guided one, which may vary in cost. You can buy some drinks and snacks while on board.

Magnificient. The best beautiful natural waterway which is between two continent in the World. You can make a cheap boat trip on the bosphorus to see historic palaces, waterfront houses, mosques and natural beauties during two or three hours...
Bhasporas tour . Excellent tour to bhasporas through cruise and very cheap I would suggest to take direct cruise to bhasporas no need to pay more to travel agent
Do not miss. There are several tour companies that offer this tour. Do not miss, book one. There is a lot of history in the places that the tour visit and beautiful views .

Beautiful views over Istanbul. The local ferry is a great thing to do - very cheap and takes you over to the Asian side of Istanbul - the local kebab shops over there are worth the trip on their own!!The views you get from the ferry are amazing, great photographic opportunities. Grab yourself a turkish tea from the top deck for 20p-ish and enjoy it! It can get very busy though so you might have to run to get a good spot. We even saw dolphins on one of our trips!!

The View Never Gets Old!!!!. This is quiet possibly one of my favorite places in the world. So much to see and so beautiful. You can do a Bosphorus Tour or simply hop on to one the many routes that cross between Asian and European sides. It is a great overview of the city both during the day and at night. It is relatively cheap and very safe way to see this wonderful city. The mild rocking of the boat, the sounds of the seagulls and the vendor's continuous offerings of beverages (without being pushy) makes time fly by.

The separator of Europe and Asia. We had a great experience, we used metro bus to go from Europe to Asia crossing the "Bos" as called by the Turkish people. There is a big difference in culture between the two. Asian lifestyle was more relaxed or manageable than the busy European side. Traffic going across was hectic.

Bosphorus Strait is the heart of Istanbul. Strait is the important traffic ships from the Black Sea to the Mediterranean Sea. The View of Istanbul both sides of Asia and Europe was clear and beautiful to the eye. Besides the strait is also suitable become the object of photography. We could use the ferry to cross the Bosphorus. And while we cross the strait we can also see and feed a lot of seagull that will following us.

Relax have a ship tour . Jump to a ship public or special tour what ever you like and choose... Relax on the top of the ship enjoy the view and if you have a guide listen to the history of each place on each side of the bosphorus

Go with the shorter tip on the public ferry. There are lots of options to cruise the Bosphorus so it can be difficult to recognize the differences and pick the one for you. The public ferry is very affordable and offers basically the same amenities as the private options, so I don't see why you'd opt for a private tour. We struggled to decide between the shorter and longer cruise and ended up being really happy we went with the short one. A few hours is plenty of time to see the city from the Strait, and the views don't vary too much as you move down the Strait. With the longer option you need to get off the boat and spend a couple hours on land so it becomes a full day activity. Overall it's a great way to spend a few hours and see Istanbul from a new perspective!

Fun on the commuter boats. We had a great day hopping on and off the ferries across the Bosphorous. You can get them from Eminonou or Karakoy (south and North ends of Galata bridge respectively) across to the Asia side of istanbul. We went first to Uskudar but didn't find it very exciting, then back to Besiktas. Wish we'd got the slightly further ferry to Kadikoy on the Asia side as this had a much busier looking port. The ferries are frequent and generally well signed, though if you're confused we found it easy enough to say the name of where we wanted to head to a member of staff who pointed us in the right direction! We were lucky to be there when it was free travel in the wake of the coup attempt so not sure how much each ferry would have cost us
Best Viewed from a cruise. Bosphorous Strait was one of my favourite parts of exploring Istanbul - seeing the houses, the bridges up close as well as Ortakoy and Dolmabace from the water was nice.

A place you have to visit. İ recomend everybody to visit this place specialy at the evenning time so. You can see the best view of the Bosphorus bridge and have the best test of (CAMPEER) THE TURKİSH TRADİTİONAL FOOD.

The Deep Blue Sea . The tour of the Bosphorous was phenomenal, we loved it here it was calming and beautiful. The journey itself was smooth and very educational. Soaking up a lot of sun on the way. It definitely is something to try out in Istanbul
Take the boat tour. This is a great experience. Take the boat tour where you can go under the beautiful bridges as well as see amazing views of the city itself.
Cool. This is a must do while in Istanbul. The inexpensive way is to hop on one of the ferries but I would recommend a boat that takes you up the Straight so you go under the bridges.

Cruise the Bosphorus. My daughter and I took a day trip on the Bosphorus Strait which was a highlight of our week in Istanbul. It was so nice to get out on the water and relax. We stopped at a little town before heading back to Istanbul which was very charming.

Neil Williamson . Great views of the city. You can see many of the great sites from the water. Worth taking a few ferry trips that are cheap and you are mixing with the real Turkish people. Refreshments are cheap on-board and a crossing can on average take 20 minutes. Time well spent.
Beautiful Cruise!. Must take this cruise - reasonable, amazing, incredible - and gives you a sense of Istanbul's place at the crossroads of Asia/Europe...East/West...

How to visit Bosphorus . I am born and living in Istanbul for my entire life and I'm not sure how to visit all the Bosphorus. First of all Bosphorus is a natural canal connecting Marmara Sea with Black Sea. The entrance of the Bosphorus from the Marmara Sea is marked with the Maiden Tower (Kız Kulesi). At this point we can see Üsküdar on Asian side and Beşiktaş on European side. From this point, Bosphorus is about 30 km long and opens to Black Sea at Rumeli lighthouse on European side and Anadolu lighthouse on Asian side.If you travel the strait with car, you may only have little glimpses, because nearly all the strait is blocked with buildings. Therefore you have two options: Either travel by sea or sit in a restaurant or cafe near the Bosphorus. To travel by the sea, cheapest and one of the most pleasant alternative is scheduled ferries between two sides; such as Üsküdar-Beşiktaş ferry, which generally operates every half an hour. Secondly there are small ferries operated by the government to visit almost all the Bosphorus, but they are very rare. Anyway, the schedule can be learned from ferry stations. Thirdly there are tourist boats, which are most common, but according to me, most unpleasant. Also some serious travel companies, like Fest Travel, offer special cultural-cruise tours, which can be the golden standard. Also if you can spend a little bit more, there are rentable motor yachts of varying size, from the docks at Göksu River, Anadolu Hisarı.If you prefer a visit from the land, best option is to have a seat in a fish restaurant just near the Bosphorus, with waves wetting your shoes. Never visit touristic restaurants. Go where the locals go. A cheaper alternative can be a cafe or tea house just near the water.

Asia and Europe. Great trip to see both continents at once. Nice yacht cross Marmara see for 3 hours. Our guide Sada gave us a good information during the whole tour. We had our buffet lunch on board. Chance to dress Sultan and take pictures also. Three hours is too much for the tour.

The tour is a bit expensive but deserves every nickle. The tour is a bit expensive but deserves every nickle. When you take a tour shop around, some tours are cheaper than others, and there are some free lancers situated at Sultanahmet Gardens who charge every one differently. we found out later that we paid triple times more than another couple. Do not pay more than 20 TL.

Cross to Asia. If you have travelled all the way across Europe to visit Istanbul you could complete your trip by changing continents and making your way over the Bosphorus Strait to the Asian side. We used a normal passenger ferry, which was much cheaper than the tour boats.
Great way to see both side of Istanbul . The boat ride was great way to explore the wonderful view of Istanbul both the Asian and the European side of the country.

Yousef. It's very nice place we go in big bout during th two sides of posphore canal, in the two sides you can see the great history of othmanian imparatory was cover 30% of the world in the past so you can see that nothing will stay forever, where is the greatness!!!!!

Asia and Europe. Joining Asia and Europe and linking Mediterranean Sea with Black Sea, the Bosphorus is a place to see and experience. This tour was included in our cruise package which ended in Istanbul so I cannot comment on the Bosphorus boat company. We thoroughly enjoyed the 2 hours on the water. I took great photos of some amazing buildings. This is something that you must do.

West meets east. It was quite an emotional experience to take a boat ride on this strait. To think that it is a sea route that keeps Russia alive, and how easy it may be to blockade it and start a war. Lovely views are to be had from the Istanbul skyline, with the mosques and impressive bridges.

Amazing city views. We used the public ferries on a regular basis moving from one side to the other. Amazing value! We also took a Bosphorus Tour starting from Kadikoy on the Asian side. The trip took about 1 1/2 hours I think. Great trip costing about £5 each. Plenty of beautiful views along the straight and of the 2 sides of the city. There was an English commentary but it was quite difficult to follow. Great experience.

A must do.12 lira per person for 90 minute boat ride. this is like exploring the whole city from the water. the ferry is clean and well maintained. We wish more cities had such good and affordable boat cruise options.

Best cruise you will get for £1. Take one of the many ferries that cross the Bosphorus, or even take a selection of destinations, all for £1. Get yourself a seat on the open top deck and enjoy the views

Magnificent and easy to travel on !. The Bosphorous strait divides Asia from Europe . The strait leads up from the Black Sea into the Sea of Marmara so there is always an enormous amount of sea "traffic "and if you sit watching , the number of cargo ships, tourist boats and taxi s is mind blowing !Annually the Bosphorous swim is held , my husband swam it two years ago : it's. 6 km swim held every July . You can catch water taxi s along the Bosphorous , often the fastest route due to the heavy traffic in Istanbul and get water ferries for TL 15 to cross the Bosphorous. You can also get your hotel to arrange private boat tours up the Bosphorous with guides ,where you can get great views of the main landmarks and Palaces along the Bosphorous.

well worth a visit. I would recommend a visit to see Istanbul from another perspective .See the impressive buildings along the Straits. Go under the famous Bosherous Bridge. Also get some breeze as you travel by boat.

Take the ferry for a very low cost but high reward trip. We took the public ferry (last pier before the bridge), which was big, seemed safe, and made a few quick stops along the way. An audio tour provides a map and some good information about the sites along the way. The views all along are stunning. At the last stop DO climb to the castle area for some wonderful views, plus there are a handful of good and not too pricey restaurants where you can have a nice lunch. It is a hike but you could take a cab if you aren't capable of the walk. There is a glassblower too, who works right there and has inexpensive but nice items for sale.

Best way to see the many parts of this fascinating city!. We were able to take a 2 hour private cruise up the Bosphorus during sunset. I'm sure I will never forget it. This city is so beautiful and diverse and the Turkish people are so proud of their country. I loved seeing the huge flags on both sides of the strait and the many styles of architecture. Very memorable!
busy market. This is a commercial place with lots of shop selling Branded goods. The street is beautiful with greenery on both sides and chairs in front of food joints
Gorgeous. Not only the views are magnificent, the feeling of being in the middle of two continents is priceless!
Excellent and a definite MUST. If u have the time do the day trip and the evening dinner cruise with the belly dancers. The food was good and Istanbul at night is just gorgeous.

Worth every penny spent . Be careful whole choosing your service provided. Go to the Galatta bridge and there you can see counter selling tickets for 12 lira. It's the best one. Go for the evening trip.

The entertainment alone is worth the Bosphorus Cruise. The food on the cruise was disappointing but the entertainment was fantastic. During our cruise we not only experienced the sun set but there was a full moon.

Awesome Cruise views. We took a cruise from the historic district to the Asian side. We went around sunset and the views were amazing! I loved watching the sun come down over the city. You see another side of the Asian and also European side from the boat cruise. I recommend everyone to take a cruise over the strait and see a different side of the city.

Great views and atmosphere . Great views on both sides of the bosphorus; although the ferries need to be more organized and fixed as they tend to be very crowded and old, and the timings and prices are ill-advertised and are more focused to locals or to turkish speaking people who would be able to communicate with the personnel in the docks who speaks turkish only.

Afternoon cruise. The Bosphorus is the reason for Istanbul's existence. Ferries buzz across it constantly. We took the 12TL "official" 2-hour cruise from the ferry terminal and it was utterly fascinating. We also took the ferry across to Kadikoy and back as the trip boat didn't cover the lower part - the views towards Topkapi were wonderful. Next time we'll make sure we go to the Princes' Islands.
The Private Bosphorus is Fantastic. The view of Istanbul Europe and Istanbul Asia can be observed during the cruise. It will be a fantastic one !
Sunset cruise on the Bosphorus. Head to Eminou and take the 7pm TURYOL cruise (90 minutes). Costs maybe 12 TYL? Relaxing and very beautiful.

Top 6 Things to do in Istanbul. If you visit Istanbul, there are 6 things you should be sure to experience. The city looks different from the water, different perspective. Who doesn't like to spend a little time on the water? At a minimum, take a ferry to the Asian side (maybe enjoy lunch and a stroll down the waterfront) and take a ferry back. If one of your crossings is a bit north you get a good view of the bridge and the palace.

Cruising the Bosphoros. If the weather is good, then a cruise up the Bosphoros is definitely a good option. There are several versions (short cruise, long cruise, etc), so all depends on what you want to do.We took a simple up and down cruise and thoroughly enjoyed it. You are able to get a different perspective of the sites from the boat and there are some quite spectacular views.Booking is easy, if you go down to the docks (a short tram trip from the Sultanahmet Square). There is a hive of activity with many of the little eateries all full of people eating and chatting. There are obviously many ticket touts, but if you want simple, then just head to the ticket centre and book your trip.

The soul of the city. The major sights of Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque give history and architecture but only when you are on a ferry on the water do you connect with the true majesty of this city. You see what the first settlers saw thousands of years ago- the spot where three bodies of water connect providing spectacular vistas. The Bosphorus is lined with palaces, forts, gracious summer homes, tea gardens and fish restaurants galore. Take the touristic public ferry ( 3 per day in summer 2 off season) from Eminonu. The pier is the one next to the Galata bridge. It will take most of the day if you go to the last stop and do the round trip but you can get off in on the European side earlier, have lunch and take a bus back to Taxim or Kabatas where you get the tram back to the old city.
Bosphorus Strait. An excellent view from the Topkapi Palace which i visited in June 2016. Truly mesmerising experience to view the straits from the top.

Bosphorus Strait Ferry Boat Experience. There is so much coastline in Istanbul that the best way to really get a feel for the massive size of the city is to take a ferry ride on the Bosphorus Straight.
Nice view. You can see the both continent Asia and Europe from here. Also there are boat trips near this place. You can see the Bosporus and have a good local food near sea side.

Bosphorus Cruise: A must do in Istanbul. We booked a cruise-tour along Bosphorus Strait a day after the explosion at Ataturk Airport. Most boats were only one-third occupied, as our bout was. The cruise was amazing! We could see both the Asian and European parts of Istanbul: the lovely structures of the buildings (I forgot the names mentioned by Mozaffer, the tour-guide). The cruise took 1.5 hours. This is a must-do in Istanbul!

It seems a different country. Crossing the Bosphorus with the boat it's an incredible experience, when you see these amazing houses with the boats and how big is Istanbul it's wonderful! Like beeing in different city than when you're on the historical centre.
Worth taking a tour. Went on a tour of the Bosphorus and the Golden Horn with Gokkusagi Tourism Agency. Well informed English speaking guide, relaxed atmosphere and two stops on 4.5 hour tour.

Take the Ferry. The Bosphorus Strait is Istanbul's defining feature. While you can pay more than $50 for a half day boat tour, the best tip is to take one of the many fast, efficient and frequent ferries available for about $1.50. It will get you out on the water to see the fantastic city views.

Cruise along the Bosphorus Strait. We got the chance to experience a FREE Bosphorus strait cruise as a compensation of the travel agency which made a wrong hotel booking for us. Nonetheless, it was an enjoyable evening having to experience a dinner buffet while cruising the entire strait of the Bosphore.I would recommend this to couples who would like to have a romantic night.WARNING : If you are sea sick then I wouldnt recommend this tour for you. But if you really want to try it -- I recommend that you take an antiemetic drug one hour before boarding the boat or yacht.

Busy waterway. A fascinating waterway. We hopped onto a tour boat that plies the Bosphorus, from the Boğaziçi Köprüsü bridge to Galata bridge. A 90min trip. There is such movement and great buildings to see. It didn't cost much, about $8 or $9.
Get onto the water.. Whether by water taxi or cruise ship, get onto the water. The Bosphorus offers amazing views of the city (east and west) stretching out far, far north and south.
Just Ok. We found a boat and paid a reduced price and went up and down the Bosphorus Strait. Frankly, it was ok but not that great. If you have extra time, I think it would be ok, but only then.

Very nice experience . Our guide was English speaking and well informed , well behaved.He had a typical knack to the subject. The Bosphorus cruise is an experience of its kind. The Cruise vessels are ok and near tidy. The Turkish Tea was delight.It was sunny day and bit warm. But overall a nice experience to see both the Asian as well as European sides.The old ancient structures, houses and new bridges are expamples perfect harmony to modern world with ancient heritage.Houses had yachts/boats and as informed by the guide they are damn expensive .The short gondolla tide was also quick and Golden Horn view was awasome.Recommended for when touring Turkey. More for the views and houses/hotels and beautiful Architectural marvels.
Good Boattrip with the public Boat. The Boatrip is very nice, but not recommend a Audio Guide. The most names they are explained are not to remember.

Magnificent Bosphorous. Well it was on May day that we took this cruise and we were lucky. The sun was playing hide and seek and it rained , warm and cold at time but the view was out of this world, the historic monuments, the meeting of the West and the East was memorable and photogenic. Highly recommend to any one visiting Turkey, not expensive and worth the time and money. Would visit again with a larger group of friends soon.
4 Lira ferry great way to cross. Caught the local ferry to Eyup (up the Golden Horn) and then all the way across to Uskador for 4 Lira. Best value sight seeing ever!

Crossing the Bosphorus Strait is like a dream, Imagine you quuickly pass from Europe to Asia!!. For me and for my daugther was like I dream, because in thta day, we had coffe in Europa and had a lunch in Asia.The sensation to be crossing from one continet for another by boat, sure it is unforgettable. Well and you are into the boat you can see how Istanbul is very very beautiful. Some birds cacth along the boat and the passengers gives them some food, like fried potatoes and they take it on the air. More its is so cheaper.
Splendid Bosphorus. It is a pleasure to have a walk near bosphorus with the view of historical buildings, the old city and new city together.

Gorgeous sail. We took the 2pm cruise down Bosphorus strait. It was a gorgeous afternoon, azure Marmara sea reflects blue sky.Travelling down the palaces and the fort, while bridges hung above was such an awesome experience. Travel down the sights on the European coadt, while travelling back along the Asian coast, dotted with old ruins. Absolutely a must!

River cruise. West meets East on the water of the Bosphorus. Simply stunning views all along the route. Great for photographic opportunities all along. Thousands of interesting jelly fish swim alongside boat. Half day plenty of time to see all sorts. Very inexpensive.
Bosphorus the awesome. There are not many places as beautiful as this piece of land called Bosphorus in the world,having a boat ride here would take you away from all the problems of yours
One of the most Beautiful to take a pictures!. The unbelieveble view traveling by Bósphoro sea! I and my family got good pics! I like a lot and I wish come back soon! Its worthy it!

Nice inexpensive tour. You don't need a whole day tour if you can get to where the ferry departs...once there it is only 10 liras...but if you are not close you will need a ride. Uber is available and by using the app you don't need to speak to the driver..

One and only !. Istanbul is the only city that is located on both sides of a sea strait !
According to historians, Bosphorus Strait is quite young, estimated as about 7000 years old.
Full of beautiful (and unfortunately a few ugly) historical mansions.

Must do!. A standard part of any visit to Istanbul, but well-deserves its ranking. Linking the Black Sea and (via the Sea of Marmara) the Mediterranean, this is one of the key and most iconic waterways in the world. Crossed now by two bridges with a third soon to be opened, the Bosphorus connects Europe and Asia. A zigzag boat trip on a sunny day cannot be bettered.
Nice to know. bophoris is a must see place. We decided to take a Boat tour about 2 hours to know the River. Nice that divides Istambul between Europe and Ásia.
Must do!. We took the Afternoon Bosphorus Cruise. This was an excellent afternoon. The information that you get while cruising are great - you see Istanbul from a different view.
begin early and stop at noon. in a good and sunny day Bosphorus give us so many and beautiful scenic views. Try not to be at the sun at mid day. enjoy and you are blessed with this wonderful trip

On one side, Asia and on the other, Europe. Standing on a bridge overlooking the Bosporus with the classic Byzantine architecture of Istanbul/Constantinople on each side is an awe inspiring experience. Take one of the numerous boat cruises to see the old palaces lining the straits

Nice Evening Cruise. The boats can be packed with tourists so get in and get a good seat on an outside deck. The views are mainly on the left side once you get going. Enjoy a beer and then enjoy the sites!
Fantastic Views . Take the hour and a half Boat Ride Along the Bosphorus spectacular views of many of the homes and hotels along the Bosphorus Strait.

Breathtaking tour. There are alot of options when you decide to take a bosphorus tour but I personally feel the turyol ferry boat tour is the best.You can take the tram to karikoy station. From the station walk towards the left side towards the turyol ferryboat stationYou can take ferryboat metro from here to kadikoy and uskudar (the asian sides two major areas)Also you can get the bosphorus tour for around 12 lira. The best thing about this tour is that it is for about 1 HR 30 min and it doesn't stop anywhereIt's a non stop bosphorus tour excellent for people with time constraints.The ferry takes you showing you the European side u der the bosphorus bridge and take a turn back from the next bridge. Coming back you can see the asian sideIt's better to take snacks from outside as the ones offered on the ferry are expensive and not that fresh
History!!. No need to use long sentences to explain istanbul!! It's just about feelings. You have to go at least one time in your life...

Old meets new.. Beautiful stretch of water. You get to see a lot of Instanbul in a short period of time on a boat cruise. It was amazing to see traditional fisherman in their small boats surrounded by modern day ships cruising up and down the waterway. Instanbul is where the old and new world collide.

Worth it. For the geography freaks a sail down the Bosphorus would be interesting. There are several picturesque mosques, palaces and bridges (2) along the way. At daytime you can take the cheap local ferry, get off at the last stop (an overgrown village), have freshly-caught fish for lunch and get the next ferry back. At night, dinner cruises are offered at 40 euros per head (discounted price during current tourism slump). The heritage buildings and the two bridges are brilliantly lit up and the scene is very different from daytime.

Beautiful stretch of water. Not only is the Bosphorus Strait one of the most strategically located in the world, it is also one of the most beautiful.We enjoyed the ferry boat ride up and down, gazing at sights such as mosques, schools, and residences ($1M+) - some with glass living room floors to see right down into the Bosphorus.
Boat trip . Always go for the boat tour is a golden rule. Every city in the world is always best seen from the water and Istanbul is no exception.

A view of two continents . We took the boat ride across the Bosphorus Strait. It is indeed an unique moment as you see the two continents Asia and Europe on either side . You also get an overall overview of Istanbul as you are pointed out various landmarks by your guide.

Boat trip a must.... Take a boat trip from the old city side to the last stop. It is a government boat that transport people to 8 places along the Bosphorus Strait. We got of at the last point and walked up the hill for a breathtaking view from an old Byzantine Caste of the Bosporus mouth into the Black Sea. There are many little restaurants and the seafood is fresh. We stayed for three hours then caught the last trip on the same boat back to the old city. Remember to buy a return ticket. By the way, we walked for about 1 km towards the military base and next to the base there is place to swim in the Bosporus (no beach just rocks, but worthwhile. A swim in the Bosporus is a must for your Bucket List )
A relaxing experience. Our cruise was excellent with all the points of interest explained to us along the way. The breeze can be chilly so take warm jackets.

Great . Took a local ferry to somewhere where I wasn't planning to go. So relaxing, enjoyable watching a road on water working.. Queues of ships could be seen in the distance waiting to pass through. It's very similar to Hong Kong and it's system.. I did a 2 hour cruise as well but truthfully the ferry ride was both quicker and more enjoyable.. Did get to see up closer to various buildings, palaces on the cruise but it got tedious quickly...

Relaxing . Can be done as a packaged tour with a guide or independently. Some boats have a recorded commentary to explain various sites along the way as they explore north on the European side of Istanbul and down the Asian side. A peaceful way to great an overview of how vast this city is.

Best Bosphorus & Old Istanbul view. Ortaköy is one of the most popular touristic place in Istanbul..You can easily go there by bus, it is located near Beşiktaş . You will see church, synagogue and mosque ... You will get reflection of multicultural mosaique ..You can also view of Bosphorus and Istanbul, take a short Bosphorus boat tour.

Bosphorus Tour. We used the Sahir Hatlari Long Bosphorus tour and would recommend it as it wasn't very crowded and views were stunning, fortunately the day we chose the trip it was cloudy and it made the trip all the more pleasant.
Bosphorus day cruise trip. An excellent value for money day trip viewing the splendour of Istanbul. An enjoyable day trip to various locations.
Very nice and vital waterway. It flows beautifully surrounded. We also saw dolphins and birds. And lots of different boats and ships.

The best way to see the Bosphorus and the places around. This is the best way to see more about Istanbul, we took a boat and we paid like 12 tl per person, it was a hr and a half tour and we had the beeeest views ever, my boyfriend and I were very happy to experience this together, we got amazing shots from the bosphorus and we wont ever forget this tour

Excellent Trip & Lunch. 10:35 departure from Eminonu as before. No commentary but can rent a verbal guide.Cost was TL25 which was great for a 6hr round trip including 2hr:35 stop at A. KavagiI so enjoyed the trip I repeated it 3 days later. 1st trip, I had a great lunch at Sariyer but decided to go to A. Kavagi for lunch on the 2nd trip. Both were excellent but not particularly cheap.Boat had an open sided bow and stern section which were covered and a central fully enclosed part with a small snack bar selling drinks and snacks (not sure if sold alcohol) There are other Bosphorus trips available that may include lunch but this didn't.This trip is ideal for me as a ship photographer because I see vessels not normally seen in N. Europe.When in Istanbul again, I will definitely go again.

Boat tour on Bosphorus . While in Istanbul, do not forget to get on the water because the girl to each direction is amazing! But at the same time, dont fall into turístic traps and pay too much. For example take the Bosphorus Tour from Karaköy where you only pay 12 liras (4€) for a 2 hour tour! Enjoyed this time a lot!

Amazing boat tour. Magnificent boat tour the view is straight out of a postcard. Thats were you get the whole impression of this fabulous metropolitan city. We took the boat from the galata bridge for around 10 Lira per Person which was a bargain.
a great cruise. the bosphorus cruise was amazing, it takes you through all the historical places of the European and the Asian side, it was a great trip.

Fine boat ride. Having walked one end of Istanbul to the other my feet were killing me so when we were down on the bridge near Galata Tower, we took advantage of a two hour tour of the Bosphorus Strait. It cost approximately $4 USD!!! What a bargain for two hours of bliss, seeing beautiful palaces and mansions and castles. My feet were thankful for the boat ride and my eyes even more so.
A must visit. Well worth your time in Istanbul. An enjoyable visit on a sunny day. Don't miss the restaurants close by.

Straight forwards voyage! . We took 10.30am from the harbour, single ticket 12TL. Grabbed some bread from the stalls and hopped on. Drinks served on ferry, don't expect any tourist voice over, so have a guide/map to hand to ensure you know what it is you're looking at on both east and west shores! If you choose to alight at any of the ports do your homework for restaurants.Return by bus absolutely fine (we took the western side from Sayiar)

Amazing Scenery!!. Well one of the scenes of Istanbul that leaves you spellbound and amazed is the Bosphorous Strait visit. It a waterway that separates Asia and Europe and the Bosphorous Bridge passing above your heads adds a cherry on the top. Typically there are many companies and tours that give the Bosphorous Strait cruise services. Some are cheaper, other being expensive due to availability of liquor and belly dancing activities on the cruise. However, either cruise you choose, you are definitely gonna enjoy the swift breeze in the mid sea with bluish waters all around you and a magnificent view of the city and shores. If you happen to take a cruise somewhere close to sunset, you can enjoy the cruise in the day as well as some part in the night too. Must a try!!

DINNER CRUISE: AN ENCHANTING & MOST ENJOYABLE EVENING. An enchanting night as we cruised through the Asian and European side and marveled at the amazing scenery. Food is good (chicken or fish) after their appetizers but their dessert needs improvement (cake was too dry, coarse and too sweet).Fantastic entertainment with numerous belly dancing and some audience participation. The fun filled dinner cruise costs 40€ without alcohol and 50€ or 60€ with alcohol. All inclusive with hotel pick up (at 1930 if you're staying in Sultanahmet) drop off (cruise ends midnight) unlimited alcohol (if that choice is taken), soda or coffee. Dinner is served at 9 pm (2100) and show starts at 10 pm. Hotels and big tour companies like Viator usually charge more and we almost paid a more expensive price. But as we walked from Hagia Sophia back to our hotel, we passed by a small inconspicuous store offering tours at more affordable prices. The company is called "Turista" and they have a variety of tours throughtout Turkey. The dinner cruise we bought is exactly the same as the more costly one offered by our hotel. Istanbul looks magical cruising through Bosphorus Strait, with the different lights from the churches, mosques, buildings, hotels and bridges. This outing should not be missed.
I could watch this all day. One of my favorite things to do in Turkey is to have breakfast and coffee outside on the edge of the Bosporus and watch the world go by

My flat overlooked the Bosporus . The sight of the boats and ships traversing the strait provides hours of fascination. Day and night the water is full of activity. There is an AP that identifies the ships and gives you an idea of what they are carrying. Take the ferries, cross and recrossed and savour this city from the water. The only way to truly see this jewel

Great value for money cruise with Sehir Hatlari cruise-lines!. Pleasant cruise, we had a 20% discount offered by the Istanbul Museum card (20 Lira instead of 25). They were serving tea/coffee/ayran ( you had to pay for them). Pleasant 3 hours stop in Anadolu Kavagi- you can visit the th Yoros Castle or simply enjoy a tea/coffe/lunch at one of the many restaurants offering a spectacular view.

Best Natural Attraction In Istanbul . This is a must-do in Istanbul ... The cheapest tours on bosphorous are in Eminonu which is close to Halic metro station there you can take a 1:30 min tour with big boats on bosphor . There are other day & night tours with hotel pick ups , i guess all of them are fun ... Ask your hotel reception to introduce you some .

Connects Two Continent!. Where Europe meets Aisa. Take a ride on Bosphorus, exclusive or economical trips available! I took a Ferry which costed 15 Lira :) and it took me all alone European and Asian side and you can hop off and hop on wih the same ticket :)

The Ferry Boat Ride Was a Great City Overview. Except for the pouring Rain that day we enjoyed our ride. It's challenging to figure out where to buy tickets for the right ride and once we did apparently the one we chose did not make the one stop we wanted to take! We've braved using all the public transportation (taxi, subway and ferry). It's been an adventure! Having google maps and wifi wherever we go has really been a huge asset!
Beautiful blue waters. It is worth the two hour boat trip on the Sehir Hatlari line to enjoy this view of Istanbul. Best value for tourists as it's $3.

Great views and history. Joining Asia and Europe and linking Mediterranean Sea with Black Sea, the Bosphorus is a place to see and experience. Great pictures and sightsee from the city. You can take one of the several tours or even the public transportation (ferry) to experience the strait from within
Bosphorus is one of the most beautiful place in Istanbul. Bosphorus Strait is one of the most beautiful place in Istanbul because of its location and panoramic view.
Boat trip. This is a must. Cruise the Bosphorus from Dolmache palace area to the Black Sea. Span Europe and Asia. We saw several dolphins, and beautiful bridges and buildings.

Fabulous way to spend 2 hours. Take a tour boat from the Eminonu jetty (metro stop). 12 Turkish Lire (about £3) for 2 hour journey up the Bosphorus. Go past the Maidens tower, under two bridges, past old waterside palaces one side as super tankers pass through on other side. Snacks and drinks cheap on boat. Definitely recommended.

use the hope off and hope on trip by Dentur Avrasya. This deal allows you to get off in any of the 04 locations and then jump in once you visited the place without any further charge to continue your journey, the fair is just 15 Lira for one person

East meets west. Istanbul lives true to its name.A true oriental experience!!Bosphorus Strait is place that lets you relax.There are a lot of beautiful views.A number of options for ice cream lovers is also an added attraction

Up the river . This was ok, but boat was quite some distance from the sights which made it difficult to see clearly. Audio guide stopped after about half an hour, I think he gave up
Ok but became boring in the end

Surreal..... One of my favourite outings while at Istanbul....This is the Asian part of the city...Feel the breeze and watch the boats and the ferries go past the quaint cafes by the riverside and soak it all in over some delicious Kumper & Cay

Chill by the Bosphorous when the weather is good!. When it's sunny, nothing beats hanging around the Bosphorous. You will most likely be around it a lot as it is in between most things in Istanbul. But if the weather is good, I would definitely recommend taking some time out to sit down and enjoy the view - particularly in between Uskudar where you can chill with some tea!
Average. Went there in a cruise that was full of tourists my self is not a fan of sea cruises since a easily get sea sick the view is nice over all
Crossing is always fun!. I took a cab to the Asian side, and up to Camille Hill. Very nice view, a fun ride and I enjoyed a cold beer at the view restaurant.
Excellent cruise trip. Bosphorus Strait is just on the sea front.with an amazing cruise trip you can catch a lot of good places including Bosphorous.

should be on top of your to do list in Istanbul. this is the famous strait which divides the city but also the Europe and Asia.
a lot of tour operators offer hop on hop off boats along the strait. you can pay as low as TRY 15 or USD 5 for a 2-hour boat ride.

Breathtaking area of Istambul. Istambul is just one of the most amazing places anyone can visit. Every sight is breathtaking! We went through the Bosforo on a small ferry boat, great experience for my family and especially for my daughter, she loved it!
Beautiful waterway. We went on a lovely cruise of the Bosphorus Strait. It was so nice! The views are fantastic. The breeze is nice. This is a fantastic way to spend a couple of hours!

Romantic . Well it might sound crazy but we walked from Dolmabache palace to Bosphorus, but it was worth it to see the amazing streets bit about if traffic but once you reach it worth it. Alot of nice shops for shopping (don't forget to bargain) and do make sure to try stuffed potatoes, they have Alot of shops at that point you can also take boats cost of 15 TL to have trip in Bosphorus, on way back you can easily get bus and you can use your Istanbul card in buses also,

Beautiful location. You should see it during the night. Lighting give it a great charm. You should also see it from a boat and have dinner in the nearby restaurants as it blends with the Bosphorus suspended bridge.

A unique cruise through the centuries. A boat trip on the Bosphorus is a must for any visitor to Istanbul. Tour boats typically go north via the European side of the channel and back via the Asian (or vice versa), so you get to see some of each as what was once called Constantinople evolved through the centuries. From thousand-year-old fortifications to some of the world's priciest waterfront villas, the city reveals various sides of itself in serene comfort, sparing the viewer Istanbul's notorious traffic.

Easily Done on a Ferry. . We got on a local ferry that took us about 2 hours to complete. It cost us 12 Liras per person. It was a simple, relaxing boat ride. Nothing fancy. It made stops at both the European side and the Asian side. Along the way we were able to observe the landmark bridges and palaces and hotels. So this was a simple and inexpensive way to tour the southern half of Bosphorus Strait.

HIghlight of our day. We had a Bosphorus Strait breakfast cruise when we got off our cruise ship. IT included a Turkish breakfast and went under the two road bridges that cross from Asia to Europe. The commentary was good, easily understandable and because ot the lack of tourists visiting Turkey at the moment, the ones that do go there are well looked after.
birds eyeview!. a trip through the Bosphorus Strait gives you a bird's eye view of the historic places of Istanbul. Plus you get to enjoy the beautiful and scenic river.
Nice two hour trip. At the wharf, either the government or a private two hour ferry ride costs 12 TL. Two hours was enough. The trip was interesting and pleasant.
so many sites within reach.. A highlight of any trip or tour is to spend time exploring this area. We have been on a boat in Jan and now August and didn't in it boring at all.

Between two continents. It was an amazing feeling doing a boat trip down the Bosphorus and knowing you were between Europe and Asia. We saw many famous landmarks and Istanbul is absolutely amazing. We can't wait to visit again. A walk around Istanbul takes you back in time and the sights you see are unforgettable.John and Gail Laney

A boat trip to vosporus. It was so great our boat trip to vosporus. We took the boat from sirceci and cost 8 euro per person and boat took us up to the first bridge. It was night and lights from istanbul was amazing. Ayia Sofia view was great and let me to imagine that view for almost 15 centruries for all passing vosporus

Visit on sunset & wait Bosphorus Bridge Lighting. Go there on sunset and walk by the shops and cozy cafe, don't forget the coffee shops and wait for the Bosphorus Bridge Lighting to have a great picture. Eat Dondurma (ice cream)
Loads of boats to choose from. A nice couple of hours on the water seeing Istanbul we went as the sun went down so very pretty as lights come on
Take a Cruise to Really See It. Take the Bosphorus Cruise to really see the strait. It is lined with history, and the audio tour available on the cruise will help you understand what you are seeing.
Dominates Istanbul. Runs through the centre of Istanbul and parts of it you can walk along. Lots of boats and ferries to catch. In some areas good seafood restaurants
great views. If you are in stanbul only for one day. I would reccomend you going for cruise on bosphorus strait. You will see a lot of beatiful palaces and more.

Take a cruise!. We selected a tour which included a Bosphorus cruise. It was a highlight for us. It's a leisurely cruise from Istanbul toward the Black Sea. It was several hours in length and included lunch, some narration and a photo session in period dress which was fun. We stopped at a small fishing village in the middle of the trip which is just starting to have a tourist market so it was more laid back with less shops and restaurants and more tradition. It was a highlight in our trip!

Highlight of Istanbul. A city straddling two continents ...... your trip to this city is not complete unless you have an experience of crossing over the Bosporus Strait. It is a beautiful water channel in the middle of the city. You can take a hop-on hop-off boat ride during the day from Kabatas and see various areas of Istanbul this way .... the ferry stops at a number of stops on both the European and Asian side. Then you can take a Bosporus Dinner Cruise (plenty of companies to choose from) in which you can see the city lights from the ferry and enjoy the fresh air ..... at the same time, enjoy a nice dinner and a dance and culture show aboard the ferry. Both experiences are extremely nice!
So beautiful!. So beautiful, especially in the evening. I recommend everyone take a night cruise to marvel at the beauty of it all through the night.

Beautiful. You have to take cruiz in the Bosphure. It's amazing. The water, sky, fresh air.. all together makes you in heaven. Just sit in the boat, relax and breaaathe.I will do this cruiz over & over again.
not very exciting,. Its a 2 hour boat trip up and down the bosphorus. If you are limited for time, skip this and go for the boat ride to the Princes islands. Better use of time and more interesting,

One of the best waterways in the world to visit. Dotted by many historic buildings and palaces, Bosphorus offers vistas that are hard to see anywhere else in the world. This strait separates two continents: Europe and Asia. It is a melting point of East and West, a bridge between the cultures of Europe and Middle East. You will have a chance to go under two bridges that link the two continents in this bustling megapolis that is Istanbul.

Majestic views. The bridges can sometimes take hours to get across in traffic. This is so much faster and you get to see Istanbul from the water. We took a day trip around the Bosphorus and it was well worth the time and money. It was very relaxing and we met some fascinating people.

LOVED THE CRUISE ON THE BOSPHORUS!!!. It was a beautifull sunny day - the water was calm. We made friends with 2 german ladies and 3 girls from Kazakistan - had a marvelous time with them on the cruise - cost 20 lira per person, well worth the price.

Majestic. I always make it a point to travel between east and west istanbul taking advantage of the cheap ship travel ( 4 liras each direction ) and sit outdoors watching the scenic views of old city, the hills and mountains ...while sipping Turkish tea offered by the tea man on the ship. It's my favourite trip each time I visit. Do it as often as ....everyday. You will smile all through.

Guarenteed to see dolphins by Ahirkapi lighthouse. There are lots of ferries and boat trips to choose from and definitely worth doing. However there is one spot on the straits where you see dolphins 24/7. By Ahirkapi lighthouse (you can walk up from the new mosque/ Egyptian bazaar or down from the blue mosque), there is jetty by the rocks where tour boats come in and fisherman come in. There's usually about three pods of dolphins that come right against the shore or can be seen not far away. One evening we saw about 20 and some were leaping. Even the locals sit on the rocks with snacks and watch.
A very busy stretch of water. The strait is a busy stretch of water and from the hill as a vantage point you can see tankers and cruise ships waiting in line to come through this stretch of water.

Another way to see the city. This is a must see tour of the city. You can go to the Bosphorus where the bridge is and take any of the boats leaving every 10 or 15 mintues. It´s a 2 hour tour that allows you to enjoy both shores of the Bosphorus with Europe on one side and Asia on the other.

Great view from Gulhane Park. One of the most famous waterways in the world, going back to the days of Homer. There's a great (free!) view from Gulhane Park, if you have time to walk all the way to the back of the park behind the walls of the Topkapi Palace. I went early on a misty morning and it was spectacular. There is a cute outdoor tea pavilion there too; it was closed when I was there but would probably be a nice spot from which to take in the view later in the day.Gulhane Park itself is a beautiful sight, a well-manicured city park with lots of history. Black-Crowned Night Heron were roosting in the tops of some of its stately trees.

A fantastic way to see Istanbul on a sunny afternoon. On the afternoon of Day 1 of my Turkey trip, I braved cold and wet weather to ride on the deck of a boat down the famous Bosphorus Strait, which is 32 km (20-mile)-long and joins the Sea of Marmara to the south with the Black Sea to the north of Istanbul.25 March 2016

Amazing holiday. This is wonderful to see. So many beautiful buildings to be seen, famous landmarks busy with cruise ships, cargo ship, fishing boats and many small craft. Could not believe how busy and large this area is.

You have to navigate. We had a great opportunity to rent a boat and did a two hour navigation of the Bosphorus. We went up the European side and came back on the Asian side. It is a view and experience that changes your perspective of the city of Istanbul.From land you cannot get to see the beautiful homes and buildings that look onto the strait.

Take Time for a Bosphorus Cruise. We took the ferry at Eminou and traveled up the Bosphorus to the mouth of the Black Sea. So very, very pleasant, interesting and a change of pace from run-around sightseeing! Lots of interesting old yalis (summer homes of the past), a fortress, and the don't- miss coming on board of the most delicious yoghurt you've ever tasted. It's the specialty of some village along the way, and a real treat. We docked at the mouth of the Black Sea, and had a wonderful fish lunch, before catching the ferry back to Istanbul.

Nice 2 hr boat ride. You can visit Bosphorus Straight using a boat (Chartered or public). It takes about 2 hrs to visit half the straight and come back alternatively you can take half day tour all the way to Black sea, have lunch and come back. Evening cruise is advisable for viewing the city at night. If you are on low budget i would advise Turyol cruise which starts next to Galata bridge.There are many attractions which can be seen from the bosphorous. Must visit trip on your Istanbul trip.

Amazing must do experience. It is very easy to board one of the boats cruising the Bosphorus, choose among many waiting. Make sure of the duration of the cruise and buy your ticket right next to the boat you choose before you board.There is refreshments for sale on the boat but you can also buy from the stalls along the pier at much cheaper and support the local turkish people.It is a busy, bustling stretchof water and the cruise shows you both Western and Eastern sides of the banks of the Bosphorus.

A good relaxing boat trip at Bosphorus strait. We had about 1.5 hours of cruising at the Bosphorus Strait one sunny afternoon while visiting Istanbul. Beautiful blue water and sky. Gave us a good view of all the grand and beautiful buildings at both banks of the strait. Pity there was no beer or wine for sale on board

Amazing Istanbul Skyline. You must allocate at least half a day to experience the sights of Istanbul on the wonderful Bosphorus Cruise. Our family really enjoyed the cruise on the deck of the boat. The skyline of Istanbul from the Bosphorus Strait is just too amazing to describe. It's definitely not to be missed.
On one sie Europe, on the other Asia. It is a great experience to take a cruise on the strait. You can have wonderful photo opportunities from the whole city. Go specifically when there is sunshine.

River cruise, see a lot of Istanbul. The river cruise included a tour guide pointing out highlights and was well run. Was a bit cold at one point in March, make sure your boat has a cabin with openable windows as well as a deck (most are that way). Recommend this as a good way of getting familiar with Istanbul.

Wonderful Mosque at Bosphorus. This Mosque is situated on Bosphorus and you can see it on almost all postcards from Istanbul. It is not large Mosque as Sultan Ahmet Cami but architecture of facade is wonderful and worth of seeing. Also iterior is rich and designed with style. There are a lot of caffes near by where you can have drink and enjoy the sun and beauty of Bosphorus.
