Just beside the Mosque you can take a cheap tour (15 TL/1 h tour) around Boshorus by boat to enjoy beauty of view of Istanbul from sea.

Relax and look at two continents.. As a change from walking all the time we took a relaxing trip on the Bosphorus. There are plenty of offers so you can choose your boat and price. Most boats go up the European side as far as the second intercontinental bridge and then come back down the Asian side. Boats are generally comfortable and have toilets and refreshments.

the Bosphorus on a lovely day in April. I took a 1 1/2 hour cruise on the Bosphorus on a lovely day in April. The views of Istanbul were wonderful from this vantage point and I met some wonderful ladies from Morocco. It was so relaxing after walking all over Taksim that it was a welcome treat to give my aching feet a rest. I believe the price was only 12 Turkish lira which was a good bargain. I would suggest this adventure for those visiting Istanbul.
Nice hour and half cruise. Enjoyable trip from pier to Rumeli Fortress aboard boat. Interesting to see all the multi-million dollar homes lining the Bosphorus.
Loved it. Asia at one side and europe on the other.....East meets West...Beautiful, open and spacious.A cruise on the Bosphorus Strait is a must.
Magnificent. Beautiful, open and spacious. It looks superb with boat ferry tours. Easy to get to and away from. Definitely worth a visit.

East meets West. A must-do, though even the local ferry is half filled with tourists now. Still, that leaves half local, which provides a a more down-to-earth experience.Take the local Sehir Hatlari ferry for the 2h round trip (12 TL) and avoid the audio guide (15 TL). The 2h trip is just enough to see amazing homes, palaces, mosques, and fortresses, on both Asian and European sides, and the bridges connecting the two. There's so much to see that the mind saturates after about an hour and after that, it's just a really nice, relaxing boat ride in an amazing part of the world.I took the audio guide but found it detracted from the overall experience so stopped using it after 45'. The technology is old and the interface is, well, what you would expect from 10-year old technology. Better to download your own audio, or buy a book. Take a jacket as it gets windy on the water, even in spring/summer. Best seats are in the back or on the left. Lots of people have read that you should queue 45' in advance for a good seat, so you won't be the only one in the know. The boat has three stories, the lower lever is inside, the middle level is covered but the left-side seats get the afternoon sun on the way up. And the top is largely uncovered so direct sun for 2h. Beverages, light snacks, and ice cream sold aboard.

Choose the long/full cruise. We booked the "Full Bosphorus Cruise" by Sehir Hatlari (3 hours on the boat, 3 hours ashore). In one and a half hour we reached Anadolu Kavagi on the Asian side of the strait. There were beautiful buildings and nature to admire all the way. In Anadolu Kavagi we walked up to the Fortress where you'll get a magnificent view of the Black Sea.

Must do item when in Istanbul. This is must do attraction while in Istanbul, take a cruise on the Bosphorus all the way to the Black Sea and see the beautiful houses along the water way, including the Rumelli Fort. Very good Lunch served on the cruise. Tour guide give usefull information. Recommended......
Bosphorus boat trip. To understand the size of Istanbul a trip on the Bosphorus was a great way to see the city and would recommend other people to do so but pick a nice day

Nice 4 1/2 Hour Boat Trip to Black Sea. The trip included a buffet lunch and a half-hour stop at Anadolu Kavagi, a village at the end of the Bosporus before entering the Black Sea. The lunch was pretty good, but I abstained from drinking any adult beverages since they were twice the price of Istanbul rate (aha - a captive audience). A person described points of interest including Dolmbahce Palace (the sultans' residence after they left Topaki), multimillionaire homes, Ruetti fortress built by the Ottomans in 1452 AD during the siege of Constantinople to stop the Byzantines from resupplying, the bridges (now two and builing a third), Bevik Cove (where the wealthy people live), etc. The halfway point was a 1/2 hour visit to Anadolu Kavagi, the last village before entering the Black Sea. I thought the place would be a tourist trap but was pleasantly surprised at the prices - cokes, beer, and fruit juice was less than half of Istanbul market prices - so we stocked up. The trip was a very nice way to spend an afternoon and see the Bosphorus and it's Asian and European sides.The price was reasonable - 220 lira (about $80 US) which included the boat trip, buffet lunch, and round trip transportation to/from our hotel.Tips - Bring a sweater especially if the projected temperature is 80 degrees farenheit or less. Gets cool on the water with the wind. Also, go on a sunny day since the quality of picture taking will suff on cloudy/rainy days.

Cruise. . We did a 2 hour cruise up the Bosphorus and I can't say that there was anything particularly remarkable to see. I would rather have been walking around or going into more museums. Disappointing.

Pretty view if you have extra time. This boat ride was pretty typical. The waterway is like a race course with large vessels zipping past each other, pretty close...the views were of different palaces and upper scale homes or apartments. It is a cooling ride, but not really impressive.

It is just cool!. If you want to relax on a beautiful sunny day take a hop on/hop off ferry ride on the Bosporus. You get to see both sides on the strait, palaces, the bridges, and two continents! There are some beautiful homes as you get farther down the strait. You quickly realize why they say there are 16 million people in Istanbul. The city is spread out on both sides! You can get off at a number of the palaces or at a big park. Or you can just stay on the ferry for the 2+ hour round trip. It is very affordable. We did this twice we enjoyed it so much.

2 hour boat trip more than enough!. For 12TL you can hop on a boat for this tour. We found it quite boring and it didn't help that it was very cold out on the water. The few historic buildings that were pointed out were all old and we were informed of the date of the building, the architect and all of them were in the Baroque style!

Bosphorus Tour during the day and at night. We had a day tour of the Bosphorus, which included a visit to a Palace on the Asian side of Turkey, and also did a Cultural night tour of the Bosphorus, dinner and dancing included. Aamazing evening.

Cross between two continents. Take a boat/cruise to explore and enjoy istanbul city which separate by Bosphorus strait. You can see Asia and Europe continent between. Cruise is every hour, price is affordable.

Take a Boat Trip. We took the City Ferry... you could be going all the way up the Bosphorus till Black Sea ( Kavak ) or get off somewhere in between. Most impressive is the areas between the 2 bridges. Incredible view of the homes by the straight. Our daughter fed the birds with a piece of pretzel we bought on the ferry. She had a blast.

Where 2 continents meets. Enjoy this place by took Bosphorus cruise privately. The captain was very friendly and talkative to us. Feel peacefully and it was very enjoyable trip. Cruising along this straits give you a great experience to tell home. Some of the places that we unable to visit by land can be seen from here. Pass through 2 bridges Fatih Sultan Mehmet and Istanbul bridge and it is so beautiful. Elaboration info from local guide will absolutely bring this cruise value added. You are in the middle of 2 Continents. Asia and Europe of Turkey. Feel it here...
Bosphorus Strait Review. A cruise on the Bosphorus Strait is a must. This is the only channel in the world that is on two continents; that is, Europe and Asia. And the view is spectacular.
Take a cruise. Slow down and take a couple of hours to enjoy the view while cruising the Bosphorus. Enjoy a leisure lunch and shopping when the ferry stops before returning to Istanbul.

Great floating around on the water. The wife is waiting for back surgery so going around all the museums and stuff was a bit too much. Nice just to sit on a boat in the sun and watch the shoreline go past

Enjoy the view. On a sunny day you should definitely consider taking a little cruise along the Bosphorus. It's a great way to relax and escape the busy streets of Istanbul for a little while. You will see the beautiful skyline with all it's major buildings - don't miss it!
beautiful. this is a lovely outing for a clear day so you can see all the buildings and the views are beautiful

Recommended to change the mood. As Istanbul is always busy and crowded this little cruise help you change the mood to see the sea and the Strait although it is not a long cruise but i was really helpful for me during my stay in Istanbul.

Great way to see Istanbul. Once your feet burn from walking through the narrow alleys and bazars it's time to jump on a boat and sail along the Bosphorus Strait to relax. Watch the skyline and the 2 massive bridges connecting Europe and Asia.

Must Do!. No trip to Istanbul would be complete without a boat trip along the Bosphorus Straight. I just managed the 2 hour trip and only cost 12tl. What's not to enjoy about sitting on a boat and being taken to photograph all the shore sights.

Historical views and historical perspective. This isn't just a beautiful view, this is a living slice of history - East meets West is such a cliché but here you can feel that it does justice to it. A must see if you are in Istanbul.
Wow!. Fantastic panorama! Strong emotions!! I hope to come back with my future boyfriend/husband! Ideally doing the cruise to see the all city!

TAKE THE SUNSET CRUISE!. Best way to see it is to take the Turyol Hop-On Hop-Off Ferry -- TL12 for 90 minute roundtrip from Eminonu (stopping at various points on both the Eurpoean and Asian sides). We took the last ferry, leaving at 7 pm and returning at 8:30 pm, and thus got to see the sunset on the Bosphorus. Far better than the much more expensive dinner cruises on offer (with mediocre food and dancing).

Can get cold in the cooler months. I did not cruise on the Bosporus as March was still cool and it was colder on the water. You can catch a ferry for 15 TL for a 2 hour tour. there are still some good views especially when the sun shines on the water, and it turns turquoise.

Great Way to View Europe & Asia. We didn't have time to book a 3-hour cruise of the Bosphorus Strait with stops along the way to view castles and monuments. So we did the fast track alternative, which was to take the 15-minute ferry ride (operated by the local transit authority) across the Bosphorus to Asian Istanbul. It was very punctual and orderly but takes more time to load on an doff the ferry that it does for the complete crossing. Once on board, we went to the top of the boat, and a number of tourists took bread crumbs to feed the seagulls. This made for a much more entertaining crossing. The weather was stormy but it didn't seem to make a difference for the crossing. There are som many nice sights to see along the way. Try to sit in the same place on the return trip so you can see another view. Once across to Uskudar, we spent a few hours exploring this great area.
Beautiful. The place connecting two continents - Europe and Asia. Not only does it feel amazing to be in such a place, but also the place is extremely wonderful.

Breathtaking View of Bosphorus on tour to Bosphorus Strait !. When to travel on Bosphorus Strait, view to Bosphorus bridge (Both) are outstanding to watch with a feeling of cool breeze and chattering noise of sea birds.

Beautiful and scenic. This actually feels more like a lake in the middle of Europe with its calm waters and the beautiful houses and palaces built on its shore on both sides. The strait joins 2 seas and separates European Turkey from Asian Turkey. There are long half day cruises you can take to travel up its entire length but I would recommend the shorter 90 minute ferry cruises from Istanbul.

Enjoyable cruise along the Bosphorus Strait.. . We were booked on the cruise along the Bosphorus Strait. Ride was for an hour plus. There were many POI along the way and we could even see some dolphins swimming along. Quite windy as we sat on the top deck. Enjoyable cruise!

Sense of nature . Stay away from any agency, go by yourself and get your own tickets, it will be cheaper Nice cruise in the morning while it was coooold , but with the apple tea you won't feel anything
Wanna see the scenic beauty...Then you are at the right place. A place which reminds you that what the beauty of nature is. In a word, its marvellous to look at...

Glittering!. You can take a 15-minute ferry ride across the Bosphorus to Asian Istanbul, or you can take a several-hour cruise up to the Black Sea. Even as far as the Golden Horn, there is a lot of traffic on the Bosphorus, but the water remains blue and sparkling.

Well worth a boat trip. Joined the boat trip from the ferry terminal near the Galata Bridge and headed downstream first. Great views of some spectacular buildings. Really helped by a good weather day, great day out.

good sightseeing. boarded the long bosphorous cruise for a view of the strait, nice waterfront houses on the way up the strait. you can stop by a fishing village for pricey seafood. its a good way to spend the day if you are free and if weather cooperates. but if you are strained for time, you can probably skip this as i think the sights are not worth the time you spend on the boat.
Beautiful view. It's nice to sit on a bench and relax looking at the strait... There are a lot of interesting places along it.

Huge variety of housing to see. We did the local ferry trip from Istanbul ferry terminal at Eminonu ferries. Make sure you find the right terminal to get your tickets as there are many others all with touts trying to sell you Bosphorus cruises. These latter ones are about 2 hrs long and would be fine, but we wanted to the trip to Anadolu Kavagi. Takes about 1.5 hrs then 3 hours there and the return trip. Sit on the left hand side on the way up as you are close to this bank and see the main palaces. At Anadolu Kavagi you could walk up tp the old castle - about 30 mins up, and eat in a restaurant on the way down, with fantastic views over the straits. Or just eat in really good fish restaurants in the small town. The ferry does snacks and great Turkish tea/apple tea. Ferry toilets OK but sparse in number.
Boat tour is a good idea. We did a boat tour of the Bosphorous Strait and it was very fun. We counted twenty mosques on the strait.

East meets West on the Bosphorus. Not to be missed if you're visiting Istanbul - a boat trip on the Bosphorus Strait where Europe and Asia meet. The trip takes you out to sea on the Strait, under the Bosphorus Bridge, with a guide who points out many important buildings and attractions of the Turkish capital. Here, our minds boggled to see the foreboding Rumeli Fortress, the glittering Yildiz Palace and the strange, wooden Ottoman dwellings in all their glory, telling ourselves to visit these attractions separately while in Istanbul. The tour also included a look around the spice bazaar on the European side and set foot on the Asia side of the Strait.
Bosphorous tour is a must do.. Seeing Istanbul by water is critical and also great for views of the many palaces, estates and neighborhoods on the water.

Best and easiest way to see both European & Asian sides of Istanbul.. A cruise on the Bosphorus is the best way to see the various sites on both the European & Asian sides of Istanbul. The most economical and an excellent value to do this is by the Sehir Hatlari’s ferry boat that gives a full Bhosphorus cruise round-trip for TL25 (starting from Emononu).The blue green waters of the Bhosphorus strait is 31 km (17 miles) in length, the average mid-stream depth of 65 m (213 ft). The width at its northern entrance (at the Black Sea) is 3,329 m (1.8 nmi) and at the southern entrance (at Sea of Marmara) is 2,826 m (1.5 nmi). It is spanned by two inter-continental bridges connecting the continents of Europe and Asia. The modern analogs of the ancient “Silk Road” (now “Silk Highways”). A new third bridge is scheduled to open later this year. The Bosphorus strait is the second busiest in the world with an average traffic of 48,000 commercial cargo ships transiting through it between the Sea of Marmara and the Black Sea.

Tour of 1,5 hours. We made a nice tour of 1,5 hours with the Tuyol ferry (peer near the Galata bridge. The costs were 12 lire pp. The tour goes till the second bridge and then goes back. During the tour, information inturkish only is given on what you see on the shores.

MOST INEXPENSIVE LUXURY TOUR. Take a Bosphorus local ferry for less than a dollar or euro on a sunny day with some sandwiches and soft drinks, sit outdoors and enjoy criss crossing "townships" on european and asian coasts. This could be the most beautiful day you spent in Istanbul... A minigolf version of this tour would be the Vaporetto Line #1 in Venice.

A very nice way to spend a few hours. Many pounds ago, I was lucky enough to be able to go to Turkey & Take a boat tour of the Golden Horn of Old Istanbul. It was a very pleasant trip if one is not cursed with Sea Sickness as the water can be choppy especially when a larger ship goes by. None the less it is a great way to see the waterfront of Istanbul. The really strange part is that on the European Side is packed with Victorian and older buildings and the Great Walls. On the Asiatic side it is mostly modern architecture. Which for some reason reminded me a lot of Orange County California. Anyways I highly recommend the trip for those who want to see the City of Constantine.
great way to see Istanbul. paid 12 liras for 90 minute boat ride. beautiful sight. took the boat ride around sunset time. lovely colors in the sky. can get v chilly so bring a scarf or windbreaker.
Amazing. The trip on Bousphor costs 19 liras if you go right to th ship, but there are many men on square near this ship, who will propose to buy the same ticket per 30 liras - be attentive!

Beautiful. A wonderful part of Istanbul. Spectacular scenery and lovely villages along the route. Great to take a boat ride and soak up the atmosphere. You may see a dolphin or a Turkish submarine if you're lucky.

Beautiful inexpensive boat ride.. We took the cheap option, by getting on one of the smaller no-frills cruise boats with the locals. It was only $4 for two hours, but no dancing or meal included. But $4 for two hours!
Beautiful trip. A great experience especially when you take the bosphorus boat trip to see the other side of Istanbul

Nice cruise. Very relaxing cruise nearly up to the Black Sea and back. Only drawback was the half way point. There is either the trek up to the fort, then back to some pretty indifferent restaurants, or try to while away the three hour wait in the aforementioned establishments and the one or two shops. Either way they've got you. Still, a nice enough trip anyway.

A boat trip up the Bosphorus is a must. We took a two hour trip up the Bosspherus straight which started off by the Gatata bridge and stopped off to drop off locals at about 5 stations. It gave you a good feel for the extent of Istanbul.
Enjoyable trip . It's nice trip but boats are very old and sitting arrangements are not good.They should provide some hot ♨ tea ☕. Trip need to be improve.Guide information was useful.

Bosphorus Evening Cruize..!!. It is very surprising to see Istanbul directly on see from Boat...Tea and Juice were offered by our guide were good.This place is photographers paradise..I could see Dolphins also.Cool Breeze will reduce stress and Seaguls will fly over you.You can also see Galata bridge and Bosphorus bridge from Cruzie.This is the most amazing way to see Istanbul..Must to Bucket list in istanbul..!!

Ferrying up and down the Bosphorus. We used our Istanbul Transport card to sail up and down the Bosphorus and enjoyed the views on both European and Asian sides of Istanbul. At night it is a fairytale outing - all the lights and bridges and boats on the water. Well worth the money spent!

God's gift to Istanbul. Istanbul is a blessed city where humans and nature combine to give the city its great attractions.The Bosphorus Strait is a natural wonder and God's gift to Istanbul. You can never get tired of the lazy cruise going up and down the straits and envy the owners of homes by the water.Palaces, ancient forts and mosques, intercontinental bridges, quaint apartments and villas dot the waterfront.

A view of Asia and Europe and historic sites. The Bosphorus ferry tour to the Black Sea is awe inspiring as you view historic sites and are in Asia and Europe at the same time. An afternoon with good information and spectacular views.

A nice day out. The boat trip up and down the straight is a nice way to spend 90 minutes or so. The boat is comfortable if the weather is nice and they even serve food. It's not the most exciting thing to do, but it's worth it.

East meets West. A boat trip on the Bosphrus is a must, as is the Big City hop off hop on bus tour. Istanbul from the sea gives you another prospective of the city, you see it not in detail, but rather like a picture you explore in pieces, but the whole picture is still there-

Tour on bosphorus . It's good to try to take a tour. You have two choices short trip 2 hours for 12 Turkish lira it's starting 2.3 pm or long trip 6 hours
You must try it

A Beautiful View. We took the tour up to the castle at the entrance to the Bosphorus Strit right next to the new bridge and the Black sea. You can go ashore and climb to the castle (or take a taxi up the hill) for 3 hours and then enjoy a great fish meal at the pier. Truly a beautiful way to see the Straits and to look at many ancient buildings from a view you cannot get on shore. It is very inexpensive for a round-trip ticket and takes the better part of a day. Other trips for 90 minutes on the boat are available, but I would recommend this one.

Be sure to take the ferry ride on the Bosphorus Strait.. We enjoyed the ferry ride, talking a one-way excursion and catching a taxi back. One could also catch a bus, but we were short on time. Great to ride on the ferry down the strait and see the sights.

Amazing cruise on Bosphorus. When visiting Istanbul you must take some hours on cruising the Bosphorus. Fantastic view from the boat. Our boat stopped at the beginning if The Black Sea. Many famous places to look at. Lunch onboard.

Take a Tour up the Bosphorus and take your Best Camera. The Best Views of Istanbul can be seen here.. Take time to appreciate a cruise up the Bosphorus Strait and gain a vantage point unique in the world. You will enjoy the birds that fly along beside you too. The result is that you go between Europe and Asia

View the sights from the water. We did this trip twice although this was accidental . The first trip which our hotel booked for us had a very well informed guide who made the trip fascinating . Many aboard chose to sit on a higher deck which had a very poor recorded commentary . Whilst they did see a pod of dolphins playing with the boat which we somehow missed they missed out on an excellent guide . Our second trip the following day was in a cruise ship which had made special arrangements to cruise the straits because it had cancelled tours of Istanbul for its passengers as a safety precaution . The commentary was not as comprehensive which was understandable in the circumstances but was in any event well appreciated by our fellow travellers .
Between Asia and Europe. Loved this strait between Asia and Europe, connecting Sea or Marmara and Black Sea. And turkey, Istanbul on both ends of shore.
Ferry. Take a ferry if it's good weather! Just get out on the Bosporous. I recommend going to Kadikoy and if you do, don't miss the sweet shop, Cafer Erol!

Take a ride. Very easy, like a bus trip to use. Buy a jeton (4 TL) nearby the ferry station from Eminõnū to Üsküdar. 15 min and you have reached the asian part of Istanbul. Once you go off board turn right and take a walk on the seaside. After 10 to 15 min you will reach some bars that are located to the seaside. Sit down, relax, take a look on the ship traffic on the Bosporus. Have a turkish coffee or two and watch. We stayed one and a half hour. Better than a guided boat tour for about 12 to 15 TL.
Beautiful. Istanbul is amazing in how to crosses the strait - just the history of this little waterway alone is amazing ... take a cruise up and take in the views - very nice

Most enlightening!. I so enjoyed sailing down the Bosphorus and taking in all the different architecture, most centuries old! I was amazed at how the wooden structures, houses built almost into the water were centuries old. Well worth a visit!

A relaxing ride along the river to see both Asia and Europe. I was in Istanbul for only two nights and wanted to get a good glimpse of the city within limited time. To take a boat ride is highly recommended for it is relaxing way to see much of the city.

RedRiverLawyer. Our advice on visiting Istanbul: getting out on the water of The Bosphorus is a must to understand why there always has been a city in this strategic location. Seeing both the Asian and European sides of Istanbul from the water makes it easier to see how the city and its people function. Given that the city streets are often choked with vehicles, it clearly is easier for citizens to take a ferry across The Bosphorus when possible and walk whenever possible. We arranged a 2-hour private boat tour through Sea Song travel advisors in Istanbul. A good investment of time and money since we felt we were cruising on a private yacht for a quite reasonable price.

Enjoyable cruise. We had a two hour cruise today on the Golden Horn river and along the Bosphorous Strait.Tips: 1. Take a jacket/sweater and a neck scarf along as it could be a little windy and cold, especially if you are out on the deck. 2. A sunny day with a clear sky is the best.3. A good guide is essential, but if people don't show interest, the guide may skip some less interesting, but still worthwhile historical stories about the neighborhoods that will be seen during the cruise.4. The views are stunning, take you best camera along.
weekend GATEAWAY. VERY NICE CORNER, near in bosphorus shore..little bazar and retaurant cafe ,you can take short Boat trip in my opinion its much better than other boattrip...

Must do . Initially thought the cruise of the Bosphorus woukd be touristy but after doing it have to to say is a must do. Gives so much more perspective to the city and shows yiu wjat else there is to see. Do it sooner during the trip so that you can be sure you are all that interests you including the non tourist waters side areas away from the torist traps . so many great sights along the straight
Bosphorus. We sailed through the beautiful river going towards Princess Islands.Amazing trip since you get to see so many gorgeous palaces and castles along the way.a must do trip in Istanbul.enjoy

Ferry ride. Take the Tyrmol ferry tour up the Bosphorus. Best 12Tl. Near the bridge. 1 1/2 hour trip to the second bridge passing beautiful palaces and homes and a ancient fort near the second bridge.We had previously taken a local ferry to the Princes Islands. The largest islan with cafes and examples of timber buildings.
Mesmerizing beauty!. The Bosphorus Strait has mesmerizing beauty. Everyone should visit at least once for its History and beauty.

Great trip aboard a ferry... The whole trip was amazing. Advice to book a private boat if you can afford it for more fun but nevertheless an amazing day spent sailing on the river that divides Asia and Europe... They stop at the eastern end and you can buy a fresh fish sandwich from the 10-20 shops/stalls there with their mouthwatering turkish pickles dipped in some salty liquid. Will remember the day forever...

Quick, Nightime Tour. I had a long layover in Istanbul so I had a driver take me on a tour of the city. We drove to Bosphorus and I was able to take several picture along the river. To see Asia on the other side and then the bridges connecting the two continents was cool.

Bosphorus by night. We did a private tour of the Bosphorus by night and it was a magical experience.A beautiful yacht with inside and outside seating takes you right out to the Black Sea. Drinks and snacks are offered onboard. The yacht can be booked via your hotel.

Best thing to do in Istanbul. If you are short on time and want to make the best out of your stay in the wonderful Istanbul, then this is the best place to visit. Take the cruise trip through which will get to see a lot of historical and key places around Istanbul located on the shores of the bosphorus. Don't forget to eat the kumpir found at the scores of outlets leading up to the cruise.

Beautiful views. Do not forget to take extra batteries and memory card for your camera. Views on both the sides are excellent. It reflects the real beauy of Istanbul. Not to be missed at all costs. Full day activity. The cruise ship takes you on a beautiful journey of Europe and Asia.

Centre of World. East or west ,europe or asia.in bosphorus strait magic will embrace you.You will see history,elegant touch of palaces through the strait.In the end you may find yourself in a daydream of that magical shadow of Istanbul.

Wow. Asia at one side and europe on the other..... amazing feeling. The cruise u get by booking in advance is always expensive. I always get the cruise from the galata bridge side. There are solo small.motor boats which take u near to the dead sea in just 6 euros. Surprising? Hun !

An adventure you have to do when in Istanbul. Take a boat trip, we did a day trip with lunch which was most enjoyable. The commentry was informative. a stop off at a fishing village just made the afternoon
windy tour. We just hopped on a local boat near Eminomu harbor. We paid 12 lira each for a one and a half hour tour. Great views. Bring a jacket because it is much colder on the boat than on land.

Boat trip of the Bosphorus. On a sunny afternoon a boat trip down the Bosphorus is not something to be missed! Most tour boats explain the sights in both Turkish and English, so you are able to understand what you are looking at. Both the European and Asian shoreline are dotted with historical and beautiful buildings that must be seen! Highly recommend a trip.

Beautiful view of 2 Continents. Took a lovely boat tour of the Bosphorus. Learned about the natural aspects of the flow of water along with the cultural and architectural sights on both continents of Istanbul.

Helps you appreciate the city.. A trip on the Bosphorus either on a cruise or the commuter ferry is a must for visitors. On a sunny day the city sparkles and at night it glows. Do your research on cruise companies as you give a whole day and it needs to be worth it. A ride on the ferry is cheap. Have a cup tea and a local bun and drink in the scenery.A visit to the Asian side gives a more local insight into Istanbul. Go on a Sunday for a busy and bustling atmosphere.
A must. If in Istanbul, a boat ride on the Bosporus is a must. Great view of the city. Try to do it within a guided tour and then you can learn a lot.

A Must Cruise in Istanbul. Highly recommend a cruise on the Bosphorus Strait while in Istanbul. You can take a half day tour or the almost full day cruise all the way to the Black Sea and back. Worth the views and very inexpensive.

Relaxing way to see both sides of city. We woke up too late to make the 10:30 AM departure for the 6 hour cruise but thoroughly enjoyed our two hour plus afternoon trip, from Eminonu, on the Bosphorus. Although we opted to not rent the audio guide, we relied on our DK Eyewitness Guide Book and were able to make out some famous landmarks and sites as we cruised the water, and we thoroughly enjoyed the light snacks and apple tea that were available. My favorite part was taking a look at the fortress of Europe, built by Mehmet II, before his invasion of Constantinople. VMy husband and I came away from the trip much relaxed from the enjoyable sights and smooth cruise.Highly recommended, especially if you need a break from the bustle and noise of the city.

Wow!!!!. If you are in Isntabul, don't miss the 90 minutes ferry trip through Bosphorus Strait. We truly enjoyed it. And, yes, do not miss to each fresh fish sandwiches from the fish boats upon your return.
Beautiful. Boat trip was not useful, long but there was spectacular sights of Asia and Europe. My second visit to Istanbul. Enjoyed it.
Nice area. you can see some of really nice views from here, but area is also very busy, so you can have a drink or relax a bit there.

Great Views all around. Bosphorus Strait as I know, is the connection between Black Sea and Sea of Marmara. It's a great experience to go through.Travelling through is by only a Boat.If you really wanna enjoy, go some times in middle of Summer.

Its a must things to do if you're in Istanbul. My wife and I used the Dentur Avrasya for the trip which located next to Dolmabahce Mosque which cost about 15 TL per person. Although the boat does not stop at any place along the Strait but we took a lot of pictures with amazing views from both Asian and Europe side.Have your camera ready at all times when cruising :)
Bosphorus. Amazing place for family to travel. Good peaceful place to relax as indeed it really best place within budget to travel to Europe.
trade mark of Istanbul. its the iconic strait of Turkey and istanbul separating Asia from Europe and this makes Istanbul such an unique city.
Boat trip. Great fun. Very cold this time of year. Stay downstairs indoors on boat. Food offered is for sale but not clear when offered.

Picturesque. One of the most interesting strech of water between the 2 continents,its unique.The Bosphorus lays between Europe and Asia Minor and is one of the most beautiful sceneries in the world.Location wise its the most expensive piece of land in Turkey.Its the strech of water between the black sea and the marmara sea.There are palaces built by the byzantine and ottoman empire at the coastline.The sun sets from one end rising from the other continent.
Go for a relaxing boat ride. Taking a ferry across the Bosphorus Strait is one of the funnest and cheapest thrills that Istanbul offers.
Must see by boat. If possible, charter a boat for the day and see Istanbul from the water. It truly was a wonderful experience.

Short trio across the Bosphorous and between the bridges. Very busy channel.ships from all sizes and shapes. Loads of hotel and restaurants on both side. Two huge hanging bridges connects Europe with Asia. 30 minutes boat ride takes you aver the central area. Enjoy a cup of tea and come back.

Amazing bosphorus. İts a üniuqe Place on the Earth ,wonderfull Wiew and historical ancient houses,best restaurants,amazing Experience...its Sea between two continents,you can take a Public boat and. Watch all of them, .. .Main Boat stations are Eminönü,Beşiktaş,Kadıköy and. Üsküdar

In between Europe and Asia. Probably the only narrow stretch of water that separates a city in 2 continents. A good way to chill out. Dress warmly.

When the weather is fine, most splendid!. I like to ride a ferry when I go to the Asian side of Istanbul, it's so much better than getting on a subway. Take the Ferry cruise, it's cheap and totally worth it!. Take the ferry cruise up to the black sea and back. Grab lunch at the little fishing village and have fried mussels. So good! This is really inexpensive and a fun day trip.

Separates the European from the Asian parts of Istanbul . The bosphorus is a sea straight transecting Istanbul and dividing it to its two famous parts. Lovely . Really really really lovely place to visit ... I totally recommonding it ,,, it is an important area to check and hang out

A must do activity in Istanbul. The Bosphorous strait boat trips are easily accessible from the Katabas metro stop. The hop on hop off trip is reasonable and allows you time to see all the sights that interest you. long weekend visit. Any visit to this great city is incomplete without a boat trip along the Bosporus, which separates Europe from Asia; in some places only 400 metres apart. Shipping traffic is constant all day long; going one way in the morning and the other in the afternoon. It is a magical experience not to be missed by discerning travellers

At night ! it is beautiful. I think this has beautiful view. I took boat and it was good experience.^_^ day time & night time both..

besiktas is the best quarter. a good place for a walk can be found on various spots along the bosphorus. walk from galata bridge to besiktas until the bosphorus bridge (or reverse). besiktas is one of the best quarters of istanbul, maybe even the best. alon the way is istanbul modern art museum and besiktas stadium (currently under construction but finished mid2016). another good walk is on the asian side from üsküdar northwards. non of the bridges over he boshoros is open to pedestrians as the city prefers to charge money from motorists. what a shame, they should think their pedestrian-unfriendly position over!

Small cruising. If you guys love to see the bosphorus strait, try to take a cruise over the area to see the wide range and seaside of the place. You will see things that you can't imagine it was built like palaces and so many things.
A tourist must-do. The ferry ride on the Bosphorus was definitely one of the highlights of our visit to Istanbul. Just make sure that you have a good tour guide - our's wasn't.
Palaces. Is a must do! Cruise on the Bosporus Strait, see all the old Palaces, Dolmabahce Palace and all the others. We were lucky, the weather was perfect.

Public Ferry for the win. Traveling on a budget or not, I don't think you can't beat the public ferry option if you have the time. I spent 9 days in Istanbul, so this was the right answer for me. The public ferry leaves from Eminönü to Anadolu, and your best bet is to get on the 10:35am ferry. I arrived at 9:50 in the off season, purchased my ticket and waiting in line to ensure I had an optimal seat for the one hour forty-five minute trip. This probably wasn't as crucial in the off-season, but there was still a line of about 50 people by 10:35! While Anadolu wasn't my favorite, I did enjoy sitting at an over-priced restaurant with a view of the Bosphorus for an hour, drinking coffee and eating my packed lunch.A much shorter option is to take the public ferry from Eminönü to Üsküdar and back, which will run you a about 5TL round trip with your Istanbulkart, and give you views of the both sides of the city.

What a view!. I've took a short cruise like almost everyday just enjoying the view of the east and west side of istanbul. The view of the buildings and the busy river cruises were so amazing. Infact you can feed the seagulls while the cruise is taking off, really enjoy it!

Grandiose. This should be one of the must-do activity in our Istanbul visit itinerary. Just catch any boat from Galata Bridge , and it will take us to the Bhosporus bridge. The view of the city from the waters is amazing.

Have a chill time on the water. Great place to see Istanbul from water. Beautiful place to chill on the boat. Not expensive if you travel on the normal boat just few bucks. Most boats sell turkish coffee and tea, snacks, great place to take pictures.

Leisurely cruise along the river. Views of old and new city on either side.
Take a shorter cruise.
The food on boats are very pricey, you can take your own on board.
The commentary is usually in various languages, and very mumbled, so rather read a guide book.

A historically eventful water body! . This historically significant stretch of water links the Black Sea with the Sea of Marmara. It is roughly 30 kms long. You can find references to this strait in ancient Greek tales like the Jason and the golden fleece. As you travel down the enchanting Bosphorus you can relive the history, beauty, myths and geography of this connecting waterway. If you get on and off the ferry, as you travel across the Bosphorus, you can sample all the charm of this area. This ferry trip was the highlight of my Istanbul Odyssey.
I Thought I'd be Impressed. I was excited to sail between Asia and Europe. While we were sailing between the two continents, the feeling was just ok. The boat was spacious, when you are inside!

Fabulous trip. Numerous tour ships operating from the Golden Horn between Ataturk and Galata bridges. The tour is just over 2 hours. The boats travel into the Bosphorus Strait and under the huge Europe-Asia bridge. Both sides of the Straight are seen, the vistas are fantastic.

Rich with history. I really love Turkey, this particular area is great because of all the architecture and history associated with Turkey and the Ottoman Empire. I would recommend just wandering around and looking at everything.
Brilliant. Take the hop on and hop off ferry. Fantastic value and do interesting. Get of and do a palace or just stroll around. We will do again next time we visit!
Relaxing and peaceful . Beautiful ride through the Bosforus, one get to see both sides of Turkey. Be sure to take your dizzines medicine before :)Strongly recommended tour

😍😍😍😍I love the sea . I lovely this whole cruise . There was so much to see . I would definately recommend to anyone . the trip was epic . You get to see everything from the bridges to clubs to real estate to museums to mosques to sea gulfs to meeting interesting people in the cruise

Loved it. It's one of the must do every time you visit Istanbul. Try to get into the (Bogaze) one that is offered by Istanbul Baladyies. It's cheaper and nicer than the other ones offered by guides standing by the cost it only costs 12 TL . Also try the hip on hip off offered by the Bogaze for some sightseeing during the trip.

Adds Immensely to Istanbul. This narrow sea channel connects the Black Sea and the Sea of Marmara and forms part of the boundary between Asia and Europe. I think it contributes immensely to Istanbul's wonderful ambiance. I enjoy going down to the shore to watch ferries, tour boats, fishing vessels, freighters, tankers and -- on my most recent trip -- dolphins in the water. I especially like being out on the strait, even on chilly winter days.I've been on long and short Bosphorus cruises, leaving from the European side of Istanbul, and found it magical to look at settlements on two continents at the same time. I can see more during the day, but at night the lights on both shores are stunning. The least expensive way to be on the Bosphorus is to take a public ferry between Europe and Asia. I never tire of seeing the massive Hagia Sophia, coming and going. A ferry can cost less than the equivalent of $1 U.S., depending on its departure point.A fairly new way to be on the strait is the Hop-On Hop-Off Bosphorus cruise offered afternoons by Dentur Avrasya. The first boat leaves at 12:45 p.m. and hourly after that. Though passengers can stay on for the entire 1-hour, 45-minute cruise, each boat makes four short stops at places of interest in Europe and Asia. We got off twice in Asia, first to see Kucuksu Pavillion, a former royal hunting lodge, and then to explore Beylerbeyl Palace. On board, we sat on the upper deck to marvel at Ottoman mansions along the way and the magnificent Dolmabahce Palace.For those who have no interest in being on the water, two suspension bridges cross the strait, connecting Europe and Asia. A third -- Yavuz Sultan Selim Bridge -- is under construction and is expected to be completed in May 2016.

Boat Ride. A boat ride sailing along the Bosphorus Straits
Many flamingo flying around
Nice view overseeing the Eminonu

if you go to Istanbul Don't miss The Bosphorus Strait !. If you go to Istanbul you'll need to sail along the Bosphorus Strait to see a very
spectacular view ! This is not a recommend This is a MUST ;)
must tour Bosphorus. Bosphorus a must place to visit and take tour or more , unforgettable experience to see asiaand europe on side

I would advise not to board the cruise last minute, as you wouldn't get a nice seat with a nice view, or you might have to sit separately from your friends. Anyway, it is so awesome to have the chance to look at both Europe and Asia at the same time!Ohya, and don't forget to bring some snacks on board, so that you can kill the time. If you forget, don't worry, you can buy some snacks on the cruise as well.

Lovely . I took a Bosphorus tour on a ship and I believe it is worth visiting. There are so many awesome places on the shores of it that you don't know whether to look left or right. Great!

Bosphorus tour. Sehir Hatlari Bosphorus lines sales offices are located on the right docks of Galata Bridge when coming from Spice Bazaar. You can catch a ferry for 25TL return all the way to where the Bosphorus meets Black sea. You get off at the end and can walk up to an old, crumbling fort that used to protect the waterway. Wear comfortable walking shoes as climb is steep. You have 3 hours to relax there before the boat leaves. At the base there are little seafood restaurants. Walk towards the bus station where there is a cafe on the L side corner. Very tasty sea bass!!! Whole trip lasts 6 hours. It is local ferry, without commentary but somewhat more authentic.
Awesome views. The buzzing heart and soul of Istanbul. You will love the place. It is busy and alive. You most try the yummy potatoes and the answering waffles.

Bosphorus At Night. So my boyfriend kindly did the one hour drive to the Bosphorus area for me because he knew I wanted to see it. We went late at night and I found it simply stunning to take in the sights at night! For those wanting to take pictures, I obviously would not recommend going at night because only the lit up bridge would be worth it but all the wonderful buildings along the way won't be as appreciated photography wise. The following day he actually took me across the bridge because he knew I wanted to say I've been to Asia haha! I love the fact that this is the only place where 2 continents meet and enjoyed my short spell in the Asian side of Turkey. There were some hills that provided spectacular views of city and water...very lovely to see especially in the lovely weather. This place comes highly recommended by visitors to Istanbul and I agree with them. Both times I've been to Istanbul I've turned down going on the water to Maiden's Tower or Galata Tower etc but the next time I visit, I'm hoping it'll be third time lucky and I'll be brave enough to do it!

Superb experience @ Bosphorous. I took the Bosphorous dinner cruise last week and it was a wonderful 3 hour ride, during which some of the historic places could be seen from the cruise. Must do attraction during any visit to Istanbul
The most beautiful view. This is very unique location of the world where two continents meet together. Very historical places in each side designated with beautiful palases

Wonderful sights along the Bosphorus Strait. Had the great opportunity to explore the Bosphorus Strait on a cruise as part of a tour group. Our group members were the only passengers aboard! So that certainly added something special.We started out at a point south of the First Bosphorus Bridge, and continued northward along the Europe side of the Strait, up to the Second Bosphorus Bridge. We then went southward close to the Asia side of the waterway. The cruise lasted about one hour. The weather was great for a February afternoon, sunny and not too cold.Certainly a strange but exciting feeling to have Europe on one side and Asia on the other. Wonderful views along the strait. They included the Dolmabahce Palace, Ciragan Palace, Ortakoy Mosque, Egyptian Embassy, Rumelihisari fortress, Anadoluhisari fortress, Kucuksu Palace, and Beylerbeyi Palace.
the prodigious Bosphorus. There are gorgeous places to visit during a stay in this wonderful city, the Bosphorus was one of the top 5 places I have seen.

Criss-cross continents. Take a ferry along the Bosphorus to enjoy greater Constantinople. Grand houses and buildings cram the shoreline and ancient fortresses protect the old city. one of the world greatest waterways. No trip to Istanbul would be complete without a ferry ride on the Bosporus, which links the Black Sea with the Sea of Marmara. On one bank is Asia, on the other Europe, and in between is a curious, two-current strait: The surface water travels from the Black Sea to the Sea of Marmara, and the colder, saltier current of water travels below it in the opposite direction. The ride is especially delightful on a sunny day, when the Bosporus is filled with ships of all nations on their way to and from Bulgaria, Romania, Russia and the Asian parts of Turkey. The trip takes you past upscale waterside suburbs with good seafood restaurants, wonderful imperial palaces, classic Turkish mansions, vast bridges that link the continents, and the fortresses of Anadolu Hisar and Rumeli Hisar. Keep an eye out for the stylish yalis (villas) that the Turkish aristocracy built along the waterfront. Some are fairly run-down, but others are beautifully restored, with expensive speed boats moored at their front piers. If your particular method of travel allows it, try to break for a seafood lunch at Anadolu Kavagi, at the Black Sea end of the Bosporus. Afterward, for a spectacular view of the Black Sea, climb to the castle at the top of the hill behind it.
Nice boat ride. It was a fun ride as our family rode the ferry. Many residence houses, mansions and restaurants are on the banks of the strait. It was relaxing and worth the time.

Memories that I will never forget!. Such a beautiful scenery. Felt a little emotional and stunned - all mix together. Took a boat ride through the strait, what a wonderful view to see the unpretentious Istanbul unfold right before my eyes.I would surely coming back :)

Okay. Paid around €10 pp for this. Boat was okay. Not too small. Got seats on the upper deck. You have to be there first for good seats. First 10 minutes was fine, with an English guide. Became boring after that, although makes for a good cruise. Enjoyed it.

...another MUST in Istanbul... ..Took a boat ride at sunset up and down the banks of the Strait.. stunning views of the city proper and beautiful views of the Asian side. Rolling slowly from Eminönü towards the İstanbul Çevre Yolu Bridge over the Bosphorus, you come across the beautiful buildings that stud the west coat. As the boat veers to cross the Strait towards the Asian side, the landscape, until then urban, becomes luxuriating green and very suburban. Beautiful villas surrounded by much greenery dot the banks. Some old palace too, on your way to Kiz Kulesi, The Maiden's Tower, a lighthouse in the middle of the water. By then the boat was veering back towards Eminönü, with profile of the house standing in front of the falling sun in all its splendor. Definitely one excursion you don't want to miss.
The most wonderful views. Feast your eyes on this wonderful ancient city by travelling along the Bosphorus with Europe on one side and Asia on the other.
Separating two continents. Busy with shipping with excellent views of old and new Istanbul. The numerous ferries with diverse routes are a very inexpensive way to explore the strait.

Boat trip. We took a water taxi as it was cheaper and enjoyed the gentle breeze and wonderful sights as we sailed along. We had lunch on the Asian side before catching the wrong taxi back (whoops) certainly an experience one must have when visiting Istanbul

Gives you a different view of Istanbul. We went on a private cruise down the Bosphorus. Definitely worth the money, especially taking a private cruise rather than the overcrowded ferry.Saw Istanbul from a different perspective. Went past several universities, outdoor cafes, the luxurious yachts, the upmarket areas and sumptuous hotels.A completely different look at Istanbul, a change from the old part where there are thousands of people to a fairly quiet area. We saw the old fort, the floating club owned by a football team and ex-palaces previously owned by Sultans. We spent about two hours going up and down the river, saw the European side and the Asian side (still haven't figured out which is which). I would recommend a trip, you will enjoy it.

A unique experience. A very busy waterway. We took a ferry ride on the Bosphorus - spectacular views. We also returned on board our cruise ship, the Magnifica, and were able to enjoy the glorious sunset over the Bosphorus from the deck of the ship. Very memorable!

A cruise up the Bosphorus is a must!. We took a cruise up the Bosphorus with our hotel tour guide and about 8 others which was well worth it. Great history about the area, the divide between Europe and Asia. The beautiful architecture, the bridges, the cargo ships heading up toward Georgia, et. al. This was worth every penny and was a lovely tour.
nice place for walking. very nice area to walk around, especially in a good weather. Great view on the bridge. Lots of restaurants and cafes, also there is a market with different things to buy.

Relax and enjoy the beauty of Istanbul!. This was the best part of my trip, Istanbul has a beautiful charm in everything! This is your chance to see it all while you sit back and enjoy the cool breeze! Don't miss it :)

For a walk or dinner at a fish restaurant. Its amazing beautiful especially from european side... from besiktas to ortakoy you can walk on an amazing way or in Bebek you have to feel different cozy ambiance ... you can find very nice cafes restaurants for breakfast lunch or dinner...this region starts from Besiktas and finish in Sariyer...

Its an amazing strait connecting the Marmara Sea and the Black sea.. I have done the Bhosphorus cuise twice. Each time it has been an amazing experience. There are any number of heritage buildings on the two shores with a lot of history behind each building. It is best to take the audio guide while going on the cruise. The sea can be quite windy and chilly and it is best to be properly clad with dark glasses and head caps or scarves. Its an almost two hour cruise and a photographers delight with the sea gulls flying alongside the boat, diving for the fish churned up by the boat's propeller. The toilets on the boat are avoidable.

A river trip between two continents. It is a really interesting waterway trip unusual in the you are sailing between two continents, Asia on the one side and Europe on the other. The boats vary a lot. We were on a new luxury boat where they have wedding receptions. There were white tables and chairs but it was cold. Some of the boats looked like old fishing trawlers, so be careful to choose a good one. There are many palaces built along the bosphorus on both banks and there are many mosques too, so it is a really interesting trip. The bosphorus runs between the sea of marmara and the black sea. The sea of marmara runs into the age an and then into the Mediterranean so it is a really important waterway. Worth a trip.

Lovely but come first and early to get a nice vue. We had a boat trip with shuttle service included ( hotel bosphorus bosphorus hotel) a really nice boat not too crowded 100L for both of us little bit expensive u can get a tour for even half that price.Come first so that u can choose a nice place people are so rude they just start pushing each other to get to the terrace seats.We had a private entrance fare from the harbour pictures below ( you can book this trip with the red tour bus in taksim)

Enjoyable Ferry Boat Ride. People continually tried to sell us a 2 hour cruise ( 25 TL r/t) but we completely resisted and were rewarded. We took a ferry boat for 4 TL each way (about $1.30 each way) and had a fantastic view from the top deck. Coin/ticket machines were a bit tricky to navigate but local people were very kind and helped us use the coin fare machines. Beautiful, sunny, warm February day which allowed us to see everything in and around the Bosphorus, Good people watching too. Young children played accordions on the ferries soliciting tips. Super for people watching too11!
scenic. This was quite interesting on a boat tour to Asia. There are impressive palaces, resorts, bridges and views. Quite photogenic

A must see. Unique, magnificent landscape, full of history and Levantine atmosphere: grandiose and beautiful palaces, fortresses and luxurious vintage villas, completed with boats, gullets and yachts forms can create a... drunkenness of senses and colours.

Beautiful. We took a boat by 16 Turkish Lira per head for a 1 and half hours navigation in the Bosphorus. It is worth going at any moment of the day, the views are simply great.Some precautions: toilets were rather unclean, coffe and tea aboard were expensive and not quite tasty, seagulls bombarded with flying excrement and wind was an issue. Despite all these, it is something worth doing and enjoyable taking the appropriate precautions. One must be careful with streets offers of "Bosphorus navigation" coming from virtually hundreds of locals. Better ask at the hotel or check at the pier.
Beautiful. very beautiful coin to see the Bosphore and have some good days, it was a very good trip I've ever done!
Find a cafe along the Strait - get some tea & relax. Such an incredible historic location. Find an outdoor cafe, get some tea, relax & enjoy the sights & sounds of the people & boats in the area

Connecting the Two Continents. The straight presents a beautiful view of the city and its two parts both during day and night. One can spend considerable time exploring by boat the place on the banks and enjoy the beauty of city specially at night.
europe?asia?. there are lots of historic sights and mosques around the strait.suggest you to bring warm clothes while traveling by a vessel.
Beautiful views. Certainly a wonderful way to visit Istanbul. Catch a ferry and enjoy the beautiful view. Order tea on board to have the local experience.

Amazing. This is the place I do love most in Istanbul. Calm and amazing, with the bosphorous view, the Bosphorous bridge on day time as well as at night......The buildings around, the magnificent palces, restaurants and cafés.....It's a place where we can relax and have fun.....
Great for a sunny chilled out day. Take a ferry from kabatas or besiktas and for only a few liras you can enjoy a hop on hop off tour of Bosporus! Not ideal if its raining!

Cheap and cheerful or more expensive indulgence . We looked at the lovely cruises available, from 90 minutes (most around 35 Euro) up to half day or evenings with dinners.However, our time limits did not allow for these, this trip. So we took a ferry across the strait, from Eminonu to Uskadur, had a wander around the town and caught another ferry back around sunset. As we had picked up an Istanbulkart (which covers travel by train, bus, tram or ferry around Istanbul) it only cost 3.20 TL each way. The card is easy to charge up at hotels, ticket machines or stations. 30 TL each met our needs for 4 days.We could have extended it by catching a bus to Kadakoy and then another ferry back for a different route.Istanbul offers so many options, it can suit any budget, so choose the method that fits you.

Recommended Activity!. I really advise everyone to have Bosphorus Cruise up and down at the Bosphorus Strait. It splits the Asia and Europe as two continents and amazing scenery! It is a good choice to feel the whole city!

Best Kampir and view of the bridge. Best time is in the evening, enjoyable for some hangout time. Many Kampir (Turkish stuffed baked potato) kiosks, and Turkish ice cream vendors. Enjoy the ice cream vendor's tricks and the good taste as well. Perfect for nice evening shots with the lighted bridge.

where the continents meet. I now live just down to the Bosporus Strait… and it has this magical something about it. I've crossed the strait by ferries, the bridge and under it via the metro I guess a hundred times or more now.Be sure to take a stroll from Ortakoy to Karakoy (The Golden Horn) or one of the many tours on the water…It's a great get-away in the heart of this massive city.

Gorgeous and with low budget. I took the full Bosphorus trip , all took around 6 hrs , you will need to go to Kabatas ferry port , this port is right beside kabatas metro station which you can go to it by funicular from Taksim metro station , it's only one station from Taksim.When I reached there I picked a random company which name is Dentur Avrasya, the ferry boat moved 11:15 am from Kabatas and passed by Bakistas 11:30 am, during the way to the port (Anadolu Kavagi) which took around 1:15 hrs, we were passing by a lot of Istanbul's old buildings on the shore of Bosphorus, we reached Anadolu Kavagi which is in the Asian side of Istanbul , a small village with stunning views to the Bosphorus and dead sea, to have this great view you will need to go up to the hill to visit Yoros Castle, the view from this point is breath taking , it's worth the effort of going up the hill , don't worry it's not so hard to go up , but be ready with a comfortable pair of shoes, there are signs to show you the qay to the castle from the port till the castle , so you will not get lost.We went up there and took some gorgeous photos , then we took lunch in a restaurant beside the castle which name is Yoros restaurant , the lunch was two main dishes , fish of course , as they have a great fresh fish taste in this area, the lunch cost was around 50 to 60 liras, then we went bach to the port, we took the ferry boat at 3:30 pm sharp back to Istanbul, on the way back we saw the great houses on the asian shore of Bosphorus, and some other old buildings.We reached Kabatas around 4:45pm.This is a great trip , with only 20 liras for the ferry boat per person , and if you needed to eat you will chose what's suitable for you.Enjoy and have a great time.

Good day trip. We really enjoyed the day/tour on the Bosphorus Strait. It was so interesting to see the homes, palaces and fortresses along the shore. Geographically one can realize its importance, and it's one of the few places in the world where one can travel from Europe to Asia in the same day.

Great View of Istanbul from the Water. Upon leaving Istanbul our cruise ship traveled through the Bosphorus Strait to the Black Sea. We spend the first half of the trip on deck to observe the many buildings, bridges, and sites of North Istanbul. A great view that you couldn't have had by car or bus.

Beautiful!. The Bosphorus Strait is one of the most beautiful places on Earth. Asia and Europe on either side make for an extremely unique distinction! The sight of Istanbul landmarks from the strait is divine. It is worth getting a cruise ride on the Bosphorus. Sometime just sit by the shore and enjoy the view!

Magical stretch of water. We took a half day cruise over the Bosphorus, and believe me, it turned out to be the highlight of our Istanbul visit. This narrow stretch of water which separates two continents - Asia and Europe - has a magical appeal to it.Its was a wonderful sight looking at two continental land masses on either side as we cruised over the Bosphorus. Along the way, we passed by large cruise liners berthed near Istanbul. This is a not-to-be-missed activity in Istanbul.

Beautiful but time consuming. It took the ferry long tour around the Bosphorus from Eminonu port, once you get there there will be many tourist trapping tours that cost a lot of money and are not not as wholesome as the official tour. So try to avoid them. The official tour is taken from the last ferry just before galata bridge. it costs only 25TL. While the other tours are 4 or 5 times that.That being said, even the official tour is not that eventful, the ferry docs at a few ports around the strait, and only one stop at a fishing village where you can have lunch. The views of both sides of Istanbul are really beautiful during the trip. And the ferry has good beverage and snack service not included in the ticket price. At the fishing village, you have about 4 hours to have lunch at the extremely touristy restaurants there, the food is good and is mainly sea food. You can also hike to the castle on top of the hill, the castle itself is dull but there are some nice views from up there. And it's not really a hike, more of a walk up the street.If you're short on time, skip this trip, as it takes a lot of time with very little to be done.

Nice boat ride even on a rainy day. A good way to see the sights and sounds of the Bosphorus. Make sure your camera batteries don't die out because there will be lots of picture-taking going on. We had a 90 minute boat ride up one side the strait and back down on the other side.
Clear division of European and Asian sides of city. Interesting how a narrow strait of water clearly defines the clean touristy European side of Istanbul from the denser souk looking Asian side.

Day trip value for money. Took a short trip ferry from Eminonu which was just 12 lira per person, something reasonably priced for a change for 90 mins tripGoes to bosphorus bridge and to next one before taking a turn back to Eminonu Great view of Europe and Asia
Fantastic. The magic of Istanbul is found in the Bosphorus - a real working seaway with a great choice of Vessels manoeuvring up and down the straight !

In the edge of both Asia and Europe. Conquer a landmark, a pole, or any important place as Bosphorus is a dream of any travelers. And we're not exemption. Remember to enjoy the view of the Bebek neighborhood from the hills of the Bosporus. Take our memorial photos on Fatih Sultan Mehmet Bridge as seen from Rumelihisarı. Architecture of the old castles on the river shore is impressive for an ancient Greece, Rome, the Byzantines and the Ottoman Empire.

Fabulous buildings line the banks. The round ferry trip from Istanbul offers some wonderful views of the beautiful buildings that line both sides of the Bosphorus Strait. There are fabulous palaces, very attractive mosques and some extraordinary houses.
Do it!. Take a cruise up the Bosphorus!... so worth it... great for a short or long trip for families or couples, or on your own... very cheap and cool way to spend sometime.
did the day cruise. This is a great way to see the harbor and the OLD OLD buildings. This is a guided tour and worth taking.

A great way to enjoy the city. Having a cruise a long the Bosphorus is a great way to enjoy the city. It is surely a must do. Cruising along both the Asian and the Europen sides, you get a chance to get close to the palaces and important buildings, as well as spectacular mansions.

Staggering views crossing one of the world's busiest warterways. the only real way to experience the Bosphorus is to sail across from the Asianto the European shores on a small boat - crossing on a passenger ferry is still exciting but it doesn't give you the same water-level view of the thrilling architecture and you miss the excitement of racing under the shadow of massive cargo ship churning through the narrow channel towards the Black Sea

Enjoy shiping/ fishing. The best place for enjoying shiping fishing and eatinng seafood with overall Seaview restaurants .its good for walking around .get istiklal street to the end visit the galata tower and pass to eminunu iskelesi / bridge .you can find it easily go geting ship thiket dont forget to buy some simit/turkish traditional bread for eating seagulls.

Great way to see Istanbul. Taking a cruise down the Bosphorus Strait is a great way to get an overview of Istanbul and also a great way to see towns outside of the city. Try to go early, so that you can spend some time at the last stop and look around before coming back to Istanbul. Ask around regarding which is the right company to go with, as some include meals which are not very satisfying.

Bosphorus River Cruise. Highly recommended... try to go on a cruise that includes both the Asian and European sides of the river. Ours involved a short stopover in between a 3 hour cruise with full buffet lunch included for just £20 per adult and the kids were free (ages 1, 2, 4)

Take a walk. Specially Baltalimanı and upward to north, walking is enjoyable. Traffic is not too congested. Nice restaurants all around. Try like Polis House (Baltalimanı) and Istanbul Municipal House restaurant (Istinye) for the fix very affordable breakfast, tea, lunch or dinner. If you want fresh fish and some extras then try Yenikoy restaurants. Around Tarabya and north to Kirecburnu there are fancy restaurants with live music or so.It is a very quite and safe area comparing to Old Town.

Warm Day Excursion. The Bosphorus strait naturally devides the European and Asian side of Turkey, thus separating the two continents. It also connects the Black Sea to the Sea of Marmara. This body of water serves as a major water highway for the transport of energy to Europe from Russia and Western Asia. The strait is over 2 miles across, 20 miles in length. Take a boat tour to view old villas, palaces of marble and old fishing villages. Tour boats are easily arranged through hotel concierge services or from the dockside. Most tours showcase the Grande Dolmabahce Palace, the Spice Market and the imperial pavilions of Yidiz Palace. Guided tours in various languages are offered. Prices vary from 15-30 Euro.

Loved this cruise!. Extremely informative cruise! Tour guide presenting in English. Boat I. Very good condition! Loved seeing Istanbul from another angle. Snacks and Turkish tea available onboard! Very affordable attraction!

Make sure you wear enough for the cruise!. The view is fantastic! And the price is fair enough. The only thing is to keep yourself warm. I went at the early November and it is already very cold on the strait.
not much to see!. Ferry trip to Bosphorus was nice but I don't recommend it as must do, I enjoyed the trip to princes islands more than Bosphorus trip.

A Boat Cruise a Must-do!. We took a 1.5 hour cruise along the Bosphorus Strait and thoroughly enjoyed it, without spending much at all - we paid 12TL each after deciding not to opt for one of the expensive tours themselves (EUR20+), and didn't feel hard done by at all.There was obviously no commentary or guide to let us know where we were going, and what the history of the buildings along the shore were, but we enjoyed it all the same.The boat had a nice indoor area with wooden benches and tables, a small cafe, and outdoor seating and standing areas, where we spent most of our time admiring the scenery, the passing buildings, and the bridges.The weather played along and this is an experience not to miss, however you choose to go about it, you must take the time to travel along the Bosphorus by boat!

another must-visit place. take a yacht ride on the bosphorus. and try to time it preferably in the evening such that its dusk on the return trip. the twinkling lights of all the buildings on both sides make a very pretty sight. you can also spot private yachts dotting the coast near galatasarai
Loved it. We booked this as part of a full day tour, and it was one of the best. We ride on a large boat and navigate for about two hours. The views were great even though it wasn't sunny.
Go for a ride.. Do not book this trip from your hotel. It is better and cheaper to catch the light rail to the spice markets and walk over and purchase your own ticket. You will save, trust me.
Take the boat. We took the boat to travel the Bosphorus strait from west to east and back. It is a great place to see all the different neighborhoods of Istanbul.

Great stay. It was a very nice stay at Inntel hotel Taksim.. Very clean and convinient for families and couple too,,, the sttaf are very helpfull specially UFUK he helped me a lot during my stay,,. Also they have a very delecouis brakfeast , so i advice everyone else to visit you won't regret ;)

Perfect way to see Istanbul in 2 hours. You must take a Boshorus river cruise. It is lovely and peaceful and calm. The cruise takes you from the heart of the city to the outer edge suburbs where life is quite different.Highly recommended and very good value at 12TKL
what a cruise. excellent cruise down the Bhosphorous,was cold that day but enjoyed it a lot.got to see the old city and the new city by boat.
Good place to go while visiting Istanbul. As tourists it's always good to visit the historic areas of a country you visit. Bosporus strait is where Europe and Asia connect and it's worth a visit.

River Stroll. Nice and very affordable way to spend part of your day. I think the 2 hour tour is enough as it could get a bit boring if you spent too much time on a tour. There are some great views of buildings and bridges. In winter it can be quite chilly and windy, so bundle up!

100 mins . Great tour. You can make this cruise from the harbour in eminönü. You just pay 12 lira and enjoy the tour with the locals. You can have also fish and bread :) try to sit on the left hand side of the boat.

Amazing view from port hole!!. Woke up in the morning looked out of the port hole and wow what a sight. The mosques in all their glory. Cannot think of a better way to arrive than a cruise ship early morning.

Cruise on the Bosphorus. Did a Bosphorus cruise arranged through a touring company, and it was a fantastic way of introduction to the wonder of Istanbul. The cruise took us through the old and the new Istanbul, and the east and the west divided by the strait., we were also lucky enough to see a large freighter, as only one at a time is allowed through the strait on their way to the Black Sea. I would recommend this cruise as a way of familiarity to city's history and famous landmarks

Beautiful! Take a city-run (not private) cruise to relax and appreciate!. The Bosphorus is the river running through Istanbul. It is gorgeous and certainly lends the city a more metropolitan, worldly, and relaxed air (despite the city's craziness at times). I recommend taking a river cruise - the ones run by the city are 12 TL for two hours and are awesome. Don't get ripped off and take the private tours (set up right next to the city-run kiosk) right over the bridge. Make sure you are on the city tours. They aren't packed and you get just relax in your chosen seat (or move around) for a couple hours as the waves crash and you are transported past many of the "main" historical and tourist sites. This was honestly one of my favorite activities of my whole trip to Istanbul!
Scenic views. We took the bike tour along the Bosphorous, the views were great, the riding flat. Not crowded at all.
Fabulous!. Visiting the Bosphorus Strait is one of the things you must do when in Istanbul! The views of the city are wonderful and you will not regret your decision!

Restful boat cruise, nice break from walking. The best value boat cruise is just North of the Kabatas tram/metro/ferry exchange. Walk North past all that and you'll see smaller boats for Prince's Islands for 6TL or hop on hop off boats for 15TL. There is food and light snacks for purchase on boats. No toilets so so what you need before boarding.

Great on a cruise. Great to take in a view of Istanbul via a cruise.
The changing architecture and difference between old & new city
Is amazing.

great river cruise well into the night. lovely nighttime cruise on the bosphorus - really recommend it. dinner and then a show and a dance floor to midnight. great fun and amazing scenery along the way

Serene. The strait has the European part of Turkey on one and the Asian on the other side. The guide told us that the European side was the old turkey which was more of the tourist areas...and the Asian side was the residential place.....But when u r in the cruise...All u see are Victorian style houses..and the domes of mosques and numerous palaces....and then u see the sports cars on the roads...as u sail by....its an experience in itself.....wherever u go u will always have the sea gulls with u

Beautiful Water. I saw the strait during a cold February. It was covered in small boats and birds. We took the ferry across the water and loved it! The sweet drink they gave us was also quite delicious. I forget the name but it was like the Turkish version of hot chocolate but with cinnamon!

get a different view. Taking a boat through the straits is a chance to sit down and watch Istanbul pass by--it is a history lesson, a chance to rest and in the evening an opportunity to watch spectacular sunsets

Not to be missed in Turkey. For a small fee you can take A relaxing boat trip down the straight. You will see the history and beauty of the straight as well as some incredible homes in what is the most expensive real estate in the world. There are some great photo ops and drinks are available on the cruise.

Cruise Tour of Bosphorus Strait. We took a 1.5 hour cruise of the Bosphorus Strait while in Istanbul. It was a great way to see the city scape from a different vantage point. Narration was good pointing out the various landmarks as we traveled both shorelines.

Breathtakingly beautiful!. The bosphorous strait is the first thing visible when flying into istanbul, you just can't miss the euro-asia divide. Several cruise options available on the waterfront, but you may need to negotiate hard for a good ticket price. If you want to spend some extra time, you could roam around the waterfront wheer many small eatery vendors sell a variety if Turkish snacks and kebabs , both vegetarian and non vegetarian. A must see and must do when in Istanbul!

A magical important strait dividing Asia and Europe in Turkey. There is a lot to see on a cruise along the Bosphorus Strait, It is an active waterway, compared to other waterways (say, the Hudson River in NYC)... there are palaces built along it, fishing village, dachas, bridges, you can take a very relaxing cruise along the Bosphorus, on a tour, or just on a public ferry: Sehir Hatlari
Wooow. I just love it...also my son and daughter....we took great pictures...we had wonderful time . The view and the sea...I will never forget

day and night view. we went on this cruise on our first day, there are agents every where selling and negotiating the price we have paid 40TL for two of us (after haggling) and it was for one and a half hour tour, lovely view from day into sun set and illuminating the mosques and bridges, information is provided in both languages( turkish and english) on the tour.however u can't take many clear photos on this tour (4:30 to 6:00 pm).on board cafe for hot and cold drinks and snack but we didn't try any other food. if tired and still wanted to see istanbual then its an ideal trip.

Took a fairy ride down the Bosphorus. This is sort of like the architectural tour of Turkey. You go down the Bosphorus and see the entire city from that view. See where continents converge by the joining of the waters and feel the current.

Lovely time! Buy cemitas, and feed the birds!. We took a delightful trip up the Bosphorus on the public boat. You can get an audio guide (which we did) but if you're not on the right side you miss everything they are talking about and also the guide doesn't always work, so skip the 10 TL and just enjoy it. We had a wonderful misty/hazy day and it made everything very ethereal. It was gorgeous to watch the buildings and towns go by and when we got basically to the edge of the Black Sea, we had a 3 hour stop for a great fish lunch on the Asian side, a coffee and a wander and time to head back. Great way to spend a day!
