Cruise starts from the Galata bridge area and one can see the distinct architectures of both the Asian and European influence on Istanbul architectureSnacks n juices / tea is available on payment.Try opting for a periphery seat on the boat for better views

Never ending parade of traffic. When I can I get a Bosphorus view in hotels. There is an unending parade of boats, ferries, freighters, sailboat races. Beautiful view to the other side, Asia or Europe and brings fresh cooling air on a hot day. Mesmerizing

Don't get ripped off!. My hostel lady told me not to get ripped off, but ripped off I got. The boats cost 12 lira, like four or five dollars. I managed to pay 100 lira. And that's when I said his first offer of 120 was too high.I thought if I paid more money, it would be a cozier boat with an English guide. It was nothing of the sort. And I just threw all that money in the proverbial toilet. I also did it in the rain, which was less than desirable. But I'm glad I didn't miss it because the Borphorus is what makes Istanbul Istanbul. I must say it was hard for me to find the building where you could buy tickets on the government-sponsored boats. I saw buildings for boats to the Asian side, but couldn't find the building that looked like the municipal boat center for the Bosphorus cruise. (If you find it, let me know!) When I asked for directions, I fell into the scam. The hazards of travelling alone on a shoestring. But I factored a scam or two into my budget. I saved a fortune by avoiding a tour. What I lost on the cruise I made up a hundredfold on my hostel, the Taksim House on Purtelas Street. (Be careful, there are several Taksim Houses in Istanbul). The lady who runs it has a conscience and is a treasure of information for people trying to do this inexpensively. Listen to her and watch your step with the scam artists. I met two, and the second introduced my to his cousins! He ate up the better part of my second day. (But that was an education in itself.)

Glad we did it - 90 minute boat tour. We boarded right at 6PM and headed out. Beautiful to watch the sunset and then about 1/2 way through the boat-ride, the lights all over the city came on. It was quiet, relaxing and beautiful sites to see. Would recommend!

A wonderful sightseeing trip. You can cruise the Bosphorus Strait by taking one of the ferries from Eminonu that lasts 2 hours for 12TYL. The Bosphorus Strait boasts a lot of landmarks in its wake from the Dolmabahce Palace to the Bosphorus bridge to the Maiden's Tower. It is quite a delight to view all these from the water.

Beautiful - however boat tour not good in poor weather. Stunnning location, and central to the Istanbul experience. Looked at the straight on two days, stunning to view in glorious weather, sadly on the day we did a boat tour, the cloud came in and wind picked up mid way through trip, my wife was ill for much of the second half.

Very interesting and beautiful buildings on the shore. Went on a Bosphorus cruise and found it extremely interesting to see on one side Europe and on the other side Asia. Many beautiful palaces and buildings to see on the shore, big bridges and make sure to go to the Horn where the view is spectacular
Enjoyable. Took a tour on ferry with my tire group. Very relaxing few hours. Nice way to take photos. They offered beverages as well.

RELAXING AND CHEAP. If you are able to avoid going on a fixed tour of the Bosphorous at high costs, rather walk/tram down to the left of the Galata bridge and buy a ticket from the Turyol ferry group. These hour and a half trips leave frequently during the day/night and take you around the strait. The cost is a very reasonable 12 TL's (+/- $4) and the ticket office is right at the shoreline next to the ferries.

take a boat ride and rest your feet. There are short cruises available. One is the palace cruise and it lasts about 90 minutes. the views are incredible and the history building are worth photographing when near the shorelines.
Beautiful skyline. At least take the time to drive along the Bosphorus to see the skyline. There are great restaurants, boats, clubs (though I didn't bother) and beautiful private homes.

Incredible waterway. Took a day cruise on the Bosporous. Boarded at Eminonu docks by the Galata Bridge and near mouth of the Golden Horn. Crused all the way to small town of Rumeli Kavagi where we had a wonderful lunch. Along the way you get to see many of the grand palaces (Dolmabahce, Ciragon,Beylerbeyi), Rumeli Castle, and a number of small, fashionable towns (Bebek, Kanlica...). Worth a half day to get a much diferent perspective. Lastly, this waterway is one of the busiest for large ships transitting between the Black sea and the Med.

Happy we did a boat tour. I am happy that we did a boat tour, but we really could have done it much more cheaply using the public transport ferry system. Though with the tour company, we did get some description of what we were seeing, which was good. And we were able to negotiate a lower price on the boat tour, so do not assume that they are a fixed price.

Great for sightseeing. We took a boat trip down the river it was good to see the different sides many more minarets on the European side and somer very old buildings. There is plenty of activity on this strait with ferry boats back and forth all day. We also passed a couple of cruise ships that seem to dock right near the centre of the city. This is a good way to see the skyline of the city of Istanbul.
Majestic strait. Sailing along this straight not only lets you enjoy the views but also a beautiful landscape of Turkish villas. The trip to Istanbul is not done without the Bosphorus Strait.
cruise on Bosphorus. A good experience to cruise on the strait, one and half hour for 12 Turkish Lira. Good part of the city is visible.
River boat cruise. Went on a sunset cruise boat on a Turkish night food was ok but the scenery of the city at night was breathtaking and gave a different perspective of this city

Where 2 Worlds Meet. Walking around the Bosporus is an absolute must. Walking from the Asia side to the Europe side is jaw dropping especially when you see all the mosques in the horizon i.e. Suleymaniye, Rustem Pasha, Yeni Cami etc. Try to walk here at night and also for sunrise to truly see its beauty.@instabuilt

Another perspective of Istanbul. The Bosphorous Strait is an important waterway of Istanbul. Many cruises travel along the Bosphorous. I took a 2 hour cruise from Eminonu and paid the extra for the audio guide. The audio was Ok but often did not work. I also took the local ferry from Eminonu across to Kadikoy, takes less 30 mins one way.Travelling by boat is a lovely and relaxing way to see Istanbul. Looking back to the Sultanahmet area and seeing the skyline dominated by Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya is impressive, and the Suleymaniye Mosque up on the hill, with the New Mosque below, the Galata Tower on the other side of the Golden Horn, then further along the Dolmabahce Palace, Rumeli Fortress to name a few, and across to the Asian side. Highly recommended.

Beautiful by night or day. We booked a night cruise on the Bosphorus, which included dinner and a showThe evening was both fun and informative and we saw the sights and lights of IstanbulThe following day we sailed firstly on the European side and then on the Asian side of the Bosphorus. The tour was fascinating and gave information about the city's history and culture

Bosphorus 6 hr tour. there is no guide but you can rent earphones that guides you through . the boat stops on the way for a couple hours at some of the towns where you can shop and have wonderfulfresh seafood by the water . extremely enjoyable . this is much cheaper than a tour with a guide . about 40 TL round trip .

A journey through times past. Throughout history, the Bosphorus Strait has been a strategic military and trade route. The level of commercial and public transportation that takes place daily on the waters can only be experienced from the water. The many tour boats that operate on the Bosphorus give one a feeling and sensation that you cannot get from the land. Great place to get an alternate view of many attractions. Best to go near sundown if possible in order to optimize your photographic opportunities,
Amazing Experience !!. It was a wonderful experience crossing two continents (Asia and Europe) through this strait.Loved it !!

Something to See. OK -- it's a shipping lane -- but it's impressive! Europe on one side and Asia on the other, you'll start to understand how Istanbul rose to such prominence and why it's still important today. This is a drive-by activity, but one you MUST do if you are in Istanbul.

Confusing. There are literally dozens of boats offering a range of trips "up river" I would suggest holding on until about 30 mins before a trip is due to set off the price can drop dramatically. Huge river and very busy but gives you a very different perpective.

Take a 90 minute tour-- only the free Staten Island Ferry is cheaper. For around $3 each, my wife and I took a guided 90 minute tour of the Bosphorous Strait. I don't remember the tour company, but we picked it up on the water just across from the Spice Market. We did the trip on a cloudless warm sunny day, and enjoyed the ambiance as well as the sites. We passed under the major bridges, viewed palaces, mosques, churches, and a synagogue. All the while there was a running commentary in Turkish, German, and English.

Over the bridge this time. I did the cruise of the Bosphorus Strait many years ago while on a cruise vacation. Now on business, I drove on a bridge over the Strait and there was so much traffic I had the chance to view the city from across the bridge. (I was not driving) You can see where the cruise ships port and the skyline of Istanbul as you drive from the European side to the Asian side. Beautiful site.
get the local boat. check out the regular local boats which are only a couple of euros per journey and are full of local character.

Most Beautiful parts of Bosphorus Strait in EU Side. My Recommendations: Go to Eminonu Port, Take a one way ferry ticket of "Long Bosphorus Tour" (from Sehir hatlari Port or any other line that has a stop point in Sariyer Port) and then walk along this wonderful strait, it would be a very long journey (totally more than 9 hours with lunch time), but I suggest taking taxis or 25E Bus Line(Sariyer-Kabatas Line) between Sariyer-Tarabya, between Istinye-Rumeli Hisari and also between Kurucesme-Ortakoy...By the way, the best districts that I can suggest are Tarabya,Yenikoy,Sariye,Rumeli Hisari,Bebek,Ortakoy and also the road that goes between Cirahan Palace and Yildiz Park...Best Wishes

Europe and Asia coming together.... We went with the local boats for the Bosphorus straight tour. There were no commentaries or information given so what we had to do was look around and take lots of pictures for 2 hours.It was very cold and windy so make sure you get warm clothes with you. The tea serves on board is not free but cheap enough to go for seconds.We paid 15 TL each and had great time.
Bosphorus Strait. did the two hour bosporus tour on one of the local boats, no commentary given and basically you just wandered up and down the boat taking in all the views, plesant enough

Bargain!. They will try to give you high price for this so make sure you bargain first. It should cost not more than 15 TL. Once you're on board, drinks will keep coming. Just a reminder: it's not for free.
rough sea. did a cruise on the Bosporus, was very windy with some rain, compensated it with cigars and whiskey. great view of the city, gives you an understanding of the size of the cith

boating on the Bosphorus. We were lucky enough to have rooms overlooking and wer amazed at the commercial tankers and traffic through the straight. Also took the ferry to Buyucada a great 1 and a half hour ride each way with a couple of days there enjoying

By far the best way of seeing Istanbul: From the water. In the ten full days we were in Istanbul, I think there was only one where we didn't take some sort of boat trip. These included the full Bosphorus tour up to Anadolu Kavağı and the shorter two hour trip to past Rumeli Hisarı (Fortress of Europe), but mostly, we just jumped on the next ferry leaving for the Asian shore.With the Istanbul card fro transport, a twenty minute crossing costs all of TL2.15 (less than £0.50) , and you get great views of Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia from the water.

the best!. That is the best experince in Istanbul, in my opinion. I was twice in Istanbul and I went both times to boat trip and it was great. To be between two continents is incredible feeling. And it is so so beautiful, the water - ctistal blue, the wind, and all the landmarks you can see. Dolmabahce saray can be seen by its greatness. And for those who is watching turkish series, well, you can see the house from "Gumus" :D If you manage to recognize it ;) You will never forget the beauty of Bosphorus!!!

Fabulous to cruise on!. My friends and I cruised on the Bosphorus thrice - twice by day and once by night and it was one of the most enchanting ferry rides/cruises I have undertaken. The view on both the Asian and European sides is absolutely lovely as sail past the lovely historic landmarks of Istanbul and beautiful villas of the rich and famous.A trip to Istanbul would not be complete without cruising on the Bosphorus and I would highly recommend the day cruise as well as the night time dinner cruise.

Ortakoy bridge . Wow! A sight to remember. Simply a great engineering feat joining EAST to WEST. Despite all the tourists it is still a quiet place to relax. Good shops, bar and café around. Well worth a visit.

Great Place for a Day Tour. This was one of my better experiences in Istanbul. This is a must, mostly so you can appreciate how big this city is and understand some of the history. I highly recommend taking one of the many boat tours that are offered.

Best memory from Istanbul. We took a cruise with dinner by the Bosphorus that our hotel suggested and it was the best thing we did in Istanbul. Lovely way to see the city! They offered music, belly dancing, etc. Enjoying Istanbul from the water while having a drink was great.
Beautiful. I enjoy visiting this place all the time, every time I visit Istanbul I have to go there and enjoy the view.
nice view and relaxing. you will see many high lights from the Bosphorus like the palace and many villas. i did the tour in 2014.you can take the boat in front of the galata bridge

Magical!. Mix with the locals and visitors. I was proposed to on the ferry and had many witnesses! I said yes of course! Something I will never forget. What a magical place. The locals embraced me and congratulated us.

A nice boat ride and view of the city from the water. A nice way to see Istanbul from the water. If you have a guide with you they'll be able to explain the different areas of the cities as well as some of the major structures, but either way it's an interesting insight into the diversity of the city.

Turkey is the best! Hidden secret "Istanbul Turkey" Very safe!!!. Breath taking and a must! Safety is not an issue! Visit Turkey and take a boat ride down the river Bosphorus and see the amazing sites. Use a tour guide at all times or go with a citizen! So much to see and do in Turkey, you would be in awe!
Good for viewing. A cruise along the Bosporus is very enjoyable with plenty to see on the trip. Nice and relaxing. We thought it was worth doing.

Lots of ships from everywhere.. There are empty tankers on their way to Russia to pick up oil, there are tankers docking in Istanbul, and many many ferry boats going back and forth from the Europe to the Asia side of Istanbul. It is always busy!

Cheap ride to Asia. We had nothing planned for the rest of the day and decided to take a ferry to the Asian side. The ferry terminal closest to the bridge from the old district to the new district in the Golden Horn all take you for 4 TL per person each way, which is about $1.33 US. The ride takes 12 minutes and runs every 20 minutes. The ferry drops you off near the Bazaar on the Asian side.

see europe and asia. best way to see bosphorus strait is by hop on hop off cruise departing Kabatas hourly from lunch time passing under both bridges and past rumeli fort stop off European side at Emirgan or Asian side at Kucuksu or Beyerbeyi then catch next boat
Give the tours guides a miss. For a cheaper trip buy a public ticket and travel during the day. not much to see at night except lights on both shores

A different view of the city. I highly recommend you get a boat and tour around the bosphorus. I did a night tour, with dinner and show included and it was great, but you don't really see much of the outside. I also did a daytime one and found it to be well worth it! I just wish I had picked one with a tour guide/explanation. I just went to the pier near Eminonu and got a ferry that goes around for about 2 hrs for 12TL, but they do not explain anything to you - but you do get a great view of both the European and Asian sides and if you have your book with you, you will be able to see where you are and what are the landmarks - this is the cheaper option! Be careful with other boat tours that charge up to 35€ - that is a very overpriced boat ride (if it does not include any food or entertainment). You get beautiful views of Istanbul and all the lovely minarets and mosques around he city

Sights are beautiful. We did this from Kabata (end of the T1 line) and found it was easy to get on and off there. Although it was raining, we were still amazed with the beauty of the palaces and homes along the strait!
Boat cruise up the Bosphorus. When visiting Istanbul it is a must to go on a boat cruise up the Bosphorus , you get to see the palaces and many places from the water which is excellent.
nice to visit by boat. . Fantastic, absolutely beautiful, rich with history. Not to be missed if you are in Istanbul. Turkish people are very friendly and helpful

Fun water cruise!. This was a nice way to see both the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. Beware the juice offered is not free as implied by those serving it. Good weather is helpful, but the is an I closed area. Better views from the top deck.
Bosphorus view. The bosphorus gives you a perspective about the Euroasia vision.Beautiful sea, suggest to arrange a boat or yatch depending on your budget.

East meets west. This is a very busy waterway . The only way to appreciate how vast , is by ferry. These tours operate every hour and provide insight to the the changing history and alliances of this great city. You may also may also like to walk across the Galata bridge and see the fishermen proudly showing off their catch. The tram provides another easy transport mode. The 10TL ticket for 3 rides is a perfect solution for tired tourist legs.

A wonderful orientation to Istanbul. Taking a cruise on the Bosphorus is no doubt the best way to orientate yourself with Istanbul and a great way to get a glimpse of both the European and Asian side. It also gives you a different perspective and most of the key sights are visible from deck. There are various cruise options which vary in price of course. I opted for a cruise with mainly locals which was very reasonably priced compared to some of the other cruises offered to tourists. It took 2 hours to complete a round trip.
Beautiful views of the City.. If you have a chance to get out on the Bosphorus, you should. It offers great views. At least take a stroll along the water and enjoy the peacefulness offered there.
Breathtaking view around Istabul. There is no word to describe how amazing the view is. A must visit and take public ferry if you have limited time.
SeaSide. You should take a walk along the sea side and observe the city and the people. It is refreshing and making you happy.

Sunrise on the Bosphorus. Passing through the Bosphorus is amazing, you are at the junction of Europe and Asia, with so much history on either side of you. The amount of shipping and ferries that ply the straits is unbelievable and how there aren't aciident is a miracle. and then you pull into Istanbulwith the horizon covered by mosque minarets and churches. You have to visit once in your life.
Tour boat advised. Take a tour boat to get the full feeling of this hectic place. It is one of the busiest waterways in the world deviding Asia and Europe. It is a must see in Istanbul.
A Boat Ride LikeNo Other. A boat ride on the Bosphorus Strait is a cruise to remember as you float under bridges, pass mosgues and forts and palaces.

U have to make it . It's lovely tour No need at all for a tide or hotel reservations Go to the sea and ask for it It's really cheap but lovely U can take the public transportation or some privet company do it it's more proper but there public is good also I went at April weather was great

Great way to get an introduction to the city. We took this river cruise the first afternoon we arrived from the US so we were a little jet lagged but it was an easy relaxing way to be introduced to the "old city" and the "new city". The Bosphorus river cruise is very relaxing and you get to see folks that really use it as a mode of transportation. It is not just a "touristy" river cruise.

Senior travelers. We wanted to 2 hour tour but arrived too early. We took the 6 hour tour. audio was a waste. It was interesting but too long. The stop over lasted over 2 hours. Not much to see in the town. With the 6 hr tour we were able to walk around.
A cheap treat. Just hop on the many ferries and for only a few lira take a trip on the water like the locals do, maybe go to Kadikoy to see the magnificent Haydarpasa railroad station?

Use the ferry!. For 4TL you can cross on a swish ferry to the other side. We went from the European side to one port, walked up the coast to another and retured. Two of us, two crossings for less than £5! A most worthwhile experience.
Another view of Istanbul.. Seeing the beautiful homes, historic forts and commerce along the Strait was a good way to see Istanbul from another perspective. Great to do on a very hot day!

Incredible views. We took a water tour of the Bosphorus Strait and had to finally stop taking pictures and just enjoy the beauty. It was an incredible day with good weather. We are so glad we took time to do this. Istanbul is a beautiful city

Great to see from a boat. Even though the concierge at our hotel seemed not to know about these boat tours, we went to the area and, of course, there they were. A bit confusing, but we figured it out and so glad we did. It was a very full boat. There were vendors walking around selling glasses of orange juice and snacks. There was a loud speaker probably telling all about the sights in Turkish. English followed, I think, but it was so loud with all the people, it was too hard to hear. I'd love to return on a quiet day! But even so, it was an excellent tour.

On a bright sunny day, WOW. We were lucky to have a sunny day and this was the highlight of this particular day. Gives you a completely different perspective of Istanbul and if you like taking pictures a great way to get some fantastic photos. Also a way to cool off if there is a breeze blowing. The guide on the ship was very clear so that you knew exactly what you were looking at.

Worth crossing and enjoying the coffee shops on the Asian side. The crossing is amazing, you have a beautiful feeling of going from Europe to Asia, surrounded by seagulls and magnificent views on both sides. Enjoy some treats on the boat, it is worth it. On the other side, take a stroll through the area, it is full of charm and enjoy some roasted chestnuts and baklava! It is a quick ride to cross and come back.

Bosphorus Riviera. Although there are no sand beaches, an hour's cruise along the Bosphorus made it clear that the mansions and palaces on the water's edge (including a very grand one from Nicholas II of Russia) were at one time and still are a playground for the truly rich. It's a great rainy day activity (true for us) and an interesting presentation of the vastness of Istanbul's resources from a perspective unknown from roads and rails.

Black Sea View. Take a tour that will take you all the way to the last bridge that is being bult now - there, you get 45 min time off - run up the steep hill to the castle to have a view of the Black Sea .

Great Boat Cruise. Strait between two continents, Europe and Asia, a great cruise and sightseeing of Istanbul and also historical architecture. You get to see some of the finest hotels to lovely villas and palaces by the sea.
WOW. The strait gives an amazing view of the 3 islands and a great cruise ride in to the waters. had a great experience

Great tours, buy your ticket at the ticket booth, not from a street vendor.. Take a tour boat ride! We went twice before, having bought our tickets from a salesman on the street, the first time was fine but the second time we did this we ended up waiting a long time for a shuttle (so he could collect enough passengers) then shuttled us off to a small shabby boat that was overcrowded and had no good seats left. To be safe, the third time, we went to the Turyol ticket counter at the Eminönü docks. It's about 12 TL (currently 4 bucks) for a 90 minute tour going to the second bridge and back. We went with the Turyol company and found the boat to be in good shape with plenty of seats. Sit on the port side of the boat, (on the left facing forward) since the boat tours close to the shore.

The Asian side. I am not talking about the cruise but just the ferry crossing from the Europe side over to Asia in 20 minutes. It is interesting: nice view on crossing. Shopping similar to the Europe side but cheaper. And Istanbul is actually a good shopping place particularly for cotton material. Easy crossing from many points in the Europe side.

where East and West Istanbul meets.. We had taken Bosphorus cruise here.The east and west Istanbul is divided by this.The cruise was of an hour and worthwhile to take.Charges are high and if you take night cruise with diner,it is very costly.The food served is also mix of local and continental taste.Not much illumination is done here on the bridges,and historical places are also not illuminated nicely.So the night view is not much attractive.But suggest to visit..Rakesh Agrawal,Gujarat,India

Scenic cruise. The Bosphorus strait joins the Sea of Marmara to the Black Sea. When visiting Istanbul, a cruise along the Bosphorus is a must. On the western side is the European part of Istanbul and on the eastern side, the Asian part.The European side is more interesting. The cruise we went on was only the lower and middle Bosphorus, not all the way to the Black Sea. We started northwards staying closer to the European side and returned along the Asian side.We start with seeing the Golden Horn, the 19th century Dolmabahce Palace, Mosque and clock tower, the Ciragan palace, the first Bosphorus bridge (as we pass under the bridge we can see the road high above with a clearance of over 200 feet above the water), and then the Mecidie mosque in Ortakay, and the Fortress of Europe. Along the middle Bosphorus you pass a few quaint townships and villages.At the second Bosphorus bridge (Fatih Sultan Mehmet bridge) we turned southwards along the Asian side.We saw the Kucuksu palace and the Maiden's Tower before ending the cruise near the Dolmabahce pier.Lovely cruise. Beautiful sights and we were lucky to have pleasant weather that day.

The living heart of old & recent Turkey. This Area is truly the pulsating living heart of old & recent Turkey, it tells you the whole story, from Sultan Ahmet Mosque overlooking it to Hajia Sofia to the Grand Bazar having all the old & genuine aroma of Turkey to the super-fast modern ferries departing to Bursa to the huge Bosphorus bridge to Kabatash harbor where most of the Bosfour cruise trips depart and arrive to Maiden tower in the middle of the strait with all the legends around it, it is all backed in this strait, amazing….. and magic
Amazing scenery. Istanbul has a amazing scenery like bosphorus. You can see europe and asia together I think it is very intresting if you love take a photo you should see bosphorus

Try the short trip. We did the full trip on the public ferry with 3 hour layover in small town which laced in charm and did not have much to offer. Would suggest the shorter two hour cruise if you want to get a feel for the bustle of the traffic on the Bosphorus.

Great Way to See Istanbul. There are different ways to see this great water way. From Topkapi Palace is one, but from cruise boat or ferry boat is another, and better. Don't buy tickets from these selling them on street. Go directly to the dock, south end of Galata bridge, and pay at the entrance. Cost 12TL each person.

Bosphorus cruise. That trip was awsome . It was an interesting experience sailing in between europe and asia and seeing all those historical places at both sides . Sea breeze was so refreshing , the guide explanation was so helpful . You need the guide in order to enjoy it and know what is around and what are you looking at .

Boat trip. We booked though our hotel and had great weather...the views from the boat were stunning and the information given by our guide was very good although some times the right English word escaped him. You do need to have good weather.

cheap ride. the cruises are expensive take the ferries that go up and down and drop people off at different stop same thing with the golden horn also if you see some place you want to eat jump off and check it out just be alert to the time table step out of your comfort zone just a little you can always get a cab with the cab get the price in advance and if you think it is to high barter have a get time

By tour boat. I had my hotel book me onto a day tour which encompassed a cruise on a large boat up the Bosphorus sea. Its essential to do this to get a grip on the city as much as doing the same on Sydney Harbour. See the old city fort walls and the Dolmabache from the water. The exclusive seaside suburbs, the Golden Horn and thr entrance into the port with it's old martime tower.

Turquoise waters and cultural crossroads to this day. You can just feel the history of ancient traders, all religions, races and walks of life. Istanbul is a cross rosdsbof cultures even to this day, and this is so evident with the Bosohorus Bridge spanning two continents and its scenic city with turquoise waters.
Beautiful Boat Ride. The boat trip we took on the Bosphorus was amazing. You can get so many beautiful pictures, and you are able to truly appreciate the size and magnificence of Istanbul.
Need atleast 2 hours. You must must must do the cruise and feel the euro-asian bosphorus bridge! its breathtaking opportunity for all photographers

So much to see. A really important seaway that allows major ship traffic to travel in one direction every 12 hours because it risks collisions if there was 2 way traffic. Ships power through the Straits every 5 minutes and you are so close to them. Tours of the Straits allows you to see magnificent houses built there along the shore.
Cruise up/down bosphorus 'river.. Great boat trip both up and down Bosphorus. Great views and good for picture taking. See both Europe and Asia side.

A must for visitors. We took the 2 hr trip that leaves at 1430 at cost of 12 lira. Wonderful w a y to see the diversity of this important waterway. Great photo opportunities. Left side boat closer to shore, but right side is sunnier. Tea and coffee service incredibly cheap as well.

Cool!. Very relaxing especially if you are sitting on deck chair in middle of ferry. Travels at a leisurely pace - helped to have people travelling with me to point out some interesting info. Lighting on buildings & bridges is impressive at nighttime.

Amazing views. A must to do! Offers great views of the city! Made me realize how big Istanbul was and how I could have used another 3 nights just to explore more. Saw lots of great sights and the tour on the boat was great.

Simply stunning on a nice day.. I've taken a boat trip for a couple of hrs on the Bosphorus before which was wonderful as we had great weather. Wouldnt be so good on a rainy day. Also seeing sunset with a few beers and a sheesha is an absolute must on a visit to Istanbul. Some of the best sunsets i've seen were on the Galata Bridge as the sun went down over the Bospohorus. Highly recommend this beautiful part of Istanbul.
Beautiful sight to see from a different perspective. This an amazing site to see at night by taking one of the boat tours. It gets cold so make sure to take a sweater.
A must do!. Take a cruise - yes you must! The lovely Bhosphorus is absolutely stunning and you can see the various sights and bridges from the waters.
Must see. The great cruise to be taken at the time of sunset and night. The city at night looks beautiful and you should not miss this
Fantastic Views. A visit to Istanbul can't be complete without the views from the Bosphorus. The views, especially those of the old city are marvelous.

An Amazing Waterway. The amount of traffic on this waterway is remarkable. We were able to observe it from a great rooftop bar at night, and from a nice lunch spot during the day, and from a cruise ship leaving Istanbul and heading south. There is lots of local ferry traffic too, and a great ferry ride up and back that will take the better part of the middle of the day, and gives you a unique view of both sides of the City

Fascinating and Magical. We were lucky enough to pass up and down the Strait 3 times during a two week cruise and it was different and equally fascinating each time. Such a mix of cultures with the European side and the Asian side and the range of architecture and different skyline has to be seen to be believed. Really beautiful part of the world and something I will always remember. Peaceful but also bustling and so full of different craft going about their business in a seemingly ad-hoc manner across the water.

Stunning Views. This is truly amazing with stunning views and plenty to see on route, stunning buildings and great bridges, I would be careful of the boat ride you choose they get extremely busy and we stood for 2 hours.

A chance to rest your legs and see both sides of the Bosphorus!. Took the 14:30 short cruise for 12 TL. Got there at 13:30 and was one of the first on the boat so could choose my seat. Left hand side of the boat is best for photographs! Lots of drinks and snacks including ice cream brought around by boat staff! Loved the atmosphere on the top deck! Lots of moving around space and families with children! Part of the upper deck was sheltered in the middle.
Bosphorus cruise/tour. Good for the money. Think it would be weather dependent as good views of Istanbul of Mosques, Palaces etc along the Strait. If you are lucky enough, then sunset is beautiful.

Average at best. Did a short cruise up and down the Bosphorus, there is nothing spectacular here so its more of a fill in whilst your in Istanbul or a pleasant couple of hours rest whilst your on the boat.
Can't say that anything we saw along the Bosphorus left a lasting impression.

Bucket list ticked. A must do when in Istanbul. The tour we took was 15euro and almost 3 hours long. Takes you from near Sultanahmed up the Golden Horn and up the Bosphorus. Great way to see as much of the different architecture of the different era's.

Stunning view of a beautiful city. A trip on one of the many tour boats up & down the Bosphorus is well worth the time & money. It gives you an entirely different view of Istanbul's star attractions with numerous photo opportunities along the way. Many of the trips leave from the terminal near to the Dolmabahce Palace area & travel leisurely down to the bridge that joins the European side of the city to the Asian side, past beautiful mosques & castle ruins then back up the strait to near the Galata Bridge past the ritzy mansions, the Maidens Tower & the cruise terminal.

take a public transport to have the best views of Istanbul. Take the opportunity to sail in the Bosphorus cheaply and easily with public transportation. Depending on where do you go you will have nice views of both sides of Istanbul; europeand and Asian sides.

Unique and Peaceful Views of Istanbul. The Bosphorus Strait is an excellent area for a boat excursion with many options for rent. Fresh fish sandwiches are always available. A boat tour offers a unique and peaceful way to view the European and Asian parts of Istanbul with spectacular views of Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and Dolmabahce Palace.
Nice little trip. We got a non stop boat which went up the Bosphorous, took 1.5 hours, it ws dull and rainy at the time so a good use of our time. Only cost 12 lira each.

Great Boat Tours. If you're in Istanbul, definitely take a boat tour on the Bosphorus! There are long ones and short ones. We took the short one because we were only there for 3 days, but if I went back I would take a long one.
A must during Istanbul stay. A visit to Istanbul without a cruise trip on Bosphorus is incomplete. A must do activity provided you chose the right service.

Very memorable - go if you have time, and allow at least half a day. By travelling on the ferries up the Bosphorous you really get an understanding of how important this waterway is, strategically, separating Asia from Europe. We especially like the two castles facing each other across the straights, and there are some lovely summer houses on the water front. There are plenty of boat trips available,for different durations, but we chose to take local ferries that criss-cross the water from Europe to Asia and back - each trip is 4 TLY (less than £1). That meant we could stop wherever we wanted, so we had a coffee on one side and lunch on the other. It was probably less efficient, but felt "authentic" and more fun. We went in late September and it was pretty chilly - take lots of layers.

Must do in Istanbul. Istanbul skyline is amazing when seen from the Bosphorus under right weather conditions. Turyol is the company to go with - boarding dock right next to the fish sandwich boats.These 1.5 - 2 hour cruises are frequent, so wait for the next ride if you can't get good seating. Try to board early (30-min) and look for seats on the left side of the boat - works both for outbound and return trip. Typically, these 12TL/person cruises are packed in tourist season, so feel free to sit on metal section right next to the railing for good pictures (otherwise someone else is likely to block your view). Also, avoid this cruise on a rainy day. We had initially planned to take the longer cruise on our last day in Istanbul. Due to change in weather conditions, we decided do the shorter cruise the day before. Next day the weather was horrible with couple of hours of torrential rains - felt really bad for people doing the cruise that day.Cruises booked through hotels are expensive, but include other activities and lunch. We did see couple of smaller boats with very few people in them (also operated by Turyol) - not sure if these are booked through hotels. However, these are likely to offer unobstructed photo opportunities.Suggest taking the cruise couple of hours before sunset.
One of the wonders :)). You can spend a life there ! Take a boat tour and enjoy. Much to see at every curve of it. It is a unique place between two continents.

Must do. Several options from plain vanilla ferry for 12 lira to fancy dinner cruises, go to ferry area and donot fall into trap of touts offering the same at much higher prices in Sultan Ahmet square, took plain vanilla ferry and the ride was marvellous, some ferries offer taped English commentary, would have been a better option

Dont leave Istanbul unless you have done Bosphorus Cruise. An absolute MUST DO. There are many offers on doing a Bosphorus cruise..take any one of them. This is an absolute must do. The food on the boats are pretty pricey, but you can take some take-aways with you. There is an opportunity for dress up photos on the cruise. The views are magnificent. So dont miss out!

Europe with a touch of Asia.. We took a cruise down the river to where it met the Black Sea. The views were amazing and there was an opportunity to swim in the Bosphorus Strait. Food was supplied on the boat but alcohol was an extra payment. The trip lasted 4-5 hours and was excellent value for money.A new bridge is being constructed over the river and to travel under it during construction was unbeliveable. We stopped at a village on the Asia side of the river to so we travelled 2 continents in one day.

Turyol cruise - stand on the left side of the boat. We saw the Bosphorus by a 90 minute cruise with Turyol cruises, arranged by Istanbul Walks tours. It is best to stand on the left side of the boat so you get the best views.

Sit and Watch The World Float By. Beautiful skyline with dramatic towering Minarutes and lots of water traffic to keep you entertained. Ferries are a major mode of transportation in the area and in the summer the cruise ships are a large presence.
Where Europe meets Asia. Take a cruise you wont regret along Bosphorus Strait. Get close to both continents, Europe and Asia.

Take a guided tour. We took a cruise to Rumeli fortress and it was a great way to get the first look at the city. Bosphorus strait in itself is already a magnificent historic waterway and then you can also see both the European and Asian side the same time. Here we had a good quide, which is essential.....

cruising along the Bosphorus strait by local ferryfor a reasonable fare. The local ferry departs from the Eminonu Pier Spend the day floating along the straits past picturesque buildings ,mosques ,and villas. The ferry stops near the entrance to the Black Sea at Anadolu Kavagi for about2 hours .Here you can have lunch at many of the fish restaurants along the shore

Great event. The bosphorus cruise in the morning showed great buildings on both European and Asian sides of Turkey.The Bosphorus strait divides both the continents and Bosphorus bridge connects it.All the beautiful palaces,mosques and hotels were looking spectacular. IT Started from Dolby manche Palace and cruised into The Topkapi palace and blue mosque midway.Great view.Saw the Maidens Tower deep in the Marmara sea.

First things first!. Firstly you nedd to buy a transport card , cheap transportation make it easy for you to enjoy the city more.
Such journey will coast you just les than a us dollar.
Its better if you make it either early in the morning or late evening.
A cup of turkish tea makes even delightful.
Enjoy ..dont forget the selfie!!
good but busy. lovely perspective of istanbul from the river. busy with locals as well as tourists. snacks and drinks sold continuously. limited stop off points

Top of a Waterfall. We missed the big boat excursion due to a run in with roosting birds but we did make it to the docks in time to find another couple in the same boat (no pun intended). They asked us if we would share the cost of a smaller boat tour with them and showed us the boat. Smaller yes but incredibly stout looking. Reminded me of a tug boat. The captain was friendly and very happy to take us all on a tour, first along the eastern shore line and then once back across the Strait back to Istanbul along the western shore. The Captain served tea (Chai) to everyone and quite honestly, I thin we had a better time that the big boat tour we missed. My small son was allowed to steer the boat for a short distance and that made his entire day! Ours to! Fantastic journey. Riding on the Bosphorus is like riding at the top of a water fall. The water is moving incredibly fast and its as dark as night. Had a really good time. Ignore the time I visited, that is as far back as trip advisor will go and this trip took place back in 2002.

Take the ferry up the Strait, eat a delicious lunch at the last stop. Go to the bakery and get one of everything. YUM. On our last day of our short 6 days in Istanbul we went on the ferry all the way to top of the Bosporus Strait near the red sea. We drank tea looked out the window and talk to really nice people. We enjoyed seeing the different sides and to see the Mosques on the hills. We had the best lunch at the last ferry stop. The fish was so good. Wish I knew the name but when you get off the ferry just to any restaurant they all were good.

Great way to see Istanbul from the water. If you're ever in Istanbul, you should definitely go on a boat tour on the Bosphorus Strait. Enjoying the views on both the european and asian side of the strait while sitting on the sun roof of one of the boats is a very good excursion. Try to find a boat that's not too crowded...maybe from the port of Kabatas...

You have not seen Istanbul if you missed the Bosphorus. There is nothing to dislike when it comes to the Bosphorus... Charming at all time day and night, tried once hop on hop off by the ferry, it was a real joy especially seing the historical monuments with the luxurious villas .. Cannot say more..

Fantastic way to see both the Asian and Europe side of Istanbul. We did the Bosphorus cruise with a guide and it was fantastic. The history is unbelievable and some of the real estate that you see is out of this world, not to be missed.

The Link-line between Europe and Asia. The Bosphorus Strait is what separates Europe and Asia and is also the link-line between the two continents. A cruise in the Bosphorus Straits is a "must-do" for all visitors as it provides one with the unique opportunity of seeing the 'old' and the 'new' impressive architectural wonders along the coastline.
The meeting point between Europe and Asia. The most famous strait in the world, with great historical meaning! It is as if the entire city bows to the shores of Bosphorus.

Looking from Europe to Asia. The Bosphorus strait is a highlight of Istanbul. You can go on a small boat from the end of the Galata Bridge for a trip up the strait and back which is a worthwhile experience. You will see the palaces on the banks and old towers as well as passing under the bridges that join Europe to Asia. We were on a cruise this time that went to the Black Sea and so we enjoyed passing through the Bosphorus strait on the ship but previously we have enjoyed the day trip in the small local boats with commentary.

Dominates. The Bosphorus is THERE. It oozes history and the level of shipping movement is astonishing. One could sit and stare for hours. Many of the guest houses and hotels, also cafes have a roof top garden or eating area where it is possible to sit and view the movements of great and small vessels. A wonder.

Cruising the Bosporus strait. Flo tours with whom we have booked our turkey vacation booked a private boat for the five of us that could carry 80 people . It was quite enjoyable going along both shoreline up-and-down. lots of history and one of the highlights of our trip.

Another MUST go. But do not pay expensive tickets, go to Ortakoy. Go to Ortakoy and look for the boats with popular prices. And enjoy the the Bosphorus, take lots and lots of photos, drink tea and eat simitz. It´s cheap and you MUST go!

Beautiful Waterway & way to take in the sights of Istanbul. The Bosphorus Strait is a wonderful waterway that actually separates the Europe & Asian Continents.. There are many cruise company's offering tours which is a wonderful way to take in the sights! A cruise on the Bosphorus is a must whilst in Istanbul

Beautiful sights to behold. The Bosphorus strait complements Istanbul. Without it, Istanbul would not be as famous as it is. You can sit n the shore and just watch shipping traffic go by all day. The Bosphorus bridge is an engineering marvel jus =t as the Golden Gate bridge is. There is nothing to dislike about the Bosphorus Strait.

Nice. We took a sea tour around the Bosphor. It was nice. But dont just sit in the top floor. Go down the stairs and walk around the side of the ship where you can feel the breeze and get very close to the sea.
Do take a ride on the cruise. My recommendation, take a ride on the cruise so that you can see the whole of Istanbul from the sea. Amazing views.

Relaxing. Booked with seher atlari..12tl for the short cruise but with a museum pass you only pay 9tl..great experience seeing both sides of the bosphorus...takes you under both bridges and back...can see mansions..palace...bridges...cruise ships..ortakoy...rumeli fortress..and a stunning far view of istanbul in the distance with the mosques topkapi and aya sophia in the distance....ashame i didnt get to see any dolphins in the bosphorus
Beautiful views. We travelled the Bosphorus strait many times by boat during our bus tour. Never got sick of the views, lovely travelling across

Cruising on bosphorus is worthwhile. . We did a 1.5 hour cruise up to the second bridge. Great way to see the extra layout on this city and parts of the tourist track. Makes you realize size of the place.
Dont miss this. We went for Christmas vacation and the weather made the Bosphorus Strait amazing to travel it can be more romantic as the sun touches all the museums and greens all over.
A must when in Istanbul. Choppy ride but worth it. The view from the straits towards the inland of Istanbul is priceless. A must in Istanbul.

Beautiful and Historic Sights. This scenic body of water divides Istanbul into the European and Asian sides. At the very least, take the commuter ferry across to the Asia side. It's only 4 Lira at this writing, one way per person (that's less than $2). There are fewer sights on the Asian side, but there are some scenic areas along the waterfront. Uskudar has a couple of mosques. There is limited food/beverage service on board these ferries. If you stick to one side, you can enjoy the views for free.
Great. I love this place .everything in there for me is magicalThe atmosphere is great,you feel alive .I've had the best moments there with my small family.Big recommend

Ride the local ferries, back and forth from Europe to Asia and back. Ride the local ferries, back and forth from Europe to Asia and back. Take a day trip up and down the Istanbul section of the strait, or take several local runs across the waters, Get an Istanbul transit card and add to is as needed. Really resonable and flexible, same with the "tramvay," light rail lines and buses!

Istanbul you are lovely. The cruise was joyful .You can see Asian and European sectors of Istanbul.Boats are well prepared and I love sea rides.You move towards the black sea and back. Istanbul is very beautiful.

Take Bosporus Ferry. Take the two-hour ferry--that's more than enough time and it's cheap. Ours left at 2:30 from the foot of the Galata Bridge on the European side, across the street from the spice market. Go on a sunny day, if possible. An enjoyable break from the crazy hustle and bustle of the streets of Istanbul.

Public ferry all the way!. We had an istanbulkart that we bought from a local kiosk near the sultanahmet tram station. This allowed us to ride the tram and ferries. It was fun. None of the ferries were overly crowded so there were plenty of good pics to be taken.

3 hour boat tour. Took a commercial boat tour from Eminonu to take in the Bosphorus canal. Very informative commentary for the whole trip, and great value for money. Would 100% recommend to anyone visiting Istanbul

Boat ride at Bosphorus Strait. Bosphorus Strait is a great place for a boat ride! Really amazing time in a hot day in Istambul!! You can have a good perspective of the city, both sides, Asia and Europe.

relaxation!.... after a full day of sightseeing... taking this tour of the bosphorus strait was very very relaxing.. and i must say i got to see places that i couldnt see and learn the history!... the beautiful yiali houses right on the bospherus were something else... we were given tea and sat on the deck it was delightful!

A must in Istanbul!. We took a Turyol Cruise down the Bosporus Strait and highly recommend if you are visiting the city. We contemplated doing a guided tour that was more expensive (around 35 Euros per person), but our hotel recommended the Turyol instead. It leaves every hour, on the hour, and it costs 12 TRL per person (around $4 US dollars). You can also purchase an audio guide for around $3 US dollars per person. It takes about an hour and a half and goes down each coast line giving you plenty of time to take pictures and listen to the audio guide. It does get crowded so would recommend getting there early and sitting on the upper outside seats of the boat if you want to get good pictures.

Be choosy for a great cruise.. Try and take in one of the cruises, but be careful to ensure the cruise takes in the Roumelli Fortress - with an actual stop off at the fortress. Also be sure the cruise takes you right to the Black Sea where at the moment there is a superb sight - the work-in-progress latest suspension bridge. Not a sight you are likely to see often. There are many interesting sights along the way, so relax and enjoy.

Must do in istanbul. Really worth doing...we just bought tickets at the booth near the BBQ fish stalls at base of galata bridge. Bit of a free for all getting a good viewing spot on the ferry but we managed. Great way to get a view of the scale and history of the city.
Bosphorus - EuroAsia. A little boring, especially if you expect a lot of activity ;) It is a trip that should not be made alone

Stunning views from the Bosphorus Strait.. A cruise on the Bosphorus Strait is a must for every first time visitor to Istanbul. Do a day trip instead of an evening dinner cruise. The dinner cruise in fairly expensive and food not that great. The day cruise is very special with spectacular views. The Bosphorus split Europe on the one side, and Asia on the other.

A great way to end a visit to Istanbul. An interesting and restful excursion on one of the many pleasure boats you pick up at the port by the Spice Market. A different perspective of Istanbul, taking in both palaces, mosques and the houses of the rich by the water.

Bosporus Strait Cruise. We had a days cruise on the Bosporus with Neon Travel in Turkey. We stopped at several places as well as the Black Sea. Everyone was so very pleasant and accommodating. Highly recommended and very reasonable. They picked us up at the hotel.

Nice place. the best area i have visited in Turkey, the walk, the ambiance and the food street booths all around was great. I had so much fun there i remember, and i would recommend it for Istanbul visitors.

A relaxing excursion and getaway. A Bosphorous cruise provides a break from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul and provides a welcome change of pace. The government ferry is well priced and comfortable, with a relaxing 3 hour stop for lunch. This is a good way to recharge.

Superb Experience. Not to miss.. We got on the long ferry trip at 10:30 (Start Lining up for tickets at 09:30!!).This is not something to miss if you are visiting Istanbul. Only thing to remember is to take along your own toilet paper because the ferry doesn't supply it!!Restaurants at the Black sea are all ready to serve and are not expensive for good quality food. Look for the clearest fish eyes in the displays and chose that place.

Sailing into the. Sailed into the Bosphorus upon the MV Discovery and was so impressed with Istanbul. A beautiful bustling city with 20 million inhabitants was mind blowing, better than I ever expected and a wonderful way to see the city from a ship in the Bosphorus Strait. Recommended.

My dreamland was true.... I fall in love with Bosphorus...I like to live near this paradise place in the world...Maybe one day :):) why can't? Blue and green are dancing each other...Not together but each other...I can live with this beauty easily...Come, see and stay in this city that capital city center of love, history and culture...
Great boat tour. Strait between two continents, Europe and Asia, a great boat sightseing of Istanbul and historical arhitecture.

Sunset cruise from the Asian side. If you spend anytime around the Blue Mosque and Ayasophia, you will meet people selling 3-hour sunset cruise trips to you. The cruise is fine but no matter how well you negotiate, you will end up overpaying for the cruise. Because if you get on a cruise from the Asian side, it will be 10 liras per person only. You may be told that the 10 lira cruise is shorter and doesn't have a licensed guide explaining things to you. To be honest, my guide's English was not that great. I had a hard time understanding him. Also, there was not much to see after sunset. This means you only need to be on the cruise for approx 1 hr.

Dinner cruise on the Bosphorus. We went on a Turnabout Tour dinner cruise on the Bosphorus at night, it was great views. The food and entertainment were OK, but the best part was the views of the buildings on the Bosphorus.

Relaxing 2 hour cruise - but. Wonderful way to spend a relaxing 2 hours plus, enjoying the scenery and gentle motion of the ferry.. If we hadn't done the Big Bus Tour the previous day, we wouldn't have a clue of what we were seeing. Commentary quality can vary and the amount of useful information often too brief to be useful. Some ferry lines are comfortable, clean and have good PA systems, but others leave much to be desired. Most cruises are 2 hours durations, but the longer ones include diner and a show. All have snack bars and toilets. Suggest some research before buying tickets. Sehir Hatlari are the best value. We bought a "discounted" cruise ticket from some men who insinuated they were part of the Big Bus Tour company. The bus drivers seemed to know this group of men and this added to the illusion that this was a legitimate business. The men said they'd walk us to the boat a few minutes away. The walk turned out to be 15 minutes weaving in and out of alleys, and the crowd of fellow passengers grew with every turn. Finally, we crossed a makeshift gangway in a remote section of the Kennedy Caddesi - a distance away from the main ferries. On the conclusion of the trip, we were told to make our own way back to Sultanahmet by hailing a cab (during rush hour!) or walk the 3 kms. Furious and exhausted, it spoiled the evening for us.

Wonderful !. One of the best activities that you can do in Istanbul , we began our Bosphorus tour along the european side from Kabataj station , and returned along the asian side , it was very pleasing ! You can enjoy the architecture of the bridges , the old buildings like Dolmabahçe palace , and many other beautiful views.

Completes a visit to the magical city of Istanbul. A Bosphorus cruise is definitely worth the time. Besides the amazing views, you get to see the city from a different perspective and gives you an understanding of why Istanbul is such a historically important city by being at the confluence of three important bodies of water. A great way to see the varied and impressive skyline of the city, from the historic Sultanhamet area, to the more European looking neighbourhoods of Beyoğlu & Beşiktaş, to the pretty and picturesque Beykoz landscapes on the Anatolian side.

Must see so that you can appreciate the city skyline. It's well worth it to get on the water, even if only taking a ferry ride, to get a perspective where you can truly appreciate the beautiful skyline of Istanbul - the old city with its mosques and minarets are on one side, and the more modern buildings are on the other.

No visit to Istanbul is complete without a cruise on the Bosporus. My wife and I took one of the many Bosporus tour boats available by the Galata Bridge. It was arranged by our hotel as part of a multi-day package. I can not recall the specific tour boat but based on the brochures and our visual observation, the several tour boats are roughly the same in cost and tour specifics. In our case, we took a 2.5 - 3 hour tour that started at the Golden Horn and went up the Bosporus past the Bosporus Bridge. It stopped at the Beylerbeyi Palace,a summer place built in the 1860s. We took 30-40 minutes to tour the palace and grounds before returning to the Golden Horn.For us, the ability to see Istanbul from the water was essential. It gave us a visual perspective on the city as well as an appreciation of the variety of the harbor. The tour guide was able to tell us about the major sights and give us historical nuggets about certain buildings or activities.The end result was that we got oriented to istanbul and saw much more than the historic old city. It also whet my appetite to take a longer cruise either into the Sea of Marmara or the Black Sea and observe more of this beautiful country.

"Not to be missed". We took longer sahir hitlari cruise for a very affordable prize. Audio aid with map was provided for additional 10 TL. It gave highlights of important landmarks on the way. There was 3 hours stop at anadulo kavagi. We had to hike to the fort but the magnificent view of bosphorus strait entering the black sea was worth the effort. Very good seafood is available in many restaurants of this small village. It was one of our most enjoyable days in Istanbul. Not to be missed.
Magnificent view of a magnificent city from water.. A must visit while in Istanbul. Try to have a cruise 2 times once in night once in day time to see different looks of Istanbul skyline.

Get to thread the needle and see Asia meeting Europe. This is a great value for money. The boat ride lasted 90-120 minute and costs 12 Lire ($4). Make sure you go to the pier and buy from the guy as you board. There are hundreds of unlicensed people offering boat rides for 80 lire a head and they just sell you the 12 lire ticket. The boat is open seating with a cloth roof. If's it clear the sun will be pretty strong. Assume the boat will always be crowded. If you want some of the ride, but not all and you can work in a visit to the Asia side -- take a ferry to Kadıköy and enjoy great restaurants in the un-touristy side. In all events, it is a great experience and provides for some good scenery shots.

6hrs tour is a joke. We went for the 6hrs tour as we thought we would have he better experience, thats wrong. The tour up to the black sea is not so versatile like the short tour, and the worst pary: the castle is closed. So you walk up the hill for half an hour to experienced the closed doors. Take a picture of the black sea and then spend 2,5 hours in a village that just consists of ripp off restaurants. Then go back the exacty same route as before.The short tour is the better choice

Best Cruising. Fantastic view of entire Istanbul, while you cruise through the Bosphorous strait, which mostly starts from the Golden horn. This strait gives an ample view of both old and new part of Istanbul city (Europe side) as well as Asian side. This strait is also a boundary between Asia and Europe which connects the Black Sea with the Sea of Marmara . Must to visit

Great Cruise & Views on Both Shores. We took a cruise from the Galata Bridge up the European Shore to the 2nd Bridge and then returned along the Asia Shore.The views of numerous palaces, mosques and waterfront homes and businesses are excellent. Marine traffic in the Straits is incredible with small boats zooming everywhere.Definitely recommend taking a cruise to see the sights.

Amazing wonder.. I took a boat up and had a picnic lunch. But you can do the restaurant thing if you want. The ferry stopped at places with restaurants. Either way it is just a striking view of nature, engineering, and culture. Spend the money and take any one of the boat rides up and back.

Take a Bosphorous Tour to the Black Sea!. The Bosphorous Ferry Tour up to the Black Sea was the highlight of our trip. We chose the all day excursion that made several stops on both sides (European & Asian) and stopped in Anadolu Kavagi (Beykoz) for almost 3 hours. That was time for a hike up to the Fort & lunch. The trek up was challenging considering the temperatures that day but we made it and we're not youngsters. The views made it all worthwhile! The Black Sea lay before us shining in all its' splendor. We will never forget that.  The village had many places to eat and shops for souvenirs. I suggest you go beyond the restaurants upon embarking and hit the places further in for quality and price. As with Istanbul the people are lovely and we noshed on midye tav a (fried skewered mussels) & balik ekmek (fish bread-fish sandwich) that were both on my eat list. After the rigorous hike up to the fort we enjoyed an Efes beer before getting back on the boat.  The ferry was full of international travelers who make traveling fun & entertaining. We all were awestruck at the beauty we passed on the shores as we passed. Conversations flowed freely as you got to know individuals and chatted with those around you. This is what travel is about especially when confined on a ferry leisurely traveling up the Bosphorous. The sights along the way were spectacular. It was a beautiful day with the sun high above and the breeze feeling marvelous as we spotted a palace, another historic sight or beautiful vacation homes that lined the way. My only suggestion isdepending on which ferry you take, you may want to bring a small pack of kleenexwith you. If you've done your homework in researching customs in the area it came as no surprise when I went into the bathroom and spotted both "holes" and no paper.I'll leave it at that but remember should you embrace the culture --never use your right hand...
Great views. Spectacular Views from Europe to Asia, and all around, great place to visit and see the sites and imagine the history surrounding the straits

Hop-On-Hop-Off To See The Palaces!. In addition to Sultanahmet, I highly recommend the Bosphorus hop-on-hop-off boat tours so you can see the waterfront palaces. Never have I seen Baroque/Rococo done to such delicious extremes!

very nice. we took the ferry from Kabatas docks. cost was 15 liras for a two hours tour. It was worth the money ... lots of cool buildings to see on both sides of the bosphorus. The announcer is not audible so we gave up on her. Nice thing to do in the evening.

Do not leave Istanbul before taking this awesome Bosphorus strait cruise.. Make your Istanbul complete with this delightful Bosphorus cruise.There are so may cruises to choose but be selective and make sure your cruise include the 2nd bridge which take syou near the start of the black sea.Breath taking view of the city, all the minarets and even the bridge(s).Higly recommended!!We took a boat to Uskudar at night and the sights of the lighted buildings are breath taking!!!

Asia and Europe. First this is a great way to get the feel of Istanbul. You can see so much from these boat tours and you get to see the Asia side as well. Several sites you can only see from the boat tours so it is well worth the relaxing few hours on the water

AWESOME!. I live in a landlocked city so I do t get to see bodies of water like this unless I'm traveling. And rare that I get to see one as busy as the Bosphorus with the ferries, water taxis, yachts and freighters. And see across the water to the Asian side (or European side if you are on the Asian). Don't mess with any paid tourist ferry. Just take one of the commuter ferries for 4TL ($1.33!) for the exact same effect. So easy. Fun. Amazing sights and you may be 40 yards from a huge freighter crossing your path. Take your camera. Then do it again!! Plenty of places on the shores to sit and have Turkish coffee while watching the water.

Try to Get on the Bosphorus!. If you can, I would suggest taking a boat ride on the Bosphorus. It is such an amazing experience and there are great views of the city! Not only that, it is a great way to get around! We took a boat out on a sunny day and it ended up being a highlight for me even if I do get a little sea sick.. (Went July 2014).

Great Views of the City. I highly recommend the commuter ferries instead of the expensive tours. They leave from Karikoy, Eminonu, and Beshikash for either Uskudar or Kaorikoy and cost less than $2 for the trip if you use an Istanbul Card ("akbil") to pay.Wore out my camera shooting so many photos.
An enchanting visit. Not only seeing the Blue Mosque, this area has various shops with lots of history. We found it pretty safe to wander about, although we were with a tour group .

Look oyt for dolphins if u at the marmara sea end. What a unique piece of water!! Walkibg along it or sailing across it or sitting by it - its a must. And you can give the expensive crowded tourist boats a miss.

The Busy Bosphorous. The Bosphorous divides Istanbul into 2 distinct areas and is very wide with ferries and boats sailing all the time it is indeed a very busy river. People can be seen fishing all day and night off the bridge. If you go on a river cruise at night the lights make the city come alive and all the mosques are lit up - very pretty.

Take the public ferry to see the city....avoid the Tour Companies your hotel will try to line you up with.. A cruise on one of the public ferries is the best way to see Istanbul in my opinion. Do yourself a favor and SKIP the tour companies...they will rip you off. Unfortunately they have deals with so many hotels in the 'tourist areas' that it is difficult to save yourself money.
Take the cruise!. Take one of the many short cruises available on the Bosphorus, It is relaxing and the buildings you see on shore are beautiful!
Bosphorus Straight. We went on boat trip from the Golden Horn then along the Bosphorus Straight. It gives a good view of the city on both sides (Europe and Asia).
Bosphorus Strait. Take a boat trip if you are in Istanbul to see the varied landscape along the Bosphorus Strait. Its amazing how large some of the home are along the water.

Beautiful cruise down the Bosphorus Strait. We took the afternoon cruise after we booked from a kiosk in Sultanahment Square. It cost us Euros 10.00 per person, and I can say it is worth every cent. Do not miss it.
Amazing. One of the best things to do when visiting Istanbul. Go to Kabatas station and get for a very cheap price. view both sides of the boat is breath taking
Amazing. I travel all of the world maybe. But That's is amazing. if you have a sparetime test to trip of bosphourtour. history is fantastic. do it don't hasitate a bout that☺

A beautiful way to see Istanbul. We did a lunch tour of the Bosphorus and enjoyed all the bridges, the amazing array of architectual styles in residential areas, the mosques, the grand palaces, small fisherman, kids jumping and swimming on the banks (we didn't see any public swimming pools) - and the mass of the population of Istanbul just going about their business of the day.

good trip. This was a good choice because we could see the forts, museums, palaces from the strait. Also, the two continents being divided in the same country. The boat has fresh orange juice, turkish tea. It is just a bit expensive.
There are many mosques and many yellow houses that are still inhabited with the progeny of ottoman sultans.

Cruise. Everyone does this I guess,but amazing views from the sea side.We started the cruise from Kabatas station and got to see many places which we would have missed if we had travelled by foot.Worth the money.

Wonderful way to see the city. We took a public ferry in the evening for a 4 hour river cruise, 2 hours up, and 2 hours back. What a wonderful way to view the whole city at sunset, and did I mention quite inexpensive. The ride was comfortable and very enjoyable. We stopped at a little village for dinner and shopping and then returned. Very enjoyable evening. We even made new friends on this trip
Beautiful, very memorable!. We did a tour on the Big Bus service, well worth going on as you see so many sights in the several hours.

Between Europe and Asia. We took the boat to cross the Bosphorus Strait from Besiktas to Kadikoy which takes about 15 minutes and costs around 3 Lira's a person. It's very nice to see the the sights from a different perspective and pass by the Girl's Tower in the middle.
River views. Take ferry across the straight to see city from the water not much else to say other then do a trip in the daylight and one at nightfall

Boat trip is best way to see Istanbul shores. I will strongly advise to get some of the boats staring all over the shores- Galata, Kabatas, Besiktas, Otarkoy etc. That way you can enjoy the scenes with no need to mingle with the chaotic and not always clean city jungle. Price ranges between 4 - 20 € and usually takes between 1,5 and 2,5 hours

Relaxing Afternoon to the Black Sea. We took the Bosphorus and Black Sea Cruise - picked up from hotel at 1230 and returned at 1800. Very relaxing journey which included lunch and interesting commentary on sites along the shoreline . Stopped at Anadolu Kavagi for possibly an hour and a half. The current was not right for swimming so we walked around the little town and then back on board for the return journey.
Metro ferry. Great way to see Istanbul from the water cruise along the river and back for a metro trip each way. Hop on at Karakoy and take in both sides along the river.

Boat trip a must but cable car a waste of time!. We joined a tour group to do a boat trip of the Bosphorus. A half day afternoon experience. The boat trip was beautiful to see Istanbul from the water and get a perspective of the European and Asian continents! That part was well worth it but the cable car component of this tour is lacklustre to say the least! The only benefit was they dropped you off at the Egyptian Spice Market on the way back to your hotel! Pick a tour that doesn't include the cable car and it's a really impressive way to see beautiful architecture and modern seaside mansions!

boats and cruises in Bosphorus :). you can take a boat transfer you from the European to the luxury asian side and come back and take the excellent pics make a great memory and spend an ottman night in a night cruise its a great felling.
Great place. It is a great place to be there all the time. Make sure to try the baked potato and the Lukam. You can have a bosphorus tour also

Between Europe & Asia. A sightseeing cruise on the Bosphorus is a must if you visit Istanbul. The skyline is a blend of modern and exotic, with mosques, palaces, villas and fortifications lining the waterfront.

Don't buy tickets from random people. take one of the boat tours, but make sure you don't buy tickets from random people poking around. Their price is 30 TL whereas the normal price from the ticket box nearby is 12 TL per person. 30 TL is a rip off for tourists
Must see in Istanbul. We take a long cruise through whole Bosphorus strait almost to Black see. You have nice views of Istanbul from the ship. Definitely must see in Istanbul.
A surprise for our first visit to Turkey. This area is beautiful to cruise through on a boat! There are dozens of decorative mosques, incredible buildings, and gorgeous scenery!

Popbutar Boat Ride, but not worth the time. This several hour boat ride on a hot crowed boat with a bathroom that consists of a hole in the floor, should not be a priority on your list of Istanbul sights. It is interesting to see the various palaces and mansions on route, but if you have a limited time in Istanbul don"t bother

Very good value boat trip. Almost Must Do to take a boat ride while in Istanbul. The 'Full Bosphorous Cruise' is great value at 20TL for a cruise from 11:15am to 5pm, including over 2 hours on land at "Fishing Village" a few kms short of the Black Sea. Walk to the old fort there and enjoy a seafood lunch at one of the numerous restaurants that are just waiting for the boat to arrive
The European side of Turkey. Fantastic views here as number of ships are cruising to the port and could see the side of Europe strait while in Istanbul.
Fabulous. It is definitely worth taking a trip on the Bosphorus Strait as there are so many beautiful buildings on either side. Seeing a city from the water adds another dimension.
great trip. we did this by cruise and it was so good to see the sites from the water, if you go to turkey make sure that you go on a tour it is the only way that you will see everything

Must do activity in Istanbul.. Fun 2 hr boat ride on the Bosphorus up to the second bridge. We timed it correctly so that we could see the sunset on the way back. It was a perfect ending to our trip to Istanbul. The 2hr trip is only 12TL (on more than one tour company).

Take a boat trip on the strait. The Strait is one of the things you can't miss when in Istanbul. You basically can see it from everywhere.
You should however take a tour with the Şehir Hatları company. This is the public company and is much cheaper and better that the private ones. A 2 hour tour is 10 TL.

Crossing continents is Cool.. We crossed the Bosphorus Strait on a sunny and cool day in mid-September. It is exciting to see the incredible diversity of water craft (perhaps 'craft' is too limited a term as some of the container ships are huge) from different countries of origin.Crossing from the European to Asian side seems more culturally intensive (at least it did to us) as the diversity of dress (reflecting cultural mores) was more pronounced on the Asian side.Walking along the water front affords multiple views back to the European side (and camera clicks) that can't easily be viewed at street level there. My husband had his shoes shined by one of the local people there - I swear his shoes' lives have been extended considerably - and they have never looked as good. The person shining his shoes tried to converse with us in the best he could, but we were able to communicate the essentials of life: number of children and our location of origin. I am pretty sure he overcharged us for the memorable (yes, it was that) experience (25 lire), but he earned it by virtue of the number of component parts to the 'shine' - I gave up counting after six of them.

bosphorus strait. the strait was very peaceful and scenic. we did it at night and it was so beautiful to see the lights all round and the festive atmosphere even though there was no festival it just felt so opulent. the rich cultural and religious atmosphere of the mosques is definitely something not to be missed.

The Bosphorus. One of the most beautiful sights in the world, the Bosphorus is a strait winding between two continents and joining two seas. The entrance to the Bosphorus is like a small bay, and from here one gets the best view of the old and amazing Istanbul.

beautiful and peaceful. i was great . i and my wife really enjoyed being on the seabus and being in the middle of water and watching the beautiful view of city. we did it several time during 3 day in istanbul and we got different parts of the city.

A natural attraction. We cruised it, in and out of the Black Sea. Natural scenery, and they are currently completing a magnificent suspension bridge across the North end, linking Europe and Asia, but more out of the city. Watch for the colour changing lights on the city ring-road bridge.
Worth a cruise. Went on a 2 hr cruise along the Bosphorus which was worth killing a few hours and also seeing the different buildings and architecture along the way.

Every trial is optional except this one. You have to choices when you be at Istanbul wither you try this small cruise or you should try it! You can skip this trip but you can never say that I've visited Istanbul!
Boat trip. We went on a tour in a boat & so managed to see a lot in the 2 hour round trip. Some of the expensive real estate along the banks was magnificent.
