Awesome. It's an amazing experience to stand here or take a boat as we did to see where the continents meet. The Islamic architecture, the Bosphorus with its bridges, and the boats make for an amazing memory.

ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS. We bought hop-on hop-off ticket for this one. That's public ferry. You should write this attraction inside your 'must to do things in Turkey'. The view was incredibly amazing. You're gonna see so many beautiful historical buildings, mosques, restaurants, condos, everything was so great. Refresh your mind and soul in Bosphorus Strait :) Oh the ticket price for ferry is 15 lira. Hope it helps!
Beautiful little cruise. Bosphorus strait is certainly amazing , after all where in the world can you have Europe and Asia together..
A Must!!!. A must do for any and all visitors to Istanbul. Whether you do a private charter or a group excursion boat, the best way to understand the city is to take this tour.

An essential element of a visit to Istanbul. No visit to Istanbul could be complete without a boat trip up the strait to the Black Sea. We were on a perfectly sized boat with a very welcoming crew and were given a delicious lunch and as much information as we wanted about the history of both banks of the strait.
Amazing. I couldn't get enough of the scenery. The ships moving around, the beautiful mosques, great restaurants, everything was like a picture from a travel catalogue.
One word: BEAUTIFUL!. Must see while in Istanbul. Take the public ferry. It's not too expensive. Not much more to say except that it is gorgeous!
Panoramic view of Istanbul. We did a tour including a boat ride on the Bosphorus.It was a warm calm day so we enjoyed it very much and got a better idea of Istanbul European and Asian side.

bosphore tours. amassing boat ride you can feel the immensity of the city , take the 2 hour trip you see every thing the 5 hour one a big no no you get a 3 hour stop on a tourist trap nothing to do only a restaurant and shops not worth it ,

Take a tour to see this expansive city from the water. Take a boat trip up the Bosphorus and get to see the rest of the city. Fascinating. I used my guidebook to uncover the highlights on each side, but I think you can purchase an audio guide. Only cost 12 tl. Great value. Don't worry if you don't get a good seat on the outside of the boat, people move around and you can squeeze yourself in somewhere. Food and drink available onboard.

Spend as much time as possible on the Strait, you will miss it when you leave.. Spend as much time as possible on the Strait. You will miss it when you return home. Take the Ferries to the stops up and down Istanbul, take the Sunset $10 Cruise and see Istanbul at Sunset, take the Ferry to Kadikoy on the Asian side for dinner and some of the other places it stops. You can thank me later.

Bosphorus Straits are Istanbul. The most striking thing about the Bosphorus Strait is the number of tankers waiting to use it. Marine traffic has to use a one way system to negotiate their narrow strait. There are great views from all around the city, once you get up high.

Further than planned. We were thinking of just riding the ferry from Eminonu (European side) to Karakoy (other side of Galata bridge) and back. Opps I heard Kadikoy but thought he said Karakoy. We jumped on using our Istanbulkart (1.5 TL per person) and did not get off at Karakoy stop thinking we would ride it back to Eminonu....Instead we ferried down the Bosphorus while my wife panicked. I of course was calm and quiet (wondering where are we going?). The views of the western side and the eastern side were great. Upon arriving at Kadikoy I found out the ferry was not returning so we disembarked and found the ferry headed back to Eminonu. For 3 TL per preson this turned out to be a great adventure (to me...wife was not sure).
Interesting trip through history. Cruise along Bosphorus very worthwhile viewing many buildings which had once been palaces. Interesting to see all the activity on the water

Go at Night!. I'd recommend taking a Bosphorus cruise at sunset to enjoy the way Istanbul comes alive at night. Truly a fascinating experience to see the diversity of architecture as you cruise from the historical district to a more modern, thriving nightlife scene. Fun to see the bridge light up and to see palaces and maiden's tower all lit up as well. An absolute must!

Uniquely Istanbul. You can't miss the Bosphorus Strait; it divides the city into the Asian and the European "continents". We were on a Princess cruise and we sailed past Istanbul on our way to Romania and Bulgaria, then came back to Istanbul for an overnight. I was enraptured-the only way to put it-with the unique way the city was laid out and how many attractions we would later see were visible from the ship. The Blue Mosque was not only visible from the ship, we could hear the call to prayer from the ship. The call to prayer was a call to me to come visit and a teaser for what was to come.
the main thing to see in istanbul. you go around with the public transportation boats if you want to see it like the locals, and it will be quite cheaper
Very nice. Great place to visit ant enjoy history, book a hotel along the shore and truly feel that you are a part of life here.

Great way to see the city!. You can take a public transport ferry across the Strait for 2.5-4 lira between the Europe and Asia sides of Istanbul. Well worth doing and the view and breeze in the middle of the river will make you never want to leave. Have your camera ready and try to sit on the upstairs deck on the side facing the bridges for the best photograph views.

Great experience for the diversity of residential architecture. Well worth the trip through the Bosphorous strait and into the black sea; lovely houses along the way. Ortokoy is cute little port town to explore; it has an awesome massive mosque and lots of little shops
What a sight. What a sight to see. You cannot get enough of the vastness of this great city anywhere better than on a boat on the Bospherous

Consider the public ferries!. I went with the public ferry - Sahir Hatlari. They offer short and full Bosphorus Cruises at very reasonable prices. If you go with a private company you just don't know what you'll get. The boat was big - no worry about sea-sickness and I could change seats inside or out, right or left, front or back depending on my mood/the view. There was food and water/drinks on board at very reasonable prices. The only thing I didn't like was that the bathroom wasn't clean. And in order to know about the sites you pass you would need to get an audio guide. I think it was 10 or 15 t (the long cruise - up to the plack sea and back - was I think 25 t. The prices and schedules are available on their website.

Beautiful Bosphorus. I went on a cruise up the Bosphorus and revelled in the beauty of the sights. From the boat you could fully appreciate the size of the city of Istanbul, its history and the magnificent buildings which make it so interesting.

Ok at best. Over the years we have taken a lot of scenic tours on rivers, lakes etc. we did not book through a tour company but simply took the tram, bought a ticket and got on. The view from the boat is great but the boat by North American standards is pretty bad. The cover over the top of the boat was full of bird crap and was disgusting to look at. The toilet on board was the worst I have ever smelt, plugged and would not flush. The cool part of the trip was starting on Europe and stopping in Asia before returning to Europe. You do get a different prospective from the water than you do from the land and that was the good part Seeing some of the million dollar homes was also cool. I would not rate this as high as trip advisor does in terms of things to do in Istanbul. Istanbul is a unique city with lots of great places to visit, I would leave this when I have hit all the other high spots
Worthwhile. We took the shorter two hour tour. That was enough the longer tour would have been too much. We would not have wanted to do a longer tour.

A Different Side of the City. Our Tour Group had a boat to themselves and had an excellent trip along the Golden Horn starting in Europe and returning from Asia!It really is the only way to see many of the splendid buildings - and it is amazing just how many of these Istanbul has to offer - as well some of the leading 5Star Hotels (ie Four Seasons & Shangri-La). It just served to illustrate what a diverse and large City Istanbul is. Difficult to appreciate without going on some form of Bosphorous cruise - a must in my humble opinion!
The longer trip is so worthwhile. We enjoyed an afternoon cruising up the Bosphorus as far as the Black Sea. Wonderful to see all the history and old building on either side of the Strait.

Boat ride on the Bosphorus. The view of a city is totally different when you see it from a boat. This is one of my must do if I'm in a city with water, Istanbul looked so different from the perspective of the water, There are many boat options and I chose the longest time on the water as I love being on the water and it gave us a chance to take a break from all the walking! The views were breathtaking and it gave us a chance to some of the beautiful buildings on the banks of the Bosphorus. It's a busy place waterway with lots to see. I enjoyed it so much that I wanted to take a different boat and do it again! Great experience!

Not to be missed. We decided to do the Bosphorus stait ferry ride as it was our first visit to Instanbul.Wow. This cruise was just spectacular. Having the Asian continent on one sideof the straight and Instanbul on the other side its just awe inspiring. The cruiseis gentle - a good pace and such a busy water straiht. It was not expensive soa must if you can spare the time
Nice view . You may not need Bosphorus cruise if you are going to take some ferries to Kadikoy or Prince Islands from Kabatas.Otherwise take a cruise

A must when in Istanbul!. We took the boat over the Bosphorus and it was breath taking. An absolutely beautiful city and it is so cheap! I think it worked out 70p for a trip. Very beautiful and lots of sights to be seen on the way

Poorly organised "tour" of an interesting area. Our pre-booked tour became a bit of a farce as the company we had paid bumped us onto another tour which didn't include the lunch or stop-over we had been promised. It was all very last minute despite booking it a few weeks in advance, the transport from the hotel was very late & had other pick-ups to do before arriving at the harbour. Our guide was panicking & we ran across the busy bus station to keep up with her, she then bought tickets for the regular local ferry which we could have done ourselves! Our group was split up on the ferry due to the chaos and despite our guide's best efforts to describe the variety of sights on either bank we felt neglected at times & could have achieved a similar experience with a guide book a ferry ticket for a fraction of the cost. However the city, the history, the architecture & the atmosphere were all fantastic. A poorly organised tour emphasised the difficulty of pre-booking with an unknown company even if through a reputable online agent such as Viator/TripAdvisor. Thankfully a sizeable refund was received following a battle with both tour companies but the half-day experience we had been looking forward to never happened :-(

Sights, sounds and smells. Istanbul and the Bosphorus, the two are surely synonymous. Simply to stand at the waterside and watch the coming and going of shipos and boats is fascinating. The Bosphorus Tour by boat is a 'must' for any visitor to the city, but do not waste your money by listening to one of the innumerable touts who iwll accost you. Just go to the shipping company's ticket office and pay a trifling sum for the six hour trip. Three of those hours are spent at the terminla village, Anadolu Kavagi, which is twice as long as needed, the village having little to commend it. The trip is remarkably good value however, but so too is a journey on the ferry accros to Kadikoy on thr Asian shore, a mere 15 minutes or so. At times the odour of fish can be compelling.
Bosphorus Cruise. Great view. Must tour but my advice, don't took long hour tour. 2 hours is enough to enjoy the scenery.
See Istanbul on a boat!.. Get on a ferry/boat and have a go. Simply awesome even for someone like me who got seasick :). We took the day-long trip and it was worth every single lira.

You must do this!. This is a must-do trip for anyone visiting Istanbul. You see the differences between the European and Asian sides and the fortifications on either side plus the Shipping passing through- I found it quite magical.It takes 1 1/2 to 2 hours and is well worth it.
A view worth while. Sailing the Bosphorus strait gives you a great view to both side of the Istanbul city and its history.

To see it - do it by boat!. We had breakfast on a boat that traveled the Strait from south to north! What a collection of water traffic, as well as architecture on the shores. Beautiful buildings and great views!
Boat tour. Take a boat tour to the Asia side for a refreshing lunch on the water. Lemonade with mint and apple is the best.

Connecting continents. This narrow stretch of water separates Europe from Asia in this multi-cultural location ..... and connects the Sea of Marmara to the Black Sea. A busy waterway with great dining and sightseeing opportunities.

What a Strait ....... The Bosphorus Strait divides the city of Istanbul in two , the busy and hectic European city side where all the major international 5 star hotels have found their footing , and the quiter residentual Asian side , the Strait has its beginning in the Sea of Marmara and ends in the Black Sea . Located on both sides of the are fine examples of Turkish design , architecture , restauarants , bars , open air disco`s , private residences, greenery and two marvels of construction the two bridges spanning the strait .Tourist boats carry visiting guests up and down the waterway , giving you a chance to take in all the sights and sounds of the surroundings .Well worth a visit when in Istanbul , take a cruise and enjoy ........
Sailing on the. Went by boat and was beautiful to see. Lovely architecture, very clean. The people are lovely and friendly.

Amazing . So much to see in architecture. ..old and new. The marvellous bridges that connects Asia and Europe..beautiful. I personally prefer the European side in Sultanahmet and throughly enjoyed this cruise though.

Must see. Especially with boat trip, amazing old buildings and palaces, amazing sea road, 3 bridges (one is under construction) and seem like a river one side Asia the other side Europe, if you want to see from car try in weekdays , week ends terribly crowded.

Bosphorus Strait. toured this in a very crowded boat cruise. cruise was nt great but the views were super and the real estate is quite something to see. Was amazed at the number of cargo ships in the area. Beautiful views of the Bosphorus from Topkapi palace. Water is a very pretty blue.

boat trip. this is a must do in Istanbul , this tour is around 2 hours talking you all around Istanbul with many stunning views, the boat is 2 floors with free toilets and there is shop in the first floor for sandwiches and orange fresh juice tea and turkish coffee is also available with many other chocolate and ships and sweets.

Stunning views from cruise ship. Cruised up here on the Island Princess, stunning views.
No 'trouble' most people very friendly...Wish i was still there.

A relaxing overview of the city and its reason for being!. Here is a good way to spend that first jet lagged day when you need to stay awake till your hotel room is ready. First, it departs across from the Spice Market and the Rustem Camii, a must see and you can see the m before stepping on the tour boat. Secondly the two hour tour covers the city from its shoreline, a must see vistas of palaces, beautiful yali(summer homes) and long vistas of Istanbul's famous sights, minarets and domes from the sea. Don't miss and take photos!
Bosphorus & golden horn. this is a must tour as it shows the how east meets the west. lots of historical sites on the bank of the channel and offer you the stunning views.

Take a 4 hour boat ride with meal between your days of long walks for a great break.. Lovely boat ride, good food and amazing sights sandwiched between Asia and Europe, lined with palaces and amazing estate homes. Boat trip we took was 4 hours with a meal and choice of a stop in a fishing village or a swim. We opted for a swim and those who were left in the village for the hour we were swimming said it was boring and dirty. The swimming was great and refreshing but the current was strong.

Take a boat trip. A hive of throbbing activity that sees shipping constantly travelling 24 hours through the straits, you can travel very easily on the numerous errors ferries between the European and Asian side of Istanbul much quicker than trying to drive take a tour along it to get some great pictures
It was a lovely trip to the Bosporous.. The Bosporous trip was really nice. We got to see both the Asian and European sides of Turkey. Excellent
Straight connecting three major area of istanbul. nice place for a good view of Istanbul. You could see the three major land which is connected by the straight to be one BIG ISTANBUL

Lovely afternoon. We took a 2-hour cruise for 3Euro on the Bosphorus. We saw beautiful palaces and houses and completely different areas of Istanbul by boat. The breeze on the boat was delightful on a 100 degree plus afternoon.

A lot to see without walking. You can take this tour by yourself but I recommend a guide we could hear the boat guide but they did not point to things or tell all of the other things that happen along this tour.

Great place for a Boat trip. Beautiful Busy water way great place to take a ferry ride to save yourself the tour guide cost. If you want a tour don't buy from street vendors or from the street people selling them. Go to your hotel and buy it there.

I enjoyed walking there.. Must see, must walk.
Just avoid noon time in summer, have water with you, good comfortable shoes and clothes, a camera is a must.
Quite a walk, nice scenery.

Cruising on the Bosphorus. The sites on the cruise were beautiful. It was very relaxing. However it was a bit too long. The last 30 minutes were boring as you're seeing sites you've already seen. They combined an English and German tour together. Because they were switching back and forth between languages, we didn't get a full explanation of everything we saw.

A must place to go for Istanbul. This is a must place to go and visit Istanbul. What a beautiful place!
Usual a two hours tour of round-trip through the strait. Very very beautiful and you can see the many beautiful buildings and pass through the bridges between Asian and Europe......

A cruise on the Bosphorus is a wonderful idea for any trip to Istanbul. A great experience in any trip to Istanbul is a cruise up the Bosphorus. Many of the structures along the river are architecturally gorgeous and have a rich history. There are many options to take a tour, so be sure to get one that includes a guide to let you in on their many stories.

Wonderful day . Amazing weather and wonderful view
To take phosphorus trip is only 10 lira around 5 usd it's for 2 hours and it was awesome

Most beautiful sunset.. I could spend days riding the ferry boat and watching the sunset at the Bosphorus Strait.There are a lot of boat tours along the coast of the strait, most of them charge a little bit more than they should, but it's worth it.A cheaper alternative is to take the regular ferry boat to the asian side of the city, walk around the harbour and come back... way cheaper and almost as fun as the guided tours.

Great Boat Cruise. We took a 2 hour+ boat cruise on the Bosphorus Strait. This was a fantastic experience. The boat began on the European side, went around the Bosphorus, near the Asian shore, and then back to the European side. It was great to take in the wonderful sights and sounds. Plus, we did the cruise in the evening, and it was nice because it was timed so that you could experience a sunset while on the Bosphorus! An excellent idea!

Glad we took the full tour.. We took the full trip (Six hours)and were glad that we did. The ferry sailed for 1.5 hours stopping at a few landing stations then stopped for just under three hours at a lovely little town. It was hard work passing all the restauranteurs plying their trade but we went away from the waterfront and found a lovely little family restaurant. The sail back was just as enjoyable. Great value at TL25

First thing we did in Istanbul. After buying a pickle snack near the fish sandwich boats, we caught a public ferry from the left of the sandwich boats. We also paid extra for the headsets which were accompanied with maps - by clicking on each point on the map, abroef description and history of each historic site was given as we passed them all. This really help to give us a sense of where everything was.

Asia meets Europe meets Russia. Driving along the Bosphorus strait with each area of the strait buzzing with activity. Day trips are possible using the ferry. Just swipe your Istanbul card Asia - Europe.

Busy waterway. I had not realized before this visit that this is a tremendously busy waterway. Even with the 12/12 hour switch from north to south for the larger tankers. Many ferries and tourist boats battle with smaller personal watercraft. Wonderful views can be seen from both sides that cannot be seen from either bank by car.

Worth a trip. We arrived in Istanbul after hours of travel and were hot, sweaty and more than a little stressed. A friend suggested the cruise, so after checking in to our hotel, we went down to the left of Galata Bridge and caught a boat that cruised down the Bosphorus Strait to the second bridge, stopping only a couple of times to pick up and drop off passengers. It cost 12TL, took 11/2 hours and was worth it. We saw the city from a different perspective, as well as the very nice buildings and homes on the Asian side and some old fortifications. It was great watching other people enjoying the cruise as well. If you have the time, I recommend giving it a go.
Gorgeous views. You must take a boat ride down the Bosporus Strait. You will get beautiful views of the European and Asian sides of Istanbul, and catch some jellyfish swimming along side your boat!

Magical. We took a private cruise up the European side and back down the Asian side, the opulent Palaces, mosques and castles are incredible! The waterway itself is a busy and fascinating centre of maritime commerce with everything from massive container ships to tiny dinghys performing an intricate dance to get to their destinations. An outstanding experience and not to be missed.

Nice boat ride. A nice boat ride along the river in a public ferry. Do not take the private ones which are on offer for 15 euros, the public one at 12 TL is good and equivalent. A tip. Get on early and take the seat on right as you face towards the rear of the ferry. As the ship moves you should be on your left to get the best view. A must do when in Istanbul.

executive and historical places should visited. for family friends ,couple very very nice place and people and island for entertainment for luxury for restaurant best food and historical place its wonderful place

Not to be missed but Careful pick your boat. First look at a map and know where you are going. There are short trips of a couple of hours and longer trips that let you go swimming and stop for various sights.Then decide the time of day you want night time for lights and sunset,or daytime for sights. Then what do you want from the boat a meal entertainment and what level of music or to some people noise. Beware of booze cruises if that's not what you want.Then if you are not on a tight budget you may want to pick from a reputable travel agent or get your hotel to recommend a trip. If you go to the ferry area by tram - the budget option understand that small boats roll in the swell if this makes you nervous or sea sick. Often the cheap options will tell you incorrectly that you have booked a larger boat when you have in fact booked a small converted fishing boat. This is OK if you have sea legs and a hat in the daytime as it may not have cover. So armed with caution sunscreen and some knowledge do it it's a great view and not to be missed. Try to include a fish sand which and delicious pickles- the pink things in a plastic cup that go perfectly with your fishwich. Prices start at about 12 TL and go up. Enjoy.

glorious view. i can never get sick of this beautiful view, full of culture and history that goes back centuries. walk across the Galata bridge and stop by and have a Balik Ekmek with Pickles for 8 liras around $3usd . fresh fish with salad in half a loaf of bread cooked in front of you. thousands of people eat here daily so it is always fresh and tasty. but dont forget the Pickles they make it ll the better

Choose different perspectives. Took a few ferries to see the bosphorus strait from several angles. My top 3: the tea garden next yo the Topkapi Palace - enjoy traditionally prepared tea & enjoy the view, take a ferry to Üsküdar & walk along the waterfront & last but not least the Galat tower

Fantastic views all along the way. A cruise down the Bosphorus is a must-do. Make sure to visit the Asian side of the strait as well. There are several small fishing villages along the way that are very charming - great picture opportunities. Strongly recommend the full day cruise along the Bosphorus if the weather is good. They go all the way to the Black Sea.

2hr boat trip at sunset. really enjoyed seeing the city from the water - there was a bar on board selling snacks, drinks and ice creams and a great commentary in excellent English - good value at around £30 for a family of 5 - I think we got a good price as it was the last tour of the day so we were prepared to barter...and it worked - saved about £20!

if you visit istanbul you have to go for a cruise through it. you will enjoy the cruise too much , it is about one hour you see both sides of Istanbul Asian part and the European part , you can also take a cruise in the evening and enjoy dinner on the ship , you will absolutely love it

Istanbul by boat. This sightseeing attraction is nice but not necessary if you don't have the time. It was very pleasant and relaxing, many in our group enjoyed the trip by boat. You could get a guided trip, and the guide will explain all the sites on both sides of the river, so you get a different perspective on the sites that you see from land. It was very pleasant.I don't recommend to take the long trips or ones with dinner, the food is really average and you don't get your money's worth at all. Don't be drawn to the scammers at the port who ask for large sums for this cheap trip.Do your research on the Internet and you can find cheap large boats that travel both sides all day, so you don't get stuck with the scammers. Be careful these guys smell a tourist a mile away, so prepare from your hotel, be safe, and enjoy your excursion for the afternoon.

Istanbul by Boat. The Bosphorus strait offers many options for seeing Istanbul by boat. It's a great way to see the skyline and shoreline, as well as many of the sights from a unique perspective. We rode some of the commuter ferries to get between the European side and the Asian side, the ferries are a great way to get around and a cool way to see the city. There are also "Hop on, Hop off" ferries that are pretty cool too. We used both methods and were able to see a lot of the city, the palaces, bridges etc. It was scorchingly hot in Istanbul during our visit (in August) so, having the ability to see the city while relaxing on a boat was really nice.

Fabulous half day cruise. We did a wonderful half day cruise, one sundry perfect afternoon, up to the Black Sea and had the most brilliant day. We went on the cruise that served a delicious buffet lunch. The music onboard was perfect for the delightful mood of the day. My husband was one of those who went swimming in the Black Sea off the boat's deck and he loved it!

Take the ferry!. There is a local ferry that connects the Old City with the Asian side. Take a ferry that costs 4TL for a roundtrip around the sunset; don't get off the ferry (unless, of course, you want to) and just remain on the ferry. So gorgeous! I preferred this over any fancy rooftop bar where you could watch the sunset.

Get away from traffic and marvel. After the crush of trains and trams and the nightmare of taxis to and being a pedestrian in the Sultanahmet area, the sheer joy of sailing on a ferry on the Bosporus with a sea breeze and so much to see was wonderful ,,, and cheap. (plus no one trying to sell you a carpet)

This is a great way to see the city.. This is the best way to get a sense of the city. The architecture is phenomenal. You can see the Europe on one side and Asia on the other. Being the gateway to the Black Sea, it is a busy strait.

Night dinner tour. We joined a dinner cruise to see the Bosphorus. We felt herded to be frank. The food was nothing outstanding but the "culural show" was interesting until the belly dancers came to the table drapping themselves all over the men waiting for money to be slipped into their "attire". If you are going...go with a group of friends. Was interesting to cruise the water at night.
Beautiful experience to go across few times. Everytime I go to Istanbul I love to move across the Bosphorus for few times: every crossing is another chapter in my experiencing of Istanbul.

My new Love. Was a very nice surprise our 2 weeks there ,totally unexpected but I can say PARIS I just found my new love (ISTANBUL) from now on.Loved everything about it ,very crowded but organized ,nice people ,clean ,so much to do ,etc,etc will be back ,food is out of this world ,so much history ,eeeee

Amazing water that separates two continents.. If you are able, you should not miss a boat ride on this waterway. The view of the structures and tour guide information make this one visit you don't want to miss if you are in Turkey.

Breathtakingly Beautiful. We did this in style - a privateYacht for 2 hours and the views were just stunning. have a look. This is the way to do it and honestly not all that expensive if you are more than 5/6 people. The Yacht could comfortably take 20 and we were only 9. Some cool music in the background on a nice sunny day with Beer & conversations.

The most beautiful scene. What a view of Asia and Europe. Black sea at one end and the Mediterranean on the other. The breeze on the boat is so refreshing. One of the most memorable trips. It can be very economic if you go to the Galata Bridge (Asian Side). Tickets are always available within couple of hours at most.
Scenic view of Istanbul. Visited this on a cruise both during daytime and at night and both are excellent and have their own advantages.
short visit.. Nice looking and very good atmosphere. You can walk around and have fun either alone or with loved ones.

Ancient city tour. The tour was one and three quarters. You see so much and it is amazing. Goes to the Black Sea and the other are Sea of Mamara. Delightful, had apple tea and the most delicious sweet whilst travelling. Cost 12 lira each and tea and sweet 3 lira.

Boat trip on the Bosphorus Strait. We enjoyed a nice boat ride on the Bosphorus Strait. Perfect view of construction of a new bridge and many interesting buildings on the shores, The stop of about 4 hours halfway the trip was a bit too long for the place to visit. It was a nice place for lunch but not very many interesting things to see.
Great view. Beatifull view of both asian and european sides of Istanbul, there are ferries to cross to both sides and you can enjoy the view doing a walk on the sea front.

A cruise on the Bosphorous. Hop on a boat and cruise the length of the Bosphorous up one side and back the other. Buildings of interest will be pointed out in Arabic, Germam, Spanisg and English. The cruise will take about 3 hours and is very pleasant.

Phosphorous Strait boat tour. I took the tour for Bosporus strait that goes from Kabatas and or Besitas. It is 1hour and 45min tour by boat. it is based on hop on and hop off which means you can spend all day going down on stations moving around, sitting on cafe's, eating lunch (on your own expense & discretion) etc.. and then get on another boat later to continue the tour.The boat tour goes on the European side with explanations on the ares we are passing by and returns on the Asian side where you can see houses on the shore of the strait that cost tens of millions of euros

Great views fun restuarants along the river. A beautiful view from the many restuarants river facing. A cruise down the river provides stunning views of palaces and villas . The views of the Mosques and city from the river are fantastic.
Nice to be done at 6 PM. Try it and jump on cruise at 6 PM and enjoy the last hour of day light and sun set and it will be an unforgettable memory

Stunning views across the river!. This river provides a beautiful view point from well positioned restaurants and river facing Hotels. A cruise down the river provides stunning views of palaces and villas on both sides of the Bosphorus strait. The views of the Mosques and city from the river are absolutely divine. An Iistanbul visit is incomplete without a river cruise!

special. We travelled through the Bosporus Strait on a cruiseboat with a great view as we headed for the Black Sea --- viewing Europe on one shore and Asia on the other - it was great sailing under the two huge bridges teeming with traffic and to view the Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosques

Stunning. We went on a 90 minute trip up the Bosphorus which i think is quite enough. The buildings lining the strait are a mixture of historical sites, palatial mansions and old wooden houses renovated to preserve a bit of history.
Very pretty and worth taking the time to go.

Bosphorous Trip in Istanbul. Never miss this trip !! it is cheap, and nice.On the boat you will not have a guide, but tha view is amazing !!! I booked a short trip ( I think is the best ) .You can have this short trip every half hour .

Great Way to See Istanbul. Taking a river cruise on the Bosphorus is a great way to see the sights. We took the scheduled river cruise/taxi and that worked just fine. I wouldn't waste my money on all those hawking tours.
recommend. Go to cruise from 1 and hal hour until 4 hours. Especially recomend night cruise with full programm and day cruise obn Bosphorus
Wonderful overview of the city. This is a worthwhile boat ride. Many available and they are not too expensive. Two hours will do it and you will get an idea of both continents and their connections

Continent divide by Bosphorus. Boat cruise on Bosphorus divide is worth spending time and money. The architect on both the side of continent looks different and very interesting.this strait is interesting as e get to see two continents from the boat and we touch Black Sea on one side.

The Cruise was the highlight of Our Holiday. The Bosphorus Cruise was the highlight of our holiday... It costs next to nothing (a 3 hour cruise 12TL) we saw many interesting sights passed underneath 3 bridges, passed by the maiden tower and the golden horn. The bar had very reasonable prices and a waiter service was available too. we all agreed that this was the best part of the holiday.
Europe meets Asia,. it's a place where Europe meets Asia, amazing, you will feel like travelling through time, and through space, every part of Istanbul is unique and presents different epoque....
Amazing and Relaxing. Took a 1hr 30 min non stop cruise from the Galata Bridge along the Bosphorus Strait. Offers a very different view of a unique city. Just sit back and admire the view.

Great trip!. Would definitely not waste money on expensive daytrip offered. We went on boat trip offered along thevfront - 12 TL (4€), 1hr 40mins on boat around Bosphorus, no stops but lovely late afternoon with gorgeous views.

Nice view of Istanbul from the Strait. We took bought a sight seeing tour on the Bosphorus Strait and the journey took like 1.5 hours. Along the strait you can see how beautiful Istanbul is. We get to know other side of Istanbul through this journey.

Great perspective on Istanbul. Great break from walking to get a different perspective on the city. If I were to do it again I would bypass recommendations to take the public ferry and audio guide and instead opt for one of the more touristy options. The ferry was fine and the audio guide was almost good... A bit more information on each point would have made it much better.

cruise. We did a day cruise up the Bosphorous river,lunch included, we had a great time,plenty to see,we drove over the Bosphorous bridge which links Europe to Asian side, we visited the Berberyri Palace,would recommend trip to all.
Magnificent. Try and get a short cruise up and down the Bosphorus for stunning panoramic views of the city! Relatively inexpensive and worth the view!
Amazing. Very relaxing place especially in winter u cant go to istanbul without having a journey in the bosphour amazing view
So beautiful . I believe this is a must do attraction of you have been to Istanbul for sometime, very relaxing and refreshing tour out of the crowded city

Walk to Bridge and get an nice view of the city and talk to the fisherman. There are many a cruise liner close by this straight. take a walk from the port over the bridge and see a wow view and meet some nice local people

The beauty of the Bosphorus !. This is a busy and beautiful waterway separating Turkey into Europe and Asia. Multiple tanker boats and ferries crisscross the strait . Walking along the Bosphorus on either the Europe side or Asian side is beautiful.Wait for sunset from the Asian side !

Rent a boat!. I took a private yacht tour my last night off Bebet. About 1 1/2 hours long only 200TL , and they let us bring drinks. The bridge looks beautiful and I got to see a lot I missed during my stay.

Spectacular View with Asia on one Side and Europe on the Other. Just being in the Strait, with Asia on one side and Europe on the other was an experience in itself. The views were breathtaking of Istanbul and a perspective you should not miss!

Day or night cruise. Tastes differ.. I did not take the actual Bosporus boat tour, I took a boat to the prince's island, which somehow covers part of the tour. Bosporus is nice during a day in good weather and during the night as well. I took the actual tour 10 years ago and was not impressed. Now, it seemed to be very touristic (Arabic) and rather crowded If you look for that type of tourism, that is probably what you need. I read that you can also take private tour on a small boat. That is probably better in a small group and/or for the occasion.

Bosphorus tour. Lovely idea to spend a half day! We took the one way ticket (around 1h30min) , and come back by bus, like a local. So nice to see all the history, the architectur, across Europe and Asia..Do not hesitate to take the audio-guide.
breathtaking views. Take the guided day tour if you have the time, you will appreciate the history and the architecture of Istanbul, and take in the wonderful sights as you go along
Bosphorus. Take one of the many ferries that do the circuit of the Bosphorus . The cost is minimal but well worth seeing Istanbul from the water
perfect way to see the city. Highly recommend it since you can see and get a feel of all Istanbul. The buildings, neighborhoods and castles.
Nice cruise. We did a Bosphorus cruise via our hotel. We thought it was brilliant with many places to see from the ship.

Tour by Ferry. We rode the regular ferry to enjoy the views without someone barking at us or load music blaring throughout the ship. We've had the other experience in the past and can't recommend the ferry enough. Plus its inexpensive! Not just the ticket but also the snack counter. The ferry went from Galata Bridge to a small town near the Black Sea where we went ashore for 90 minutes before we re-boarded the same ferry for the return trip. Many beautiful sites along the way!

Traditional Turkish Coffee inside the boot. My son insisted to do this cruise for 12 TL. We payed cash at the entrance. It was enjoyable. We took pictures and had a good time. We had a Turkish coffee, it was made traditionally inside the boot. My wife likes it.
cruise. must try the cruise. at leat1.5 hrs trip will bring u the good feeling factor about Istanbul from the side of perspective

Ferry Tales. When in Istanbul, take a ferry. Don't take the all-day tourist ferry but a local ferry. Like the ferry to Kopekoy; it costs a whopping 4 lira (like about $1.75 in August of 2015) and, if you get the right boat, some little guy from the kitchen will come around and offer you a hot tea for another lira.

Ferry trip.. We went on a ferry trip which lasted 6 hours and went all the way to the Black Sea. I would choose one that went for half this time. The crew were okay and the buffet lunch was good but that's about it. It was certainly worth seeing Istanbul from the water but go for the shorter trip.

The bridge between two continents...... In the trip with my family we had the chance to sail around the strait so we were to know the residencial areas of the jet set of some years ago as wellas the sultans palaces like the Dolmabache....just a dream of wonder jewels.........
Beautiful history and architecture. The Bosporous trip was very enjoyable. The mosques and palaces on the waterside were absolutely beautiful. We really enjoyed being out on the water on a hot day.

Nights are magical, but too many distractions!. We took a dinner cruise through the Bosphorus....im not into cruises too much, but this experience was better than our last ones.....although I would say that Bosphorus cruise could have been better without the Turkish Dances, Music or A whole lineup of belly dancers......Bosphorus at night is a magical place in itself, and next time when I am there, I would rent my own boat, and would try to enjoy the amazing scenery of Bosphorus at night, in peace!!!

Great scenery. Beautiful scenery along the bosphorus shores, perfect for taking pictures. We took the sehir altari ships as we found them to be the best value for money. There isn't much to do at anadolu kavaği, so those who are tight on time could just do the short cruise.

A must experaince. You can spend 30 min or 5 hours on the straight, but I don't think you can ever get tiered of the scenery.The cheapest way is to take the ferries and you see as much as you do on a tour but you may have to get on early to get a good spot.

Great way to take in a beautiful city. We've all seen amazing, inspiring and romantic photos of Istanbul and the Bosphorus at some time, so if you are in Istanbul, don't miss the chance to see the city from a totally different angle!Its refreshingly cool out on the water after the summer heat in the city. There are many boat tours advertised, but the best one is the one run by the municipal transport authorities, Sehir Hatleri. The short tour (2 hours) costs only 12 TL. Just be sure to get an audio guide on the dock though (10 TL) as there are no loudspeakers or announcements during the journey. I actually prefer it that way, rather than have loudspeakers booming every few seconds. If you simply want to relax, you can turn off the audio guide and enjoy the views.

Get one of those audio tour guides. The trip was nice, but i wish i knew what i was looking at. Also dont be fooled by the people trying to sell you trips on the streets, they charge more and ships are worse. go to eminunu and book the trip yourself in one of the big fancy ships with the audio tour guide headset.

Take a Lovely Ferry Ride to See the Sights. We took the ferry near the Galata Bridge for a two hour trip. Great value and a terrific way to see the old luxurious palaces, modern bridges, forests, and new skyscrapers. An awesome way to see the Straights of Bosphorus.

Nice sights!. I was there in a cloudy and rainy day in a guided tour, I bet the sights are gorgeous in sunny days. From the boat we saw Dolambache Palace, the casino, a luxury district with splendid mansions facing this incredible strait, several beautiful mosques, bridges, and the tour guide pointed out the house that Sissi Emperess visited once. Very enjoyable and highly recommended visit while in Istanbul!
Nice relaxing day. Did the cruise, had the lunch on the boat, a nice relaxing day but too many people on board. Lovely views and nice to just sail and see the sights.
This place everybody must to visit. Its the most beautiful place i ever saw. It's a place where everybody must to visit! will remember it forever!

Very nice tour. Nice short tour of the Bosphorus. No need for tour guides , just take the blue line metro to kabatas and you are there. It will cost you 2.15 TLira per person for the metro and 6 TLira for the tour (8.5 Tlira which is equivalent to approx $3 per person.)
A must see!. Where Asia and Europe meet. Magnificent colours change in every season and with weather conditions. It ıs magical both in the evening an during day light. A must see an exprience.

A breath taking experience!!!. It was an amazing trip to do and to see istanbul from the sea. We take the tour at the evening around sunset. When you plane to visit istanbul don't miss it otherwise you will miss alot.

Long Bosphorus Cruise that reaches the Black Sea . We took the cruise of Sehir Hatlari from Eminonu originally priced at 25 TL but we got it for 20 TL since we had the istanbul museum pass. The ferry has 5 stops (3 on the European side and 2 on the Asian). Amazing views all the way. U r free to hop off at any stop. We chose Anadolu Kavagi to be our stop and it was really an excellent choice. As we stepped out of the ferry we went to the closest restaurant to the left and we had the most amazing seafood (especially the butter shrimps and the mussels). We also walked in town and bought some nice souvenirs. U also can walk for abt 20 mins to a castle at the top of the village with some amazing views.

Lazy day on the rvier. Interesting landscape of buildings from many generations. Take a boat trip down the strait, and immerse yourself in the history both modern and ancient. Get off the boat and explore mosques and sultans palaces. great place to spend the afternoon

Beautiful View. Istanbul has so many wonderful restaurants and cruise ships from which you can enjoy the strategic and beautiful Bosphorus Strait. My favorite view, however, is early in the morning just past the Northern bridge. The sunrise lights up the water and the rugged cliffs, making it one of my favorite natural views in the world.
Inexpensive shuttle boat. Take the shuttle boat from Galata bridge go to Asian side Uskudar then Besiktas, Bebek,... and back. This will cost you 4TL a ride or you can take a daily card.

Take the Full day Ferry - wonderful and cheap!. Take the ferry to the end, it will take a full day for only 12 lira ($6 USD) Get the audio tour (5 lira, or $2.50 USD), it appeared to have GPS so discussed relevant items. There is a restaurant at the top of the ruin with beautiful views. We were set to pay for an expensive tour, but hotel recommended the ferry and was very happy with that choice

The best part of Istanbul. The best part of Istanbul, not just for the views but for the breeze which beats the summer heat. Hint: the Sehir Hatlari 6-hour tour which leaves from Eminonu is only 25 TL as compared with the 50-60 Euro that other places try to charge.

to do in istanbul. it was yes my second visit but yet did not see the Bosphorus Strait .you can have a private boat tour or just go with the ferry . very interesting to see a straight connecting Europe with Asia .do not skip it

Hi. Great tour. We really loved it .
I advice all the tourist to make it.as the weather is good. And it shows all the important sights of Istanbul.
great. the 2 hours ride for bosphorus cruise is amazing. we can see both europe and asia side of istanbul. i'm amazed

Beautiful. A beautiful waterway. The 6 hour trip was enjoyable. There is so much history with many places to see along the way on both continents. The trek to the Norman castle althoigh a bit derelict was worth the views. There was a great selection of restauarants at the stopover.

Many fishers on bosphorus bridge. Highly recommend to visit in the morning. Visitor can see many fisher prepare fishing equipments and see them fishing on the bridge. Sunlight is also great in the morning!

Relax and enjoy Turkey.. Witness the two continents on a journey of two hours on boat. Very informative journey, take lots of pictures
Beware of crooks selling you tickets to boats that do not run.

Best way to enjoy your stay in Istanbul. Take a ferry ride from Eminonu and go for a fantastic hour-long cruise in the Bosphorus. It will be the best moment of your stay in Istanbul and a good way to see what a beautiful city it is with the many historical palaces on the shorelines and you will pass through few bridges too. You can choose to stay inside the ferry or go on rooftop. Rooftop gives you an airy, refreshing and exhilariting experience. You will be served snacks and turkish tea for minimal 1 TL or something. All in all - highly recommended.

What makes Istanbul so beautiful. The Bosporus divides the city into two continents; moreover, it gives it a beautiful setting to show off its architecture, palaces, mosques and woods. A long boat ride will show you gems such as palaces and forts located on beautiful hills and convince anyone of the beauty of this unique body of water.
Holiday . Bosphorus separates Asia and Europe. Plenty of tours from hotels. A definate must when in Istanbul. Stunning trip.One can't leave Istanbul without cruising the Bosphorus.

Interesting and unique. A lovely relaxing boat ride on the Bosphorus. Narration makes it more interesting to learn about the historical buildings you will see. This is also the divider between Europe and Asia. We also drove alongside of the river and stopped at two of the many riverside restaurants. Two bridges across the river take you from one continent to the other and you are still in the city of Istanbul! There are so many cars crossing the bridges that it takes a long time to get to the bridges - though once on the bridges it doesn't take long to arrive on the other side.

Lovely views. The cruise ship we were on sailed up the Bosphorus. We were berthed over looking the Blue Mosque. What a wonderful site. So many ferries traveling from site to site. On the bridge next to us had hundreds of locals fishing. Great atmosphere and safe to walk about. See it again soon as we travel to the Black Sea.

trip to the Black Sea. If you go on this trip use the local ferry it is both inexpensive and has decent food and drinks on board at local prices.Go in the morning and you can and walk up to the castle at Anadolu Kavagi which is a small fishing village north of the Bosphorus on the Asian side and the final stop.The views from here of the Black Sea and the construction of the new suspension bridge over the Bosphorus are stunning If you want to extend the trip you can get on and off the ferry at different locations but as there is around 1.30 minutes between ferries make sure you have plenty of time.

Don't miss this !. We took the late afternoon cruise which was just the right time of day as on the return the sun was getting low and all the coast was lit up. Whole family loved this trip. Very cheap too, only 12TL (£3) for hour and half.
Rehana Imran. Beautiful it takes u around. One gets lost. its another world of enjoyment. Bosphorus is interesting it conndcts Europe to Asia. U see old Istanbul n thr modern part as well
amazing. When you visit the bosphorus strait you realise that you are between two continents, please if you are in istambul take a boat and go to the strait

A must see..... The Bosphorus is a must see when you are in Istanbul Turkey. We took a cruise down the very busy straight.This straight divides two continents and has a very interesting history. There are many tour boats available to take you on the tour. We were served a lovely traditional turkish lunch, it was delicious.

The magic of two continents. . A private boat cruise through the Bosphorus is all you need to capture the magic of this beautiful city. Go just before sunset so you can capture the essence of this great strait between Asia and Europe where the cold waters of the Black Sea mix with the warm waters of the Mediterranean Sea. Cafes, Fish restaurants, the famous Potato Market where you eat baked potatoes filled with a variety of everything Turkish. An experience not to be missed at any cost.
A great view !. An excellent place to sit and have views.. Lovely restaurants.. The cruises are lovely..All kinds of food available..

Cheap way to see both sides of Turkey. Cool refreshing trip which allows you to see lots of interesting sites on both Asian and European side of the Bosphorus.Recommend you take a guide to help you identify the many lovely houses and palaces on route as tannoy system is at best poor.Trip takes about 2 hours for 12Tkl with Tiyol and is easy to turn up and walk on.
Boat trip is a must!. Take a one day boat trip to Black Sea to be able to appreciate the magnificence and beauty of the Strait.

Divide of the Continents!. What an exciting concept, of being on a strait that divides two continents. The Bosphorus was a bustling water way with taxis, fishing boasts, large ships and tourists enjoying it. The Bosphorus is easy to navigate and divides the European and Asian sides of Turkey. With taxi and tour boats lining up to take you to the other side or just to cruise to the major overhead bridge and back. The fee to ride these boats was so minimal, that is was definitely a nice way to spend a few hours and get a different perspective of the city.

Bosphorus Cruise. We oured the strait in one of the many inexpensive tourist boats, for a 1.5 hour round trip. It gives you an insight into a different part of the city, with lavish mansions along the water. So gladwe got away from the city and onto the water.
Beautiful Architecture and Homes along the Banks. In Bashitkas or Kabatas you can get a Bosphorous Tour Boat very inexpensively and then Hop On and Hop Off along the way.

History before your very eyes.. It is fascinating to see both sides of Istanbul and know the Strait connects the Black Sea and to the Aegean, Mediterranean Sea. It is the busiest waterway I have ever seen with boats and commercial vessels moving all directions.

Perfect evening - cruising on the Bosphorous. Our group of six booked a Dinner/Show Cruise on the Bosphorus for the first evening in Istanbul. It was spectacular. The sites were dreamy with palaces, yachts, a fortress, mosques and more all lit in beautiful gold and silver hues along with some other bright blues, reds and greens. The night air was crisp which all combined for a perfect start to a great trip.

Lots of trips on offer. We took a half-day cruise up the Bosphorus as far as the Black Sea. Cost was between £25 and £35, depending on whether payment was in lira, sterling or euros, and a very good lunch was included. At the half-way point there was the option to swim from the boat or to visit a former fishing village on the Asian side for shopping etc. I meant to swim, but was put off by the jellyfish! So I shopped, and found that prices for all sorts of souvenir items were a fraction of what exactly the same things cost in Istanbul - eg a lovely cushion cover for 10 lira, which at the Grand Bazaar and on-street shopping in Istanbul was 45 lira.The views all along the Bosphorus were spectacular, and the boat was comfortable with plenty of shady seating. Lots of companies do this sort of trip - you will find leaflets everywhere to choose from. Highly recommended as a full-day or half-day out.
Nice. Nice place. Good to walk on the shores or take a ferry. And don't miss the fish and bread that you will get almost everywhere there.
Stunning views as you sail the Bosphorus Strait!. Wonderful to travel on the water through the Bosphorus Strait on a cruise liner. A must do while in Istanbul for any visitor. Stunning views!

Great Cruise!. We were in Istanbul the last week of July. The Bosphorus cruise was part of our package so we didn't have to pay for it. It took about a couple of hours in the morning and the boat went up and down the strait and the guide gave us information about the landmarks on both sides of the strait. I would recommend this cruise to everyone. You have to do it at least once.

Disappointing Waste of Time. We did the hop-on-hop-off cruise but were very disappointed. The cruise itself is fine and you can see many of the key points of the city along the way but the commentary was effectively non-existent. Between the noise of the engine, the poor audio system and the accent of the commentator it was difficult to hear/understand anything. If you are seeing the sites but don't know what you are seeing it is pretty worthless.It was quite cheap around 15TL but I would rather pay much more and learn something. You might as well take the ferry for 4TL than this. If we were staying longer I would have looked for a private boat tour.
Riding like a princess. Make sure to take the ferries to the islands, especially the Princes Island and ride around the island in a horse-drawn carriage.

I was not much thrilled ...better to visit on foot in the streets. Being on 1.5 hour cruise on the Bosphorus is so boring... you see great historical buildings and landscape of the city but the cruise is so slow ..I felt asleep sometimes

Pleasant cruise for 11 lira. If you have time, this is a lovely way to see some of the city. You can take a cruise for 11 lira by the bridge connecting the Sultanahmet District to Taksim on either side. You can also disembark at various locations along the Bosphorous on both the Europe and Asia side, if you desire.

Terrific way to spend a few hours. Go the dock at Eminonu and take the Sehir Hatlari ferry. The fare is minimal but the trip is first-class. You can get hot tea and some nice snack food onboard or buy a fish sandwich at the bridge and make an afternoon picnic outing out of it. Boats depart at 2:30 every day but get there an hour early; it fills up fast!

Beautiful sight. This busy stretch of water is teeming with life. A busy area with both working and tourist craft. Highly recommend a boat trip, maybe you'll be lucky and see the dolphins like we did.

Dinner cruise. We had to travel the Bosphorus because of the importance of this body of water in history and the modern world. We did a night time dinner cruise, little did I know was more of "Booze Cruise" with traditional dancing and more! LOL! All I can say was that the food was terrible but it was entertaining and a adventure that my teenagers will never forget even though they complained the entire way!

Hire a private boat, highly recommended. Probably the Bosphorus tour was one of the few things I enjoyed most. We did not take the fairy, instead if you keep walking along the shore a little distance, you will typically find locals with their boats willing to give you a private tour. We took one of these boats and it was reasonable, comfortable and a lot of fun. Highly recommended.

A pleasant boat ride.. Although my trip on the Bosphorus was part of a half day tour of Istanbul, It was a pleasant way to spend an hour seeing the city [especially the Asian side] from the water. Suggest you sit on the Port [left hand] side of the boat so as to get the best views of the city.
Bosporous Tour. Beautiful waterway dividing the city! Ferry ride was informative, comfortable, and allowed participants to see Istanbul from the water. Great way to spend half of a day!

Worth to take this tour. Take a ride in the strait, it lasts one and a half hour, but it is worth the view of the city from the water, the Asian and European sides, Marmara and Golden Horn.There are several boats offering the service, and I appreciated the views more than a previous ride in a cruise ship.

Pleasant way to spend 1/2 day on a hot August day in Istanbul. While the weather was hot when we visited Istanbul (>90 F), the temperature on the water was pleasant and, with a steady breeze, quite comfortable. The cruise is an excellent way to see some of the historic buildings and, with a good guide to describe the sites, it is worth the time and money (our cruise cost 212 TL for two and included a stop at the Spice market and a tour of a mosque). The young woman who guided our tour was a bit difficult to understand but, once on the boat, she used a microphone and was much clearer. The tour picked us up at our hotel and dropped us back there at the end.
Beautiful view of the city.. Boat trip down this amazing waterway is not to be missed. The Mansions along the shores along the entire length of the waterway are amazing.

Beautiful View Bosphorus Strait. We took boat for Bosphorus Strait sightseeing. The view was very beautiful. We can see all iconic building in European side and Asian side. And we passed below the bridges.

Bosporus cruise at night - fantastic. We took an evening Turna cruise with entertainment and dinner. Dinner was OK but entertainment was good. To see the Bosphorus at night with buildings and the fort lit up was wonderful. What a fantastic sight.
A different view of the city. A lovely way to see the city from the water. We took the Golden Horn cruise, having done the Bosphorous in the past and were not disappointed.

Amazing place. We took a cruise on the Bosphorus and were very happy we did. It is the best way to get a true perspective of how big Istanbul is and how it spans two continents, Europe and Asia. It has to be one of the busiest waterways for commercial shipping in the world and the sights are second to none
Bosphorus. Bosphorus very beautiful and you can see it from top mountain around it or next to it in the Restaurants or Cafesfurthermore, you can have cheap trip in Bosphorus

pleasant cruise, watch out for operator. a trip Istanbul would not be complete without a boat trip on the Bosphorus.there are many tour operators who offer that. we used Plan Tours/Gray lines and it turned to be probably the worst tour we have ever been in. the included a trip to Loti lookout to 'beef it up'. mistake! For 1 hour cruise we spent an additional 3 hours in transit ( traffic, waiting for groups, queueing up, walking through residential areas).If the Bosphorus cruise is what you want, best to make your way to the pier or choose an operator that has only that on the agenda.the cruise as such is pleasant, but again, check the boat. ours was mainly suited for lunches or dinners, with most seats facing inside. We had to continuously twist our necks to see the views. i just gave up after a while.

Woah. its a amazing to be in the place in person to admire the beauty of the place . we went on a boat excursion which was amazing . first time to see strait connecting Europe with Asia . the place is crowded ,Noisy but worth the visit

Marvelous. Marvelous sight, there's many Bosphorous trips but it's very hard to find a good one, don't trust anyone, only go with well known companies even if more expensive.
In the Bosphorus Strait you can see many icons of Istanbul like the Bridge, Dolmabahce, and even Sultanahmet Mosque ......

Crossing the Bosphorous. We took a trip across the Bosphorous with our tour guide from Experta, and enjoyed a delicious lunch on the aisan side of Istanbul.
It was a beautiful ride and a wonderful view of the 'old' city from the water.

unforgettable journey. A pleasant journey on a boat is a must do. You can see the city from a different point of view. Take a smaller boat as the big ones are too much crowde. People selling tickets on fair prices in Sultanahmet Square.

Good value. We took a boat tour to the eastern side. The boat tour was lovely our boat had a top deck which provided great views. The only downside was that once we arrived on the eastern side there were lots of people vying for your attention/custom and this wasn't very pleasant.

very interesting to make a trip on bosphorus. there is not much city in the world divided by sea strait.to ride a big public boat departing from eminönü and to look both side by drinking turkish hot black tea in months summer,spring or fall.must be done 100 things before you die.avoid small boats because in fall months strait would be rough currents and to much shaken in small boats.

Pearl Necklace. You go crazy all day long just because of bad traffic, crowd, rasping noises etc. You forget these stressful moments whenever you see the lights pretending like a pearl necklace all through Bosphorus. I believe that it is the best relaxing and refreshing place around the world if you have any chance to watch that beauty while you are sipping your drink

Nothing nicer than a trip on the river. Have done mini Bosphorus tours in the past with guests, but just as nice is simply catching one of the many ferries linking the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. Lovely to be out on the water, along with everything from tiny fishing boats to massive cruise liners and freight ships. Buy a simit for 1TL and feed the seagulls en route!

Connecting Asia and Europe . It was an amazing experience to travel through the boundary of Asia and Europe. Our was a evening trip with dinner ant Portaxe.The lit up view of two connecting bridge those connect Istanbul's Asian part to European part is amazing.. This is a busy water way with small yachts to big ship passing to and fro..Had an amazing evening..

Nice and relaxing boat tour. We tried out one of the many Bosphorus boat tours and even though there's not really a whole lot to see, we still enjoyed the opportunity to see the different sides of the city (i.e. Euro side vs Asian side).

You don't need reviews of this...just go.. If you remotely like history, you don't need me to tell you anything because you already know.If you don't, go for the views... see it many angles. Form Sultanahment, the Galata Tower, sunset on some rooftop, Kadakoy, Topkapi itself. If you don't want to splurge on a Bosphoros cruise, at least ride the ferry to Kadakoy and the from Uskadar back to the European side.

An Afternoon excursion. It houses some of the Most Expensive real estate in the world. You can choose to do a guided tour which highlights the different buildings r grab a guide book and take a public ferry, It is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon. The strait itself is incredibly busy with ferries, private boats and huge commercial ships.

Connecting Europe and Asia. Impressive. I was amaised by the traffic on the strait. It's like a highway for ships, big ships. There is a bridge over the strait, connecting Europe and Asia. But it's not very well connected to the public transport. Give yourself suficient time if you want to cross it.
East meets West. Very cool to grab a ferry or take a boat cruise on. You can go to the Asia side and spend time if you like. The cruise along both sides is pretty and there are lots of photo ops.
A very pleasent way to spend a day. I did a cruise down the Bosphorus and I loved it. It has such a pretty coastline with mansions, palaces and normal life.

Don't miss a boat ride on the Bosphorus. We took a boat ride on the Bosphorus with our guide, Lale, from KSG tours. We left from the European side and glided along as Lale explained what we were seeing along the shore. We disembarked on the Asian side. We learned alot of history of Istanbul as we cruised by buildings, old fortresses, and under bridges. It is a great way to see more of Istanbul.

Hystori, crimes. An excellent walk in Istambul in the evening.. we kind of felt the "heart"of the city. Ok, I don't really like istambul but the hystori and it['s crimes are there arround you, at every corner. People are colourfull.. they are nice but they are very bold.. eager to enter into yours attention. I think that they do not know what is the meaning of "to |walk". They usually have something to sell or something to say about sports.
A Highlight of our Istanbul Adventure. Our boat trip along the Bosphorus Strait was one of the highlights of our trip to Istanbul. Beautiful sights along both sides of the strait.

Boat trip. We did a boat cruise along the Bosphorus Strait as part of our tour and found this to be an eye opener. Commentary on the boat was good explaining the different sides and plenty of interesting places to see. Tea and coffeee available on board

beautiful at night. Went to the Eminonu pier and took a boat trip across Bosporus for one hour, it costs 12 lira per person.You have to pay in cash, Istanbul card not accepted. It was a beautiful and relaxing experience.

Take a boat ride. boating on the Bosphorus was on our to do list. The guide pointed out many historical palaces and other spots of interest as we cruised along. The drinks they offered for sale were way over priced, and when no one bought anything, they cut the prices in half.

Better on your own. The travel through Bosforo is nice but if you take an excursion it may take a long time while they fetch people in every hotel if you are among the first, you will loose around 2 hours on the bus. The lunch is forgettable. After the Bosforo trip, they take you to tha Bazaars. Better if you can do it on your own!
it was a nice journey. it was a nice journey a advice you to take it from Sultanahmet and eat before it a fresh grilled fish sandwich so you can have a juice or a tea in your journey

Very nice way to spend an evening and see more of the City. We took a dinner cruise on the Bosphorus. We really enjoyed it. We had so little time in Istanbul that night was a great time to get on the water. The dinner cruise provided beautiful night views of the strait and we experienced some Turkish culture as well.

If you love boats then hop aboard. Take a boat ride and see all the interesting castles, government buildings and boats in the bustling port area. Wonderful was to see the city. The bridges have colored lights at night.

Gilligan less 1 hour. We took the Sehir Hatlir (government transport co - SH) 2 hour Bosphorus tour for 12 Turkish lira on a relatively fast, clean, safe and efficient ferry from Eminonu pier past the 2nd bridge and return. Great views on both sides, highly recommended.

Two Continents - beautiful waterway. On a beautiful morning, our tour group had a private trip on the Bosphorus. Our guide pointed out all the places of interest along the way, including the beautiful Dolmabahce Palace right on the water, along with stunning houses and Roman walls on both sides. We travelled down the European side first, turned around and then looked at the Asian side. Our cruise lasted one and a half hours, but did not include a meal. However, drinks were brought around for sale. A beautiful way to see both sides of the Bosphorus.

Beating heart of the city. We've spent five nights in Ortakoy, at the bank of the strait, watching to ferry boats, sea tankers, looking at the amazing bridge, turning into a light show at night. You can only understand Istanbul if you have spent sufficient time at and on the Bospurus strait

Magical evening.. We were fortunate to book a 4 hour dinner and cruise along the Bosphorus one magical evening not knowing what we were in for. The dinner was good with unlimited drinks supplied all night and we met some great people. ...now friends ! The lighting from all the palaces, castles, mosques and the bridge along the Bosphorus ensured some superb photography of Istanbul.

Sit back and enjoy the view. Cruising the Bosphorus was one of the best experiences of my last trip to Istanbul. The weather was beautiful, sunny with a slight breeze, and it was so relaxing to just lounge on the top deck of the boat and watch the gorgeous scenery glide by. I got to see aspects of the city I wouldn't have discovered otherwise, such as the very upscale residential areas inhabited by Turkish media stars and CEOs and the graceful old yalis of the Asian side. I even picked out a couple of dream houses, should I happen to win the lottery. Definitely worth the time.

Beautiful Historic Waterway. A cruise on the Bosphorus and the straights are a must for every first time visitor, especially. You see the busyness of a city which bridges Europe and Asia and can appreciate the long history, beauty and culture.

Relaxing mini cruising to see this lovely city. If you can, choose the cruise which includes the Dolmabahce Palace as this museum-like building is a-must-see place in Istanbul. During the cruise, you pass by this building then later, you will visit the place. It's a nice finish after enjoying the equally beautiful Bosphoris Strait.
Carefull who you going with. Be careful when booking, if you want to go all the way to the Black Sea, book official boat don't take any offer from tourist attractions, they just go half way
Let me take you on a sea cruise. Take IDO (E-do) seabus express. Best way to get to Kadikoy and back. Less then 20 minutes across the bay in comfort. Staff very helpful.
Touristy but worth it. Highly recommend a private Bosphorous Cruise, especially at sunset. Very romantic and so many beautiful palaces and mosques on the shores.
Cruise Ship Version. Although we only saw this from our cruise ship, the scenery is stunning. If you have the time take a dinner cruise. I wish we had been able to.

Galata bridge and fish Restaurants . Nice whether and from the bridge you cas see emasing historical places and there are hundreds of mens fishing on the bridge.
There are three boats used as fish grilling restaurants offering fresh and simple fish sandwich

Along the Bosphorus Strait you can see many attrations. There are a number of ferry boats that have tours in the Bosphorus Strait. It is a nice way to see the major sites from a different perspective. At night it is particularly interesting

special view EAST/WEST divide. The Bosphorus Strait is what divides the West from the East. When you cross the bridge you will get to Asia which is quite cool. Anyways, the view on the strait is superb. There are quite good restaurants on that area and you can also walk for a long strip looking to Asia. At Dusk the scenery is gorgeus and the lights of Kenpiski hotel mix up with the blue background and the colorful lights of the bridge, so your photos will be indeed very interesting. It's a nice location for a run if happens that you stay nearby. There are some marks on the floor so you can track you running or walk. Good place for a quick walk after dinner in one of many good restaurants on the area.

Excellent cruise, good value. Lovely 90 minutes cruise. Really nice cool air breeze, plenty to see.Easy and quick to buy tickets (12 TL) at boat, river bank. Cheaper than buying from pestering promoters near the Blue mosque.

Take a few hour cruise!. We found a cruise with our hotel that went right up to the black sea. Great views, different way to see the sights and rest your feet. There are people swimming, but I wouldn't in Istanbul because of the trash and pollution.
Istanbul overlook. Must see. This is the best tour to overlook Istanbul along Bosphorus channel, especially at the Eurasian strait.
Night Cruise. You have to do a night cruise on the Bosphorus. Magical and spectacular! Did this as an excursion from a cruise ship but I am sure Viator has availability.

A rather expensive evening Bosphorus cruise & an inexpensive Strait crossing--to the wonderful Asian side of Istanbul. My 82-year-old mother and I bought an evening cruise over the Bosphorus from the hotel. To me, it was good although a little pricey (EUROS60/person). We got a hotel pick-up, a nice cruise with on-board dinner (average taste & portion; not enough free healthy drinks), rather slow service, interesting shows (e.g. very good belly dancing... BUT sitting at the back, we couldn't see so well and they could be repetitive!). However, all in all, the whole experience was valuable.Then, I took her on the Kadikoy ferry--to the Asian side of Istanbul. The boat to the other side was good and air-conned, but the one coming back wasn't all that good. My mother loved the experience and we paid only 4 lyras each for each way (8 lyras X 2 for the whole trip!). There was a kind ASK ME volunteer named Sema who gave us excellent information on how to cross the Bosphorus and helped us buy the tokens. Also, on the way to the Asian side, my mother started talking with one gentle Turkish lady and in the end we exchanged our email address. We had a very fresh fish and cheap lunch that day. On the last day, my mother wanted to do the crossing again but unfortunately we didn't have the time. But I must say that the people on the Asian side seemed to be more hospitable and sincere.

Cruising the Bhosphurus. A unique experience, a cruise on the Bhosphurus let's you sea both the European and Asia side of Istanbul.Starting at The port of Kabatas, 2 mins from the Dolmabachie Palace, the cruise takes you alond the Bhosphurus and under the Bhosphurus Bridge, stopping off at local ports to embark or disembark to see the siights.

Crossing continents. The Bosphorus Straight is initially just another piece of water but when you realize that it separates two continents then it starts to become a bit more impressive. It is worth crossing either by ferry or by walking across the bridge. Top tip, if you chose the ferry queue up and buy a ticked from the stall, do not buy a ticket from one of the touts as you will get ripped off. Once across the straight the Galatta Tower is easily identifiable and is a short walk from the ferry terminal. You also get a different view of Istanbul from the Northern side of the straight and therefore a couple of different photo oppertunities

Good Welcome. First thing I did when I arrived at the city was to take a cruise on the Bosphorus. It was a good introduction for me. I realized city is much more bigger than I thought. I took one of the public ferries taking off from Kabatas. My cruise lasted about 80 minutes. No recordings or narration was available. Next time I will take the longer cruise offered by the city from Golden Horn.
Wonderful. A wonderful experience cruising down the Bosphorus Strait. Like taking a cruise down the years of history.

Memorable experience. Take the Marmaray train to the Asian side of the city and then hop on a boat. You can use your Istanbulkart (contactless public transport payment card) and get a really great trip back to the European side (or vice versa). Lovely way to travel on a hot day.

Gorgeous Day tour by boat. we had a gorgeous day tour by boat of the beautiful Bosphorus strait and lunch onboard, while we admired the incredible homes and architecture of Istanbul, wonderful tour and visit. Also tours available at night and the city, and Bosphoros are mesmerizing in its evening beauty

An itmportant body of water that you can cruise, travel and admire. We took a night time Bosphorus cruise. We bought our tickets from one of the ferry companies for a 9:30 cruise. While this was not an exclusive or action packed cruise, they did give us a verbal guided tour of the special sights and bridges of the Bosphorus.
