On land, we watched locals fish from the bridges at night The Bosphorus is a special and strategic place and is the life blood of Istanbul. However you see it, it is very special

Scenic from land, scenic from sea. We arrived by ship with great views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. From Topkapi Palace and the city views of the straight and its bustling traffic are marvelous. The shore sights of palaces, private mansions representing some of the most valuable property in the world, and the bridges connecting Europe with Asia make for a great boat ride

A Feast for the Eyes. Wow! We took a cruise along the Bosphorus, a mix of beauty and history, and fell in love. It was...magical, or, at the very least, romantic. The strait is quite long; its hilly shores offering up historical treasures like the stunning Dolmabahce Palace and Beylerbeyi Palace, an array of mansions in various architectural styles on both the European and Asian sides, trendy mega-clubs, and the haunting Maiden's Tower set atop a rocky outcrop at its entrance. I say, sit back, relax, and don't miss the view!

The gateway to Asia!. One of the places we all hear and read about in history and geography, the link between Europe and Asia! The river is huge and there is an unbelievable amount of river traffic both day and night. Nine million Turks live and Europe and 6 more in the Asian part of Istanbul. Took a nighttime river cruise that was a little pricy, but worth every penny just experience being on the river, especially at night. The views were worth every penny!

A good way to relax and to enjoy the view. The trip with the boat was worth it! It's like 20 min a boat ride, you can see both sides, the boat wasn't full, you can take a lot of pictures, it's peaceful. I would totally recomand to anyone who goes to Istanbul! Make sure you will not miss it!

Wonderful half day journey. This amazing journey especially to kids and family stunning views throughout the journey the old cassle at end of journey with sea food restaurants a nice day experience highly recommend.
Busy Strait. This straight is so busy with ships and boats, it's full on. Well worth the ferry trip to see how much activity there is.

A gate to Europe and Asia. A Strait that divide Europe and Asia continent. Can see different kind of view from different side of the Strait. Experiencing Turkey's historical sight through the Bosphorus cruise.
Great fun. It is wonderful cruising in the Bosphorus Strait and visiting the islands there and sampling the fares available. You can go from one to another. Great fun if you have time on your hands

Bosphorus Cruise is a must do !. We took the short Bosphorus Cruise from Kabatas. They have one tour at 1030 hrs and then from 1245 they have a trip every hour till 1845 hrs. The trip lasts under two hours and takes you just after the second bridge and goes quite close to the shore. There are stops made at Besiktas & Bebek on the European side and Kandilli & Beylerbeyi on the Asian side.A super way to see istanbul.

Interesting cruise. Its good to see Asia on one side and Europe on the other. You will come across some amazing sites and offcourse Europe's most expensive hotel. The place offers a place where you will find Turkey's rich people's villas.Its interesting.

Europe meets Asia..and what a view!. Just a caveat before I tell you the good news..there are some tour boat operators who are not going to give you good value for money...they run cheap tours in barely sea worthy rust buckets and are severely over priced. If they come begging you to take a tour, promising this and that..and make you feel hussled avoid them like the plague!Now the good news...the sights to be seen along the Bosphorus from the Karaokoy, Eminonu, area, past Galata Tower, Fatih mosque, Sultanahmet, Ciragan Palace, the Golden Horn up to Bebek and back along the Asian side are really worth the excursion fare. Istanbul has a spectacular skyline best appreciated by boat, especially on a warm and sunny day. Words will not do it justice. Best to look and book for one of the Hop Off Hop On tours that let you get off and wander in some of the more scenic and historic areas for 45 minutes until the next boat comes..all for one ticket price. And for pure romance you can always take a sunset tour so you will be charmed by the (many colored) lights of the big city and historic palaces..and the bridges...with the moon above.If you are looking for terrific camera shots..hoping to maybe see a dolphin or two frolicking in the straits, love seeing the big ships, and have a passion for beauty in architecture then DO definitely take the long, leisurel Bosphorus tour.

A commuter ferry is a tourist cruise!. Our tip - take one of the commuter ferries from the main ferry terminal. Will cost only a couple of dollars, there is a cafe on board, and will save the outrageous cost of some of the more established tours.

Best by Boat.. The best way to visit it is by using a boat service who will show you the most important things to visit at Istanbul from an unique perspective. The ride is about 11 Euros par person, if they ask for more than you must negotiate the price. It is worthy.

Boring. We had heard from a lot of people and guide books that you haven't really seen Istanbul unless you do a cruise on the Bosphorus. Load of nonsense. We did a 90 minute cruise. The best part of it is leaving the port in Eminonu as you do get a nice view of the city from there. For the next 85 minutes though you're just seeing the same thing over and over - building after building after building. There's nothing interesting about it. I wouldn't waste my time on this. There's no need to do a cruise to fully see or experience the city.

Most beautiful place on earth. Excellent place to spend time, holiday, Sunday in Istanbul when the traffic on the roads are constantly and increasingly overloaded. Most beautiful sea-land scenary in the world.

Research the Ferry System. Research the Ferry system before you leave. Do the 2 hour tour first and then choose where you will go back too. Ask for directions to the ferry you want to use, there are so many going to different locations, it is difficult to just "wing it".Best way to travel, fast, comfortable and value for money.

Beautiful way to enjoy two. Ontinenta. We took a full day cruise on the Bosphorus all the way to the Black Sea. If you have the time, this is a splendid way to enjoy being in Asia and Europe. The scenery is spectacular. Especially enjoyed crushing under the new bridge that is under construction!

Nice Break from the Bustle of the city. We took the hop on, hop off Bosphorus boat tour. It was a pleasant way to see both the European and Asian side of Istanbul. It was a bit crowded at times but people were pleasant about giving you space to take pictures.

A Boat Ride is a Must. A boat ride is a must and a 90 minute one is alll I suggest for most people as it is long enough to see the area. I had planned a 6 hour one in the future but do not think most people wold like unless you wanted to say you when to the Black Sea on wanted to have lunch in the small fishing town where you stop for 2 hours.

Brilliant Views. We took a boat trip down the straights and it was well worth it. On either side the views are just stunning seeing both the old and the modern plus one minute you are viewing Europe and the next you are viewing Asia. These trips are very inexpensive and well worth taking time out of your day to do

Experience the Bosphorus by Boat!. Definitely take a Bosphorus cruise. We took a 4 hour lunch cruise, which was quite reasonably priced as it included a buffet and a 30 minute stop at Anadolu Kavagli.

Beautiful way to see instanbul and a wonderful sunset. What a wonderful boat trip this was - Istanbul is a stunning city and being able to capture its beauty from a boat was great. We were also lucky enough to have been able to watch a beautiful sunset whilst on the bosphorus. It was very chilly so make sure you wrap up warm

on the water. much of the old city was designed to be viewed from the water, displaying the opulance and power of istanbul, seeing the city this way is great to do very early in your stay, because it help you stay oriented and doesn't take any leg worka great many private boat tours are available, some are quiet competitivefor the more experienced traveller however I would suggest taking the public ferry, you can zig-zag up the waterway or take any combination of trips, all costing only 4TL maidens tower has it's own small ferry, but you get a good look at it from the ferries that pass close by

All-day cruise well worth it. We had a beautiful day for our day-long Bosphorus cruise-it's a long hike up to Koros Castle (last boat stop) but the views are well worth it! Sit on the same side of the boat both ways so you can see the views on each side of the straits.

Natural Wonder. The Bosphorus Strait is a channel of water between the Black Sea and the Mediterranean Sea. It is used as a shipping route, and splits the city of Istanbul. A boat tour up to the Black Sea is one of the highlights of an Istanbul trip.

A happening place. A fantastic busy waterway. Take the time to sit on the bridge have a beer or Turkish coffee and watch the waterway full of ferries, small boats, passenger liners and cargo ships. Be surprised by the splash in the water as local men take to the sea for a cool down. Take a cruise down the Bosphorus Strait, Marramar Sea out to the Black sea.

The best part of the city!.... Boğaziçi Kıyısı...İstanbul Bosphorus is one of the most important sights of the world!..If you take a tour by any of the boats available,then you will see and understand much better about its real face.Amazing scenery with many historical and old villas,mosques,palaces on both sides of the Bosphorus will also give you some important information about it.Strongly recommended.

Up close and personal.. A lovely boat ride up and down the Bosphorus River (with breakfast provided) was a lovely and relaxing way to see both the Ottoman and Asian sides of Istanbul. Incredible architecture on both sides of the river and a sneak peak of the Istanbul history.
Take a boat ride!. Great views of the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. Calm and relaxing trip. You'll also be able to see most of the historical sites in Istanbul.

A Must Do In Istanbul. A must-do in Istanbul is to get out onto the Bosphorus Strait. You can get on one of the local ferries or do a sightseeing boat tour. Having a guide or guide book (such as Rick Steves') that explains what you're seeing is helpful. Try to stop on the Asian side of Istanbul for a meal.

Bosphorus, the pearl necklace of Istanbul. Located between Asia and Europe this strait is one of the beautiful spots in the world. Take a boat tour starting from Karaköy on the Marmara Sea towards the Black Sea. On the way one can see beautiful summer houses (Yalı : Houses by the sea, Köşk: Mansions build away from the sea) of the Ottomans.

Amazing cruise along the Bosphorus Strait. Truly amazing experience, you see both Europe and Asia and they serve food and drink on the cruise, approx. 4 hrs and top it off with a bit of song a and dance ..

Cruising away the day. Cruising along both during the day and night is a relaxing and peaceful way to see the sights of Istanbul from the water. If you want a commentary hire the headphones otherwise sit back relax and enjoy the view.

Joyful Cruise. My family and I decided to take a cruise and enjoy the calm waters of the bosphorus strait. Our 2 story boat was very cosy and classy. It was a private cruise, though u can take theirr water taxi or a group cruise for a cheaper price. The ride lasted around 2.5-3 hours. The view was lovely with many coffee shops/restaurants situated along both sides of the bosphorus strait. You can also see many houses and villas built along side one part of the bosphorus with houses and villas built all the way up on the hills and surrounded by huge trees and greenery. You will definitely feel envious of such residents and owners. Some passengers on other boats will wave at u and u'll wave back which always makes us smile. The weather was great because it was close to sunset and the sun wasn't blazing hot. When u reach back, u'll find boiled corn sellers which is just what u need after a long ride.

DOLPHINS MAKES DREAMS TRUE!. Was there with wife for vacation and we got tickets for boat (for about 30 people and only 10 people was on boat).Very nice boat ride showing gorgeous views and if you have good camera you can make very nice pictures.Boat makes one stop for about hour at river cost with number of restairants and you can enjoy with Mediterranean food.Only 12 Euro for 2-3 hours of amazing boat travelIf you lucky then you can see dolphins. They brings happines and luck!

Beautiful canal between the two continents in one country. Beautiful canal between the two continents in one countrySunrise and sunset from the Black Sea to the Aegean, the strait that divides the city in two continents. Where you can take beautiful night on a cruise ship with sea and city views from historic sites and beauty more. I recommend not miss the sunset Phosphorus Strait.This castle is another attraction of the gorge many legends have been told about it.

Great views from the bridge of our Cruise ship. Only way to appreciate the Bosphorus is to travel through on a cruise ship, ( we were on the Emerald Princess) really is quite a sight to view the only city in the world that spans two continents!

Make a river cruise one of the first things you do. Getting on a river cruise of the Bosphorus is the best way to soak in the city during your early days. Try and make this a summer activity, it wasn't very nice the first time I did it in November.

Bosphorus Strait. Important waterway to the Black Sea. We took boat tour partially up the Bosphorus Strait. Gives you a feel for the area. Able to see the palaces and mosques which are by the water's edge.

Good chance to see the Yelkouan Shearwater. There are any number of boat trips up the straight. We took the hop on hop off for a 2 hour trip. It was pleasant and gives you several opportunities to see Yelkouan Shearwaters but you do have to keep your eyes pealed for them. Only one of three flocks came close to the boat. Do not attempt to eat any of the food or drink offered to you on the boat. My son got the poops from the orange juice offered.
Bosphorus Strait. It is very disturbingly to follow the strait observing the European coast on the one hand and Asian with another.

An excellent way to get a feel for Istanbul. Every first trip to Istanbul should include a cruise on the Bosphorus where you can not only get a totally different appreciation for the many parts of Istanbul but also be in between Europe & Asia! I would recommend a cruise that provides commentary on the sights and history.
Great way to start your trip.. Great views of the European and Asian sides of the country. Calm and relaxing tour in cruise boat. You'll also be able to see historical sites.
Take a boat ride.. Take a boat ride up or down the Bosphourus.....Really fantastic way to see different areas of the city and lots of different cultural hot spots.
stanbul in 1 day. Istanbul sits on both sides of the Bosporus Straits. Europe is on the west side, Asia is on the east side. Take a boat ride up the Straits.

The All Day Cruise. The day long cruise is very special. The extra 10 lira for headphones is worth it. You would not understand what you are seeing if you don't have them. The boats are well equipped and comfortable. They stop for over two hours at the north end, near the Black Sea. You have that time to explore an old fort, have lunch, or simply wander. The cruise begins as a pier near the Galata Bridge.
By boat. We really liked the tour for 12 Lira but you should not expect more than just a boat trip on the strait. Refreshing and interesting.
Great Experience. What a feeling to be cruising on the Bosphorus. We really enjoyed it. Would recommend to everyone. Like the fact that it felt really relaxing.
enjoyable suitable for kids and adults. wonderfull ride would advise to go on the long tour to anadol agave where you end up overlooking the black sea.
View it by sea. We did a boat trip and it was worth every penny. Took lots of photos. It is very interesting to see where two continents face each other. This trip is a must

Great cruise on the public ferry. We took the round trip cruise to Anadolu Kavagi on the public ferry from Eminomu and enjoyed it a lot. The cruise to AK is about 2 hrs, we spend about 3 hrs there and then the cruise back was about 2 hrs. We got to see beautiful homes, palaces, Rumeli fortress, the Ortakoy Mosque from the boat. It was a good break from the crowds in Istanbul. I would recommend this trip over the cruises offered by travel companies. It was only 25 TL ( $10) per person and the boat was very clean, with comfortable seating.
Terrible Tour. You cannot hear the information very well from the people selling or offering tours. I don't think I would recommend this.
Bosporus Straits. I love to just sit and watch the ferries..and other vessels ply the waters here...and the background view is unrivaled. The sense of history... and the future is all around you!
Nothing better than a boat trip on the Bosphorus. A ferry fide up the Bosphorus is a treat. A must for a cooling,calm break on a hot day. Beautiful palaces, Ottoman houses, mosques along the way.

Afternoon cruise on Bosphorus Strait. Bosphorous strait divides Asian and European side of Turkey. It also connects the black sea and sea of Marmara. We took an afternoon cruise on the Strait. It got a little hot in the boat as we took an afternoon cruise but it was still very enjoyable. Our boat docked at end of Bosphorous strait and we were able to swim in the calm waters. Wonderful experience.
plz visit. it is the main tourist attraction of istanbul, turkey. so plz enjoy the scenic beauty. plz take a day cruise around 7:30 pm. really worth payee.

beautiful scenery. a really great experience. Beautiful scenery with fascinating sights on both sides of the Bosphorus. Excellent boat trips on either public ferries or private boat tours.The Hop On, Hop Off boat trip is an excellent idea - it allows one to hop off the boat at sights like the Dolmabace Palace or other palaces, plus towns on the Asian side of the Bosphorus. A really wonderful experience - not to be missed.!

Read your ancient history first. Lots of pretty things to look at, but to us the most important aspect of it was to get a feel for the physical space in which so much history and mythology takes place. We took the shorter cruise and I think it was enough.

Loved to watch the boats. Loved to watch the numerous tankers and other boats navigating the Bosphorous. Take a ferry ride across to the Asian side. They leave from the Galata Bridge and round-trip is about an hour and a half.

Breathtaking. Loved it. Well worth it. Enjoyed seeing the beautiful homes, seeing both continents was incredible. Cruised the Bosphorous both on the big cruise ship and a smaller boat which served lunch. Take it all in.

Do not miss this. Taking a cruise on the Bospherous is a "must do" in Istanbul.
Take a cruise that goes up to the black sea and do swim in this sea as this opportunity comes once in a life time.

Breathtaking views. We do the Bosphorous boat trip every time we visit Istanbul.
It is the perfect way to take postcard photo's or to entertain a guest or just enjoy with your partner...
Wish we could live in one of those beautiful homes lookong across the Bosphorous.
Enjoy with a turkish tea or cold drinks!

A great experience . Had been to Turkey for a family holiday with my wife and two grown up sons and Istanbul did cast a magic spell over me... As a traveler who has travelled almost around the world Istanbul has its own charm and the visit to Istanbul is incomplete without this cruise trip over the Bosphorus.The trip was superb experience.
Dr.Javed Rasheed

Great Tour . It was a great boat. Saw a lot of great views and on the stop we had a great lunch (lots of restaurants to choose from but I recommend the seafood) and bought some nice souvenirs from the shops. Greatly recommend it.
Lovely!. Love that there are so many places along the Strait to have an amazing Turkish coffee, meals, shopping, parks, mosques, etc... an eyeful of beauty
Worth the time. Book a tour. We'll run, informative and a great way to spend 5 hours. You can see what makes the Bosporous special

istanbul from the water. loved seeing the view of the city from the boat
should have choosen to sit on the left side closer to the shore as the boat went clockwise round the harbour
found it difficult to hear the tour guide as the speaker near us was not on.

Take a boat Trip or Stroll around it. If you in Istanbul, take time out and just sit and see life go around this place, you can take a trip on a boat. Do visit the boats selling fish burgers, sunset is a beautiful time to visit and take pictures.
Bosphorus Boat tour. Enjoyed every minute of our our bosphorus tour hier, feed the birds and enjoying the sun,tour costs only 10 lira

Easy to explore using the great ferry system in Istanbul. A beautiful water way which is worth exploring using the various ferry/ boat options available to you. We caught a number of ferries during our stay crossing over to explore different parts of the area. One not to be missed is the ferry ride over to Princess Island or Büyükada, the Biggest of the Princes’ Islands Take the tram to Kabataş and walk over to the ferry terminal where ferries leave to the different islands.

Eminonu in the evening of Seker Bayrami. was as crowded as crowded can be. And yet, there was nothing but joy and good cheer all around. Even managed to get to the boats for a yummy fish sandwich. Trams were crowded both ways but there was not a sign of stress. Congratulations to the Istanbulites.

A must see in Istanbul!. No trip to Istanbul can be complete without a boat trip down the Bosphorus strait!
Enjoy your tea or coffee whilst admiring the beautiful Istanbul skyline. Try to hire a guide or take a boat which provides information on the different sights you are seeing.

Refreshing river cruise to see Asia and Europe together. We bought full day tour for 70 Euro per person. It started with Bosphorus strait. What a beautiful ride it was. From river you can see the both Asian and European part of Turkey which is rare. The historic places Blue Mosque, Top Kapi, Palaces, forts you can see. But, the most nice thing was the blue river and wonderful breezes...
Must go!!. The bosphorus strait is something you need to do. Take a boat, any of the ferries and take a ride from the west Istanbul to the east and you will not regret it.

The view of Istanbul from the water is stunning. We jumped on a very inexpensive boat near the Galata Bridge. I think it was 12 Euros. It was the perfect way to see how giant and busy and beautiful and impressive Istanbul is. We had a map so that we could pick out significant buildings. The bridges are beautiful and the Bosphorus is full of all kinds of ferries and tankers and pleasure boats and ships all zooming along. It was also a nice way to cool down. I think it took about 2 hours for the whole trip. It was well worth it.

Boat Tour - nice way to explore Istanbul!. Istanbul is a huge city and has many things to offer which could easily overhelm with choices. Therefore, take a step back and explore the city by boat from a distance. It offers a nice new view!

Asia on one side, Europe on the other!. Unique waterway that embraces Istanbul and connects it to Mediterranean sea at one end and the Black sea at the other. Take a refreshing ride on a regular public ferry or a commercial one. Love this waterway!

something magical. this clear blue stretch of water defines Istanbul and sets it apart from many other great cities of the world. with the ferries and cargo ships traversing constantly, it gives Istanbul not only some cooling breezes but a dynamic that just cant be achieved in land locked cities. even the cry of the gulls overhead add to the complex flavour that is Istanbul.

Trip down Bosphous. Great way to gain a sea view of this fascinating city that spans two continents. You can buy a ticket for 12 Turkish Lira for a one and a half hour ride. Please take guide book to point out the important landmarks along this special body of water, a Strait

Gateway to Europe. It is one of the important way of trade in the past until now and it was caused wars. itis between Asia & Europe. i Enjoy cruise in the Bosporus but the price expensive however great view. There are different kind of cruise like trip to Bursa,Princess Island,tour for two hoursuse boat as taxi.

Nice boat ride. We did this with a tour, not worth it, it's a boat ride with English narration so you don't need to pay someone to take you. It was a nice cool hour 1/2 on a boat. It would have been nice to jump off and jump back on but we stayed on the whole time.

do a boat cruise, its refreshing!. we enjoyed the cruise with europe on one side and asia on the other! on the way back we hopped of at Ortakoy village impusively and then realised that i had left my driving licence as security deposit, at the Galata quay against the audio guide! however, we really enjoyed Ortakoy and then had to take a cab back to Galata bridge to reddem my licence!!! it became an adventure! would highly recommend the cruise and Ortakoy for a beer and food pitstop! the blue of the bosporous is enchanting!

Gateway to Europe. The Bosphorus Strait comes with a price. It cost wars back in earlier days. These days, it is thousands of dollars for a plane fare to Istanbul. Waking up to this every morning is definitely worth every penny. Cay on the ferry is the best way to enjoy this view.
Worth a trip on the boat- 1.5 hours to see both European and Asian side.. Worth a boat trip- you see more of the architecture at a slower pace giving you more time to absorb the beauty of this city
Worth the half day tour. Got to see all the sights on both coastlines from Istanbul to the second Bosphorus bridge where we made the U turn. The July weather was gorgeous!

The border between Asia and Europe. The waterway is busy and historic - the views of Aya Sophia and other historic buildings is impressive. But I'd rather be in the buildings than just see them from afar...

Bosforus cruise. The view is amazing , we took one of the boats that sail along the strait and stops for a few hours at the end form the Black Sea. Unfortunately , the restaurants in Anadolu Kavagi are extremely expensive and not at all clean! We recommend the cruise , but take some food with you and have a picnic up at the castle! Do not accept the persistent offer of the restaurants! You will pay a high price for being disappointed !

Beautiful. Amazing experience. The strait is stunningly beautiful with so many historical building along the way.I went there at winter time and as solo traveler. I contacted my local agent and asked to be put in a group to take the tour with other solo travelers, so I did not have to pay very expensive tour. Ask your agent if you want to take the tour with other solo travelers, so you can be in one group.

Cross from Asia to Europe. Loved the local ferries and good to go across to have a meal. But they finish early in the evening so check the time of return in the evening very careful. Good to walk from terminal back up to the main area of old Istanbul.

Nothing Great.. You visit the strait when you take the cruise. The cruise is strictly OK. You have the option of taking half day or a full day cruise. We found half day tour also too much as one gets bored. (Or probably my guide was not that good)

NIce waterfront. My family wondered around the busy waterfront area where the Bosphorus Strait meets the Golden Horn. There is lots of hustle and bustle ..... many nearby restaurants both under the bridges and along the waterfront. We enjoyed walking along the waterway (for a brief distance). The views of the city, all the boats and cruise ships, the historical buildings in the skyline..... a nice place for pictures and a stroll.

Breath taking. From Taksim there are buses (40 T by AKM building) that you can take or you can go to Kabatas by metro and from there almost all buses will drive in the road by Bosphorus.You can also take the Yenikapi-Haciosman metro from Taksim and change line by Sisli-Mecidiyekoy to drive over the Bosphorus bridge and go to the Asian side or to Moda park. There are plenty of bars, cafes and restaurant in Bosphorus strait or you can just walk along the strait and enjoy the view.

Total Waste of Time. Its like every other cruise. At one point I literally wanted to jump in the water and get off the boat- it was soooooo long.If it was shorter one- probably I would have liked it.TAKE A CARDIGAN- IT DOES GET REALLY WINDY AND COLD ONCE YOU ARE IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SEA..I wouldnt really recommend it if you have been to plenty other cruises.Rather go to some unexplored areas and try out new food.

A must do...so beautiful and refreshing. This is a must do. Take a tour through the public boats, as they are very reasonably priced. Private ships/yachts/ferries are ridiculously expensive. We were offered a trip for 90 euros per person (5 of us) for an hour and a half cruise on the Bosphorous, but the concierge at our hotel recommended the governmental boat-yard, and from here we spent only TL 45 for all of us. The boat was huge with leather seats on the top deck, and a nice air-conditioned sitting area in the bottom deck. We thoroughly enjoyed our almost two hour cruise. It is so beautiful and refreshing. It is also guided in the sense that announcements are made in Turkish and English about all the places of interest which are being crossed, both on the European and Asian sides. Also it has a few stops where one can hop on and hop off at no extra charge.A must do, but don't waste money on private boats etc. Also make sure to have your camera and phones ready for some amazing photos, while of course going on a bright , sunny day.

There's a perfect Bosphorus boat or ferry trip for all budgets & preferences.. You can take local ferries for 4TL (or use your IstanbulCard), you can pay for a romantic dinner cruise, or something else in the wide assortment and price-range of tourist cruises, or for 15TL you can take the hop-off/hop-on. But whatever you do, get out there on the water! This is not to be missed. It is relaxing and you will get unparalleled views of this magnificent City.
A must. Wow! What a way to see this beautiful city, except on a boat that only had 11 people. I would highly recommend this being on one of you top 10 things to do, when you visit Istanbul.
Beauty. What an absolutely beautiful place. The views are simply amazing. Take a cruise, take a ferry, walk along the edges just go,

Beautiful to look at or cruise on.... We did a sunset cruise on the straight for an hour and it only cost about $10 each. Food and drinks were available on board but cost a lot more. Easy to find, near the spice market.

Relaxing. A pleasant way to spend a few hours and see the city from a different perspective. The guide on our boat was not outstanding with both his English and knowledege - maybe we were unlucky. However the lunch was OK, but the stop at the village was too long.

Ferry from Europe to Asia. The longer cruises leave in the afternoon - and there are loads of people offering to sell you the best deal around the waterside. If you just want to see some sites - with a dash of local colour - hop on one of the commuter ferries that criss-cross all day long. It only costs TL6 each way and you can get chatting to locals.

Tarabya or bust!. There are multiple ways to view the Bosphorus Strait, including by boat (ferry or cruise) but one way I found on this trip was to take the M4 to the end of the line (Hacioman) and then walk down to the seaside at Tarabya. It's a pleasant little harbor town inside Istanbul's city limits...

The Bosphorus strait cruise : definitely a must. This is the cruise you really have to do while you are in Istanbul. You could see the old buildings in both sides, the asian and european side. You could see the birds try to catch the bread behind your boat from the back side of the boat. Definitely a must.

A fun ferry ride. See the city from a different point to view. Took this ride in the late afternoon and enjoyed the cooling off as well as the history being told to us as we rode. Went by the tower, glad we didn't make an effort to see that separately. The ride helped us make plans to see the Asian side.

Lower priority activity. I would rate this as a lower priority activity if you're pressed for time. While spending a day on the water during a Bosphorus Cruise sounds great and starting the day in Europe while eating lunch in Asia, the cruise was pretty ordinary and restaurants in Anadolu Kavagi are touristy and lower quality. If you do go, skip the restaurants at the port when you get off the boat. Do the hike up to the castle for great views then stop at the restaurants at the top of the hill.

Best views in and of the city!. Our boat tour of the Bosphorus Strait was part of a three-fold excursion including a bus ride around the Golden Horn and a half hour stop at the Spice Market. The Spice Market was very cool but the boat ride was the highlight. The water is clean and blue and the gorgeous buildings, hotels and palaces along the shore are, at times, stunning. This is a must do activity.

1 city, 2 continents. Cool.. the views from the Bosporus both on shore and from the water were spectacular. It was truly an inspiration to look at both Europe and Asia as we crossed on the ferry. It was amazing to me that I could be in the same city, but travel between 2 continents! the views were amazingly beautiful, the boat ride cheap and fast. Walking the shores of the Bosporus was also very unique. You could watch the boats or the men fishing. You could walk by restaurants and bars right on the water, and there were also some great parks along the water.

Cool place on a hot day. The division of Asia and Europe. The inexpensive (about 2 turkish lira .80 us) for the commuter ride. The crowds, the views, the gulls, the multiple ferries, fishing boats commercial, tankers, container vessels, how they maneuver around one another is amazing with 10-15 boats darting about. what Fun!

What a sight !. Few bodies of water in the world have the activity of this Strait, one that has the beauty of being able to see one of the world's metropolis from a vantage point that enriches the character of magnificent Istanbul. Enjoyed from one of the various hotels that have a terrace adjoining the water.
Amazing Experience. We took a short bosphorous stour by IDO till Prince's Island. It was very nice and enjoyable tour. Good for photographs.

Do not miss this when you visit Istanbul.. I always wondered what connected the Black Sea to the Mediterranean - this is an amazingly beautiful and busy waterway which is the focus of Istanbul. Should not be missed.

Water-way between old, new and Asian side.... During our stayed we visited the Asian side twice and also had dinner their one night. To be honest, we didn't notice any difference between the European or Asian Side except that the shopkeepers on Asian side are honest and charge you the real market price compared to touristic European side where they charge 2 to 3 times the prices you pay on the Asian side. I would suggest that rather than using expensive touristic boats/cruises; try using the public- water- transportation boats/ferries..to experience the life of Istanbul residents..

Well Worth the boat trip.. I visited Istanbul in August 2014 with friends. We debated whether to take a boat trip along the Bosphorus and were delighted that we decided to do so. The timing of our trip meant that the sun setting over the city provided a wonderful view of the blue mosque from the Bosphorus. Well recommended.
Great experience . Great experience and a must if you visit Istanbul, make sure you research with which co. you take your trip with. You can haggle with the private boats.

Yacht rental for Bosphorus cruising. On our last day in Istanbul we rented a yacht with captain and mate for a half day cruise along the Bosphorus and the Golden Horn. This gives a different perspective to the area, and the splendid sights are in all directions. The captain accommodated our suggestions, and provided an enjoyable morning of nautical sightseeing.
modern and ancient together. Is the best way to see how Istanbul combined the old,ancient architecture with the modern and the new conception of buildings,tourisms and travelling visits,....

Two continents separated, two cultures joined. Turkey is literally a bridge between Asia and Europe. Istanbul "Sehir hatlari" city boats zigzag up and down the Bosphorus. A ride from near the Galata Bridge to the Black sea and back is a nice trip. Best in the summer . Great value!

The water for a river in particular is clear blue green and a must see during your first or any visit. A cheap ferry ride by Turystol ferry is a pure pleasure on a sunny Istanbul day. To see the city and how it is built in both Europe and Asia on several sides of the Bosporus is magnificent from a boat. Their are 2 sides that encompass Europe split by the river. The modern Galata tower and Taskim square are on one side of the Galata bridge and Sultanahmet District and the spice market on the other side of the European Istanbul. Kadakoy with its open market and fish cafes are on the Asian side along with modern Istanas well. There are beautiful palaces and museums and castles along the banks for you to discover and houses and parks with great beauty as well. definitely do a Bosporus cruise!
Stunning!. A boat trip along the Bosphorus is an absolute must. It is truly beautiful. We took a half day tour as far as the Black Sea and while we loved Istanbul, this was the highllight of our trip

Amazing. The ride across this strait is absolutely stunning. The views on either side are just breathtaking. If you are in Istanbul, you should not miss it. It is value for money. Almost 90 minutes cruise, you get to see some nice monuments, scenery and you get ample opportunity for some nice clicks.

"Must Do". You haven't seen Istanbul properif you don't traverse the Bosphorus.The only question is which Ferry?Duration of cruise? Day or Night?We did a 2 Hour cruise and used the Ferry the locals usedand even got a discount with ourMuseum card.

Best first day activity. We took a boat tour up and down the Bosphorus. It was a great way to get a sense of scope of the city, and some of the amazing places to visit later on foot. Very relaxing, very cool. We even got to see some of the famous dolphins!

Great views of the waterway. Going on a boat along the Bosphorus was indeed a nice journey, we got to go twice so more fun. The buildings on either side depict history, in terms of old forts, churches, mosques and later period residential buildings.

Cruise with lunch. We signed up for a half day cruise with lunch. We had beautiful weather and a delicious lunch. We could not understand much of what was said over the loudspeaker, but enjoyed being on the water and watching the sights go by. This cruise let us off in a little village for ice cream and curios or you could chose to take a swim off the boat. Relaxing way to sight see.

Fantastic.. On a sunday this can get VERY busy with the number and variety of boats, ferries and cruise ships. It's busy everyday, but sunday seems to be manic...good to watch. but difficult to navigate.

Spend some time. This is one of the busiest shipping lanes I have ever encountered. Find yourself a good vantage point and a pair of binoculars and you can literaly spend hours just watching the comings and goings of thousands of ships.

Beautiful views on the city. I highly recommend seeing the city from the water. The Golden Horn and the Bosporus Strait are both of great historical importance and offer beautiful views on the city. The skyline of the old city area (Sultanahmet) shows the multitude of the minarets and at night, there's a beautifully lit city to see from here. You can do an evening cruise on Saturdays in Summer for only 20Tl (€6,66) that takes 5 hours and that takes you all the way north, almost to the Black Sea, stopping at a few stops, eventually stopping at the Asian side in a small fishing village called Anadolu Kavagi, where you can stay for about 2 hours to have dinner in one of the many fish restaurants. At around 22h30, the ferry takes you back to the city, so you can enjoy the city lights by night.

Great Boat trip. Went on a boat down the Bosphorus on a hot November Sunday,very cheap very interesting. We had a bit of hassel to buy tickets but you get hassel every where in Istanbul it,s part of the visit.We were on the boat for a couple of hours saw lots of sites took lots of photo,s.Would recommend it to anyone visiting,lots of boats to pick from.

Pick a good ferry and get the audio guide. Great views of blue waters, beautiful buildings and a Castle at the end! If you want to relax and see good sights, it's fantastic. For those with more curiosity, the audio guide, this might be a little dull, but skip the more prosaic parts about every random palace that you see; they burned down at one point, were owned by various important or semi-important people, now they are either a private museum or hotel. Focus on the mosques and castles for the best stuff. And make sure to book a ferry that stops at Castle Yoros!
Well worth the trip!. Take a boat ride on the mighty Bosphorus and see the magnificent domes and minarets from a completely different perspective, you won't be disappointed.
Must see. Both asia and europe on each side waiting for you, with old ottoman buldings just near the sea. It is an unblievable experience

Outstanding views, day and night. We took several ferry tours of the Bosphorous, The public transportation is very cheap, 4 TL normal price, 2.15 TL if you use the Istanbul Card. The commercial tour up and down the European and Asian coasts is also cheap, 12 TL for 2 hours. The night cruise with food and entertainment was OK, the entertainers were so-so, but we had dancing and singing until almost midnight under a beautiful Turkish moon. Highly recommended!
Take a cruise. Wonderful to take a boat along the Straits to see the historical buildings and modern mansions. Lots of traffic. Something is always going on.

Amazing. This is one of the most significant waterway on the planet for the economic development of the western world; and still is today. The history of this river dates back before the Romans. It is a MUST SEE.
Boat Ride. You can take a 1.5 hour ride from just across the Spice / Egyptian Market. Very nice ride on a sunny day. You do not have to get off the boat but you see many sites. Worth giong.

Must cruise while in Istanbul. If you have traveled to Istanbul- you have to do a bosphorus cruise. This strait is what makes Istanbul such an important city. Interesting to have Europe on one side and Asia on the other~

Pleasant Boat Ride. The boat ride was very pleasant. I recommend the upper deck under the shaded canopy. A good way to see the numerous historical and modern aspects of the strait buildings and bridges. Despite being one of the busiest shipping lanes in the world, the water seemed clean and nice. I great way to sit in a cooling breeze while touring the area.

Ferry cross the bosphorus. We wanted to go to the Asian side of Istanbul but any of the tours we checked out basically took you across the bridge stopped for a photo op and then headed back to the European side, so we took the ferry.The docks were an easy walk from the hotel and for 4TL per person, each way, we had a great open air, (on the upper deck), ride across the Bosporus. No tour guide but a great view and you can spend a much time as you want wandering the shops and restaurants of the Asian side of Istanbul.

Bosphorus ferry - historical splendour. This is such a must do - hop on a ferry for a 2 hour cruise or do the dinner option. I did a 2 hour ferry cruise as I was alone but it was incredible to see the hotels and luxurious resorts along the river banks. History abounds - to be part of the river, a hub of activity, ships, ferries, tourists and locals - awesome experience.

Mesmerising Boat Ride. I loved the 1.5 hours on the ferry down the Bosphorus Strait. The sun setting over the Bosphorous pours molten liquid over the buildings on both Asian and European side. Both the sides are lined with ancient and historically important buildings.

The best moment of the trip.. The Bosphorus Strait was the best visit of our trip. The boat takes you in a big tour around Bosphorus and you can see the whole city and its nature. Extra highly super recommended!

Scenic and Wonderful - 2 Continents!. When in Istanbul, you must take a water taxi/shuttle from the European Side to the Asian Side to truly appreciate the city and all that it offers. I recommend to sit outside with a cup of turkish tea, and just soak in your surroundings. It takes roughly 20 min and truly worth the trip. On your way you might see dolphins as well, which is an unexpected surprise! In addition you should also see the Maiden's Tower, very picturesque.

Our favourite part of our entire trip.. We took a private boat tour of the Bosphorus Strait and the beauty of the city we saw such as the Sultan's hunting lodge or any of the incredible building on both the Asian/European side of the strait are gorgeous but it is seeing the fortress walls all the way along the city that melds the past with the present and really make the Bosphorus magical. If you go to Istanbul you have to go do a boat tour of the strait.

An Amazing Spectacle. It is something you can enjoy from a seat on the promenade or from the deck of one of the many ferry boats which carve their way across what must be one of the busiest waterways in the world. You can book boat cruises and even dinner cruises on the Bosphorus. The traveller can go a short distance or follow it all the way to the Black Sea. We were lucky enough to cruise through it on an ocean liner. It was amazing! Photo opportunities at every turn: beautiful buildings, fabulous architecture, pretty vistas. We have now seen it from several of the perspectives which I listed above and have been spellbound by each. The best view, probably, is at night when many of the buildings are lit. See it from as many angles as possible.
blue, blue water.. a boat trip is a must, relaxing and very informative. the villas are amazing, clearly many very wealthy residents!

View two continents at the same time. We had three boat trips on the Bosphorus during our visit to Istanbul it was a fantastic experience each time. It is the perfect way to see so much of this amazing city. The Bosphorous is an incredibly busy area of water but no trip to Istanbul or Turkey would be complete without this experience. Watching the other boats and seeing both Continents at once is a chance of a lifetime.

Sailing on the Bosphorous - a Must Do!. What an amazing place is Istanbul, crossroads of East and West. There is no better way to appreciate its architecture and culture then a cruise down the Bosphorus. Fantastic photo opportunities!

Splendid Minus the Boat. The straight is incredible, dividing Istanbul between Asia and Europe. It is a must see, but definitely be mindful that many of those boats say that they have bathrooms but they mean Turkish bathrooms - the holes on the groud, which for women are hard to use, especially in a moving boat. There are amazing homes and a castle to see, a gorgeous bridge that connects both sides and makes for great pictures.

It's alright. This is the best part of the city. After beating hours upon hours of traffic you get to see this area of town which is fully developed with hotels and homes. Large boats pass at a regular constant pace.

Ahmet Denizci . You can't find anywhere to compare. Just see the bosphorus you will understand. The water is alive so the people. The city never sleeps so the bosphorus. Feel how the two continents get so close to each other and connected with two bridges. Istanbul is historical beatific city and the bosphorus the water between Black Sea and the Marmara sea.

Relaxing trip on the water!. This was a magical boat trip on the Bosphorus Strait. We leisurely saw the sights of Istanbul from the historic waterway. It was a beautiful day in September and so very relaxing and informative!

An enjoyable must do.. A pleasant cruise on the Bosphorus straight is very popular and worth doing. It is very closely link to the history of the area and town. Advance booking is also recommended due to its popularity.

Ho-Hum. Istanbul has SO many other historic and interesting sites. If you've already seen it all, and it's hot, and you want a refreshing break, then fine, hop on a boat and go for a short cruise. It is pleasant enough. The Bosphorus itself is a hugely interesting geographical phenomenon, but that can be well appreciated by looking at a map.

We took a relaxing 90 minute boat trip.... We liked what we saw, its lined either side with interesting architecture. You don't really get a feel from the boat for the Europe/Asia difference, but you can get ferries which stop regularly and you can get off and explore more, we just weren't there for long enough. what amazed me were the number and size of tanker and container vessels that travel along the Bosphorus.

Not to miss Trip. Weather was beautiful when we cruised on the ferry. One will get to see the European and 'Asian' sides of Turkey. Lots of beautiful historic sights to enjoy. My family thoroughly savored every moment of this trip.The downside is the cleanliness of the toilet in the ferry. One would have to hold their breath to do the personal necessity.
fantastic. Great to see the Asian and European side of turkey. i love the architectural designs of the buildings and the historic landmarks. i love to see the seagulls flying around the boat.

Travel between 2 continents. It is a unique occasion to take a ride on a ferry between 2 continents (Asia & Europe). The waters of the strait are traversed by numerous ferries. Two suspension bridges cross the Bosphorus and connects Asia and Europe and the third one is about to open.This is the world's narrowest strait used for international navigation, the Bosporus connects the Black Sea with the Sea of Marmara (which is connected by the Dardanelles to the Aegean Sea, and thereby to the Mediterranean Sea.)

Fantastic cruising views east and west. We took a 90 minute Hop On Hop Off ferry journey on a beautiful day, which made for spectacular views of the sights on the European coast as we cruised north to the Fatih Bridge, and then the Asian coast as we cruised south. While we did not get off, you had the option of stopping at some places to explore. A very cheap way to see the Bosphorous, and when the weather is good, it is very relaxing way to spend an afternoon. Very limited commentary, so it pays to have some information about the sights you will see along the way.

Relaxing cruise. We had an afternoon cruise along the Bosphorus Straight at the end of our visit to Istanbul and it was amazing.We had the Asian side one side of the Strait and the European on the other. It seemed to me that all the Universities and most hotels were on the European and the beautiful houses on the Asian. It is well worth the tour to get a prospectus of the area.
Busy, blue and beautiful!. Very busy with all the boats and ships, wonderful to behold, giving added wonder to an amazing city!

Afternoon cruise with lunch. Was a relaxing afternoon cruising the Bospherus. Were picked up from our hotel and after collecting other groups, were delivered to the ferry. There was an informative lady giving information about the sights over a speaker in English and German. Was a little difficult to hear on the top deck if too far away however. Lunch was a help yourself buffet and had a good selection on offer. We stopped at a small enclave for an hours wander or you could choose to stay on board and they take you out into the sea for a swim in the Black Sea. Not much to do at small place they stop, but we went for a wander around and the hour went fast. A lot of restaurants with eager owners trying to get your business.

Fantastic cruise. We took a cruise along the straits of bosphorus. It was a pleasant experience as the 2 hour cruise was a memorable journey for me. There were a lot to see along the sail and the scenary was fantastic and awesome. It was so beautiful and the weather was good. I love looking at both sides of the straits. Don't miss the cruise if you happen to be in Istanbul.

Fantastic!. I was here in early March for 1 day only and did this !.5 hour Bosphorus Cruise on the spur-of-the-moment....boarded at 5 minutes to 6 for the 6pm "sunset cruise"....15 TL . which is around $6. The view of Istanbul and the New Mosque, pulling out of the harbor is gorgeous.... we went under 2 beautifully-illuminated bridges...Dolmabahce Palace was all lit up...the moon rose as darkness fell.....you.could stay inside and drink chai, or wander on the deck for unobstructed views....a Bosphorus cruise is a wonderful experience and should not be missed on a visit to Istanbul....and for a bonus, try the sunset cruise.
One of my favorite bodies of water. I have traveled over the Bosphorus by bus and car, and traveled on it by large boat and small. This is a great place.

one huge city. I traveled through the Bosphorus Strait on a cruise ship and it is really interesting how narrow the strait is, you have to make a reservation to travel through the area. You will view the massive city of Istanbul and be in awe of just the size of the city, that is home to more people than the entire country of Greece!

Lovely views. As you sail through the bosphorous strait with Europe on one side and Asia on one seeing the magnificent views of the historical places and going under the bridges that join europe and asia including the bosphorous bridge

God's gift. The bosphorus is truly one of the most beautiful places in the world. You will remember it forever. :) Take a cruise on the official Sehir Hatlari cruise. Best value for money and a very cool and non-touristy experience :)
Catch a ferry to Kadikoy. see the real Istanbul from a ferry, easy to do and inexpensive. On our boat there were some singers and musicians. See the other side and experience some good restaurants.
Cruised through here. Via the Mediterranean Sea to the Black Sea.One if the most amazing and memorable journeys in my life. Beats a boring rivercruise any day :-)!

cruising on the Bosphorus. After two hectic days of on-the-go sightseeing, a cruise on the Bosphorus was such a relaxing and enjoy enjoyable morning. I can say it really put to bed any notion that Istanbul was a back water. The architecture was a mix of Italy, Americas, Asian. Gardens were also wonderfully kept and presented. We loved it.

Bosphorus Strait. We took a cruise down the Bosphorus Strait and it was worth while. You see many interesting places and you can also plan site seeing trips for future days you are spending in Istanbul. We did wait a while like 15 a 20 minutes before we left the wharf but still enjoyed the ride. A must to do, and very informative.

Do not hire a private cruise...use the public boat and save lots of money!. Our 5 hour Bosphorus Cruise was amazing. The travel agency near our hotel wanted to charge 90 bucks per person, whereas the public cruise is just a few dollars!

You're on two continents, Europe and Asia Minor, take the cruise!. Such a neat experience to straddle two continents. The views of Istanbul from the Strait are breathtaking. It's estimated close to 20 million live in Istanbul. You are living, experiencing, breathing history! The cruise is part of the entire experience.

A cruise on the Bosphorus is a must. Take a cruise tour of the Bosphorus is a must for all visitors to Istanbul just to see the beautiful old buildings and the residences of the rich and famous. Some of the most expensive real-estate in the world can be found here!

Take a boat ride on the strait. Take a boat ride on this strait and admire the great piece of engineering that the bosphorus bridge represents. This strait separates the European and Asian part of Istanbul. You can visit the Asian side and spent a day there and also get to see the Black Sea from the Asian side.

Great afternoon cruise with a fabulous lunch. Fortunately the weather was great on the day of the cruise, we sailed up towards the Black Sea had time out for swimming and then visited Anadolu Kavagi village not much to see but time to stretch your legs
Beautiful Bosphorous. The straight is beautiful, but different from many perspectives. Beaches and eateries ~ locals enjoying the beautiful scenery and beaches.

unbeatable for 12TL. Board the Turkyol boats at Karaköy or Eminönü and travel around for almost two hours seeing major sights from the water. Even the touristy boat is cheap (12TL for the round trip), but if you take the public transportation boat to Kadiköy it will only set you back 4TL one way, and you get to walk around in the Asian side as a bonus. Highly recommended
Did this as apart of our tour. Relaxing, beautiful and full of history. You can enjoy a beer (but no wine :( on the boat) and of course turkish tea.

Memorable and romantic . The night cruise along the Bosphorus is a must do. You get to see the whole old town along the twinkling bridge lights and of course there is dinner and entertainment on the boat. We booked the cruise near our hotel. The booking agencies are everywhere. You get pick up and drop from your hotel.

A refreshing tour. Istanbul in the middle of June can be hot, and touring the streets of can be a mixed pleasure. On such a day, a boat trip on the Bosphorus strait is a relief, and you get a very interesting new perspective on this fabulous city. Find a departure point on either side of the Galata bridge, and go with the boat on a round trip for about two hours, calling at ferry stations both in Asia and in Europe. Also observe the very busy shipping through the strait, the only passage between the Mediterranean and all ports in the Black Sea.

See Istanbul from the the water. The Bosporous defined the city of Istanbul and it needs to be seen from the water. Dentur offers great hop on, hop off ferry trips, ball the way up the Bosprorus to the Black Sea, or around the Golden Horn.may sights and palce to visit on the way but if you dont jump off, the round trips each take close to two hours, 15 Turkish Lira each, the Bosporous boats run every two hours, those on the Golden Horn every hour.
Take a boat ride. Take one of the many boat rides available, that takes you up the Bosphorus. You will see the history and the modern side of Istanbul. It's really worth it.

It was very Good!. If you visit Istanbul you should take a Bosphorus cruise!  Go direct to Eminönü and step on in the public ferries.This is the shortest and least expensive kind of Bosphorus cruise. It's not really a cruise, of course but we enjoyable.

An amazing waterway. The Bosphorus Strait is an amazing waterway separating Europe from Asia and The Black Sea from the Aegean Sea. Its shores are lined with ferry terminals, palaces, beautiful homes and urban forests

Bosphorus Strait Cruise. The cruise cost around USD60 per person and takes about one hour. The cruise takes you along the river that separates Istanbul into European region and Asian region. If you have time, you may join the cruise but if you skip it, nothing much you miss.

A nice tour. There are many different tours related to Bosporus Strait.some of them at morning and some of them at night.We choose night tour.It was very amusing and exciting. nice view, nice whether,.. nice Turkish show. but some centers sell its thickets more expensive than real price. there is a place just near the bridge that sell the real price.

See Istanbul from another perspective. Beautiful view to Istanbul from another perspective, take a ferry and go to see the Eastern promenade, there are a few nice places to eat. On the boat they are serving tea and so on. I liked it a lot!
Excellent Skyline View. This is a great place to enjoy dinner on the cruise and admire the beautiful skyline of Istanbul city! Breathtaking views of the Asian and European side of the city!
amazing bridge.. bridge joining asian and european side of the city is to diw was.... walk over the river and view of blue mosque and galata tower is mind blowing...

A day trip to rival the best.. Buy your ticket next to the bridge at 25 TL and get a guide player with map. It leaves about 10.30am and takes 90 mins up to Anadolu Kavagi which is the start of the Black Sea. There you stay till 1.30pm and enjoy at one of many restaurants a very good and fresh fish meal. The shopping is also good for light items. The coast up is lined on both sides with Pashas, Mosques and palaces. They vary from the very antique to the most modern but all are interesting and of course you get to see Europe and Asia and dine in Asia for lunch.

Great tour for a great price. We spent over two hours on the boat on the top deck with a cool breeze coming from the water. It was a great chance to see the divide and see the buildings on both sides. There were snack ls available and and audio guide was so available.

A Nice Visit. On our first day in Istanbul we had booked a hotel in Ortakoy and our room was not ready for about three hours so we left our lugage in the hotel and and headed for this beautiful and busy spot. Here we had the famous Kumpir and also had a cruise of the Bousphorus. We thoroughly enjoyed everything.
Good Value for 20 Euro. Did a 2 hour cruise on the Bosphorus, a great way to see some of the most amazing Ottaman architecture.

Holistically magnificent!. Ever had a dream where you sail on blue water and pass through both modern and historic architecture with the sun shining from above and the cool wind blow through your hair? Well this is a dream come true then. When the sky's shining bright and there are no clouds in sight the Bosphorus Strait by far becomes one of the most picturesque places I could ever think of. A small water body that divides two different continents yet in a way connects them together shows you how different the architectural ideas were back then.
be eurasian.... it is the only place in the world to be neither in europe nor in asia...so if you are wondering about feeling eurasian..go for it...it is 1 of the most beautiful things to do here...

Half day trip with IBO Cruise Istanbul. This was an afternoon cruise that went to the Black Sea. Great tour and lunch that was provided on board was excellent. This was cooked fresh on board doing local Turkish dishes. Each dish was explained. Ample time at village on Black sea to have a look around before returning to Istanbul. Would recommend. A great way to see lots in a relaxing atmosphere.

Must see. This is a significant place in the world, separates Asia and Europe and a beautiful waterway. we took a local cruise which was for 1.5hours and cost 12 TL, operated by Turyol. They leave every hour Cruise takes you all the way to the 2nd bridge and brings you back. There are others offering cruise as well. Becareful of touts. It is easy to get on the local ferries. They serve tea on board for 2TL and bread for 3TL. The waterway is beautiful and you can see lots of nice buildings on both Asia and Europe side. Another local operator has 2 tours, one in the morning which is for full day(didn't check the cost) and another starts at 2.30pm which is half day tour, cost is 12 TL as well.

Amazing — The busy 3% of Turkey that's in Europe but touching Asia. Highly recommended.This is one of those places you have to see "in person" to appreciate the "busy-ness" of this seemingly chaotic waterway junction spanning Europe and Asia as a gateway from the Mediterranean to the Black Sea via the Bosphorus. And it's somewhat mystical too. If you know some ancient history and languages from this part of the world (as I do) you can visualise how and why the Ancient Greeks and so many other peoples occupied, fought over, and traversed this territory over the millennia.Of special interest to those from highly regulated societies like the U.S. will be the water traffic. Take a look at what goes on here and then imagine the reaction of the US Coast Guard. This place is chaotic. The Coast Guard would have a field day here citing traffic violators for unsafe navigation and loading practices. Yet there's something attractive too about these somewhat non-regulated cultures — a pleasant departure from the overbearing, over-regulated west. It's all so captivating.My wife and I had a chance to view the criss-crossing boat traffic from the vantage point of cruise ship in June 2015. We enjoyed it. We think you will too. I'll upload some pix when I get a chance.Enjoy!

Well worth the time and relaxing way to see city water front. This is a great trip we were lucky only about 30 people on the boat, it was overcast and had a couple of brief showers so half the trip we were inside the boat. Guide was excellent and spoke excellent English. The visit to the hunting palace was a highlight as was seeing the many up market hotels and houses along the water front. Great value trip but for those on a budget take your own food and drinks. Not over top I thought but a couple of young backpackers thought it was high.

unforgettable impression when crossing the Strait. enjoy your chance to take a boat tour in the Bosphorus Strait... you can choose time and price as well... i advice you to take an evening tour.when the magnificent bridges are lit...the guide tells you about the landmarks you are passing by...

Beautiful and historic. Had lunch at a small cafe overlooking the intercontinental bridge crossing the strait. Was told this is the only bridge in the world that connects 2 continents (Europe on one side and Asia on the other). Take time to learn a bit about the history and the many, many wars that have been fought over control of the strait. This has been a key shipping lane over the years control of it has brought battles and riches to many who have fought over it. Seeing it is a real bucket list item to visit.
Interesting outing. I would recommend this trip for a few hours during your visit to Istanbul, the journey is pleasant and good views and opportunities to take photographs.
Take a ride. Be sure to take a boat ride on The Bosphorus. It is easy to see why this waterway is so strategic. It is lined by old forts and VERY expensive residences.

A ferry ride is a must. Take time to enjoy a ferry ride (just avoid the Islamic holidays/weekends as the ferry will be extra crowded) that leaves from the area near the spice market and proceeds around the Golden Horn and into the Bosphorus Strait and under the first Bosphorus Bridge. You'll see the various fortifications build to protect this area, many historical buildings, etc. Having a personal tour guide rather than looking at a guide book will help you appreciate the history of the area.

Could watch it for hours. Activity around the clock with cruise ships, cargo ships, ferries and private boats constantly moving back and forth across the Bosphorus Strait. I could sit or stand and watch the activity for hours on end, knowing how this activity has been the same throughout history, both in peaceful times and wartime. A year later I was able to sail through it to the Black Sea, which is another great adventure not to be missed.
Great boat trip. Worth the boat ride down the Bosphorus Strait. A great way to see the beautiful homes on the Asia side.

The best way to see Istanbul. The cruise is the best way to see the different parts of this enchanting city and appreciate its history. Take the public ferry from Eminonu for a round trip which will last for 5-6 hours. You get to see the European and Asian sides of Istanbul as well as the lavish waterside mansions, including the Ottoman Empire's last hurrah in the form of the Dohlmabace Palace. Pass the gigantic bridges that connect both parts, enjoy the sight of the jelly fish that bob alongside the boat (these are the reason no one swims in the Bosphorus) and soak in the ambience of this ancient waterway that has played such an important role in the history of this city. Right at the end of the boat's trip, catch a glimpse of the Black Sea before stopping at a fishing village for a meal, before heading back.You can also take a one way trip and get off at Sariyer to club this with a trip to the Dohlmabahce Palace and a few other museums on the way.
refreshing and relaxing. if the weather is good then this is a must do! we visited in october and it was pleasant and they serve soem really nice turkish tea. And an amazing view all around!
A must do. The Eminonu port is packed with thousands of people, but that should not be a reason to not go for Bosphorus ride. It's really worth it.
Well worth the cruise. Travelled by ship through the bosphorus strait to the Back Sea. Views of Istanbul were stunning as good as the entry into Venice by sea. A sight not to be missed

Architetural diamond. We saw the strait from the sea. It seemed surrealistic in the morning water dust. Everything was bluish and this work of human hands looked so well adapted to the surrounding. Beautiful.

Choose the ferry. There are hundreds of agencies provide thet tour services and the price is around 30 euros per person. After I talked with my turkish friends, we decides to choose the ferry.sehir hatlari nearby Galata bridge is very easy to find. 15 lira for a long tour single trip is a good choice. Then take the bus and come back to istanbul along the Asia side by bus.

Perfect place. Take a cruise along the Bosphorus strait. Sunset around the Golden Horn when returning was spectacular. Go for the evening cruises in summer. You can take a walk through the bridge, Asian and European side. Nice sea breeze and good view. One of the best places ever for a stroll in a busy city while at the edge by the sea.

Bosphorous Boat Trip. Our hotel arranged the boat trip with a taxi to and from the boat which made it very easy. It's a great way to see all the different areas of Istanbul which would take ages to walk around as it's so massive. Also we saw dolphins which was amazing :) The traffic on the water is almost as crazy as the traffic on the roads.

Relaxing way to see the city. We took a 3 hour cruise and a 3 hour city tour, the ideal way to start a visit to Istanbul. The company picked us up at the hotel and the tour ended near the Blue Mosque.

Beautiful!. The cruise on the strait gives one a glimpse into the old and new Istanbul. One will cross Dolmabache Palace and some beautiful riverside luxury homes. Having a meal in one of the cafes beneath the Galata Bridge will give an idea of how busy the strait is with innumerable ferries and smaller motorboats plying all over. One enjoyable meal was in the House Café strategically located on the river.

Take the ferry!. Want a great inexpensive intro to Istanbul? Grab the ferry that crosses the Bosphorus and stay on it coming back. You get about an hour to view the city and get your bearings for a couple of bucks. Want a great daytrip? Take the ferry that goes all the way to the Black Sea, have a great lunch while you're up there, then sit on the same side coming down (left side is best both ways!). Leaves the ferry terminal about 10:30 and returns about 4. A really great day for about $25 for the 'cruise', plus what you pay for lunch. Great way to get away from it all but still see a ton of stuff!

Visit two continents in one short trip. Nice boat trip where you see many historic sites and can step into Europe on one side and Asia on the other. Beautiful and interesting. Definitely see when you visit Istanbul!

relaxing way to spend a couple of hours. Several cruising companies at Eminonu pier, so you have a choice of timing. we went with the one closest to the restaurants on the pier. only 12TL per person for a 1.5 hour cruise which went as far as the second bridge close to the black sea. Several stops on the way but we were in no hurry. There was very little in terms of guide service during the trip. The tea and snack service on the boat was very good value. Comfortable seating to see several Istanbul sights from a different perspective. those who are used to a western style bathroom may find the old style 'hole in the ground' bathroom a little disconcerting.

Worth taking tour. We had night tour on Bosphorus cruise with dinner, belle dance and local dances. Enjoyed the view of the surrounding buildings with lightening in late evening and night. It was an arranged trip for whole of our group so the guides were very helpful and we didn't have any problem regarding meal, drinks or of any sort during the trip. On should not miss this tour in Istanbul.
Great views soaked with history. Wonderful views both sides of the strait. Forts and palaces in abundance in eye catching scenery. You do need a knowledgeable guide to get full value.

Take a lovely boat cruise between Europe and Asia. We really enjoyed this cruise, amongst the passengers there were 4 young girls on too who were very friendly and took a photo of us. It is so relaxing and it was a beautiful day.

Great boat ride on the Bosphorus. We thoroughly enjoyed our boat ride on the Bosphorus. It gave us great views of both sides of Istanbul and the Bosphorous straits. The amount of boat and ship traffic was very interesting. This was especially true of tour boats darting about in narrow quarters. It provided with an excellent perspective of the European and Asian side of the city. One caveat. The staff offered drinks when departing with no mention of cost. He later returned demanding payment. A slick 'marketing' tactic.

Beautiful view. Thinking of this place is the on the two continents, you would feel amazed on almost everything. The views on both banks are very special and historical places along the way. Very nice!

Waste of time and money. We took the ITS Bosphorus cruise but I imagine they are all the same. First they drop you at the Egyptian spice market for 45 minutes which is over crowded and where they push you to spend money. Next you're taken to the boat, when again you're pushed to purchase snacks. The guides are very difficult to understand / hear (in all languages) but there didn't seem to be all that much interesting info anyway. It's a nice boat ride, nothing more. We found the public transportation ferry to be interesting.

Worth a boat ride!. We took a boat tour as a shore excursion from Celebrity Cruise. The strait is beautiful, and reminded us a bit of the San Francisco Bay Area, where we live. However, the buildings along the Bosphorus are more interesting and beautiful, and really makes you want to live there!
A busy body of water.... Well worth taking a tour of the Bosphorus, even if it is just a ferry ride. Lots of ships and boats of all sizes and well as seeing the homes lining the Bosphorus.

Bospherous Cruise. Best time during Summer / Spring to take a bospherous cruise is post 4 PM when the Sun does tricks with the facades of this great city . Emenonu which is close to the tourist district and on T1 Tram line is the best place to board . The hustle and bustle and the fish sandwich boats provide a colorful facade . Turyol is the best company to use since it has departures every hour and the trip lasts for 2 hours . They take you all the way across the two bridges that connect europe to Asia . The turyol boats have toilets and refreshments that you can buy online .

An absolute must do in order to understand Istanbul. The Bosphorus splits Istanbul in two Asia from Europe. The best way to really get a feel of its importance to history is to take a boat trip along it. Bigger than a large city river but human in size. It meanders like a river and you can see lots of interesting buildings including fancy villas on both sides of the banks. Great to cruise under both bridges and appreciate the size of them and how they link the continents. Most tourist boats depart from the same place and are double deckers with the upstairs open to the sun. Our boat was a 2-3 hr cruise including a stop at a hunting lodge. They half covered the upper deck with a sunshade tarpaulin pulled over on wires. They keep the other half open so you can get a view of the bank. Not obvious when you get on which side will be shaded. When sunny you want the shade. The uncovered side is nearest the far bank of the Golden Horn when travelling to the Bosphorus. i.e when getting on the boat with the boat pointing into the dock nose first, the shaded side will be on your left. Drinks can be bought on board cans of pop 5tl as is instant coffee. Loos on board can be a bit smelly. Some good informative guiding through the loudspeakers but a little spasmodic and not easy to hear at the back of the boat. Guide stand next to the bar near front of upper deckWe booked ours at the hotel which included hotel pick up. This was by far the worst part. Nearly an hour to do 4 hotel pick ups with lots of waiting and no explanation. in order to travel a mile or so to the dock. If we had known we would have taken the tram, air conditioned, and 10min to get there. Booking via hotel doesn't include a return trip so beware.

2 different wow view. Knowing Turkey has two side Europe and Asia, really wanna explore and Bosphorus tour for $40 the tour start from spice bazzard and end up with beautiful Bosphorus tour. Really amazing to see two side of Turkey. Palace in Europe side and beautiful house in Asian side. Must try.

Ride the Bosphorus. The sites of Istanbul were seen from a floating perspective. The narration helped to imagine life in the 13th century and the food brought us back to the 21st. A must do experience.

Cruising. Cruisin' on the Bosphorus strait, to see the dynamic city of Istanbul. Take a tea or coffee afternoon, enjoy the view and let the imagination on your head play on absorbing the energy of Istanbul

do it yourself. you can either book through one of the many opportunities in hotels or travel agents across the city and pay around 30-40 euros. or you can go yourself to the port on the asian side of the city and jump on a ferry for a 'cruise' for just 20 turkish lira! yes thats right. the price of a beer. and it was very enjoyable too, about 2 hours and lots of food and drink service on board. why anyone takes the first option is beyond me.in general, its a great way to see the strait and the istanbul coastlines.

AN EFFORTLESS WAY TO TRAVEL AROUND ISTANBUL..!. What can I say about the highly efficient water way system of Istanbul.? The fact we used the many ferry boats to get from A to B including the crossing from Europe to Asia says it all, and the best advice I can give is to get yourself a travel pass and using the many local tobacconist's / newspaper stands to top up your card, will enable you to travel anywhere and it even works on the trams, public toilets, and it won't break the bank either, it also saves having to queue for tickets..!We used many ferry boats, and also booked a Bosphorus trip which took us on a two hour tour taking in all the usual sights along the way, and this was a brilliant way to relax.
