For our wedding anniversary we booked a dinner/dance show cruise with the "Orient Bosphorus" which turned out to be a memorable night, as we went for several hours up and down the horn, sampling much Raki & Beer. The beauty of Istanbul, is it's use of the river system the timings, and arrivals at the various terminals are second to none. Just watch the rush hour traffic, as the Turks haven't heard of the queueing system and this can be very intimidating, and having travelled the World and visited many river systems, I would highly recommend using Istanbul's ferry service..

Busy water way..... We sailed up the straights whilst on a cruise so had a great vantage point from the top deck. It was great to see the city waterways a hive of activity with all the different ships & boats going about their daily business etc.

Crusinig the Bosphorus for a sense of history. Any number of operators offer a Bosphorus cruise sailing under the bridge. Get a real sense of history. If you are lucky do it on a cruise ship and get to understand how narrow it is and how important to international shipping.

BOSPHORUS STRAIGHT. WOW... What an amazing trip we had. One the side's of the Bosphorus all these beautiful palaces and hunting houses. you can see the part of Istanbul where the "rich" people lives. You can see part of the old City Walls the surrounded Istanbul. This cruise is not to be missed.

dont buy ticket from street vendors. Go to the ferry booking office down at the waterfront..... where the locals buy their tickets.... it's a fraction of the price that is offered to you on the streets. Really relaxing way to see more of this amazing city.

Interesting. Took Turyal Ferry cruise between European and Asian side. It's about 90 mins ride along the Bosphorus straits. Amazing view ! There are other boats or ferries to choose from and much longer rides. You can also hop on and in to visit or look around the Asian side or just just go for a short tour . It's worth trying!

Unique. If you visit Istanbul as we, you should take a Bosphorus cruise! We made it the first day we arrived. Go direct to Eminönü and step on in the public ferries. No problem! You'll see the domes and minarets of Old Istanbul, Leander's Tower (Kız Kulesi), the magnificent façade of Dolmabahçe Palace, the sprawling new districts of office towers, and the sweep of the Bosphorus to the north and the Sea of Marmara to the south.This is the shortest and least expensive kind of Bosphorus cruise. It's not really a cruise, of course but we enjoyed a lot.

Great 2 hour boat tour of the Bosphorus. We took a two hour boat tour with S.S. Altin Boynuz. Touring the Bosphorus by boat is a must do if this is your first visit to Istanbul. Incredible views and sights of Europe on one side and Asia on the other. The company provided a pamphlet of the sights along the Bosphorus. Bring your camera as you will want to use it. This was a great tour on a windy day but we still enjoyed it very much.

Cross the Bridge and see Awesome Views!. Can't stress enough the fact of crossing to the Asian side for just some minutes of your trip... We had awesome views of Istambul Europe side from the Asian side... Our driver took us to Camilica Hills and took some very nice pictures of the European side of Istanbul... Very highly recommended!

take the tourist ferry. We did the long ride up to the fishing village at the end of the strait before the ships leave for the Black Sea. Wonderful day out on the water and well worth it. We took the 10:30am ferry and were back around 4pm. We had lunch in the little stop over village. Can't really comment on our restaurant as it was average at best but there are lots to choose from. The hike up to the castle ruins is a good walk if you want some exercise but there is not really anything to see.

feels like living in the fairytale land of Aladdin. I went there with the cliche thought of taking a picture in between the borders of the two continents- Europe and Asia. But when I actually reached Bosphorus strait, I was quite blown away by the scenery. It felt rather magical like being on the set of Aladdin. The hustle and bustle of the local's life at the market nearby, just adds on to the surreal feeling. I think I was there on some festival, where they had also released some lanterns along the river, it was very beautiful.

Busy Bosphorus. We took a ferry across to the Asian side. If you walk to the right from the ferry terminal, along the water, about 15 minutes down you will come across seats in rows with cushions that you can sit on and order coffee/tea and look out over the Bosphorus. Watching the ships, large, small, in between, is fascinating.

The View of Europe & Asia Istanbul. Definitely a must, The architecture of Istanbul is so unique that you can see a mixture of Asian & European architectural buildings because of the strategic location of Istanbul in between Asia & Europe. The best way to enjoy the beauty of 2 different Buildings culture is to be on the Bosphorus! As 1 side you have the Asia buildings view while the other side European buildings view!
Private cruise is worth the extra money. We took a 2.5 hour cruise on the Bosphorous and it was worth the money to see Istanbul from the water and enjoy the sites.

An absolute must do!. We did a 2 hour tour from the Sultanahmet area to the second bridge on the Bosphorus. Great views of the Sultanahmet district, the Galata Tower, the Dolmabache Palace, the European neighbourhoods, the Asian neighbourhoods etc. Enjoyed seeing the the busy bosphorus life in Istanbul!Money totally well spent - a must do!

Beautiful cruise. IF you are in Istanbul, the trip is incomplete without taking a cruise on Bosphorus. Read on tripadvisor not to take private cruise and hence with stuck to the regular cruise with was pretty good and lasted over an hour and gave us a good view of the scenic bosphorus and the historical monuments around it. This cruise does not got to the black sea and turns around just before the start of black sea. The seafood under the galata bridge was really good and fresh.

Make sure you take a cruise. So many choices of cruises to suit all budgets we did the long Bosphorus 25 TL, just fantastic the fisherman on Galata Bridge with all the restaurants underneath have a fish roll delicious (Balik Emek)

love to come back here. you have to do the strait if you are in Istanbul, very interesting sights as you cruise along on one of the ferries. the guides give you plenty of information on its history etc, a stunning city to visit

Peaceful with great views. We were greeted by enthusiastic waves from young students in another boat as we traveled the strait. We just don't have views in our young country (U.S.) like the ones we had of both the European and Asian sides of Turkey. Traveled twice by public ferry boat (I recommend this, as it's cheap and fine) and once on a private tour boat. Take time for this if you're in Istanbul!

Best tour Value and romantic lunch. The Bosphorus tour leaves the ferry pier nearest the Golden Horn/Spice Market area bridge in Old Town and is only 25 lira. It departs at 10:30am but get there an hour early. It is scenic and takes you to the fishing village on the Black Sea with a 3 hour stop there. Climb half way up to the castle to where you go from the road (sign is there) to a footpath and stop for lunch at the Blue & White tables/chair Yosun Restaurant. The back of the restaurant is part of the castle wall ruin (look hard if the sun shades are out). The view is fantastic, the food is superb and services is prompt & friendly. This lunch, climb to the castle ruin and Bosphorus tour will be on of our life long memories.

Hokey, but worth it. We booked a dinner cruise one evening. Hokey, with dinner and dancing, including belly dancing, but really what we liked was the slow ride as the sun set, to see all the mosques and palaces lit up as we cruised under the bridges. Wow! Don't expect much from the food, and the entertainment was okay (but sort of hokey)--but overall, a good experience.

Fantastic. Taking a boat tour through the Bosphorus Strait while in Istanbul is an absolute must! Looking at the various shorelines it is an experience that cannot easily be topped anywhere else in the world.

Really nice cruise. This is one to definitely spend half a day doing. As with most reviews don't go with the touts at the cruise port, but instead book before hand with the official company. You get 25% discounts with the Museum Card.Arrive at least 90mins before departure to get good seats on top of the boat or by the side. But even if you don't you can find a place to stand up once the cruise gets going.

Seagull!. When boarding the boats go downstairs since that's where they have the nice seating. Make sure you have cash so you can get juice or tea. It makes for a very nice experience. The seagulls are out of control. If you take treats they dive for them. The view is awesome. 8/10 would do again.

Cruising on the Bosphorus.. We booked a hop on, hop off Bosphorus cruise. It was one of the highlights of our holiday with many interesting palaces and two fortresses (Fortress of Europe and Fortress of Asia). We stopped off once at the Goksu River were we found an interesting palace and a beautiful river creek with cabin cruisers and small boats along its length. We were also able to walk close by the Fortress of Asia (though we did not go in)

Two Continents in one!. I can't think of any other place where you can see two continents from your boat sailing in the mingling waters of Europe and Asia. The Asian side is bustling with activity while the European side is subdued.........one of the most attractive sites is a tiered burial ground such that the departed "can admire" the Bosporus. The other attraction on the European side is the Aquarium.....
Good fun! . Good views and great fun - rather a bumpy ride at times! No need to book - just walk along the river front and admire the persistence of the sales people!

Heart warming soothing cruise. A ship with two floors. One can choose to sit upstairs, in the open air, where a little shop is found. Or one can sit downstairs where an optional lunch or dinner is offered. The captain pointed out the landmarks on the way, in English, and put international songs. We had one stop at a fishermen's village. It was a half day cruise which was worth the try. We really enjoyed it and recommend it

well worth a visit. along the waterfront is a good walk. You must try the water taxi there is a lot of them and it is a pleasant tri. you can do a return or get a tram back. there is some nice gardens along the front also a old aircraft and machines to see at the other side you can use the hop on bus to see these sights.
the history is there. I was moved by it's antiquity but from a natural beauty point can not put it equal to Hong Kong, Golden Gate or NY near Statue of Liberty

Divides Europe and Asia. Strait that divides Europe from Asia. Take a boat trip for a couple of hours to see the sights of Istanbul in a different light and learn about the history of this great city.

River Cruise. Wow an amazing river so busy always something to see. We were lucky to stay with a view of the straight. Then we went on the cruise everyone who visits Istanbul should enjoy the Hop on Hop off boat cruise

go for it. was with a large group of 50 plus professionals many of whom I know well from across the world. and it helps. the boat ride is scenic and the weather was chill and soggy with drizzling when we started and that was bit not good since it would have been lovely to stand out and watch. we moved inside quickly after photo sessions and the food served is what you get everywhere - the turkish special. it is just that in 3 days it was as many times was having the same set menu. inside is well furnished and there is ample space and seating. you can sit, dance, step outside and have a drink and a cosy chat while taking in the sights outside.

A drive along this important waterway is another good way to check out life among the rich and richer.. During this visit to Istanbul instead of a boat tour on the Bosphorus we drove on the European side all the way from the airport vicinity almost to the Black Sea and back again. Some of the homes and condos along the water are really spectacular, at least as much as can be seen from the road. Be prepared for heavy traffic on this two-laned roadway at any time of the day.

Great refreshing trip on the water!. Being short of time, we did the 2h non-stop trip, but there are other options, including lunch stops, swimming breaks, step-ashore in Asia and evening dinner cruises. All seem to be great value. We got to see a lot of historic sites from the sea, and lots of interesting maritime traffic.
A MNM azing sights. You get to see this amazing city from a different perspective and the commentaries are full of interesting facts you might not otherwise find out.
A must trip great overview of Istanbul. A lovely trip on the boat, a must do for Istanbul. A excellent pleasant overview of Istanbul wealthy and history.

Enjoyable and inexpensive. We took on of the private ferries, 12TL for about 1.5 hours, up to the second bridge and back. Commentary was prerecorded and ordinary but the trip was very enjoyable and gave a good feel for the frenetic activity on Istanbul's waterways along with close views of the coastline on both European and Asian sides. Only downer was a nearly hour long wait from initial boarding to departure.
Amazing Energy. Amazing to see strait integrates into the daily life of the local. Talk a walk at Galata Bridge and chat up the anglers. Perfect evening.

I would truly recommend a trip along this river.. This is a wonderful river to visit. Ferries go across between the European side and Asian side very very regularly from Eminouou. The fares are very very reasonable. I would recommend a tour to THE PRINCES ISLANDS! , a wonderful hours trip up the river. There are fantastic night dining cruises which are very romantic.

A really nice way to spend some time. The Bosphorus is a nice place to spend 2 hours on a warm summer day. I'm sure it's nice in all seasons but I visited when it was warm. We got to see a lot of Istanbul with it's beautiful houses and grand palaces along the ride. The best places to get tickets is right by the Galata bridge. You will find seemingly lone entrepreneurs selling tickets. I saved a few dollars by asking the gentleman in the small tourist information building. He directed me to a small ticket building/booth to buy them.P.S. any food or drinks that any of these boat attendants puts in your hands IS NOT FREE. If you don't want to pay for it, don't accept it.

take the ferry. cheaper than the organized tours but not as luxurious. Worth it to me for the price. Leaves in the am. Stops in a little fishing town near the Black Sea. If you eat at a restaurant on the water you may be charged for the water and bread even if you don't eat it. The only time I felt ripped off in Turkey. Grrrr.

Wonderful cruise. definitely a river cruise should be on your agenda during your stay.A lot of historical sites can be viewed from the river.we went for night time dinner cruise with a show and also a day time cruise.All the castles and beautiful summer homes was breathtaking. my only grievance was the exorbitant charges for snacks on the day time cruise , the prices were 10 x the street price.
East meets West. The views are spectacular, and the feel of history being all around.For me there is nothing to 'dislike'!

Beautiful views of all dies of Istanbul. We did this as part of a Dolmabahce Palace and boat cruise with ibocruise.com. It's well worth a boat trip you get to see all the wonderful sight from the boat, we were also able to go to Kucuksu Palace on the Asian side

Love Bosphorus. Bosphorus is one of the unbelievable and transformer (in good meaning of the word) place. It transfers you to different beauty of Istanbul also you can go to one Island to another and they are so differently beautiful and have their own histories. You also be able to see Dolphins on that journey ...

A must. A trip to Istanbul isn't complete without a cruise. You're hounded by salesmen by the blue mosque about their boats but we used the commuter ferry (€25) for a return trip. Departs at 10.25 but get there early to get the best seats on the edge of the top deck.

Take a cruise. There is lots to see up and down the Bosphorus Strait. Take one of the government transport ships and see the sights along the river, ultimately stopping up north to see the Castle. This is a great way to see Istanbul.

Worth during evening. I did a cruise with a private operator- turyol. Choose the 7:30 pm time & the weather was pleasant.
It gives a view in sunlight while going one way for great pics and on return journey an amazing view with the city & bridges lighted up.
I strongly suggest plan this way in evening.

Sit back and relax on the water. Ignore the touts around Sultanhamet Square and jump on the tram to Kabatas and take the boat from there for less than 1/2 the price. Then just sit back and relax as you view where the wealthy of Istanbul live in fine waterside houses. You ticket allows you to get of the boat your on at one of the stops it makes and to get on a later boat. A good way to rest your feet and see the sites. The best views are from the left hand side of the boat.
A great trip. No visit to Istanbul is complete without a trip on the Bosphorus. Can be a bit breezy at times but worth it

interesting trip. a 2hour trip on the Bosphoros, probably picked the wrong boat, no commentary on anything around us. Spectacular views of the presidential yacht :Savarona: and of the two bridges spanning from europe to asia. Houses on the asian side are very well presented and beautiful to look at

What you must do in Istanbul. It was really a gorgerous 90 minutes boat trip to Bosphorus Strait. You can view so many historical building in both European & Asian sides. It costs only 12 Turkish Lira per person. Value for money.

1 hour cruise down the Bosphorous Strait. We did a 1 hour cruise up and down the Bosphorous Strait as a shore excursion organised by RCI cruiseline. What a memorable trip, going along the European side first and then back along the Asian. Many many great photo opportunities. A great way to see the amazing panoramic coastline of beautiful Istanbul, Turkey.

Beautiful sights. The strait which divides Asia and Europe.The boat ride was amazing and when we went in the month of May it was pretty chill.You had excellent sights on both the sides and we could see some huge cruise ships anchored.It is one of the must see places when you are in Istanbul.

Stunning view of Istanbul. Stunning view of Istanbul, especially the view of old city, monuments, water front, fresh air breeze makes this place one of the best place to visit when you are in Istanbul.
A must do!. Nice tour by boat, it cost 12 TL, and it showed us the Bosphorus Strait with its buildings and monuments. A definite must-do in Istanbul, especially when your time is limited.

Nice evening. we visited this area just before sunset. it is a good place to relax in. you can order beer / wine and foods at several bars and have a good evening/night beside the beach. Bosphorus Bridge is visible from this area. there are fishermen fishing there and you can join them. the atmosphere is lovely.

Heavenly views!. We've been to Istanbul twice last year and both times have taken a boat trip along the Bosphorus! The views are absolutely amazing! It's a definite sight-seeing "to do" when in Istanbul!

Probably the best views of Istanbul. This is probably the best place if one wants to view Istanbul and have a fairly good idea of spread of the city. starting from the Sirkeci (area near Sultanahmet / Egypt (Spice) Bazar and taking you to the place where two continents (Asia and Europe) face each other and then towards the new Istanbul area. One can view / witness the sea areas around Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, Bosphorus Bridge, Dolmabache Palace and even beautiful views of the Galata Tower and the city itself. Its a no miss thing in Istanbul, which in my opinion is highly under rated city in the world as compared to what it has to offer to the tourist. Beautiful City with great options.

Great views.. You can take a tour boat but we did the ferries, very cheap but it was great to just get on and off. It was cool to be able to see how local people used them. There were several places along the shoreline where you could stop, sit and watch. Lots of people fishing from the shore - but never saw a fish being caught

Out on the water. What a lovely way to spend an afternoon. The old buildings and new all intermingled on the shoreline. Lunch on board was just ok though. We enjoyed the trip and would highly recommend it to all. The weather was kind too which is always a help!

Ferry on the Bosphorus Strait. The public ferries on the Bosphorous Strait must be the best value attraction of all time. It costs 50 pence to take a trip that can last as long as you want. You can get off and on when you like (50p each time!) and see amazing palaces and buildings. They even serve turkish tea on board! We couldn't believe how wonderful it was.

Stunning waterway. The waterway that divides Europe from Asia is fascinating. Take the regular ferry from the tram stop for the Spice Market and spend a leisurely day viewing the csize of the city, the universities, the mosques, the Ottoman palaces, the magnificent summer homes of Turkey's wealthy and the little resorts and gigantic bridges that take you from Asia to Europe or back and the large freighters that connect the Black Sea countries to the world beyond.Turn around at a little fishing village near the mouth of the Black Sea where you have a nice seafood lunch before heading back

Take the day, boat ride, ferry ride, fish sandwiches. we did a boat trip up and down the Bosphorus one day, how else would you ever be able to see how big Istanbul is? On the European side we had the BEST FISH SANDWICHES EVER!! then took a ferry to the Asia side. It was late enough in the afternoon on our last day. We got out and strolled around for a few minutes then went back to get on another ferry to go back. "No more boat" we were told. "No," I said. "We have to get back!" "No more boat". We would have had to either walk or take a taxi through rush hour traffic across the bridge. "No, " I repeated! then we noticed one just starting to pull out and we ran over and jumped on it. Of course it took us to a different part of town then where we needed to go, but it was closer.Pay attention to the time :)

The tour boat tour was iffy. We did one of the standard tour boat tours. It was supposed to have narrative but speaker was terrible. We just cruised for 1.5 hours and learned zero. I fell asleep. Be careful on the boat you take to be sure they have decent sound system and available seats with a view. Ours was a bust.

Beautiful... A beautiful river cruise along the Bosphorus is all you need to spend a fantastic afternoon. Have a knowledgeable guide accompany you to get a glimpse of history of the place and to know about the historic monuments along the European side of the river.

Summer 2014. Toured the Bosporus by private boat which was great, as you get to see both sides of it, drink good Turkish coffee or tea while enjoying the wonderful houses and the landmarks!! Highly recommend a boat trip!!

Active Waterway. We did not take any of the local cruises that were offered, but enjoyed watching all the activity taking place on the water from our vantage point at Topkapi Palace overlooking the strait.
Incredible Views. We liked everything about this river cruise....seeing both the European and Asian side of Bosphorus river. This is one of several must dos for people visiting Istanbul.
A Pleasant Way to spend A Few Hours. Fascinating architecture on view of both the European and Asian sides of the river. It's interesting to note the difference in modern development level.

great way to spend 90 minutes on a sunny day in Istanbul. The trip started by Galata Bridge, heading North along the European side, past Dolmabahce Palace, Ortakoy Mosque, under the Bosphorus Bridge and turned South back along the Asia side from Fatih Sultan Mehmet Bridge.Good views of Kiz Kulesi on way back.If you want a seat "up front" be one of the first to board!Drinks were available even without going down to the lower deck.Good value at 12TL

The Best Place to Be. For a couple of dollars you can have a great ride on the water; you have not been to Istanbul is you don't do this. I recommend one of the four Princes' Islands for a day trip. I've been to two of them and they're both lovely to walk and climb. If you're lazy they have horse drawn carriages that would take you around the island.

Gotta be done. We took a Bosphorus cruise of about 90 minutes. It was good value in that we saw a lot from the river on both sides and it was not expensive. Really shows you the gap between the wealthy and average person but isn't that the same in every major city.

Worth the fuss. Who would have thought one water mass between Europe and Asia could keep you within the borders of one city? A Bosphorus cruise is a worthy activity while in Istanbul. There are two hours cruises and 4 hour cruises. A two hour cruise takes you from the cruise docks which are opposite the New Mosque and you sail towards the left banks all the way to the second bridge. You are in the Asian part of Istanbul by then. On the way back the cruise sails towards the right banks. Most cruises don't provide guiding so read up on what you will see on both left and right sides of the strait. A ticket is priced between 15 and 25TL for the 2 hour cruise.

treat yourself! You desrve it!. The Bosphorus Strait is a magnificent expanse of water in between the European and Asia sides of Istanbul. It is the most photographed area, appearing on TV and has grown to be an international symbol of Istanbul. We were not going to miss the experience. We travelled across from Old Town to the Asian side and back just for the experience and views. You will not regret it and actually if you do not take it you will feel like you owe yourself a large part of your Istanbul experience. We decide to take the normal ferries. Just 8TL ($3) for a return trip you will buy a life time experience that you will imbibe on each time you see Istanbul on TV be it on the news or any programme. Well worth it. Be careful of the many hustlers at the bay who will try to sell you sinfully expensive cruises just to cross over. Go for the public transport ferry you will enjoy at almost no cost at all.
Romantic. Best place for a romantic cruise with dinner just before sunset. then u can see how the city comes to life after sunset.

Spectacular. Just amazing. This area can be seen from land or traveling down the Bosphorus strait. What is so vivid for us was the view at sunset as we were leaving port for our cruise. It was a mesmerizing view never to be forgotten.

Europe-Asia. Very nice views from each side. in the middle between Europe and Asia.
Worth to come when in Istanbul.

Bosphorus Cruise. Revel in Istanbul picturesque cityscapes on a cruise along the Bosphorus strait. Relish panoramic coastal views while gliding by boat along the city's spectacular skyline. A jacket is a must on the cruise as it is cool on the water,

Ride the ferry and enjoy this waterway!. We took the local ferry short tour, which goes up past FSM bridge a ways before returning, stopping once in Ortakoy. There is the longer trip up to Anadolu Kavagi too, but a 2.5 hour short tour was perfect, and you get to see lots of major sites along the way, such as Dolmbahache Palace, Rumeli Fortress, Bosphorus and FSM bridges, etc. It was a glorious way to enjoy the water, appreciate the importance of this waterway historically and at present, and to ride between continents.

Beautiful highlight of a beautiful city. Take a boat ride. Walk over the bridge from one side to the other. Try and ignore the smell! It's a beautiful area, and affords an amazing view of the mosques. We saw dolphins while waiting to take our Bosphorus Cruise. I'd also take a cruise to see all of the Bosphorus.

Relaxing Bosphorus. Watching boats on the Bosphorus is mesmerizing. One could spend a day or evening just doing that....but get out as there is much to see. We did spend one evening on the balcony with some snacks and wine and music and of course the call to prayer.

Too long but still worth seeing. The boat ride (only 12 Turkish Lira, ~4) was about 2 hrs long, way longer that it needed to be but it's still worth seeing the Bosphorus up close. They sell food/drinks on the boat and there is a large covered area to sit in if you don't want to stand in the sun/wind. It's just an hour too long.

Important busy waterway. To learn how important this waterway is to the whole of Europe is incredible - too narrow for the large shipping trade to pass,, so 12 hours is dedicated for ships going south, and 12 for those going north. Plus all the interesting Palaces, Sultan's residences etc., along the shores is so interesting and a must visit for all.

Short Ride. There are several ferry rides that you can choose from.We decided on the 90 minute tour, since we felt that it would give us a good sense of the Bosphorus as well as the sights lining the Strait. We were not disappointed. You can buy an audio guide, or like us, you can have a tour book which names the sights as you pass. The speakers on the ferry are impossible to hear, unless you are sitting in the back

Take a night time cruise. Seeing Istanbul from the Bosphorus Straits is great and even better at night. Find a night time cruise and get ready to take a ton of pictures of this beautiful city. I will do this again.
lovely, relaxing short 1 hour cruise. seeing homes along the shoreline, experiencing a restful hour, taking photos of land and water views, hearing our Tauck guide describe what we were seeing.

Take the cruise and have fun!. We just walked to eminonu from our hotel to kill time. Our hotel guys recommended we take the cruise along Bosphorus. It was chilly, but went ahead with the cruise anyway. They sell tickets and the frequency of these boats is hourly. It was a great way to see the city, especially this strait is what divides the city from being in Asia and Europe. Was just a treat all through. Just be careful of the pickpockets, someone we knew lost his wallet! And don't miss the Apple tea that you can buy from one of the vendors on the boat. Don't miss taking your camera along as well. Like anything in Istanbul, this boat ride too provides you to click awesome pictures. Make sure you steer yourself clear of those vendors who claim to get you these tickets, it's worth the effort of standing in a queue.

A lovely sail along the coast. There is much to see from the water, as you sail by and watch the busy life dissolve into quieter urban life and become greener. It was rather cold on the water, so take a jacket with you!

Scenic. Really like cruising along the Bosphorus in a ferry. We stood on the open deck and viewed some beautiful real estate along the river. You got an overall view of the Istanbul skyline which was superb.
Awe-inspiring strait!. A really beautiful strait. My advice is to walk along its shores if you want to feel its beauty. Personally, I did it! The most beautiful 25 km walk of my life.
Beautiful. Take a boat tour through the Bosporus. It is simply stunning and you get to see the beautiful city from the sea.

Cruising the Bosphorus. Had a relaxing cruise on the Bosphorus taking in the sights aling the way. Some impressive building to be seen. Was quite cold the day that we went, so rug up if you want to stand outside.

The Bosphorus Strait Ferry Boat Experience. Istanbul's major landmarks along the Bosphorus Strait are beautiful from this vantage point where land and sea are intertwined. A highly recommended ferry boat tour when visiting this vibrant city!

Bosphorus Cruise. The Bosphorus Cruise is a "Must" for any tourist going to Istanbul because it would allow you to explore both the European and Asian side of Istanbul. If you are going during winter season then make sure to take Jackets and Sweaters.

Interesting history, not much to look at.. The history behind the Bosphorus Strait is interesting, but it's not much to look at. Just a body of water running through the city. I love Istanbul, but I certainly wouldn't rate the strait as a must see. Chances are if you're in Istanbul, you'll spend lots of your time walking around/near it anyways.

UNIQUE STRETCH OF WATER. No wonder the turks didn't want to relinquish this stretch of water, the 32 kms is pretty special linking the Black Sea to the Sea of Marmara. Apparently big vessels take turns transiting the strait ie northbound vessels one day and southbound vessels the next day.

cruise. It is beautiful to take a cruise both in the day aand night . Ofcourse it became so cold in the night that we needed blankets ! In the day also it was cold enough to enjoy the sun . Sip a turkish tea while you cruise. The Asia side houses are amazing

A beautiful place to cruise!. We went on a half day cruise on the Bosphorus to the Black Sea on the final day of our holiday in Turkey. It was absolutely wonderful - blue skies, a gentle breeze, and calm sailing. It's a great way to see the city and there are some beautiful buildings as you sail along. Thoroughly recommend it.

Very pretty. A great way to see how HUGE Istanbul is! It just goes on and on and on!
Recommend taking a cruise which lets you see it in the daylight and then the return trip shows the city at night.

Beautiful scenery. Went as part of tour with United Travel Services, Inc. Our private guide, Esim, took care of us while we were in Istanbul. We had private boat, just my husband, myself, Esim, and the crew. We had wonderful lunch as we motored along. It was a beautiful day and a wonderful memory.

Lots of choices for a water visit!. You can take ferries from Europe to Asia, you can take a hop-on, hop-off tour boat, you can take a lunch or dinner cruise, you can sail around in a circle on just the Bosphorus or on the Golden Horn, or both.... There are castles and palaces along the way, and a couple of good stops for café breaks. A very restful addition to exploring Istanbul.

Wonderful trip up the Bosphorus. We took a cruise day tour up the Bosphorus from Istanbul, they picked us up from our hotel and dropped us off at the boat where we and a few other people had a whole boat to ourselves. We took the trip up to the Black Sea and it was our first step on Asia! Must take the hike up to the little castle to get a good view of the Black Sea. Great time!
Nice boat trip. We took one of the local 90 min boat trips and had a blast. Nice view of the strait and all the different building architectures.

Sunset cruise, nice to relax. We took an evening sunset cruise (1,5 hours) with one of the ferry operators in Eminou. It was nice to rest our feet after a long day of walking and to see the city from the water. Made few nice photos. It does get a bit monotonous after a while (last half hour were a bit boring). There are beautiful buildings, mansions and ruins on both sides of the strait, however no explanation is offered. It could have been much better experience with an audio commentary. The ticket is very cheap, though. Beware that it gets cool and windy on the open water and so if you want to stay on the upper deck, bring a sweater.
Luxury. Pity about the great big 3000+ travelling people ships, spoils the area completely, but a very impressive waterway

Open deck 2 level boat with good visibility. They will offer you drinks as though they are free, but they are NOT free. They will come around afterward for payment.
There was a good commentary in multiple languages explaining the buildings and sights that you cruise past.

A different perspective of Istanbul. We took a two hour boat tour of the Bosphorus and thoroughly enjoyed it. We bought our tickets from a vendor along the piers, so we weren't quite sure what sort of cruise it would be. Turned out to be a nice double decker boat. We left from the Galata Bridge and went for one hour up the Bosphorus along the European shore as far as the Fatih Sultan Mehmet Bridge, then turned around and followed the Asian shore back to the Golden Horn. Great way to see Istanbul.

Lunch on the bank. A must stop for lunch to sit in one of the many restaurants on the banks and enjoy the view as the boats go by. A great place to take a break in the middle of the day -- sip some tea or coffee

Great take!. I was part of a group of about 20 and we had a private boat. Great views of the city. I found it interesting that part of Turkey is in Europe part is in Asia. Great pictures from the water.

Bosphorus Cruise. A great two hour day cruise on the Bosphorus dividing Europe and Asia. One can enjoy seeing all the important landmarks on the European as well as the Asian coastline. One can easily identify each landmark as there is a running English commentary.
The best in Istambul.. I liked to watch the buildings travelling in the history. I didn't dislike anything during the trip.
Beautiful. Impressive. A pretty body of water. The ferry to the black sea should be a must. It is a very relaxing ride with a lot of beauty and history along both shores.
Joining asia to europe. It is really worth the effort to do a half day cruise on the Bosphorus, this allows yuo to see the new and old parts of Istanbul that you may want to visit up close.

Wonders of the water. A body of water travelled by various boats; ferries, sailboats, cruise ships and fishing boats. A wonder to watch all the vessels and travelel to the Asian side for lunch. A beautiful day.

Great Ferry trip. Down by the water front (Taksim Square side of town) you can get a ferry around the Bosphorus for just over an hour. It was a great way to see the waterfront and palaces that you can't see on land. Well worth it. Food and drinks are available on board. It does make a few stops if you want to explore other areas. You can get a tram there (Kabatas) last stop on tram and you're there

Take the shorter version of the cruise. Take the shorter version of the cruise to watch the strait. The two sides of it gives and amazing view of some great buildings and hotels + some very rich homes around the shores.

Stunning City Line. Have you ever been in two continents at once? if not, try a Bosphorus cruise at the Bosphorus Strait. You will be exactly in between Asia and Europe. The view was stunning, the cityline you see from the Asia side and the Europe side is different and really beautiful. It is also a very quick tour (considering you hop on a 1 hour cruise) to see the historical buildings as well as the city dynamics altogether. I went on the tour early February and it was sooo cold being on topdeck of a cruise with sea breeze hitting your face. They do sell chips, warm drinks and fresh juice on board, though - just don't drink too much as toilets on the boat is not very clean. Loved it.

Bospherus cruise. We went on the sunset cruise, meal included with some shows. We enjoyed it very much. The food, entertainment, the view and the companions were excellent. A must if you are in Istanbul. They collect and drop you off again.
Wow... how two continents meet :). Had a great trip on a boat during the day. Nice views all around and we really enjoyed this trip.Were on top deck and had the full scenic feeling.

Short trip to Kadikoy on Asian shore. I was going to take the full day trip departing at 10.35 from Eminonu pier and only returning at 16.30 for 25TL but looking at the long queues of tourists and the fact the ship did not have many outdoor viewing seats would have meant I'd be stuck downstairs with poor views, therefore I decided to pass. Instead I walked 30 secs to the second departure terminal along and caught a ferry to Kadikoy on the Asian shore. It costs 2 TL each way on an Istanbulkart (which you can't use for the long tour). The journey was short taking approx 20 mins. However the boat was better as there was a nice open upper deck with loads of room and no tourists. You pass Topkapi Palace, Blue mosque and Hagia Sophia so I was able to get great photos. I had a look around in Kadikoy and then jumped on another ferry back. But if you want lunch there are loads of places and a local market to look around. Also if you want to carry on your trip there are also lots if other destinations Eg prince's islands to carry on from there too. This trip may be preferable for those who want to go to the Asian side of Istanbul and see the Bosphorus whilst getting a few photos and save half a day.

Beautiful! Lined with beautiful buildings.. A trip to Istanbul is not complete if you don't pass through the Bosphorus Strait. It is the best way to see everything along the way including the bridges that connects the Asian side to the European side. The beautiful buildings alongside the strait is truly a spectacular sight.

Stunning views, excellent boat trip guide on the Bosphorus. It was just before sunset about as more than fifty business executives set out on what was to be an exceptional trip with stunning historical views. The beautiful mansions owned by wealthy Turkish families and rich foreign investors gave us a glimpse of what this beautiful city with an unparalleled ancient historical events can offer. As we cruised along the Bosphorus the fusion of east and west civilizations, Constantinople, Ottoman Empire, everything in-between to modern day Istanbul, clear demonstration of the resilience of the human spirit. What made our excursion more rewarding was an exceptional and captivating narrator/tour guide Saffet Emre Tonguc, he had us eating out of his palm.

asia meets europe?. yup! take the normal hop on hop off water boat.. it's much better than the private tours in my book.. grab a seat topdeck.. and sitting in the middle benches is best.. you get to see the sights from both sides! crossing continents? yeah you have it right there in an hour!
Spectacular view of Istanbul. Reasonably priced tour of the strait.You can see Istanbul from a different angle while enjoying cool fresh breeze of sea.

Istanbul Bosphorus, Istanbul, Turkey. One has to spend at least one day to see both from the sea and the land. There are many boats doing to tours hourly. One has to take a walk by the sea side near Bebek distrıct.
Average. We went with a tour group. Pick up where smooth. In the beginning the sightseeing are very interesting but then it get a bit boring. It was a long day on the water .

Bosporus River Cruise.. We picked a sunny day to venture out for a cruise on the Bosphorus River, we were picked up from our hotel around 9am and we were dropped back around 3pm.This cruise is a must do if your visiting Istanbul as it gives a different perspective of the city from the water.Excellent for taking photos of historic buildings and of course the bridges that cross the Bosphorus.

Relaxed and cost effective trip but lacking in explanations. We took the 1.5 hr tour with Turyol boats. The ship was nice, the price was right and the multiple sites and pics were great. The problem was that the operator's descriptions of sites in English were not decipherable and no map was provided so it was not as enjoyable as it could have been if we had known what we were looking at and had more historical context. The answer may be in an audioguide but don't recall if it was available.
very nice. It was a very pleasant , and the view of the city at sunset is wonderful.And the weather has held with us was very nice
You have to do it. Again, this is a must do, but don't be disappointed. There are some fab buildings along the river and clearly some VERY wealthy people in Turkey, but overall not a top experience.

Between Europe and Asia. You can cruise on many different trips on the Bosphorus taking in the scenery and history of where two continents meet. Sea traffic can be busy in the high season and there are many tourists taking trips but no matter there is plenty of room and lots of trips. Wise to plan and book in advance in busy times but lots to enjoy and make sure you take the cameras.

Boat ride!. I dearly love boat rides, and for very little money we spent an hour and a half on the water, seeing many interesting buildings along the way. It's hard to understand the recorded audio guide unless you are right by a speaker.
Bosphorus journey. Nice change of pace - to relax on the boat. Small boat with English guide and at the end we were able to visit the Sultan's day/hunting lodge - exquisite!
Stunning views. Stunning views from vantage points on both sides of the straights. Large local ferries are available for a modest fare, i.f possible extend your trip to the Prince Islands

Salnig between Continents. A Bosphorus cruise is a must- easily accessible by the European side of the Galetta Bridge. Very inexpensive 12 to about 15 lire- about an hour and a half. There is no stopping but give the opportunity to recover from sightseeing on your feet !

Great to do a cruise on. The bosphorus is amazing! I went there and did a two hour cruise (dont remember the company). The cruise was realy cheap and we got to see the whole thing. Its realy beautiful. You can see all seaside vilas, the old part of the city and the bridge. No regrets!

Take the Public Ferry boat or a Private Charter. There are numerous ways of cruising the Bosphorus, all of which offer a wonderful view of the many palaces and historic buildings on both the Asian and European banks.For only TRL 12 per person, a 90 minute "Bosphorus Tour" on one of the public ferry boats is a cheap and cheerful, although rather crowded, way to do this. These boats get extremely crowded and noisy, especially at weekends.For around TRL200 an hour, you can charter a private boat to take you on your own cruise. Expensive for just a couple, but if you are a group of friends or two families, this is the way to go.

Great 1 hr boat tour. The boat was big and they did not over load it with people. Unfortunately, it was difficult to hear everything the tour guide says with the wind. We got some great photos. Bring your own water & snacks. Theirs are very expensive, but try the decadent ice creams. Make sure you wear sun screen or a hat if you plan to be on top.level.
Don't miss it!. Travelling between two continents and watching the beautiful and misterious city of Istanbul. Have a cup of apple tea and take all the pictures you can!

Relaxing afternoon. We picked up one of the many boat charters to cruise on this tripIt turned out to be a great way to see both sides of the city while relaxing on the boat after all the walking to visit all the sites in Istanbul Don,t miss the local fish fry at the ship locations directly from the fishing boats It is very local and one has to sit on little stools to eat

Loved it. We did a Bosphorus cruise of a couple of hours, and we loved it! Beautiful scenery from start to end. It can get a bit chilly so bringing a light jacket would be a good idea, otherwise, sitting inside is a perfectly fine option too.

Lovely way to spend a Sunday arvo. We caught a ferry on a very cold and wet Istanbul day. The trip lasted for 2 hours and our guide was very knowledgeable about all the fabulous buildings, bridges etc that we could see. Sipping a cup of tea whilst watching everything go past was a very pleasant thing to do. It's a great way to see a lot of Istanbul's highlights.

great way to see the river. Bosphorus boat trip is a great way to spent the afternoon for the 2.30 trip be at the ticket office by 1.40 that way you get the best seat which is at the back right hand side sit back and enjoy.
Great views. Even on a sunny day you might consider a long sleeve as the breeze on the water on a 24 degree day was a bit cool. Interesting history too!

Amazing vilas all around. The city is beautifully placed on the Bosforus Strait. Most hotels and restaurants have terases on the top floor, so that you can get a good view of it (helps they have a "hilly" terrain). Best view: really dubious terrasse, near Suleymanie Mosque. No real name, but you can see it from the Suleymanie's gardens. Advice: order bottled drinks only. Do take a cruise down the Bosforus - it's just 12 lira and you'll have a great view of how Istanbul's wealthy live. It's rather long - 1 and a half to 2 hours. And all along there are the obvious historical landmarks, like the Dolmabahce. But also very inreresting to look at are all the beautiful vilas and houses all along the river.

Different View. A very wide expanse of water. We did a lunch cruise between the two very large bridges. Great views from the water for a different view of Istanbul. Only problem was we were not allowed into the Black Sea
Tour. Take a Bosphorus tour organized by the local, states company, 2 hours and you can see a lot.Not expensive, make sure you find a seat on the left side of the ferry.

go for an evening cruise. The Bosphorus is an interesting place to visit, especially from the sea. You can discover a different Istanbul from the sea, the small harbors with million euro yachts and expensive villas etc. A boat tour is perfect.

Minicruise on the Bosphorus. Ferries start from Eminönü BUT be sure to take the RIGHT ferry; it's a bit confusing : just ask !The ferry goes from the European to the Asian side and vice versa on this 31 km long strait and you will admire palaces, old wooden houses, modern yacht-ports, mosques and 2 suspension-bridges during this tour;From departure till the entrance of the Black Sea it takes about 2-3 hours.We disembarked at Sariyer where we enjoyed lunch at the terrace of a fish-restaurant and took a later ferry back to Istanbul.This is a must-see and also a very relaxing mini-cruise, weather permitting !
The Bosphourus cruise. This is highly recommended, many trip organisers around the main sites in sultanhmet sell these crusies and is a must see for all visitors.

From the Black Sea - Bosphrous - Sea of Marmara - Aegean, to the Mediterran. Way to go!. As the world's narrowest Strait - about 31 ks long and an average of about a kilometer wide - it is the boarder between Asia and Europe, and has the Golden Horn as an estuary. Also, it is the major sea access route for Russia and the Ukraine.In World War One a place called Gallipoli saw the Turks turn back the Allies.If you like a view of the Strait, take a trip over the Fatih Sultan Mehmet Suspension Bridge. But you can instead take a train ride under the water in the Undersea Railway Tunnel which opened in October 2013.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Short tour on the public ferry Sehir. Was a lovely day so nice and smooth. The extra audio guide was a good option for 10 lira. Beware the toilets. Often Turkish squat style or just plain gross. Don't drink too much liquid!

Ortaköy. Have been there to party with my friends,Ortaköy and bebek are the locations for a bit more expensive restaurants but very quality discos and after party bars..you can see the bosphorus bridge by then..
May 23 - 29 - Istanbul. Beautiful and scenic. Peaceful waters.The views of the buildings on the shore add to its scenery. The Bosporous bridge is reminiscent of the Golden Gate at SF.

Istanbul's best feature. Hop a local ferry with a "simit" ring (best ones are from the Karakoy area, close to the actual bakery) and take in the Bosphorus from the water. Tea used to be sold in glasses, but the paper cups now used are perhaps more sanitary, albeit with less character. There is no bad time of year for a Bosphorus boat ride--the Bosphorus is lovely in all seasons.

See the Turkish Riviera on the cheap.. This is a perfect way to see a part of Istanbul that's not crowded with cars, shops, cafés, people and cats! It's a fascinating and beautiful stretch of water with some gorgeous houses and palaces, mosques and forests areas on show. Sit back and relax and imagine what it would have been like living in some of these places. And then imagine how much work it would be to maintain them and unless you're fabulously wealthy and can afford an army of servants (in which case why are you on the public ferry?) thank your stars you don't live there now ...imagine all the vacuum cleaning and washing them windows! Don't both with an organised tour - they're expensive and no different to the local ferry which offers a 2 hour tour for 12 TL. It's really easy to find. Go to the ferry port at eminou, look for the ferry kiosk just near the underside of the Galatta Bridge (follow your nose - it's just near the fish cafés!). The tour is clearly advertised, it leaves at 4.30 pm but get there half an hour early. It's a huge ferry so little chan of missing out on a seat. Don't bother with the audio guide - it has very little information other than the names of the buildings (a mix of palaces, private residences, mosques and schools) and the back stories are pretty basic - built by a sultan or rich person either as a palace or summer residence. Famous people from days gone by were hosted there. Yep that's it! Have lunch before hand at a restaurant around the Bridge - there are many to chose from but most have the same menu. We went to the very last on the northern side. Really cute little place with quirky wooded tables and benches covered in cushions. Has a great choice of the usual Turkish fare (the lentil soup is really lovely) as well as pizza, pastas, burgers and toasted sandwiches and potato wedges for those who are feeling Turkished out. Great choices for kids.

Day teip on Sehir Hatlari government ferry. There are many day trips along the Bosphorus. You can pay an awful lot of money to the touts who hang around the docks at Eminonu, or walk straight up to the Sehir Hatlari ferry terminal and buy a ticket for 25TKL - about US$9. The ferry for the day trip leaves at 10.35 but if you want a seat in the open on the top deck you need to get there by about 10.00am. The ferry makes 3 or 4 stops on its way towards the north end of the Bosphorus strait and arrives Anadolu Kavağı about 12.15. There's then a 3 hour wait and you can walk to the ruined castle at the top of the hill and have lunch at any number of restaurants at the top of the hill or next to the ferry. Return time is 3pm and it takes about 90 minutes to returnI gave this three stars. It's not my kind of thing as I like to be active. We did this on day 4 of our trip when we thought we'd like to have a rest from sightseeing. The 3 hour wait at lunch is an hour too long. On a warm sunny day it should be quite pleasant but it was grey and cloudy and the river and surrounds didn't really look their best when we went.

Nice but very Crowded. This is the old city, with the view of ottomen homes, great view of the blue mosque, bhosphorurs river. You can take the river cruise of just walk on the bridge ans watch people fishing. The place is always crowded, there is boat which is docked which makes excellent fish dishes, try not to miss it, but its crowded like crazy.

Cruising the Bosphorus. I took a half day tour that included a bus ride past the old city walls that included a trip to the Spice Market and then the 1 1/2 hour boat ride. Our guide recommended that the view was better on the right side of the boat. If possible, try to take the boat ride on a clear day. Many of my pictures look very gray as it was overcast.
wonderful boat ride. This is a must to do. Take the morning boat ride with stops. Be sure to get off and see the villages up and down the Bosphorus. It is worth an entire day trip.

Beautiful Bosphorus. A great way to see the City from a different perspective. See the old ottoman homes along the Bosphorus gives you an idea of how the city used to be. From this perspective you can appreciate the changing times, with the modern skyscrapers on the horizon and the wooden homes on the shore. Take a boat trip up the Bosphorus and marvel at the Bosphorus Bridge and Rumelli Fortress. Wonderful!

Rest for Tired Feet, Views to Please. After walking for hours from early morning to see the historic sights and shop in the Grand Bazaar, I found my way to the public ferry. Many families and friends were sharing the ride. Whether seated on top or within the cabin, one got a good view of the historic buildings and fortifications and million-dollar homes. With a guidebook, you can identify main buildings — or just enjoy the view. The hot apple tea was just right; the Turkish family that sat at the table with me shared their fruit. We smiled and exchanged the few words we knew in common. Late that afternoon walking back to Hotel Amira from the Hagia Sophia and fountain, a family of four smiled broadly and waved to me as I approached them on the walkway. I returned the greeting to my Turkish family.
Half day enough. We had a good guide and saw some good things - Maidens Tower, Rumeli Fortress - but if I had to miss anything, it would be this. Half day enough

The Venice feeling. Travelling along the Bosphorus Strait by boat reminded us of Venice - there are so many splendid palaces to be seen along the way, very close to the water. You also get good glimpses of the most expensive living areas of the city. The boat can take you to s mall fishing village where fresh fish for lunch is a delicious option.

A cruise on the Bosphorous.. This was a very agreeable way to get to see the layout and the vastness of Istanbul. Really interesting to see the Asian side and the European side. Our particular guide was very good, and knew his stuff, making it all the more enjoyable. A nice change from the hordes of people milling about everywhere on land!
One of the few worthwhile cruises. The strait is constantly fascinating with an intoxicating mix of palaces mansions and districts . Take the 12tl boat from the Spice Market . Fast and comfortable .

Impressive. One can’t imagine this strait in reality since would never be there to see it with his own eyes.I think God wanted to show again His power by creating this strait between two continents. It’s so long, but at the same time with so high shores, and then during time the city embroidered the shores with so many nice palaces, villas, hotels and other building which during the night makes it to look like we can see the pictures with the Earth Planet cities seen during night from the space. Many and millions tiny lights all around, on one and on the other shore, with 2 cherries on the top: the two trans-continental awesome bridges crossing majestically the strait. Both during day and during night these bridges are looking exactly as they are: pieces of modern engineering art.And then, go to take the sea buses for a boat trip under the bridges, and enjoy all the scenery, all the nice view of the pretty building, old and new, of the both shores. It’s making all money!
An amazing ride. take the public ferry. Well priced, big boat and enjoy the view. Good idea to have a guidebook so that you know what you are seeing since no narrator.
A quiet little ferry ride.. Just catch a ferry don't bother with expensive tour boats! Sit back and relax with a cool drink as you watch the old and new of this region go past.

MMMMM not a great 5 hours. We did a 5 hour boat trip up the Bosphorus Strait and could have given it a miss. Lunch was supplied and was almost the same as breakfast. It was marketed as going into the Black sea but it stop short of it at the new bridge being build and leaves you disappointed. Well I was. It dropped us off on the Asia side at Anadolu Kavagi where we walked up to an old castle and the view to the Black sea and back up the Bosphorus Strait was amazing. Than it was a sail back to Istanbul where the old buildings were pointed out to us. Mildly interesting.
There's not a same place in all over the world. . I visited so many countries and so many cities but I didn't see such a beautiful place in the world. It is unique.
The best, it was our first experience and we loved it. very nice trip, not short not long just right, we enjoyed the trip and the scene.I would recommend for all people visiting this lovely city.
Bosphorus cruise. Take a cruise it's a must about 12 Tl,1.5 hrs ,u get to see the area around Istanbul,residential areas .great water views as u leave the harbour.
Good cruise. Wonderful to cruise the Strait. Many dodgy operators offering cruises. Get a recommendation from your hotel about best service.
Interesting. We did the full trip to the Black Sea and back and thought it too long with not a lot to view on the way. 3 hours spent at the end was far too long.

A different View. Its nice to be able to see both the European and Asian sides from the water, it gives you a new appreciation of the landscape.
Some beautiful buildings along the waters edge.
Worth doing
A ferry travel along the Bosphorus is a must. You will have one foot in Asia and one in Europe as the ferry moves along the Bosphorus. Some include lunch and a stop near the Black Sea.

Fantastic views and a good way to see Istanbul. we took the public ferry leaving at 10.30am from down near the bridge at Spice market.Cost is 25 tl return which is a bargain.The ferry starts selling tickets around 9 and the rush to board at around 10. Depart at 10.30. You make several stops and arrive at 12 near the Black Sea.We had lunch at one of the numerous cafes along the riverside catching a lovely breeze on the warm day.We returned at 3 arriving at Istanbul wharf around 4.30There are enough seats for everyone, but if you want to sit outside under cover you need to be there before say 9.30am.Got to see how the ship operate, and a lovely day.recommended over tours that charge more but do less. This is a public ferry not an organised tour.

Like a movie. When you will be there , you will feel you are like in a turkish movie , excperincing their life and its beautyFresh air , blue sky with some white cotton , and green as long as you can seeWhat the man would ask more than that!

Best to view on a short cruise. There are various offers of short cruises on the bosphorus, ranging from 1,5 hours to 4 hours, the latter covering the whole lenght of the straight. We took the 1.5 hour hop on hop off. You can get off the ship at one station on the european side and at two stops at the asian side. You will see the most interesting parts of the bosphorus this way and it costs only 15 Lira which is about 5.50 Euros or 5.80 US Dollars. They sell also some food and drinks on board.

LinkinG European and Asian waters. on a beautiful day a lovely trip. Try to have a good guide to point out the fabulous old homes built before everything encroached on them. The public rides or ferries give no explanations. You just go to the top, wait at a small restaurant and come back. Make more of it than that.

Beautiful Bosphorus. A boat trip on the Bosphorus is a must when visiting Istanbul. It is amazing that this is the only city in the world divided by a river that is 'internal water'. We were passed by a Russian army boat as we did our trip.You get some fabulous views of various palaces from the water and some of the other suburbs of Istanbul that you may not have had the opportunity to visit.There are many boat companies operating from the harbour near the Galata bridge so finding a trip should not be too diffiuclt.

Worth a boat trip.. We booked a boat trip up the Golden Horn and then around the Bosphorus. The Golden Horn section was 'mixed' with some excellent views of old Istanbul coupled with some derelict and abandoned boat yards. The Bosphorus part was little more interesting with many old buildings, palaces and historic sites. Definitely worth a trip for the €10 each we paid.
Boat Cruise. A great way to see some of the historic locations but from the water. Also a great way to see the homes and neighborhoods in this very large city
Good place for sail n dine. If you want to spend great evening sailing on a ferry with good buffet food, this is the best option. Book early to avoid disappointment.

Bosphorus Cruise. We took at two our cruise on the Bosphorus, It was interesting to see the different sights and we were lucky to have a tour guide with us. He pointed out what significant buildings there were. I was glad it was only two hours as we were tired and it was at the end of the day. It also got quite cold and I wished I had more layers. I did take my favorite picture from Istanbul while on the boat, of a mosque with boats and even a gull. Perfect timing!

The way to see the city.. It was so great to see both the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. Just use the state run Ferry that leaves at 2:30pm and if you have the museum pass it will only cost $9. It is the last ferry before the bridge.
Take a boat trip!. Wether you take a trip with public transport or a 2 hour trip, take a boat. The view is better and you get to see all corners of Istanbul.

The voyager I used was Şehir Hatları. The voyager I used was Şehir Hatları. It was the biggest ship among all. Sailing time is approximately 2 hours from Eminönü terminal. Departure time at 14:30.Route: http://en.sehirhatlari.com.tr/en/timetable/short-bosphorus-tour-363.htmlPrice: http://en.sehirhatlari.com.tr/en/timetable/bosphorus-tours-347.html

An interesting cruise.. We took a 6 hour cruise on the Bosphorus which was very interesting, seeing palaces on the waterside as well as other interesting buildings. It was good to see villages both on the Eupean side and the Asian side. Our final destination where the boat stopped for lunch was almost in sight of the Black Sea. However a 3 hour lunch break was a little too long.

Bosphorus Tour - a must. 6 hour cruise 30TL return ticket departs from Pier 3 at 10.30am. The ticket line starts building from about 9am, with a mad rush for seats on the ferry at 10am. The audio guide costs 10TL but ensure you have a form of ID to leave with them for security. The tour is very informative and picturesque and takes around 90mins to get to the Black Sea. There is a 3 hour break at a coastal town for lunch and a climb to the castle ruins. The tour is a must do while in Istanbul. 2 hour tours are also available, and leave at various times during the day.

Dinner cruise and show while visiting Istanbul. Outstanding evening on the cruise by Turna. Our Hotel helped make the reservations for the meal, show, pick up and delivery back to the Hotel. We had one hoot of a time with a lively show, a good meal, and finally dancing the night away. Drinks were plentiful and we enjoyed the party deluxe. We felt like we were back in college and having one of the greates times of our life. We highly recommend this and the Bosphorus is a sight to behold. Enjoy!

Lots to see!. We were luck as we were in Istanbul for a wedding on a boat which cruised the Bosphorus, both by day and night. There are lots of boat trips to choose from but I'd probably recommend a hop-on hop off tour as there are lots of places to visit along both the European and Asian sides.

Beautiful just Beautiful. I was attending a business function in Istanbul and we were lucky enough to be brought on a evening Bosphorus cruise. Istanbul was beautiful from here and it gave a real sense if how amazingly historic Istanbul is. Amazing buildings along the coast and amazing views of the bridges between Europe and Asia.Food was good but not amazing, dancing was fun.Great experience.

great way to see the city without traffic hassles. There are a number of cruises ranging from cheap to more expensive + from a bit over an hour to half a day (from Istanbul up to the black sea) and even ferries to cross it. The best views from the water are from the Golden Horn harbour up to the 2nd bridge crossing from the European to the Asian side. This takes about 2 hours and I found this was the best option (but don't take the really cheap cruise, which really packs people on smaller boats and makes moving around difficult). This is a protected but busy waterway so the water is relatively smooth and is a relaxing way to see the city without being stuck in traffic.

Enjoyable boat ride. Beautiful boat ride down the Bosporus straits. Used the government ferry - was very comfortable, easy seating and relatively inexpensive. Very good views of some beautiful buildings, homes and architecture en route.

Wish we could do this crouise again and again and again!!. Being Greek means that you will hear about the beauty of Bosporus a thousand times in a lifetime! So,I thought that they might be exaggerating... NOPE!! Everything was true!! The view you get to see is AMAZING!! See for yourselves!!
Fun!. The river is at the heart of this city, so any visit here must include a trip down or across the Bosphorus. Preferably on a smallish boat and not on a big, crowded river cruise.

One of must!!!. We did the public bosphorus tour the one leaves at 10 30 by the bridge and went all the way to the black sea.our turkish frinend was with us so he explained us lots of things about boshphorus surroundings.palaces.villas.mansions.a definetly must do and dont miss try calamari in that black sea district.

Evening cruice endning in party. We took a cruice-boat down the Bosphorous: The first part of the trip was just beautiful: Watching the sunset and the lights of the shores and taking in the sights. Then Turkish cuisine - average and to be expected for a group cruice boat. The came the entertainment. the bellydancer was crap, but the folklore dancers made up for her shortfall. The trip ended in the harbour with music and dancing. we had a great time and made new friends onboard.

Ride the ferry boat. The best way to see the Bosphorus is by the Ferry boat. Get on at Eminonou and ride to the end. If you have an Istanbul Card, which is the best deal for getting around, just swipe your card and ride. Get off at the different stops and check out the local cafes. You can eat on many of the boats and of course drink tea.

River Cruise on the Bosphorus. It was fantastic!! Looking at the architechual designs of the different periods, the different mansions & palaces, seeing the bridge all very informative and educational

atmospheric like nowhere else!!!!. incredible view of the Boshorus.....magnificent bridges..the fishermen lined up by the walkway.....beautiful boats bobbing on the waves..delicious fish caught and served in nearby restaurants...sun shine and incredibly beautiful sunset in the evening...perfect time to walk along after six..perfect place to propose marriage too! lively bustling atmosphere....just wonderful...has to be experienced...

Absolutely wonderful!. If you are in Istambul, you must get on one of the boats that take you up to the Black Sea. It offers a unique view of the city and its Northern suburbs, as well as a welcome quiet moment away from the bustling crowds. A great escape, really worth it!

Lives up to all your expectations. We took two boat trips up the Bosphorus and enjoyed seeing the life and history visible from both the "Europe" and "Asia" sides. Ramparts and ruins, old and new villas worth millions of dollars. Grand old palaces and hotels. Plus cool modern and "everyday" things, restaurants, mosques, etc. If you are interested in Istanbul, you should absolutely visit the Bosphorus.

Great Waterway - Suggest 2 hour cruise. We have never travelled on the Bosphorus despite visiting Istanbul several times.
We used TSC tours and we did a 2 hour cruise with a guide, Mustufa, who explained all as we went along.
Thoroughly enjoyed this remarkable waterway

Interesting And Special Only Because Of The name. It is a busy waterway and has some magic about it but it looks pretty much like any similar patch of water between two land masses. Worth a visit by boat or across one of the bridges.

Don't be fooled!. You MUST see Istanbul from the water, especially on a beautiful sunny day, but beware of expensive tourist cruises - the local ferry or a local cruise from Eminonu will take you on an hour-and-a-half round trip for around 12 lira ($6AUD). Very easy and enjoyable!
Nightly Cruise. Super ! Nice boat , show , food , scenery and service . It is a must activity . Lots of fun and dancing
A nice cruise exploring. We enjoyed a few wines and beers aboard this cruise. It was a nice way to see the houses and buildings that you can not see from the road.

Be a smart Bosphorus Cruise traveller!. Well worth the trip - the views from the boat are great and there's a recorded commentary in English. BUT, beware the touts who hang around the mosques and try to sell you this trip for 10 Euros or more - you can just go down to Pier 3 at the harbor yourself and pay 14 Turkish lira or so.
A must see. This is the excellent place to see where the continents meet... Especially April and May are the best times to see.. Must be seen day and night...

Relaxing Bosphorus Cruise. The Bosphorus Cruise was quite relaxing. The cruise offered two types of tickets, regular and VIP. For the VIP, you'll get to be in a lounge on the 2nd floor. Quite nice, though was very quiet. They also serve food and drinks on the cruise. :)
Take the local ships. if you want to see this part of Istanbul, you should take the local ships. You would have the local adventure.

One side Europe and the other Asia. Great feeling. A great fun way to sail on the Bosphorus and enjoy the sights...
I would suggest that you look for a tour which leaves before the sunset so you get both daylight and evening scenery.

Lovely lovely. You have undressed my heart
And left it naked cold unbeat anymore
By the strait of Bosphorus...
Even the Contantinople wall shade its face
splendid. very beautiful , boat ride is very enjoyable (takes about 2 hours) and one can see old Istanbul from the boat, many palaces and mosques. It definitely worth a visit by boat!

Do what the local do... ride a ferry. We took a slow trip across the straight on a public ferry. Gentlemen were drinking tea, families were sitting together and we got a great view of both sides of the strait. It's not really a tourist thing- it's how local people travel to work and back home. For this reason I recommend it.

Bosphorus love. Beylerbeyi eat mussels, Çengelköy under the special bir tree breakfast, anadolu kavağı fresh fish, kanlıca with povder suggerd traditional yogurt. In europe side, beşiktaş çarşı kokoreç (?!), ortaköy grilled potatos, in Bebek area eat waffle, baltalimanı mixed sandwich, sarıyer fresh fish.

Beautiful, windy, impressive. Strategically, one of the most important spots in the world. It is peculiar that the Brits don't have it. Mind you, they tried (last time when they conducted an act of aggression against Turkey on Galipoli, with porely lead Brit and Anzac troops by Churchill), and they lost. Leaving Turkey as the one and only master of this important and beautiful region. You can take a boat ride along the Bosphorus and enjoy the views on both sides. You will see the old town, both sultan castles, hundreds of expensive villas, the modern part of the city. Just bare in mind that it is windy. But you will enjoy it, surely.

Boat ride is worth it!. Make sure you plan a couple of hours to take the boat ride. This is a very nice way to see both sides of Istanbul. Take a snack with you. There are some simple snacks on the boat and they are expensive and not very good.

Escape the bustle..... Istanbul is a very busy, bustling, vibrant city, and you can feel exhausted with the crowds and non stop sightseeing. Here's the perfect remedy - go on a couple of hours' boat cruise up the Bosphorus! It's unbelievably beautiful, silent and peaceful, you glide past palaces, mosques, historic ruins, the breeze on the water cools the hot sunshine, and you feel utterly restored. It's a chance to see that iconic skyline from the waterfront, to take super photos, to relax on deck and just chill out. We stopped at the House Hotel at Ortaky on the Asian side, and sat in their outdoor cafe, amid cascading scarlet geraniums in pots along the staircase, sipping iced coffee and feeling all was well with the world, before driving back over the Bosphorus bridge to our hotel in Sultanahmet. Blissful!

A lovely way to see Istanbul. Having spent a couple of days doing the sites we opted for a boat trip. There are many on offer, all much the same. Great views, just one tip, try and sit on the left side to get the best look at the wonderful palaces up the riverside.

Public Ferry Trip. This is a very inexpensive way to comfortably travel up the strait. It was 25 Turkish lire (about $10.00 US). The inside is climate controlled and the windows are huge. Do rent the audio history box, but make sure it works before you leave. It is easy to share these between travelers because you click on a dot for the report for each place you see. Sit on the left side of the boat both ways to get the best sunlight for pictures. You get ample time for lunch up near the Black Sea. It stops so quickly at the other locations, you hardly realize it has done anything.

Nice to do if you have time. We took ferry for about an hour and half round trip. More than enough. Cost 12 turkish lire per ticket. Announcements made in both Turkish and English. Ferry leaves from pier just beyond the spice market.

Bosphorus trip. just a must do 2 hour boat trip that shows you a lot of sites that can only be viewed from a boat
Well worth the 12 TL it cost!!

Bosphorous Audio guided tour. We took the longer tour with audio. Suggest you test the audio device before leaving the desk (ID is taken as a form of security) as the ear piece in one did not function, and it is a bit of a nuisance having to back track, when you come off the boat to get (past the entrance barrier which blocked us) to return the audios. It might be more helpful if travellers could select one side upstream, and other side downstream, to listen as having to crane way over to the other side of the strait is a challenge. The castle of Youros is worth a visit. A handy map is supplied with the purchase ticket showing all points of interest along the coast.

Beautiful view and a great time to relax. Get a view of both the Europe side and the Asia side of Istanbul, and instead of looking at the view of the sea from the city, you'd be looking at the view of the city from the sea. I'd advise you to take the 90 mins cruise or the 2 hours cruise (they're operated by 2 different boat companies - there are more options) instead of the 6 hour cruise as it gets boring after 90 minutes of just sightseeing. Traditional local refreshments like cay (tea) and water rice crackers, etc are available for sale (really cheap, too!) onboard.
Impressive. A chance to see all Istanbul, both continents, from the water, and truly appreciate, overview this amazing city!

Awesome to see. Fascinating sight to see. I stood there picturing the rich history that is behind this place. The hustle and bustle of water traffic was interesting to watch, as we drank American coffee on a sidewalk café.
Exotic. by day and night a great place to be. Lively and nice. Dividing east and west with great history meaning. Take a dinercruise to see the most with a nice show on board.

Take a ferry. For a cheap outing take one of the ferries from the area located not far from the spice markets, and head out into the Bosphorous, lots of fun and a good way to see the outer city coastline. After the ride, walk over the bridge to the modern side, and return under, where there are heaps of bars and restaurants. Nothing better than a cold Effes Beer looking out over the water.
