Cold March evening to see Asia on one side & Europe the other. Turyol - The shipping company with which we took the Bosphorous cruise was a wonderful experience. The weather was outstanding (I like the cold). And they play some awesome (sometimes loud) Turkish music too! Asia on one side and Europe the other, you would end up enjoying the best of both these continents. The Apple Tea... yeah.. it is wonderful onboard!It is possible to see some wild dolphins if you are lucky!

Mini Cruise. If you get the chance to take a cruise on the Bosphorus Strait, DO IT. You get to see both sides of Istanbul, the Asian & the European. You can also purchase refreshments on board. When you do this cruise you pass no more than six (6) Royal; Palaces on the waterfront. Enjoyed it immensely.

The short cruise. Was told to just go down to the wharf and take a short cruse and not bother with a guide or hiring the head set. I wonder if I would have got more out of the trip it I had got the commentary. Glad I did it but I think there is probably more to it than I got out of it. It wasn't an expensive trip.

How many Don't Miss places can one city have?. Guess you can tell I was totally impressed and amazed by Istanbul. First trip there and although saw all the must do places, there is so much more out there! We actually did the Bosphorus twice in one day. In the afternoon, took the Sultanahmet tram to the end at Kabatas and took the hop on hop off cruise up the Bosphorus, which goes close to the shoreline so you can see all the palaces, residences and parks as you go. There are about five places where you can get off and then take a later boat to continue and eventually get back to downtown where you got on. We got off at Ermigan Park for the tulip festival - amazingly beautiful. Boat goes to second bridge and turns to cruise close to the Asia side. More beautiful homes and buildings. Also many waterside restaurants that look inviting. After a short break, enjoyed one of the dinner cruises with cultural dancing, and it wasn't just belly dancing, but included dances in turkish costumes and was a nice way to end our stay in Istanbul.

Bosphorus Trip. Nice trip by Boat, take with you some bread for Birds, dont forget your camera otherwise you will regret all the time, nice shots and difference views all over the trip..i like it and will go again ...

lovely. well with a visit. its easy to get to and there is plenty to see :)we went on th local ferry which was inexpensive and just as comfy. we travelled to the Asian side and stayed a while before we travelled back. all very easy and beautiful to see.

Take the 2 hour boat tour.. This was a lovely tour. Make sure you take the 2 hour tour that leaves at 2:30 PM each day. This tour will take you all along the Europe side and then return on the Asia side. It's 15 TYL. They will try to charge you more but insist on 15 TLY. Well worth it. I suggest a guide if you don't know Istanbul well. If you come from your hotel taxi you will need to hire a taxi by the Spice Market. Negotiate..it should not cost you more than 30 TYL to get to the hotel but they will try to charge you 70. It very okay to negotiate. Just move to the next taxi and you will eventually find a reasonable driver.

Our #1 Istanbul experience. One of the great urban waterways anywhere. Fascinating and beautiful in itself, it is the key to the geography - and hence the history - of Istanbul. Take a whole day and go all the way to the Black Sea. Make sure stops include at least the following: Ortaköy Mosque (under the Bosphorus Bridge); Rumeli Fortress; Küçüksu Palace; and the Black Sea proper. We went with IBO Tours and Cruises: there was a delay co-ordinating with a half-day cruise and the lunch was average, but they get our vote for the things that matter: the comfortable boat and very knowledgeable and personable guide.

cheapest way to have bosphorus cruise. all the private tours providing half day bosphorus cruise cost a minimum of 25 or 30 euros for a 2 hour cruise...and they have a fixed time for the tour either in morning or eveninif you want to just have cruise on the bosphorus and see the city on either side of bosphorus strait just go to eminonu pier and buy the ticket from TURYOL company for yourself at any time which is convenient for you...it leaves every hour and the cost is just 12 lira per person... the cruise lasts for 90minutes...it takes you upto the second bridge and back....the best part is it does not sail in the middle of water it sails closer to the shore so that you can have a good view of the city... before you board take a fish sandwich for 8 lira so....the whole trip with a sandwich cost me only 20 liras which is less than 8 eurostip----take a seat on the left side of the cruise this will give a good view of the city...
Excellent. Two hours on the Cruise, nice weather, cheap and value for money. Enjoyed alot.All facilities are available like Tea, Coffee, Washroom. etc.

Boat ride down the Bosphorous Strait. We visited Istanbul and being from Scotland we found it extremely hot so the boat ride down the Bosphorous Strait was a sweet relief from the heat and constant walking. Very relaxing. We enjoyed a 2 hour boat ride which was a fantastic way to see a lot of the sights of Istanbul, especially on a tight time frame. Loved every minute!
Must Do in Istanbul!!!!. The boat ride down the Bosphorous is something you cannot afford to miss while you are there. The chilling wind and the beautiful strait is absolutely breathtaking.

BOAT RIDE DOWN THE BOSPHOROUS. We just LOVED the ride down the Bosphorous under the bridges with the ability to see both sides: Turkey and Asia! All the buildings and homes were so interesting and it was a lovely ride.

A pleasant jaunt up the Bosphorus.. The Bosphorus Strait is literally just the area of sea that goes from the Golden Horn, Sea of Marmaris up to the Black Sea. Boats plow these straits and it is very interesting to take one of the trips that goes to Anadolu, the last stop before the Black Sea. The boats criss cross the Straits. there are some fascinating stops for lunch along the way. If you are visiting Istanbul this trip is worth taking if you want to get away from the City, and see more of Turkey on a very pleasant jaunt up the Bosphorus.

Surreal experience!. Since the very first beginning of our journey to always admired Istambul from Madrid, we were fully impressed by the hospitality of the crew and officers of Turkish Airline! Flight attendant were beautiful, stunning and smiling jointly with Turkish Chef in charge of superior quality food. The magic start there!!! Bosphorus strait is magnificent with such an strategic importance, regardless to say it is the main gate to the Black sea! Speechless views, breathtaking panoramic of Europe and Asia within a unique country! Smooth and safe navigation make this straight another must to visit! Passing under the Bosphorus bridge is another story! Please make an effort and visit, it pay off!!!

Treat yourself to a Bosphorus cruise. Take a round trip on the Bosphorus and see the beautiful houses, palaces, fortresses and bridges up close and personal. And such a bargain, a 2 hour rest for 15 Turkish lire. Find the boats at the end of tram line 1.

Historic view from the water. We took a five hour cruise up the Bosphorus to the mouth of the Black Sea where we stopped at a charming fishing village. We had a marvelous meal and then climbed the hill to view the ruins of Yoros Castle. Sailed by so much history...wonderful afternoon.
Istanbul from the water. We went on a half day cruise on the Golden Horn and Bosphorus. Lots of interesting sites to see plus an hour stop before returning to the dock.

Enjoyable way to spend an evening. We thoroughly enjoyed our cruise which cost 35 euros per person. This included a three course meal and free unlimited alcoholic drinks together with entertainment including a belly dancer. Another interesting way to view the city.
Great cruise. Evening cruise with show and meal was so delightful. A definite repeat. View during the cruise was beautiful and worth it. Food was also good but not fantastic.
Fascinating landscape. I look at the Bosphorus Strait like I would look at a live canvas where the painting is changing constantly more beautiful, more breathtaking every time.

Great views. Enjoyed our trip along the Bosphorus. Was interesting to see the buildings and contrast from both European and Asian sides. The weather was great-lots of photo opportunities. Was cool to see the other users of the waterways from fishermen to huge cargo ships. Definitely worth while and quite relaxing to be on the water
beautiful stretch of water. this strait really defines Istanbul and makes it the city it is. Take a boat trip and really enjoy seeing both sides, with mosques and houses en route.

a must for a visit. Lots of tourist just visit old part of the city and beyoglu region but they miss pearl of Istanbul, Bosphorus, and even sightseeing from the sea does not mean as walking and feeling nature from the land is a must. just walk all shoreline of Bosphorus both either European or Asian side and you justify me
Chill. Go to the Asian side by ferry or car and chill in front of the Maiden island, looking at Istanbul. Relaxing.

A must do. Cruising along the Bosphorus was one of the highlights of our trip. The boat was very nice and buffet lunch was delicious. The guide was very helpful and the price was well worth it. 35 euros for a 5 hour cruise including free drinks and a buffet lunch.
Would do it again if I returned to Istanbul.

Views of the city from the water. Really enjoyed our cruise on the Bosphorus eventhough the weather wasn't the best. It certainly would have been stunning if the sun had been shining
It was really interesting to see the city from a different perspective. I imagine the waterway would be a bit chaotic in summer, but that is half the fun of Istanbul

Cruising the Bosphorus - a great way the spend an afternoon. Cruising the Bosphorus strait was a really nice experience. Both sides are very nice, the bridges majestic and the whole scenery beautiful.

Cheap crossing. We didn't try the ferry tours instead used our Istanbulkart card and used local ferries to cross the Bosphorous to the Asian side cost 2.15TL per crossing a nice cheap way to sail the Bosphorous.

A highlight to appreciate the unique setting of Istambul. We came into Istamboul harbour our a cruise ship and also took a 2 hour boat tour of the harbour. The views are uncomparable and some of the most impressive in the world. It helped us better appreciate the setting and the breadth of this magnificient city during that and our most recent visit where we took the ferry to the Asian area.

Bosphorus Ferry woderful. It was a beautiful day and we thoroughly enjoyed the ferry ride and our photos are fantastic. We had our own private guide who explained the area so it was more enjoyable knowing all of the history

Think I might pop over to Asia for lunch..... Now how often do you get to say that?The Bosphorus Strait is the perfect place to check out Istanbul. Oh sure you'll want to head into the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace during your trip but you owe it to yourself to get out on the water at least once to see these places from water level. It's actually more fun when you know what these places look like and can pick them out (or have a local do that for you).Beyond the viewing options afforded of the various Mosques and palaces is the fact that the water is quite placid. It is a straight so there is no problem with swell etc for those prone to sea sickness etc.If possible it would be ideal to get out on the water at least twice. Once at night and then once during the day. And before you go to Istanbul make sure you are aware of the Istanbulkart system. Because honestly just getting a normal public ferry across the Strait is a fun exercise and you don't need an expensive fancy tourist boat to get the view!

Good day trip. Go straight to the bosphorus ferry terminal and buy your ticket direct. Plenty of touts selling you "day trips" and most just put you on this ferry anyway. 25L return. 2 hour trip with 2 stops to the headland, where you see a large tower on a hill and the boat turns around. Get off, follow the crowd as everyone walks up the hill. Quite steep but take it slow, can easily be done in 45 mins. Walk around the tower, take in the views. Walk down, have some food (we went for the cheapest, cafeteria style local place in the corner rather than the expensive seafood restaurants with people trying to drag you in.) Then the ferry comes and picks you up and takes you back (1 1/2 hours). Good day out.
Take a cruise and enjoy. Lovely to take a cruise along, well worth a visit. We were with a group so not sure where you organise the cruises from.

When in Turkey ..Do what I did !. This is a MUST take a ferry for 2hrs up the Bosphorus & enjoy the History. Truely Beautiful.! cheap & comfortable, there are many ferries that cruise the waterways & they leave regularly, The beer is awesome, what a way to spend the afternoon.

High Point. We took the tour by the ferry, the long tour and I highly recommend it. There are some locals but mainly tourists take this ferry and it is the best bargain in Istanbul. I honestly enjoyed it more than the museums/mosques. Very limited seating outside and it was not particularly warm the day we visited so inside was good!! Be reasonable early or you might have trouble getting a seat.

Take a tour to see most of it. Bosphorus is great when you take the boat ride to see Istanbul from the sea. You can take longer tour, like half day or full day to see Bosphorus and other sea, or you can take the cheaper option, Bosphorus tour at Eminönü Gezi İskelesi. Try to do, at least once, the one during sunset. You will see Istanbul becomes alive, with lights from the buldings, people dining at waterfront, and huge bridges connecting european and asian sides lit by colorful lights.

People and the sea. There is much beauty, both natural and edifices! On one hand the sea in the strait, on the other hand how people were able to use the land, sea and intelligence to create something wonderful! If it's a clear day, one can see both sides of the strait, the multitude of boats and ships that move, castles and beautiful shores and vegetation. It is a delight to the senses of sight and hearing! It is a "must do"!
Exciting Istanbul. Dynamic place loaded with ancient curiosities to discover!and wonderful food! Especially the grilled sardines!

Great 2 hours on the Bosphorus. We planned on going on a boattrip on the Bosphorus. Walked to the harbour on west of the bridge over the Golden horn. We where "attacked" by a friendly salesperson offering us a boattrip. We took hour chances and ... suddenly where on a bus with a schoolclass. Very nice trip to the boat.Two hours on the strait seeing all the sights. Well worth it.

The life of the whole city is here.. Wherever you are in Istanbul the water calls to you. A boat trip up the Bosperous in the evening with dinner on board is an unmissable experience. You glide passed the ancient palaces and under 21st century bridges for an unforgetable evening.

Sailing on the Bosphorus - View of the Asian vs European side of Istanbul. Leisurely cruise along the bosphoru gives you a birds eye view of old istanbul vs new istanbul - Asian vs European side of istanbul. while on t cruise you will notice the distinct differences in the architecture from the asian vs the european side. You will have an amazing view on the water of the Spice Bazaar, a few mosques along the way,the Galata tower bridge and much more as you move a long. Tip: Take a neck scarf with as it becomes chilly on the water the furthur in you go. all in all a nice excursion on the water.

Nice but bit boring. We went on Bosphorus tour and we did enjoy the scenes of all the charming historical building and the bridges that connect Asian to European sides..but trip took up to two hrs and we got a bit bored at the end..Also if you are going when weather is cold, ensure that you wear heavy clothes coz it will get freezing!

Lovely crossing of the Bosphorus Strait. Walking on the bridge that crosses the Bosphorus Strait was a real pleasure: A lot of tourists were also passing by, enjoying the view of the Strait. In addition, we had the opportunity to taste some local desserts from street vendors and watch the numerous people that were actually fishing using fishing rods.In some parts, there is a lower walk under the bridge, which lets you get really close to the sea (the level from which the tourist boats exist); make sure that you spend some time there, too, and you may also find some restaurants offering traditional dishes.In any case, you get a lovely view from the bridge during sunset, so you'd better keep that in mind!
Nice cruise. The cruise is enjoyable and unexpensive- again, this is at its best with a good guide, either a book or a person, to tell you about all the different buildings. I saw dolphins as well!

Cruise on the Bosphorus. We took a four hour cruise on the Bosphorus as part of a tour and it was fantastic! The sights from the strait was breathtaking; castles, mosques, palaces from the water sight rival those in Italy. A pod of dolphins played along our boat for about a mile so we were very excited to see them! Bring a jacket for the cruise since it does get windy. You will see a lot of commercial boat traffic since it connects to the Black Sea and you will see some locals fishing in their small boats. Highly recommend everyone takes a cruise to fully appreciate seeing Istanbul from the strait.

Perfect way to rest your tired feet. Istanbul is all about walking and taking in the various sights. So what better way to continue with your sightseeing while sitting down and letting the sights flow past. We boarded the boat at Ortakoy and spent 70 min going up and down the Bosphorus for 12 TL. Make sure you got a jacket with you. It can get chilly even on a warm day.

Ferry to asia. We went to the port in istanbul and caught the commuter ferry from the European side to the Asian side. It only cost 4 turkish lira, you buy a coin token each way that activates the turnstiles, in all fairness there's not as much going on at the far side, but it is a cheap easy way to travel over the Bosphorus

Fascinating architectural local. Would have loved to have stayed longer and wish I could have sailed the strait, sadly I was stuck above, but it was a delightful place to have a picnic on a marble picnic site (table and benches) with wonderful turkish cuisine and strong dark coffee.

walking the Bosphorus. For those that want to get out and stretch their legs, you can walk quite some way along the Bosphoros we walked from Kabatas ferry terminal to the Faith Sultan bridge(the second bridge across the Bosphoros) the distance is 10km. The first 3km to the Bosphoros bridge is along a path that runs behind the Dolmabahce Sarayi Museum a stunning piece of architecture. Before you reach the Bosphoros bridge their is a cute little wharf called Beskitas which is well worth a stop. About 800mtrs after the Bosphoros bridge you reach a pedestrian walkway right on the water that runs all the way to the Faith Sultan bridge. The whole walk is flat and spectacular. You can walk back or grab a cab. The area between the two bridges is very upmarket with plenty of eating opportunities. A great way to stroll along the Bosphoros and take everything in.

Legendary waterway. Where else in the world could you gaze across to Asia, and see the towers of the old bastion occupied by the British during the Crimean war, whilst watching shipping traffic of every type ( from yachts to Russian oil tankers heading south from the Black Sea) , whilst enjoying the sights of a city famous for many centuries, once the centre of the Roman Empire ?Don't forget to have a stroll along the shore and stop for a drink at once of the cafés further out of Central Istanbul

Busy and Fascinating. Take a public ferry ride to see how the Bosphorus dominates Istanbul with its huge number of ships, ferries and pleasure craft crossing every day. We travelled a few times on the ferry to cross to other parts of the city- every time was great experience seeing the city residents go about their daily lives and the touters trying to sell food and gadgets to an uninterested audience!

The Bosphorous is beautiful!. I took a one hour cruise 2 weeks ago and was lucky to get a 70 degree day. The Boshorous is a busy commercial waterway with many ferries, private and commercial, an occasional oil tanker ( always impressive to see up close), cruise ships, fishing boats and and private yachts here and there. Beautiful homes line the coast and the views of both the Asian and European sides of Istanbul are lovely. In good weather I'd consider it a must do if you are in Istanbul.

A must. Take the public ferry it's inexpensive stops at many ports, you can get off and catch the return ferry, you can rent a recorded GPS guide set at the ferry dock that gaves a description of the many sites along the River I would suggest take the ferry for its full saling route, a full day is needed, there are many food vendors at the various dockings along the way
Do take the drinks. A great trip along the Bosphorus the bridges are awesome and the Roman structures just breathtaking but beware the pushy drink salesmen.
Beautiful experience. It was great to view the city from the strait. However, after a while it becomes a little boring if you're not a boat person, which I'm not.Remember to bring an extra sweater!
Cruise Bosphorus Strait. We took a 2 hour cruise for 9 lira from the city pier. It gave a great perspective of the contrasting aspects of this intriguing city, where Europe meets Asia.

To the Black Sea and back.. We travelled with IBO tours (half day cruise 45 euros/person including lunch) and after an overlong bus journey through the teeming city we boarded our boat for the tour.The bus trip does allow you to see lots of the city that you wouldn't normally get to such as the very upmarket Bebek area.The trip lasts about 4 hours and is a wonderfully relaxing thing to do after days of sightseeing in the city.BIg merchant ships,ferries of every description,big bridges,fortresses,fishing villages,smart villas,birds skimming over the Bosphorus,an excellent lunch,a choice of inside/outside seating and loads to see and photograph are the components of this trip which returns much closer to the city at Kabatas,the terminus of the tram.

The jewel of Istanbul. A cruise in evening on the strait or sitting and sipping Cay from either the European or the Asian banks during day time or afternoon is the best way to enjoy this. The evening cruise is better since it offers fantastic views of well-lit Istanbul banks and the bridges which connect both sides. The cruises typically leave between 7-8 pm from Kabatas and it is best to buy the tickets directly from the venue.If however, you are in the area around daytime, sitting on one of the many gardens on the banks (We were on the European side, near Kabatas), with unlimited supply of Cay and Nargile is an equally good idea to enjoy the blue beauty.

Not terrific, but still a must do. A Bosphorus boat tour is one of those must-do activities, even though the experience isn't outstanding. The city has so much to see, and going up the European side and down the Asian side is a novel experience.I was at the dock just as a boat was about to depart for a 90 minute tour. The tout was eager for any additional sale, so he accepted the 11 TL I had. They're flexible. Make them an offer.The outside deck was cold in early April and everyone there ended up inside. But the air was clear and photography was good. Two recommendations for the boat trip: 1) go when the sky is clear, and 2) go when there are big ships on the strait to add to the drama.

Ferry to the Asian side of Turkey. We took a ferry from the dock and only went one stop to the Asian side. The ferry was quick and comfortable, no sea sickness worries. The view back of the city was good. We only had a quick walk around the Asian side and there was nothing much to see and then we caught the ferry back.

See Istanbul from the mighty Bosphorous. A 2 hour cruise on a beautiful day was a highlight of Istanbul tour. The shipping traffic, size and scope of small fishing boats to cargo ships gives an idea of why this was the centre of the world at one time. A must for all visitors.
Wonderful view. The Bosphorus Strait connected from three bridges and worth's to be visited by ship enjoying the beauty of the nature and humans.

4 night trip to istanbul. took the underground metro system from the old town to the Asian side and returned by the local ferry. local transport so cheap it is un believable. lots happening on the bosphorus strait i.e lots of marine shipping coming ang going. plenty of boat tours available if required.

Easter cold weather. Everyone started on top deck. We went straight inside and kept warm and got best seats before the crowds upstairs started shivering and came inside. Snack bar at head fo ship with Tea, Coffee and snacks. Nice lazy watch the world trip.
Bridge connecting Asia and Europe. The Bosphorous bridge was constructed in record time of just three years and connects the Asia side and Europe side of Turkey. Wonderful sight in the night.

take a small ship from eminonu and visit the bosporus. it is great to take the ship from eminonu area and you can choose to go to princess islands or just go for 2 hour trip to bosporus and watch the city fromt he sea.it is worth it.

Best trip of all!. We loved the Bosphorus tour which went from Eminonu to the Black Sea. It is very reasonable and you can buy an audio guide should you wish. We did but really didn't use them as we were so interested in just looking at the beautiful houses and palaces as we went past. After an hour and a half we got off at Anadolu Kavagi, a little fishing village where we were inundated with offers for lunch! We climbed up to castle where we had a lovely view of the Black Sea and the new bridge being built.

Europe & Asia, Just A Bridge!!!. Bosphorus is a beautiful strait especially at nights. There are different ways to take a boat tour. For example you can take a 2 hours cruise boat tour with 15$ or Euro. Even you can take a local ferries that is too cheaper. Moreover, there is an especial cruise boat tour with different hobbies like Arabic dance, live music, free drinks, Turkish dance and finally reception party. It'll take more than 3 hours and only at night. You should pay 40 to 70$ per adult depends on cruise boat that you'll choose. In addition, there is free shuttle service for this boat tour. About clothes, casual clothes or formal clothes, both of them will be suitable, that's your choice. You can have a memorable night and good experience of Bosphorus Strait and great view of Istanbul bridge especially at night. I suggest you take a boat tour and enjoy your time.

A unique experience. Few sights rival the feeling of straddling 2 continents, on a wide sea surface full of ships, with amazing sites all around on the shores. You can see this on any of the standard Bosphorus tours, or even on cheap local ferry boats. Beware of the weather which can change quickly, and on the boat it can get quite cold.
Worth the trip. We took a trip up the Bosphorus and back which took about 3/4 hours. Lovely sunny day with gorgeous views all around. Gives a good idea of the size of Istanbul.

Not to be missed. It's a bit of a bun-fight finding, boarding and securing a decent seat on the regular boat up the Bosphorus; in fact we had to stand for the duration of just under 2 hours up river....but it was worth it! Palaces galore, beautifully restored river mansions, castle, galleries, grand university, giant bridges, giant ships, luxury boats galore. DOLPHINS! Hills covered in April blossom, restored fishing villages on the Asian side, where you stop for a simple fish lunch at one of the many toe-in-the-water establishments drinking black tea and water, of course. On board, wrap up if it's not Summer, my fingers went numb in the April sun!

no need to take one of the tours. It is possible to take a boat tour up the bosphourus strait and it will cost you about 12 tl, but you could buy a travel card, which you might as well buy anyway and jump on one of the local ferries, this will cost you 2tl you can still see all the same sights, get a cup of tea and mingle with the locals.

Amazing ferry tour. We took the boat tour on bosphorus strait from the berth near Kabotas. 1,5hr we traveled along the strait and saw the beautiful places of Istanbul from the sea. It was abit cold, but there a hot tea you can buy there. It's recommended to see the beautiful views of Sultan Ahmet, Ayasofya, Galata tower etc. from the strait.
Beautiful strait. Very stunning. The wind are amazing. Many things will always make you remember this place. Seagull voices are well-matched with this environment. This place are make me happy

Wonderful boat trip. We took the ferry from Eminonu by the bridge which cost 12 lira each for the 1 and a half hour trip. Once into the Bosphorus we cruised up the European side with castles and palaces then turned at the second bridge crossing and returned on the Asiatic side. It was very interesting but sadly the announcements in English were difficult to understand. Well worth it.
Bosphorous Strait. Great boat trips are a fantastic way to see buildings and bridges.Go up the cable cars to see view.Remember your camera.

Great views. I would recommend the trip as a great way to see just how big and beautiful Istanbul is. However maybe it was just the operator that hooked us but the vessel was uncomfortable with seating on the open deck a premium and on the inside cabin uncomfortable at best. At TL 30 for 2 hours value OK but could do with either commentary or hand out map highlighting sites of interest on the day. Make sure you pack a jacket in spring as wind makes it pretty chilly even on sunny days

Use public transport. Take the public transport ferry - only 25tl return. Walk up to the castle. On the way up there are a number of cafés where you can have a snack and take in the views of the Bosphorus from the terrace.
Nice cruise. Just a two hour cruise on the sea. Was romantic and calm, we did the private boat and enjoyed every bit of it, it was just ok but nothing else but cruising

90 minutes of sheer beauty. Take one of the many ferries available for 12 liras each for a 90 minute ride on the bosphorus strait. Goes right up to the Black Sea entrance and covers both sides of the continent!!

Accidental day trip!. Having decided to go on a Bosphorus trip, we were warned not to give in to the 'private' boat trip touts on the dockside who would try to sell us 2 hour cruise trips. Instead we brushed them aside and made for the cheaper local ferry up the Bosphorus. We bought a round trip (25Tl each) and assumed we would stay on the boat until we got back to Istanbul (like you do on the Swiss lakes). But no! After 1.5 hours looking at the lovely scenery upstream towards the Black Sea, we were all told to disembark at Anadolu, a sleepy little Asia side Turkish village just after 12pm and it seemed the next ferry back to Istanbul would be at 3pm. There are many small restaurants and eating places by the quay, but we made a leisurely stroll up to the castle ruins and had a light lunch at a small cafe near the castle. Our table had a magnificent view back down river and we were pleased that we hadn't realised that this was such a lengthy trip! In fact, investigating the ticket, we HAD bought a round trip cruise! So be warned - if you are pushed for time, just go with the private cruises and you will be back in 2 hours. As it was we had a most unexpected trip which we joined at 10:30am and were returned to Istanbul at about 4:30pm. There is no commentary on this service, but we had our DK Istanbul guide book with us, so didn't miss much. A highlight of our trip to Istanbul
A cruise to see many landmarks. Taking a cruise on the Bosphorus Strait, you get to see so many landmarks with so many history in them.

Two Hour Bosphorous Cruise. As noted in previous reviews, there's not much to see on such a short cruise. You show up at the dock near the Galata Bridge, and the next boat scheduled is docked and ready for boarding. So it's easy to do an impromptu cruise if you are already in the area. However, the boats only go to the second Bosphorous Bridge and although pleasant in good weather, the scenery is mainly the port areas of Istanbul and a few residential areas in the more northern part of the cruise. The 5 hour cruise is therefore recommended, as it goes farther up the strait, and leaves the dock around 10:30 AM.

Wonderful cruise. Excellent scenery, lovely cruise, posh properties. Take Sehir Hatlari, it is only 25 TL round trip. At the final destination, A.Kavagi, close to Black Sea, there is not to much too see, expensive food, there was a lot of dust, because there were doing some utility works, the fortrees on the top of the hill is closed and belong probably to the army. I recommned to get off at previous stops like Sariyer.

A good way to see Istanbul's architecture. The Bosphorus Strait is an interesting journey. Day cruises are available, or the local ferry. We did both - a cruise with stops off heading up towards the Black Sea (we got to the Black Sea and turned around) and the local Ferry headed the other way to the Princes Islands. Both were interesting. There are lots of interesting buildings to see from the boats, so its worth doing just to get a feel for how vast Istanbul is! We have seen dolphins in the Strait on previous visits, but not this time, I suspect it was warmer last time.

A trip to Istanbul isnt complete without this boat trip. A good 2 hour boat ride (if you take the short boat ride) that takes you along the asia/europe border. Its relaxing, especially if the weather is cool.

A great Istanbul introduction. This tour gives you the time to settle in, relax and watch the world go by. Your imagination scrambles to think of all the history before you. It's given a verbal guide by the staff to let you know where and what to look for. You do learn a lot of stuff and I appreciate the lifestyle of the city from the sea. The tour gives you time to set a North and South bearings to your city. Time to establish some landmarks for your walks later in the week. It lets you rub elbows with other foriegn travellers who are always interesting. Russian, Italian, you name it. It's a true melting pot. The cruise was the perfect way to get familiar to this wonderful piece of history and it's great people.

Geography. The bit where Europe joins Asia, and where the land bridge between the med and the Black Sea broke around 30k years ago.Lots of history with the various civilizations adding their bit to the area

Golden Horn to the Black sea.. Beautiful views of amazing Mosques and houses. Traveled to the edge of the black Sea. Amazing history and Historic Geography for this region. The Fort makes you wonder how many times the region has changed hands.

Bosphorus Cruise. The view from the cruise ferry which took us on a 2-hour tour across the famous strait separating Europe from Asia was brilliantly breathtaking. A visit to Istanbul would be incomplete without it.

One of the highlightd. We enjoyed a trip on the local ferry along the Bosphorus on a sunny morning. It was a great way to see many of the highlights and sights of the city enjoying the views of the European and Asian side! We got off at Anadolu Kavagi the last stop and found there wasn't a lot to do there as the fortress on the hill is now closed for safety reasons. We decided to take the local bus back which was an interesting experience! The trip is worth doing and probably a lot cheaper to take the local ferry than private cruise.

Bustling Waterway!. Be adventurous and grab a travel card and take a ferry even just to watch the water traffic. A major shipping route to the Black Sea, fisherman and ferries taking the 65% of Istanbul's population that live on the Asian side to work on the European side. Plenty of places to jump off and explore. Provides a great way to see the city from a different angle.

One of the most Amazing Places on Earth!. The Bosphorus is by far one of the most vibrant locations I have traveled to in the world. The cruise is a must for a first time visitor. It's quite awesome to sit and sail through the windy Bosphorus with a view of vibrant Istanbul on both sides.

You can see Europe and Asia at the same time !!. Great trip on the Bosphorus. Istanbul is an amazing place. On the boat you can look out on one side and see Europe and out the other side and see Asia. And you get to see all the city sites in one go even if they are from afar. Take some binoculars if you can you will see so much more

Bosphorus. This is a great place to visit - where on one side is Europe and the other Asia. Take a boat cruise and enjoy a day seeing the sights of Istanbul form the sea - it is so beautiful and peaceful.

Bosphorus Strait. Really enjoyed this trip. was amazed how humongous Istanbul is!Buffet lunch was delicious. Met some lovely people from Montreal.Only complaint is that it was difficult to hear what the tour guide was saying - bad sound system!

This is a must do in Istanbul. We took the cruise in the middle of April. it was sunny, but not too warm.The view from the boat along the strait is amazing all the way up. We only took it one-way and stopped in Anadolu. On the way back we took the bus and stopped a few places along the way. I recommend this if you have the time to do some more exploring.

A relax, easy cruise will give you closed-up view of Asian and European shores.. We took a Bosphorus cruise to see what are on the Bosphorus shores. The ctuise was easy and relaxed. There are vendors for drinks, tea, and snakes. These cruises run on scheduler departure time. It will be nice to arrive early and secure a seat that will allow good picture taking of the buildings and monuments along the shores.
7 hour trip up to the Black Sea. We very much enjoyed out boat trip on the Bosphorus. This ship leaves only one time a day , at ten thirty. You can see many sights along the shores.

Busy place but not to be missed. took 3 boat trips during my stay. And each one was very enjoyable and educational visited fericoy by boat the real turkey without the hustle and bustle , some beautiful old palaces on the banks but having a fish sandwich is a must under Galatia bridge

Interesting tour. We did a 90 minute tour of the Bosphorus, initially we were on the top deck but even though the weather was fine we had to move below because of the cold. It gives you a different perspective of the city and you realise just how huge Istanbul is. The bridges linking Asia and Europe are massive.
Magnificent view. The view is best seen from a boat cruise. Love having dinner along the Bosphorus bank and enjoying both view and food.

Good waterway to mess around on by ferry while holidaying in Istanbul. It's rather hard/weird to review or rate a waterway but there's no doubt that taking the various Bosphorus ferries is a highlight of any break in Istanbul. Firstly there's the long trip up to the north end of the Bosphorus near the Black Sea. I have been using this ferry since 1977 and its changed a fair deal. These days nearly all the punters are people on a day trip be they foreign tourists or locals on a day out. Far fewer people simply using the boat to get from stop to stop. Indeed the 25L fare makes this less attractive although its still very cheap for a day out. The ferry takes about 1.5 hours each way with a stop of nearly three hours. I recommend waking up the steep hill to take lunch at the cafe below the castle. The food is only average but the views over the straight are spectacular. Sip a cold beer and watch the ships glide by.Then there are the short trips [about 15 mins] between various points on the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. Just time to relax with a glass of tea and watch the harbour dolphins. Great way of getting about and it only costs pence particularly with an "Istanbulkart".Another cheap trip worth taking is up the Golden Horn to Eyup. This is a bit of a tourist trap around a famous mosque but again the boat ride is interesting. Tends to be packed at weekends.Finally its probably worth mentioning the Princes Islands. More the Sea of Marmara than the Bosphorus but the boat journey starts in the straight. If you want a longish ride [1.5 hours] which is cheaper than the Bosphorus tour then this is just a few TL and although the towns on the islands are a bit touristy you can always go for a walk and enjoy the views. Or else do the tourist bit and take a horse and carriage. Again weekends tend to be busy.All in all Istanbul just wouldn't be Istanbul without the Bosphorus
Cruise an historic waterway. Went on a half-day cruise. Great way to appreciate the layout & relationship between European and Asian side, the buildings, the landscape.

Great ferry ride. The Boporus is one of the truly great waterways in the world with enormous history from the Greeks, Romans, Vikings, Venicians and Ottomans. The palaces, castles and villas make interesting ferry viewing. Take the Government ferry and stop do lunch at the top of the Bospors where ther is a small fishing village and an old Roman fort on the hill overlooking the Black Sea. The views are spectacular. Lots of commercial shipping dwarf the ferry and highlights how strategically important this waterway is.
Feel the wind. Be in Istanbul and not going on a Bosfor cruising ... such a shame. Feel the wind, take a brake, look around the city rich monument history, and cruise with a tourist guide.

Ferry cruise along the Bosphorus. The ferry cruise took us along the strait and into the Golden Horn area. Unfortunately Winter has been long and harsh this year so the weather was not great. Initially, overcast and breezy, it began to rain en route. I should imagine it is a more pleasant trip on a sunny day. The ferry did not provide much sustenance which would have been helpful on this trip which took over 2 hours. They had packet coffee and cheap biscuits. I was told the ferry was leaving in 10 minutes but we actually waited for approximately 40 minutes before it departed. When we returned, we moored at a different place which left me somewhat disorientated and I got lost returning to my hotel in Serkeci in the pouring rain. other guests at the hotel stated they had a similar experience to mine. It would help tourists if the ferries marked their mooring spots and guided their passengers to prevent this from recurring. There is certainly room for improvement. More comfort on the boat and better snacks and drinks available for the passengers. However, it does offer good views of historical sights and the packed hilltops plus some views of areas filmed in some of the Turkish dramas.

A very busy waterway!. If you get a chance go on a boat ride and experience Istanbul from the water. Great perspective. You don't realize just how many beautiful mosques there are until you view them from the water.

Nice, but Ordinary. Overall the strait is rather nice to look at with a few monuments on its shores. Being in between Europe and Asia was rather neat, but in the end it is just a water way. The cruises and the ferries just really allow you to escape the crush of the city...

Short Ferry Tour from Galata Bridge.. We did the short, 2 hour ,tour of the strait in a boat. It was really an easy way too see most of the shoreline and was very pleasant. We used the official big boats not the ones approach you on the way there . It was about $5 a person.
Great way to see the city skyline. Great way to see the city skyline. Gives u a sense of the city landscape, its size, it's diversity. Make sure u choose a sunny day to enjoy the view

Nice trip. A Bosporus boat ride is an essential part of a visit to Istanbul. We took the short 2 hour 'cruise' on the public ferry system for 12 TL each from Eminönü. This was perfect as it takes you up the Bosporus under the 2 bridges linking Asia and Europe. You don't need a tour... just be there 35 minutes ahead of time and queue. In April it left at 14:30. The boat is not fancy.. basically a large ferry... and if you get there early you can get an outside seat. Worth going and really good value. You can also use Jetons (tokens) to get on a regular ferry across to the Asia side, plus there are private companies running trips. We avoided all the vendors selling 'boat tours' and went straight to the public ferry company. There was a longer trip but we did not consider it worth while as it includes 3 hours ashore in a small town for lunch. The 2 hours was perfect as we went past several palaces and mosques, saw the bridge, some freighters, and got to experience the Bosporus with a local crowd.

Ferry ride worthwhile. tram/travel card also works on ferry its really a good system & makes it very easy to have a trip on the Bosphorus giving you a different perspective of the different sides of the city from the water - we also did a Trip to the Princes islands using tram & Ferry which was easy & great fun

A cruise with fish sandwich. I felt lost in the crowed, many sales people selling scarfs, bags,clothes with budget prices, decorated boats sells grilled fish, cheap street food, Turkish tea and many things around, colorful place. You can enjoy the Bosphorus tour which take almost two hours, get your ticket= 12 TL and you can buy your snack from the cruise, there is day trips so you can enjoy the sun and night romantic trips to enjoy the lights of magical Istanbul and the Bosphorus bridges Don't forget to buy Turkish bread to feed the birds.

What a crucial part of the world!. Although is was an unseasonably cold day in Istanbul, we were able to sit and contemplate the importance of this strait, as so many ships were lined up to go through. It was an interesting place to think about how the world turns, and how much we depend on shipping.
Beautiful view. Love it! Separates Istanbul from Europe and Asia. A cruise is an option if you want to enjoy this or just from kennedy road or a view from your hotel room!

Great Boat Ride. I would call it a good boar ride....can't call these as CRUISE and a good idea to take one for Euro 5/person from the start point. Don't sign up with any travel agent who fleece you for the same. Get a day tour when the weather is nice
Atookhe ferr. We took the ferrndreturnet gettin off at all. It wasan enjoybletip.we a a ma soere able to sellthe acs on land. Would ecommed it. It wa not pensive.

Skip the tourist cruise, enjoy it the local way!. Our family spent five days in a flat overlooking this shockingly blue and vibrantly busy waterway. Sure there are lots of tourist cruises with pushy touts shoving brochures in your faces. But to really see it the authentic way, walk out on the lower deck of the Galata bridge and watch the guys fish and the boats go under. Or take a public passenger ferry from Eminonu or Karakoy over to the Asian side. There are night ferries as well. The ferries are comfortable offering indoor or outdoor seating and serve tea aboard.
enjoy sunset. this is one of the best place to enjoy sunset.I was there with my family and It was perfect! enjoy beautiful view with simit or kestane

It does impress how large Istanbul is , but is overly long. The Bosphorus boat tour takes about 2- 2.5 hours and fills a wet day well, but be wary about the people selling tickets in the main square. What they do not tell you is that you have to walk - crocodile fashion to the quay side which takes at least 20 mins plus. They do like to cram as many people onto the boats as possible, fortunately for us there was a second boat requested due to numbers.The trip is ok, but the captain needs to realize that when using a microphone , shouting distorts the sound to an level that you cannot understand. The trip does impress just how large Istanbul is ( 12 million), but does tend to get a bit boring after a while.Good for a wet and windy afternoon

Relaxing Quiet Stroll Up the River. Our trip was organised as part of wedding events with a trip up the river to the hotel where the wedding was being held but really enjoyed it. So much to see from the river, great commentary and on a hot day the breeze is perfect and welcomed.

Lively and Beautiful. The Bosphorus Strait is full of fishermen boats, ferries, yachts, ships, and seagulls! I just love the seagulls!The strait is full of energy and has a beautiful and positive vibe about it. It is also clean and does not smell of fish, unlike the Atlantic ocean, for instance.In order to see more of the city, take a ferry cruise. It will be enjoyable and memorable.

Beautiful. We took the public ferry to the islands. It was beautiful and a super cheap way to see the city. It was very relaxing and not too crowded. If you are on a budget this is the way to get out on the water without spending an arm and a leg.
Magical!. This is the charm of Istanbul besides Sultan Ahmet. Imagine being on both sides of two continents over a 2 hr cruise. Wow! And enjoying historical sites en route. Fab!

Just wow and wow and wow. This must be one of, if not THE, most fascinating bodies of water in the world. It is so picturesque and there is always something happening.Every angle is different and you could spend hours and hours looking at views and taking a boat tour. A highlight of the city!

Richness over the Bay!. You'll see all kinds of historic and modern structures and building starting from BC to current including First suspension bridge.. The historic buildings are massive and big and well maintained and currently in use. Overlooking the residential hills.

Cruise Along the Bosphorus. Do yourself a favor and follow the trolley line in Sultanahmet by foot down to the docks.For about $8 you can buy a cruise ticket and for another few dollars get an audio tour (in any language) with a map. As you cruise along, the narrative describes the many sights to be seen along both banks. I just went so yes, it was chilly, but sit inside--it is so worth it ;-).
drinking tea and looking at the Bosphorus. Nice people, hot tea (with lots of sugar I added), and a beautiful view of the Bosporus strait and the Asian side of Istanbul

A cruise that shouldn't be missed!. The trip is very relaxing and a feast in the eyes with all the palaces, old buildings and the Istanbul landscape. It was cold, though, that kept most people inside. The guide's mic was not very clear during the trip which was unfortunate. Overall, it was fun for me and my newfound friends.

Nice way to spend a couple of hours. We saw lots of sellers trying to sell tours on the river. we made our way down to the bridge where the ferries are and just bought a ticket for a two hour round trip. We did this on our first day in Istanbul and it was a great chance to sit down and get our bearings. I'm not sure that the views are exactly picturesque but it was a chance to see some huge palaces, get a bit of fresh air, (sun on the way there and a chilly wind and a gray sky on the way back), a sit down and a cup of coffee with no effort on our part and at a cost of a couple of pounds. Some of the ferry rides last far longer and you can get on and off. We felt two hours was enough for us and it allowed our legs a rest from the sight seeing.

Really good!. We walked down towards the Galata bridge and chose a round trip that took 2 hours. There were all day hop on and off options but we decided this would suit us best.It was sunny when we got on the boat which was really lucky and we admired the many sites along the way.There are audio guides available at an extra cost but we had our lonely planet guide book which listed all the bits not to miss.Definitely an enjoyable experience and an excellent way to see Istanbul!

One of the must do activities while in Istanbul. To appreciate the beauty of the city, it is advised to take a cruise along the Bosphorus that will take you along some of the best sites that the city has to offer and moreover, the cruise will also get down at the sites that interest you. For me personally, both the sides had so much to offer. Be sure that you have a large memory space for your cameras to capture all these beautiful sites along your cruise. Choose wisely when opting for a cruise as many would just take you on a ride without any explanations or tour.
nice place. we went on bosphrous tour by cruise and we enjoyed lot on cruise ride with belly dance...!!!dinner was surprising for us!!!!

Chilly but beautiful. Beautiful trip all the way to Black Sea. The day was sunny and beautiful but the wind was blowing in the strait and it was cold. If you are in Istanbul in spring or fall wear your jacket and hat

Cold and fun. The chai seller will take your order, bring the tea, and clear everything in twenty minutes and in all kinds of weather. Our guide said that if one sees someone asleep, it is a civic duty to wake the person upon arrival. And where else can you travel across continents is such a fun way?
Wrong season. April is a bit chilly in Istanbul, so the Bosphorus straight is even more so. Not too much to watch, especially on the Asian side.
Hop-on, Hop-off boat ride. We just stayed on the whole time (1.5 hours), but you can get off at any of the stops to see the sites. Nice way of seeing a different part of Istanbul other than old city.

Brilliant day out. My boyfriend and I did a day cruise along the strait. We got to stop off at a fishing village for a couple of hours before coming back. Sadly the weather was awful and it rained the entire time. But the views were amazing. There is so much to see, and despite the rain, it was a lovely experience. Due to going in March, it got cold on the boat, so I could recommend wrapping up.If you are staying in Istanbul, you simply must do a cruise. It will help you appreciate the archiecture and you will get to see the city from a completely different perspective.

A Must-Do trip while in Istanbul. I did the Bosphorus Strait tour with a planned tour guide. It really isn't necessary as you can take the trolly to the pier and easily book the book. However, be cautious as there are many people trying to sell boat rides, but they are on interior boats, so always ask to see the boat first. The guide was helpful as she did point out interesting sights but if you had a good book, you could easily figure things out. The cruise was about 90 minutes and food and drinks were available for purchase on the boat. Many families were on the cruise and there were lots of children as I cruised on Sunday. If you want a more peaceful cruise, I would recommend not going on the weekend.
Great Experience. A fantastic experience.The cruise on the Bosphorus was indeed worth braving the chilly winds on the day we took it.Truly unforgetable.

A good way to spend an afternoon in Istanbul. We booked this boat trip up the Bosphorus through our hotel and I can honestly say it was really worth it. As we visited in March I found it bitterly cold on the top deck but was fine once we’d moved into the enclosed section. The guide was very knowledge talking through the intercom and came round regularly to ask if we had any questions.

Amazing touring experience. Taking any of tours available from Eminönü,Ortaköy,Kadıköy and Üsküdar piers by special tour boats through Bosphorus which is about an hour and half is one of the amazing ways of exploring some important sights of the city located on either sides of Bosphorus.Otherwise,walking alongwith any side of the city is also very good opportunity to see the beauties from another angle.İf you have time,suggested routes are Bebek to Arnavutköy,Üsküdar to Salacak,Tarabya on either direction.Recommended.

Go with boats with warm clothes!. Just go and have fun!best pictures!You will see every historical buildings, bridge and asian side too!Don't forget to bring warm clothes cause it is so cold there!and also seat on the left side both times!

A trip on the Bosphorus. We went to Eminonu station on the tram line and exited towards the docks. There were a couple of touts there who were selling bosphorus cruise trips. We selected the first chap that didn't sound like too much of a salesman. It cost TL 30 and we went on a 2 hour private boat ride of the two sides of the Bosphorus. There's no commentary onboard this particular trip but they did serve tea. To get the most out of this take a long a map and familiarise yourself with the buildings that you'll see along the way. They did provide us with a map but some prior reading would help.Do definitely do it as it is a great opportunity for taking some beautiful photos.

Fantastic!. The Bosphorus must be one of the most beautiful and amazing places in all of Turkey. It's a delight to see these ottoman palaces, mosques, castles, villas(yalia) along the Bosphorus coast. It's definitely a must when you are visiting Istanbul, I really enjoyed it!

A recommended attraction. Take a boat trip around the strait. The view is impressive knowing you sail between continents. You'll notice the difference between the overpopulated and visibly older European coast and the more modern Asian coast.

A seat with a view.. Book one of the boats for a half day tour - easily done quay side. It allows an afternoon aboard one of the many boats touring the Straits. A breath of fresh air and a continually changing scenery at a sedate pace. See all the palaces and the beauty of the Straits without the hassle of city traffic. A half day tour is ideal for those with a tight time budget. Relatively inexpensive too.
Picture oppertunity at sunset. The number of ships the fishermen people just walking along the front, an amazing site. Definately worth the walk down to see.
Lovely sight!. Lovely expedition on the bosphorus. We saw the lovely hotels, the 1st suspension bridge, the ongoing construction of the would be undersea rail track......

Cruised this on my birthday. What an enjoyable cruise. Take one of the ships from Istanbul thru the straight and to the Black Sea. On the way, you will see palaces, the tower, and even the fortified walls Mehmed the Conqueror built to control water access in the later conquest of Constantinople (Istanbul). You can get food on the ship and there are stairs to the deck as well as bathrooms. You will also pass the little lighthouse where 'M' was a captive when Pierce played James Bond.

A Bosphorous cruise is a must. The Bosphorous literally separates East from West by dividing European Istanbul from it's Asian half. A cruise along it is beautiful as it gives you the vantage point of all of the bridges that cross it and Istanbul's beautiful skyline with it's many mosques, especially on the Sultanahment side. Great to do in the summer, but gets quite cold and wet in the winter. Dress appropriately.

Interesting. . This is an interesting and pretty cruise, especially on a clear, sunny day, with palaces, pretty homes, and a fortress to see. It is a little long though. We did it in the morning, which is supposedly best, with fewer crowds, according to our guide. You can buy limited beverages (hot tea, orange juice) on board. I would love to do the nighttime version of the cruise.

Interesting but long. If you only have a bit of time in Istanbul, this might not be the best place to spend it. Took and hour and a half. But it is fascinating ti be right on the line between 2 continents.

It was a wonderful day. On advice of our hotel manager, I contacted many agencies arranging for a Bosphorus guided tour. Prices ranged from 45 to 55 Euros per head, including lunch. But we were lucky to find out by ourselves that it costs much less if you book your own passage on a full day cruise (in fact 5h30mn). We got our tickets paying 25 TL each (approx 10 USD).The ferry was a new one and it moved at a reasonable speed to let us enjoy the sight of the many palaces on both sides of the Bosphorus strait. Most people had either small books or audio help (it costs 5TL). It was a sunny day of December 2014. The ferry stopped at many places to let people hop-on hop off. Ninety minutes later, we reached the end of the strait at we landed at a small village full of restaurants. We climbed the hill to overlook the strait. There was a restaurant there and a citadel used by the ancient Turks to watch the entrance/exit of the Black sea.We left the place at 15.00hrs to reach Eminonu at about 17.00 hrsThis small "trip" is worth making because it gives an overall look at the many castles, mosques; fortresses... built to glorify and defend the Ottomans against those people of the black sea. To really enjoy this cruise, you need to have good weather and really like making your own discoveries

Bosphorus. The Bosphorus is so beautiful, rich of history and every day life that You should stay there for a day just to look and enjoy.Use the ordinary ferry to cross it and You will understand by Yourself. You don't need to pay extras.

An interesting body of water. We thought it was reminiscent of Victoria Harbor in Hong Kong. A lovely body of water with plenty to see. We went by car with a local and stopped at spots along the way to watch all the activity- a boat would probably be the best approach.

Forget every other Boat Trip! . We took the 2hr tour for 12TL/person. You can rent an audio guide for a further 10TL. We were lucky to get perfect sunshine, not too hot or cold and saw the sun rays glinting off of the minarets and the tiles of the many mosques along the strait. It's a unique way to appreciate the history and the architecture of the many historically important places that you'll cross by. Being along the busy yet majestic Strait and being in the middle of 2 continents, you really understand why Istanbul is one of the ancient and the modern world's greatest cities and why it was the seat of power for the Roman, Byzantine and the Ottoman Empires. And when you are returning back, you can see the Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque, lining the horizon, which makes you appreciate the engineering and the architecture of previous eras.

Very nice cruise on a sunny day. I took the tour in the end of winter, on a partly cloudy day. The tour was 1,5 hours going up to the 2nd bridge, which I think it was enough. It was nice to see all the building on the European side, expecially the Bosphorus bridge, Dolmabahce Palace and the Fortress of Europe. It was freezingly cold to be on the upper deck.Some of the best pictures I took was on this cruise. When it was sunny, the pictures looked vibrant like a postcard. I could hardly believe it turned out so good like that.

nice trip, beautiful view. Şehir Hatları is Istanbul’s official ferry company and offers Bosphorus Cruises (short or long). You can check the prices and timetable on their offices on the docks of Eminönü.We took the short one, available during the winter on weekends only and departing at 14:00 or 14:30, I don't remember exactly. It costs 12 TL a person, plus 10 TL if you want audio guide, and it takes you from Eminönü to Istinye (past the second bridge). There are snacks and beverage available to buy on board.I enjoyed this short tour as we were pressed by time, but if I return, I will take the long one, to also see Anadolu Kavagi.
Just wow.. You must go with a boat, better with a big one, and see the almighty Istanbul. The city is huge, and you also get to see the asian side.

AMAZING! Absolutely Life Canging. By far one of the best places I have visited in my life! Stayed 2 weeks with 3 young boys & there Turkish father, which makes it even more exciting- Iam totally addicted to the wonderful energy! We crosseded the Bosphorus or toured along every 3 days-

Life on the River. Istanbul is a vibrant city. You cannot explore Istanbul without taking a cruise or two. There are several cruises you can take. Depending on the amount of time you have, you can cruise up and around the river. You can hop on and off to visit several sites. You can visit Prince Island if you have more time. The views from the river are not to be missed. Sunny weather and this cruising is lots of fun watching the seagulls follow the boats. We also had onboard "entertainment" in the form of a salesman hawking stuff made in Turkey (on the trip to Prince Island).

Nice Boat Trip. We enjoyed our boat trip along the Bosphorus but that water is very dirty and has a lot if trash. :( We really enjoyed seeing the beautiful houses and hotels on the water side and out captain was great and pointing everything out and explaining what each place was.

Lovely cruise. We had a marvellus one-and-a-half-hour boat ride in the strait that costed 15 liras if I remember correctly. We had a very good time seeing all those beautyfull seaside buildings, such as luxurius houses, expesive hotels and old palaces. Definitely worth having the tour in the strait even if the weather is not good. When we were in Istanbul it was cloudy, rainy and cold but that didn't stop us from enjoing the city.

Impressive and romantic tour. You can take the boat for the Bosporus tour with only 12 Turkish lires. The boat trip lasts about 2 and a half hours and you can see first the European coast and then the Asian. You may choose to have this trip at the begin inning of your visit in IStabul to anderstand better the distance from one place to another and adore by sea the town and the monuments you will be visiting for the rest days. Choose sunset time for a more romantic scene and perfect pictures of the town!!

Just Wonderful.. Even though our tour was on a rainy, windy day it was worth every penny and more. I must have taken hundreds of photos. Lovely homes, castles, ancient and new. Old, old fishing boats, new sleek boats and everything in between. Visit the spice market before or after tour.

Piece of history. we did a boat tour of the strait and i guess that is one of the most effective way to appreciate the Bosphorous strait with having yourself in the open sea and able to watch two continents on its sides. after the end of the tour you could even treat yourself to a nice little meal along many of the restaurants around.

A beautiful majestic strait!. A beautiful majestic strait. It is glorified by many poets and writers, depicted in many paintings. It seems that already so much was told about it, but every time I want to say more. Be sure to take a stroll along the Bosphorus by boat. And the best views of the Bosphorus opens, in my opinion, from the hotel “Swissotel The Bosphorus”.

Small bosphorus tour to be done on a sunny day. I followed previous advices and did only the small bosphorus tour of 2 hours. In winter, there is only one tour per day at 14h30. It costs 12TL -or 9TL with the reduction given by the museum pass.The tour is definitely to be done on a sunny afternoon! The landscapes are then amazing.

Worth to take a boattrip on the Bosphorus Strait. It is nice to sit on a boat and enjoy the view of Europe at one side and Asia on the other. There are a lot of interesting buildings along the coast. If you are lucky with a good guide who can explain you all the details and who can tell you something about the rich history of Istanbul, the trip will be unforgetable.

Impressive Waterway. We had a private guide and road one of the general sightseeing boats that take you from the Golden Horn and make a long loop around the Strait. You get a feel for how busy the waterway is. You also get a view of some beautiful palaces, homes and hotels. The tour is a bit long though for what you see.
Bosphorous Strait. It certainly is a busy hub below the Galata bridge with the boats going to and fro. The cruise takes you along the strait for a glimpse of the European and Asian side of Istanbul.

Beautiful views. Went on a cruise. Lovely views, saw dolphins, pretty houses at the banks of the Bosphorus.
The bridges and sea gulls added to the effect and the stop at the fishing village was cute.

Take the Public Boat. The public boat takes around one and a half hours each way from the Galata Bridge (South Side) to the Black Sea calling at various villages on both sides on the way. There is a period of about three hours before the return - time for a fish meal and a 'stroll' up to the tower, one of two built to show the entrance to the Bosphoros to the British fighting in the Crimean War. At TL25 return the trip is far cheaper than similar trips organised by tour companies.

Disappointing. It's not a good idea to do this in the winter months especially on a Cloudy day. The half day cruise was too long and the weather made the views dull. The stop at a fishing village was really disappointing. This is a tiny place that seems to exist solely for tourists with lots of unappealing restaurants crammed together as well as the usual tourist shops selling pashminas and other tat.I do wish that tour guides wouldn't talk so much too! They don't seem to know when to stop and just let you take in the view without an accompanying monologue.Better to take the non- tourist ferry and save your money!

Worth it. We had a 3 hour morning boat trip along the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus, relaxing and great to see all the buildings. We also did an evening dinner cruise along the Bosphorus, it was great to see the same buildings lit up.

Azzure Waters...Lovely views.. One of the lovely waterways is Bosphorus strait.Charming Azzure water makes you sink into its dark blue depths.You can just have Bosphorus Cruise tours from Eminonu or just can have a cheap boat ride or just walk over the Galata bridge to see and enjoy the views.Must see during your stay at Istanbul.

Not much to wee, really. We recently spent some hours cruising the Bosoprus. It would have been nice if 1. the sun had been shining and it were warm, and 2 someone could inform us what we were passing.

"Full-on" stretch of water. When I saw the ships charging up the Bosphorus Strait toward the Black Sea, I instantly understood why this water way has been so important and for so many centuries. We went on a boat trip from near the main tourist area (Sultanahmet) to the Asian side, above the Faith Sultan Mehmet Bridge. The views along the way (land side) were fabulous, with a lot of action on the water side as we encountered many other vessels (at very near distances). I loved the mansions on the Asian side, which sat in the afternoon sun on the banks of the river. On our way home (after stopping for ice cream on the Asian side), we visited an Island on which stood 'The Maiden's Tower'. All-in-all, I highly recommend taking a boat ride up the Bosphorus River!! (I actually visited in April 2012, but can't input this date)

A serene experience. A cruise on the Bosphorous especially in the evening is definitely the highlight of Istanbul visit. The dark blue waters are inviting and when you cruise along the river the lighted monuments alongside and the bridges are a must watch. Coupled with this the traditional dances and the food make it a memorable evening!

whoa theres a stop called eminonu get off walk or you will miss some grt thing to look at. hey lol this place is great get off the train walk across the bridge when u come to the guard house walk downstairs there are like 25 places to eat seafood and watch the 20 ferries n boats almost crash into eachother its like brooklyn at 3pm on a monday what a place to take pictures and video and the size of the prawns are crazy big, i can see most people missing this place u can walk the bottom part of the bridge all the way to the end check out the tourisit ferries all decked out in jewels and lights there are tiny places to eat to the right where you can see the fish pick it out n have it cooked for you check out the guys fishing on top of the bridge as well

You Can't Beat This....A Beautiful Waterway. The ferries and freighters plying the waters of the Bosphorus make for a never-ending magical view. The waters always seem choppy, as if they can't decide which way to go. And indeed, the surface waters flow in one direction because of the change in salinity while the deeper waters, driven by the tides, frequently flow in the opposite direction. Asia? Europe? The Bosphorus is both. Endlessly fascinating....an unsurpassably beautiful backdrop to a beautiful city.

A great Boat Tour. We just came back from a five-hour boat tour on Bosphorus Strait, which we enjoyed. The guide, Aslam, was knowledgeable and spoke good English, and the trip was very pleasant. It was fun to see where Europe and Asia meet. We also stopped at two former Sultans' Palaces, none of which can impress any of the tourist who has seen palaces in Austria, France, Russia or England. But the parks around them are gorgeous, and since they are situated on the water, the view is fantastic. Take this tour if you have extra Euros and the weather is sunny.
Day trip. Recommend using the IOD Municipal - full day outing, stopping for 2.5 hours on the Asian side. Great opportunity to view many of the site from the river. Not to be missed.

Short trip OK. 2 hour ride on any boat pays off. No need to go for the cheapest provider, prices 12-15TRY, trips start from Eminönü. Prepare for winds and take some water with you altough service is good even on smaller boats.

Back through time. We took a cruise on the up the Bosporus Strait to the edge of the Black Sea. It was like a trip back in time as we gendered on old Byzantine ruins, ancient Mosques & Churches. It was fun to see folks fishing along the route as well. If you want to take a trip through time, book a trip up the Bosporus straight that stops on the Asian side. It was fun at least taking a few steps in Asia.

A wonderful experience.. We were a bit tired and decided this would be a good way to see the sights without using too much energy. Our trip included a fantastic buffet meal, which catered generously for about 50 people. The day was overcast and windy but we were quite comfortable on the boat. The guide was good in explaining different landmarks as we approached them. The trip took about 4 hours and was relaxing and well worth it. We were picked up and dropped off at our hotel which was included in the price. I think it was about 45 tl each. I wouls certainly recommend a trip down the Bosphorus! them

Take a ferry and just explore. We took several ferry trips and all were full of remarkable scenery, of Istanbul's many mosques, parks, towers, castles, and people. Weekdays were definitely more pleasant. All the ferries we took were precisely on time.

Asian and european cruise. Good cruise across the Bosphorus Strait to the Asian side and then up to the new bridge with a slow meander back down. It allowed us to see both architectures and where else we would like to visit.

Once in a Lifetime Cruise Opportunity. I highly recommend you take a cruise up the Bosphorous. Seeing the mansions, the various communities, a different continent on each side... how often in life do you have such a pleasure?
Lovely wind and views. The Bosphorus is clean, very big and the boat service Turyol we took was beautiful, clean and fast. Went to Princess Island which was spectacular
A Boat Ride on the Bosphorus was Fabulous. I hired a private boat to take me on a tour of the Bosphorus. It was a bright sunny day, and a must do when you are in Istanbul. I enjoyed it very much

Lovely place with multiple attractions around. Boats traveling along the strait, walking on its banks, seeing people fishing, visit attractions along its sides are very good.
you will never feel that you need to leave the place.

History, And More. I have always wanted to see this historic waterway. Many rooftop restaurants and bars offer views, but there's nothing like a short cruise to the second bridge. They leave from the Gallata Bridge area. Amazing sights. Take a guide if you can.

loftyrob198. Numerous boat trips are on offer for visitors to experience this extremely busy waterway link to the Black Sea. You get a different perspective of the City from the water. Most of the trips leave from the pier areas to the south of the Galata Bridge and not far from the Spice Market. The one I went on was good value and took us up beyond the Bosphorus Bridge on the European side going and the Asian side returning. Watch out for boat trip touts who offer transport to their boat 'a short distance away' and promise to bring you back afterwards but don't. This area of the City is extremely busy.

Spectacular views. Whenever I'm in Istanbul, a "cruise" on the regular "vaporetto"s from Eminonu to f.x. Kadikoy is a must. For a few Lira (and even with just a couple of hours to spare) you cross the Bosphorus from Europe to Asia and back and have spectacluar views of the city of Istanbul 360 degrees. Highly recommended!

Soak in the romantic atmosphere. Enjoy the shimmering sunlight reflecting off the waves, feel the freezing Spring breeze on your face, and just embrace your inner romantic as the seagulls fly with you across the Bosphorus.

Wow !!. Yes I did the cruise, and yes it was a fantastic experience, but....nothing prepared me for the impact of the first sight of the Bosphorus ! It's like a huge moving picture, I could have sat there for hours. A real must see
One of the Busiest Waterways in the World. It is fascinating to see all the boat traffic on the Bosphorus. Ferries, tour boats, tankers, etc. are everywhere.
Bosphorus. Excellent way of getting a view of Istanbul from the water. This is where the Sea of Marmara meets up with the Black Sea
Amazing cruise.. Special occasion ,to see two continents in the same time, and a lot of historical places on both sides.Book a cruise and take your time ,have a turkish cofee and enjoy !

A scenery that you want to keep forever in your mind!. The houses by the sea, the water sparkling under the sun, the huge colorful ships making their way to the sea, the trees tall most touching the water. All of them in a strait sea line that could have been a small river and still is on of the most busy sea parts in the world. A romantic and yet reality scenery that you would like to keep for ever in your mind! Make the boat tour!!!!
Istanbul never sleeps. We got on the boat ride to admire the beautiful bosphorus, took lots of pictures, but it was freezing, we had some tea to warm up a little bit.

A beautiful cruise. We took a 3 hour cruise up the Bosphorus. The secenry was beautiful. There is something mystical about seeing Asia on one shore and Europe on the other. There were many quaint villages, and quite few impressive palaces.

Fantastic overview of Istanbul. A good on-board commentary, bright sunshine and great food contributed to a nice day out along the Strait, with a stop at a fishing village at the other end, four hours in all including pick up from the hotel. It gave us a breather from monument hopping and allowed us to catch up on reading our guide book, and to get a view of things we might want to do later. Worth the money.
Cruising the Bosphorus. This was an amazing cruise where you will get to see the two continents and beautiful homes along the water. It is another must see in Istanbul, Turkey.

2 hour cruise. 2 hour cruise to the second bridge and back. I had a good guide book and a map and so was able to recognise the points of interest. Next time I would check and book a cruise in advance to ensure there was a guide on board
