Interesting. This was included in part of a tour, the boat we were on was therefore only for the tour and therefore was plenty room to move around and take photos etc. The commentary was very good and clear and we were therefore able to enjoy the experience.

Interesting perspective. Went out on a boat trip. Pleasant enough weather. Always get an interesting perspective of a city from the distance of being on the water. Some beautiful buildings along the route.
Could spend hours watching the Bosphorus. Incredibly important waterway - strong currents, boats of all types and sizes - easy to imagine the Istanbul of times past...

Take the public ferry. Take the public ferries - only 12lira for the 2 hour tour or 24lira for all the way to the Black Sea. Don't take any private tours! Perfect way to view the city. 2 hour tour starts at 230pm from Eminonu pier (right next to the bridge).

Nice view of Istanbul. We bought the Metro-card and went by the official lines over to the Asia-side of Istanbul. Quite windy and LARGE boats made the trip adventurous. We made jokes about the Asia-side being sooo very different from the Europe-side :-)
This is a must. A great cruise excellently led by operators with views and commentary of Istanbul of both Europe and the Asian sides on this historic and busy river.

Great Boat Trip. Taking the boat (ferry) for the Bosphorus dinner cruise was really enjoyable. The start was not good as we arrived 7:50 pm & it started moving at 9:00, still we got good seats (face to face next to other people on a 10-seats table. The food was not good. The service was average. Still it was great due to the show on the boat (Turkish traditional show, belly-dancing, marriage simulation show & other). After all it took 2 hours & half, which was enjoyable.
Perfect paradise. I loved the journey of bousphorus very much . We ride in front of the egyptian bazaar . The journey took one and half hour of good view.
Asia to Erurope. Once you cross the Bosphorus Strait, you have experienced jumping from one continent to another in a few minutes. I loved it.

beautiful day. We were confused and thought our cruise went for 2 hours but it went all day (this is the 10:35 departure) We were pleasantly surprised at the village where it stopped for lunch and we had a delicious fish BBQ. We walked to the castle- it is quite a steep climb. Glad we spent the day on the Bosphorous - it gave us a good understanding of the area.

Istanbul....Europe and Asia. Beautiful waterway. View from cruise ship is breathtaking . We could not imagine or foresee the number of cargo ships,tourist boats that channel their way through this area
An interesting waterway. Very busy with lots of ferries and ocean liners, You may also see some of the Russian fleet passing through.
Bosphorus. We cruised along the Bosphorus between the two bridges connect in Asia and Europe. Absolutely breathtaking. A must do while in Istanbul.

Very scenic.. We really enjoyed the scenery along the Bosphorus Straight. We took the boat ride and found it relaxing and comfortable. We were amazed at the amount of pictures we ended up taking on the boat trip.
buy the ticket at the dock. Don't need to go through a travel agent, you can buy a ticket at pier 3 , so much cheaper, it's a municiple ferry and it more than does the job.

The highlight of Istanbul. Istanbul looks more magical from the water than from any other vantage-point. There is a wide choice of boats and ferries running between the port buildings on the European and Asian sides, but one of the best ways to get your bearings is to start with a 2-hour Bosphorus cruise with commentary, showing you the principal buildings on both shores.
great boat trip. it is worth paying for a days trip to see the bosphorus , the view from the boat is great and you see so many great houses and places

Wonderful. There are many ways to see the Bosphorous, and I did several of them. From hotels and restaurants high up on the European side, there are fabulous views, particularly at night when the Bosphorous bridge is lit up. I also took the ferries to get around from port to port - very easy. I also did an hour and 15 minute tour of the Bosphorous, which cost about 15 TL, went in a big circle and did not stop at any of the ports. It was perfect for me, as I had limited time and did not want to get off anywhere. Also, 1:15 is probably the longest I could have endured - my stomach got a little queasy from boat fumes and the rolling ferry boat. There is a loudspeaker commentary, which I could not understand, but with a little up front guidebook reading, you will know exactly what you are looking at. Highly recommended.
busy place. Great spot to watch all the boats, cruise ships, people fishing etc. great restaurants under bridge to look out on Bosphorus Strait. Lots of tours, dinner cruises...worth it. Very busy!

Must see. The cruise is a must see. Be carefull of the weather. Satisfying view of the Golden Horn and the European and the Asian shore of the city. At least view of three palaces, four bridges and lots of nice monuments, such as Galata Tower.

Worth doing for an orientation of the area. I really wanted to do this as it gave me a very good sense of exactly where we were in relation to old and new (only 800 years) Istanbul and the differentiation between Europe and Asia. I must say, I had it all wrong before I went on the trip

So much to see down this waterway. Took a cruise for 10TKY from the Eminonu pier, Cruise Boats leave all the time and last aound 2 hours.. Perfect way to enjoy the Bosphorus and get to see the Historical buildings and Palaces along the way.Takes you up to the 2nd bridge. Thouroughly enjoyed it especially return trip the sun was setting. Careful though some have those white plastic chars just lined up on the deck, so it can prove a lil uncomfortable.
Superb. I take the private boat instead of the sharing ferry.nice scenery cruising through the Bosphorus Straits and pass through under the Asia and Europe bridge.

Like no other. Night cruise on Bosphorus was amazing, so see the lights and colours of bridges connecting two continents and palace and mosques glowing in a dark was was just beautiful its a must if you are in Istanbul,
Relaxing on the Water. Great way to Istanbul. It is nice to remove your self from the crowded sidewalks and traffic and sit back and see Istanbul from the water.

Amazing Bosphorous cruises both by day and by night!!!. For me Bosphorous was one of the main attractions to visit Istanbul - a cruise by the day is wonderful - we took one which was being sold outside The Blue Mosque for 15 euros each or €25 for 2 - nice double decked boat going up the golden horn and showing all the sights on both sides. Then we took the one at night with dinner and entertainment programme for €70 each - the Bosphorus becomes like a fairyland by night - the dinner is very good quality and entertainment wonderful as well.

Don't Miss This. We took the Bosphorus Cruise on a non- narrated boat. They gave us a maps of what we would see and we just followed the map as we passed by each site. For us it was the perfect cruise, allowing some peace and quietness, but also having knowledge of what we were seeing. It was a little chilly the day we went, but the beauty made up for the cool weather. Be sure and take a jacket. They do sell beverages and snacks if you need a little something. There are cruises that are narrated and ll of them are pretty inexpensive.
Take a Cruise. Make sure you have enough time to enjoy a cruise along the Bosphorus, choose a boat with a commentary so you can travel through history

Short circuit bosphorus ferry. We took to the tram to Eminou port, at terminal 3 (I think) there is a ferry that offers a 90 minute bosphorus cruise for about 15 TL, there are only two or three timeslots a day - 14:30 and 14:50 when we were there. They have an audio guide which you can rent for 10TL. It can work automatically with the GPS but it didnt prove very useful because it couldn't keep up with how fast we were going and the order of landmarks were sometimes not in the right sequence. It was interesting and enjoyable none the less. Afterwards walk around the harbour and stop at the restaurant that serves the very popular fresh fish with salad in a roll followed by some ayran!

Must do. Great way to see Asia and Europe. See lavish palaces and decadent villas. Rumeli Hisar Fortress., Dolmabahce Palace. You get good views of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sopha. Go under the Bosphorus Bridge, one of the world's largest suspension bridge.

Bosphorus cruise. We so lucked out as our cab driver, from The Marmara Hotel, showed us the cruise lines. A two hour, delightful cruise on a two level boat. We chose the top level with a cloth canopy and wicker chairs and cushions. I did take my own guide book so I knew what to look for along the way as it was not a guided tour boat. Not expensive at all. So glad we got to the Black Sea before we turned around.

Turn that wonderful view into real life!. I had always been inspired by pictures of the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque from the Bosphorus. We took a trip up towards the Black Sea - you can do it on an ordinary ferry and pay less, but we had an enjoyable lunch, short stop in a small village on the Asian side, and a potted history of the palaces etc. as we motored back to the dock. Plus - a bus picks you up from your hotel so you also get to see a bit of the city in comfort.

A relaxing interlude. Not to be missed after a long walk around the many sights in this wonderful city, and a breath-getter in preparation for the assault on the Spice and Grand Bazaars. Be wary of the "free" bread roll offered on boarding - they want payment later, it's not included!
Use the national ferries. these are better than the boats and cheaper. The Ferry system is great for the golden horn too. The Istanbulkart is a must youcan travel for about 2.5tl per trip.

a cruise through the most beautiful city in the world. A bosphorus cruise gave us a good orientation to the city. Would advise doing early on in the trip. we went on the sunset trip, which was cool and breezy. would like to one day experience it in the daytime as in the last 30 minutes (of 2 hours) some sights are obscured by the darkness.

Immerse Yourself. Why not immerse yourself in the everyday life of an Instanbul citizen and ride the ferry across the Strait. It's an easy way to act like a local and get to the Asian Contintent-side of the city.
Boat trip. Did the full day boat trip to the black sea with stop over in village. nice and relaxing and good sight seeing

A must do Istanbul experience. We took both a sightseeing cruise and a ferry from Eminonu to Uskudar. Both were enjoyable. The 1.5 hour cruise we took gave us a view of Istanbul we would not otherwise have gotten - and took us under both bridges. Well worth doing. The ferry was actually more comfortable than the sightseeing boat, and took only 13 minutes between Eminonu and Uskudar. For a "you can't do this anywhere else in the world" experience, take the Marmaray train / subway between Sirkeci and Uskudar in four minutes. While the view is of a tunnel, where else in the world can you ride a metro between continents? The Sirkeci station is accessible from both the Eminonu waterfront area and the Sultanahmet area via different exits.

Take the ferry. There are expensive tours of the Bosphorus. Our hotel manager (the Amira hotel) and our guide (Murat Kazmacı) told us to take the 12 Turkish Lira ferry. The trip was two hours and wonderful. We rented headphones and a GPS-driven device that gave us all we needed to know about every site along the way.

Lovely boat trip.. We took the boat trip all the way along the straight and back. The tour which includes lunch is very relaxing. Food was good,and there are drinks available on the boat,Staff are friendly and you get great views of Istanbuls VERY busy waterways.You go from Europe to Asia and back. Incredible.

Great scenery avoiding the horrific Istanbul traffic but avoid the short nigh cruise. I did the Bosphorus cruise twice. I took the day trip (4 hours) with one hour stop in the Asian side, excellent trip I would say, in a comfortable not crowded boat, with great guides doing English, Spanish and Italian narratives of what we were seeing. We stop in a very cozy restaurant to have lunch (not included but well priced and delicious) was very relaxing and gave us a great perspective of the city without dealing with the busy traffic.The second trip, was in the evening. We wanted to see the city from Bosphorus during nighttime, so we took the two hours trip...Horrible to say less...Crowded boat, full of drunk teens, children screaming, not enough seating, did not understand a word of the guide who spoke through a bad microphone from God knows where because never saw the person. Expensive and bad coffee. If you don't like to deal with drunk people screaming in your ears, barfing, swearing, plus children screaming their head off during a boat cruise that suppose to be relaxing and informative, please avoid this tour in the night. Take the longer trip during the day and perhaps do some research about hiring a taxi boat ...But this night 2 hours cruise is a nightmare, it was great I did the other tour, otherwise I will stay with this no good experience as the Bosphorus strait.
Awesome!. I was fascinated to see the rivera of Asia and Europe at the same time. Lot of History and great people.

Stunning. The cruise will take you past most of the Ottoman palaces and you can see most of the grand Mosques. You travel under the huge bridges that cross the river and witness the massive cargo ships entering the harbour. Look out for dolphins... they are all over the place.

Take a Cruise Tour. We arrived Istanbul from NY & wanted to adjust to local time. Took taxi from Marriott Sisli down to waterfront for 1.5 hour cruise up the Bos. Awesome views of beautiful shoreline. Huge mansions, palaces,etc. Very reasonable price......around $20 lira

Enjoyable trip in the Bosphorus Strait. Enjoyed a tour with our group on the Strait. The waterway is very busy and interesting. We cruised down the strait, and saw palaces, homes and vacation homes for the rich.

Bosphorus. Beware of the official cruise as they make up the prices and expect you to haggle. You can get much cheaper boat trips by going down to the pier yourself at Eminonou. Also I only realised afterwards that we could have got 25% off with our museum card passes.

Great to crise down!. We did a 3 hour return cruise through the strait and really enjoyed seeing the sprawling city to go on for what seem like forever. There are some very grand looking buildings along the way indeed!

Take a boat ride and enjoy the view. Excellent an hours boat ride for 12 lira from ortokoy.get a different perspective on the city, and rest the legs.its pleasant to take to the water and have a look at how the city has developed.Well worth an hour.

One of the most beautiful cruises. We took the boat tour as part of our pre-cruise tours in Istanbul. The boat was wonderful, and the view is expansive, refreshing and beautiful. Our tour guide gave us many wonderful descriptions along the Strait. So ensure that you take the trip on a guided tour so that you get most out of your visit on the Strait.

Really worth doing and a way to relax for a couple of hours. We had decided that we will try and do the Bosporus cruise on the last day of our visit in Istanbul and after all the walking around it was really nice to rest our feet for a couple of hours.We picked a boat from next to the Galata bridge an for a couple of hours you see the beautiful stretch of see with all the amazing palaces, forts and mosques and just to complete the experience our boat docked for a couple of minutes on the Asian side.The boat goes beyond the Rumeli and you pass all the major bridges along the way.Don't buy tickets from touts in the street as you know what you are buying. Our tickets were 12 lt person and worth every lira.Try and sit on the left hand side as it's better for photo taking.

Very good. It was a different experience to travel just between two continents. You get to see Asia and turn the other side to see Europe.. :) And mostly importantly, you can take a snap of the welcome to Europe and Welcome to Asia boards as well.. :)

Very busy, interesting.. A dynamic waterway! Lots of ferries plying between the old, new and Asian areas of Istanbul and up the Bosphorus toward the Black Sea. Ocean liners can be seen in the Karakoy district . Interesting bridges.
Nice break. A boat ride is always a nice break. There was no narration and had we not had a private guide to tell us about what we were seeing, I would not have enjoyed as much.

A beautiful stretch of inland sea with great views.. Take one of the tourist runs from Emininou at 10-15 lira for a 90 minute trip or even a ferry, even cheaper as you use your Istanbul travel card ( good for trams and buses too)..
Cruise not what you'd expect. The boat ride on the strait is crowded and honestly kind of boring. No real reason to go out of your way to do iit.
Beautiful sea. The sea of Marmara is so beautiful! I enjoyed the cruise. Love the dark blue sea, sunshine and so windy breezy! I really love it!

Beat jet lag. Take a ferry ride when you first arrive. Get off for a couple hours for lunch & stroll at last stop. Wonder at the city spanning two continents. Bargain for a pashmina with the delightful local man on board. Revel in the great houses & restaurants along the shoreline. See if you can spot Elvis in the yard of a mansion. He is there with a twin. Laugh! Go at 10 am for longest ride. Short one in afternoon.
Cruise the Boshorus. Even in the rain, the cruise of the Bosphorus Strait was amazing with views of the city, castles and many historic landmarks.
Wonderful Area. It a must seen area when in Istanbul. How often can you see the border between two continents (Europe and Asia).

Nice boat ride. There are many boat rides to choose from. We took the two hour version that cost very little and no reservation required. The tour is nice, but not narrated on this line. Still for the value good choice.

So so. Depends how long you intend to stay and see, i'd make sure i see all other sites and if i have time i'd consider the Bosphorus tour. It is basically a trip on a ferry to show the link of Asian & European sides of Turkey
Fantastic boat trip. Brilliant boat trip for a hot day for little money also English speaking audio which I missed because too busy taking photos!

This is great. Such an interesting & historic waterway, & boy is it busy. Separating the European & Asian sides if Istanbul, a trip along the Bosphorous is a must to include in any trip to this amazing city; it delivers a completely different perspective of life in Istanbul & it's sights.

A different perspective. We took a cruise on the last day of our tour of Turkey. We saw some interesting sights, and learned a bit more about the history of the Golden Horn. It was difficult to hear the guide's comments, however, and that made it a bit frustrating. It was a beautiful day.

Cruise ship pass. Either way (tour boat or cruise ship), beautiful and stately mansions. Unbelievable ship and boat traffic-that alone is worth the scene. Cruise ship had to wait for oil rig being towed into Black Sea through narrow part (300-400yds). Made for spectacular sunset when it was backlit in sunset.

Worth it if you have time. We did a 2 hour cruise up the Golden Horn and then out on the Bosphorus to the Asian side of Istanbul. I love being on the water and you get a great perspective of just how huge Istanbul is which is quite difficult to imagine if you only stick to the main sights in the Old Sultanhamet district.We had good weather and a guide who pointed out all the most important sights en route so it was win win for me. No need to do a full day cruise but if you can spare a few hours then this is a very pleasant outing.
Great cruise to see the Asian and Europe sides. A great way to see nice landscape along the Bosphorus. Many historical buildings like the summer places can be seen. It was quite windy and refreshing.
Bosphourus. Walking along the Bosphorus river was a site to behold and boy did we walk!!!! It was nothing less than spectacular

A Unique Experience. Took a two-hour Bosphorus cruise out of Istanbul at a cost of US$42. An unique experience as the boat travels between the European and Asian parts of Istanbul, including going under two bridges that span the two continents. The cruise is leisurely and, on a nice sunny day, quite relaxing. On the down side, unless you have a guide or have done considerable amount of "homework" to research what it is you are seeing, it all becomes somewhat boring. Was it worth it? For me, I'd say "yes" as I did have a guide and didn't mind the expense or the time as I see this as a once-in-a-lifetime experience. However, if cost or time is a factor in your travel plans, then giving the cruise a miss is not a big sacrifice.

Do the Hop on Hop off Bus. By doing the Hop on Hop off bus you get a very good view of this amazing waterways. We really enjoyed viewing from the top deck and it wasn't crowded so we were able to take photos quite easilyThere are a lot of cruises both day or night, we didn't get a chance to do these however they look like they would be funWe only had time to view from the bus, and we were happy with that plus we got to see the other attractions as well

Relax tour. The views are very nice although the water of strait is clear as Greek one. No need for 6 hrs tour , lots of choices and boats around the hub are available .my suggestion 1.5hr trip is enough and can see sunset in the boat..that is beautiful.

Historic Waterway. I saw the Bosphorus two ways and would recommend them both. First, I took a cruise up to the Rumeli fortress and back. The houses built on the waters edge are among the most expensive real-estate in the world.On my last night I had a rooftop dinner at a restaurant overlooking the Bosphorus from the Sultanamet district. Most romantic scene you can imagine.

ferry trip to rumeli. wonderful trip allowing you to see the villages and harbours on each side, the fort currently not open but splendid view and pleasant cafes on the hillside, about 5 hrs there and back, convenient to eat under harbour bridge afterwards

From the Med to the Black Sea!. This is one of the most stategic stretches of water in the world! Wonderful views of the ships lining up in the Black Sea can be had from the castle at the top of the hill at Anadolu Kavagi(at the northern end) The shipping,waterbus and ferry traffic at the southern end is a specticle to be seen. Deep fried sardines at Anadolu Kavagi are excellent especially with a small beer...Cheers!!

excellent strait, very nice views.... Bosphorus Strait or Bogaz (means throat in local language) is an strategical and wonderful strait between 2 sea: Marmara and Black sea. It,s about 30 km long and separates 2 parts of Istanbul: Asian part and European Part, exactly 2 regional of Asia and Europe. Because of height differencebetween begin (Black sea) and the end (Marmara sea), water is flowing always from Black sea to Marmara sea. The view of Bosphorus Strait is wonderful. you can see nature and historical sites and modern parts of Istanbul together. For example you can see Dolmabahca palace, Ciragan palace/ hotel, Ortakoy mosque, Hatice sultan palace, Istanbul bosphorus great bridge or Bogaz bridge and galataseray island. you can take a tour for Bosphorus strait bye general ships that transfering people in strait. they are chip and low cost. they are like bus. in that ships peddlers also selling things like turkish traditional scarfs, hand made, clothes, shoes, foods and...

Take a cruise, but don't buy tickets on the street. A very nice trip along the Bosphorus, rent the audio guide, you can learn a lot of histories on the way. Becareful not to buy tickets on the street, which they said costs 15 euro; go directly to the port to buy the tickets, which is much cheaper.

Worth a return trip. The Bosporus stait is a thing to experience, you can get the cheaper ferry across to the Asian side of Istanbul for less than some places charge for a cup of tea. But the bracing sea air and the views are well worth that sacrifice. And you can get a cup of tea for 1TL on the ferry to make up for it!
time to relax. a two hour cruise here is well worth the time soaking up the views, relaxing in the sunshine & taking lots of pictures

Take a Ride. Take a cruise for a couple of hours on this busy and famous waterway. Pleasant ride with some interesting views on both the Europian and Asian sides - not overwhelming though except as to the amount of boat traffic. I suppose this is something everyone should so during their visit but it did not overwhelm me like I thought it would.

Always very good view. Here we are once again crossing to European side by ferry boat from Harem pier in Anatolian side and it is very much amazing view through Bosphorus to watch over the both sides from the boat.Passing tankers and cruise ships are always taking very good place in the scenery if you would like to shot the photos with them.Amazing trip by boat if you can do this from any piers in Eminönü,Sirkeci,Beşiktaş,Üsküdar and Kadıköy as there are plenty of tours available during day and night.Very much advised to join fo any of the tours through Bosphorus.

Take a cruise thru to really enjoy the beauty!. You can better enjoy the city of Istanbul when you are on a short cruise and see things from a calm uncrowded point of view! Great photo ops of the great sites!

Quick Ferry Ride from Europe to Asia. For just a few dollars, you can visit the continent of Asia from Istanbul. That's pretty cool so we did it just for that fact. It was a quick ride across the Bosphorus, wasn't too crowded when we went so there were plenty of seats.Once we were on the Asian side, we walked around, had some lunch, saw a small mosque. Not a whole lot to do within walking distance, but it was worth the visit.

great contrast to Istanbul. Looking for a break from the frantic atmosphere of Istanbul, we took the tram to Bakatas terminus, and jumped on the ferry to Prince's Islands - 5 turkish lira, which was a pittance against the prices quoted for tourist boat trips. Ferry was mobbed, possibly because it was Sunday and locals were escaping the city. As we were a bit short of time, after 1hr 20 mins we got off at Burgazadasi rather stay on to Adalar as we originally planned - really nice little town, very relaxed. Treated ourselves to a return journey on the express service - 40 minutes, at an exhorbitant 10 lira ! We came away wishing we had more time, but got a taste of the area and the views of istanbul from the sea were tremendous.

Cruise the Bosphorus. It is definitely worthwhile to take a cruise along the Bosphorus Straight. It gives you an orientation to the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. In addition to a number of sights, you can see the summer homes on both sides. This gives you an insight to the impressive wealth of Istanbul.
Beautiful Bosphorus. We visited with our convention group to a dinner place along the Bosphorus, and passed by multiple times when switching between street car and funicular.

Bosphorous cruise an alternative.. Instead of taking the regular cruise which most visitors do we crossed the Bosphorous from Kabatas to Uskudur by the regular ferry boat( per person just 4liras ticket). stayed on the Asian side for some time & then took the boat from Uskudur to Eminou.again for 4Liras each.The entire crossing is wonderful gives you great view of Istanbul on both sides also the ships, boats & cruise liners , the entire life of this great waterway comes alive. no need to book the cruise you can go at your own time as the ferry boats operate almost the whole day & seating on the deck is abundant with hardly any rush.Heard from most people who take the cruise up the Bosphorous that after some time it becomes monotonous as the boat keeps on going upstream whereas it is more interesting to cross the straights form either side.

take the river tour. We booked a tour up the Bosphorus and all the way into the Black Sea. Truly unbelievable. While they tell you stories of the past and history, the views of Europe and Asia are breathtaking. Once you reach the Black Sea, you can swim and even though the water is cold, its a great experience. Return by sundown. Don't forget to be on the lookout for dolphins. They are quite visible,
Take a ferry to Asia!. The ferry ride across the Bosphorus is very affordable, and a great way to see some more of the city while resting from lots of walking!

Evening trip as part of Cruise excursion-WORTH IT. Signed up for an evening cruise up the Bosphorus as part of a short on shore excursion with Holland America. Wow - it was worth it. There are all sorts of lovely hotels, houses and nightclubs all along the European side -- not as many on Asian. We went all the way up to the bridge and back -- a good trip and very relaxing. I took a lot of photos and posted some here. Now I want to go back to Istanbul to some of those cool nightclubs on the Bosphorus!

IBO full day cruise Bosphorus with Black Sea an overpriced con. Cost 40 Euros/ 115TLira to go to Anadolu Kavagi.This is well short of Black Sea. Guide poor.Food worse.
Brochure indicates northernmost stop is Poyrazkoy which is on the Black Sea.
The public ferry does the same trip for 20 TLira.
We argued with the guide and we're fobbed off with nonsense.
This company deserves to fail.

A lovely way to see more of the city. We used the hop on/off ferry and travelled along the Bosphorus. So you head off on the European side of the city, visit the Asian side before returning back to your starting point. The ferries are pretty busy so you need to be there promptly in order to sit on the exterior seats and beware the purveyors of beverages as they can be a little pricey. It was especially good to have the opportunity to get off the ferry and explore a slightly different area, and there are many fish restaurants along the route offering lovely vistas of the city.

Take a Boat Tour. Unless you are completely not boat-worthy, take a boat tour. This is a terribly historic bit of water and a boat tour gets you out on it and lets you learn tons about this city. You will see things you cannot see from the shore.
Nice Boat trip. Advice is take a boat trip .Its really worth it to get a good idea of Istanbul itself and its really relaxing

A lovely waterway. A wide river dividing Europe and Asia. Flowing gently out to see there are ferry rides and great views as you sail down its length and breadth. Many restaurants and cafes and shopping areas hug the river which is surprisingly clean considering the amount of commercial shipping and Cruise ships that use it.

Beautiful. What a beautiful journey....take at least a 4 hr trip....we headed up to the Black Sea and maybe should have spent a night there. The journey along the Bosphorus is wonderful and surprising. Go with a good guide.

Bosphorus Strait. Took a 1.5 hour tour up the strait at the recommendation of a local, the weather was perfect and the sights were great (helped that it was a beautiful sunny day). The 1.5 trip only goes halfway up the strait from the old section of Istanbul, but there is a lot to see along the way. I was impressed at the friendliness of the Turkish people, although I didn't speak the language we had a great time.

If you stay in Istanbul, stay right on the Bosphorus!. If I didn't stay at a hotel on the Bosphorus - my trip would not have been the same! Take the ferry ride or hire a private tour boat (we did) Sunset on the Bosphorus is magical!!

Take a day tour up the historic Bosphorus.. The Bosphorus is Istanbul's iconic waterway dividing the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. The full day tour takes you up the straitspast numerous palaces, picturesque suburban villages and historic buildings to the mouth of the Black Sea and lets you off at Anadolu Kavagi, a fishing village on the north end of the Asian side for lunch and a walk up to the 14th c. castle at the top of the hill before continuing back down to Istanbul. The ferry also makes several stpos where one can disembark and return on their own. Relaxing and quiet - no loud tour announcements over the public address system.

Bosphorus is not a "river", it's a sea-strait!. Ok, first and foremost, please stop referring Bosphorus as a river. It is not a river. It is a sea strait between Blacksea and Marmara Sea. It is like Strait of Gibraltar, only narrower. And yes, having a ferry trip is one of the best methods to experience Istanbul.

3hours cruise. 25 TL for 3 hours cruise is worth it, we take the cruise from sultan Ahmet.
With guided (although the accent was not clear)
Beautiful sight seeing

Take a boat trip. A visit to Istanbul is not complete without a trip up the Bosphorus Strait in a ferry. It gives you a different perspective of the city seeing it from the sea instead of the shore. There are lots of boats on offer and the one we took went as far as the first Bosphorus bridge which took about and hour and a half. This covers most of the important sights close to the city.

You need the right guide.... A trip through the Bosphorus Strait can be very enjoyable with the right guide. You need someone that can really point out the sites and someone you can ask questions of. Don't take the trip they are pushing when you are near the Blue Mosque etc. the guides are not good at all
Sight seeing. Brilliant and joyful. I can't imagine to have travel through Bosphorus strait with my colleague on that day

Two continebts - one boat ride.. We took one of the tours available (there are many) and spent about 2 hours headed North and then back to the city center. Watercraft really is one of the best ways to see a lot min a relatively short period of time. So much history - so little time.This was time well spent.
Worth the visit. I have the chance to do a private boat cruise, and it was brilliant, it is possible to see spectacular houses and monuments next to the Bosphoro shore, really good
Bosphorus Strait. Wonderful waterways with the distinct European and Asian sides and the wondrous Palaces, forts, Universities and homes borders it's shores - a cruise down the Bosphorus is memorable

Boating. Afternoon on the water going from Istanbul to sight the entrance to the Black Sea.sunny warm afternoon on a nice boat seeing an exotic culture with interesting architecture and sights.what could be better

Boat trip on Bosphorus Strait. There are a number of companies selling boat trips on the Bosphorus Strait. You can pay quite a lot but there are trips available for as little as 10 Turkish lira ($5.) We did a cheaper one and it was quite adequate. We had comfortable seats, the boat sat well in the water and we had some excellent views. We simply bought our tickets from one of the touts near the water. It also included a free shuttle bus.

Great views from boat. One sees some wonderful buildings when travelling on the Bosphorus by sightseeing boat. There are the Dolmabache Palace and some really fancy hotels and restaurants. I was amazed to see all the big houses, never thought of people actually living along the Bosphorus. Just remember to bring a jacket, it gets quite chilly if you sit on the deck.

Nice without being too exciting. The trip up the Bosphouros is OK without being too exciting. Lots of traffic on the waterway and under the two bridges and return. Worth trying the restaurants on the old bridge before or afterwards and take a walk along both sides as you will find something that suits your taste.

Worth the Day. Spend the day on the water with the sea air and the sun on your face. Take the public ferry which will take you all the way up the Bospherus to the Black Sea. Make note of interesting areas and buildings you might want to visit another day. When you reach the Black Sea you are at the terminus, and there is a 3-hour wait for the return ferry. Explore the fortress on the cliff (quite the hike so wear appropriate shoes) and have lunch before your return. Don't waste your money on a private tour. With a decent guide book you can be your own tour guide.
Ok. We did 2 hr tour, ok views from the river, glad I did not do a longer one. If u have time do it but if short visit skip it.

Nice trip!. Take a boattrip up and down the Bosphorus strait. There are som large and beautiful buildings on both sides. Its also nice with some wind in your hair during a warm day. Kind of exotic to see Asia on one side and Europe on the other side.

Must See. A cruise through the strait must be on your schedule when you visit Istanbul and make it in the day light so that you can see its attractions and beauty. Try to find a good restaurant or cafe on the Bosphurus and set there and enjoy.
Two continents connected by water. Forget about taking a private tour, just take the ferry for TL10 per person and do the tour for 1.5hrs. It's definitely a great way to see Istanbul.

Magnificent. Admittedly it was a tad cold when I went as it was February but the trip up and down the Bosphorus straight was a great time. I was the only one standing on the upper deck of the ferry snapping photos and enjoying the day. Watching the activity on both sides of the river was fascinating and there is so much history in Istanbul a short review can't possibly do it justice. If you have the opportunity, take a cruise, see the landscape, learn about the history, see the enormous chain links intended to keep out invading armies centuries ago. What a fascinating place. Wizardofwhere.com

nice trip. to get a cheap ride. 15 lira per person...do the following...walk as if u are going to go to the top kapi palace but do not enter it...walk with the walls of the castle towards the sea....keep walking downwards for 10 min in the sea direction...u will see cute hotels, cozy restaurants on the way...,,u will find ur self on the main road.( i think it s called kennedy road) anyway cross the road to reach the promenade . if u look right u will find a small pier. private owned boats come to take take turns for the bosphorous trip.the boast is nothing luxurious but 15 lira is more than enough for a 2 hr trip on the bosphorous. i will submit a picture of the pier.after ur boat trip ...u can buy the famous turkish sandwiches on the promenade for 5 lira...recommended

Boat tour of the Bosphorus Strait. We had lunch during a boat tour of the Bosphorus Strait. The food was good along with the commentary. Much better views were upstairs on the boat, but remember to bring sunscreen. The boat tour is a good way to get a different view of Istanbul.

Too expensive for what you get. The tour itself is nice since you have a nice view of the city and the "guide" gives some information. However, it is extremely expensive for what you get... by taking the normal ferries of the public transportantion (which costs ~1.5 euros) you have almost the same views for a lot less money. One advice is to convince the sellers to go down with the price, since we booked for half of the price of what it was appearing there.

Europe and Asia by water. A private boat tour up one side and down the other gives you an amazing perspective of what Turkey is all about.
This is a must but do it with a guide!

Best way to move around. FORGET TAKING THE EXPENSIVE BOSPHORUS TOURS! Take the ferries! Too bad we didn't know sooner. THIS is the way to move around Istanbul. Beautiful, cheap (3TL), fast (no traffic), and elbow to elbow with local commuters.

romantic & bustling. Romantic in the sense that it is a waterway for commerce, tourism, travel. Connects the Sea of Marmara with the Black sea. Fun watching ships and ferries trail to Bosphorus and to walk along it, where there are many interesting buildings and restaurants.

Disappointing night cruise on the Bosphorous. We took the last night cruise of the season. Disorganized at the Eminonu ferry station. With paper tickets, they don't explain the process and crowds mass at the single entrance gate. After boarding, we sat on the top deck and were bombarded with annoying music blared on speakers. You have to move downstairs which limits the overall view of the area. The we disembarked at Anadolu Kavagi. You get attacked by vendors and restaurant staff to overpay for below average food. ***Tip, bring your own food and drink and find an area to have your own picnic***. Two hours of being uncomfortable, then back on boat for another great scenic ride, save for the awful music blared on the loudspeakers. Only reason I give it two stars is because of the natural beauty of the area.
great waterways !. do take the boat down to the black sea by paying a little extra and see the beautiful houses by the Strait !!
One place of my bucket list..... I've wanted to visit this area and view the Bosphorus Strait for as long as I can remember.... the foundation stone of civilization as we know it!

Nice view of both sides of Istanbul - Europe and Asia. The strait is part of the boundary between Europe and Asia. It is the world's narrowest strait used for international navigation and it connects the Black Sea with the Sea of Marmara. We took a boat ride during the sunset and it was a nice a view of both sides of Istanbul. Walking around hagia sofia and blue mosque you will find people selling the boat tour.

Refreshing. We chose (Sehir Hatlari) company for the trip as their boats are very good and their schedule is exact. They have short (1.5 hours) and a full trip (6 hours). We chose the full trip and it takes 1.5 hours to reach a landing point called Anadulu Kavagi where they remain for 3 hours, enough time to have a sea food lunch, and then back to Eminonu in 1.5 hours. They have a morning and a night trip.An internet site showing their schedule and plans is present too.It was very nice and refreshing.
Beautiful journey. A wonderful beginning or ending to a trip in Turkey. It's a beautiful way to cruise and see both continents and the lovely architecture.
Relaxing and great views. The Bosphorus runs between Europe and Asia with unique panoramic views. Very enjoyable, but what was missing was a glass of wine.

We came in by cruise ship so not that impressed. WE went on a boat ride on the strait but it was pretty uneventful after coming in by cruise ship. You do go under the bridges and they are lit up at night. We had a dinner on the boat and it was not good.

Dont Miss!. The area all in all is amazing
everything looks sooo social to u and comfortable
nice for couples and families both
very nice view

Lovely views.. You cannot visit Istanbul and not take a Ferry ride to the Black Sea. Round trips are available, but we chose to take a car back so we could stop for lunch and any other interesting spots.

Excellent sights - but pick a good tour company. A trip up the Bosphorus Strait is a must if you are visiting Istanbul. The views from the water are wonderful and you get a different angle on this vibrant city. Be careful to pick a reputable tour company. i went with Senkron Sightseeing Tours and although the views on the trip were stunning I felt the overall organisation of the trip was a bit chaotic and just felt there were too many people on the boat. It was 35 Euros for a half day tour that included a short stopover at a village (Anadolu Kavagi) just off the Black Sea and lunch on board the boat.

Great for night cruise. A circle of night cruise can take a couple of hours (three if dinner included) on one of open roof big boats. You can enjoy your night with passing by many famous spots facing Bosphorus and finally the great Bosphorus bridge with magnificent lighting at nights. Well recommended.

Took a boat tour!. I think if you go to Istanbul them you have to take a boat tour! My daughter loved and so did we, was cheap and a long tour , they serve tea I suggest bringing a snack especially with kids on tow.

Great Scenery. This strait is the connection between Europe and Asia. When you visit, you have to have a boat trip. I was with friends and we had this boat trip with live music and dinner.Absolutelly delicious time, crossing the Strait, seeing those beautiful houses by the shore, sailing under the bridges, a magical scene that you must do if you go to Istambul.

Great way to see Istanbul by water!. We took a Bosphorus Cruise and it was amazing! The weather was in the 70's and the view of the city was fantastic. If you are in Istanbul, do not miss an opportunity to see the city from the water. The tour we took allowed us to see so many of the historical sights-palaces. mosques, etc. The history of the city is fascinating! Don't miss this!

Afternoon boat trip. This is a great way to see Istanbul and take in the sites without be surrounded by hundreds of people. Its worth taking something to keep you warm, during our trip the weather changed and there was a small thunder storm. It would of been a good idea to have a jacket handy!

Great Boat ride. We had a very nice trip. It was fairly crowed getting onto the boat, but it was very fun. We were fortunate to hit a holiday and ran into a flotilla of local boats blowing horns and waving flags. It was peaceful and a great trip. The spice market is across the street so can just walk over and spend part of your day.

We skipped the boat trip. On the advice of friends, we skipped the all-day boat trip and opted for a ferry ride to Asia (Karikoy) instead. This worked for us and might for you too, particularly if you have a short time in Istanbul. There are 90 minute tours available from Eminonou that run most days from 12-7pm.

Great way to spend a few hours. We chose the public ferry's two hour circle trip, which goes up past the second bridge and makes one stop to pick up passengers. I didn't think I could handle 7 hour one. It leaves at 2:30pm and you can board at 2:00pm to get a good seat. It's all about the view and the buildings along the river. At 12TL it is very affordable and enjoyable. The ferry is much nicer than some of the boats on the private tours.
quite exciying. The area boast a great history and the views were quite good.educational tour and great sightseeing.did not like the fact we had to find our way back to our hotel after the tour ended
Ferry ride. The 2 hour ferry trip was a great way to orientate to Istanbul. Much of the highlights are on the waterfront of the strait

Short afternoon cruise. What a fabulous trip, well worth the money and I was able to get some spendid photos of some really magnificent buildings bridges etc. This trip really gives you a feel for the history, the importance of this waterway in the region and how busy these straights are with shipping. The currents were unexpectedly swift as well and the view of fortifications built up over centuries is best appriciated & clearly visible from the water, something I never expected to learn or observe. This is a trip I would repeat given the oppertunity it was that good.

Do no be fooled to buy expensive boat ride !. There are multiple operators running boat cruises at Bosphorus Strait. Do not be fooled into buying one of the expensive rides. There is a ride available at 12lt. He boat leaves next to Galat Bridge and lasts allmost three hours.
Boat trip. Beautiful view from the boat, 1.5 hour trip while going through the most places of historical Istanbul.

Great tour organized by the municipality. We took the longer 3 hours tour and ate at the last stop. Get the audio guide and put on automatic. Take the one in the morning, I think it was at 11AM, so that you can arrive on time for lunch at the stop.

Visit at night for extra delight. The boat cruise was a lovely experience, seeing the city all lit up at night was beautiful. The food on the boat was great, the service was wonderful. The show on the cruise was a special insight into old fashioned courting ways of a Turkish man to woman. Very cute. Dancers were very talented. Costumes great
Nice Trip. Bosphorus trip by boat was a good experience with a lot to see from both sides of European and Asian sides.

Night time crossing fun. We debated about a cruise but decided we wanted to visit the different shores of the city so instead used the local ferries to cross at night. The views are spectacular, the crossing cheap and it means you spend your time visiting other sights rather than being stuck on a boat for hours
A way to see Istanbul. Cruise down Bosphorus Strait for about 45mins. It's another way to see Istanbul, both the Europe and Asia side of Istanbul. It can get pretty windy while cruising.

Take the ferry. The cheapest way to experience this is to take the ordinary ferry from Eminonu - e.g. to Kadikoy. It costs you 3 lira (less with an Instanbulkart / Akbil). Spend a few hours wandering around Kadikoy. where no one will try to sell you anything on the street but it has nice pedestrian streets and an antiques road to browse in. You still get the views of the old city from the water but at a fraction of the cost.

A great way to get out of the city for a day. We took the all day tour which gets you almost to the Black Sea and in sight of the new bridge being built over the Bosphorus. There's a lot of time of lunch at the far end, so take 45 minutes or so and walk up the hill to the castle. Great views.

This waterway is one history's grand boulevards. Few cities have grand waterways. New York City and maybe London come to mind. Istanbul spreads for miles and miles on either side of the Bosphorus Strait into Asia and Europe. You can cross it by ferry or pass under it on the Marmaray subway (new 10/2013 - no photos allowed). All views are great but the view from the Topkapi palace are the most striking. Weather gives this waterway many different looks. Historic trade routes, military battles, and political alliances happen here because of the strait's critical geography. We did not take the Bosphorus cruise as my wife is prone to motion sickness.

A delightful sail and an instructive one. There are regular boat services as well as organized tours. If possible visit some of the highlights along the route: Dolmabace Palace, Rumeli Fortress, etc. Excellent fish restaurants at the village nearest to the Black Sea

night music cruise. Nice tour only in Saturday night in july and august by the oldest ferry company in Istanbul. First dock right of Galata bridge, start at 18:25 20 tl only. Total 4 h of pure pleasure for all sences exc taste if wine or beer geek. Own bottles tolerated if not so agressive. Can't recommend eatery in Kavagi in the asiatic part because most of them aren't alcohol serving - maybe rumeli or european Kavagi is better. Nice night shot's opportunities in both directions.

A pleasant cruise in the night. There are several boats which take you for a cruise down the straits. The view of the coastline is spectacular because of the lighting. The cruise includes dinner and some local dances like belly dancing.

This is a must thing to do in Istanbul.. The cruise along the Bosporus strait is a must thing to do in Istanbul and gives you the sights along the strait, there is no beach or shore to see, but villas, hotels, palaces, mosques and beautiful houses. It was windy and a bit choppy when we had the tour but a great 3 hrs to spend. Highly recommended.

Amazing view from the bridge. I passed over the Bosphorus strait via the Bosphorus bridge on early morning, just as the sun was rising. The view, both northwards and southwards was amazing. Well worth the trip.

Lovely morning. Took the trip with Tuysol from their landing near the Galata bridge. It was 18 lira each for a. 2 hour trip which made the 30 euro offers from the vendors near the. Blue Mosque seem extortionate.
Large spacious boat, really enjoyed seeing the sites from the water.

Boat Trip. Took a short trip up the Bosphorus on cruise boat, travelling along the European and Asian sides of the river. The architecture and historical buildings were most interesting. Ideal, but inexpensive way of burning up a few hours. The trip included a visit to the Spice Market.

The Best in The World. No matter how many places you have seen, it is not completed without seeing Bosphorous... It is beautiful, probably the most beautiful to see in Istanbul. There is not such city or place in the world.If you like to walk a lot, I recommend to walk from Eminönü till Emirgan, it will take you hours and hours but you would be amazed.
Bosphorus Strait. Afternoon is the best time for cruises since reflections along the Strait of homes are awesome photos.

Cool views. There are lots and lots of really nice cafés which have views over the bosphorus. Maybe a bit more expensive then other cafés but for European standards still cheap and the cool views and photos are included

A Must!!!. A visit to Istanbul will not be complete without a cruise on The Bosphorous Strait. We did it on our last evening in Istanbul and it brought our whole vacation to a wonderful end. We booked a cruise which included dinner and entertainment. The trip took about 4 hours and the city view at night from the Bosphorous is truly something to behold. We could identify all the places we visited but they looked different at night in coloured lights.

Great view.. The cruse on the boat is well worth doing. You get a good view of all the buildings on both sides of the Bosphorus. Very interesting. It is a trip well worth doing. We did it in the day time, but, I suspect that it would be much better at night.
Unique. I loved the concept of being separated from Asia by a strait but united under a same town. One of the best trips of my life.

Amazing international highway. The best way to enjoy the view of the strait is from the Konyali cafe at the Topkapi palace grounds. The number of ships going to the Sea of Marmara or to the Back Sea is fascinating to watch.

Relaxing sightseeing. We did the 3 hours boat trip up and down the Bosphorus, but not as far as the Black Sea. This scenery on both sides gave us a good idea of the nearby surroundings as well as the newer kind of architecture of some of the houses on the Asian side. We also passed some medieval fortresses. The background history regarding the fortresses and how the Turks had used these waterways to their benefit in the past during war times were very informative and interesting. A visit to Istanbul is not finished without a boat trip on the Bosphorus Strait. Highly recommend!
Unique. Took a tour at night across to Asia and back. Impressive and great views of all the buildings and bridges with lights is beautiful!

Don't miss it.. All,sorts of,options but the 11/2 hour cruise is probably the best and all you need. Get there a bit early so you can get a seat outside and make sure you get the non sunny side as it can get quite hot in summer.

Excellent views. We took the Bosphorous cruise and really enjoyed it. Our tour guide was knowledgeable and the tour was very educational. We did the tour on our very first day, and this allowed us to get our bearings on the important sites/monuments to see.

Must do!. Istanbul is a city that faces the sea(s) surrounding so a visitor will get a great view of the city cruising the Bosphorus straits!The snapshots you get are fashinating and the colours of the sea,the beautiful houses upper on the straits and the trees coming down to the sea make it an experience!The only problem was the time of the day-noon-that made it difficult due to the heat and moisture.It 's better to pick up the night cruise.

Take a boat ride. Take a boat ride along the Bosphorus and you'll see many types of architecture. Travel under the Galata Bridge to the Bosphorus Bridge and back. Life along the Bosphorus is fascinating.
Panoramic Views. The Bosphorus is the lifeline of Istanbul which connects the Old Town European side and the Asian side.A cruise on the Bosphorus is a must when in Istanbul

Spice Souk & Cruise. We decided to do a tour and chose the Spice Souk and Bosphorous Cruise tour as we both live to cook and we wanted to have a view of Istanbul from the sea - we were picked up from our hotel and had a quick zip through the city up and down all the narrow and twisty streets to a meeting point where we disembarked and waited for another bus to take us to the Spice Souk this was fascinating and the smell of the spices was incredible, we had about 45 mins in the souk we bought saffron and of course some Turkish delight (which is NOTHING like you buy back home!) we then got back on the bus and was taken to the ferry and got on one of the boats this part takes about an 1hr and we were very lucky that we had blue skies and sunshine I loved it, especially as the next day the heavens opened and the streets were like small rivers with drains popping open all over the place.
Fantastic!. Take the 5 hour tour. Get sunscreen and water. Lunch is delicious! You will experience Istanbul in a more and complete manner from the Bosphorous

Fantastic view. The view of the Bosphorus is nice ,especially if u look at it from the neighboring hills or high places around .there is a lot of caffe around the area you can enjoy the panoramic view while you drink the Turkish tea (chai)

Asia and Europe. For me the best activity in Istambul. It takes 6 hours, 3 on a boat and 3 in very fantastic place where you must visit the fortress and eat looking for the Bosphorus strait. From there you can observe the Black Sea, Europe and Asia together.A must!

Cute but not amazing. Ok. It's nice and cheap. Use municipality company like Turyol and the price is only 12 TL if i remember well. It's a good first impression of the city, in special way if you do the tour on late afternoon to see he panorama at dusk.

Beautiful scenery. Well worth doing the excursion. Beautiful scenery on both sides of the Bosphorus. Extremely hot so remember to take water with you. You can buy water or cold drinks on the ferry but quite expensive.

Boat down the Bosphorus. To appreciate Istanbul you need to get out on the water. Take a scenic boat cruise - about two hours and head up the strait and under the huge bridges. Else take a cheap ferry to the Asian side and see much the same thing. Istanbul has a great skyline from the water.

Sort of Must see- for cruise and view of Istanbul along the bank. If you have enough time keep a good amount of time for a cruise down this strait as you'll not only see the Instanbul spread around the banks, but also enjoy the refreshing short cruise trip
Great views. Probably the best way to see Istanbul. Fascinating to see the numerous historical sites of interest. Highly recommend.

Better with a guide. I took a cruise by IBO which included a brief stop at the Rumeli fortress, and also as part of my walking tour with Circle Istanbul. IBO has its own (chartered?) ship and does not dock at the main jetty at Eminonou.While the sights are pretty either way, you do get a lot more out of the trip if you have a guide who can tell you what the various buildings and districts you will see along the way are.Bring a picnic to have onboard.

A wonderful afternoon. Since I was traveling with AmaWaterways, they organized the Bosphorus cruise and limited it to just those traveling with our group. Which meant lots of room, good service, ability to move around, get great pictures, sip a glass of wine and actually step off the boat several times. The homes and other buildings along the shoreline are very definitely upscale and the weather was glorious, although quite warm for some. I would definitely recommend that anyone visiting Istanbul for the first time get out on the water in order to get a different perspective on this amazing city.

Nice tour. Once you are visiting Istanbul, it's nice to take a boat tour thru the Bosphorus. The city is full of historical places, and I recommend at least 4 days there.Those tours usually go around the city, passing by the Galata Bridge, Maiden's Tower and the Bosphorus Bridge (conection between Europe and Asia).

A fascinating experience.. I highly recommend that you take one of the many ferries that constantly cross the Bosphorus. You can mix with the locals and see the city from both Asia and Europe. The crossing gives you a great view of old city and the boat action on the busy Bosphorus is worth the trip all by itself. Also, there is excellent shopping on the Asian side within easy walking distance of the ferry terminal. There are many tourist cruises that will show you the many sites of the cites.... these are worth it as well.

A Very Busy Waterway - Fun to Watch & Ferries are Available for Short Tours. The waterway has lots of traffic from small boats to large freighters and cruise ships. It is fund to walk along the waterway and see the traffic. It is very safe and there are lots of locals and tourists taking ferries and sightseeing ships. I recommend the government ferry which has a ferry that runs a 3-4 hour trip up the Bosporus and back. It is very affordable, safe and the trip allows a lot of interesting sights, including old fortresses, castles, small villages and gorgeous old villas.In Istanbul along the waterway there are a lot of restaurants serving fresh seafood.

Best sites. From our July trip to Istanbul this one would be placed as number one on my list and I highly recommended to anyone. Sailing between Europe and Asia while enjoying all the beautiful sites with the explanations of a guide, and a taste of the traditional cup of tea. Thumbs up!
We travelled over the Bosphorus strait.. It was an interesting trip across the Bosphorus strait. We had an excellent commentary from our tour director.

Lovely boating on. . .. We stepped onto the boat after a long day of walking and looking at museums. Tea was served on our private cruise. Nice boat- we sat outside, wonderful breeze- lovely ending to a beautiful day. Lots of houses to see up and down the Bosphorus. Helped to get the area into perspective.

A Must See. Take a ferry from Kavatas (pronounced Kavatash) or Besiktas (pronounced Beshiktash) ports and take a tour of the Bosphorous and enjoy the beautiful scenery. Go to Bebek for lunch or dinner in one of the many restaurants overlooking the Bosphorous.
Sea view fun. We had taken the Bosporus cruise tour during the nite time. We thoroughly enjoyed the ride. Music, Dance & cool breeze. Awesome combination.

An other view of Istanbul. We have done it with the regular boat (12TL/person). It's also possible to have an audioguide (10TL). It's really interesting because very different from what we see when we stay in Sultanahmet or Beyoglu. Very nice buildings, a lot of trees, residantial quartiers...

Nice experience on the public boat. So this was basically a very nice trip. A few tips ...* Where you sit on the boat makes a difference. Try to get there early. I don't know how early is early enough, but the 30 minutes suggested in the LP is laughable. I couldn't score a decent seat at that time, but ended up sitting on the life vest box on the back of the boat. Which isn't a bad alternative. * Theres no narration, so consider bringing a guidebook or renting an audio tour. I was able to spot most things described in the Lonely Planet. * Its not obvious from the schedule, but this tour includes a ridiculously long lunch stop at a village full of overpriced restaurants with a heavy focus on fish. A lot of us were really confused about how when the boat left, which didn't really help us make the most of our time. (In our case, for the 1035 cruise, the boat left for Istanbul at 300). To break up the monotony, consider hiking up to the castle, though honestly you can't do a lot once you get there.

Great view.. We thought the cruise wasn't needed, but we were wrong.The cruise offers a great view, and you can see clearly the Istanbul. The european side, and the asian, and the bridges. It is great.

A boat ride on the Bosphorous. As part of a Holland America Line cruise to the Eastern Med., we pulled in to Istanbul for some excursions. The first and most important being a boat ride on the Bosphorous Strait. We chose to sit upstairs in the open air (it got very chilly so a warm hat, scarf and jacket is needed) whereupon we were served orange juice and apple tea with a little snack. Our comentator was very informative about all the buildings along the way. We were given an excellent overview of the history of the Bosphorous and what we could see all around us. Going up the strait and under the main crossing bridge, we concentrated on the attractions on the left and turned around to come back so concentrated on the attractions on the other left (Asian side). The say the least the architecture was astounding. Some incredibly intricate and beautiful buildings. Some homes, some palaces, some refurbished Omani residences, some private places. Going up on the first left were some ever so swanky hotels and restaurants with their own piers. Party boats on the Bosphorous are plentiful, stopping off at various venues it looked like. Nightime on the Bosphorous is magical, we arrived back to dock as it was getting dark and all the million twinkly lights on the boats and from the across the water was simply too beautiful to describe. It is worth it if you have time to take a day ride and an evening ride and have dinner on the boat as well. Some have discos going. I would say it is one of the big must do's whilst in Istanbul.
Best of Istanbul. Taking a private boat ride down the Bosphorus is a highlight of Istanbul to enjoy the beauty of this unique location.

Historical. Great views which will leave you spell bound .One seems to be enchanted by the view of Asia & Europe. Night views not to be missed along with the Boat/ Ferry ride to Princess island.Hog on the bakalaw.
Umm.. I guess you have to do the required boat trip, we did it during daylight and may well have been more impressed if we had done a night cruise, not sure. Underwhelming.

a trip up the Bosphorus to the Black Sea. took one of the local ferries, don't go on one of the private excursions, as they are a lot more expensive and don't offer anything different, and its rather fun to travel with all the locals

Lovely. We took the Saturday night cruise which happens only in Summer. It costs 20 lira both way, which is quite cheap considering it's both ways.For the trip itself, you can see a lot around the Bosphorus and it's beautiful. There's nothing really fancy on the boat, and no guide. It's only as good as you can make it to be.The boat stops at the Asian part near the Black sea. That village is quite small with only restaurants near the shore. The ones near the shore are overpriced so go to the ones in the back. It's a nice way to spend the evening, but don't expect something really amazing.

DON't Miss it. What a trip. For 15 TL (£5) you can take the Hop off/ on boat all the way to Poshours bridge. Come off on the Asian side, have a meal and drink and take the next bout back. The boat comes every hour until about 18:45 but you need to check the time table. It is fantastic trip which will give a different view of Istanbul.

Beautiful Views and a relaxing way to spend the day-and cooler, too!. OK, so you went to Istanbul in Summer, and you're wilting. You've fled to the cistern, but now you need something new. Well, get down to the water and get on a boat! The Bosphorus is beautiful; grand hills, sweeping suspension bridges, castles, seriously drool factor homes, and enticing waterfront restaurant. This last bit is the one real downside; you'll want the boat to stop at a lot of great looking restaurants, but it can't stop at every one. Great views of sights like the Ortakoy Mosque, Rumeli Fortress-(this is the best way to view the Dolambahce Palace, trust me) while you enjoy the cool(er) breezes, and have a soda. Yes, the soda's a bit pricey by Istanbul standards. Deal with it, you didn't take a vacation to pinch pennies, get over it. There are a variety of ferry services you can choose from, from the basic public ferries to the private tours. We took the Avrasya Deniz "jump on/off" ferry for 15TL, they were helpful, and the trip was a lot of fun. Being able to get off at interesting stops is a big plus, certainly. It's a don't miss, especially during summer.

A scenic view of Istanbul.. Another highlight of my trip to Istanbul was to see it from the Bosphorus.Truly a magnificent view to behold as you cruise through the turquoise waters of the Bosphorus river and take in the sights of the famous landmarks, the castle ruins and the beautiful private homes on the hilltops.Don't be duped into buying tours from the touters/ tour offices as they charge extortionate prices (we were quoted 600 liras for a family cruise by a local tour operator!!).Do some research and go independently if you can.We purchased the audio guides available on the cruise but due to poor network signal, it didn't work so that was pointless!Nonetheless, a pleasant experience was had by us - a must do!

Choose carefully who you go with. We went on the Sehir Hatari ferry Saturday evening cruise which is only run in the summer. The journey up the river is great with views to both sides of the Bosphorus and it only cost 20TL but the boat was dirty and there was incredibly loud music playing which to us seemed unnecessary. Soft drinks and snacks were available and we stopped at the top end on the Asian side for dinner. There were not many restaurants to choose from and all were overpriced so all in all it was a real disappointment. I would recommend just taking a boat ride up and catching the bus back along the European side, that is a great trip.
Ok cruise. We did the cruise and I think it is ok. We took it with the 19h00 group and I think it was good where you see the city with lights and see it from the water.

Cruise on the Bosphorus. The cruise was lovely, our tour group had the whole boat to ourselves so it wasn't noisy or crowded as some of the other boats we saw, and it was a great experience. An informative guide, beautiful scenery, -and i even saw a couple of dolphins swimming!. All along the Bosphorus you can see different styles of architecture from traditional homes to modern clubs. It was a great experience for me, and i can easily imagine the historical events that took place on tne Bosphorus - the wars, the chain across it etc

Fab lazy day. Did the full day cruise, partly to save our feet and thought it was fab.We sat on the left side of the boat which was a good thing as we were in the shade both ways, the boat slows down at various major sights so loads of photo opportunities. There's a 2 hour (ish) stop at the top, the village is a bit nothingy although there is a ruined fort at the top of the hill (which we couldn't be bothered with), we just wandered around a bit a sat on a shady bench watching the world go by.A good way to chill out & yet still do a bit of exploring.

great boat trip. We decided to just get the ferry over to Karakoy another area that was across the Bosphorus Strait. It cost something in the region of £3 return and once over at the other side there is a massive shopping mall as well as the Fenebache Football Stadium. Crossing the strait was a great sight
Take the commuter ferry and relax. Taking the commuter ferry is cheap and a great way to go up and down the strait and see many of the historical sites such as Dolmabahce Palace.

Beautiful. We loved taking the ferry across the Bosphorus. Ferries will set you back 4TL each (around $2), and a trip can take anywhere from 15 – 45 minutes. We definitely recommend heading to Kadikoy, and also Besitkas, both really beautiful and different areas to visit!

Every tourist does this. nice boat ride, tickets available on spot and multiple other places.Like everything in Istanbul rates are very negotiable , I saw them varying between Lira 15 to Lira 35 per person in the ride we took

What an eye opener. Cruising along the Bosphorus gives you an insight into the wealthier side of Istanbul. Apart from some beautiful museums along the way, you will see some incredible private homes, some new builds but many older palatial homes as well as many converted public buildings. There's certainly lots of money still around in this part of Turkey!

Great views . We did this trip but on our own. You don't need to pay the 25TL or 70 euro to do a your or private yatch. Take the ferry to Asia and you see everything. Walk along the coast and do as you please without the rush of a guide.
Epic. Take a trip from the harbour itself and don't be fooled into paying 20 euros by those other rogue traders. A great chance to see the true scale of Istanbul!

A great swim. I went to Istanbul to take part in the 6.5 mk Intercontinental swim 2014. The Bosphorous is wonderful. The water runs fast and is very clean. It is certainly worth a trip on the ferry if you are not swimming.

Relax and smile. Spend a relaxing day on the Bosphorus by taking the ferry close to the New Galata bridge. The 25TL fee stands in sharp contrast with the 70 euros private cruises (which are not different) offer. Walk up to the Yoros Castle at the last stop to get some splendid views. Worth it!

A perfect way to see 'East meets West'. We absolutely loved our tour of the Bosphorous. Because Istanbul is at the confluence of two continents, this provides the perfect opportunity to see and experience each. If you are going to get a tour, I'd recommend the full day tour as the half day (either morning or afternoon) will miss out. Our tour took us to the Maiden's Tower, Ortakoy, the Rumeli Fortress, and an old Genovese castle overlooking the Black Sea. Along the way, we saw the Topkepi Palace, the Hagia Sophia, the Golden Horn, and the Dolmabahce Palace from the water - all spectacular. Along the way, you can see several Ottoman palaces on the Asian side that you might miss if you stayed in central Istanbul.Though you may find your tour expensive, it's worth it. Even if you have a poor guide or are just crossing on the ferry, take an opportunity to take in the cityscape of Istanbul.Highly recommended.

Not to be missed. I took my Family and Friends on a Turkish Gullet to go up and down the Bosphorus. It was amazing the Captain had arranged a wonderful table of different Boreks (Turkish Pastry filled with meat, cheese or spinach), Bulgurs, Mezes and drinks not to forget a huge Chocolate Cake for the Grandkids! I suggest this private boat over the heavily loaded with people Tourist boats, loud and inelegant.I don't have with me the name of the Company of this great boat, which by the way came to pick us up at our Boutique Hotel,Sumahan on the Water and ripped us back there, but if you want it let me know and I will give it to you.

Breath taking. Me and my wife went on a tour at bousfor and it was as relaxing as it was beautiful.The sights were breath taking and best be seen before sunset and it was 2 hours for only 10TL!!!!Note: of you wanna see beautiful sights make sure you are facing the the closer side of the city but you're gonna have to bear the sun for the first hour :)The only reason i give it 4 out of 5 cuz the guy who gave us the tickets was a jerk and yelled at everybody
amazing. it was magnificient to see----so much history. watching the cargo ships and the ferries everyday was a signt to see. take a cruise for the sights are great
fun boat cruise with info on the sites. fun boat cruise with info on the sites, got a history lesson on turkey and saw the famous castles and palaces that line the strait.
Great Trip. Beautiful sights and water. You can see so many different historical sites from the water and overall beautiful scenery.

A great way to start our Turkey jorney.... We took a bosphorus cruise on the first day we arrived in Istanbul and that really made our journey.It's a beautiful day with a small group of great people. we even made a friend on the tour.The tour also include the winter palace tour and egyption market.You can see both Asian side and European side of Turkey land and if you into Architecture it is a very good journey. the tour guide was great too...at the end of the tour we visited a leather place which was ok as it is a main product of Turkey besides carpet.Take this tour on a sunny day otherwise you need to grab your jacket on a cooler climate.

Nowhere like this. No wonder this was once the centre of the world. The location was the crossroads of so much of the globe. The climate is beautiful and the aura of its importance and activity remains loud and clear. Take your wife! This needs to be right at the top of your bucket list.

Fantastic Sunset Cruise. If you are in Istanbul on a Saturday night, the sunset cruise is well worth the 25TL. Use the ferry service, don't bother with private tours, but get there early to get your ticket, and then early again to queue to get on. We were early, by chance, and so glad, as the queue got very long very quickly. Great way to spend a Sat night. The tour leaves from Eminiou, and you get about 2 hrs at a village on the Black Sea for dinner, before returning. Choose your restaurant carefully for dinner. Our fish meal (red mullet) was inedible, and smelled bad. Don't know the name, but it was right on the water. Also got absolutely savaged by sand flies, and the bites left huge red welts which took a week to subside and were very itchy, even with antihistamines. So, probably better to not be right on the water.

Take private boat to enjoy the trip. I tried to join the public boat that depart at 2:30PM, but it is very crowded and it cost 10 LTR, so I decide to take the private boat which cost 20 LTR/Person. it really worth the time and money. the trip takes 1:30 min 2ways. you can go on the boat front to see the beautiful views.

The feeling of crossing the two continents is so great. Bosphorus Strait is really a must while in Istanbul. I was so lost while wondering around the Old City and there was hundreds of ads and people that offered me that tour. Most of them are two-hour ride and I was glad that I didnt pick any of those. I booked the tour from my hotel and I was picked in the morning and dropped off back to the hotel after the trip. The blue sea, the sun, the blue sky and the breeze are so refreshing. The scenery with beautiful and old buildings by the water ... we had a couple of stops which the 2-hour ride would not offer. If you want to swim in the sea then go for a full day cruise. You will not regret.
Beautiful scenery. Taking a cruise along the Bosphorus is a must do in Istanbul. It can be very relaxing after a long day walking around the city and the scenery is breathtaking.

Excellent experience - best visited after sunset!. We had booked a dinner cruise starting around 7.45, and we loved every bit of it. As the sun sets, the lightings on the bridge and surrounding places make it a unique experience and a dinner cruise would just make it perfect!If you are visiting Istanbul, I recommend to keep one evening to enjoy the bosphorous strait - a must do!
Blue sea under dazzling sun makes it a bejeweled experience. On the sunny bright day the blue water of Bosphorus strait made us feel drown in the brightness of blue! Wonderful!

Much more than a simple connection between two continents. It´s worthwhile to explore Istanbul reaching out two continents at once. The boat tours (60- 90 min) take locals here and there and you can absorb so much from this experience. Go on a sunny day. Must see Istanbul fix
