Nice Boat Ride. After you have walked your, ummm, legs off, it might be time to just sit back, relax, and let someone else do the driving. If that's the case, you need to jump on one of the boats doing a trip up the Bosphorus. It really is a nice relaxing trip and you'll get to see the city of Istanbul from a whole new prospective.There are several boat trip, depending on how much time, or money you want to spend. One of the basic trips, and one of the best, is a 1.5 hour trip up the Strait to the second Bridge....as a San Franciscan it's emotionally difficult to see how the Turks have stolen the concept of the Golden Gate Bridge...not once, but twice <gasp> OK, so once you get close to it, you realize it has nothing on the GGB, it's just another knock off.On the quicky tour you still get to land on the Asian side, and have a commentary, in English, during the trip. It's definitely worth doing.

A worthwhile day trip. Bring a sweater/jacket for the wind if you want to sit topside; the views are equally good outside or in. Our boat went just to the second bridge; some longer trips reach the Black Sea - be sure you know which itinerary you're following. The buildings on the Asia side seemed more interesting or unique to me

Always a great view. i love to walk the area and enjoy the ever changing reviews across the Bosphorus Strait and now you can see the third Bosphorus Bridge being built, and also watch the continuous flow of shipping passing through.
Overrated. It is always nice to be on the water, but our audio was confusing to operate so we missed good information about the various locations we were passing by.

Rivers as ancient as this one are rare.. Good value here and very interesting with Asia on one side and Europe on the other. Golden Horn also included.Took a She tour as our hotel was up the hills from Aga Sofia and we didn't want the walk.

An Ancient Delight!. We just love the Bhos! The constant stream of boats and people fishing from the piers, but it is also a great location from which to admire Istanbul - best done from one the many ferrys that chug around this ancient waterway.

A 2 hour boat trip on the Bosphorus was really great. We were sold two tickets at 10 Euros per person for a two hour trip on the Bosphorus with a commentary. It was most enjoyable. We met at a location in from of the Blue Mosque and then were escorted "crocodile style" down to get on the boat. The salesman had said it was "a two minute walk, just 200 metres" and this was a huge understatement. The pace is fairly fast, all downhill but it is 7-10 minutes' walk and being of mature years, it was a bit of a frog march for me. Not suitable if you are infirm as getting on the boat can be a bit tricky as well as the walk to get to the boat in the first place. There are other boat trips which might be more suitable.The commentary was informative but not constant, which was good. There were toilets and a bar on board and it was sunny but a bit windy and chilly on the return journey so you may like to take a jacket. There were wonderful views of many palaces and we went up as far as the second bridge and returned down the Asian side. We also had a brief trip up the Gold Horn. Well worth the money.

Cruise between Asian & European Continents. See it all as you cruise down Bosphorus, the narrow strait of water that separates the 2 continents and cuts the city of Istanbul in half. It is a wonderful way to view & get a feel for both sides of the city, from the waterfront cafes and bars to the local fishermen. The cruise provided us with fabulous views and most excellent photo opportunities of the palaces, villas, fortresses and elite residences of the upper class. We went before dusk and enjoyed seeing the city in daylight then watching the scenery change into glittery lights as the sun was setting.

A most enjoyable experience, cruising through Bosporous Strait. Cruising though Bosporous is an experience you must not miss. I highly recommend it especially if you hit lucky with the weather. The regular line boats are fine and very inexpensive. You can relax and enjoy the ride. The waters are very calm most of the time and you pass several interesting places both on the European & Asian sides.

Beautiful. Went on a 2 hr Bosphorus Straight cruise. Tour guide told us about the many attractions along the way. Beautiful day, so we were lucky. Get an idea of how much the cruises normally cost, as those selling will negotiate the price with you. Don't take the first price! Everything there is negotiable. However, our guy we bought tix from in the square also ended up taking us to his family's Turkish carpet store for a demonstration...how did we get roped into that?! There are many vendors at the port. I bought a peeled, salted cucumber and watermelon.

Best 120 lira we spent on the entire holiday. Had lunch at a seafront restaurant and asked the waiter if any boats moored nearby where for hire. Rather than get a train or pay for 2 taxis (there were 6 of us) we hired a cruiser for 120 Lira to drop us off near the Galata Bridge. It was absolutely fantastic, no waiting in traffic or changing trains! Our own personal river taxi - we could have had the boat for up to an hour.
Where Asia meets Europe. What a wonderfull way to spend the day;on a boat slowly sailing down the Bosphorus.Europe on one side ,Asia on the other and plenty of sites along the way.
Fab views. Nice boat trip away from masses of people. You get a good view of both sides and the commentary was good. Could have done with some shade

Bosphorus Strait.. Going on the Bridge over the straits from the European To the Asian side, is an experience in itself. A cruise on the river, is most relaxing. do not miss the Belly Dance, as we,, as the person, who twirls a heavy drape in numerous ways, on board the Cruise. A fantastic sight from the Topikap Palace.

The best part of İstanbul. İf you are in any side of İstanbul,you must arrange some time to spend on the shore to walk down some hours.Magnificent&breathtaking view fm both sides will take you away,You also have plenty of options on both parts to eat and drink at many kind of restaurants&cafes.You must also take one of the boats fm Kadıköy,Üsküdar,Eminönü or Beşiktaş for having some tours lasting a few hours to see the beautiful houses and villas on both sides.Strongly recommended.

east meets west. a classic experience. this is the place where you could clearly feel best of eastern and western influences. during day time just keep strolling on the streets aimlessly and at late evening watch it from yatch. awesome experience. feel the meeting place of east and west

Must-See, Use Mass Transit. The Bosphorus Strait is a must-see in Istanbul, absolutely astounding in its beauty. Do not buy a tour, though! Take the mass transit ferry from Eminonu to Kadikoy -- it's only 3 Turkish Lira per person ($1.5 USD, ~1 Euro), and it'll give you a beautiful view of Sultanahmet, the ships waiting to pass through, and both sides of the city in general.

Great 1.5 Hour Trip. Avoid Bosphorus tour hawkers near major attractions and take the public ferry. It was only 10 Lire each and tours on tape with headphones are available. Tea, coffee, and snacks all on board. Bring your camera to capture incredible sites.

Beautiful views of both sides of Bosphorus. One needs to take this cruise to really appreciate the 2 sides of Istanbul. Only when you are on the cruise , you can see the actual differences in the 2 banks of the strait

relaxing 2 hour cruise with good views. I enjoyed this trip as I could get to rest my tired feet after days of pounding the mostly cobblestone pavements. I know the story of the Ottoman invasion of Constantinople so that made the trip interesting. Some magnificent buildings along the way.
a busy waterway. a good way to spend half a day on the water and travel up to the black sea. see lots of sights along the way, and enjoy the strait traffic.

Beautiful. Don't miss the opportunity to take a boat trip on the Bosphorus. There is first of all the beautiful water (it's obviously kept quite clean of trash etc). Seeing the bridge and the division of Asia and Europe is special. The history is great to behold. The houses are incredible (ah, to live in one of those...). The view of the city is great!

Nice cruise. We took a Bosphorus cruise that lasted about 1.5 hours and took us up the European side and then back down the Asian side, along with a guide telling us about everything. It was nice to be out on the water for a little while, although the second half was windier/choppier than the first. There are tons of companies that do Bosphorus cruises, and if you walk through any touristy area in the city (especially the square between the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque), you will have tons of guys pestering you to take a Bosphorus cruise tour. You can also just take the public ferry that goes across to the Asian side if you want a short cruise and you want to go visit the other side.

Make Sure You Have A Good Guide. We were lucky enough to have a guide with us who knew all the major sites and interactions during our hour long cruise of the major points. Just looking is not enough.

Worth the ride. We had the person who we rented an apartment from sign us up for a private sunset cruise - it was worth it! There are public ferries, but I am not sure how those are. The water is a little choppy, so make sure you have your sea legs before going!

Jewel of Istanbul. Bosphorus is a unique gem of Istanbul as it divides two continents. Lovely area to visit with lots of restaurants,cafes and recreational grounds. My favorites are Bebek, Ortaköy, Tarabya on the European side and Beylerbeyi and Çengelköy on the Asian side.

A Bosphorus cruise is a must. You can see some of the palaces and forts only from the water. It also shows you how housing (for the rich) changed over time. A great and inexpensive cruise for 45 to 75 minutes, based on where you catch a boat and who you travel with. Lovely on a blue-sky day

Wonderful cruise. We took a ferry cruising up to Black Sea from Eminonu. It took 2 hours for outword journey. We took a ferry again we went to back to Emınonu, but it was boring. I think there may be other way to go back.

Relaxing cruise. Take a tour of the bosphorus is well worth the time. It is a perfect way to relax and see many historical buildings and a good overview of the city. Perfect for an afternoon on a sunny day.

A relaxing a scenic must. This busy waterway is teaming with all kinds and sizes of boats. You really have to be a good driver with all the wakes and undertow. You drive down the middle and one side is Europe and one side is Asia. You can se all the beautiful ancient palaces from the Ottoman era. Stop for lunch at a great seafood restaurant.

Catch the local boat 10TL. What a great trip for the price. Took about an hour and a half up to the top and back.Plenty to see for the once in a lifetime boat trip.Cheap as compared to the tour prices.

Awesome treasure. We took two tours of the Bosporus including a Black Sea visit - a fascinating waterway separating Europe and Asia. The two seas it connect represent very different ecosystems with both fresh and salt water. Be in awe of the tankers headed to the Black Sea for it's oil and natural gas as they pass your ferry or yacht. Thee third bridge connecting the two sides of Turkey will be a sight to see.
Just a boat ride. The Bosphorus is very cool but just a boat ride looking at some old and pricy real estate. As a realtor this was very interesting for me but most everyone on our tour was bored.
Boat tour. A great way to spend the evening a boat tour down the Bosphorus . Nice to take a trip during the day also.see all the wonder buildings as you cruise along.
Loved the boat tour. We really enjoyed the boat tour and even hopped off in a smaller town to sepnd the day. Cheap and worth it!

Bospherous Strait. We had a great AirBnB with a terrific view of the busy Bospherous Straight. Large cruise ships, ferries, fishing boats....so much is happening! Also we crossed the Bospherous on a ferry to the Asia side which is very residential and local.

A must!. To get the best view of the city you must cross to the asiatic side. Don't need to invest a fortune in one of the very publicited services, there are several municipal ferries that cross the strait every few minutes and they cost the same than taking the metro or the tram (1.9 Lt), so it is a cheap experience yet very enyoyable.

Bosphorus Strait cruise. There are many cruise company going up the Bosphorus Sea. Our trip was for two hours, you do not need longer. Ask if there is an English commentary on board, as some of the cruises do not have any commentary at all.

Great Value. Took local ferry (not the tourist one) great value and relaxing day.
The talking guide needs some work but still a must.

A quick sail up the Bosphorus. Wonderful to be able to sit on a boat after sightseeing and enjoy the views under the 2 bridges and up towards the Black Sea. So much choice of different tours and this one suited us perfectly.

River Cruise. We had a half day river cruise and found it very interesting seeing the 4 palaces and being informed that shipping in each direction as restricted to one way in the morning and the other way in the afternoon.

If only it wasn't so cold. A fun and cheap way to see Istanbul from another perspective. Regular ferries are frequent and so cheap. We would have done a 2 hour tour but it was so cold and windy we couldn't face it. Took a 20 minute public ferry over to Kadikoy for 3 lira. Nice views.

Do what the locals do....... Rather than use the tourist boats across and along the straits do what the locals do and jump on one or two of the locals boats.Why, well out of the rush hour there is plenty of room on these boats.They go on time, you are not waiting for them to fill up with other visitors.They are so inexpensive it is embarrassing, and you can use your metro/tram ticket on most of them. It is much cheaper than most cities transportation systems and it works!Finally, pick a good day and the views are stunning without hoards of people and dire commentary. Take your guide book and have fun working out what is where, we did and loved it, we just went with the flow.

Definitely worth a trip. We took the boat there and the bus back from Sariyer. You need to get to the port early i.e. 45 - 60 minutes prior to departure as everyone is going for the top deck side seats. Nothing much worth seeing in Sariyer but I enjoyed the bus trip back.

A boat trip that completes the holiday. Very cheap way to see the many spectacular villas that line the banks of the Bosphorus, round it off with a typical "fish in bread " meal from the fisherman under the arches of the Galata bridge.

Great way to. We were a group of 4 with Tooba our guide from Fez.we had a leisurely cruise on the Bosphorous & two continents. she was full of knowledge and had a great sense of humour. a nice way to enjoy the Palace and beautiful buildings along the way.

More history packed on the shores. Another place where we should have spent more time. If I return here, will try to see more length of this area. Only did a 2 hour cruise. This was another place where the constant 'haze' spoilt the use of a long lens on my camera. Needs to be winter to improve this.

Most relaxing, try both day and evening cruise. A cruise on the Bosphorus Strait is the most relaxing moment you can get in Istanbul. In my opinion! Far away from the crowd, from standing at queues, from walking and walking and walking :) If you got time, I suggest you go for one cruise in the evening (departure at 8 pm) and one during the day (when the sun is up). Because it feels and looks different. Trust me. Not to say, that from 8 pm the cruise boat is not so crowded as during the day and you feel more charmed. During the day you can see the luxurious villas on the waterfront (luxurious, but with good taste), the Dolmabahce Palace, the Bosphorus Bridge...and all the waterfront details you can't see after sunset. During the evening, it's magic time! All the buildings are highlighted and you can even spot Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia. Tips:- if you go for the day cruise and it is a sunny day, it means that a lot of people will do the same. So please get on the boat as soon as you can, around 30-20 minutes before, because otherwise you won't get a good view. - we took the tour with a boat company (can't remember the name, although they have many boats) that is on the Eminonu side of Galata Bridge (Sultanahmet shore, looking at Sultanahmet, on the right), next to the fish sandwiches. - it costs 12 LT per ticket, 1,5 h tour (at the company we were with)- we didn't get the tours from the Ferry Company because they have fewer hours available and in May they don't do evening tours.- on the evening tour it gets very chilly so get an extra shirt or jacket.- they have tea and juice on board
A nice cruise. Its also a must so you can get an understanding of the importance of the location of Istanbul in the development of world history.

Relaxing start to Istanbul. We planned our Bosphorus Strait cruise on the afternoon of our arrival - figuring that we would be tired after long flights and not up to much else. It was a nice start to our trip. We used Sehir Hatlari - it's very cheap (much cheaper than some of the others) and the map and audio guide are perfect. It is the last boat company on the waterfront in Eminonu, nearest the bridge across the Golden Horn - basically opposite new mosque. I wouldn't say any of the sights are specular - but it's a good way to just sit back and relax if you aren't up to anything more strenuous.

Wonderful experience!. Take the plunge and go for the all-day tour which leaves from the Galata Bridge at 10:35 and takes you all the way to the edge of the Black Sea. There you have a couple of hours in which to explore the castle at Anadolu Kavagi, have lunch in one of the charming restaurants and sail back to the Galata Bridge back at 16:15. This tour should cost you 25 Turkish Lire per person return, if you buy your ticket from the shipping office in front of the Galata Bridge. Beware of ticket touts in Sultanahmet who will sell you the same tour for 70 Euros!!
east meets west. hard to imagine your on a bridge crossing the bosphorus between two continents,an experience not to be missed
must see place. You should fly over it, you should boat through it, you should see near it and mandatory have tea, just awesome, no words enough to describe its beauty especially in a nighttime

Nice 1 & 1/2 hours trip. Nice trip, just under 2 hours for very little money, a couple of pounds actually. It can get quite cool on the water if sitting outside on top so make sure it is a warm day, or wrap up warm.

Great boat ride. Loved our boat ride of the Bosphorous Strait. We had an older boat reserved for our 16-member tour group. In April I wore my long underwear and was comfortable in the light intermittent drizzle and low wind. Most boats have a lot of indoor seating. A lot of lovely homes and hotels line the straight. And it is a great way to see Istanbul.

See the real Istanbul. There are so many options to go out to enjoy the Bosphorus. Go on the public ferry or a private cruise.We took a Bosphorus Hop On Hop Off Cruise from Kabatas for only 15TL. There are 4 points you can leave the boat if you like, or you can do a complete circuit. We cruised close to the bank, seeing Dolmabahche Palace, Ortakoy, Bebek, Rumeli Hisari and alighted for lunch at Emirgan Park. After 2 hours, we took the boat to the Asian side and saw summer houses right on the riverbank and two more palaces. We stopped again at Kucuksu for playground and coffee.An opportunity to see the Istanbul outside the tourist centres and its history. I would list it top of my list to do in Istanbul!

great experience. don't miss a bosphorus cruise, it is one of the most enjoyable things you can do in istanbul. a 'short cruise' lasts almost 2 hours and it costs 3 euros if you take sahir hatlari cruise and not a private one.

Jellyfish galore. We recommend everyone visiting Istanbul take the 2hr ferry trip along the Bosphorus on a calm day during their trip. Filled with jellyfish, lined with historic and monumental buildings, used by local fishermen and cargo ships, the Bosphorus is always lively and has a lot to offer in terms of getting a feel for life in Istanbul. Bring a shawl or windbreaker as it can get cooler along the waterside (and esp. if you take a tour ferry).
A Two-Hour Cruise. Took the two-hour cruise on a sunny afternoon...lovely. Great views of both the Europe and Asia sides. Well worth the time!

must do trip. have now don ethis trip 3 times, once room the bridge fish boat quay, once on a bvery posh evening trip and this time on a 4 hour golden horn and bosphorus trip advertised all over the old town. This one was by the worse, driven all over the old town thro lots of traffic to collect 2 people even tho w ecoul dhave walked from the pick up in 10 minutes, then off 35 minutes , rubbish announcements of few sites, expected then to waita hour in the queue to ride the cable car then a con of a road tranfers back rather then the cruise back up the golden horn as advertised. I gnore and avoid all the cruis eboat sellers, they take you to a different landing pickup and give a rip off trip so just head to the large starting point beside the bridge and thefish kebab boats by the spice market and do 2 or 3 hr option here as we did the 1st time. Far far better option

Worth the trip. Absolutely worth the trip. Recommended to go with a guide so that you can learn something on the way. Otherwise it might be a bit boring. A lot of history to see and learn about. Can be a bit chilly.

Beautiful views. Took the cruise in Bosphorus. The views were amazing. Many sea gulls flying over the boat, adds to the fun. The boats were comfortable but try to get in the boat early to take a seat on the upper deck, where the views are unobstructive. Do not forget your sun cream. Excellent way to explore Istanbul.

Lovely views, chance of dolphins!. We took a normal commuter ferry across and were lucky enough to see dolphins! We also walked across the bridge several times (there are restaurants underneath but we never managed to dine there) which has pretty amazing views. There are always people fishing, day and night, so you can see some pretty interesting things if you look in their buckets as you pass. Watch your valuables as you move around, because, although we had no issues and Istanbul is a safe city for tourists, there can be a lot of foot traffic on the bridge and some dodgy-looking characters about.

Trip to Princes Islands. Interesting stretch of water with a lot of traffic on a daily basis. Compelling to spend a little time enjoying the activity.We took an inexpensive trip ( 5 TKL ) one way to the Princes Islands, taking in the views of both the asian and european coastline.

Coffe time at Bebek. After we drank Turkeısh tea everywhere and every time, we want to drink coffee so much. I read that there are some nice cafes around Bebek and went there. Our choice was correct. We enjoyed coffee and the scenery of Bosphorus.

Go to the water.. and view Asia and Europe.. Took a boat ride on the Bosphorus and enjoyed the sights on both sides of the continental divide. When you go to Istambul you have to take a boat ride and view Asia and Europe. If you do not take this ride you will regret not having the experience. Just go to the docks or ask the hotel staff where is the best place to find a boat and it will all work out. This water trip is very common and basically a no brainer. I took the metro from Taskim square right to the water front.

Great trip with IBO cruise. We had booked a half day Bosphorus cruise and were picked up at 1:30, because of traffic it took over an hour to get to the jetty under the second bridge, but none the less it was a good day. Once on board we were served with a quite substantial lunch, which was a surprise as we hadn't expected that. We cruised to a small town just up the straight on the Asian side and had a wander around for a while - not a lot to do here but sit and take in the view or buy a coffee. Then back on board and up to the Black Sea, turn around and sail to Istanbul. On the way back the captain / guide gave a commentary on the various buildings and bridges we passed. Good day, we got back to our hotel around 6:30.
Beautiful. I took a ferry from Europe to Asia. It was beautiful. Very scenic! Lots of activity on the water but the views were absolutely stunning.

Watching all the ships go by.... Walk along the strait side from Karakoy past the modern art museum, Dolmabahce Palace and the Kempinski Ciragn Palace hotel to Atakoy, its mosque and the Bosphorous Bridge. Dozens of cargo ships pass up and down whilke local ferrys dodge in nd out of passing vessels as they cross the Bosphorous to the Asian side.

Sailing up the Bosphorous was everything it should be. We had a limited time in Istanbul and took advice by catching the ferry rather than paying over the odds for a far more expensive, and possibly unsafe, boat. It gave us an excellent idea of the beauty of Istanbul and its vast size as it went on and on, with stunning villas, Palaces, mosques etc. making us wish we had more time to explore - but we found a wonderful place to eat as a result of this trip, and it was worth every penny.
Full Bosporus Cruise. This was an excellent day out. We sat on the bench on the perimeter of the ferry and enjoyed every minute. I observed, however, that young children were bored.

See the complexity and size of the city from the water.. A busy waterway that gives great views of a very complex and seemingly endless city. A trip along the Bosphorus gives you views into history, modern city design and a sense of the enormous space Istanbul takes up. Also offers great views of many of the famous sites.
Bosphorus Strait by boat. It's a very pleasant experience. Enjoyed it very much and seen both the strait and Istanbul and its surroundings.

Cruise the Bospherus and see the Istanbul skyline.. It's a delight to see the mosques and minarets, the palaces and parks from the water. Do the cruise that takes in the Golden Horn and takes you under the bridges linking Europe and Asia.

Bosphorus Tour. This tour is not to be missed - but take the longer tour that goes right up to the Black Sea; shorter tours stop at tye bridge and you would miss a lot. We took a tour that included lunch, which was well cooked and plentiful.
Magnificent. Take ferry from Kadikoy to Eminonu (TLR 1.95 one way). Trip takes good 20 minutes and its worth every minute.

Beautiful.... The cruise is very pleasant. Just try to avoid weekends, when it will be really crowded. Don't forget your camera! If you buy the ticket at the station, it will cost only TRY 10. However, you will be offered very different types of cruises and prices on the streets, just be aware.

Ok trip. Everywhere you go in Istanbul there are men waving fliers in your face yelling "Bosphorus Tour". We eventually booked a half day tour through our hotel. I was too skeptical of the people selling the tours on the street. It was a beautiful day so it was nice to take a ride on a boat and get some sun. We saw some dolphins and the tour guides pointed out the sites along the strait. We went to the second bridge, turned around went up the golden horn. We got off on Pierre Loti and took a cable car down. The boarded the bus again and were taken to a shopping opportunity" which was the tour trying to get us to buy a carpet from a store they took us to. We left then. It is possible to take a cruise yourself but then you do not get the tour guide telling you about the things you are seeing.

Stunning on a suny day. It was recommended to us by a ticket-selling company and a nice Egyptian guy (Mahmoud-Thanks) who was brilliant and gave a thorough explanation about the trip. The boat starts from near Hagia Sofia which makes it very convenient specially if you are staying in Fatih (Sultan Ahmet) area. Then It enters the golden horn before heading to bosphorus which was abonus. Then there's a live guidance telling you about all historic sites and more (only the noise wasn't great and his English could be better). You go to the next bridge (near black sea) before coming back along the Asian side to where the journey starts and finishes. It takes around 2-2:30 hours and was really fantastic. Refreshment; tea, coffee and chocolate available on board.

Worth doing. You can get either a specific boat trip which can usually be organised by your hotel and is a full day, including lunch, or you can get a local boat which leaves about 1035 goes right up to Kavagi where you can have lunch and returns by about 1730 (I think). We got a shorter trip which was 20 TL each and went as far as the second bridge and lasted 2 hours. Well worth it, really enjoyable and good views of Istanbul.

A must do list when you are in Istanbul. Clear and blue water a long the strait, interesting and historic buildings a long the strait, and this is the only strait in the world that lies between 2 continent.Amazing!

worthwhile. Take a tour on the Bosporus. Do not opt for the private operators as they charges way too much. Rather take the tour operated by the Government, they will charge only 10 Lira for a short trip of 2 hours and around 30 Lira for the full day trip. While cruising on the Bosporus, you can see the landmarks on the Europe side, along with few great private villas on Europe & Asian side.

Have your guide book handy. We opted for the shorter, 90 minute cruise, and we were glad we didn't take the full 5+ hour cruise. It was a beautiful day and fun to see the sights from the water. The narration, however, was just about impossible to understand, very muffled. Take your own guide book so you know what you are looking at!

Bosphorus Strait Boat Tour. It was so beautiful watching everything from the Bosphorus! We were able to see everything from must see discos to bars to restaurants. Castles were by the side and we never would have seen if it wasn't for the cruise.

the center of Istanbul, between Asia and Europe. Enjoy to stay here to look at the boats and all the people taking the boat to cross the Bosphorus. Take care to the pickpockets. A busy place. We disliked the smell of the fish in this place. At the groundlevel of the Galata bridge, there are so many restaurants, that it is easy to choose which one you prefer. The waiters propose you to enter and to make a good price (generally they offer coffee or tea).

A great day out!. We too the full day ferry which left at 10:30 and enjoyed a two hour cruise up the Bosphorous where we had lunch on a mountaintop terrace restaurant, followed by a nice warm cruise in the sun back down to the mouth of the Golden Horn.

Skipped the cruise but walked instead. The idea of being stuck on a boat for a minimum of two hours did not appeal to us, so we decided to walk along the Bosphorus istead and it was great! On a Sunday morning we started our hike at Karakoy and walked north all the way up to Ortakoy (less than two hours including stops along the way). It was a beautiful walk and we enjoyed the different vantage points along the way. A nice alternative the highly popular cruise.
love the view of the strait. it was great if you take the tour on a ship through bosphorus strait,,,lovely night and lovely dinner
Good option. Make sure you buy your ticket for the show in the boat, worth your money, very funny and the belly dance is a must

Unforgettable!. Fascinating to watch the 100s of ships on this strait everyday going back and forth from the Marmara Sea to the Black Sea. Wonderful place for long walks and just enjoying being close to the water.

So much on offer. Difficult to review this as Bosphoris strait offers a lot and depends on what you want to do/see. Few things that we did and recommend are:A Bosphorus cruise is recommended if you are in Istanbul as a tourist. Nice pleasant experience and it is not very expensive at 15 TL (for the short 1.5-2 hour cruise). Try taking the tickets from the good/recommended cruise companies at the ferry terminals or from Şehir Hatları, the official ferry company and avoid the agents who try to sell you the cruise tickets at other major tourist attractions or near the ferry terminals.So many walks along the different parts of the strait is also a great experience with its views, atmosphere, the suspension bridges (great view at night) and the historic sites. Have food from any of the good restaurants and cafes and just enjoy the evening hustle bustle and the breeze.A normal ferry ride like a Istanbul resident is also a great experience and pretty cheap too.

A relaxing Sunday. Starting from Eminonu, the tour takes almost the whole day. Have tea on the ship and enjoy the view. Food at Anadolu Hisari was also great. You can get off in Besiktas on the way back.
Can't say you have been to Istanbul without a cruise on the Bosporus. No trip to Istanbul is complete without a cruise of the Bosporus. It is the best way to cap off a trip to the city.

Great boat trip. Best way to see both sides of the Bosphorus Strait in 2 hrs. A few companies to choose from. There are cruises with food and a drop off but the 2 hr trip with no commentary is much cheaper and really good to see the various buildings.

Worth the Money. If you are visiting make sure you take time to do this cruise. You get to see a different vantage point of the city that you don't see from the street. It took about an hour and a half and some of the sights were great

Sunset trip around the Bosphorus Strait. Picked a tour from a kiosk in Sultanahmet. 20TL, easier. I did the sunset tour (7pm in April) to get the best pictures. The boat itself was fine, a bit rickety but you get what you pay for. The trip around was lovely - no guide, no information though so I suggest you read up before going if you wanna know what you're looking at. The scenery was lovely and I managed a lot of beautiful photos.

Not to be missed. If you stay more than two days in Istanbul, then spend 2 hours cruising at Bosporus Strait. Surely you will not feel the same as cruising at Venice Grand Canale or Seine at Paris, but it is worth to spend those 2 hours.Feels like turning back in time waiting for an old greek ship to get by.

a sail through history of a great country. Don't miss that if you visited Istanbul, it's such a good tour, you will enjoy amazing scenes along the tour.make sure you take the long tour at day time and to get the electronic guide the rent it at the ticket place get on board early so you can get a good spot , you can get down at any station and come back with any other boat included in the ticket that would let you experience some fish markets at the roman side.tickets are about 25 TL for the long tour

A large body of water. Take a ferry/tour of the Bosphorus. The best one is the Metro run one that you can get at Eminonu. Its relaxing and fun way to see Istanbul from. There is so much water traffic on this strait that you might think its a highway.
boat trip. Around 2 hours, great to see the wonderful architecture along both sides of the strait. A nice way to rest your feet and drink some tea!

Fun sail with magnificent views. Be careful not to buy tickets from travel agencies or street venders. Tickets can be bought easy at a pier and easy to get thickets for 10 or 15 TL for a short tour.There are short and long tours. We took a short tour in the late morning and felt it was right. Coffee or tea can be bought on the ship.Better check the weather as it might get cold due to winds.
Busy trading straight. Makes for a fascinating visual experience. Busy and industrious and divides the old from the new. Interesting
Good trip. If you take a cruise, buy this at the quay side and not from a street vendor. Cheaper safer and much better boats.

Cheap Bosphorus Cruise for 1 hour. Take the T1 tram Kabatas direction and go down Eminonu station walk about 100 meters towards the strait near the Galata bridge and you will see a 10TL 1 hour cruise. This cruise is amazing.If you buy the cruise from travel agencies or people offering you tickets on Sultanameth square you will pay minimum of 15 Euro for the same trip.

Cruise - An essential and quite wonderful view of Istanbul. We travelled with Bezak - Bosphorous Boat Tours, who have lots of touts in the main tourist area. We had a three hour tour that showed the highlights of the Golden Horn and Bosphorous. The price on leaflet was €15 pp but we got tickets for €11 pp. Bad points:There are loads of ticket sellers operating who then bring all of their customers together. We then had a ridiculous 30 mins of swarming around in a huge crowd being led / then waiting / led / then waiting again. This culminated a small dodgy looking pier with no boat. Then the boat came in but clearly did not have enough room for the massed throng. There was quite a bit of pushing and shoving which was not fun to be part of.Good points:The second boat came along soon after and everyone got on a boatThe boats were quite modern and in good orderThe English speaking guide was very goodThere was a toilet Food and drinks were availableThe cruise was wonderful - a very good length, great for photographySaw many Yelkouan Shearwaters flying along the BosphorusPoints to remember:However warm and sunny it is in the city it will always be significantly colder on the water - not too much of a problem when cruising with the wind, but then very noticeable when cruising against it. Most people wanted to be on the top floor which gave the best views and was open - however in the open you have two major risks sunburn and cold. Always wear/have available a number of thin layers that can be added and removed accordingly, a hat (that wont blow off in wind that can be stronger than you expect) and sun block lotion.You may want to consider the main ferry terminal which has similar ferry rides (and indeed much longer trips out to the beautiful looking islands) for much lower prices.Finally you will never see many of the wonderful views of great buildings and city any other way than this type of cruise. Bring your camera!!

We caught a ferry to the Black Sea from Kabatas.. Getting on early, we grabbed a seat at the back upstairs. It was cold but we were rugged up and the view was worth it. The ferry travelled up the European side and stopped for 3 hours at a fishing village on the Asian side up near the Black Sea. A walk up an enormous hill to a castle was well worth it with a panoramic vista revealed looking north. A great experience! We had lunch at a restaurant just below the ruins looking back towards the city, then back through the village (which was very quaint) and onto the ferry, up the Asian side and returned to Kabatas, which is easily accessible by tram.

Lovely cruise but main ferry is an old shed!. We were going to travel on the main ferry boat tour from Eminomu but soon worked out that if you weren't in the first 150 aboard, you'd be stuck inside so we went with a smaller operator at same price and on same itinerary. Cruise is lovely but they need a decent ferry on the route!

Take one of the cruises, you see so much. cruise was about 2 hours long and you see so much of Istanbul. Both sides are so interesting and it was the only way we saw anything of the Asian side. Interesting with all the ship and ferry traffic. We had a beautiful day and it is a high light.

Cheap and a must-do while in Istanbul. My wife and I took the 2-hr "short" cruise, which goes up the Bosphorus way past the second bridge. We had a great day, and I thought the shortie was more than enough to get the flavour up river and to sit back and relax. I think it costs about 10 TL each, which you can buy right at the terminal at Eminonu. Others sell them for more.Once you get your sea legs you soon discover many cheaper public ferry alternatives to exploring all the waterways of this great city, but if time is short I would recommend this. Gorgeous city views, great properties, and a great perspective on how big Istanbul really is!!!!

Four hours of cruise in afternoon. Purchased ticket for 45 euro. Lunch and snack included. Guided tour from bhospuras to black sea and Asian and European side importance with all historical places can be seen from sea... loved it

Look Where You Are!. Unless you are a seasoned or jaded traveler, you'll be impressed with just being in the Bosphorus Strait and seeing the Black Sea on one end and the Sea of Marmara on the other. We took a boat tour and it was well worth it.

A Great Dolphin Surprise. If you come to Istanbul a boat trip on the Bosphorus is a must. Thoroughly enjoyed every minute, the strait is more like the sea than it is a river. We were greeted twice with the sights of a group of dolphins during our boat trip. This was the most amazing unexpected surprise.! ;-)

90 minute cruise a fantastic way to spend an afternoon. Tickets are 12 lire purchased from the ticket office by the wharf in Eminonu. The company is Turyol and the ferries leave every two hours. This is a lovely way to spend a time and you see so much. The views are amazing, palaces, stately homes, fortifications. Before you leave grab a fish sandwich from the boat kiosks next door for 6 Turkish lire. On the boat you can buy a Turkish tea for 1 lire from the waiter who walks around with a tray of them. Take a warm scarf and a camera. A refreshing and energising way to view Istanbul.

See where the super-rich live. Bosphorus property is some of the most expensive in the world and it must be galling having spent $100 million dollars or more to have tourist boats cruising past! Fascinating to see the different styles of architecture and sizes of houses; the flowering Judas trees giving bright purple patches over the hills.A long history of being the place to be, particularly in summer where winds from the Black Sea keep temperatures down, a number of these palaces remain to admire.The Bosphorus has been of great strategic importance in the past as the only link from the Black Sea to the Mediterranean and a few castles remain.We were lucky with a beautiful sunny day, though quite cool needing a windbreaker and it was good to be sitting down for a couple of hours after spending the morning walking the other tourist attractions.

Nothing like it. The Bosphorus is a unique strait bringing the east and the West, Europe and Asia together. It is beautiful in every season but spring means a lot of green and pink as all the Judas trees are in bloom in spring. You can walk along the Bosphorus, take a ferry to cross it or take the special 'Beggar's boat' that goes all the way to the Black Sea and enjoy a fish meal there..This boat can best be taken at Sirkeci, the first ferry station. The boat then stops at many places, letting you enjoy the beautiful Yali's, old wooden houses by the sea.

Enjoyable, very competitively priced but bring your own guide. You can get a ticket for 10 TL when boarding (don't purchase from elsewhere as more expensive) and children are free. Make sure you use the loo beforehand as the onboard facilities are so poor one could not be blamed for preferring to pollute the sea instead.Go for the 2 hour ride as that is more than enough.The promised guide must have been a mute as he did not say anything.A must see as you can see both the European and Asian sides and appreciate the truly stunning skyline and coastal buildings if you have done your research or have access to the net to help explain what you are seeing.
Sea tour. Love the cruising around the Bosphorus, love the people in the boat with their tea and other drinks, love the wiev,

Question of timing. If you get a day at hand go to Eminönü ferry terminals for the bosphorus cruise with Sehir Hatlari at 25 Turkish Lira (2014). Dirt cheap. If in a hurry use the ferry from there to the Asian side for a three Lira token (passing by the Maiden's island) and go back for another three. If you use Sehir's ferry map and timetable this may turn out to be real fun and adventure. I did the crossing from Üsküdar to Eminönü in the late March afternoon and was awarded with a nice sunset over the strait and a Hagia Sophia in red glow.

Just take the public ferry.....it's cheap and excellent fun. We did some ferry hopping up the Bosphorus and it was great fun. Don't get caught out by booking an expensive tourist trip. Just go down the the ferry, decide where you want to go and pay a few TL and get on board. They all seem to have a little restaurant serving teas, coffee, water and snacks. The views of Istanbul from the water are amazing and if you are a keen photographer you will get some great shots. We went for miles and then walked and walked and walked taking in some amazing sites. You can grab a local bus back to the city which is an experience in itself and really cheap.

You haven't seen Istanbul If you haven't Traversed the Bosphorus. Bosphorus is beautiful. As I said in the caption, You haven't seen Istanbul If you haven't Traversed the Bosphorus. It's something you cannot miss.
Take a trip if you can possible make the time. We did the 2hr short bosphorus Cruise (leaves 10.30, 12.30, 14.30 for 10TL each. Fantastic value for money

Amazing sites on an open air boat. Definitely book a Bosphorus Boat Tour! Make sure to be careful which boat tour you select. Our tour was a double decker boat with an open air top and a closed bottom. The open top had a drink area and booths all around to give great views of the sites. This tour gives a great perspective of all of Istanbul and allows you too see all of the gorgeous architecture from the Asian and European sides.

Don't waste money on a commercial trip! Use an Akbil.. I was with some Istanbullus and was introduced early to the Akbil travel card, 7 lira from any tobacco kiosk displaying the sign.You can top this card up with a note of 5, 10, 20 or 50 lira at machines near any tram stop.With your Akbil, it costs less than 2 lira per journey on trams, the funikular, the tunnel, the buses and, amazingly, on crossing the Bosphorus. If you choose carefully, you can zig-zag up and down the whole Bosphorus for under 4 lira! Fantastic value. And, you can get a cup of tea for 1lira (even less on some boats).The Bosphorus itself is truly beautiful. I crossed it many times during my week in Istanbul and really loved it.

Restful & scenic. It was a beautiful sunny day, perfect for this cruise. It was intriguing to see all the development along the water. The palace was amazing. So many gorgeous houses along the water. It's very cool to travel these historic waterways.

See Asia and Europe at the same time. We took a boat ride from the dock on the Asian side of Istanbul and were fascinated by the views on both sides of us. The New Palace is just one of the many outstanding views on the European side, while the Topkapi Palace commands the highest point at the end of the Asian side. The ride gives you a good idea of the physical immensity of Istanbul, its cultural variations, and its significance through the millennia due to its location on the Silk Road and being the link between the Black and Aegean Seas.

Mandatory. It's a most go you we'll se Istanbul in a different and amazing way me and my friend did 1 hour and half tour in the river perfect , you can se the old cartel on the left side of the river whed a massive cemetery the wiew that you have to the bridges is amazing
A 2 hour round trip cruise. For 10L ($4.5) you can cruise up and down Bosphorus and see both the European and Asian sides of the city. Its round trip with no stops.
Cruise is a must. You must take a cruise on the Bosporus. Seeing ships from Odessa and Crimea at this time was poignant. The scenery really stands out fromm the water.

A Different View of Istanbul. Whether you take a Bosphorus cruise or just use the Ferry Boats, you need to get out on the water to really appreciate the city of Istanbul. So much of the history and culture of Istanbul is focused on the water. We opted not to take a cruise, we simply ran out of time and good weather in March, but made use of several of the Ferry Boats and really enjoyed each one. We took a ferry over to Kadikoy on the Asian side of the city and had a wonderful afternoon in that part of the city after seeing beautiful views of the old city on the way over. We also took a ferry up the Golden Horn and again, the views of the city on both sides were quite amazing. You really see a different side of Istanbul from the water.

A must. However you do it, take a 90 minute public tour, approx. 12 TL, ($6), or sit and have tea by the strait or Golden Horn. The breeze, smell and beauty are wonderful. Avoid the private tours unless your hotel has recommended one, also do not purchase one by the historical sites, they are the same. Just go to the ferry and get on when you are ready.

Worth a visit. The trip is worth a visit and takes about 2 hours to complete as it travels up along one side of the straight and down along the opposite side. Make sure the boat operators speak your language as otherwise the tour would be boring.
Take a day tour. The Bosphorous and and the connected Golden Horne are fascinating areas. I took an all day tour which included some three to four hours on the water.Wonderful.

Great Views from the Water. We took a Bosphorus Cruise and were so glad we did. The views are magnificient of all the palaces and beautiful mansions that can only be seen on the waterfront. Make sure you take a tour and not just go on a ferry ride so that you can get explanations of what you are seeing.
Take the boat. We took the typical 10 lira Turkish boat. scenic and wonderful You just ahve to imagine the golden Horn full of sailing ships

Boat Sight-seeing. This wonderful boat ride around the bosphorus strait must not be missed. My tour guide got us on this as a suprise as it is not on our itinerary. I get to see both the European side and the Asian side of Istanbul. If you are lucky enough, you get to see Dolphins.Please wear slightly thick clothings during the cold periods. The wind is a blast!

Well worth a boat trip. We took a boat trip along the Bosphorus and around the Golden Horn , we did not use the ferry , we went a "cruise" for 90mins and cost us 12TL each - very good value for money . So, just to get the bearings, it is on the opposite side of the Galata Brige from the Eminonu tram stop . The trips run every hour on the hour. Watch out for guy that brings around drinks , orange juice / tea - you might think these are free - they are not !
boat over 2 sides. that was very nice. so there are not enogh chair for passengers to rest sometime , you can make a rest and enjoy of the boat between sided of the river

half day trip. The weather wasn't too good to start off with. The trip was interesting and went down almost to the Black sea. The lunch on board was very good. However if you have the time you may be better taking a whole day and stopping off in the middle to have lunch. Can't remember the town we stopped at on the Asian side but the fish there looked wonderful

So much to see. There are a lot of ferry and boat companies that will take you for a tour along this Strait. Since so many of the buildings are along this body of water, it's a very interesting way to see the outsides from a different angle. It's an extremely busy water way and was fun just watching the hustle and bustle. We went around sunset and it was beautiful.

A Cruise is a Must. I took a cruise on a boat of the Bosphorus Strait on my last day in Istanbul, and it was totally worth it. The trip was about 1-1.5 hours, so it wasn't overly long, but it allowed me to see much of the beauty of Istanbul. The boat first traveled along the European side of Istanbul, and then on the Asian side, allowing us to see both. The photo opportunities were amazing, and if you don't have a lot of time to explore Istanbul (I had two days), it gives you a chance to see many things that you wouldn't otherwise see.Those on the cruise should watch out for dolphins - we saw a number jumping in the Strait.It will be much cooler on the water, especially with the air, so I recommend a jacket unless your traveling during a very warm time. Our boat had an indoor section outdoor of the wind for those who wanted it. The boat also served refreshments - those are not free, so I would always check prices.
Looks amazing. Only had the opportunity to see this from the water front at the Four Seasons Hotel. I know you can get boat trips, but its unbelivable how busy this is...

Great View of the City. I took both a cruise through the Bosphorus and a ferry. I found both very fun. It's especially amazing because most of Istanbul's major sites and palaces are by the strait, so you get a great view of everything.
Beautiful. I really enjoyed riding up the Bosphorus. It was a beautiful day, cold but sunny, and the ride was about 2 and 1/2 hours long. There was not much commentary, but the sites were fantastic.
Not as swell as I thought it would be. It was OK, seeing the Sultans' hunting palace was interesting, sort of, but really, it was just kind of a boat ride.

Nice boat ride. Went took a late afternoon boat to enjoy sunset from Bosporus strait. Boat departed from Eminonu and sailed away for about two hours. We went past Bosporus bridge, at night it was pretty. This is a must-do activity for tourist.

Good ship, good guide. We tried another trip, but left! Thec ship was stinking from petrol, dirty. We decideed to use are agency Odup street 16, and with no regret. Taxi to the ship, clean and well keept ship, very good guide with great knowledge about history, buildings and architecture. Taxi back, all in all a postive experience, and weather was OK
public sea bus. take the public sea bus from eminonu enjoy the view in the middle of the sea, then you can take it back to the same place

Just buy a regular line cityboat and cross the strait. Just buy a regular city ticket for example to Üsküdar (with Istanbul Card=1,95) and stay on the boat when reaching . We did it and had to wonderfull "bosporus sunset cruise" for 1,95 Lira...both ways...
Boat tour. A boat tour of the Bosphorus is rewarded with expansive views of the city shores, mosques, castles, fishing boats and even porpoises.

Ferry ride up the Bosphore toward Black Sea from Istanbul. Took a ferry from the waterfront near Sultanamet. We stopped at places to eat and shop with beautiful views in both thEropan and Asian sides of the Bosphore. It was dramatic to see a Turkish submarine surface beside out tourist day ferry. We ended visiting a reapstaurant and shop where you could see the entrance to the Black Sea.

Pleasant trip. Great way to see the city and understand size of the city. I woudl recommend doing this first to orient yourself to the city. Plan for 90 minute boat ride and dress appropriately if you wish to be outside. Recommend starboard side of boat for seating.
Worth it!. Go to the dock and there you could get your tickets cheaper or bargain with one of those guys selling them around Hagia Sofia and blue mosque

Recommeneded. We went on an afternoon cruise, which was really good value for money. We were also very fortunate to see dolphins - look up Bosphorus Dolphin Watch before you go. We weren't aware of this, but we were pleasantly surprised to see a couple of dolphins swim by, though it was pretty bad weather on the day.

A Relaxing Day. We took the full-day Bosphorus cruise one day in Istanbul, and it was the nicest, most relaxing day we had there! The cruise up and down the strait was lovely on a sunny day, and the village at the end near the Black Sea (Anadolu Kavagi), was a nice place to spend a few hours. Although the village has mostly touristy fish restaurants, it was still nice to be in a more peaceful small-town atmosphere for a day. We first hiked up to the ruined castle above the town (very steep but good exercise and great views), and we had lunch after that. The 3 hours between sailings was plenty of time for both a hike and lunch. Highly recommended, even if you only have a few days in Istanbul!

Dont' bother with a organised trip. We quite fancied the idea of a boat trip and there were plenty of people selling tickets in the square by the Blue Mosque - for 15 euros. We went to the dock ourselves and there is a ticket office that sells tickets for 12lire per person and it was a lovely day so we caught the lunchtime boat. The trip lasted about 1 1/2 hours and we didn't bother with the guide, just enjoyed the weather and the scenery. A little man was constantly doing the rounds with trays of tea and snacks.

Take a boat tour, guide needed. We took a lovely boat tour up and down the Bosphorus river. Some very interesting and beautiful architecture and views. As we didn't have a guide it was near on impossible to understand anything more about the great sights we were seeing. The boat tour audio was impossible to hear and was only very brief anyway.

To see it you must go on a ferry or cruise. There is no better way to end your day in Istanbul than to take the Turyol Short Bosphorus Cruise. It lasts for 1 1/2 hours and will take you along the Bosphorus Strait showing you many of the historical sites. Get yourself a good guide book so that you know what the different sites are. Great to see at sunset however go on a tour which ends at sunset not starts at sunset otherwise as the tour progresses it will be very dark and hard to take any photos or really see the sites!
Great Views. Amazing views of Europe and Asia. Waters are a bit choppy, but that just makes it all the more fun! Stunning view of Istanbul. Must see and take a boat tour.
Most beautiful sunset. I recommend you take the Bosphorus Strait cruise at 4 p.m in March. The cruise lasts 2 hours and at the end you witness this most memorable sunset over Istanbul !

Magnificent cruise. Wow, we were driven across from Europe to Asia to join a magnificent cruise up the Bosphorus. You are truly transported back in history, travelling through the Golden Horn, seeing the palaces and fortresses. Magnificent

OK but imminently avoidable. It was raining so it was a good time to be in a sheltered boat as opposed to walking around in the open, but unless you just have to see things from a water perspective, this excursion can be avoided. Without our guide, Mehmet Raci, it would have been a waste of our time. He did bring interest to the trip, explaining the history of palaces, schools, fortresses and Istanbul areas in view.

Top highlight of Istanbul City. Istanbul is a great city to visit, but Bosphorus is one of the top highlights of this great city to observe the distinct architectural landscapes and city's out-looking from a single point. I definitely recommend a visitor to catch a ferry ride to Bosphorise Cruise ride to complete the Istanbul Trip.

Boat cruise. This is surely something everybody must do, if it's a sunny day drop all other plans and take a cruise which only takes one to one and a half hours to complete. Good value too with prices from 12-20 Liras.
meh. It's a strait. It was cool to be able to travel from Europe to Asia, but besides that I found it to be nothing particularly special.

relax and unwind. there are a host of tour operators and private people offering their cruises. be sure to haggle to get the best price. cruising slowly along the Bosphorus on the back of an open boat, laying in the sun. most cruises will take you along the shores of the east and western sides of the river and most will serve refreshments. it gives a great perspective to the city from both sides.

Nice boat trip!. Visit it by boat! near the bridge are a lot of boats to take, they are all cheap, aroun 10 TL, and if you have more, take a boat and dinner at nigh time, it has a show with dancers and everything, it is worth it!

Just cruising..... If you're in Istanbul visiting, you must get out on the water and cruise by ferry boat. Take the sehir hatlari nostalgic boat anywhere and just relax. A great way to move about, even on a rainy day....dry and warm inside. Enjoy!

Wonderful day trip. This is the straight that separates Europe and Asia, and the day trip shows you the wonderful scenes of both side of the continents. Water is beautiful, bridges are breathtaking, and the cruise ride was quiet and smooth. We took the Sehir Hatları ferry line and stopped at a small village before entering the Black Sea. Highly recommended.

Nice cruise. There are more companies that organizes cruises on Bosphorus strait.We chose a short cruise(about 2 hours long) operated by Sehir Hatlari company.The starting point is right next to Galata Bridge but you can embark on Ortakoy,too.It's a nice cruise,it provides you stunning views of Istanbul including Ortakoy Mosque,the two suspension bridge over the strait,Rumeli Fortress.A tip:sit on the same side of the boat on both going and turning back. This way you’ll see both shores.Details about timetable and prices you can find here:http://sehirhatlari.com.tr/en/timetable/short-circle-cruise-363.html

It's very cold yet COOL!. Went there during winter, it's damn cold inside the ferry. But having to see all the beautiful view, makes us forget about the coldness! Get a cup of warm coffee/tea and enjoy the scenery! :D

Magical experience. This is a place where you really need to take a boat trip and see - knowing that you are in such a busy commercial intersection, you feel like you are in the middle of the world! And the palaces that line the shores make you want to be a Turkish millionaire to buy a house and move there. You hotel and other travel agencies may suggest you organized boat trips with bus transfer to/from the boat for 30-60 euros. Do not pay that! Just go to the seashore at Eminönü and take a boat for 10 turkish liras (3 euros)!

great day. Highly recommend a cruise along the Bosphorus. We spent 5 hours going from Josephine's Palace to the Black Sea and back, with a stop for lunch. It was a rainy day but fun. A perfect way to see great architecture.

ROMANTIC. is romantic and educational at the same time. It is an experience that should not be miss .watch the city from another point of view and understand why they have become so many wars for this town. Do it with good weather. I am sure you will be surprised from the beauty!
Beauty of Istanbul lies here. Its god's gift to Istanbul. Blue waters, screeching sea gulls and lined up houses, buildings, ancient buildings makes the Bosphorous strait charming and magnificient.

Brilliant. Buy a travel card from one of the shops and you can use trams, metro and boats as much as you like. No need to visit a tourist agency, they will rip you off. Take the tram to the quay at Eminönü, observe what an enormous city Istanbul has become and see how Eminönü is buzzing with activity. This is the busiest ferry crossings for the Bosphorus and the Marmara Sea. Get on the boat in Europe and travel to Üsküdar or Kadıköy in Asia. I would recommend Kadiköy and you can have a little wander round, look at the shops and If you happen to be in town on a Tuesday or Friday, the famous Tuesday market is a worth seeing. Get something to eat in one of the cafes which serve fresh fish and travel back to Europe in the afternoon. A very pleasant and interesting day.

Worth it, sort of. It was cool to cruise up the Bosphorus, but our boat had no tour guide to tell us what we were seeing. Avoid the guys on the street lobbying you to take their boat cruise and go with the big established companies.

Great Half Day Tour. This was a great half day tour. Very interesting to see the well preserved palaces along the shore line. The tour would be a 5 out of 5 if only it was conducted on a private craft where the guide could provide information to all on the tour. The public craft could not facilitate this.

Beautiful. It's imperative that you sail across the Bosphorus strait. It's large, the water is murky and deep but not that polluted as it keeps flowing. Saw some dolphins swimming and it was really cool

Bike ride along the river. I had the privilege of staying along the Bosphorus, the bike ride along the river is amazing, it cleared my head in the mornings and was so peaceful, you can ride for miles along the dedicated cycle track.

Nice. Take the 2 hour tour for $10 TL. In my opinion, any longer would be too much and you can use the rest of your day to explore the many, many other tourist attractions in Istanbul. You get to see the European and Asian side of Turkey and all of the wonderful palaces, 2 huge bridges and mosques along its shoreline. Lots of photographic opportunities.

Lovely day trip. We took the Bosphorus ferry day trip for 25TL. You don't need to pay an agency to charge you a lot for this trip, just go to the quay at Eminonu and get a ticket at the Sehir Hatlari ticket office for the boat. It leaves at 10.35am and makes several stops up the Bosphorus, arriving at the other end at 12.10pm. You can then have a little wander round the village which has a few nice little shops, get something to eat in one of the cafes which serve fresh fish and come back on the ferry at 3pm. A really pleasant relaxing day. When we went it was not too busy but no doubt it can get quite packed later in the year.

Beautiful and Historic. Take the cruise and see Asia and Europe face each other! Wonderful forts, mosques, old and new city views as well as the many ships sailing the Strait. The Geneva old fort tower is a great guidepost still protecting the port entrance.

A beautiful active river Boats and ferries everywhere Buy jetons to go on the ferry train bus etc. Cheap and easy. Fabulous views You can hop from shore to shore and access most of the important sights from the ferries

Another angle of the city. Isn’t nice to know that in one side of the strait is Europe and in the other side is Asia?You can see historical buildings, nice landscapes from a different point of view. Relax and enjoy the view. Tip: don’t mix the cruise with a night of entertainment in only one attraction! You will not enjoy the cruise itself and the typical dance is poor quality in these cruises. The food is also poor. Do it separately to have the most of each.
great time even in the rain. we toured by boat. The views were wonderful. The homes and mansions along the waterway were really enjoyable.

Wonderful experience. No need to take expensive tourist boats. Use the service that locals do. Take the local IDO ferry across every 10-15 mins.For down the Straits trip use Turyol boats not expensive for 1.30 hrs trip.

Cruise from Ortokoy. Took a cruise from Ortokoy which was a short 1 hour cruise. Cost 10TL only.Also, if you want to go to Asian side, take a ferry from Eminonou to Kadikoy or from Karakoy to Kadikoy. Cost 3TL each way. Never ever take a taxi to goto Asian side.
Boat trip. I would highly recommend a boat trip along the Bosphorus as it gives the visitor a different outlook to the city. Spectacular views of both sides of Istanbul - old and new.

Just turn up and see what's available. After being offered various Bosphorous Cruises by street vendors averaging 15/20€ per person, we just decided to hop on the tram to Eminönü to see what was available. We arrived shortly before 1030am and there was a boat most people were heading towards which had a man advertising a cruise on the microphone. We asked him how much the tickets were, and for 10TL (yes, 10TL) we got a two hour cruise on the Bosphorous which took us on the same itinerary as the 15/20€ trips - the only difference being was that we had to use our guidebook and map to read about the sights along the way because there was no commentary. With easily 10/15 different nationalities on board, I don't know how any tour guide could keep up with everyone anyway, so it seemed like a great idea to us.Well worth doing!

Great Opportunity For Sightseeing!. Whilst staying in Istanbul I organised a guided cruise along the Bosphorous as part of a larger tour package. It was an excellent chance to see some of the older buildings and the walls of Istanbul from the water. Sit back and enjoy a nice hot Salep whilst you look out the window or travel to the upper decks with your camera for some amazing photo opportunities!

A good excursion easily done by tour or solo in ferries. This is such a historic body of water that it's worth taking both a tour and just hopping on ferries to try one or two of the routes. I got to see the old Haydarpasha railroad station exactly this way. My ride was timed perfectly to see a rosy sunset over Sulttanahmet with its horizon featuring the minarets.

A Nice Cruise. Took a non guided cruise for two hours along the Bosphorus Straight. It was alright and nice to do on a nice day. I am torn weather or not to have taken a guided cruise as I am sure there would have been more historical information given however it was significantly more. The unguided tour offers you a good view of the lavish lifestyle the Sultan's use to live and the gorgeous architecture along the Bosphorus. It is one thing to visit the Palaces along the Straight but you can't comprehend the size of the buildings until you see if from the water.

emotions you will never forget. We sailed 3 times the Bosphorous Strait, in our short 2 days visit to Istanbul, (well this was our 4th visit to Istanbul) one was in the morning, but a bad day with no sun, then at night in the moonlight cruise then next day, with sunshine and to Kadikoy (Asia) The difference is great. When sunny the water is blue!

Great way to see the river & houses. Hour n half on boat cruise was perfect time. You can check out bridges, historical buildings, see all the houses , different areas see the difference in Asia to Europe . 12 TL , cheap . Would of been better on a warmer day though
It was fun to do. We did the short boat trip over the Bosphorus strait. It was fun to do and watch the city from a different viewpoint.

Great on a nice day!. We did a 3 hour cruise with a visit to the hunting lodge of the Sultans. The hunting lodge was okay but the cruise was really nice - we had a beautiful sunny day. Would not recommend in bad weather.

Nice. I've been twice to Istanbul, and the first time I didn't cross the strait. This time I decided to visit the Asian part of the city, so the 20 minutes crossing in the ferry was a nice relaxing part of it. It is always interesting to see a city from the water if there is a chance of doing so.

A view from afar.. Saw this beautiful strait and famous bridge from an overlook at the Topkapi Palace, Magnificent view. Did not have time to take the boat ride this trip but highly recommend you do so when there.

d day landings. We were fortunate to wake up and look out onto all the boats moored up ready in the strait both myself and another fellow traveller said it looked like the morning of the d day landings with so many ships. Fascinating watching the near misses by galata bridge with so many boats fighting for their little bit of the bosphorous

See Istanbul by Sea!. After a lot or persistent haggling in Agia Sophia Square we took a two and a quarter hour boat tour on the Bosphorus and were not disappointed!! (Never pay the price on the leaflet they give you; it's surprising how much discount you can negotiate!) There are some magnificent views to take in and having an English speaking guide is also very useful. Sailing under the two bridges which connect the European and Asian sides is especially beautiful at night. It's definitely a peaceful way to take in the sights!

Great afternoon on the water. What better way to spend a sunny afternoon than aboard a boat cruising the Bosphorus. Istanbul is the only city in the world that straddles two continents and the boat was the perfect way to see along both the European shoreline, on our way out, and Asian side upon our return. As well as superb views of the city, we also saw beautiful imperial palaces, mansions perched on the water’s edge, fortresses and traditional Ottoman wooden houses. Really beautiful out on the water and offers a different perspective of Istanbul.We took an afternoon cruise, booked through Viator “Bosphorus Cruise and Istanbul's Egyptian Bazaar”. It also included a trip to the Spice or Egyptian Bazaar which was a great added bonus. We got picked up and dropped off to our hotel, had a great friendly English speaking guide and spent around four hours on the tour in total, half of that time on the water. We felt it was good value for money considering what we got to see. Great way to spend an afternoon.
Outstanding!. Took a day cruise on the Bosphorus. Quite beautiful and historical. I would definitely ride out to the Black Sea. Very peaceful and informative.

Beautiful view!. Golden Horn connects into this separating Europe from Asia, though both sides are Istanbul. the suspension bridge lights up at night & is a beautiful site! We look forward to our cruise on this body of water next week!
Better Water cities in Prague and Budapest. So many ships as a waterway, it is nice and we had a pretty day,but after Prague, this is not the romantic bridge and shoreline of other great Cities.

Beautiful!. Not only is the Strait just separating 2 continents, it is a really busy body of water which will just captivate your attention. Not only is it beautiful but the historical context adds an entire different dimension.
3 hours travel by ship. very exciting and relaxing time. We ride a ship and we see seabrides in bosphor that i never seen in before.

Take the local ferry. No need to pay for tourist trips - just go to Eminonu or one of the other piers and jump on one of the commuter ferries - wonderful value (less than £1 for an hour and a half sailing up and down the Bosphorus) and in winter, you can enjoy a cup of delicious warming sahlep, served on board.
Must be done. This is a must do cruise to see the glorious Istanbul. Dress well as it can get windy and cold. you will enjoy.
Great Way To See Alot. This tour with the audio guide will teach you a tremendous amount about the city and the area. Don't miss it!

A Boat Trip To Take. If you are here for a few days, it is well worth taking a boat trip up the Bosphoros. Be aware, lots of touts, enticing you to go, shops offering what seems a good deal, don't be tempted, go straight to the boats themselves. The best deal we found was at pier 10. A 2 hour round trip, up the European side and back the Asian side, 10TL. A tip sit on the left side for the best views both ways

a must visit in istanbul. Bosphorus strait divides Istanbul between asia and europe. It is a must visit landmark. Amazing one and half hour of trip. I took a cruise from galata bridge. It costs around 12 turkish lira per person for the trip. The Dolmabahce Palace and Rumeli Fortress are the best highlights of the trip. I will recommend to visit late evening, you will find beautiful lights on bosphorus bridge.

Stunning Views/Poor Reception. We took a cruise to the Straight of Bosphorus. We docked at a small fishing village and then climed to Yoros Castle ruins. The views were stunning............However the moment we stepped off the ferry we were surrounded by restaurant owners all attempting to get our group to eat in their establishments. At times they were quite aggresive. While I understand it was "off season" with few tourists, it was very unsettling. I would not repeat this visit...........Be warned about the welcome you'll get.

Neverending entertainment. A busy waterway. Lovely to view at different times of the day. Have a walk across the Galata Bridge to see the anglers. We were disappointed that there was no riverside walk.

Connecting Asia and Europe. This is beautiful landmark that you must visit. There was a bridge that connecting Asia side and Europe side. i recommend to visit this in he night, you will found beautiful light on bridge.

Incredible moment!. We took the TURYOL cruise, around the late evening. It is not a bad idea to take the cruise at this time for we can enjoy both the sunset and night. For the cruise proceeds near the coast, we can marvel at most attractions along European side. The Dolmabahce Palace and Rumeli Fortress are the best highlights of the trip. Bring some snacks or fish bread, order some black tean on the boat, chatting with people on the cruise, you will enjoy the incredible moments of Istanbul.

A feast to the eyes. The boat cruise in the Bosphorus strait is fascinating.You get to see the entire city of Istanbul appreciating the buildings at the European & Asian side of the city.Remember to sit to the left of the boat {if boarding from the european side} & reserve your place by the window early as the boat cruise can packed with tourist. A 'must do' while at Istanbul.

Excellent for a day cruise. Excellent for a day cruise , make sure you take this cruise, It give a totally different view of Istanbul with lush green mountains and valleys and other historical sites We loved it !

Madness!. When in Istanbul you must take time to visit a bridge and watch the madness that is the Bosphorous strait. Commuters getting from one continent to another, cruise ships docking - a constant swirl of sea going traffic.. and in amongst it will be intrepid fishermen in little rowing boats. People also fish from the bridges ... Istanbul was on our honeymoon cruise and yet again we found a place that we want to go back to!

Worthwhile cruise. There are many men in the tourist areas attempting to sell Bosphorus cruises at a high price. You can take the public ferry for much less. I took the tram from my hotel near the Blue Mosque to the Eminonu stop. I walked across the street to the ferry terminals and turned left. There is a large terminal near the Galata Bridge that sells full day Bosphorus cruises for 25 liras roundtrip. Audioguides are an additional 10 liras. The company's name is Sehir Hatlari. Since I cruised in January, there was only one departure time (10:30am). I arrived about an hour early, but I could have waited until about 15 minutes prior to departure to buy my ticket. There was not a very large crowd on a cool Monday morning in January.The cruise takes about 1 1/2 hours to reach the last stop Anadolu Kavagi. I sat outside on the boat and it was quite chilly, but it was worth it. The view was wonderful. You can see so many things from the Bosphorus that you would miss if you only traveled on land. After arriving in Anadolu, I walked/hiked up to the castle ruins. There is not very much to see once up there. The view is nice, but there is nothing else to do other than eat. I ate lunch at a restaurant in the town then returned to the ferry for the 3pm departure. The afternoon brought sun and slightly warmer temperatures making the seating outside on the ship more bearable.Overall, this cruise was money well spent and the highlight of this visit to Istanbul. This was my second visit to Istanbul, so I was looking for something to do away from the Old Town area. I would recommend this cruise to visitors to the city. Try to make time to do it.
busy!. The water here is beautiful. There are so many water vessels at all times such as tour boats, water taxis and auto ferries.

Nice Bosphorus tour. Very nice way on the bosphorus to se the most historical monuments outside the city center especially. if you're in the city only for a few days and cannot see everything, like dolmabahce palace, I highly recommend this tour on the bosphorus.
