The views of the architecture of Istanbul are easily visible from the water, however, and you can see the sights from both sides of the straight and the boats are comfortable and covered so you can relax and enjoy the smooth ride.

Where Asia meets Europe. We took a gorgeous cruise on the Bosphorus strait.We were lucky that the weather was gorgeous and not to windy.The boat ride was beautiful and we were taken by the forts or Istanbul and some very historic architectural structures by the water. We passed under 2 very beautiful bridges and also along some very affluent areas of Turkey.Gorgeous and memorable outing indeed.

One of the best tours in İstanbul.... During summer time,the boats are usually crowded,so try to board on the one leaving as early as possible so that you get a good seat for about 90 minutes and so beautiful trip.As you are going to see Asia and Europe continents together with the connecting bridges,you will have fantastic photos during this short trip.When you are off the boat in Anadolukavağı,that is the best time now to have some fish&seafood there at fair prices.

A chance to put your feet up!. After a hard day's walking and standing at various sites it was great to get on board and be taken for a cruise around the shores of the Bosphorus. Our guide came too and was able to point out so many places of interest. This was great and we saw many of them from the inside the next day.

Ferry ride. We took 2 different ferry trips, not sure where we went to but we had a view of the skyline on the way back, it only cost 3TL each way for about an hours round trip so not bad, we had a cup of tea on board, Turkish prices not tourist prices, if you just want to see a little bit of Istanbul from a distance well worth a ferry trip

Good cruise. We did the short cruise on the Bosphorous. The boat was fairly crowded, but we did have a good time. The tour guide was good and pointed out various monuments along the cruise. Its a great idea to carry your camera and zoom lens when you go for the cruise. On a slightly cold and chilly day, please carry and extra layer - its really windy on the boat, even if it is sunny.

Ferry ride along the Bosphorus. Allow yourself the entire day to enjoy Bosphorus. You can get on a public ferry at Eminonu, and it crisscrosses the Bosphorus between Europe & Asian side. It'll reach Anadolu Kavagi is about 1.5 hour, makes a stop about 3 hours, before heading back to Istanbul. Enough time in Anadolu Kavagi, to have lunch (fish is cheap there) and visit the fort, on top of the hill. Taking the public ferry is definitely cheaper, than taking a tour package. The view along Bosphorus is also amazing.

You haven't seen Istanbul if you haven't seen the strait. Our hotel was on the Bosphorus Strait and our room had an excellent view of the Strait and Asia. No view anywhere in the world seeing two continents in the same city. All the hotels on the Strait have balconies to have a deink and admire the view.
A Must ..... One of the most amazing tour to have in Istanbul is the Bosphorus Cruise....if you were lucky you can watch dolphins plying around...
Great ferry. Went on a ferry across the Bosphorus .Great fun.On time.Sat outside.Lovely to see all the boats and the views. Of the city skyline on our way back.Great value
Here Europe, there Asia. Busy with cruisers, pleasure boats, liners and freight, but how can you resist seeing both Europe and Asia in one photo shot. And the bridges are pretty impressive.

If you ever wondered the size of Istanbul. I would recommend the 10TL trip which you can get from the shore her Emonou(sp) tram station. It is just enough and goes to the second bridge. I used the Travel Adviser downloaded Istanbul City guide with the cell phone GPS for site information. It is the best deal in Istanbul!

Wonderful city.. You have to get on one of the many boats that sail the Bosphorus. The one we got on was fairly big and had a bar/drinks/snacks as it was nearly a 3 hour round trip. This is when you can see and visit two continents in a matter of hours!

Marvellous. A very enjoyable ride on the sea that joins asia with europe. Late afternoon ride is more suitable to enjoy the weather & the Lighting on the Bosphorus Bridge. Plenty of cruise boats to chose from. Cruise offers a wonderful view of the city and the mountains.

Used Zoe Yacht but not a good experience. It was great cruising the Bosphorus but not with this company. The boat was very nice but the crew were very disinterested. Quite happy to sell us a beer or wine but ask them something about the mansions on the banks of the strait and they haven't a clue. If you use this company, take a guide book with you. The reason I gave this a 3 is because of the Bosphorus not the company.

2 continents. As tour guides will never cease telling you, Istanbul is the only city to span 2 continents and the historic stretch of water is now linked by 2, soon to be 3, bridges. It is one of the world's great sites and experiences.

A Cruise up the Bosphorous. We took a cruise up the Bosphrous up to the edge of the Black Sea. The whole trip took 6 hours but stops at a lovely little village and one has three hours for lunch etc before re-joining the ship.No need to go to a travel agency for the tickets. The tram stops across from the ferry station and the boat of choice is the one run by the Turkish Govt. The boats stops a few tmes ,but only quickly ,and crossing the Bosphorous and returning.Well worth the time.Michael & Minka

Connecting Turkiye. As a bonus after a quick shopping at the old spicy market, just across the market square, there you see the famous Bosphorus Strait which connects the Asian and the European Turkey. I was on the European side. Too bad, i did not have the time to cross to the Asian part. Nevertheless, the half trip was already worth sharing.

Nice cruise and history lesson. The Bosphorus is one of the most important water bodies in Turkey and offers a nice cruise. For this, you will need to go through a tour operator. Dime a dozen available on Divan Yolu (main street with the tram line), or just ask your hotel reception (mind the hidden commission). There are three options available. Would definitely recommend that you do any one of them.1. A quick 2-hour cruise, where you don’t get off the boat. It just takes you along the coastline and the guide explains all about Istanbul’s history and the different monuments. There are about 3 departures in a day – 2 pm, 4.30 pm and 7 pm. You will be approached by numerous people as you walk down the Ayasofya area offering you the cruise. Most of them are pretty safe and are offering you the same cruise. Negotiate well with them. We managed to get it for 20 Euros (or 55 TL) for two persons. With some luck, you can manage 45-50 TL as well. More than anything, this gave us a good history lesson of Istanbul, with the guide explaining everything. 2. A half-day cruise. You will be picked up and dropped at the hotel. Different tour operators will offer different itineraries. Pick the one you like. If it’s a day cruise, would recommend the one that lets you get off the boat and explore the Dolmabahçe palace. Cost was listed at between 35-45 Euros per person. Possibly negotiable. Lunch may not be included. If it’s an evening cruise, they will probably not let you get off. It will have a belly-dance, other performances along with dinner and drinks. Cost is likely to be higher – around 90-100 Euros per person.3. Full-day cruise. Pick up from and drop back to hotel. They cover a few things on the Asian side of Istanbul as well. Do it only if you are spending many days in Istanbul and are really interested in the sights they show. Cost is around 80-90 Euros per head. Lunch included.

A cruise on the Bosporus. We took a boat from Ortakoy a ten minute taxi ride with no traffic from the Swissotel. TL10.00 per person. The boat is fairly large , clean and comfortable, it takes a little over two hours and it's well worth it.

A relaxing cruise in the middle of the day. The sights along the Bosphorus are lovely. The crowded European side is so different from the tony residential Asian side. I wish we had more time to explore all these neighborhoods, though it is possible to take a ferry to eat at the different waterfront cafes and restaurants along the water.
Great 2 hour tour for cheap!. We took the 10 Lira 2-hour ferry tour on the Bosphorus and saw some amazing structures along the way. Definitely should be at the top of anyone's list.
Leisure trip. You need good weather to get the best from this trip. Organise it yourself otherwise you will pay a lot more.Half a day is sufficient.
breathtaking. Travelled to Saraya, took the boat back to Eminonu, the scenary on either side of the bosphorus is just WOW. All is so well kept, mixture of modern and historical, nothing to dislike!!!
Make sure to take a boat tour. You can see the waterfront palaces, villas, and hotels. A lot of good picture opportunities both on European and Asian site.
A definite "must do". So much to see on both sides while cruising the straight, especially the remarkable Rumeli Fortress with its impressive walls and towers as well as several mosques.

Nice cruise. it's lovely to sail in the evening. the air is cooler and the colours rich and mellow. one may take the ordinary ferry ride or go for the dinner cruise. the hilly terrain provides a nice backdrop.
Chilly, but great!. Many great seafood places to eat and watch the life of Istanbul float and walk by! If you are lucky you can catch a Turkish, US or Russian warship go by!

Good relaxing time. We took an afternoon cruise. It took us up to Black Sea, where we spend around 1hr on the beach in nearby village. The meal and soft drinks where provided on the boat. They did consider food allergies and other diets. As I'm vegetarian I had a veggie meal for me :) It was sunny afternoon and the views on both, European and Asian side are amazing. The guide was really nice and provided a lots of info. It is good if you want to have a relaxed, not rushed afternoon.
City of palaces. get a ticket from Kabatas for only 12.5 TL for a hop on hop off trip around the strait. really nice dont pay alot for the tour unless you must
Trip on the Bosphorus. We had an afternoon cruise on the Bosphorus - it was an excellent way to see both sides of the city. Recommended

Must do a trip on the bosphorus. Yes you must - it has to be done - we did one up the Bosphorus to pierre loti and took the cable car to the vantage point for photos and then back down and up the golden horn and back - a half day and well worth it.
Beautiful!. There is a tour boat that runs in the afternoon for cheap. It's approx 2 hours.Otherwise, take the ferry to any part of the Asian side, and you will be amazed at the view.
Very interesting!. I took a cruise with my friends to Bosphorus Strait and it was very interesting. We can see fantastic buildings in both sides, Asian and European. I loved it!

Take the 1.5 hour trip. We loved this! 1.5 hours up the coastline viewing the most spectacular waterside homes, hotels and visitors' sites. Then a really steep hike to the top of the rock with wonderful views; followed by freshly caught fish on the quayside for lunch and 1.5 hours on the way back. Really glad we didn't do the shorter trip!

bhosphorus on public ferry for muslim travellers. take the public ferry
10.35 am sailing each day, 25 euros
there are non-alcoholic restaurants at the end.
Beautiful Views. The Bosphorus Strait is an absolute must-see in Istanbul of course and you should definitely get yourself onto a cruise to explore it fully.

There is a one hour cruise. A smaller ferry that runs for about an hour to check the main portions of the strait...
It costs about 10lira and can save a lot of time.
We took one that departed at 715pm and got to see the sunset and the night view.
It can get chilly, ideal to bring a jacket/shawl along.

A more relaxed way to see Istanbul. A cruise down the Bosphorus Straight give you a perspective of how large and diverse Istanbul is. Starting from around the city centre, it takes you progressively to the more suburban areas. If you get a cruises that is a hop-on/hop-off boat then you can get to see these areas that you'd otherwise not see. It's quite pretty and is worth the time.Go early to avoid crowds and so you can see the more outlying areas of Istanbul.

Buy your ticket at the Quay. A lovely time of day to see the Bosphorus is at sunset.There seem to be two options either a long cruise which sadly we had no time to do or the shorter hour and a half cruise up to the bridge.The quayside was heavingly busy on a Sunday afternoon but we ignored all the ticket touts and various places selling tickets and headed straight for the ticket office ourselves and got our ticket for 12tky.We used tuyol boats which are to the left of the Galata bridge.by chance we were one of the first onto the boat & were able to get seats at the side. These boats are busy so I would recommend turning up early.The commentary was pretty inaudible but our guide book provided information anyway.seeing the skyline of Istanbul in the setting evening sun is lovely

another must do. a trip to Istanbul is not complete without a cruise on the Bosphorus Strait. have a guide or at a minimun get a guide book to explain what you will see of importance along the way. much more enriching that way

Great views from the boat trip. We did the Bosphorus boat trip on The Istanbul BigCity Council Official boat trip (Istanbul Buyuk Belediyesi), priced at 25 lira per person for the full extended trip lasting almost 6 hours (with a 2 hour 45 minute stop) at the halfway point Anadolu Kavagi. The shorter trip was 10 lira pp.This was great value for money and a super day out with fantastic views of the Bosphorus and the bridges. Recommended.

Historic crossroads plus its relaxing and pretty. For centuries this area was the crossroads of trade between the Far East and Europe. Now it's an important shipping area for Baltic area countries and Turkey. If you take the ferry or a cruise you'll see lovely places, gardens and scenery. The water is beautiful. You can also take a stroll along the waterway. It's a nice way to take a break from the city. There are street vendors with yummy food n drink for sale to make an impromptu picnic. If you cross the Galta (misspelled) bridge, you can walk from Asia to Europe. It's a fun way to stump your friends at home.
Wow!. I don't know what i was expecting, but it defiantly surpassed anything I thought of! Huge, wide, beautiful and awe inspiring!

Bosphorus Cruise. Granted, there are TONS of Bosphorus cruises out there, but I think it's definitely something you should experience if you're in Istanbul. The one I took was only 25TL & it provided a great view of the residential life along the coast. It sailed for about an hour, then we stopped at Anadolu Kavagi for a few hours where we ate fresh fish & hiked to get a great view of the Black Sea. The cruise then returned us to our departure point in Besiktas. It took the majority of the afternoon, but it was definitely worth it. Seeing Istanbul from the water provides a different perspective, and a beautiful one at that. Here's the site for the cruise: http://sehirhatlari.com.tr/en/timetable/full-bosphorus-cruise-362.html

Bosphorous. great. Don't bother with commercial cruises, take the ferry up to Anadolu Kavagi and back. takes 3 or 4 hours but you can have lunch there and take a walk up to the castle from where you can see the Black Sea and the construction of the third Bosphorous Bridge.

A must-do in Istanbul. A boat trip, however short, on the Bosphorus is a surely a must-do when you visit Istanbul. The views are amazing especially on a good day. We took a return trip of about an hour up river begining at Galata Bridge. There is much to see on both sides of the river.

Cruise on the Bosphorus. as part of a tour we went on a cruise mid morning. the weather was nice and the view from the boat was very nice. we also took a trip at dusk for just 10 liras. it lasted for about 1.5 hours. the experience was great with the sun settting and the surounding becoming dark gradually.

Don't just take any cruise.... We took one of the 2-hour cruises being sold on the street between Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. It turned out to be pretty disappointing. It was advertised as English commentary but evidently was shared with a Russian tour group and the Russian guide spoke for most of the cruise while the English commentary lasted only the first 20 mins or so. This meant that 3/4 of the cruise was really boring... Also there was a lot of pushing and shoving as we were herded onto the boat like cattle and everyone was trying to get the top floor seats. Though it was a warm day it got quite windy and cold on the boat, so I'd recommend warm clothes and a scarf. We heard from other people afterwards that the full day tour was good, as there was only 20 or so passengers and they got off at some attractions and got a good background and history of Istanbul.
A wonderful cruise. Many different companies have boats that take you up and back for about 2 hours on the Bosphorus with wonderful views of a beautiful city.

A must-do on trip to Istanbul. So, you might ask, what can be so thrilling about a simple ferry cruise up and down the Bosphorus? To us, it was one of the most memorable things we did while visiting and would highly recommend it because the strait is narrow enough to really see everything on both sides and there is a lot to see. People swimming, glimpses of beautiful homes, views of magnificent mosques, palaces, impressive government buildings, ancient fortresses, interesting restaurants and a great variety of many activities really added to the experience. A loud speaker carries the narration of the tour so you don't miss a thing and to miss anything would be a shame.

With kids. This was very pleasant. We have 2 14yo, and an 11yo, so didn't want to do the public ferry to the black see. We took a private boat, which also did the Golden Horn, and it took 2 hrs (lots around, negotiate down the price - we had 6 people for 100tl=$50us). A must do in Istanbul.

A Must for every traveller. Just awesome experience. Take a ferry with cabaret and ply at night. There are lots of Ferry available with dinner and cocktail. It is not costly also. Be there at the deck while you are about to cross under the bridge.

Can't beat the harbor views and action. A lively and lovely harbor which is an attraction all by itself. Take some ferries to the new town and the Asian side, and a Bosphorus trip if you have time. Gorgeous at night as well or in the morning from your hotel's inevitable rooftop terrace.

Full Day Tour. Enjoy the wonder of the Bosphorus Strait on a full day tour. Wonderful way to spend the day without the crowds and see Istanbul from the water. we used ibobooking.com....hotel pickup & drop off...very convenient.

The greatest way to travel between Europe and Asia. My last visit to Istanbul was 50 years ago; there were almost no cars, only lots of taxis. There was a shortage of plastic bags, and there were no bridges over the Bosphorus. So, much has changed. But the most fun way to travel between the European and the Asian parts of Istanbul is still the same. Just fascinating to watch all the activities while one is crossing the water. And using the public boats is cheap, just 3 TL per passage, that's about one and a half US$.

A nice walk to see Turkish life.. We talk a few nice walks from the Metropolis hostel along by the water. The kids liked running on the rocks dodging the cats, fishermen, swimmers and alcoholics. Not very health and safety but fun anyway. We did a circular route up through the park below Topkapi palace...quite lovely.

Had a great trip on the Ferry. We really enjoyed our round trip on the ferry, it was cheap, not full of tourists and we loved pulling into and out of the various stops along the way. We got off twice, once to go see the castle, which was a nice hike, and the second on the Asian side to check out some markets. This is a must do trip!

Try the sea taxi or the night cruise. The title says it all...the sea taxi is so convenient, unique and quick. It shows you all that is to see on the shores in a jiffy. Then take the night cruise! For a languid romantic ride. I had the opportunity to do both!

Boat Trip. If you walk across the bridge from Europe to Asia - on the left are a number of vendors selling boat trips on the Bosphorus, one we found, departed at 1100 for a two hour trip up to the second bridge and back again for TL10pp, well worth the money and should be done.

just try it ... its brilliant. for only 10 TL, I took a 2 hours cruise which was impressive. its a good feeling to be between the largest continent and the second smallest continent in the planet.you might need to know that there are two types of boats small and big.in my point of view, its better to be in a small boat with a fewer people but if there are a lot of people it would cause lack of space and you will be sitting in the middle or inside the cabin which is no good. So, make sure you go for the big boat.

Best way to be in two places at once.. This is a nice way to see and get to know about Istanbul. I took a cruise in the early evening which enabled me to see half of the strait during daylight and then the Bosphorus bridge and the rest of Istanbul lit up at night. It got a little chilly later on so I'm glad I took some warm clothing. There was a tour guide and he spoke with some of the passengers after his talk; he said he really appreciated people asking him questions as it reassured him that people were actually listening but also because he enjoys talking about his country, he was really approachable. There was an initial surge of tourists attempting to take pictures of everything the guide highlighted but this soon stopped and everyone seemed to relax (especially after indulging in the beer and snacks on sale). This is such a great way to spend a few hours and appreciate the special, vast and amazing landscape of Istanbul.

You get an alternate view of the city. a boat tour is a must if you have the time when visiting Istanbul. Our hotel made arrangements for a sunset cruise of 2 hours. I was a bit disappointed as you really can't see much after sunset. Then it's just a long boat ride. So definitely do a day trip and ensure you get commentary about what you are seeing. There is so much history here. You will see the main tourist attractions from the water, which is beautiful, and you can see the locals fishing, swimming, and picnicking on the weekends along the banks. If you walk along the banks, you can find all sorts of vendors- food, souvenirs, shooting at balloon games. It's a great place to watch people.
Boat Ride. Do not pass up a 1/2 day boat ride out to the Black Sea. It is glorious, restful and really interesting.
Gateway to Asia. We took a short cruise on the bosphorus, not one offered by the many guides around the area for 15 euro, but a walk to the dock area and paid 10 turkish lire for 2 hours, bargain

Take the ferry!. The best way to see the Bosphorus is to use a good-ish guide book which covers the trip - many do - and take the 25 TRY per head round trip ferry at 10.35 each day from the Eminonu ferry terminal by the Galata bridge. It takes 90 odd minutes and make several stops along the way, leaving you about 3 hours at its furthest stop before coming back the same way. Plenty of restaurants vying for your business there, but be warned the climb to the castle is quite punishing, though rewarding!Strongly recommended as a break from pounding the city streets!

Great Scenic Trip. We took a guided tour to see Bosphorus Strait .It was a great scenic trip covering almost whole of the Golden horn shows you Marmara sea,Asian side and European side simultaneously.Also all of the important landmarks on both sides of the coast are shown .Floating between Europe and Asia is a wonderful experience and is a must see during your stay at Istanbul.The cost of this trip depends upon how much bargain you were able to do with the agencies.But you can also go by local ferry that is much cheaper but without a commentary.

Not to be missed. You cannot come to Turkey and not do a boat trip down the Bospherus. Trips cost approximately £10 and worth every penny. The weather was perfect when I did the trip. You get a real perspective of just how huge Istanbul is. The modern and the ancient mix and blend in perfectly. Not to be missed.

Floating between Europe and Asia. It was cool to see all the different architectures of the buildings along the bosphorus strait. If you sit on the left side of the boat, you'll see the Europe side on the left, and Asia side on the right. Bring a jacket... it can get windy and a bit chilly.

by road and by ferry. on our first day we took the hop on-off bus to get our bearings of the city and it crossed the bridge... the next day we went down to the ferry terminals and bought a ticket ( 1 euro) and sat out on deck and enjoyed one of the most scenic and historic trips to be taken anywhere... try it.... the easy way to to get a coin from the machines for 3 lira and this allows you through the turnstiles.... dont worry about the crowds, they are mainly local and only want to get on to the bottom deck to get off quickly... head up to the top deck and sit back and enjoy

Abit of a scam. The cruise was great but I had asked before paying if the cruise went to the ruins of Rumeli Fort and told yes and shown a map confirming this. However as we approached the fort our boat turned around and headed for home. Once on shore I couldn't find our capt or the guy who sold me our tickets. Also all passengers were told while being bussed to the boat that a bus would return us to our pickup spot - no bus. Apart from the lies, it is a nice cruise and no other tourist appeared to nice the rip off. Must mention the offenders were Burgas should have been bogus. Included is a pic of how close we came to Rumeli.

Relaxing Boat Trip.. We enjoyed our trip along the Bosphorus.Interesting to see the different styles of Palaces and Private homes along the way and a lot of pride taken in the upkeep and maintenance of them.

See Asian and European sides of Istanbul. The short Bosphorus trip is a tourist tour. You can see both sides of Istanbul in low and middle Bosphorus. The view is amazing. if you are tired of walking through Istanbul, take the boat and enjoy the scenery.

Well worth it but stick to the cruise only. Very impressive to see Europe on one side and Asia on the left.Try to get a 'cruise only', as we took a bus tour and cable ride package. The latter 2 are pointless as the bus takes you on the outskirts straight to a cable car high on a hill which only last less than 1 minute. we lost 3 hrs with this which could be better utilised on other sightseeing areas.

Perfect Way to Cool Off in the Summer & Appreciate Istanbul's Coastline. A 10 Turkish lira per person you can't go wrong with catching a boat to see some of Istanbuls sites on this 2 hour cruise. It's a good way to help you select what you'd like to see during your stay in Istanbul! The only downside would be the 10 lira tours don't feature any commentary in what you're passing by but for 10 lira - why complain! Use a guidebook and ask there what you're passing by and problem solved! The cruises run up the European side first then back down the Asian side so no worries about where to sit. Tea and other beverages as well as snacks are on offer as well while travelling - so civilized! Enjoy!
ferry 12.5tl. good educative trip by ferry indeed city of sultans for ferry take tram to kabatas .the ticket office is right opposite
Boat trips are great. We really enjoyed the boat trip there was loads to see and it really was very pleasant and interesting. Get a guide book and it explains the sights and their history.

Great 2 hour trip.. Wanted to go on a boat trip. There are so many options, lots of people will approach you offering trips, be careful. We walked along and found a nice big boat with the prices clearly displayed at the terminal. You could spend a lot of money with a meal but we just wanted to enjoy a short trip. We went to the waterfront by the Galata Bridge near Eminonu and paid 10 TL which we thought a bargain for 2 hours. It was a big boat, you could sit inside or on top under shade. There was a place where you could buy a drink and snack and a man who brought round a tray of Turkish tea for a few lira. There was so much to see, it was one of the highlights of our holiday.

A must see. My wife and I took the decision to take a 2 hour boat trip on the Bosphorus which only cost 20 Turkish Lira.We were not disappointed, the trip was excellent and took us to all the interesting points along he river. Lots of commercial traffic and cruise ships. Simply brilliant.

Beautiful scenery. We did about 2 hours on the boat. Coming from the European side we saw a lot of the Asian side seafront, which seemed a lot more modern, and lots of very up market hotels and houses, The Asian side had lots of very expensive looking large estate houses, with many different types and sizes.
A must do. You see the major palaces from this ferry ride. Bring a camera, you'll need it! Don't worry about which side to sit on- the ferry reverses and you see both sides of the coastline.

What a difference. I really loved Istanbul and I just loved to go to the asian part of the city, since it's quite different from the european one. Almost no one could speak english, but I had such a great time trying to communicate!Also, the boat is good, cheap and if you take it in the end of the afternoon you might see a great sunset. There is also a cafeteria inside.
Great. Worth doing even if you forget you sea bands and Kwells! Having booked just above the hotel we got the advantage of an add on with a view from a height across Istanbul.

Seaside lunch at the Black Sea. Took the all day ferry up to Black Sea! Ferry stops at North end of the Strait for about 3 hours. Great fort with excellent views and very nice, casual seaside restaurants for lunch. We took the 1035am ferry, back in Istanbul around 415pm, an excellent day and very economical!
Good way to see the city. Take a break from all the walking and queueing up and let the boat move you instead. It's a nice way to see the city and its ports without too much effort.

Definitely worth the time and money. Went for a 2h ride for 10TL. there are 3 levels on the cruise with only the top deck is open-air. Beautiful view of Istanbul and the bridges, there are also some great photo spots. Went in the day but I believe the night view would be even better.

Bosphorous At Night. I should recommend to use the cruises with dinner and some entertainment to enjoy Bosphorous at night either. The price of the cruise we used was US$65 per person (proposed by the Sky Group Agence) which for the services that we received was high but I enjoyed every moment of our 4 hours trip.

BOSPHORUS STRAIT. Just sitting by the waterfront and watching ferries and people coming and going gave real flavour of the city. Also mini cruise on Bosphorus gave one chance to see both continents at once and such memorable structures as the Bosphorus bride and Hotel Kapinski.
Traffic. The Bosphorous is a waterway the has more traffic on it than any other waterway we had seen. There are sooo! many boats and ships that its a marvel there aren't accidents all the time.
great cruise. another excellent excursion on the sparkling bosphorus..well planned and narrated as you sat back and enjoyed the interesting sights we used VIATOR for our excursions.....great service
Bosphorus. The best view i have ever seen in my life. Since i have also turkish ties, it is the best place for me in the world. Especially the view at nights are beautiful

Enjoy the beauty of the Bosphorus!. We did the tour just a few blocks down from the Dolmbahçe Palace for 15TL. It was a lovely tour that allowed us to hop on and hop off of the boat. It took us over to the Asian side where we were able to meander around some sea side villages. Definitely something to do. So many beautiful houses and monuments to see along the Bosphorus, don't want to miss out on this.

Be careful. We cruised this as part of a Black Sea Cruise (twice)BUT the local cruises looked pricey and VEY touristy.Depends on what you want. Sights are lovely but Eve Cruise with food, drink & entertainment sounded Ghastly!!

Lovely relaxing way to see Istanbul. You can pick up the ferry next to the Galata Bridge for only 12TL and it is a lovely, relaxing way to enjoy the views of Istanbul. The trip takes just over 1.5 hours and it is lovely and cool on the boat, (especially after a hot morning touring the city sights). On board you can buy a refreshing glass of fresh orange juice (2TL) and a sandwich (5TL). Great value way to enjoy the Bosphorus.

One of the highlights of visiting Istanbul. I would suggest that you go the peir and catch the boat by your self, no need for an organised tour, you will save a lot. Just ask the hotel for directions.
Amazing views. Take the longer cruise on the Bosphorus to see more of both continents. Three palaces and the Great Wall are just a few of the sites you will see.
Stunning. Take a public ferry to view this at its best. Stunning to see both the Asian and European sides from the comfort of a ship.

An essential Boat trip. We did an organised boat trip for a couple of hours with commentary. Some interesting Palaces, homes. recreational areas. A very pleasant way to see the shores of the Strait. It is and possible to take a local ferry to see the sights.

Beauty on both sides of the Bosphorus. Our cruise on the Bosphorus was highlighted by sights on both the Europe and Asia sides. Our tour guide pointed out many different places and things to see. We were also given a delicious meal topped off by scrumptious turkish delight. It was a great boat ride.

Must see puts istanbul in perspective. This is a must do 2 hour cruise. You can walk over near the blue mosque and the fountain they have students selling tickets for agencies for 10 euros. The boat departs at 1:20 will take you all over istanbul and explain every sight. You will see europe and asian side and how every culture makes istanbul connect. Beautiful weather would be amazing for this trip.
So much to see. The views are breathtaking especially at nightime when you can see all of istanbul lit up especially the mosques. Istanbul is officially my favourite city.

Not to be missed. This one is a must .. make sure you take the trip either in Early Morning or at Dusk .. Very Picture-Loving Place .. If you embark from Ortakoy you end up with a 45 Min Tour ... the Long Tour -about 2 Hours - leaves from Kabatc Port not oratkoy -spilled kapatach in Turkish .. This one is worth more than the above one (Price was 25 Lira for the long one) The Ortakoy district is where you get the Best Ever Kumpit (Turkish Mashed Potatoes ) ... Don't Miss this Tour

Get the boat up to the Black Sea.. Loved the dolphins, views of the city, palaces and life going by. The boat is not expensive and well worth the trip although if you are not at the quay early enough you may have to stand ( we were there atvEaster).We were blessed with good weather and had a great alfresco lunch at the last stop by the Black Sea. Lovely fish in a little marina restaurant.
Beautful Bosphorus. Loved viewing all the amazing architecture along the Bosphorus. Calm waters, on a very hot day. A must see whilst in Turkey

The Bosphorus from shore and on a boat. The Bosphorus is hard to miss in Istanbul. A lively and picturesque community of boats and ships of all sizes and types, fishermen, people strolling and sitting along the shores. Except for the Galata Bridge area, the area is not over-populated with intrusive tourist shops.

The cruise is well worth the time. The cruise up the Bosphorus was lovely. We had taken a combo tour of the Bosphorus along with a cable car ride. DON'T MAKE THAT MISTAKE! Take the cruise only which takes around an hour or a little more. You'll pass the old city walls, ancient palaces, universities, 5 star hotels, forests, go under the bridge and all the way to the end where the boat makes a u-turn and then you start seeing the Asian side.The cable card ride is something that is not worth the time nor effort as you're bused to the cable car location and the escalators are broken so you wait in line over an hour in the heat to take the ride that lasts about 10 seconds. This was organized by She Tours through Forever Tours, a big mistake. We didn't know it was She Tours until the end of the tour and hadn't booked with them because of their low rating on Trip advisor. we went with the highly rated Forever tours and. Ugh to our dismay they turned our trip into she Tours. Grrrrrr
For romantic moments.... You can see a variety of the Ottoman Palaces ,Religious buildings, modern houses ,V.I.P. sea shore clubs and Hotels ,all kind of ships and many more....

A marine highway that splits continents. The Bosphorus is well worth a trip on a boat - I recommend the shorter (1,5 hr) trip leaving from near the Galata bridge. Also the best view of the strait and the golden horn is to be had in the afternoon, sipping tea with the locals at the cafe on the waterside of Gulhane Park.

Beautiful sunset cruise!. Take one of those sunset cruises. Get to Eminonu (tram is best) before six and you'll find people there who can get you on the cruise - we paid 12TL each which is much lesser if you try to "book" it with one of those hawks outside Hagia Sophia. We haggled a little as the price offered was 15TL each. You're sure to find a good price once you're at Eminonu as many of them are trying to fill up the boats. Our boat was still mostly empty, the experience was great and we saw others that were full to the brim with people scrambling to be on the top deck. It's a must-do on Bosphorus.
Nice Boat ride. On our trip to Istanbul we enjoyed both a ferry to the Asia side and a your of the Strait. Both are recommended and a nice way to see new sights.
Try form the House Hotel Lounge. Probably one of the best places to enjoy the Strait is from the first floor of the House Hotel . Just try it out !

This is a fabulous view expecially from a ship. I passed in and out of the strait several times while on a cruise.It is a very memorable experience. The views on all sides are great. A photographers delight!

Don't miss this one. If you have free time, take the long cruise from Eminönü costing 25 TL (be careful, there are some offered for 25 EUR also). It takes 1,5 hours to reach almost the Black Sea. There, at the end of Bosphorus, the ship takes a 1,5 hour pause, you can get off and eat the best seafood in Istanbul at one of the buffet-like places for quite reasonable price. Then the ship returns on the same route to Eminönü.
Beauty. We actually saw this on "The Other Tour" if you have looked up the other tour I highly recommend it!

Historic waterway; must see. If you have any sense of history at all, you must take a cruise up the Bosphorus. The castles, the palaces, and my favorite--the castle that Mehmet the Conqueror built prior to taking Constantinople in 1543. Amazing.
very interesting. take a boat - you will be able to see both faces of Istambul (Asian and European) from the water: palaces, living areas, people fishing and sailing, older houses

This is completely a different experience to explore Istanbul. You should get on the cruises that leaves every few hours you can hop on or hop off every few hours from the stops you get off, offcourse with single ticket and it just worth the money you pay for it. on the way you will get to see monuments from asian/european sides and enjoy the beautiful scenery. Avoid this during afternoons since its too sunny and gets a bit tiring as well but if you feel tired you can get off have some food or hang out and then get bacck on it.

Wonderful. We took the short (2 hour) circuit tour on one of the traditional Istanbul ferries (large), after reading of issues with the longer trip. It was a great way to see many places of interest, with the optional audio commentary pointing out features. Nice to sit back and relax after the hectic pace of getting around Istanbul. Thoroughly recommended, as with the audio commentary.

Wonderful Water Views of Both the European and Asian Sides. Don't miss taking a boat tour along the Bosphorous! It takes you around the waterway and you'll see wonderful views of both sides of Istanbul - the European Continent and the Asian Continent as well as many historic buildings and the ancient "city walls".
Bosphorus. Take a ride on the water. You come around the bridges and seeing the beautiful buildings on the waterfront. It does not cost a farm if you take "ferries"

Unique spot. This is very hi traffic maritime area, meanwhile walking on the boardwalk was interesting to see woman in burkas fishing with rods, laughing on the side with Jewish man also fishing, it shows in some places we are more respectfully tolerant to each other...it was great experience to speaking to the both, and enjoying freedom of expression.
relaxing bosphorus. Great tour along the Bosphorus with great views of a beautiful city. Istanbul is exciting, colourful and filled with colour and life.

Buy a trip locally. Buy a ticket down at the port - endless choice and very much cheaper than buying from a travel agent. You can choose the type of "cruise" you want to do.We did a 2 hour trip for 8TL each

An inexpensive and photogenic day trip. A ferry trip up the Bosphorus and back to Istanbul is relaxing and full of stunning views. If you've wanted to see the Black Sea, this is an easy way to get there. Don't pay the big fees for a private tour. The government run ferry is only 25TL for a round trip. Get tickets and board at the ferry terminal closest to the Galata Bridge at Eminonu. Good to be there about 9:30 am for the 10:30 departure so you can get good seats outside under the roof near the edge for best views. You get to see some incredible scenery including historic fortresses, fishing villages, pa;aces, and upscale residences in one of the legendary places in the world. You are following in the wake of Jason and Argonauts, after all! At the last stop in Anadolu Kavagi, the ferry lets you off for about 3 hours. You should, if you're physically able, walk up to the fortress to get a great view of the Black Sea and ships moving up and down the Bosphorus. There are lots of restaurants on the way up the hill and near the ferry terminal.

Cruise of Bosphorus. It is fantastic view. Bosphorus. It is one of the must see attraction of Istanbul a city where East meets West. Its apprx. 30 kms long shores are full of life with restaurants and shops. Bosphorus connects Marmara sea with Black Sea. It runs through the Istanbul and divide the city into two continents Asia and Europe. It gives the complete view of the Istanbul city famous for its museums, palaces, ruins, villages, gardens and of course beautiful mosques. It is one of the most beutiful stretch in Istanbul which gives live and romantic view of the city day and night.

Beautiful views.. Our experience was limited to a walk across the Galatea Bridge - but I wouldn't trade it for any other. It was a wonderful experience - the sights and the sounds we heard from walking across it. Next time we will enhance our experience by eating at one of the fish restaurants under the bridge !

Has to be seen to believe. This is one strait I would like to return to again and again. It was beautiful and the scenery on the shores was indescribable. The commentary on the cruise was very informative and food and drink was plenty - and reasonably priced!

Breath of fresh air. We took a tour on the Bosphorus Strait. It was refreshing to be in the cool breeze, relax and enjoy the homes on both the West and East sides of Istanbul. We got off at the other end and took a tour to Sadberk Hanim Museum. This was also amazing. Full of Ottoman clothing, jewelry and also ancient Phoenician and Greek artifacts. A wonderful surprise.

Good value Bosphorus strait tour. Had read previews reviews (not TA) but the ticket office had improved with seating and now undercover. Boat was a regular ferry consequently had loads of seats. There was no commentary but you could buy a audio guide with map. 10:35 start and furthest point was Anadolu Kavagi reached at 12:05.Three hour turn round plenty of time for lunch-however 2 stops before (Sariyer) looked a much nicer place. Might get off there next time. I thought 25TL was OK for nearly a full day.

Cruise it on a ferry boat!. We took a cruise for 7 lira to take a 2 hour cruise down the Bosphorus. If you go down to the docks, you'll see prices range all over the place. We kept walking down until we saw a ferry ready to leave - we were charged only 7 lira! So look for a cheap way to see the beautiful sites by boat, including the Asian side. Be aware though - there is no narration, we used our tour book!
Tourist trap. We paid for a boat tour and would not have done so if we knew what I waste of time it was. Do a tour, but plan it yourself.

" Voyage to the Golden Fleece". Strategically the Bosphorus Strait is exceptional. It divides not only the great city of Istanbul but also the continents of Europe and Asia. Leading from the Sea of Marmaris to the Black Sea it is a trip into the past. As a lover of history, art, literature, architecture and just life, you could not make a more interesting voyage ( well, you could - but this is definitely one of them ). I cannot urge you enough to read as much as possible about the history of this area; be adventurous and ferry hop from place to place, stopping where you want, taking in the sights, sampling the food, admiring the architecture, palaces,'yalis', - I was lucky enough to be able to spend months doing this and introducing friends and colleagues to what many would have missed. If you are not sure about doing it on your own; use a well-respected Tour Operator.

Wonderful views of Istanbul.. A cruise down the Bosphorus is a must when visiting Istanbul. Along the shores there are views of former palaces turned into luxury hotels, original Ottoman homes, fortifications running as far back as the Roman Empire. Best of all, is the view of Istanbul on the return leg of the cruise.

Bosphorus Trip. During our stay in Istanbul we have made 3 Bosphorus Trips. The view was so amazing and such a blue water that i could not get enough of it. I was so amazed on the traffic in this strait both commercial and cruises. You can take the cruise boats for tourists for prices from 10 Turkish Liras to 30 or you can take the ferry boats/public transportation, for less money. We have tried everything there. :)
Europe meets Asia. The crossroads of the ancient world and the nexus of empires. Must be seen. The houses, boats, traffic, the bridge across the straits. Sublime.
If you have the time ..... Take a boat trip along the Bosphorus strait. It just gives you another view of Istanbul - some amazing history and places along the waterfront.

lovely cruise. took a cruise down the bosphorus, guide was informative but not dry or boring, wish we could have stopped and explored more. Turkey was amazing and we can hardly wait to go back, so much too see, we loved all the history of the country, the silk road, Cappadoccia and the many roman ruins especially Aphrodisias and Bergmon
Take a boat cruise it is worth every penny. I loved seeing the view from the water. You must do this. It is a wonderful experience and the views are spectacular.
Great cruise. Love the river and there are a lot of historical buildings along the banks, especially the European side.
Take the cruise.. Taking a 45 minute cruise is quite cheap and it the easiest way to take in the city. The best time is right before sunset.

Pleasantly surprised is an understatement. Wasn't originally planning on doing a boat trip on the Bosphorus but signed up for it on a whim after walking out of the Hagia Sophia. Then unsure of what time to do the trip we just went ahead and scheduled for the last one of the day which left at 7pm. Couldn't have been more perfect. When we left the dock there was still enough sun to see the sights and the sun set on the beautiful city and it's sights, then it was gorgeous seeing the city light up. Probably the highlight of the trip.

All round trip a lot of time and you get ripped off in Anadolu Kavigi. We went on the round trip Bosphorus cruise this afternoon so the memory is quite fresh!! The trip up is interesting but after a while gets a bit samey. Stand-outs are the bridges. Also be prepared to share your journey with some pretty rude people who stand in front of you and push you out of the way to take photos of essentially nothing.The stand-out was being ripped off by a restaurant in Anadolu Kavigi called the Godze.We chose the place because it was the only that we could see that seemed to have toilets (they were filthy according to my wife).Now here's way the scams come. After walking around to find somewhere to eat we found that all the restaurants have very vague menus. At the Godze we were given a price of 70 TLR for a Sea Bass for 2 people which is pricey but we were in a holiday mood. Be aware that the price they charge is by weight. So be sure that they weigh anything in front of you. Other scams include:They give you bottled water when you sit down (very nice after we heard about the tap water being dangerous)They give you bread before the meal.They charge for these without telling you when they bring them. So ask them to take it away if it is not free. Also we were charged for the bread and water which were taken away from the table before we had finished them. We also saw the bread remaining from our table being placed into another basket which we assume was being given to someone else.My wife wanted a glass of wine. She got a nice glass and we got charged for the whole bottle but never saw the rest of the bottle.And they added a 10% service charge to the bill!!!!!! This is the first time I've seen this done in Istanbul.All up A salad - we asked for one serving and got a large salad that could have served four people and were charged accordinglyFried battered mussels - one servingA meze of seaweedA seabass ( just a sea bass)A glass of wine3 beers (33ml)2 people 190 TLR !!!!! Avoid AK at all cost.Also if you have limited time the whole trip takes from 10:30 to 4:30 with 3 hours break to be ripped off.The journey back is the same scenery only going another way. BTW the WCs on the boat are the Asian kind but at the least the boat is pretty stable. Sorry if this review is dripping in bile but the restaurants in AK know that being week day trippers and obviously tourists they'll never see you again so they make hay while the suckers are in town.That aside Istanbul has been great, the people are really friendly and the food is reasonably priced especially in the New District.

Private cruise on the Bospherus. We hired a private boat to do a sunset cruise on the Bospherus.It was worth every cent! Experience the breath taking scenery as well as the magnificent shipping on this very beautiful and busy waterway. It was both extremely exhilarating and relaxing and probablly one of the most romantic things you can do in Istanbul. An absolute must !

Full day too boring. We opted to go on our own and bought the full day cruise, total 3 hours at the ferry which is nice enough... But the 3 hours on the fishing village was too long and boring, there is nothing to do there except lunch. I was expecting the seafood to be fantastic, it. Was okay, we chose a more family own type of restaurant. Half day cruise is enough.
Amazing view. By night is an amazing view with the bridge over the Bosphorus Strait. Beautiful colors. You should go on a cruise over the Bosphorus for the best pictures and memories.
Bosphorous Bridge is breathtaking. The colour changes at night were magnificent, I cant visit istanbul without checking out this great bridge where Europe meets Asia.
Nice!. I strongly recomend the tourist tour through bosphorus. It's another good way to meet Istanbul in other view.

A must to experience!. this is the most important thing to do while you are in istanbul, taking a ferry with only Lira 20 for 1.5 hour ride to see the view along bosphorus is very worth to enjoy... in a nice weather, good to go before sun set otherwise, go afternoon time because the weather tent to be a bit windy and cold in early nite......
cruise. we took a evening cruise for 10TL (£3) 1 hour cruise . we went around 8pm one way in day light and return trip at night where you can see the city under lights.

Beautiful sunset cruise. When would you be able to take a cruise with Europe on one side and Asia the other? Go for sunset , choose a good boat and position yourself well, and enjoy all the charming view and sounds around you
Take the short trip. As we enjoyed views from our tourist boat, the tug of history was lovely, but not awe inspiring. The short trip (not to the Black Sea) was just enough.
It's an eye full. We had a hotel right on the Strait and enjoyed watching the traffic pass us by. This is where east meets west and so much history to be told.
nice cruise. it is interesting to see how connected the continents are. to see people travel daily on these waters. Nice cruise. An eye opener.

Not to be missed. I took the trip to anadolu Kavagi - its about $12 round trip and takes about 1 1/2 hours to get to the last Asian city before the Black Sea. The restaurants there are ok. Make the hike to the castle on top of the bluff overlooking the Bosphorus and the Black Sea. A little bit of Asia just across the Strait from Europe. The audio Tour was ok, its a value to let you know what you are seeing.

Great view of the sea. Even though its like competition to grab the customers, people that sell those guided cruses are well overpricing the tour.Head down to eminu, and for 10 lira you will see all of the sights that Bosporus has to offer...plus scroll down to spic market, or eat at one of the small resortourants under the bridge.

Picturesque cruise. We enjoyed our two hour cruise on the Bosphorous and for 10 Lira each we thought it was great value. Do not be enticed by the many over-zealous salesman all around Istanbul selling Bosphorous cruises to tourists. These cruises are an overpriced tourist trap. Instead head down to Eminou and beside the Galata bridge you will find the a ferry terminal that sells the tickets for 10 Lira (3 euro). There is also a 6 hour option however we found 2 hours to be more than sufficient.
Lovely cruise. We took a 90 minute cruise up and down the Bosphorus. Breathtaking combination of modern and historic. Don't miss this.

Sunset cruise. we took this sunset cruise of IDO Bosphorus Tour,its office located on the right-hand side of the Galata Bridge. you ask me, this one really is top of the bill. From 1 July until 21 August, every Saturday you can make a nightly cruise on the Bosphorus. The ferry heads for the Black Sea just before the sun starts to set. Once in Anadolu Kavağı, you have 70 minutes to go ashore and enjoy a dinner in one of the many fish restaurants.By the time you board the ferry again, darkness has fallen and you’ll enjoy the Bosphorus by night, in all its grace with nicely lit monuments and a variety of city lights, including the Bosphorus Bridge. So, for a mere TL 20 return ticket you get to see both shapes of the Bosphorus in one cruise. the live music in the boat keep ..you entertained..don't forget to pack a jacket as it may get cold in the way back..

Amazing View of Istanbul from the Water. It was amazing to see all the houses, architecture and history from the water. The photo opportunities were endless and if you have a good tour guide the history is amazing.

As spectacular as it is historic!. This cruise should not be missed. It has all the thrills of feeling like a rich merchant thousands of years ago - on a voyage between the Aegean Sea and the Black Sea. The Vantage of Istanbul's location as the richest city of the Mediterranean can be experienced first hand. The view of the Black Sea from the cliff is magical.

Something different. Try to sit on Europe side of boat as that has the more impressive sites. Last stop takes about 10 min to walk around & you are stuck there for 3 hours before the return leg. My suggestion - get off at one of the earlier stops & wait for ferry to come back.

A relaxing afternoon!. for those who love taking pictures: if you decide to sail the Bosphorus Strait in the afternoon, take a seat on the left so you can take pictures of the European side of Istanbul with the sun shining on the hill while you are sailing to the Black sea; do the same when you go back, so you can take pictures at the sunset of the Asian side! Regarding the cruise: please don't use an organized tour for this "attraction" you really don't need to be escorted! You can easily purchase audioguide of you want to learn more about the history and the places you are about to see. It costs 5 TL. And the cruise costs only 25 TL round trip! There are many stops and you can choose to get off where you want!I got off the boat at Anadolu Kavagi where there's little castle up the hill. The castle is closed but the view of the Black Sea from there is stunning. It only takes 20 minutes to go up there!

Beautiful Bosphorus. Taking a Bosphorus river cruise is a great way to see Istanbul, it's historical monuments from a distance, and the beauty of the city. We took our 9 year old twins and they also enjoyed spotting dolphin, fish, jelly fish, as well as cargo ships and a cigarette boat! A very nice and relaxing way to explore Itanbul!

Love to go back there.. An enjoyable trip for all family members where you spend two hours onboad of a ship viewing the history and beauty of Istanbul. Viewing palaces and villas offered in excess of US$15m.
Sail through history. Use the public ferries...cheaper and more accessible than tour ferries. They will get you anywhere on the Bosphorous and to the Asia side of Istanbul.

Excellent. We took the cruise boat for a 1:30-2 hours cruise on the beautiful, amazing, blue-turqoise Bosphorus. You can have a coffee, tea and listen to music while admiring the magnificent Constantinopole / Istanbul

Blue bosphorus. Take the boat trip at sunset..... Awesome! See the European and Asian side and relax whilst taking in the views of Istanbul. See the blue mosque and new mosques from the horizon as you come back into shore.

Spectacular views. Spectacular views. Just take the boat owned by the government from Eminönü and save a lot of money in comparison to the privately owned boats.
On board the orange-juice is extremly overpriced. The seller pretends in the beginning that it's complimentary welcome drink by putting it in your hands and saying "Merhaba".
Cruise the most historic strait on earth. Beautiful water, a great view of all the neighborhoods of istanbul and a chance to see the Golden Horn,

Nice ride!. I went for a ride on the Bosphorus strait and enjoyed seeing the sights especially the views of Dolmabahce Palace. Even though I went with a cruise company I would advise just taking a ride yourself and identify the areas of interest with a map.
I did the 15 Euro boat tour. One of the best things I did in Istanbul. Easy pick up and drop off. Some food on board. Great way to see the city

on the boat. Another amazing journey. just watching the city unfold as you cruise on by is wonderful.
You get a real taste of the real Turkey on the ferry.

A must to do when in Istanbul. We took a half day tour which included a boat ride on the Bosphorous. When in Instanbul a tour on the Bosphorus is an absolute must! You get to see the marvels of the city from the ocean as well as seeing the only bridge that links Asia & Europe. I highly recommended this!

Great boat trip on the Bosporus. With a boat trip you can go close to many attractions of the city. Best take the boat a bit before the sunset in order to have a stunning view on your way back.
Definitely a recommended trip for everyone.

Certainly worth a boat trip. No trip to Istanbul would be complete without a boat ride on the Bosphorous. The 1 1/2 hour trip is really all that is needed and you get a great view of the city and the surrounding suburbs. Tea and snacks are also served.

A great trip to take. We went on a boat trip on the Bosphorus during our stay in Istanbul. I would recommend to take this trip as we saw so many beautiful sights and saw the city from a different side. We got out on the "Asian side" and had time for a quick bite before we went back to the city passing a famous site the "Maiden's tower".

Choose a better cruise. Bosphorus cruise can turn out to be a romantic cruise or total disaster depending on the boat you get into. Me and my family got into a really old ferry for 1,5 hour and it was extremely crowded. My advise, ask your travel agent or hotel concierge to arrange the type of cruise you want. Never go into some random cruise from one of the dealer u meet on the street

amazing beauty. Amazing views and the history is fantastic and well preserved. The boat was a bit small so be sure to go on a larger vessel instead of hawkers trying to get you to go on their small boats.

You will not regret a boat trip on the Bosporus. I highly recommend a rented boat trip on the strait. It is a great way to see the city on both sides. During the summer it is nice to get on the water where there is a cool breeze. There are numerous restaurants along both sides of the water - make a pit stop whenever you feed hungry!

A wonderful adventure. After spending two incredible days in Istanbul, to continue our Mediterranean cruise through the Bosporus Straights into the Black Sea was another unforgettable day. It was a beautiful day and many passengers stayed on deck to watch the sights on both sides of the ship as we sailed through the straights, with the European continent on one side and the Asian on the other. The view of Istanbul as we first arrived by sea was so beautiful and exotic. We were fortunate to return through the Bosporus Straights and pass Istanbul again as we returned to the Mediterranean once we completed our tour of the Black Sea. Love cruising with Princess Cruise Line.

Superb. The trip costs about 35 turkish lira for the small boat. The boat stops at 5-6 different locations where you can get off, but you'd need to wait for the next boat. The view is super, you get to see the "Istanbul skyline", mountains, the 2 imposing bridges - basically you get to see Istanbul in all it's grandiosity. I highly recommend it!

2 hour sail up to Fatih Sultan Bridge. If you fancy a shorter trip of some 2 hrs up the Bosphorous this is great value and seems really reliable. We went with Sehir Hatlari from Eminönü - their office is just before the Galata bridge, and leaves at 12, 14:30 and 16:00. The boat is pretty big so doesn't get thrown around the frequently choppy river. We sat at the back, feet up, sipping tea and enjoying the vast view. Loved every minute (a licenced bar would've been icing on the cake!).
A trip by water. What could be better than boarding a ferry for a ride up or down the Bosphorus - all that sea traffic and great views.

Fascinating Shipping Lane. Very busy shipping lane, a mixture of hundreds of ferries and big cargo vessels, 2-3 giant cruise ships, all this without a scratch...amaizing. Bosporus bridge has a light show.
Dinner on the Galatasaray Islet is a must! Reservations mandatory!

Take the IDO 2 hour tour - great value!. We took the short tour with IDO - the company run that runs most of the ferries - cost 10 lire for 2 hours - fabulous value for money. Admittedly no frills, no guide, but we used our guide book to fill in the gaps. We arrived at the terminal at 3.55, bought our ticket from the jeton machine and were away at 4...couldn't have been simpler.

Dont' miss it. If you are in Istambul you should go in a aboat trip around the Bosforo. It is lovely and you are going to see so much. I liked it very much and even saw a family of dolphins that came with the boat for a few minutes.

Evening cruise on the Bosphorus. The dinner cruise was fun...seeing splendid sights along the shores of Europe and Asia, the pretty light shows on the bridge, meeting people from around the world, and watching and joining in the folk dancing (and modern dancing, too) was fun. The food was edible, but nothing special.

Between two continents. We love it. It's a beautiful mini cruise and many boats and ferries run it all day long. Beware of tourism companies who try to sell you a cruise and charge you a high price then end up taking you to one of the ferries which would have cost much less in the first place.

Must do if you have more than a day. The Bosporus is a waterway not a tourist attraction as such. It is the way ships from the countries surrounding the Black Sea get to the rest of the world and the way the rest of the world comes to them. There is a constant stream of ships coming and going subject to the rules of this waterway which is narrow north of Istanbul. It also divides the city and, despite the two bridges, has constant ferry traffic. It also offers tourists the chance to view a historic waterfront with significant mosques and palaces behind. And on the Asiatic side are more multimillion dollar houses than you will ever see in West Palm Beach or Beverly Hills. I am glad we had the time for a dinner cruise this visit as it was worth seeing. It was sunny and very hot so plan accordingly if you do this in the summer.

nice view. It is a nice short trip and should be visited! give us an idea how was the turkish invasion that took the greeks from their birth place. They must have had some help to cross and keep this wide area! Just imagine...

A dreamy look at night and during the day. If you get you are in a high standing hotel in Istanbul , try to get the highest level possible , to see how beautiful the Bosphorus is. at night is is shining like stars and you can have your coffee while talking to your beloved ones. if you have got time , try to have a walk on the bridge, there you can see the locals fishing and it really soothes you even watching them let alone fishing yourself.

Bosphorus boat trip. we booked on to a trip with a 3 hour stop at a village on the Asian side near the Black Sea, worth every penny. Great boat journey and loads of time to explore at the stop, would go again.
lovely. We travelled up and down the Bosphrus, on a boat, which was well worth doing in the early evening. The Strait was very busy with boats etc but, compared with the roads, was a pleasure

A must !!!. We booked this morning trip via an agency and it made life very easy as the docks and boat area is very busy and can be confusing. A 2 hour cruise with excellent commentary - a not to be missed trip!!
The trip ended with a ride on a cable car from istanbuls high test point

Beautiful Experience!. Beautiful view through the boat ride through Bosphorus tour, have your camera ready. Caution with vendors, check with your guide for recommendations. In General a visit you would never forget.
Great to get a cruise to see this. But wear sunscreen as I got burnt without feeling it :( Get a book or map about the different sites on each side, it makes all the difference.

Sit back and relax while seeing Istanbul. This is a great way to see many different aspects of Istanbul while sitting back and enjoying being on the water. There were so many beautiful sights, some very old, some new. The only complaint I had was that on our cruise the sound system was very cheap and although the guide spoke English, he was hard to understand.

Relaxing day on the water - incredible value. After some research I did the cheaper version taking the Govt ferry (25 lire return) and it was incredible value. I had been looking at private tours but very glad I took this option. The view is the same from whatever vessel and both sides of the Bosphorus its incredible. A stop for a few hours at the last point for lunch was good though not much else in the town. The feature is the trip itself, up and back which was fantastic and incredible value.

Cruise the Bosporus River. We took a private boat trip on the Bosporus and had a marvelous time. It was a good way to gain perspective on Istanbul. A lovely look at the ancient, ultra-modern and in between architecture of the amazing city.

Not what I expected at all. I took a cruise along the Bosphorus to the opening of The Black Sea. If I had preconceptions about Istanbul they were totally wrong. The shoreline is dotted with palacial houses (some of which were actual palaces), fortresses, upmarket fish restaurants and pretty desireable places to hang out. I wish I had had more time to explore some of the suburbs dotted along the shore.

Cool down on the river. Very relaxing, until you are caught in the wake of one of the other boats crossing the Bosphorus. You might get wet!. Lovely views of the palaces and riverside residences, as well as the bridges.
Bosphorous cruise. Do yourself a favour a get on a ferry for a cruise along the Bosphorous day or night or both! Look at European and Asian sides of Tukey from the water.

Nice cruise towards Princes Island. Cruised through this straits on the way to the Princes Islands. Saw a lot of jelly fish, all kinds of sizes and thought it must be the season. No dolphins tho, a pity. Various small fish swimming about too. Interesting straits and observing the European end and Asian end of Istanbul as the ferry chugs away from the mainland.

Cruise through history. Carry along a good handbook. Take a cruise on a large ferry. And enjoy the ancient and modern sites along the way. Notice how Turkish passengers react to certain buildings. Marvel at the giant bridges. Watch for dolphins. Be swept away by the magical surroundings. And do not forget your binoculars.

Bosphorus Cruise. We didn’t want to pay 25 euro per person for a cruise, this was the price at the reception of the hotel that we were staying in, so we took a stroll to the area where the boats are. We found out from the Tourist information that there are ferries for 12 TL per person, but on the way there we saw sign 10 TL per person. We decided to get on the boat. It was great and clean boat with bathroom facilities on it. The cruise was long 1.5 – 2 hours. We loved it. It is nice to see Istanbul from water and enjoy the views along the shore of both continents.

Amazing boat ride and my tips. I took a 1.5 hour boat ride - the one crosses two bridges, at 12 TL. The view is amazing - seeing the historical district, the Europe side and Anatolia side from the sea is really breathtaking. The time passes so quickly that I really don't mind the ride to be longer. It totally worth the time, and the effort to search for a reliable boat operator.I actually hopped onto a boat the night before when I was strolling along the eminomu waterfront near Galata bridge. There was a boat operator charging 10 TL for 1 hour non-stop ride and said the trip would start at 9pm (it was around 8:40pm then). Since the official boat has already closed for the day, I decided to give this operator a try. But I waited and waited, and the boat was still there when it was already 9:20pm. When asked, the operator said they will only depart at 9:30pm because they have not filled up the boat. I was really pissed and demanded the money back.The next morning, I tried another operator, TurYol, 1.5 hours for 12 TL. To my surprise, the boat departed on time even though it was almost empty. It cruised along the bosphorus straits for a solid 1.5 hours and passed two bridges. The boat is quite big and relatively modern comparing to other boats. The reliable service and comfortable ride definitely made the entire trip more enjoyable.I found the following website extremely useful. I only used it for Bosphorus Cruise on my last day in the city. But if I have come across it earlier, I would use it for other sightseeing in Istanbul.http://www.turkeytravelplanner.com/go/Istanbul/Sights/Bosphorus/BosphorusCruise.htmlI have attached a photo of the first boat operator. Given a chance, I would strongly recommend you to avoid it.

Take the ferry!. There are many boats that offer tours or dinner cruises on the Bosphorus. These can be diverting, but won't offer the rewards of visiting the small communities that dot the shores on either side. The local ferry system is very economical and quite easy to use once you get the hang of it. It's remarkable how few tourists use the ferries or visit the towns along the shore, so you will have much more contact with the inhabitants, as well as more freedom to get off and explore. Each town has an interesting feature, some historical, some functional. Bring a good guide book and you can read about the towns as you approach them and select the ones to explore that appeal to you most. You will also get an excellent opportunity to watch the busy shipping traffic and the many small fishermen in boats or along the shore. This is worth a full day. Check the weather reports to make sure you pick one with good weather, which makes it even more enjoyable.

Well worth a cruise. Very busy waterway with all sorts of boats plying their trade. The cruise was very interesting and we saw a lot of variety in building construction, from the ancient to the modern.
Cruising the Strait!. This place is very beautiful to enjoy and have a very cool background for the photo. I think, if you're traveling to Turkey you must cruising at Bosphorus.
Breathtaking. It's like floating atop the fluid that is the soul of the world. There's just something about it that is calming but unnerving at the same time. Take a cruise, you deserve it.

A must do!. Doing a cruise on the Bosphorous will give you an amazingly unique perspective on this beautiful exotic city. We did a short boat cruise for 10 TL that went just past the second bridge of the Bosphorous and took two hours which was plenty to see the Europe and Asia side of the city. We used an audio guide which was meant to track where we were through GPS but it seemed to lose track and it was difficult to follow which sites the guide was referring to. As with most things, a knowledgeable tour guide would probably make this worthwhile trip even more interesting.

Cruising the Strait.. You get to see both the European and Asian parts of Turkey. You will see yachts from all over the world. The cruise actually weaves in and out of a marina near the new city. You can also see many of the cultural buildings in the city.

Dont Miss this trip. Go when its just around sunset so you see both the sites as well as the lights once its dark. Worth more than the ticket price, a must for anyone who comes to Istanbul, even for sea sick people like me, who made it with a tablet, so not to miss out on the wonderful site

Charter a Private Yacht a Bi-Continental Cruise. The yacht picked us up at our hotel dock and we cruised up the European side and down the Asian side wowed by the spectacular private yachts and villas on the banks of the Bosphorus. We docked on the Asia side and walked the neighborhoods, having lunch at a lovely outdoor cafe and returning to our hotel on the European side in a private car over the bridge. It was truly the highlight of our trip. All was arranged by Sinan Sokman of Istanbulite Tours, who accompanied us. What was missing? Life jackets....

Clean waters in a busy port. We used an inexpensive public transportation ferry to cruise the Strait, but we had a guide with us to explain what we were seeing. A little reading before hand would make it interesting even without a guide though.

Boat ride on the Bosphorus. What a unique way to see the city! My family and I took a large boat (I suppose you could call it a ferry) down the Bosphorus for about an hour, and then stopped for a bit on the Asian side. We appreciated seeing Istanbul from a new angle, away from the congested and chaotic streets. We were impressed with how much greenery the city has to offer once you start to distance yourself from the historic center.

Worth a trip but you can get cheaper at the docks.. We bought a ticket from the touts outside the blue mosque and did not regret our boat trip on the Bospherous. There is a lot to see from the water. Later we caught a tram to the docks near Eminlnou where we saw much cheaper tours. The touts will also lie to you. They told us we would get a bus, but all they do is walk you to the water. Had we been elderly this might have been a problem.

Great Views / Worth the Trip. We spent only two days in Istanbul. On one of the days we decided to get on one of the Bosphorus tours. It was not easy to find the boats / tour areas -- we had heard about scam artists that would offer you a trip on a less than sea worthy boats, etc. So we finally got to a pier straight across the big road outside of the Spice Bazaar. The tour we took was the shorter one -- it did not go all the way to the Black Sea but was still worth it. Great views of the bridges and the European and Asia side of the city.

Great orientation to Istanbul. We began two days of intensive sight-seeing in Istanbul with a boat tour of the Bosphorous. The four of us were taken on a private boat by an experienced tour guide for a 90-minute cruise along both the European and Asian sides of the city. All along the way she told us about the rich history of the city as she pointed out various landmarks. When we docked back on the Golden Horn, we had a clear understanding of how the city is laid out and a general sense of how it evolved historically. I can't speak for what one learns on the organized tour boats, but on a clear day with a good guidebook I suspect it is also a worthwhile orientation.

Amazing boat ride, scenic and great photo shoot.. An amazing river/ Channel!!Take a cruise along the Bosphorus and be amazed at the history, the sights along the way, the oportunities to take a photo close to the shoreline of the huge bridges, homes, gardens etc.Very enchanting villages on route.A must to do in Turkey.

Private trip rather amazing. My friend convinced my husband to rent a private yacht and crew for a trip up the Bosphorus and to the Asian side for lunch. I wasn't terribly keen on the idea at first, but it was fantastic. The boat was beautiful and the sights were gorgeous from the boat. The kids loved it. If you didn't want to get the private boat you'd see the same sights from the ferries.

A short drive to Asia. Not much to say. Took the opportunity to take the 15 minute drive from old Istanbul across the Bosphorus Bridge and into Asia. It was my daughter that told me that Turkey was both in Europe as well as Asia, so with only the bridge separating us, we added another continent to our family trip.

You don't have to do an expensive tour. We didn't have the time or inclination to do an expensive tour on the Bosphorus Strait. We had to get back from the Dolmabahce Palace to Eminonou to catch our tram home so we walked along a little and then took the local commuter ferry for a few lira across to the other side and caught another one straight back to Eminonou from there. The views of the Topkapi Palace etc,were good from the water and we got some good photographs to complement the views we had from the palace.
