Ok if you have you own private tour. Was overated and actually very tiring. The general boat trips are a nightmare as there is a huge rush to get seats on the outside deck. So we were left stadning for most of the time. The views of Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque were good but not worth the ticet price for the long journey.

there's no other water way like Bosphorus. Bosphorus is the Central park for Istanbul people. If we want to relax, breath, take a break, we go by the water, some of us walk, some of us run, some us dine and wine, but we all love to be just by the water. It's not like the rivers that passes thru in many European cities, it's very clean, very blue. I suggest have a coffee in Ortakoy, spending half an hour in Ortakoy than hop on a cap to Arnavutkoy and walk from Arnavutkoy to Bebek, if you are a good walker keep walking till Rumeli hisari, and visit the old fortress...You will enjoy the view and the breeze and understand why we all love Istanbul and also why any room with Bosphorus view cost a fortune, cause we all know it's worth it...

Beautiful! Relaxing! Great value for money!. We took the short Bosphorus cruise that departs from eminonu at 2:30 PM. We made it just in time... And got seats at the lower level, at the end of the boat. Perfect seats to feel the breeze and take in the beautiful sights of Istanbul. We took a lot of pictures... Passed by the dolmabahce palace, rumeli (saw it at a distance), the maiden tower, etc. For the 10TL per ticket, we felt that this cruise (IDO/ Sehir Hatlari) was very good value for money! Their website has all the details. Great fun... Do not miss

Peace of paradise. Whenever I go to Bosphorus Ifeel happy that I live. In Bosphorus you can see both Asıa and Europe both time.Both shores are have excellent restaurants and cafes. If you walk along the shores you can see old buıldıngs. You can take a boat cruıse up and down the Bosphorus.It has a different beauty at different times of the day. Maiden Tower is on an island to the south of Bosphorus.Try one of the restaurant on Bosphorus for a breakfast early in the morning to enjoy morning breeze.Take a special desert (paper sweet or kağıt helva) during walking. And also you should try a special pastry (called simit) with black tea.Eat fish that are freshly coat and prepared at several restaurants. And also try traditional Turkish meals with olive oils.(imam bayıldı,dolma etc.)

Fabulous Day Trip. The local ferry trip up the Bosphorus is fantastic. We took the ferry to the fishing village of Sariyer (on the European side), and then took the bus back to Istanbul. All the details, including times and costs are to be found on TripAdvisor's Istanbul Forum.
Do not miss - go the whole way!. You might be tempted to take the short cruise but go the distance. Seeing the Black Sea is worth it and being on the water is amazing.

Kinda like Hong Kong. Anyone who has visited Hong Kong will be struck with some similarities to Istanbul. No, no big skyscrapers, but lots of water and ferry traffic, and the comparison is worth making.

glorious views and a dose of history along its shores. we took the shorter 90 minute return ferry on our first evening in Istanbul. It leaves from one of the Eminou piers past the Galata Bridge. A little secret, go downstairs and there is a small area at the back of the boat with a couple of wooden benches that offers unobstructed views vs. the overpacked upstairs seating. It goes past the Fatih Bridge and Boshorus Bridge and the Dolmabahce, Ciragan and other palaces plus Rumeli Hissari, the famous fort built in 1452 by Mehmet the Conqueror. A great way to introduce yourself to Istanbul.

Amazing Bosphorus. We had a amazing boat cruise along the Bosphorus till the end of the Bosphorus of Anadolu Kavagı. You have an opportunity o see Europe and Asia at the same time, then you can climb to the top of the hill above the town to Castle in order to view the Black Sea. The ferry takes about 1.5 hours from Istanbul and gives great views of the yalis and konak houses along the Bosphorus. You can have special Turkish tea and cups of the famous yogurt from Kanlica. After visiting the castle you can either take the ferry back or you can take the 15A bus to Kanlica then transfer to another bus which will take you to Uskudar, on the Asian side of Istanbul, where you can take ferry to Eminonu.I highly recommend this cruise.

Mixed feeling. (referring to the boat trips) Of course you see a lot, discover nice districts of Istanbul along the coast, pass under the bridges, etc. I don't know, I am probably picky, I wasn't charmed. But I loved taking the ferry between the 2 continents for 1,2€/one way ;-) You see less, but share more of the local life. If you stick to the boat trip, rather choose the evening one.

If you have half day to spare do not miss the Bosporus ride.but do not take a tourist boat. A commuter ferry oat leaves eminonu around six pm check the time at your hotel or at the Internet.
Take it to sariyer.in sariyer enjoy a fish dinner.then take a cab back. It will be rare experience.

Beautiful views. The views are fantastic, but don't eat your lunch in the restaurants under the Galata Bride. They are really "tourist traps". You can eat much better and cheaper when when you get off the bridge.

A must. İf you visit istanbul you should take a boat tour( not a bus tour!!!!) from old town eminonu station up to the entrance to the black sea which is rumelikavagi.Just take the scheduled ferries and dont be shy to step out in bebek( upscale cafes and restaurants), kanlica ( famous for yogurts) to see a little of real life of istanbul and than take tje next ferry back
Must See. If you do nothing else in Istanbul, take a boat the Bosphorus. This can be a simple roundtrip on a commuter ferry, or a booked cruise. Fabulous vistas!
Great views. We took the 2-hour cruise and lucked out with awesome weather. Great photo opportunities of bridges and sites. Awesome homes along the strait banks.
Excellent trip during day.You can see more and learn a lot. I liked the guided tour of Bosphorus.I liked to through it during day time and could see and enjoy it more

a must do. the transport system is a little confusing as to where you get on and which ferry you use so try and get as much info before you set out as to where you wish to go. We wished to go to Anadolu farthest east up the Bosphorous but left it too late to get the ferry. so we did a Hop on and off tour for 12.5tl each which was good value. but some of the hop off points actually do not have much to offer so again do some research first. Princes island is said to be a good one as well but again its a day tour.
The Bosphorous. It is a must for every traveler to take the Bosphorous River Cruise. For those who don't know the Bosphorous divides Istanbul into two Continents. Europe and Asia.

take a ferry to the princes islands. the ferries are inexpensive and worth the sightseeing! Get off at one of the little islands and walk around in the quietness of the island. A far cry frm the hubbub of the city! WALK THE HILLS AND VIEW THE SIGHTS!
Sailing between Europe and Asia. I gained an overview of Istanbul, a fascinating city. The tour guide knew his history. I recommend this cruise.

Bosphorus. Amazing boat trip down the Bosphorus strait. It showed the difference between the European side and the Asian side of Turkey. The Houses were phenomenal , some were so elaborate and costly that it showed how people lived so well.
The boats also have a little cafeteria on board that you can buy goodies, if you need to.
Wow, beautiful Bosphorus. Wow, it is the most beautiful landscape in Istanbul in my opinion. Be sure to get on a ferry across Bosphorus. There are several ferries at Eminonu station.

Needed a narration. On our first afternoon in Istanbul, we walked down to the harbor to find a boat tour of the harbor. We took a smaller tour boat that cost 10 lire. The ride was 2 hours long and went to the second bridge across the Strait. The scenery was amazing and included palaces, mosques and castles. However, there was no narrative from the boat crew to tell about what we were seeing. Do the ride but try to find a tour boat the includes a narration about the sites.

Beautiful!. Breathtaking view from the Hilton Conrad! This made our stay more inviting and relaxing having this view out of our window from our room. interesting that many ships and boats use this waterway and that Istanbul can take pride that this makes the visit more pleasant. The weather was perfect and there was always a nice breeze.

Boat tour up the river.. A lot of the traditional commercials at the hotels and airport viewed boat tours costing from 50-70 euro. Don´t bother with those I would say. Over priced and if you don´t like the entertainment you are stuck there for a few hours. We talked with some other tourists about them and they had nothing good to say about it.Instead we went down to the harbour and took a really cheap tour instead, 10try/person. It was a quick tour up and down the river that took about 1½ hour that gave you a good chance to see some of the important buildings along the river.

Ferry To The Black Sea. We took the ferry from Eminonu to Anadolu Kavagi, then climbed to the top of the hill above the town to Yoros Castle, in order to view the Black Sea. The ferry takes about 1.5 hours from Istanbul and costs 15 TL, a great value. It makes a few stops (you can't get off if your destination is the final stop) and gives great views of the yalis along the way. Vendors sell very inexpensive tea and cups of the famous yogurt from Kanlica, which is also one of the ferry stops. The climb to Yoros Castle takes about 15 minutes, but the views are spectacular from the top and there are some cafes along the way. After visiting the castle you can either take the ferry back (same price, or you can buy a return for 25 TL) or you can take the 15A bus to Kanlica, then transfer to another bus which will take you to Uskudar, on the Asian side of Istanbul, where you can take one of the many ferries back to the European side. We chose to take the bus, as it allowed us to see a bit more of Istanbul. If you purchase an Istanbulkart, you can use it for the buses on the Asian side and the city ferries to return to the European side. It can also be used for the city buses, trams, metro, and the Golden Horn ferries.

Wonderful 1.5hr Boat Tour. I wish I could remember the name of the specific boat tour that we did, but it was $5 USD per person and was 1.5 hours long. It was a perfect July afternoon to take this tour in. The water was beautifully colored and the tour went all the way up the Bosphorus past both bridges. It was such a relaxing way to take in the history of Istanbul along the water!

Relaxing sailing on turbulent sea. Its only a small stretch of sea with separates Asia from Europe. Quiet turbulent waves on sea, gives stunning views of Blue mosque Galata Tower, galata bridge etc.... 2 hrs just passed like minutes... Worth taking for relaxing and also enjoying city views hazel freely.Different ferry companies offer different rate, usually sunset time ferry will be little expensive rest timing one can bargain for rate.
Spectacular Architecture!. It was a very cold mid-afternoon in February, but i thoroughly enjoyed seeing all of the palaces on the Bosphorus....

Scenic & Historical. Cruised the Bosphorus as part of an excursion from the Royal Princess. Our cruise was on a large boat that served a delicious meal & provided a running commentary about the sites, the history of the region, and the cultural differences about the two sides of the Bosphorus. Beautiful palaces & homes dot the shores. Interesting how the freighters have to alternate their travel through the Bosphorus due to the narrow passage. This has always been a strategic military & shipping lane.

Relaxing Boat Trip. We took the long public ferry that took us the whole way up to the Black Sea, where we got off and walked to be able to see the sea. It was worth the trip just to say we saw the Black Sea. The boat itself was very relaxing and there was good scenery the whole way up and back. My favorite were the large houses that were built on the water with their own docks and fancy swimming pools. Also, we went during the protests in Taksim Square, so this was the only way that we got to see some attractions such as Dolmabahce Palace. I would recommend that you be one of the first to buy your tickets in the morning, then stand in line to get on the boat so that you can sit on the sides of the boat for the best views.
Night cruise on the Bosphorus. Lovely little cruise down the Bosphorus, several types are available, just did the no frills not into belly dancers and dinners.

A two hour trip for little money. There are different places from where the ferries take of for the Bosphorus tour. The amount of places is matched with a variety of offers. My experience was to take a ferry from next to the galata bridge. The tour should not cost more than 10 lires. Be aware, i know colleagues who paid 15 Euros because the were not aware of the real price. The tour is nice, it takes you on an open roof ferry upwards and downwards the strait.

120 minute evening cruise - amazing value. We traveled up the afternoon and evening on the Bosphorous cruise. The entire trip was beautiful and so refreshing. Wish we could extend our stay in Istanbul. The cruise takes you to the Asian and European parts of Istanbul in one single trip. We paid 60 liras for three people for a round trip, so strike a bargain. Not to be missed.

LOVELY. As a local, the bosphorous is used by cargo ships, commercial boats, and as a means of going from the Asian side of Istanbul to the European side, and vice versa.For the tourist, their are multiple tours you can take, to enjoy the bosphorous. Choose wisely. Some are more worthwhile than others. There are private tours, group tours, and the public ferries.We took a group tour, enjoyed our time as the fresh air on deck, the scenery of Istanbul from the water, was extremely pleassant. We also took the public ferries, and found that just as pleasant.Well worth to go on the bosphorous, the views are spectacular, and cannot be seen from land

Loved it. My husband and I travelled up the Bosphorous to A. Kavagi. We had dinner at a lovely spot and took the ferry back to Eminou.This was such a pretty ride up the Bosphorous and is a must do for everyone visiting Istanbul. Cost is 25 Lira per person round trip. Don't miss out.
I feel like staying there.. Very good.if the cruise is little bit extended.we will be able to see more.dislike tour is little short.

Cruise the Bosporus. I went in summer. Get down to the quay as early as possible and avoid the weekend. The cost is cheap, just 12TL. Don't be talked into a more expensive tour. The ferries criss cross the Bosphorus and it's very relaxing. There is a simple commentary as you sail and there is usually a little fellow selling drinks and food. The whole trip is about one and a half hours.

90 minute cruise - amazing value. We took a 90 minute cruise on the Bosphorous as a whim while walking around Istanbul. What great value and low price combined with all the sights of the European and Asia sides, castles, forts and plenty of colour. A great introduction to Turkey and it's people. Good value.
Good location. The Ottoman Legacy hotel is close by the Golden Horn and the Galata Bridge and the ships that travel along the strait.

We did it twice it was so good. We accidently did this tour twice but it was a great thing we did. We got on one of the boats the first day we were in Istanbul thinking we were going on the ferry across. It was relaxing and cool and we saw many of the places that we we decided to see in the next few days. When we returned to Istanbul at the end of our Turkey tour, we did it again, only this time on purpose. The tour we were on had food available and it was very inexpensive and quite tasty!

Bosphorus Cruise. We went for a relaxing trip to bhosphorus on our 2nd day visit to Istanbul. We took a regular ferry from Eminonu to Anadolu Kavagi. After a tour of around 2 hrs we reach the fortress at the connection of Black sea. It is at this point wherein you see bhosphorus joining the black sea. The view from the fortress is panoramic. We saw lots of Russian oil tankers passing through the bhosphorus strait. One can also realized the strategic importance bhosphorus strait has played in the history of Turkey and Ottoman Empire. It is an important route connecting ports in Russia, Romania and Bulgaria. One can see lots of Turkish flags at the shore while you are on the cruise. There are two bridges build over the Bhosphorus strait which is an example of amazing engineering work. This excursion where in one actually travels between Asia and Europe are highly recommended whenever one visits Istanbul. The cruise is having a capacity of around 200 passengers. There are also televisions installed inside the cabins which will show Turkish news channels with English subtitles. Tea and snacks are served onboard. Anadolu kavagi is a small fishing village where the cruise stops for an hour or two. After touring the small village we had our lunch and boarded the ferry back to Eminonu.Bosphorus strait cruise is something one should not miss when in Istanbul
Beautiful!. Beautiful and historic...don't miss it. You can view it from ship or the coast. I loved seeing in at night on a tour...highly recommended.

Worthy of a Day. Having just completed a Black Sea cruise on Azamara Journey, we had really enjoyed the passage up and down the Bosporus on the ship. We had time in Istanbul after leaving the ship and, among other visits, decided to take a day cruise up the Bosporus to give us a closer look at the coastline and especially to get a taste of the Asian side.This was a good decision and we enjoyed a leisurely cruise hugging the coastline past Kanlica and back. Lots of fabulous Yalis to enjoy and many old summer palaces stand grandly along the shoreline. From any vantage point, this waterway is a great transit lane for many reasons.
Nice trip. We didn't bother to take any of the Bosphorus Strait tours that were being offered by peddlers in every corner. Instead we took a ferry to Asia with the natives.
Cruise. We did a cruise in the evening of the bosphouros had a great night did Turkish dancing saw the belly dancer and the show and ate till we were ready to explode reasonably priced
bosporous strait. Misleading. Suggests that the boats travel frequently. well they only travel when boat is close to full Too much chanting Bosporous Bosporous

Amazing views. We booked a night cruise which started an hour before sunset so we were able to enjoy the views during day and night and also the amazing sunset views.Dont miss it if you have enough days in Istanbul. For us, a two hours cruise was good enough. Some companies run a full day cruise, up into the Black Sea too
Boat tour. Do the boat tour, but not the expensive one.... Just take the ferry for 10 Lira.. About 5 USd... And it will take you around., leaves from Galata bridge

Nice Perspective. With Istanbul so large a city, a cruise on the Bosphorus is a great way to see the breadth of the city. It also offers a nice perspective on regional life. Go on a weekend when locals are out enjoying the river, parks and restaurants.

Magical Journey. Jump on a ferry at Eminonu and travel to Anadolu Kavagi. Europe to Asia in a couple of hours It puts in at litel parts on the way and there are wonderful views of he shoreline and the boat traffic up to the Black Sea. There is a pause of two or three hours at Anadolu Kavagi, a former fishing village turned into a tourist centre with restaurants and gift shops. There is a ruined castle that takes a half hour to climb up to but also a bus that allows you make your way back down the coast line if you have wearied of the boat. It is a full day's commitment but well worth it.

Do a ferry trip along the Bosphorus. Avoid the sales people who sell you expensive and short trips along the first part of the Strait (that is unless you are very short for time). Its better to take the local ferry The most popular way to explore the Bosphorus is by ferry at Eminonu from the Boğaz Hattı dock (dock No 3) daily at 10.35am. From June to Sept there are other sailings - best to check. The ferry stops at a number of stops along the way finishing at Anadolu Kavağı where you can get off, have a fresh fish lunch and then come back on the same boat. You can't get on and off the ferry along the way using the same ticket (like you would on a hop on hop off service). The boats fill up early in summer – especially on weekends – so its a good idea to buy your ticket and get aboard at least 45 minutes prior to departure to get a seat outside or next to a window. During the trip waiters will offer you fresh orange juice, tea and other drinks. At one of the stops they bring aboard fresh yoghurt from Kanlica. Its a must try. You can also go only as far as Sarıyer, on the European shore. Then make your way back to the city on the bus, stopping at Emirgan and Rumeli Hisarı on the return trip; its also possible to get off the bus at Ortaköy , Çırağan Palace or Dolmabahçe Palace on the return trip.

Lovely way to spend a day!. Took the cheap trip from near Galata Bridge and didn't bother with the audio guide. We sat outside and ensured we were on the shady side of the boat. Get there ahead of time because seats disappear fast! The trip is very pleasant with great views of life on the water. The fish restaurants which abound at the final destination, we avoided and instead climbed up to the castle - a short, fairly steep climb with somewhat hazy views from the top. A pleasant enough walk but not a 'must do' unless you want the exercise. There are eateries with good but extremely windy views serving ordinary Turkish cuisine.
Beautiful & fantastic panorama. It's amazing to be able to know that at the other side of the strait is already Greece ! Really beautiful & fantastic panorama, especially during the cruise.
This is a Must Do if you are in Istanbul. A day on a boat, great views, escape from the bustle of the city up to a fishing village near the black sea, a great lunch... What's not to like?
It is okay if you have nothing to do. It is okay if you have nothing to do because this tour is boring, no guide and takes a looooong time

A little of Europe & Asian.....worth n breathtaking. Explore both continents if you can as total different....plus do not forget the cruise. Much try the baked potatoes before going on aboard.....what a meal.

THE QUICK AND EASY WAY TO DO THE BOSPHORUS BY BOAT. After reading the Trip Advisor reviews, it seemed clear that the Bosphorus cruise can be a minefield, typically including slow coach rides to and from your hotel, followed by unadvertised stops at leather shops etc, a high price in the 35-45 Euro range and an indifferent guide commentary; so a 2-3 hour cruise actually ends up taking rather more than half your day and not being that good. Here's how to do it without these problems. First make your own way to the Eminonu docks, either by T1 tram or by taxi. Then find the IDO/Sehir Atlari office and ask for the Short Circle Bosphorus Cruise which departs at 14.30 daily. (They also do some longer cruises). You will be charged all of TL10 (4 Euros)!! The boat ride takes you up the Bosphorus as far as the second suspension bridge, and the only downside is the absence of a guide commentary but you get to see all the palaces and other sights. Its the ride the locals take so it cannot be bad!

Lovely views along the way. The 1 1/2 hour cruise on the Bosphorus is a memorable event. We viewed many palaces and homes along the way. We were served tea as we snapped hundreds of photos. This is a must do trip worth the money.

A good 2hours!!!. Trip was arranged by Andres,from our hotel,Arasta boutique,a big difference in the price and quality from the guys offering the same trip on the streets...A smooth pick up with a guide to the ferry,with a snax and beer bar on board,worth the cruise..n drop back to the hotel....

take the long cruise it's well worth it. I loved the boat trip along the bosphorus passing lots of palaces and stopping at pretty fishing villages.  beware of the prices in some of the fish restaurants at the end of the trip, out bill included prices which differed from the menu and items which we hadn't ordered. but this was just a small gripe on an otherwise fantastic day

love the bosphorus cruise. i took the round trip cruise. a really wonderful trip. the views along the strait is very beautiful.and Bosphorus strait is a landmark in Istanbul. i will never get bored looking at it.

Classic İstanbul. There is no better way to see this timeless city than ferry. Watching the city go by, bridges pass over you and cargo ships cruise on by is an experience savored by visitors and locals alike. Tip: wake up early on a weekday and take the commuter ferry from Eminönü near the Galata Bridge. You won't have any commentary or Top 40 pop music, but you find yourself having tea with a nice İstanbullu on their way to work.

See the europe and asia in the middle of this strait. I took a cruise for an about one hour, and it was woth for the money i paid for. Both europe and asia can been seen on each sides., with lots of archeological important monuments and other sky scrappers

Nice boat trip. It takes 1:30 h and worth every turkish lira ( 12 tl). The cruise takes you up to the sexond bridge that connect the 2 parts of Istanbul. You will see nice palaces and beautiful houses while enjoy the wonderful view.

Breathtaking views of the European side and Asian side.. Loved it. Beautiful views on both sides of the strait which bridge connects two continents.Two or three hour boat trip for only $6.00 per person is a real deal for an unforgettable experience.
Must do in Istanbul. Lovely 2.5 hour cruise on the Bosphorus. By far the most beautiful cruise I've been on. Snacks are available and there is plenty of seating.

Boat ride was beautiful.... Took boat/dinner cruise with a technical society... worth the comfort (breezy) and the views... I think this is something to do your first time to Turkey and without kids... otherwise, wander by foot/taxi and see the site close up & personal.

Take the turyol tours. The turyol ferries, they're provided by the government and are much cheaper then other tours around for the same experience. They cost 12 TL per person and go past the Bosphorus bridge and you get clear views of both the European and Asian sides of Istanbul, don't be tricked into paying 20 TL or more for another tour!
It is worth it. You get a good picture of this old metropolis with 14 million population. We definitely recommend this.

Awesome Bhosphorous Night Cruise. The Bosphorous evening cruise is must.The well lit bridge and the historical monuments on either sides of the Marmara sea during the night and the breathtaking sea breeze was awesome!

Great site for a short boat ride. We took a tour that included a boat ride that lasted about 1 1/2 hours. This is a great way to see the European and Asian sides of the City from the water. Night boat rides are available with dinner and shows. Totally recommend it!
dreamy. there are tours in the morning and they are fine but try out night tours. it's magical at night, loved it.

An Incredible Journey. If we're asked what had been our highlights in Istanbul, Bosphorus Strait is definitely one of them. Before we even came closer, we already felt the beautiful view from our hotel. This magnificent view definitely tempted us to go on the cruise on the second day we were day. After having such a hectic day, ending the day on the cruise, enjoying the sunset is not only romantic but it's also give a feeling that is impossible to describe by words. So beautiful and so magnificent.

Dont waste money on a tour guide. Simply hop onto one of the regular ferries and enjoy the sights and sounds. Get off at the Asian side for a luncheon on top of the hill and then visit the Summer Palace (Beylerbeyi Ottoman Summer Palace). This done, you may skip the Dolma Dache Palace.
Between 2 continents. I took a short cruise on this body of water and was magical...just thinking of all the history, all the boats that cruised thru here...

Ferry ride as opposed to boat tour. Much like taking the Staten Island ferry as opposed to an expensive boat tour around Manhattan, the ferries around the bosphorus offer a great alternative to conventional tours. With 6TL you can get a wonderful view of the both sides of Istanbul including some historical monuments. No guide, so read your books prior to embarking. Go from Galata bridge Harbour to Uskudar to Besiktas, back to the bridge.
Centre of the world. Best seen from a boat cruise, this is a must do when in Istanbul. Feels like one is at the centre of the world, between the continents!

Beautiful Views of Istanbul. It was wonderful to get an overview of Istanbul from Bosphorus Strait. The ride was very comfortable and you can get to see both the old & the new parts of Istanbul. You can do this cruise from the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia. Check it out you will not have any regrets.
Betwix 2 Continents!. Beautiful buildings and hoteks on both the continents of Asia and Europe.It was very exciting to see 2 continents especially for my kids aged 5 and 9 years.

Amazing!. We took a ferry from Europe to Asia (how cool is that!) and it was so beautiful! The ferry is public transport btw. It will be much cheaper than taking a cruise and much more authentic. So make sure you buy Istanbul card and top it up. It is a good idea to take some bread with you to feed the seagulls. We took the ferry at sunset - the view of Istanbul is incredible!

You must do this when in Istanbul. Europe of your left, Asia on your right...Black Sea ahead...The whole layered history of this ancient city begins from the water...so you MUST do a Bosphorus cruise to experience Istanbul from the water. You can ride the ferries, hop on a tour or book a cruise...just do it!
2 hours of great cruising for 10 tL. So cheap and such a great way to get some perspective on Istanbul from the water.Get tickets at dock

Lots of options. We took two river cruises, one in the day and one at night. Both very different experiences. You can find river cruises in Sultanamet, near the ferry boat terminals of Eminonu, or several other seaside locations. We paid 40TL for the day cruise (about 2 hours) and only 10TL for the night cruise (about 1 hour) from Basiktas.
Beautiful Bosphorus. We were fortunate to both sail on the Bosphorous, and eat delicious dinners overlooking the clear blue waters. The boat tour was well worth the time and was a reasonable price.

Relaxing cruise on the Bosphorus. We had an excellent cruise on the Bosphorus today, booked through the Blue Brothers Travel Agency. Unlike many tours, which seem to be part boat, part bus, this was four hours on the water, cruising up the Bosphorus almost to the second bridge, then back down and up the Golden Horn. We stopped off for an hour at the top of the Horn to take a cable car up to Pierre Loti to see fantastic views of the city and have an ice cream or tea.Our guide Mali was excellent; friendly and knowledgeable. After coming down on the cable car he suggested a side trip to see the Eyüp Sultan mosque complex before walking back to the boat. Also, it was on a smaller boat that could go closer to shore and wasn't crowded like some of the large ones we saw. And they pick you up at your hotel and bring you back. All for 20 euros!

Worth a short cruise. The Bosphorus is such an integral part of the regional history that you should be part of it when visiting Istanbul. There is an inexpensive cruise with audio guides you can take just meters from the Eminonu stop.

A Bosphorus-Cruise is a MUST SEE !. A cruise on the bosphorus is just amazing. There are cruises which last between 2 to 4 hours I guess. You get a lot information about Istanbul´s history and its just beautiful to see Istanbul from the Sea. Dont forget a jacket it can get pretty windy on the bosphorus! :) You can get cool softdrinks on the ships/ferries or drink some tea.

Must Go !!. I and my family had taken the Bosphorus dinner cruise which was simply amazing with great weather and spent great time together. It takes you around the city and passes the bridge with awesome views and lights. It also had an open view sitting where we enjoyed watching the traditional dance performances and belly dance shows after the dinner. They had good quality of food with unlimited soft drinks. Its surely must visit and good experience.
vancouver tourist. you go from Asia to Europe in no time we took the boat and city tour well worth the money spent as we also stopped at a palace and so it from inside incredible

Take a Boat Ride Up the Bosperous. A half-day boat trip up the Bosperous is a wonderul way to spend time when in Istanbul. Wonderful homes and palaces line the lower end of the strait and typical wooden houses hang on the Asian shore. Of course, you pass under the two bridges which link Asia to Europe and--at he northern end--you are almost in the Black Sea. Only downside--washrooms on these Turkish tour boats tend to be much less than attractive!

Interesting views. This was a little disappointing because of the boat we were on. Take the bigger boat if you can as they are much nicer. The views were good and it was interesting to see the differences in architecture between the Europe and Asia sides of the strait.
one way trip. We took the ferry up one way and then took the local buses back stopping at Riva on the Black Sea for a swim first.Good to get out of the city if you have some spare time.

Nice Cruise. We enjoyed a wonderful cruise in the Bosphorus that took us almost 3 hours, the views of the two continents are amazing, the weather was also nice and we really enjoyed our time over there.

Strait Cruising. Went on a cruise boat along the Golden Horn near the Galata Bridge, along the Bosphorus Strait passing the Sultanahmet area viewing Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia on the right and viewing the Sea of Marmaras along that way too. Carry up the strait and you see both sides of Istanbul (Europe and Asia) and passing Dolmabahce Palace, Rumelli Fortress and various foreign consultes/embassies along the way before going under the Bosphoros Bridge. The boat carried on a bit further before doing a U-turn. We managed to see the Bosphorus Dolphins swimming along the river before the boat stopped near Dolmabahce Palace, which was the final destination. The cruise took around 1.5 hours altogether and it is worth it.

Take the ferry!. There is a 25TL ferry that works its way from Eminonu to Anadolu Kavagi and back. Take it! You will have an incredibly scenic ride up and down the Bosphorus so be sure to bring your camera. You can stop in Anadolu Kavagi for lunch or one of the other stops. It makes for a truly memorable day.

great cruise up the River. We took the Bosphorus cruise recommended to us at the hotel, and had an amazing time. It was a beautiful day, not a cloud in the sky. Favorite part? Hearing the call to prayer ring off the hills.

Too Long, Need Better Guides for Riders. We took the large boat up to the end of the top of the Strait, stayed for lunch, and then returned. The problem is simply that while the company gives you a guide with the various buildings etc. identified, we were absolutely unable to identify many of the so-called points of interest. If you can get a boat with an active guide, then it might be much better. For us it took up most of the day, and just was only average from the point of view of getting to actually see and understand the different buildings, palaces, etc.

Nice boat cruise. It was nice to see the area from the water. Unfortunately we were not able to hear or understand the commentary pointing out the sights along the way. A one hour trip that would be improved by a guide.
great view. It's very beautiful. You can see Asia and Europe at the same time. The tour is little too long, but you can have a different perspective from Istanbul.

Beautiful!. We did a 2 hr cruise on the bosphorus. Don't be conned into tours that cost 15 euro or something. Along the front is the main ticket area and we paid 10TL each. This cruise takes you from the Eminonu point to the 2nd bridge and back.You can pay 7.5TL for an audio guide. It was interesting at first, but at times was slighly boring. Worth just sitting on the boat and enjoy the views!!

This was the highlight of my Istanbul trip. "There is always the Bosphorous", says Orhan Pamuk. It refreshes the city with a cool breeze in summer, and washes away the fatigues spirits withs its blueness, vibrancy and sheer beauty.Every tour on a boat is worthwhile, and every view, on every day, is uplifting.And yes, to travel to the Black Sea, and watch the water suddenly opening up ahead of you as it nears, is, to me, a moving experience I haven't quite go the bottom of yet....

Do it yourself. A must to-do in your itinerary for Istanbul. It was a romantic ride with nice buildings and monuments on either side on the channel.There were lot of options of paid tours, but its my advice that you do-it-yourself. Take a tram to Eminonu Tram station and go to nearby Kadikoy pier, there are Govt. Boats/ ferries and Private Boat (Both are equally good, we missed the Govt. one and took the private), these private operators would be calling 5 TL per person. Both of us completed the ride in just 10 TL, they have paid coffee, tea and snacks on board. Grab a seat towards left if possible.Enjoy!!!

Go for the Evening Tour. Go for a Tour organised by the guides by the Sulthanamet. They charge a bit More, I paid 10 Euro for it. Try to stay with the tour guide when he takes you to the boat and try and get a seat on the top deck from where you can take good photos. Sit on the left side to get a good view of both the European and Asian side. Go for the evening tour when it is cooler. the wind tends to get cold one hour in. So take pleasure in it.. ;)

Boat Trip. So important to see the water from a boat. My husband and I opted for a smaller boat that was less commercial [no music or history lesson]....still a wonderful activity to spend while there....
In nice weather, a must se. Parts tourism and parts old city, this waterway is a beautiful place to see the local culture, with waterfront restaurants and parks

very interesting. Getting onto Bosphorus cruise was quite an experience. Having Europe on one side and Asia on the other is unique. I could not tell any difference between the architecture of the two continent.I learned that the real estate on both side are sky high expensive. Believe or not - the starting price is$10 million in USD!
Take a tour boat. We had a great experience on one of the tour boats that run from Karakoy to near the Black Sea. 1.5 hours each way and a nice hike and lunch at the far end. I recommend it.

Nice way to relax (boat trip). We did our homework and found the "official" 2½ hour tour - which only cost 10 turkish lire - compared to all the street sellers which tried to sell us the same tour for 25 euro! The tour was relaxing and gave a nice view of Istanbul and some of the palaces from the sea side.

Busy. We went for a couple boat tours of the Bosphorus strait looking at the land sites on the European and Asian sides. The strait is so busy with ferries, cargo ships, passengers ships and personal craft. Great adventure

Boat tour of Bosphorus. My wife, two children and I took a tour of Bosphorus and it was very nice. Price was around $6 for adults and children free. Not too busy and the landscape from the water was truly amazing. You get a great views of Istanbul from the water. I would definitely go again, if I was to return to Istanbul.

Straits of Time. Make the time to take a boat ride on the strait. We were fortunate to have a private boat for our trip. Had lunch at a local fish restaurant with freshly caught mullet. You will be impressed by the history you go by and by the tanker traffic in the strait.

Bosphorus Strait. The Bosphorus Strait a body of water that separates Europe side of Istanbul from the Asian side of Instanbul. You can take several ferry boats to different landing, depending on where you are going. It, too, has allot of history along the shores.

Amazing views from the 2 hour boat trip - highly recommended. It was lovely to take a trip on the strait after a busy morning sight seeing and when the day was at it's hottest. I hadn't expected to see so many amazing houses & residences alongside. There are also grand palaces & mosques to be seen and of course the Bosphorus Bridge. We sat at the back on the middle deck which worked well as it was less windy there & sheltered from full sun with great views

Boat Trip. Make sure you go on one up the Golden Horn and the Bosphorous - they are selling them in Sultanahmet Square - good value "discounts" for couples/groups. One of the highlights of our time there.
Fantastic Boat Trip around Bosphorus and Golden Horn. Great Boat trip around the Bosphorus and Golden Horn, we hired a boat at the harbour for £40 per hour (between 6 people) it was amazing.

A Must Do Tour. There are a number of ferries that conduct tours of the Bosphorus. We went on the boat that was run by the Ferry System. It was a large boat and it provided a 90 minute tour and provided a narration on the points of interest. It was an enjoyable and inexpensive experience.

A unique opportunity. Well worth a trip down the straight, watching the numerous craft of various sizes, including seagoing freighters. We used the public transport, and took a 2 hour trip for 10 Lira. It enabled us to take in the scale of the Bosphorous, and a unique opportunity to sail between the shores of Europe and Asia.

Busy Body of water. Fascinating place to spend a few hours in nice weather. A few hours on the water gives a visitor a gorgeous view of the beautiful structures on both the Asian and European coasts and a full appreciation of the variety of maritime traffic that uses this strategic waterway.

BOSS-phorus. This is a must do activity. If any of you are having trouble finding eminonu (where the only official istanbul cruise takes place) its the first ferry entrance to the right of the galata bridge when you are in sultanhamet. Dont pay more than 10tl. For £3.33p you would be silly not to do this. Its a shame we didnt manage a bosphorus night cruise as the bridge looked stunning lit up at night. Dont be affraid to let this activity take 2-3 hours out of your day, istanbuls beauty is best witnessed from the bosphorus strait

The architecture on this waterway was incredible. Loved the castles and noble homes and the beautiful bridges and the view was stunning. The boat wasn't crowded and the commentary was very interesting

Cool Breeze, Great Views. Its a must see to enjoy how the strait divides the two sides of Istanbul. Especially by night, the festive atmosphere can be felt. If you are on a tight budget, then go to Eminonu, and there you can get a 1 hour tour on one of the good ferries, for 10 TK Liras ($5), which is a steal. Otherwise the touristic guides are a bit of a steal and charge about $25 for a 2 hour ride.

Relaxing cruise. Enjoyed the Strait on a boat as part of the tour organized by Turista Tour company. The boat goes up to the second bridge connecting Europe to Asia. The boat has 2 decks with a small bar on the bottom deck, which serves tea & drinks.It was nice to have the Guide point out the historical buildings & explain significant history about each landmark by the waterside. Its a nice way to get to know the 2 continents that are separated by the area known as the Golden Horn.There are many boats/cruises available & many tour companies offer different types to enjoy the Strait. Some boats go up to the Black Sea & allow tourists to dive into calm waters. There are dinner cruises available too.

Gorgeous but avoid the evening dinner cruise at all costs!. The Bospherous is beautiful, day and night, but find a better way to enjoy it than on a dinner/dance cruise. A truly horrifying experience that left us wishing for an iceberg to suddenly appear. Don't say you weren't warned.

Gorgeous!. We took a long and leisurely boat tour of the waterways separating the two sides of Istanbul (Asian & European). During which I was regaled, by my then fiancé's father, with the story of the Ottoman Turks carrying their ships over land to drop them into the water (which we were presently traversing), in order to help conquer Constantinople!

Get up the Bosphorus for lunch. Don't just look at the Bosphorus, get on it. One of the best things we did was catch a ferry to Anadolu Kavagi, a small village on the Bosphorus at the mouth of the Black Sea. It's a 90 min trip from Eminonu and costs TL25 return. The 1030 departure gets you there in time for lunch (dine on the water or walk up the hill to the old castle and check out the Black Sea before choosing a restaurant with a higher vantage point) and then get the 1500 back to Istanbul. It's a great day out!

Relaxing cruise!. Brilliant cruise. It is very good for family and couples. You will certainly enjoy this cruise. we went on the 2hr short cruise which i felt was enough time to get a good feel of the place. A must in istanbul

Multiple options for seeing the strait. There are multiple options. The cheapest is the 10 lira cruise to the second bridge and back (about 2 hours). There is no guide, but it is cheap and leaves once an hour. Find the boat by the ferry cruise terminal. The ferry service runs a similar tour for 25 euro, but only in the afternoon. Private operators run guided tours for around 10 euro. The ferry service also runs a full tour (5 hours, roughly, including a lunch stop) that leaves around 10:30. The Yalis and palaces are nice to see from the water and it's a nice break from the crowds and traffic.

don't book from your hotel -- go down to the Galata Bridge. These cruises start from docks located on both sides of the Galata Bridge. Our hotel suggested a tour that was around $80 per person.We booked a shorter and more informal cruise for 12 TL per person ($7.00 or so).The boat took us out of the Golden Horn and up into the Bosphorus.It was jammed with tourists of all nationalities snapping photos all along the way.Totally worth it -- a fun afternoon.We hopped aboard after enjoying lunch at a fish restaurant on the Galata Bridge. Then -- when we got back, we toured the old Spice market which is right there.
Lovely way to spend afternoon. We did a river cruise on the Bosphorus, the boat was clean, it had just the people that were on our coach tour was was lots of place's to sit

Extended Bosphorus tour on the public ferry/25TY. A very inexpensive day out. To take a tour of the Bosphorus on a cloudless sunny day and sit aboard the ferry as it slowly eases its way down the European side from the Galata Bridge to the Black sea is to witness history unfold. Six hours with three stopping in Anadolu to climb to the summit of the mount and stare 360 degrees from a Byzantine castle used once as a lookout, what could be more wonderful?

A must go trip. The Bosphorus tour can be the best part of your journey if you choose the right tour and fine weather accompany you.Important hints:- There are many fake yours, be aware!- Cost of tours are depend on their destinations and services. some of them will let you visit some places on both Asian and European side on foot and some of them just show you those places from the ship.- A short Bosphorus tour (at the moment) will cost you 10 TL.- A complete Bosphorus tour (at the moment) will cost you 25 TL at most! unless they serve you drinks or meal.- There are special tours which will let you to swim during the tour and also have some sun seats on their ships.- There are another kind of tours which will show you both Golden horn and Bosphorus with a single ride but normally they are very time limited and expensive.- You can take the tour in day or night but night tours are a little more expensive because usually they will serve you with drink and meal and a dance party.My Advise:I tried some of these tours and the best one was a short tour between Bosphorus bridge and Sultan Mehmet-II bridge which took a little more than 1 hour for 10 TL.You can find them in about 500 meters distance west of Bosphorus bridge.Don't forget to buy a "Kumpir" before getting on the ship. Then get on the ship go to the second floor in front, find some pillow, lie down, eat your Kumpir and enjoy the ride (You can buy additional drinks on the ship).

Beautiful!. Our tour included a trip on the Bospherus. We went over to the Asian side and visited an old "Yalli" which was fascinating. The Bospherus is exciting to be on--many years of history and many different kinds of buildings. Was great to see many fishermen as well!

Busy but great views. Well worth a boat trip as you get great views of both the Asian and Europe side of Istanbul. Well worth doing the touristy boat trip as you get the captain's commentary which is quite interesting.
amazing. this is amazing above all if u live it from a boat. it's historic, pcituresque and very romantic. i just love it

A routine but picturesque little cruise. A cruise on the Bosphorus is included in most package tours and is a good way to get the lie of the land of Istanbul and see both continents of the city. The commentary tends to be indecipherable and pretty rudimentary so you may find yourself tempted to wander to other quieter parts of the boat.

Wish We'd Had More Time. This is an excellent trip. We would have liked to spend more time on the water, but we were limited in the time we had. the 2-hour trip was sufficient to see most of the sites along the Strait, but investigating the sites would have been better.

ferry ride around Bosphorus. The weather plays a big part in the activity - we were on the ferry for about 3.5 hours and it was really too long for what you see. There are some interesting sites but on balance there are better ways to spend your time in Istanbul.
Bosphorus Strait. Boat trip down the Bosphorus is well worth doing. Very enjoyable, would recommend going towards sundown. Would have liked commentary on journey to point out places of interest

The maritime deliniation line between Asia and Europe.. I took two separate cruises on the Bosphorous. One cruise line focused mostly on providing food and drinks. The other outfit was more suitable for those interested in a historical/cultural lecture. Ask what you are getting before purchasing tickets.
Take the ferry trip from Eminonu to the end and climb up to the old fort. Great views of Istanbul. Arrive 9:30ish at Eminonu dock to get tickets -- a popular trip -- see Rick Steves Istanbul book

A very busy yet nice Strait to explore. Bosphorus is very busy Strait that straddles between Europe and Asia and connects to the black sea. It is a vest body of water crowded with all size of boats. The best way to explore the strait is by tour ferry. There are a few ferries that offer a short tour from the Eminonu piers. We took a 1 hour shorter boat tour for 10 lira. There are longer tours for up to 26 Lira. Sited at the top deck, one can just relax and enjoy the busy strait. It was amazing to see the mosques, bridges and other structures from the water. It is more amazing to see the boats maneuvering around each other. A cheaper option to the tours is catching the public passenger ferry. It is cheaper but unlike the tour ferry, the public ferry makes lots of stops. Either way, on a nice clear day, this would be a highly recommended activity in Istanbul.

bosphorus boat trip. do the boat trip on an early eveniing when your feet are tired, you should sit on the the left hand side of the boat and you can get tea and cold drinks on the boat. Lovey at sunset. There is no commentry but we enjoyed it anyway
Loved the Ferry Ride!. I never tire of the busy Bosphorus River. We got off at an old fishing village for lunch and had a wonderful view of the river.
So much to see. The strait is a beehive of activity, with so many boats travelling on the water. The view is forever changing and there is so much to see.

Evening boat tours were worth it. I would recommend taking an evening boat tour as you get to see Istanbul by day and night. There are many boat tour vendors by the Blue Mosque. You can get good deals, but don't hagle too much. Many of the sellers earn income solely on a commission, but also lose their jobs if they make no sales, so many will often sell tours making no commision just to keep their jobs. I am an excellent hagler and later found out just how little these guys make. My salesperson, for example, made no money off of me though he spent about half an hour answering my questions.

Take a ferry to Harem. Take a ferry to Harem, walk down the seeside. Pick a nice restaurant to have some dinner and see the sunset. Then take the ferry back just before it's going to be totally dark. The lights of Istanbul are beautiful!
Boat trip to really see how other half live. Great ride on modern ship with commentary about two hours long good value for money and great for photo's

What is venice compared to the bosphorus!. Venice is a city of old buildings in dirty water. The bosphorus is wonderful, it joins Europe and Asia. The crammed canals of Venice are hardly romantic or appealing compared to the heart of the bosphorus. The buildings and sea-side mansions prove to make Venice's squashy houses look weak. Consider going to the bosphorus next time!

Not to be Missed!. When you are in Istanbul, don't miss a cruise along the Bosphorus Straits. It's quite a narrow strait so even for a person prone to getting sea sick, I found it very calm. Many interesting sites along the way and a lovely picture taking opportunity. We went in early June and took at about 3 pm. It would be rather hot at mid day. If going in the evening, be prepared with a wind cheater as it can get chilly with the wind blowing.

Great to go on a cruise. The cruise around the Bosphorus is on every itinerary of someone visiting Istanbul.... the view of the strait of the bridges, mosques especially in the evening is beautiful...

Bosphorus: very beautiful. The Bosphorus, Sea of Marmara, The Black Sea and the Golden horn are waterways that are connected to each other and give Istanbul its unique beauty and position as the only city to straddle Asia and Europe. In less tahn 10 minutes you can go into eithr side of Istanbul via 2 bridges on the Bosphorus.The sights cannot be described: a must see. Istanbul is the most beautiful City ever.

If you didnt visit this then you missed it. An amazing light show on the bridge and beautiful surroundings on the turnatour (orange colored cruise ship) which had a beautiful ambience, good food and excellent belly dancing show.The Boshporus strait is a must see from the cruise and the Topkapi palace terraces, breathtaking view of the sea.

Beautiful views.. We cruised through the Bosphorus Strait one evening on a cruise and then walked along it later whilst visiting Istanbul. The views are ever changing, boats, people diving for mussels, lights on the bridge, the buildings. Well worth doing.

Take the public ferry. We took the local ferry up the Bosphorus to the Black Sea. It was a lovely trip and the cost was great. We stopped at the end and got off for lunch and climbed the hill to a fort. We then returned to the town where the ferry docked. We had excellent ice cream before catching the ferry back to Istanbul.

GREAT WAY to get an overview of Istanbul from the boat on the water. We got on a simple ferry for about an hour or so and went up several miles; did not need an all day tour. Got off on the Asian side and didn't spend long. Seeing the palaces now converted to hotels or the wealthy residents with their mansions on the water was amazing.
Short and relaxing!!. If you want to take a short and relaxing trip, just go to Bosphorus trip...Don't buy from street agents there, directly go to the harbor and buy it cheaper there...

Day or Night Boat trip. We took a day trip up to the black sea, very nice guided tour in Bosporus and also Istanbul from the sea. However the tour at night was not that good. the Dancer was silly and her actions after the performance was pathetic.
A different perspective. Take an hour boat ride on the Bosphorus. The views are lovely and one has a chance to think about and absorb all that you've seen during your visit to Istanbul

Charter a boat and go up the Bosphorous. This is was real highlight -- see Istanbul from the water -- head up the Bosphorous and see the palaces, the fortress, the beautiful homes, the boats, the energy of the Strait and the city. Any trip to Istanbul need a Bosphorous Strait trip -- even for a couple hours.

Ferry on the Bosphorus is a nice way to spend an afternoon.. We took the ferry for the afternoon trip that lasts about an hour and a half. It is nice to see Istanbul from the water and to feel a breeze on a hot day. It was not crowded when we went so we had a choice of seats on the ferry. After a couple of days of walking this is a nice restful day.

a great way to spend a day. the public excursion ferry service from Eminonu to Anadolu Kavagi is the easiest and cheapest way to accomplish the picturesque scenery filled journey. Get to the boat early though if you are wanting an outside seat - on the day we went, half an hour before wasn't early enough, and leave plenty of time to find the ticket office and queue.The boat has basic comforts - take plenty of water, snacks and lunch with you, but you can get drinks and snacks on board. Where the ferry stops near the Black Sea there are plenty of restaurants - along with plenty of their touts.Up the hill from the village is the remains of a Byzantine castle/fort, which is well worth a visit and there is spectacular views over the Bosphorus and Black Sea from there.A great way to spend a day and it was only 25 lire each return.

Best views from the smaller boats. Take a two hour ride up to where the Black Sea meets the Strait for much less than the larger cruises. Pleasant way to relax and cool down, take photos. Going later in the afternoon provides changing light behind the city structures and life along the bridge as the colored lights all come on.

beauty.... a must for everybody is the cruise it shows u the both europeanand asian sde of the city. Also u can see most of the monuments from the sea side. looks beutiful a must for all the travellers

Beautiful cruise. We made a half day afternoon cruise on the Bosporus. It was a beautifull trip we have seen parts of the Europeen an Asien sites of the city and made a 'pits stop' at Maidens Tower. The guide was enthousiast and told a lot about the buildings.
Gourgeous. The strait is just a perfect place for an hour boat tour or for a whole day visit. I did both and I was mesmerized with all the beauty of that place.

Take a ferry to save money by 90 percent. Ferry ride is minus guide and dance and dinner but worth for your money as it takes only 3 to 4 turkish leera in comparison to regular guided tour cost of 50 to 60 tl. Plan ur tour in early morning and once again in late night to see Istanbul by night magnificent views of all historic buildings and bridge connecting Asia and Europe.
I recommend night bosphorus tour. Night time you can see all the city covered in lights, best time to book a cruise is at sunset. You can make nice pictures.

Nice way to spend a beautiful afternoon.. Took a ferry from the European side to the Asian side (Kadikoy) to have lunch at an Ottoman place recommended by my hotel (Seraglio). Beautiful views all around, of bridges, the old town (Sultanahmet, where I was at the shore that morning) and the "Asian" side which is somewhat newer. If I had time I would have taken more ferry rides to more places. Very cheap way to get views of both sides of the Bosphoros. Did not take a special cruise so can't compare the ferry, but the ferry was cheap and fun and you can pay attention to whatever you want.

Can't Get Enough. I have family on the Asian side of Istanbul. Since many of the attractions are on the European side, the ferries across the Bosphorus give you short but scenic cruise. The sheer number of vessels plying the waters amaze you as you cross. Of course, you have unique views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Just stay on the ferry and go back and forth.

Be careful which boat trip you book. A trip on the Bosphorus is a nice way to spend a couple of hours. However, you really should avoid booking with the people who are selling tickets around the Blue Mosque for 15 Euros per trip. We went for the 4 o-clock sailing and were instructed to assemble at the Blue Mosque at the appointed time. We were then merged with over 200 other people and paraded down to a remote pier well away from the main harbour where we were herded onto a boat with plastic chairs set around long tables in the downstairs cabin. the staff then tried to sell us over priced drinks and the trip which was supposed to be two hours turned out to be about one hour and twenty minutes. The whole thing was a most unpleasant experience.DO THE TRIP BUT BOOK EITHER THROUGH YOUR HOTEL OR DOWN ON THE HARBOUR WHERE YOU CAN SEE THE BOAT.

Busy!. A traffic jam on the Bosphorus is not very easy, as it is large and wide, but there is a LOT of traffic on there, both ferries and commercial ships. Impressive and amazing - and so is the trip across, from Asia to Europe in 20 minutes...

A Great Trip on the Ferry. Last week my spouse and I took the municipal ferry from Eminonu to Anadolu Kavagi, a small fishing village on the Bosphorus, but just a stone's throw from the Black Sea. While the ferry is old, it was a comfortable trip. We had arrived at the ferry thirty minutes early so we were able to get seats on the outside of the ferry. The views of both the European side of the Bosphorus and the Asian side were tremendous. It was a warm, sunny day, and the trip could not have been nicer. The ferry has a large snack bar and bathroom facilities at the mid part of the boat. Unfortunately, the bathroom was of the Turkish variety. The name of the ferry lines is Sehir Hatlari. In the summer there are two trips: one starts at 10:35 a.m. and the other at 1:35 p.m. The cost is 25 Turkish lira ($13.18 USD) per person. The trip each way takes about one and one-half hours. The lay over in Andolu Kavagi is two hours (not three hours as is listed on Sehir Hatlari web sight.) This is enough time to walk up the hill from town and look at the very interesting castle built by the Ottomans in the 15th century. You can also take a cab. The view of the Bosphorus on one side and the Black Sea on the other can not be beat.We rented the audio guide for 10 Turkish lira. It did not work very well going up the Bosphorus and not at all on the return trip. We asked for a refund, or at least an adjustment, but the ferry lines refused. I get the impression that all sales, and rentals, in Istanbul are final.The boat stops at three other towns before Andolu Kavagi, so make sure what town it is before you get off of the boat. My spouse and I did not so after the gang plank had been removed and the ferry was slowly departing, we jumped from the dock onto the ferry with the approval of the deck hands. This is Turkey after all.

a must when you visit Istanbul. we were travelling with a large group of 35 persons and we had a private boat trip organised on the Bosphorus. The weather was absolutely nice and we have really enjoyed it. It is certainly a very nice way to discover another part of Istanbul. very nice views. Definitevely a must !

Take the ferry, not a cruise. Save yourself money and simply take the Bosphorous ferry, rather than a boat cruise. No loudspeakers, no music, just the splash of the water against the boat, and the absolute beauty of the water and shoreline. Tip: on the return journey, get off at the Ortakoy stop to visit this neighbourhood which used to be a simple fishing village. It is touristy but still quite charming. You can't get back on the ferry to return to Istanbul port, so just take any bus that is going to Taksim square.

Pictures a MUST. I was fortunate to travel here when it was sunny, hot (but not too hot), basically a perfect time for picture-taking. The only thing is that my camera could not capture how beautiful the water sparkles in the sunlight.Definately do a ferry ride!

memorable. A boat trip up the Bosphorus is a must. You can take a ferry to the top, where it joins the Black Sea, and enjoy a fabulously fresh fish lunch of dinner at one of the many restaurants. Or hop off at one of the little villages on the way. Memorable views.

It's nice. We had a tour called Half Day Asiatic Experience in Istanbul where we went across the strait, and even though we did like to visit the Fenerbahce Park, with those marvelous views of the city, the whole area left me like 'meh'. I much preferred the Istanbul across the bridge, Sultanahmet and that area. The other side it's just like any other modern town, full of very nice commercial and residential areas but we didn't feel that authentic and ancient charm that we liked so much across the bridge. But we love history and archaeological everything, so maybe if you enjoy shopping then you would probably like the Asian side of Istanbul much better because the whole town is filled with luxury brands shops.

The night cruise may be better. It was blowing cold in April & sitting on the outside deck was freezing. The sights shown were amazing & the Mix if Asian & European is really seen here. If its not too cold, maybe night vews are more spectacular. Good cafe in the lower deck... serving snaks & coffee avl. to buy

Beautiful Oasis. enjoyed the trip to Bosphorus Bridge exciting to get away from the hussle n bustle of city life and escape to the waters edge. quite interesting as the bridge connect the Asia and Europe continents. my 2yr son was very amused by the fisherman along the waters edge and the boats....must see!

Most Enjoyable Part of Istanbul. Our tour group got a private boat to ourselves and spent almost two hours cruising the entire Bosphorus, starting from the European side and ending on the Asian side. Very enjoyable, relaxing and scenic. Lots of good photos. Had Turkish tea or coffee on the boat (for money).

Great. It's a must to do! Yet, it's not as exciting as you'd think. Yes, it's great to see the landscape on bothEuropean and Asian sides, but I was happy I chose the 1.5 round trip. A longer one might be a bit boring...

An entrancing ocean traveling experience. Traveling to Istanbul, Turkey from the Mediterranean cities of Europe allows an enchanting experience Turing the ocean transit. As you enter the Bosporus Straits you begin to notice the striking national flag of Turkey red with the white crescent moon and star. The farther you transit into the straits you are struck by the places that "are" history, like Gallipoli. You are beginning to "see" history. As you enter Istanbul aboard ship, within the Bosporus, you can see and experience the vibrant ocean and inland water traffic that makes this city something different.Consider a additional boat tour further into Istanbul's Bosporus channel where the Bosporus narrows to it's closest point. Europe is on one side and Asia is on the other. Views of the beautiful homes, hotels and waterside restaurants facing the water will reward your choice to experience this short tour. Enjoy!

A must !. Any visit to Istanbul should include a trip along the Bosphorus - after busy attractions on land this can be an oasis of calm as well as beauty - you see the City of Istanbul from a different perspective - the Bosphorus is so wide you go up one side ( European) and come back the other ( Asian) - it must be very cooling in the summer and just invigorating in May !

Don't Miss the Bosphorus Cruise. Don't miss a Bosphorous cruise! I thought it would be 'just a boat ride' but, it surely is not. It opens the heart of Istanbul to you and makes you understand much better the unique nature and history of the city. But... the weather has to be good! Postpone it if bad weather is forecast... When the weather is right, as it was for us in May, it is eye opening and hugely enjoyable!

sailing up the Bosphorus. With our guide, Esra Canturk, we took the local ferry up the Bosphorus. I hadn't fully appreciated that the city limits of Istanbul, stretched its entire length. It was a lovely way to spend a few hours and let us see the many sides and sites of a fantastic city.

Don't try the fish sandwich!. After having been assaulted by a million people trying to sell us boat rides on the Bosphorus. we took the tram to check it out, and found it very inexpensive at the dock...I think ours was 12TL pp for 1.5 hrs cruise...which was plenty. Afterward we went under the Galata bridge to get the fish sandwich from the boats..BIG MISTAKE! The fish is not Turkish, but mackerel from Norway, with bones (not good on a sandwich) It STINKS and won't come off your fingers even after washing 3 X. Tastes gross. We did try the pickles and they were good though.

Great 2hours boat tour. We went with a private boat, albeit a very large one. We used our guide book as the boat tour did not give any commentary. Very good price but you may want a larger tour with commentary.

Don't go when the weather is hazy or foggy. On our short visit to Istanbul, we were constantly pressed by guys on the street selling Bosphorus Tours. Some of them seemed reasonable value - but the weather was quite hazy, following an early morning fog. We were assured there was no problem. However, once we paid our money and set off, we ran into thick fog after a very short distnce and had to turn back.Did we get our money back ? Not a chance!

Boat trip. We were disappointed that what we thought would be a day on the boat turned out to be about two hours - with the rest of the itinerary done by coach. It also included a ludicrous visit to a fur and leather emporium, including a feeble fashion show. Our fault for not looking at the itinerary carefully enough.

The weather spoiled it. Such a shame the cloudy and windy weather did not allow us to have a full view of the margins of the Bosphrous Strait. Still, we could see the fortress, the sultan' home and the many mosques of Istambul. It was so cold that three 'chay' each was not enough. Be aware: going to the toilet can be a problem, unless you do not mind aiming at a hole on the ground... Food for thought!

Day trip to the Black Sea. This trip we took was using the government boat to the end of the strait from the golden horn to the Black Sea for 10 TL PP, great deal, since its a clean boat and on time.....the fishing village we ate was excellent with a visit to the old fort overlooking the beautiful vies of Black Sea!

A windy, but relaxing cruise. We went on a cruise ship (the large one) from Istanbul to Anadolu Kavagi, where we also had lunch. The cruise was very interesting, as well as the bosphorus strait itself. What I liked was that they had an onboard cafe, or shop, where you could buy almost anything at a reasonable price. I recommend sitting at the side of the ship, or on the second floor.

best way to get an overview of the city. Istanbul is an extremely large, spread-out city and has many wonderful attractions beyond the main Sultanhamet district, so it is difficult to see them all by land. So a boat tour of the Bosphorous is a terrific way to see the other parts of the city. While it won't give you the up-close experience you will get from guided land tours, you will see a large number of historically important and visually beautiful sites such as palaces, mosques, bridges, etc., all from a very pleasant boat ride. A good tour that covers much of the city waterfront will take several hours, and a knowledgeable guide will make it a worthwhile experience. You can then plan further excursions on land to cover the sites you want to review in more detail.

Do the boat cruise. Outstanding views of the city from the ferries. I loved the busy coming and going of the ferries, the queues of ships waiting their turn to move up into Black Sea, the swirling currents, screeching gulls and the rows and rows of fisherman on the banks. You can see the Byzantine sea walls, old forts and homes of the rich. Don't miss it.

This is Istanbul. The gulls, the bridges, the ferries and their foghorns, the Bosphorus calls to you as frequently and as urgently as the muezzin calls the faithful to prayer. You will rarely be out of sight of the Bosphorus (or the Golden Horn or the Sea of Marmara) during your stay. Travel often on the ferries--they are wonderful. You can travel from Europe to Asia in 15 minutes for about $1.50.

top attraction in Istanbul ....do upon arrival. Fantastic .... best thing is to do this upon arrival as it will give you good grip of the layout of the bosphorus and Istanbul.2.5 hours of happy sailing along both sides of the strait.At Eur 15 it is good value too!

Sunny day at the bosphorus!. Excellent little cruise on the bosphorus, with plenty of sun, clear skys and see breeze. This is a must to discover Istanbul from the see, and to appreciate its peculiar topography among its rich architecture.
Cruise. Take a cruise up the Bosphorus is well worth the price of admission. The History of this area is rich and its truly interesting to learn about it.

take a tour over the Bosphorus Strait. When visiting Istanbul one of the nicest tours to take is a boat tour through the Golden Strait and Bosphorus. You have plenty of choice between different tours. I recommend that you book the tour at the offices near Kalata Bridge where all tours depart, instead of booking them with the numerous people offering you these tours when you're walking in the old city, as the price difference is not worth it.

take a tour over the Bosphorus Strait. When visiting Istanbul one of the nicest tours to take is a boat tour through the Golden Strait and Bosphorus. You have plenty of choice between different tours. I recommend that you book the tour at the offices near Kalata Bridge where all tours depart, instead of booking them with the numerous people offering you these tours when you're walking in the old city, as the price difference is not worth it.

Cruise the Bosphorus Strait and have lunch in the small fishing village of Anadolu Kavagi. Cruise the Bosphorus Strait on board the public ferry. It only costs 25TL for a roundtrip ticket.You will see beautiful scenery, homes, and villages.At the last stop ( Anadolu Kavagi) get off and enjoy a marvelous lunch in one of the local restaurants on the water.This is a great break from the usual sightseeing in Istanbul.

Bosphorus Cruise: Choose Your Boat Wisely. My wife and I took two Bosphorus cruises: the 90 minute cruise on Turyol (recommended by our hotel) and the full cruise on IDO departing at 10:35 and returning by 16:25. In both cases we were on boats without an open deck. Yes, there were seats (already taken by early birds) around the outside of the ship, and there was a very small aft deck, in the open air, which probably seated fewer than 25 people. In other words, if you wanted fresh air blowing in your face you were essentially out of luck stuck inside the ship. Or you had to stand somewhere not occupied by a fellow passenger. Yet we saw many boats sailing the Bosphorus with happy passengers on open upper decks, enjoying the fresh breezes. I recommend that you choose your boat carefully; go down to the Enimönü peer by the Galata Bridge and see which boats have open decks that you can buy a ticket for and choose those boats, unless, that is, you like sitting behind glassed-in windows (they do open, making is somewhat less a tomb). Too, the IDO full cruise boat had one filthy bathroom for the entire boat, not exactly the accompaniment for a romantic cruise up one of the world’s most famous waterways. One of the staff at the hotel hinted that it was the luck of the draw, so to speak, regarding what kind of boat you got from Turyol, but what we noticed was that beyond the main docking area in Enimönü, where tour bus after tour bus parked, it seemed to us that these tours commandeered all of the open deck boats. I am not sure I am right about this, but that's what I saw. Maybe the tours book all the best boats in advance and leave the scows for the rest of us. Be warned. Choose your boat carefully. There were boats with open decks broadcasting tours from the peer. You’ll have a much nicer, fresher, open air cruise if you just choose the right boat.

Simply beautiful. I recommend not to miss a trip on the Bosphorus while visiting Istanbul. You should be aware that the best options to do this trip is using the official ferry companies - IDO and Sehir Hatlari have excellent Bosphorus cruises at reasonable prices.

Pretty. Did a day trip on a boat up the Bosphorus to a little fishing village. Many more wooden houses and inlets than I expected, not unlike Bergen and Stavanger in Norway. Some very expensive real estate on the water's edge and boats in the water! Full day tour took in the Dolmabahçe Palace, lunch on in the Golden Horn (very good buffet) and trip towards the Black Sea - well worth the money [Tour 10 in the booklet from the hotel]
Night & day. The Bosphorus is spectacular during a day time boat ride but is especially awe inspiring to see both the European side and the Asian side lit up on a boat trip at night.

A must see in Istanbul. Take a bosphorus cruise which costs 10 turkish lira which takes about 2 hours. Several private cruises from Eminonu are available. It is also a great experience to look at the Bosphorus from the Asia side while sipping Turkish tea at the open air cafes in Uskudar.

Smaller boat with a guide is better. This is a historic waterway that connects strategic areas of the globe and with the right guide and commentary it can come alive. From Sultan summer homes, to historic fishing villages, 'new' bridges, tankers and freighter, this waterway has it all.When we were on the water, we were even passed by a submarine (yes a working military one) which reminded us just how vital and alive this waterway is.Have your Camera ready.

As busy as the English Channel. The people on the ferry ride were amusing without realising it. The sky was hazy, making it impossible to take photos when we drank at a cafe ovelooking it all, behind the Topkapi Palace.

Something fishy here. The longer cruise lasts about six hours but there is plenty of time to enjoy an excellent lunch in one of the harbourside restaurants at the northern end of the Bosphorus. If you still have energy after that, climb up to the Roman fort for an outstanding view

Astonishing and Majestic. This was my favorite part of my vacation and I'd recommend that anyone visiting not leave without taking a cruise. I took the short boat ride because I was pressed for time but on my next trip I'll take a full day tour.

If you like river trips this is as good as to gets. If you like river trips this is as good as to gets. Spend a couple of hours getting a different perspective seeing many of the sights from the water right between Europe and Asia.

Must do. This was simply one of the highlights of my stay at Istanbul. Take the Bosphorus Tour by boat to see this gorgeous city and view their many landmarks by boat. The tour should take about one and a half hours or so.
