Many boats leave from the Galata Bridge (near Eminonu Square). If your feeling adventurous or want to save money, skip the tourist boats for one of the many local ferries!

Stunning. Loved the whole shoreline of the bosphorus river, such buildings and beauty...Turkey is beautiful overall, but this specific river is stunning esp with the grand bosphorus bridge, lights up at night in different colours!

Worth the trip. Take the ferry for the round trip. Stops for three hours at the end stop then back to Galata Bridge. This pretty much takes up a whole day. Good to do when you want a "down" day after a busy day walking around. If you are feeling active after the first leg you can wander up to the crumbling Byzantine ruins. Bit of a climb but woth

Beautiful strait that separates between Europe and Asia. A beautiful strait that separates between Europe and Asia. There are 2 hanging bridges over the strait. There are spectacular views on the shores, beautiful houses and palaces on both sides. Take a boat trip from Eminonu.
A magnificent cruise. From both sides of the posphours you can see Istanbul that cannot be seen from any other place than the cruise. Must be taken

Did a boat trip including Bosphorous and Traditional Meal. Despite atrocious cold weather and storming rain whilst on the boat, the trip was very enjoyable. The sights around the Bosphorous including the bridges and rather lovely houses was well worth seeing.

A photographers dream.. So many golden photo old you get tired of them. Night time is amazing, brilliant. Get a cab at 6 am, with a English speaking driver and AUD $20 will get you the best tour ever.

Bosphorus river cruise. We loved the river cruise and enjoyed the differences of Istanbul on the European and Asian side. We saw a few palaces along the way and were impressed with the large bridge between the two continents.

Take the commuter public ferry!. You take the commuter public ferry at the Bogaz Iskelesi near the Galata bridge in the Eminonu disctrict of the Old Town. We chose a sunny day during the week (less crowded) and a 10:35 a.m. departure because that would take us into Anadolu Karvagi just in time for lunch. The round trip was 25TL.We also made it a point to show up for boarding about 30 minutes before departure to ensure that we got a seat on the upper deck and on the left side of the boat (on the way up most attractions are on the left, the European side of the Strait, and you avoid having the sun in your eyes on the way back).The ship made several stops along the way but only long enough to drop-off and pick up passengers.During the first hour there was a photo frenzy with passengers wanting to photograph and be photographed because the views are simply amazing (the numerous palaces, two bridges connecting the two continents, park areas, luxurious homes, and smaller villages as we got up towards the Black Sea.The rest of the boat ride is much more relaxing. On board you had a snack bar and waiters came around constantly to sell food and drinks; the yogurt that they pick up in Kanlica is worth tasting. The washrooms were OK if you don't mind rudimentary boat WC's....We docked in Anadolu Karvagi at half past noon. This small fishing village on the Asian side is where the ferry makes its last stop and takes a break for lunch before heading back at 3:00 p.m. We decided to stay away from the restaurants that are along the shoreline and walked around the village, bought some souvenirs and then had lunch in a family-run eatery off the central area. This also meant not going up to visit Yoros Castle; again, because we wanted to board 30 minutes before departure.We arrived back in the Old Town around 5:00 p.m. a bit tired but well satisfied with our excursion.While in Istanbul if you have the time, I recommend this inexpensive cruise which provides the opportunity to relax, appreciate the massive size of this city and its outlying landmarks, and tour one of the busiest waterways located at the junction of two continents.

Worldclass sight, historic place. From all angles this waterway has it all. The very border between Europa and Asia, separating Istanbul in two parts. Connecting the Sea of Marmara and the Black Sea a steady stream of ships can be seen day and night. Crossing it with one of the many ferries is a delight, even better is to take a day trip along the whole Boshorus.

Beautiful and picturesque. The entire strait is beautifully done up on both the sides. I would highly recommend travellers taking the day cruise where you get to see most of the city around the strait.

Great water views. Took the tourist cruise and was impressed with the number of fabulous buildings built on both shores of the Bosphorus. It included a tour though one of the palaces on the Asian side.

Two continents for one price. Take a 15 Lira per head 2 hour boat trip near Galatta Bridge and it is the best value you can ever get in Istanbul. Going up, it is Asia is on the left and Europe on the right. Where can you travel across continents of US$ 10?

Take the ferry. We considered a boat trip at about 40TL each, but then decided to go across to the Asian side on the local ferry for 3TL each. You see the same great view of the city.The Asian side offers a wonderful street market selling all sorts for food and has plenty of cafes and restaurants with great fresh fish and decent wine.

A great overview. I took Rick Steve's advice, and went for the day-long non-tourist ferry trip to the furthest point on the Asian side, Anadolu Kavagi. In addition to the departures he lists there, at 10.35 and 13.35, there is (in season) a noon departure, which I took, reckoning not to spend three hours and more at Anadolu Kavagi (the sailing back being at 15.00). The round trip, at 25TL, is well worth it. There's a bit of a rush for the seats on the open decks, and a certain amount of crowding for the photo frenzies that every bridge, large building and stray cat caused, but by and large it's a very relaxing experience, as even the most avidly erect of the telephoto lenses retract in satiety. The spurned inside saloons, by the way, are spacious and comfortable, and also offer good views. (Tip: use the bathroom before boarding: those on board are strictly for the truly desperate.) Snacks are on sale, but I didn't sample those, so can't report. I did buy a carton of the apparently word-famous yoghurt that comes on board at Kaslica on the Asian side, and it was indeed good. The ferry was a bit behind schedule, so we docked at Anadolu Kovagi at about 14.00, which was a pity, because the plethora of fish restaurants looked inviting, but I didn't want to rush a meal to catch the 15.00 sailing. There is in fact a 16.00 sailing, but I had to be back in Istanbul fairly early, so couldn't make that. So: either take the noon sailing, or plan to take the 16.00 return trip, and indulge in a fish meal at Anadolu. I can't stand in for the quality, but it looked very good in passing.The trip back is a more sedate affair, everyone now having photographed everything remotely worth photographing, providing for a relaxing end to a long but fascinating trip. Don't miss it.

90 minute trip on the fly. At the end of Galata bridge, walking back to Sultahnamet from Taksim, we saw a boat getting ready to sail for a 90 minute Bosphorus ride for only 10 tl. Great deal! Went up to castle and back.
Make sure to get on the 1.5 hour ride. You can catch a boat from near the Spice Markets. Beautiful view of the city from the boat. Only 10 TL you can't miss it!

Wonderful and historic. Take your own snacks. This is a very worthwhile afternoon trip. But research your trip provider to make sure you get better commentary. My commentator seemed more interested in talking about the high property values. Great to see the place where Flo Nightingale started the whole nursing profession. Many other highlights. Snack counter on board very limited and overpriced.

The focus of Istanbul. Read Orhan Pamuk on the Bosphorus in his book Istanbul. We took a Bosphorus tour from Eminönü. That way we saw both shores, which was nice. The boat was quite crowded though, and there was a constant offer of food and drink to buy. The trip I preferred was later in the week when (with the help of a Turkish friend) we took a little taxi boat across to the Asian side in the evening to eat in a fish restaurant. Now that felt like the real Bosphorus experience.

Go deeper!. The Bosphorus is nothing short of spectacular, everybody knows it! But I would recomend the less known part of it, which is the entrance from the Black Sea. Great views from either side and a great boat ride!

One of the most beautiful boat rides in the world. The architecture on both sides of the Bosphorus as you go from stop to stop (on the commuter boat, not the tourist ones) is second to none. It is the essence of this gorgeous city. One stunning house after another along the shores, the beautiful ottoman yalis are rare but beautiful gems. Other modern constructions and the view of the Dolmabahce are also well worth the trip

Cruse of the Bosphorous. There are several cruises along the straits both during the day and night they are each quite different from the other . You can have a midnight cruise with a show of belly dancing with dinner are recommended as this is quite interesting. Views of the Asian side views from the cruise shows interesting features
Worth time. If u r into sea trips You will like this ride 2 hours and may be more It is fun and cheap Take a local ride , get a book or an audio tour guide Enjoy the sea and the views
Great afternoon break. Gorgeous views and a nice way to relax for a few hours in the day - you can see just how large & diverse a city Istanbul is from this tour of the strait.

Good day trip!. It's a good day trip to ride down the Bosporus and see both Asian and European part of Istanbul. The palaces along the way are pretty and the vistas are beautiful. However avoid taking a full day cruise - you may be better off doing this using local ferries!

2 hour cruise is a bit too long. But we got off at a stop on the way back. And the ferry ride gave us a chance to rest our weary feet and still see the city, reasonable price - you may want to get the headset (we didn't)

Cheap tour. We found a Bosphorus, one and a half our cruise for just 10 TYL. However, you get what you pay for. There was no commentary, they just kept packing more and more people onto the boat and when it was very full they departed. They drop off was 150 m away from where we started. It was OK but don't expect too much..
Wonderful. This is a must see river cruise in Istanbul. Viator was a very good tour service. I would use them again.

A relaxing morning. A trip around the Bosphorus and Golden horn on one of the half day trips is a great way to see Istanbut from afar. You really appreciate the size of Istanbul and you get a great perspective of more than just the tourist sites and to get way from the hussle and bustle for a awhile. It's worth the full day to take in the Dolmabahce Palace on the Asian side as well

Stunning. I highly recommend doing a day trip down the Bosphorus. There is nothing like sitting on the deck in the warm Mediterranean sun, with a glass of wine cruising to the historic sites along the strait. Then mid day take a dip in the cool refreshing Black Sea.

the cruise. good way to see both sides of the city given limited time available. both sides of the bank is beautiful however it got a little old given it is a 90-min cruise. nevertheless its worth going for.

take out your camera. Bosphorus Cruise is a must do. You can get good trips for 10 Euro- just turn up at the port. Get a good plac at rear ofboat for good photo opportunities. Take water with you and a snack - two hour round trip.
One of the most beautiful places in Istanbul.. One of the most beautiful places in Istanbul. We liked a lot. Everything was great. Do we want to go again.
Beautiful. The cruise on the Bosphorous was exciting, very picturesque, beautiful buildings on either side, etc.
Good pics. Busy and windy, very good option to cruise and to visit the two bridges. Good for pics and to see the city suburbia.

Take the cruise. While there might be other ways to take in the tour, just take the Bosphorus line and spend a bit of time hiking up to the fortress, followed by a bit of lunch at one of the restaurants by the ferry terminal. Make sure to arrive early in order to get a good seat on the top rear deck.

Stunning. Istanbul is such a beautiful city and there is no better way to appreciate its beauty and enormity than by doing a cruise along the Bosphorus. It also provides a refreshing breeze on balmy summer days. A must do!!

Probably the worst value of the week.. We did the Bosporus night cruise with a meal and drinks, this included a show of comedy, a belly dancer and folk dancers.To start, we were seated on the top deck for a welcome drink, then people just got up and the place was empty. No announcements were made. The meal was actually not bad, although I have never had to eat so quickly in my life. The waiters were taking your plate a soon as you looked as though you had stopped eating, without waiting for the rest of the table to finish. As some of us were seated on tables with only one way out, other guests were trying to get passed you while you were trying to finish your meal. This waas to get a seat so you could see the show we found out! The belly dancer did one dance, which was unimpressive, ( seen better in Morrocco and Egypt) then was only interested in going round for notes to be pushed down her costume! There is light at the end of the tunnel! The folk dancers were excellent, if it wasn't for them, the rating would have been 1.

The Bosphorus by Boat. We traveled the Bosphorus by private boat up and around the Black Sea. This is a beautiful trip and would recommend you have your travel guide book handy to identify all of the wondrous castles, mosques, fortresses, homes and hotels. Outstanding.

relax at the bosporus. A nice little boat trip an the bosporus. It is relaxing and gives you an idea how enourmous the city of Istanbull really is. It brings you along the European side as well as the Asian side. We entered the boat in the besiktas area.

A view of Istanbul one should not miss. Taking a Bosporus cruise is an important part of the Istanbul experience.There are several offering of Bosphorus Cruises. Some cost as much as 45€ for a half a day tour and 25€for a 2.5 hr. tour. This may include lunch and/or snacks free of charge.However, I would recommend some of the less expensive options. These will not include free lunch, or hotel pickup, but for the difference in price you can more than buy lunch.The cruise I took was provided by TurYol. They leave from the base of the Galata Bridge (southwest end). Easily accessible using mass transportation : take the subway to Eminönü(T1 line). When you get up to the street walk near the coast to the other side of the foot of the bridge (not across the bridge). You will be walking west-southwest.The tour lasted an hour and a half. Cost is 12TL (less than $7, a little over 5€).Plenty to see. I was quite satisfied with what I got for my money. See uploaded picture for the route.Another option is the service provided by Bogaz Turlari. I did not take their cruises, but picked up a brochure. They offer night cruises as well.Their "Short Circle Tour" is 2hrs. and costs 10TL. The Full Cruise is 25TL.Yet another alternative is taking the regular commuter ferries, as mentioned by others here. What we did was took the TurYol cruise, then later took a commuter ferry over to the Asian side of Istanbul, walked around, then got back using a commuter ferry again.

Public ferries for 3 lira. If you aren't into guided tours, one way to see the Bosphorous is to take the public ferry... Grab a seat outside or stand in the entry/exit area for some great views. Tickets are 3 lira from the jetomatik machines on the wharf. Do your research and work out which stop to leave from and route to take for the most scenic. I just went with luck, and it was fun!There is no commentary so you can just soak in the sights. A round trip takes about 1 hour unless you get off on the Asian continent. There was a man on my ferry feeding the seagulls travelling by with bread. This was quite entertaining, he was clearly enjoying himself, though I think his son was a little embarrassed! But that's what fathers are for!

It is really God gifted. It is natural and God gifted. The sentiments cannot be explained in words. Everybody is advised to go Istanbual and visit the Bosphorus by own eyes in day and night as well. It is unbelievable.

Beautiful Breeze on a Hot Day. There is only one Bosphorus Strait and if you are in Istanbul, you must take advantage of riding this great water way. Take a cruise, a boat, or even a ferry to cross to any of its many sides.You will enjoy the fresh cool breeze with a snack and cold drink, you will feel you are in paradise..Enjoy the view from all sides, see Europ and Asia from on view..It is a sight to remember.

best during sunset and party on deck. had a private boat tour for a large family and friends group that came for our wedding and the setting was simply amazing for an evening get together and party.. istanbul is a beautiful town and more so from the bosphorus

A must-see when in istanbul. You can't be in istanbul and miss the bosphorus ferry trip. You need to be accompanied by a tour guide to show you the highlights of the bosphorus both on the asian side and the european side.

Lovely. A repeated one whenever we go .... You always look on both sides as you are seeing the views for the first time .. Romantic one for brides :) always get a jacket even in summer as it may get cold in z water

Boat trip along Bosphorus. What a great way to see the city, from a luxury launch, with a tour guide to explain where we were and what we were looking at. we had a break for a drink at a jetty point. and my advise to others is go round the back of the front river facing restaurants, and you will find the places that the locals eat. Have Balak Ekmek for 5 lire. it is Fish in Bread. and is excellent value. and you will just have enough time to finihs it before the boat leaves.to take you to the Maiden tower, which is another excelent place to view the city from

Enjoyable River Boat Cruise. We decided to take one of the private boats for a 2 hour trip on the Bosphorous.
These are non stop and should cost no more than 10TL.
a realxing way to see both European and Asian sides of the city and to keep cool in the heat

Passageway between two continents. Don't get me wrong, the signifiance of this strait is immense when reflecting on the history and importance of it to its people, but in the big picture -- it's just a body of water. There are several palaces built alongside of it where the Sultan's moved to once they left Topkapi and there are amazing clubs/lounges/restaurants that dot the strait as well, but in the end -- it's just a strait. The importance is more towards what the Turks have done to the surrounding areas of the strait than the strait itself...and of course its significance to the Turks.

Incredible!. This straight has seen it all! There is such beauty to it make sure you take the daily tours and there is also nice restaurants everywhere along the straight where you can fine dine and take in the marvelous view! The ferries that run all day are fantastic we love taking them just before sunset the views and the colors of the sky are like that on a postcard!
Lots to see. Beautiful area, lots of restaurants, shops and cafés, great food and excellent views. The boat trips are definitely worth the price.
Beautiful. We had a lovely trip into the Black Sea where we had a swim before returning to the heat of Istanbul. Definitely worth doing.

pleasant boat trip. we went on an organised trip but it was a smaller boat bso it was very pleasant some are really large & busy there are plaenty of interesting sights along both banks of the strait & the tour guide was very knowledgable ( She tours )
Should be done.. Don't leave Istanbul before a trip on one of the many boats....nice views of both sides of both continents of Istanbul.
nice trip. very crowded in the boat. the tickets costs about 10 - 12 Lira only. do not take it with a tourist company. it costs about 40 euros.

Very Fun!. We actually did the Bosphorus Strait twice, once in the daytime and once at night. Daytime offers more opportunities for pictures and the night is more romantic and picturesque. Honestly it's worth seeing at both times but if I had to pick one, it would be the daytime as you will see more.

It's a must to take a boat trip on this sea to fully appreciate the vastness of a city which is 150 km long and 50 km wi. we took a fab boat trip which lasted 2 and a half hours. Thank god we chose that one and not the 7 hour one. Our guide was the most boring man ever!! We could hardly understand his accent and he repeated everything twice. The trip was spectacular though and we would not have seen the best of Istanbul if we didn't take the boat trip. A bit expensive but worth it.

Two hour Boat Tour of Bosphorous. While it sounds like something your grandparents would want to do on a trip, I highly recommend a 1 full day city tour that includes lunch and a 2 hour boat tour of Bosphorous. A great way to see and lear more about IST.

Sail between two cultures. I took a ferry from the European side of Istanbul for( 2 t.l. each way) to the Asian side. Passing very close to the Bospherous Bridge, it is amazing to see the differences in the two sides of Istanbul. (At night the Bospherous Bridge lights up in red.) Asian Istanbul is pretty with sidewalk attractions around the ferry port, large buildings and Mosques.

Bosphorus boat trip. I booked with She Tours for the afternoon tour. The weather was perfect and the tour went for about 2 hours, with excellent commentary from the tour guide. Then we went up to the cable car and travelled down. It was great.

Bosphorus Strait. The Boshorus Strait is not only an access route for Eastern Europe to main seas and oceans area, but also a place were a mixture of cultures and civilisations has occured since ancient times. It provides magnificient views, both on European and Asian shores.

Enjoy the trip. We contracted a cruise (about 2 hours long) at the exit of Topkapi Palace. The original price was 15 euros for person, but the attendant gave us a 5 euros discount (and we did not asked for!!!). The cruise begins by the European side of Istanbul and passes for every interesting places there (several mosques, Galata Bridge, Galata Tower, and all other places, as Dolmabahce Palace and so on…), until the second bridge between continents, then come back by the Asian side. It is not a must (in cultural basis), but is very pleasant, you are seated (after a long walk...) in a boat, on a sunny day, wind passing, nice landscape, hearing the information of guide, just enjoying the trip. Was fun.

An Inexpensive Way to See the Bosphorus Strait!. Don't take a guided tour with a private company, but take the ferry boat for a return (round) trip on the Turkish side of the Bosphorus Strait. It is an inexpensive to travel, and you will be richly rewarded seeing Turks with their families, as well as the beautiful scenery en route on both sides of the strait. You can pick the boat up at the start of its journey at the dock at Eminönü in the Sultanahmet. The boat stops off at Ortakoy and at Üsküdar (formerly Scutari where Florence Nightingale set up beds for the wounded during the Crimean War) but stay on board. You will see fancy hotels, palaces, summer homes, mosques, and an old fortress towards the end of the trip before turning around and coming back to Eminönü.
Don't miss this. One of the highlights of the trip was our cruise along the Bosphorus Strait. We had a blast. It was a gorgeous day and everyone had a wonderful time.
Good to see the city from the water. A great way to experience the city from the water. Watch the boats/ferries go by and catch a sniff of the sea breeze. A good way to experience and fee the city.

Great Way to See the Sights of the Bosporus. Likes include all of the sites that were easily visible from the Bosporus cruise. As far as for things that could be better - be sure to sit in a location where you can hear the tour's description of the places that you are seeing and at the same time try to secure a location that offers the best views. Some times both are not possible.
Love the Bosphorus. you can get on a boat or sit on a restaurant or cafe beside the bosphorus & look at it for hours & hours. I love its enrgy & beauty.

Get on a boat!. Seriously, just get on a boat. The Bosphorus Cruise is a day long experience. Don't get off at the end of the route where it is recommended, A.Kavagi, that is a tourist trap. There is a nice hill to climb with an okay view of the strait but there is no shortage of views from the boat. Instead, get off at Sariyer. A much nicer town with less barking and better restaurants.
Lovely. You get to see every site there is to see from a boat and all of the beautiful houses located on the sea..the colored bridge is beautiful too.

Get a Strait side restaurant table. We stopped for lunch during a guided tour. The strait is fill of shipping crossing East West, and North South. We asked our guide how many ships passed through the straits per year - tens of thousands "there are sometimes crashes".

Nice ride. We went for a guided ride on the bosphorus which was very cool. The information was very interesting to hear about the history. But even cool than that was being in between Asia and Europe, surreal.
Best seen from a pleasure boat. Recommend taking one of the many pleasure craft that do a circular trip up the West bank and then down the East bank.

Cruising during sunset. I didnt planned to cruise the Bosphorus but i pass this ferry terminal where one boat is ready to go for only TL10 so i climed aboard. I enjoyed the scenes while the sun is just about to set at 8pm. It passes the europian side then when u reach the bridge it turns to the asian side until going back where u started ur journey. I started it at Galata bridge area where the Blue mosque can be seen. It was Eid so the mosque was well lit.
Nice Day Trip. We had a good time going up the straight and seeing all of the seaside areas. It was windy but still qute comfortable on the outdoor decks of the boat.

Take the boat tour. The 1 1/2 hour boat tour from the Galata Bridge was worth the trip. Beautiful scenery. You can't really hear the commentary, even though it is in English, but if you bring a map you can see for yourself what you're looking at. And they serve cute little glasses of turkish tea (probably not the safest idea if you don't want to get burned, but yummy for the daring!).

Travel as far up as you're able!. Everyone mentions the ferry and the cruises, but it's also easy to get up the Bosphorus by going up the coast road on the 25E bus from Kabataş right near the beginning of the tram line into the Old City and the Funicular to Taksim. I did the ride up at 6:30 and watched the sun rise over the Bosphorus. AMAZING! There are at ton of cute old fishing villages. Ortakoy is artsy; Bebek is posh; and Yenikoy feels more local. All of them have amazing restaurants with views of the water. It was so worth getting out of the city to catch this.
Simply beautiful. One of the most spectacular views in the world - incredible skyline, both day and night. Best viewed from the Four Seasons on the Bosphorous or the Cirahan Hotel.

Endless options.... The Bosporus offers amazing opportunities, try any of the following and you won't bedisappointed:Ferry to the Prince's islands leaving from KabatasCatch a short cruise past Beylerbeyi palace to the old fortress from OrtakoySit in any of the cafes at Ortakoy, Bebek or Dolmabahce and watch the river traffic go pastHint, pay 10 lira for an Istanbulkart that can be credited with funds for travel on most of the ferries and trams etc... You only need one for the entire party as you can swipe it once for everyone that goes through a turnstile.Most ferries will provide a really good service of teas, drinks and snacks etc at reasonable prices.
Awesome cruise. A real must-do in Istanbul. Take a longer night cruise if possible. Take the boat from Eminonu or Sultanahmet.

do the cruise. we did the cheap option of 10Lira for a 2hr non commmentary cruise at 11am but for the same price there is a guided commentary in the afternoon at 2;30-either way a fun way to spend 2hrs looking at a very busy waterway and seeing how the rich people live.be aware that cruise finishes about 200m from where it starts ,on the other side of galata bridge,get off and try one of the floating fish restaurants,a must do istanbul experience!!
Beautiful trip. We went in a ferry, nice views, super relaxing. With a beautiful day you can really appreciate all the monuments in Istabul and the Bosphorus. Really liked it, nice tour!

I was so taken with this waterway. The Bosphorus Strait separates Asia and Europe. And what is very interesting is that the city of Istanbul is on both continents. You can take a ferry from Istanbul Europe to Istanbul Asia and it only takes 20 minutes. It is a beautiful ride and the view of the city is breathtaking. The ferry is old and has been around a while but I felt safe as we moved through the water. There also are big ships, like Carnival , that dock there.

Idyllic Bosporus ride. n the morning, buy a ticket at the Eminonu pier for cruise Bosporus. Take a one way ticket to a place Anadolu Kavagi. If you find a place along the way especially pleases come down from the ferry. In the city you can always go back by bus. View of the small towns along the Bosphorus, and beautiful home is unique. Eat yogurt from places Kanlica. Climb Fort Rumeli Hisari. Spend an unforgettable day and admire the Bosphorus bridge at night when changing colors.

Take a relaxing cruise. This is another MUST DO when in Istanbul. The cruises leave on the hour and some go all the way up to the Black Sea. We just did the Bosphorous because it looked like it was going to rain and it was gorgeous. Next time, we'll take the longer one to the sea.

Simply enchanting!. The Bosphorus represents the "border" between Asia and Europe and that in and of itself is remarkable. However the place is anything but quiet! There is a lot of water traffic and the area around Eminonu is buzzing with tourists, local vendors hawking things and locals enjoying a walk by the water's edge. We took a cruise lasting about 2 hours, it cost 10TL per person. While waiting on board to depart, we could see the 3 old-style boats on which the chefs were skillfully and artfully preparing fish. One of the area's delicacies is a fish sandwich - just fish in a bun! The scenic vistas along the cruise cannot be described adequately - they must be experienced. Ranging from small to humongous estates, palaces and hillside chalets, there are some beautiful properties in sight. The mosques in view at sunset are a sight to behold. Somehow I was not expecting the Bosphorus to be as clean as it was. The water was not murky. I wish I had the time for a full 6-hour cruise as that would have meant seeing the Black Sea. However the 2-hour cruise allowed a good experience of the Bosphorus strait. The company I went with is called Turyol and they're located to the left of the Gallata bridge. This is one not to be missed.
visit asia and europe at the same day. I travelled a lot but there is no place like Bosphorus. the silluitte of stanbul is starts to change but still amazing
makes the english channel look quiet..... never ending traffic in all directions - even at night when all the specatcular light shows start on the bridges

A tour with a view. Well worth taking the full tour of the straits. We were slightly surprised that it was pencilled in for 6 hours - but this does allow for 3 hours in Anadolu Hisari the village closest to the Black Sea. So you can take an earlier boat back to istanbul. Hike up to the castle was hard work but good views at the top. Return trip featured a dramatic thunderstorm which forced the boat to layup at an intermediate port for 30 mins and hence delayed our return.

Great boat trip!. We decided to take the famous Bosphorus trip. We used the public tourism company (Sehir Hatlari) and we took a very nice cruise in the Bosphorus, all the way to the Black Sea. It's a 5 or 6 hour cruise but it is worth every minute. It stops in the Asian side of the Bosphorus close to the beginning of the Black Sea for 2 hours so you can have time to enjoy a nice dinner. We had dinner in a very nice and simple restaurante half-way (actually more than half-way!) to the top of the hill. We had amazingly fresh grilled fish with a nice salad and it was really cheap! Strongly recommend!The boat can get a little noisy (there is live music on board and people tend to sing along and dance to local folk tunes). We discovered that if you come downstairs, you have a lot more space, you take equally nice pictures of all the palaces along the sea cost and you get rid of the noise!
Essential. When you visit Istanbul make sure you take a boat tour, very well prices at TL12 for 1.5 hours. The ferry to Kadikoy is even better value.

Beautiful real estate to see.... We had an interesting trip with informative guide. Some fantastic real estate along the strait - $45 Million upwards. Great to travel under the immense new suspension bridges on the ferry.
Lovely views. A great experience to take a cruise on the Nosphorus Strait and see the amazing architecture on both sides.
Tranquility in the heart of the city. One of my favourite activities is to get on a Bosphorous Cruise and enjoy the scenes of Istanbul while on the ferry.

Turkish Delite!. i took a cruise on the strait, very delightful. we sailed under the Suspension bridges (one of them at a time, the longest in the world) and also stopped over at the Kız Kulesi, a light house and was pleasantly surprised that it featured in "the World is not alone" by James Bond!

Beautiful Bosphorus Tour. This Bosphorus Strait boat tour was a truly breathtaking experience. I saw parts of the area I had never seen before and was treated to an oral description of all the marvelous places we passed. It was a memorable day.

Great views!. We took the boat tour after already being in Istanbul for about 5 days which gave us some idea of what we were seeing. We just walked down to where the tour boats launch, there was a boat leaving in 5 minutes so we just payed a small amount (I cannot remember exactly how much, around $20) and hopped on.The boat tour really impresses on you the size of the city in a way you dont get just walking around. It also provided many of my favorite pictures and views from our trip. You can just sit in the sun and enjoy the afternoon while seeing many amazing sights, what's not to love? After being in the city for many days and being crammed on the Tram before departing it was also nice to be out in the open with the fresh air.I would rate this as a must do in Istanbul!

A different perspective on Istanbul. The streets and people and sights are wonderful, but seeing Istanbul from the Bosphorus is special. The mosques and palaces, the boat traffic, the blue water, and the view of the Black Sea make for a special day that should be a part of any visit. We highly recommend Turkish Heritage Travel for this experience. It is always nice to get more than you expect, and this happened to us on this trip. From pick-up and return to the hotel, to excellent food and drinks, this was a great experience!

Went to Asia for 2TL. Rode the ferry for 2TL to Kadikoy and had an ice cream in Asia. What an easy, convenient, and cheap way to get to Asia.
Ferries run every 20ish minutes, were quite large and had a/c. The ride was about 20 minutes and was cool seeing Istanbul from sea.

Quick & Easy. Coming from the European side of Turkey is easy. Just make sure you get on the boat going to Karakoy because they have several ferries going to other locations that can be a bit confusing.The tickets were 2 Turkish Lira (one way) and you can get to Asia in only 20 minutes. You also get to see some pretty cool angles of both Europe and Asia on the way to and from. Ferries leave every 20 minutes so you are never left waiting too long.Definitely worth the effort to get across...even if it's just to say you went to Europe and Asia in the same day. (There's also a bridge you could attempt to walk across to say you walked from Europe to Asia if you are more adventurous!)
Amazing. There's never really anything wrong to see such beautiful coastal areas that is also full of ancient stories!
Brilliant cruise. The cruise was outstanding. The views of the palaces, the bridge connecting Europe and Asia, the open sea and the fact that you can sit back and relax, soaking in the fresh sea air.
Take a boat trip if you have the time. There's no better way to digest the city skyline than from a boat and it is slightly less bussling than the streets of Istanbul
Beautifull scenery. Should be visited. A lot of Bosforus Tours, but no need to pay expensive. Regular boat tours, like Tour Yol are cheap, but sufficient.

Good cruise. It was a good cruise, but if you don't have the time, then skip it. We got the last boat out and they waited for an hour to get as many people to fill the boat. We got back very late and tired.

A sight to Behold. Most definitly take at least a mini boat trip on the Bosphorous and you will get awonderful view of Istanbul that will be permenantly eched in your heart and mind, I shot a hundred pictures but that still cannot do justice to the sight... one has to see & experience.

Sit back & relax. The Bosphourus is a history lesson on water.Book Turkish Maritine Lines or through a agent for the ferry ride it is well worth it.5 Ottoman palaces,4 castles to name a few of the sights Had a delicious meal at one of the many fish restaurants at our stop.

cruising the views, see the history first-hand. It's a must-see, must do, and the boatmen know it. Prices are totally uncompetitive, clearly controlled/cartelled. But a boat trip must be safe and professional, so can't be done cheaper without being worse. Pay 20 Tlira for 2 h and enjoy. See the narrow choppy/tidal/strong-currented waterway that has turned history many times. Get some clean sea air, perhaps some rain and inevitably some spray to blow away the dust and madness of the big sights. Make your own way across the Golden Horn Bridge and probably get a cheaper price - but there's better things to do in Istanbul than worry about money. It's world-class value. And if you do end up on the 'wrong' side of the Horn at the end, walk the restaurant obstacle course an choose a good fish meal from the politest waiter.

Excellent Full Bosphorus Cruise. If you want a 'full' Bosphorus cruise, there is one that leaves from Eminonu and takes 90 minutes to go all the way up to the Black Sea, stopping at Anadolu Kavagi for 3 hours so that you have time to walk up to Yoros Castle and to have lunch at a waterfront cafe, then return to Eminonu-all for only 25TL per person. A portable guide player only costs 5 TL and gives an excellent commentary.
Must do and see while in Istanbul. No need to get the expensive private company tours, just jump on the traditional IDO ferry for the long or short tour and enjoy...

As another traveler stated, "This is a must do!". The view of Istanbul from a boat touring the Bosphorus Strait is magnificent. The fact the the city itself is beautiful, of course, makes this so. But, it's more than that. You can imagine what it's like living in the various neighborhoods which you pass. And, the boat/ship traffic on the water can keep you interested in that alone. We even saw seals frolicking. A real delight!

Nice Respite from Hot City. A simple 2 hour boat "tour" on the state owned ferry line will cool you off and give you and idea of huge the city is and how diverse. It's also kinda cool to think of all the ships that have passed that way for the past 3000 years.

You Should Definately Do It!. One of the many great things one can enjoy in this amazing, colorful, historical, busy and charming city! The cruise on the Bosphorus is a MUST especially if the weather is sunny. I have done this in winter and as it was sunny and bright it was a perfect experience! This is a chance to feel the beauty and might of Istanbul because while you are on the cruise you can see the Dolmabahce Saray, you can admire the magnificent views of the city from the water, and you can take a glimpse at the rich-people houses around the Bosphorus. I would definitely take another boat trip again when back to Istanbul :)

Great introduction. Taking the boat trip is a good start to Istanbul. It is also good for tired little feet if you have children. The development has increased since i last did this tour over 21 years ago, but still the palaces are splendid and the historical details impressive.
Dont miss this. We went there at night, very beautifull area, we shoot the balloons, then we ate the famous beked potatoes. we stayed and have couple of drinks
cruise the bospherous. use the local ferries to get around, not the tour ferries, great value, comfortable and beter atmsophere

If the heat and bustle of Istanbul gets too much, take to the water. Istanbul is crowded, busy, hot in the summer, and full of frenetic energy. When you need a break, make for the Eminonu ferry terminals by the Galata bridge and take to the water. You can either use the commercial ferries to take a trip across or up the Bosphorus, or join one of the cruise boats that offer a two hour trip up the Bosphorus and back. You will be rewarded with sea breezes, relative quiet, and some magnificent views of Istanbul and some of the smaller settlements and sites along the shores of this busy sea-lane.
east meets west. to be there in a cruise in between Asia and Europe, it's just "wow". Beautiful that i was so mesmerised. It is definitely one of the destinations that should not be missed.

Scatter my ashes here. This is the straight between Europe and Asia. This is where the two continents ome face to face and seperated with a waterway only about a mile wide. The water way also connects the Black Sea and the Mediterranean. The views are breathtaking.
A Must Do. You will be missing out if you do not do. The 2/5hr one is more then enough, anything longer (for us) was not necessary.
Take a cruise on the Bosphorus. You will not regret cruising the Straight especially with a knowledgeable guide to explain landmarks and history. Day or not this is a must do in Istanbul.
bosphorus is one of the most popular. cruise trip at bosphorus is very popular for tourists as they can see all historic places via bosphorus and golden horn .it is really fabulous during night

Beautiful and very relaxing. We did the 2 hour public ferry cruise (the Short Cruise with IDO Istanbul Deniz Otobüslerifor). It costs 15TL and departs daily at 14:30 from the port at Eminonu. For an extra 5TL you can have a GPS-aware audio guide which is excellent (you will need to leave a deposit of 100TL or an identity card).It is a large ferry with plenty of seating and a nice air-conditioned interior. The boat does not stop so there is no opportunity to get off and explore but it goes way beyond the 2nd bridge so you do get to see a lot more of the Bosphorus than with many other more expensive cruises.A word of warning, the description "public ferry" is also used by the private ferry companies to lure you onto the wrong boat so make sure the boat you get is IDO, sometimes just called Deniz for short.

Entertaining trip through- keep camera to hand. Fascinating sights, went through at night in one direction so saw the lights- well worth it, then came back few days later in daylight to see the old forts and other sights- If not on a cruise well worth paying for a boat trip

Sehir Hatlari. We took the 90 minute Bosphorus Cruise for 10TL. Tickets can be purchased direct from the port at Eminonu. Our trip departed at 2.30pm but there seem to be other local ferries doing similar journeys. We were on a large modern looking boat with plenty of seats on deck or inside air-conditioned area. We took off from the Galata Bridge and crossed to Uskudar to collect more passengers before continuing along the Strait passing Mosques, Dolmabahce Palace, Ciragan Palace (now Kempinski Hotel), old fortresses and beautiful homes. We also got to see dolphins and crossed under 2 bridges (Bosphorus) before making the return journey. There was no commentary on boat but you could hire a headset if you required information on the sights. We enjoyed just relaxing in the sun and watching the view unfold. A small kiosk sold snacks and drinks.

Too good to miss. One of the main attractions of visiting Istanbul is the crossing between Asia and Europe. We rented a boat and went up the Bosphorus, also swam there. Surprisingly clean water despite the number of ships entering Istanbul!
cruise on Bosphorus. Interesting but not a high priority. The stops do not allow enough time to explore areas. Our cruise did not have a good sound system so missed some information.
Pretty From Afar. It is gorgeous from above the city but not so much up close. We took a cruise and the strait was very crowded with boat traffic.

Take a Cruise!. Whether you take the ferry or a cruise, put this on your list of musts. It provides a gorgeous view from the water and you'll see a lot of things. I did a boat tour that cost 15E and we learned about the sites and stopped over on the Asian side of Istanbul where we could explore for a bit.
Bosphorus cruise. Definitely take a cruise of the Bosporus. There are a number of companies that offer them and we took the one recommended by our concerierge. Very enjoyable.

River Cruise. We took a two and l/1 hr river cruise up the Bosphorus Strait in the evening. It was a great way to see Istanbul. It was light when we went up and getting to sunset when we returned and the lights of the city highlighted all the main attractions.

A Contentious Stretch of Water. The Bosphorus is that stretch of water that connects the Black Sea to the Sea of Marmara en route to the Aegean; it is this stretch of water where Ulysses reputedly sought adventure; it is at the mouth of this waterway that lie the contended Dardenelles. Also nearby, in ancient times, it is thought that Troy lay at the mouth of this waterway, but after centuries of flooding and deposits of silt, Troy is now many kilometres from its mouth. On one side of the Bosphorus lies Asia, and on the other Europe. There are many vantage points where travellers and citizens can sit and enjoy the shipping traffic up and down. Along its shores are castles and old Ottoman palaces, one worth visiting in particular on a waterway cruise/tour is the Summer Palace. If you take a water tour you will get an amazing perspective on life in Istanbul. Another thing you can do is to take a suburban ferry to the 'other side' and find a restaurant or ice cream parlour (the Turkish do great ice cream!) and see how the locals live, dine and party. Cruise boats and ferries depart from the docks in Eminonu. Istanbul from the water is a wonderful experience. Of course, don't forget your camera!

Half day or full day, good choice.. What better way to see a city that is 150 kilometers wide? There are so many sights along the Bosphorus and many choices of tours. You won't be disappointed in either of them.

It is not a river!. The Bosphorus is where the city breathes. All the roads lead down to this beautiful strait. Try to get a room with a view of the Bosphorus or at least have a meal or two by this strait. Take a ferry across even if you have no business on the other side. Just for the fun of it. Take a boat tour to discover the beautiful houses built alongside it during the last centuries.
Boat Trip. Really enjoyed going along the water and seeing the sights on both sides of the river. This gave us a very nice way of seeing "East meets West"!!

Bosphorus-Europe to Asia. We took a lovely boat trip up the Bosphorus to the second bridge and back. I enjoyed the new perspective on the city from the water, the mix of vessels--from huge tankers to recreational boats-- and the many old and new structures along the shore. Later, our bus crossed over the bridge to the Asian side for yet another perspective.

Full day tour including the Bosphorus Straight. I went on a full day tour which included the Bosphorus Straight. I am so pleased I made this decision. The cruise along the river was pleasant with many great sights to see on the side of the river.
Serenity. While cruising the Bosphorus you unwind and feel so calm that nothing can get to you. amazing scenery and great opportunitity to see parts of town not accessible by car

Bosphorus Strait. A Bosphorus cruise is a great way to see Istanbul with views a tourist is unlikely to see any other way. Routes and times of course vary by the cruise you take, but most of Istanbul's significant sights are can be seen this way, including Ataturk's ship still docked in the straight.

Incredible! The only word to describe.. We started our cruise from the edge of the Golden horn in Old Town. It was a very hot day, but when we got on the water, it was like someone turned on the airconditioning! I was almost overwhelmed by the views. Cruising between the continents of Europe and Asia. We could just sit, relax, and watch as we glided by the Sultan's Palace, then, the fort that once guarded the strait, and then under the suspension bridges that connect the continents! Cruising down the Asian side, we were able to see so many beautiful homes lining the strait. I was so surprised to see the wealth that exists in Istanbul. Please take a cruise. It was a highlight to the trip!

Ferry ride was quick and inexpensive.. I took the public ferry ride from Besiktas to Ortakoy. I think it was about 1:50 TL. Buy the Istanbul Kart (card) at most stores for 20 TL (7 for card and 13 in fares) and use it on trahms (trams), metro (subway), funicular and buses (except the private minibuses, which as half price but may take a long time before leaving. They only leave when they bus is close to full).
A must see. We took a boat ride up the Bosphorous for a couple of hours. We got off at a small village which was not interesting, and we took a bus back to Istanbul. It was part of a tour.

We saw dolphins...:). We took the Bosporus tour as part of our conference dinner package. Our tour starts in the evening at 6.30pm until 11pm. The cruise gave us a different view of Istanbul, both the European and Asian side. We saw Dolmahbahce Palace and many beautiful houses along the straits. We also saw the impressive fortress... I think..Rumeli Hisari...It was a beautiful view...especially at sunsets. But the highlights of our cruise was watching the dolphins swimming beside our ferry...many of them...I had never seen dolphins this close before. It took us all by surprise...!!. Cruising the Bosporus is a must in Istanbul...and if you are lucky you get the chance to watch dolphins like us...:)

Just Amazing. Took a boat trip around the Bosphorus, there are tour boats for the tourists which don't coast much at all, it takes you from one side of the Bosphorus and brings you back from the other side.

Take the boat trip. We took the 1/2 day trip which went around and a reasonable distance up the bosphorus. Loved it and saw aspects of the city not to be seen otherwise. If you want to get to the Black sea, take the day trip
Worth it.. It was one of my best sightseeing experiences and is especially recommended is you are short of time.

Amazing!. Travelling on a cruise on Bosphorus is an amazing experience! watching the historic sites on the shore as you cruise along, while hundreds of seagulls following you. Make sure to do the cruise from Eminonu to A.Kavagi full stretch.

take the public ferry. No need to pay top price for a special private cruise. Take the public ferry! Especially the sunset/night lights cruise on Saturday nights. Brilliant! Join in with the locals singing and dancing on the Sat. night publc ferry.
Bosphorus, is such a romantic place. Very nice view... Take a ship- there are thousands- and take a tour aroud. You will discover an other view of this old and contemporary city of Istambul

Never a dull moment. We took a 2 hour cruise from just below the Blue Mosque up to the second bridge, up the European side and down the Asian side. There was something of interest at every point - palaces, grand hotels, restaurants and people enjoying the shoreline, green slopes with houses, apartments and life. The Turks clearly value this waterway and look after it well.Well worth the trip.

Ferry up the Bosphorus. Travel on the municipal ferry since it is much cheaper and goes the same way up the Bosphorus. Excellent day. We caught the 1.15 Ferry and returned on the 5.15pm. My daughter was happy - we saw dolphins which she managed to photograph!!!!!
dolphins. noone else on the boat saw them, and they were hanging around for a while. not bad for 10TL. got the ticket from the Official office at the ferry terminal. bargain!

Perfect boat trip!!. The best time is late afternoon so you can enjoy the sunset!!!I have been lucky enough to watch dolphins swimming next to us,great experience!!!Even their boat driving is similar to their car driving(total anarchy)

Up and down or just across, both great. Either way you see it don't forget together a fabulous fish sandwich from down near where the ferries go. We tok the kids over to the Asian side by ferry, things much cheaper over there and a great way to meet the locals

Take the Public Ferry!!. A good activity to do after you've been on you feet for a few days. We enjoyed a lazy day aboard the ship, with minimal trekking around. It's worth going all the way up to the last stop, and having lunch and walking around the little town before taking the ferry back to Istanbul.

The most magical waterway in the world!. Deep azure blue wide wavy waters running throughout from the Marmara Sea to the Black Sea dividing continents... Ships and ships and ships passing thru over the sea as if it is a busy motor highway.

Beautiful boat ride. You should make this trip...very nice...do the audio tour on the ferry! We didn't do the tour...just the ferry...good deal...watch the restaurants at the end...a bit of a rip off.

Cruising on the Bosphorous. We did a lunchtime cruise, not sure which boat. It was a nice enough meal, whilst cruising past the many sites and then we made our way up to the top of the boat to take photos of the many different places. It was a lovely day to be out on the water.

Man what a view. I've seen it from both sides, European and Asia. It's an amazing view, lots of boats, you can take a trip and sail around for hours, just be sure to choose the right season not to get any bad weather otherwise no one will adventure in the sea :)
Relax and enjoy. The tour was great. It took more than 2 hours and you could enjoy the buildings from both European and Asian parts of Istanbul.

Rather endless and dull. Everyone told us you have to take a cruise along the Bosphorus. I had my doubts, but went along anyway, hoping for the best. We took a regular local boat and sat in the open. A vendor came around with orange juice and toasted sandwiches. There was some commentary which was difficult to hear and not especially informative. The boat chugged along the coastline, passing houses and some palaces, but you couldn't see much and the pace was quite slow. Many people stretched out and drifted off to sleep, lulled by the chugging of the motor.

Bosphorus tour. We took the ride of 35 Euros a bit deceiving on the brochure , we assumed the trip included the show. We ended paying additional 10 Euros each. The show is nothing exciting. I don't think it is worth the money and late night.

Walk, coffee, walk, eat, walk, drink.... The Bosphorus is like no other place on earth. You just will never feel that way when you're on any other "boardwalk" or next to any other strait... It has a feeling about it - something that just captivates, that releases all your tensions. Every little "town" is just a little gem of its own. Start from Ortakoy and just continue walking by the strait, under the Bosphorus Bridge, get to Bebek - stop by for a cup of coffee at Bebek Cafe. Continue your walk towards Emirgan, but stop by Rumeli first. Have lunch at one of the restaurants - they are awesome. Continue on to Emirgan, stop by the Emirgan Gardens and the "Atli Kosk Museum". Then keep going to Tarabya, sit right by the water for a nice mid afternoon tea. You can end here, or just keep on going. The towns and the changing views will never end and definitely will not disappoint. Nevermind how much you are walking and the calories you are burning.

dont go for the expensive tours. There is a modestly priced 90 minute boat tour for 10 lira per person - it goes as far as the first bridge, quite an exhilarating journey, so much to see and so interesting. Also take the local ferry to asian Istanbul - you buy a token for 2 lira and use the token to go through the turnstile - its a 20 minute boat ride and 2 liras and 20 minutes back - quite a bargain and really easy to do
The East meets the West. Very informative cruise along the Bosphorus viewing both sides of Istanbul.
picturesque. It gives you a very good view of the two continents (Europe and Asia) and the tow bridges across it are very impressive. must go on the cruise to enjoy it fully.( visited May 2009)

impressive ship traffic. The Bosphories is along the city and you can see it form anywhere. It is impressive to see how many ships are moving across the strait including ferries connecting the European to the Asian part of the city
Must do in Istanbul!. We went for a 2-hour cruise on the Bosphorus and it was wonderful! The many sites, castles, palaces that you get to see are just amazing! Not to be missed if you're in Istanbul.

Good, but would have been better on a smaller boat. I thoroughly enjoyed the boat trip up the Bosphorus, but I would have liked it to be on a smaller boat with fewer people. We did the Saturday Sunset Cruise that took off right from the center of town and it was the largest boat out there. It was a bit of a cattle call and I felt more like I was on a commuter ferry boat. Look around and get one of the boats that isn't so crowded.

Take a night ride too. If you have time, take one tour during the day and one at night. We took one from the Asian side at night, at Uskudar and the Bosphorus is incredible at night with all the lights on and people partying along Ortakoy and Bebek.

Lovely ferry ride on the Bosphorous. We did a number of ferry rides on the Bosphorous as there are many interesting buildings, bridges and islands to see along the way.The water colour is beautiful on a sunny day so save the ferry trip for when the sky is blue if you can. We used a public ferry and also a private ferry to different destinations. There is no information on board so it is best to get an audio guide before you board. It has a GPS tracker and automatically comes on when you pass an important site.We went to one of the Prince's islands and it took about an hour to get there for only about $5 which was great value.
a trip on the bosphorus boat. we were disappointed with this trip - the boat went up to the 2nd suspension bridge and then came back - all a bit dull
Fantastic. Seeing Europe and Asia never wears out.The promenade, the Bebek cafes and the grand palaces and mansions are always a delight to see

Impressive but a little dirty. It's impressive because all the traffic in the area is keeping this strait busy all the time. It's also a little dirty, bt when you realise that it makes the link between Europe and Asia you can understand why it is like that. We've crossed the strait by ferrie and by bus, and it's a must f you visit Istanbul
beautiful.. the trip was good & worth the sunbaking we had..but beautiful place, palaces & fortress.u get to see dolphins as well

A great way to spend the afternoon. Loved the cruise up the Bosphorus. I would advice anyone wanting to do this to do it yourself rather then taking a organised trip, which are very expensive. If you take the tram to Kabatas station you will find a ferry port nearby from where you can take the Bhosphorus cruise for a fraction of the cost of the organised tours.

See 2 continents at the same time.. Istanbul is a city on 2 continents, Stradling the Bhosporus, the old part of the city is on the Europe side and the new part is on the Asia side. See both at the same time from a cruise boat on the Bhosporus.
Great Views. Great way to see how the city is laid out and see both Asia and Europe at the same time. Cost was only 12.50 tl or less than $8.00. Relaxing time and great photo ops.

Bosphorus via TurYol boats. Like any great city built on the water, if you don't see if from the water, you're missing some great stuff. Istanbul especially holds to this, with palaces up and down the shoreline. Save your money, and go with the locals on the Turyol 90 minute ride, which is only about $7 USD pp. They sell snacks and hot coffee, and narrate what you're seeing.

Beautiful blue waters. Boat trip on the Bosphorus is a must as is eating at the local fish sandwich stands and the pickles in the red juice cups! The Golden Horn side is calmer...but its all good. They serve small sandwiches, chai, juice on the public boats.

Great relaxing tour. Take the shortest 2 hour tour - It's enough - I cannot imagine the boredom on the 5 hour tour! The 10 lira standard tour is probably the best choice. The big ferry has an air conditioned area and the blaring hot top deck to choose from. The headsets are worth the 5 lira, especially to entertain the children. In two hours you will experience a good scenic journey of the Bosphorus straight.
Awesome boat ride.. What a relaxing hour. I couldn't believe how big Istanbul really is !! Taking the boat tour you really get a good feel of the city.
Ciragan Palace Hotel is right on the Bosphorus. The most exciting and interesting city we have ever visited

Boat trip Golden Horn and Bosphorus.. Picked up from hotel delivered by coach to Pier3 in Eminonu. Cruise under Galata Bridge, Bosphorus Bridge and Sultan Ahmet Bridge. We stopped on the Asian side for yoghurt then again at Maidens Castle. 3 hours of lazing in the afternoon....lovely after walking all morning. Refreshments on board. Next time we'll do the evening one for the night views of the City which are spectacular.
a very nice trip. i like the sea, it was nice time when we was in the boat between the sun and the sea. i like it too much.

Best deal in Istanbul. It is a wonderful day trip though it's too bad the stop at noon is 3 hours . It is only 25TL each for a round trip . Make sure that you are there early enough and fast enough up the stairs to get a good seat in the shade ( on the left side both going and returning )

Easy travelling. To go over to the Asian side daily the ferry was the best and easiest way to go. So cheap. And frequent just a pity it did not. Run during the night. So we had to take a taxi. Over the bridge which was spectacular
Ideal day trip. Travel up and back by ferry with lunch in a little fishing village.Very scenic and relaxing day
Can't miss. Great view all around while having a peaceful boat trip.
Take a ferry ride. We jumped on the ferry and rode across to the Asian side of Istanbul
Bosphorus cruise!. The best way to enjoy the strait is by cruising along the sea. The place is so beautiful and I enjoy my 1hour cruise.
Bosphorus Strait. Was great to be on the Bosphorus but the hour plus wait for the boat to 'fill up' and the hour and half ride was a bit much.

good way to see istanbul. we did the boat tour and it was a great way to see bothsides of Istanbul.Make sure you get a boat that is large and with a good tour guide.We were on the african queen and was'nt the best.

Boat trip - unmissable. Lots of operators offer boat trips up the Bosphorus and back.. up to the second bridge, the one beyond the famous one. Don't take the 70 euro one.. there are plenty of boats offering a very nice one hour or 90-minute ride for 10 lira (less than £4 sterling). Very well worth doing.. great views of sumptuous villas on both banks. And superb views back to the city itself, Euorpean and Asian.
Gorgeous. Take a boat ride down the strait..inexpensive and a nice break from walking tours!
from Marmara to Black sea. Loved our cruise along the Bosphorus. Take the public ferry and go all the way. The private tours don't go to the Black sea.

so happy to see the dolphins are back!. Seeing dolphins again in the Bosphorus is such good news. There were several swimming along our ferry as we headed up to the Black Sea for lunch. Do get there early to get in line for a good seat! The audio tour is quite good.

Great Place for Istanbul Day Walk. We walked from the northerly suspension bridge to the southerly suspension bridge across the Bosphorus (about three miles). In addition to enjoying great views of the Bospherous, we walked by a fortress constructed in prepration for the Ottoman invasion of Istanbul, encountered many fisherman, and passed several good places to eat and/or drink.

Great trip. Great & amazing, hundreds of sculptured columns with a great light effects .It will take 2 hours to cover the Bosphorus Strait.There are 3 tours (morning, afternoon & night) .I recommend the morning tour (that stops on maiden tower), as it is less people & more enjoyment .The short tour is 2 hours & the full tour is 6 hours .
Amazing to see Istanbul from a boat on the Bosphorus. Go in the afternoon say lunchtime and it shouldn't be foggy

can be better than Venedik. the Bosphorus Area in the day late is beautifull but in the night is most beautiful. you should visit. do not matter if you go by private boat or by ferry but if you come to Istanbul you should visit.

Good views best done with audio guide. This body of water is what has made Istanbul so important so of course you should go up it and see the many beautiful buildings erected along it's banks. The trip is a long and the boat is slow so don't expect thrills, but a relaxing few hours.You don't get to see too much up close so I'd recommend the audio tour guide which has pictures as well as the histories behind the impressive works of architecture. On the public boat vs tour boat issue, consider that the latter includes lunch and the public does not. Considering prices at the final stop of the public boats trip, the cost is basically equivalent so unless your picnicking you're not saving anything.

A fascinating stretch of water. We took the 6 hour ferry trip with the audio guide ( this was a bit difficult to use but we managed to get adequate information from it). The water side suburbs along the European and Asian shores are attractive and interesting, and our lunch at a fish restaurant was delicious.I recommend this trip

Lovely way to spend a day. We took a leisurely boat ride up the Bosporus towards the Black Sea and embarked at a quaint fishing town for lunch. The whole ride took about 5.5 hours round trip and was a great way to see and learn about the amazing cityscape.
East married West. Magnificent and stunning views. The living proof of hamony between all peoples' of the world. Geographically grand and spiritually fulfilling.
A respite from the heat and the walking. A ferry trip gives a different perspective of the city and really shows the contrast between the two parts of Istanbul.

great cruise. we took what turned out to be a six hour cruise on the standard ferry which included a three hour stop over in a small village (Kavagi) just at the entrance to the Black Sea. This gave us the chance to treck up to the Fort on the hill for some exercise and a great view. catch the ferry next to the Gallata Bridge.
Gorgeous views of the Asian and European side!. Loved the ship, yacht and boat activity! There was something going on all the time.
One of the best places. Watching Bosphorus and the ships passing by, I could seat for hours and enjoy the view and the sea.
Super for a dinner cruise. I booked a dinner cruise through backpackers travel. The evening and night in the strait is very beautiful.
Between two continents. Strait between two continents, beautiful scenery, on both sides of the Strait. Nice buildings and luxurious palaces on both sides. Pleasant excursion boats.
bosphorus cruise. costs TL 12 for 1 1/2 hour cruise on Turyol ferries. have english speaking comments, but you have to listen very carefully.

Bosporus at day and nicht. Don't miss to take a bus tour over the bridge ! Keep cameras ready for WELCOME to ASIA and WELCOME to EUROPE signs !
Great to make a nigh tour by boat !!!! (1 hour just 10 Lira!)
nice boat trip. I enjoyed this trip . I would recommend you avoid the hot time of the day as it can be really hot

Beautiful. The bosphorous itself is vey beautiful the colour is just absolutely amasing. We took the short bosphorous cruise by accident, even though we got the tickets for the full bosphorous cruise. The guy at the ticket counter didnt bother telling us the cruise currently docked was the short one. Eventually however we relised becuase of the heat the 2 hour cruise was enough. Saw most of the major sites and the authorities were nice enough to refund the difference when we returned with half an used ticket.

Great scenery. I was very hesitant about taking this trip, but my wife insisted, and it was worth it. The scenery is great. You get to see all the greenery and the villas/condos on hill tops.The boat, however, was another story. Here are things to look out for:- The trip only costs 10 Turkish leiras for a 1.30 hr trip – so don’t get fooled- The hour leaves at specific times. Make sure to ask when – don’t just pay and hop onboard, otherwise you will end up wasting precious time (we waited for 45 minutes).- Make sure you get good seats – especially in corner areas in order to get pictures. When the boat gets going, everyone starts moving around and they invade your space/seat. Keep an eye on your belongings at all times.- Try to go in the afternoon when the weather cools down (yet sunlight is available) to avoid getting subburnt

One of its kind - Bosphorus Strait. Bosphorus Strait is simply beautiful and has its place in the most amazing river of the world. It is big and with Europe and Asia on two sides, really provides for a experience of a life time. People in Istanbul will never go hungry for the best fishes in the world is available right there and so many people are always fishing. They have really good restaurants every where. You must take the night cruise along Bosphorus if you are visiting Istanbul for the first time but make sure you get a good seat in the cruise ship and lots of opportunity to take very good photographs.

Great to do if you have a day. We caught a local ferry, it was really cheap, took 1.5 hours to get to the mouth of the black sea and the same back. We also used audio guides which was great to find out about the sights on the way.
A view worth remebering. You can not decide if a night or day cruise is more awesome to view this, so I think you should do both :)

Good... For about 30mins. . It was a lovely trip on the public ferry (which is how our tour guide took us) however we couldn't hear the tour guide and it was probably an hour too long. Not in my top 10 tours but a must do to say you've sailed between the two continents anyway.
Lovely. Lovely way to see this part of the city. The European side was much windier than the Asian!
Bospherous Boat trip. This was one of the best things to do to get a flavour of the town

Pleasant way to spend an hour or so but .... We enjoyed a river boat trip down the Bosphorus though it wasn't the most interesting excursion we had in Istanbul. The views of the city are certainly different from the water and of course the air is much cooler. There are many tourist boats plying the river which would be a cheaper option than we paid through our tour company.
Two hour tour. We took one of the local tour boats that anchor near the floating fish restaurants. It was great to see other parts of Istanbul from the water.
When East Meets West. Enjoy city view by renting private yatch or going to public boat where we could see Asian and European culture blend. Also try to see different atmospher city view at night.
Take the ferry. We loved our ferry ride. Make sure to bring a hat, it is sunny out there!
A lifetime is not enough to enjoy Bosphorus!. Everything related to Bosphorus is worth visiting...A suggestion: The private museums along the European coast...

Lucky to see dolphins. There's a full cruise that will take you up to Andolu Kavagi - a little fishing village at the end of the Bosphorus. It's a nice place to stop for lunch and then walk up to the Yoros Castle to enjoy a beautiful view. If you're lucky, you might also see dolphins on the cruise. :-)
Great Day. Took a bopat tour all the way up the Bosporus. Worth it- so much fun and so much to see!
Nice experience!. A ride by boat through the Bosphorus is a must-do!!!

Do the 90minute Turyol Bosphorous Cruise. Do the Turyol Bosphorous Cruise. The boat leaves from the western side of the Galata Bridge on the hour, every hour from 11am to 6pm on weekdays and every 45minutes on weekends till 7.15pm. The trip will only cost you 12 TL and is worth every cent. The tour is nonstop and takes approximately 90mins return. If possible sit on the left hand side of the boat for great photo opportunities. The ferries aren't huge so they get reasonably close to shore for brilliant photos. Take the 11am cruise so that when you get back at 12.30pm you can buy a fish sandwich from the fisherman on the decoratively moored boats that are right there where the ferry docks, they are so yummy! Have included some photos of the many palaces,mosques and fortresses you will see on this amazing cruise. Enjoy.

Scenic. The best if you must take a tour. We took a half day tour that included a cruise on the Bosphorus - this was the only part that was worth the time and money. The cable car ride (walked up a hill strewn with dead rats and queued for a 3 minute ride) on Pierre Loti hill next to a cemetery was a clear miss.
a beautiful sight. lovely any time of day or night from boat or sea. sometimes you can see dolphins following the ferry

boat trip. take a 2 hour boat trip and enjoy the sites and history along the way. Public boats do not have english guides but we found a captain who invited us into the wheel house and he showed us the sites. Very friendly people!
Ferry. The ferry will take you anywhere and serve you chai while you go! We rode just to enjoy the sunshine!
Don't miss it!!!. The full cruise was fantastic..Don't miss it, if you have enough time when visit Istanbul. It takes about 8-9 hours.

What a pleasure!. The vibes is excellent, we went on the ferry. Had fish bread at amazing boat restaurants. Eat pickled cabbage ... I think. Roasted chestnuts. Lot of action to choose from along the Bosphurus

Sultan's princesses houses along the shores. The wealth displayed in the palaces constructed for the princesses is wonderful. On the Anatolyan side beautiful residencial houses stand along the Bosphorus shoreline.

One of the most beautiful waterways. The boat trip in the Bosphorus (Bogaz in Turkish) is one of the (must do's) when you visit Istanbul. Basically, there are two trips: one which is done by a tourist boat with, live music, drinks or food on board; while the other is a traditional means of transportation between Thrace and Anatolia sides of Istanbul. Both are worth it, while the first might cost up to 50 Euros that other is 2 Liras :) it is upto you to decide. I am lucky enough to do both

Take the ferry. The scheduled ferry was wonderful. Not crowded and no babbling loudspeakers to disturb the peace. The final stop at the Black Sea features a lot of "aggressive" restaurants. We hiked up to the fort first and ate after we came down to wait for the return trip. The hike up to the fort is DEMANDING but worth it . .spectacular views and there is a restaurant up there which looked like a good option to those below in the town.
Great views.. The Bosphorus tours are clean (10 lira) for 1 hour tours and you get a great view of Istanbul from the water.
A boat trip around Bosphorus is must. We just took the local boat (10TL per person)to do the round trip of Bosphorus. It is beautiful and relaxing.
Turyol. Take this tour operator - do the 1 hr 30 mins - wonderful

Watch out for the Bosphorus dolphins. We took a ferry up to Anadolu Kavagli, closest point to Black Sea coast we really wanted to visit.High point was moment when some dolphins came within about 25-30 metres of our ferry!

One of the Highlights. Great way to spend half a day to catch a glimpse of Istanbul aboard a ferry. Brief stops at ports and a 3 hour stop at Anadolu KavagI. Small fishing village, great seafood and a hike to a Roman fort. Eat after your hike and get an English speaking headset with your ticket.

Don't miss it. Our boat trips on the Bosphorus were great. We took an ordinary ferry up the river first towards the Black Sea and our guide explained the important sites to us. On another day we went to Princes Island. There were few Westerners on the ferry and we found ourselves in conversation and interaction with Iranian and Iraqui families. It was great, and very cooling with the breeze on deck.

You have to get out on the water!. As with any great city on a body of water, Istanbul is best appreciated from the Bosphorus. A boat ride is as as simple as boarding a city ferry for 2 TRY and riding the boat to the Asian side (all the better to sample the fine restaurants there - Ciya Sofrasi comes to mind). I have wonderful memories of sitting in the stern of the ferry and watching the seagulls swoop down to our wake. Best way to see Istanbul's ultra modern skyline in the north of the city.

Stunning views, pleasant cruises but no audio guide. So I took a 2 hour cruise on Bosphorus. It was well worth it, as there is so much to see, a few palaces, gorgeous white large mansions, plenty of outside entertainment, lavish hotels, fun outdoor neighborhoods, you name it. The only downside with these cruises is there is no one saying anything about what you are seeing, and after half an hour of no guidance, it gets somewhat boring. I tried purchasing an audio guide, but they wanted to hold on to my ID. As I had only brought my passport, I absolutely refused, just to be on the safe side. Careful on the private individuals trying to sell you cruise tickets, they can be annoying and more expensive. Stick to what you were told to.

Perfect wat to wind down with great views of all Istanbul's waterfront.. After a few days tramping the historic sights there's no better way to chill out, soak up some sunshine and enjoy fabulous views of Istanbul taking the local ferry up and down the Bosphorous. A really enjoyable day out with plenty of meze and seafood restaurants at the turnaround point to choose from.
Spectacular views. The scenery and water traffic in the straights were phenominal

Use the Government-Sponsored Ferry and Save $. The Public Bosphorus Excursion Ferry leaves from Eminonu @ 10:30, 12:00, and 1:30pm – 90 mins each way, 25TL/pp R/T.
