Very relaxing cruise. Very relaxing and enjoyable cruise where you get to see the really nice and really expnsive houses by the straits!!
Cruising. Seeing both the Asian and European sides of turkey was very interesting along with ll the mansions, dolma he palace, the bridges to name a few.
Enjoyable cruise. Lovely afternoon seeing the sites of Istanbul from the water. Try to take the trip on a clear day.
LOvely 2 Hour Boat Trip. Picked up the tourist boat from Eminonu for a two hour cruise for 10TL each (about £3.50), Great value for money.
Must do Cruise!. This is the high-light of istanbul. One should definitely do the cruise as they take you along the different islands on the way and you see the entire city from afar!

If you only have ONE Day in Istanbul. Take a Bosphorus cruise (for everything else, buy a book). I recommend either the ferry up the strait or one of the quick ferries across to the Asian side. The views cannot be duplicated in pictures. And price on the Asian side are much more reasonable. Of course you should spend way more than one day in Istanbul!
boat trip. its the best way to know the bosphorus, if you take the whole day you'll be able to go to Asian Isanbul
From the Water. Totally different view from water level. Take the time and get onto a boat and travel the strait. Some good bargains to be had at the dock

Lots of sights to see. We went on the short trip as we didn't have a long time in Istanbul. This was fine but it would have been nice to have a little time stopping off somewhere. Would have liked to have gone up as far as the Black Sea but no time for that. Get on the boat quite early if you want a decent seat outside.
Nice relaxing day on the Bosphorus. I took the the all day trip as a way to end my week in Istanbul. Perfect way to wind down the week. Rumeli Fortress is quite impressive.
full day. get there an hour early and get seat at back on europe side for great views if weather good
I enjoyed a great Bosphorus cruise!. It is so great to take a cruise up the Bosphorus and see the city from the water! I loved it...bring a hat, sunglasses and a jacket!
Historical strait. Interesting especially by night. Nice view of Dolmabahce Palace on the european part. Dinner cruises with oriental dances.

great trip. went on a half day boat trip - 30TL and well worth it, amazing views and a good orientation of the city. The commentary from the guide was a bit sketchy and disinterested. TIP: take binoculars!
Istanbul's Heartbeat. What would this world-class city be without its water artery joining the 2 continents!

IBO Cruises. Ignored all TA advice as we were a group of 10 people. Complete rip off: No tour guide, just a young boy who annoyed everybody with his comments (eg. there is an orange cargo boat on our right) and no explanation of what we were seeing. Had been promised on confirmation letter a stop in Anadolu Kavagi...just stopped for an hour in a deserted village, which I am still trying to find the name for. Waste of time/money. I have complained, but the company hasn't even acknowledged by email!!Worst of all was the lack of security. No lifebelts, no security talk. Frightening.
East Meets West. A fantastic experience and well worth 2 hours out of the day
OLD TOWN AND THE RIVER. Fantastic views of the European and Asian sides of Istanbul.
Take a short trip on the water. I was sceptical, but pleasantly surprised by our boat trip on the Bosphorus. This dividing line between Europe and Asia is well worth a couple of hours.
Unbelievable views. No shortage of sights to see, a cruise is a must to get a sense of the city and its wonderful architecture
a wonderful cruise. Best if seen with a tour group or with some guidance. We enjoyed Neon / Key Tours. Be sure and ask for Tolga, a fantastic and knowledgeable tour guide.
In istanbul take the ferry. we took the ferry, the view of the two Turkeys were wonderful, the guide had a lot of story to tell. Little breezy carry a sweater or a covering.

Its Europe!..No wait..Its Asia..!...No no!..Its Europe!. Thats exactly what you' ll see...Take a bot trip...Look to your right to see Asia...Turn to your left to watch Europe..What better place can be found to walk or take a boat trip at?...If you go to Galata part...You'll eat the cheapest but most fantastic fish in Istanbul..You'll notice the men wearing old fashioned, Ottoman style clothes serving fish in bread..along with pickles or pickle juice. Might sound gross..just try ityou'll love it...Not for you...Then you can take a walk under the Galata bridge where you'll find plenty of restaurants and bars to dine at. With the screams of seagulls, the view of hundreds of fishing lines from the people on the top part of the bridge and the historical landscape of Istanbul, anything you eat will taste fantastic.Not for you?...Then maybe you are someone who likes to dine at fancy restaurants...Go to Bebek...Plenty of 5 star restaurants there which will guarantee you only the best sea food...not only in Turkey but maybe in the world...Get ready to pay $$$ or even $$$$ but still be sure that it will be worth it...If you like taking photos...take as much as you can...If you have professional cameras you can go down to Balat or Goldenhorn and take fantastic pictures..
Fantastic. An amazing opportunity to be in two continents in the same day and to ride across the river that divides them. Beautiful view everywhere you look, fantastic. A must on your trip!

Best Seafood. First, be prepared to be harassed , bombarded by the resturant staff. under the bridge. Yes, the places to eat are under the bridge. Don't be grossed out. I thought the same thing. I suggest walking to the very end ( from old city toward Gallata bridge ) there you will get the best value for your meal, better service and wait staff. I guess most people give up and stop at the beginning.

Be sure to take a boat ride here.. It's best to view this area via boat. It may be the only waterway that bisects 2 continents. Try to choose a clear day. Often fog and mist enshrouds the shoreline limiting the view.

Castle closed at Anadolu Kavagi. An excellent relaxing trip to enjoy both sides Bosphous sites. The audio guide is a good choice. Beware that the Genovese Castle located at the top of Anadolu Kavagi is closed now, so you can only jump to it to have a splendid view of the Black Sea but no enjoy the views from the former courtyard.

Enjoyable. Taking a cruise on the Bosphorus was an enjoyable breaking from all the walking. There is a public cruise that leaves at 10:30 in the morning but is almost 3 hours roundtrip. Rather than take up that much time, we just went down by the river at the beginning of the Galata Bridge on the Old Town side where private boats wait to offer you a deal. We immediately ran into a guy who offered the tour at 25 lira per person. We easily negotiated him down to 15 lira a person (knowing 10-15 is the typical rate). It can get cold, so bring a jacket!

A grerat way to see the old, new, rich and opulence of Istanbul. Do not book your boat trip with a hotel or tour company, just go down to the Portside by the Galata Bridge and book direct with anyone of the tour boat companies and thyen walk on and enjopy the cruise. Going up, the best attractions are on the left of the boats and coming back, they are of course a few on the other side.
Cruise between Europe and Asia. No visit to Istanbul can be complete without cruising on the waterway between the continents.
sea strait trip between two continents. amazing views, very nice houses on the side, hotels and old palaces.. excellent
Absolute must!. Absolutely breath taking views travelling from the European side to Asian side of Istanbul! Can get a bit windy, so bring a light jacket.

Bosphorus Strait Boat Trip. Worth the trip but watch out for smaller boat holders who will show you a pic of a great bid tour boat and take you to a rather more modest one with no commentary. If you aren't fussed about the commentary the small boat (takes about 30 people) is good value.

Take the boat almost to the black sea!. We took the one day excursion, at a very good price - 25 TL per person. The boat took us up the Bosphorus for 2,5 hours, then a 2 hr. break at a small village where you hike up to a 14th century fortress and can see the Black Sea from there. Back 2 hours. It is worth getting the audio guide. We were amazed at the quantity and quality of historic palaces and castles on the way - having expected mere fishing villages!

Best on the 2 hour non-stop tour. Enjoyed the trip to the Black Sea and back. 3 hour break at Black Sea end with a derelict castle to climb to, and a bevy of pushy restaurateurs to deal with on the quay.Not much meaningful content to the stay there.The audio could have been much better and more helpful.

Excellent value sail on the Bosphorus. We thoroughly enjoyed standing on the deck feasting our eyes on all the wonderful palaces and mosques visible from the water. We even had hot coffee brought to us on deck. The loos had toilet paper and soap and were very clean!! Just where you get off the boat sample the sardines freshly caught and cooked. An authentic, delicious experience.
Find a cruise. We found a cruise for under $7.00/person. It went out for 90 minutes. Don't miss the chance to see this place from the sea.

Great to view what is in Instanbul.. Grab one of the many ferries / tours charing around 10TL for the trip. Grab a tea on the way, and have a guide book to let you know about the numerous sights along the way.
Dull. Took the boat trip. Very inexpensive. Sights were not very impressive from the boat. The river always had a haze over it.

Gold Horn view. At Park Gülhane, beside the Topkaki Palace, you can find the Setüstü Cay Bancesi to drink tea with a fabulous sunset view at the Gold Horn (below the roof restaurant of Topkakii Palace). No entrance fee, a local place.
What a view--with the right guide. Rivals the San Francisco bay--but much bigger, with significantly more history (of course) and sites that are an amalgum of the EAST and the WEST.
Lovely scenary. We have a lovely 2hrs boat trip along the strait with a n excellent travel guide from Magnificent Travel Agency Turkey. got to see from both European and Asian site of Istanbul.

Trip on the Bosphorus. Liked - a boat trip on the Bosphorus. Went on a boat with an excellent guide that made it interesting. Also went on ferry to Uskadur, which gives you a different feeling (how do you buy ferry tickets?

The one of the main areas of istanbul. One of the best places to walk near Bosphorus Strait is near Dolmabahce Palace, Ortakoy, Bebek, with it's great parks and many kafees, restaurants lokantas located near the strait
Don't Use Plan Tours!!. Very interesting to cruise up and down the Bosphorus, but don't use Plan Tours, they are about ten times more expensive. Just get on a boat at the docks!!!
I love it!. Definitely something worth of seing. Monumental and magnificent.

East meet West. It was a truely wonderful experience to catch the local ferry which runs the Bospherus Strait. On either side of the straight you see the contrast of Eastern Oriental influence against the other Western side. You feel the history of the geographical location of Turkey and instanbul
Bosphorus Cruise. Taking a cruise allows for viewing some gorgeous sites bordering the Strait.
Beautiful and lots to see. I recommend taking a boat ride around the Bosphorous from Marmara up to the Black Sea. There are a lot of historic buildings and amazing architecture to see.

water water everywhere. I got to spend time on and near the Bospherous. Taking the ferry from Eminounou to Kadikoy was great! They still have some traditional ferries and you can watch the other boats/ships and sometimes dolphins as you cross the water. There were also many places to stroll along the water for both sides.Then we took a boat cruise up the Bospherous to the Black Sea and got a great view of more ruins, castles, traditional ottoman houses, and a sense of the different areas of Istanbul. This was one of my favorite things to do.
its the joy of the day , every thing you see will make you think more and more about visiting istanbul again and again .. you will never get enough of it , i like every thing .
A boat ride along the Bhospherous was nice to be able to see both sides of Istanbul.. The views of both sides and the cable car was also nice.

Cruising in the afternoon. This is a real must and is a great way to relax after a long morning walk around the sights. We went with "She Tours" who we're excellent and picked us up from the hotel. You will see some unforgettable sights from the water
Invigorateing. Great to be out on the water and get adifferent view of the city.We had a delightful lunch up the coast

Ferry and cruise is best. The ferries were cheap and easy to acess and give the feel of the bosphorus as the everyday experience of istanbul Commutors. You can get to many interesting stops and wander from there.We took a cruise only as far as teh Fatih Sultan Mehmet bridge so I don't know what I missed by not taking the longer cruise to the "mouth of the Black Sea". Even on the shorter cruise, we saw what I wanted which was the yalılar (houses) on the edges of the strait and the views of the palaces from the water.

Take a boat trip. There seem to be plenty who offer trips on the Bosporus. They range from huge ferry type boats to teeny weeny things like the one I sailed in. But, for 10 TL each and lasting a little over an-hour-and-a-half, I have no complaint. It is a very satisfying way to see the Bosporus, and Asia, and Europe all in the one trip. Also, it enables you to take photos of the Dolmabahce Palace from viewpoints unavailable on the land.

The cruise. We had two trips on the bosphorus. the first on the local ferry which was packed as it was a sunday, not a good day if you want to see anything. It was interestin but nothing special. the second was a dinner cruise by night which was fantastic and worth every penny, the skyline at night is amazing particularly the bosphorus bridge.

Cruising along Bosphorus Strait. Crusing along the Bosphorus Strait is very worthwhile. It gives you some time to see the entire view of both the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. I highly recommend taking a cruise boat from Eminonu just before the sunset. Taking a sip of Turkish cay as you cruise along the strait is the best way to absorb the wonderful views and landscapes of Istanbul!

Busy waterway, so much to see. Loads of ferrries, all very cheap (80 pence for a single trip) criss crossing and running the gauntlet of the large merchant boats travelling to the Black Sea. The new tunnel to take the trains which is nearing completion is a major feat of engineering and will revolutionise Istanbul's transport system
super trip. Take the longer trip, don't be put off by the three hour wait for the return trip - it passes in no time ang gives the chance to ezplore a little outside the city
Amazing. Take a boat trip and youı will be captivated by amazing views.
Take a boat ride. Great to see the Asian and European sides of the city from the water. The Asian side of Turkey is largely residential . Spectacular waterfront homes.
Bosphorus boat tour. Loved the boat trip, under the beautiful bridge. But... the best thing was the amazing views of the old city walls.
beautiful. Try to find a restaurant for dinner with a view of the Bosphorous Strait

Boring. It was a litle boring and the guided tour was speaking in 4 different languages so, we had to concentrate really hard all the time to understand what the guide was saying.But the cruise was certainly boring.

Bosphorus Cruise.... The Bosphorus Cruise is a must, depending on which cruise you select it will take anything from 1.5hrs to 5hrs. You can choose from private to public cruises and prices vary! TIP FOR ALL: If you want a standard cruise along the Bosphorus up to the two bridges then book it from the harbour in Eminonu as it is much cheaper about 11 LIRAS. If you book the same cruise from an excursion place it would cost about 30Euros.The cruise is great and goes past the two main bridges of istanbul, the dolmanbache palace, universites...Overall a pleasant cruise for peanuts!

A ride through history. Take a Bosphorous cruise while you are in Istanbul. It's a great way to get a feel for the size of the city, and to see the sights from the water. We took a guided tour, and then a couple of days later, took the ferry on our own, stopping on the Asian side for lunch. Highly recommend! The ferry is 2 Turkish lira (about $1.25 US when we were there). A bargain!

Fun afternoon. we took the public ferry from the terminal almost to the Black Sea. it provided a wonderful view of Istanbul and some amazing houses along the way. Do not expect to be able to return immediately as the ferry stays for two hours before turning around. there is not much to do in the little village other than have lunch, but many restaurants fight for your business and it is very entertaining. Finding the right window to buy a ticket is also fun - the window only opens about 10 minutes before the ferry is due.

Great way to see a lot. A boat trip on the Bosphorus is a lovely way to take in a lot of the sights. You see Topkapi Palace, Dolmabahce Palace, Sulimaniye Mosque etc all from the water. The trips also give you a chance to admire some of the stunning waterside homes.

Not to be missed. We took a long tour till Anadolu Kavagi, the weather was sunny and we got red noses, despite the temperatures were not very high and on the boat it was very cold. I loved the trip a lot, we got good places by the window (and it's also possible to walk back and forth to make sure you capture the amazing views.). In the final point we had around 3 hours to walk around. We saw shops, cafes and fish market (there's not much to see there), then we cose a nice restaurant and set on a sunny terrace. By that time the wind stopped and we took off our jackets and just relaxed, sipping good wine eating the freshest fish i've ever seen. I still remember this trip as one of the happiest time of my life.

Best to take the 2 hour version. We took the 2 hour cruise which was actually 1 1/2 hours in length. it was interesting to see the sights from the Bosphorus, but the 6 hour cruise would have been to long, although that cruise includes 2 hours for a stopover lunch.
Take a boat ride. We took a boat ride after we stolled in Ortakoy, after a night of too many drinks. The view never bores, and the breez was great to feel fresh again.

Consider the alternatives. The Bosphorus Strait is amazing and a trip to Istanbul is incomplete without a boat tour. It is, however, a good idea to consider the alternatives. The standard tourist tour (at 15TL; 25TL return) is clearly not worth it. It takes a full day (10:30-17:00) and is not particularly exciting. It is a straightforward tourist attraction.A much better alternative is to cross the Bosphorus with the regular ferry to the Asian part of Istanbul (2TL). We went from Karakoy (at the Galata bridge) to Kadikoy, where we spend some time. We went back from Kadikoy to Besiktas. You get the same views of Istanbul (both the old town, the Dolmabace palace and the bridge), but it costs less money, it takes much less time, it is the same type of boat, and you are not surrounded by tourists.Alternatively, one can take the bus (or taxi) half way up the Bosphorus. Particularly the Sakip Sabanci Museum is worth the trip (check the exhibitions). Bebek is a lively little town as well. Taking the bus gives many of the same views and takes less time as well, as you do not have to wait for the boat back.

Great trip, would do it again- bring something warm to wear. I found the Bosphorus River trip very enjoyable. You can observe the beauty of Istanbul from your both. Getting a good seat is a bit competitive as many, many, many people will rush on the boat. Many more will think nothing of blocking your view to take photos. If you can get over the rudeness of human nature, you will greatly enjoy this trip. Bring something warm to wear and the breeze gets cold as you get closer to the Black Sea.

Amazing. Whether you take a traditional Istanbul ferryboat, or a smaller, faster TurYol , Dentur Avrasya, or other boat, you're sure to enjoy a tour-cruise up the Bosphorus. You can do it in as little as 1.5 hours.You set out from one of several ferryboat docks, including the Eminönü ferryboat docks (on the Golden Horn between Galata Bridge and Sirkeci Station), Kabataş docks, Beşiktaş docks, or Üsküdar docks and head north toward the Black Sea. The most impressive sights are along the southern shores of the Bosphorus, nearest to the city: Topkapı Palace, the mid-Bosphorus Maiden's Tower, the Selimiye Barracks (where Florence Nightingale worked), Dolmabahçe Palace, Çirağan Palace, Yıldız Park & Palace, the chic art-boutique-and-cafe scene in the village of Ortaköy.It is really something we must do in Istanbul.Unforgetable.

Guide Guney Presents. Being the only interconnection between the Black Sea and the Sea of Marmara, Bosphorus from ancient times on encountered the magnificent splendor of various cultures. Paintings of Ottoman Sultans and populace on their boats and ferries of hunting, war, tours and rituals give a visioary understanding of a specific glorious imperial living.Bosphorus mansions, palaces and chalets on the coastline gives a real historical and divine view even today, while breeding the birds on ferry trips.Interesting, historical and worth-to-see neighborhoods on the Bosphorus are Arnavutkoy, Ortakoy, Rumelihisar, Bebek, Besiktas, Emirgan, Uskudar, İstinye, Beylerbeyi, Anadoluhisar, Yenikoy and

Best part of our stay in Istanbul. You will truly be missing out of you go to Istanbul without a Bosphorus ride. We got to the ferries early for tickets, because they fill up fast and let me tell you... you've got to be quick to get a seat outside! We took a ferry to the last top on the Bosphorus (I can't remember the name) and then we took a local bus all the way back to Istanbul, stopping in towns along the way. Everyone was so friendly, many spoke English and were happy to help us when we had questions about getting around.
Two Continent Bridge. A long bridge that make two contintent united, ASIA and EUROPE... Acrros the bridge, brings a good experience on it

Europe and Asia in an hour and a half. Loved the chance to see Istanbul from the water.. from tiny fishing boats to huge gin palaces, run down fishing huts to ridiculously opulent houses of milllionaires, a tapestry of life unfolds as you sail up one side and then down the other closer to the Asian landmass. It is fascinating to see so many different levels and stages of building and development in such a short space of time. If you are going now, wrap up warm, the wind is pretty chilly. In summer time it will be welcome chance to get a breeze and cool down. Don't get ripped off, there are so many touts offering different cruises. The main company have an official kiosk and even though you might have to wait up to half an hour after they say you are leaving ,as they fill up places, you will get your full time on the tour.
magic. Istanbul's beauty.Dont forget to take a long trip rather then a short one unless you have little time to spend and you will love every moment of it.Ferrys from Eminonu docks every hour.

To have a better impression of Turkey !. When you visit Istanbul you are always in Old Town and you may think that Turks are still living in two storey wooden houses with no parking area. To see our contemporary way of life, a two hours Bosphorus Cruise will be enough and that will relax you after long walks during classical tour.
Fantastic Day Out. We took the coach trip which showed you the sights of Istanbul and then caught the boat after lunch. Well worth the trip
Bosphorus Strait. Interesting to follow the coast by boat. Cold and windy in mars!
Great tour with a good stop for lunch. We enjoyed the official tour which takes about 4 hours with a good stop for lunch at the village by the opening to the Black Sea.

Breezy but fun boat trip. A boat trip along the Bosphorous is a must - sounds tame but everyone who does it enjoys it. Choose times carefully as the boats can be busy. Take some maps with you so you can identify sights along the way and don't forget the camera and sun screen.

Boat trip. We took a boat trip to the first bridge. Try the public ferry not the pricey tourist boat. Good, but too short. the other trip (7 hours) is too long. The river(s) really made our stay special.

One of the best activities in Istanbul. DO NOT take a prebooked tour. they would overcharge you and the trip will not be as rewarding. Instead take the local ferry service boats(IDO and Sahliyar Hatlari) which run bosphorus cruise services from their dock in Eminonu(which can be reached easily by tram or bus).The tours cost about 10 TL each and are well worth their weight in gold.
Very scenic. To fully appreciate its beauty, I recommend taking one of many cruises up and down the Bosphorus.
Breathtaking. The views that you will experience here is amazing cannot beat it

Excellent Cruise!. We had the best time on the cruise through the Bospurous Strait up to the Black Sea. Saw dolphins, castles, marines, shopping and ate the larges, loaded potato I have ever seen. It was a cherished experience and would love to go back...
Beautiful.. To think that this was and is the divide between Asia and Europe. Cruising the Bosphorus gives you great vistas of both sides and lets you appreciate the geography of Istanbul.

A Natural Jewel. Just take the public ferry boats up towards the Black Sea and enjoy a wonderful day taking in the sights and understanding how and why this was the capital of numerous empires.I disliked living in Istanbul given its size and traffic, but I there aren't that many cities that can be in the same league with Istanbul, especially if you are a tourist.

Perfect day trip. Well worth taking a cruise up the Bosphorus and over to the Asian side. We found one, not too expensive and included lunch on the other side. The boat was a bit of a tub, but the guide was good fun and very informative. It's a great way to see parts of the city you might not otherwise see.

too much expectations?. it's a good way to spend a couple of hours but the view from the boat it's not so astonishing .. maybbe because of the awful poor building alon the coast ... but ... this is Istanbul as well ...

A BOAT TRIP TO ANOTHER CONTINENT. We went out on the Bosphorus for a trip around the Bosphorus Strait, from the port at Galata Bridge. So interesting looking over the Golden Horn, and travelling as far up the strait as the beautiful bridge itself. Refreshments available on board. Don't bother eating at any of the fish restaurants under the Galat Bridge though....stale oil.
Enjoy the sun setting over Europe while enjoying a nice cup of cai (turkish tea). 4 lire back and forth. Worth every penny of it. While on the Asian side walk around and feel the atmosphere.
A Little Local Outing. Take the local ferries up the Bosphorus. A guided tour is not needed. And make sure to try the fresh yogurt with powdered sugar along the way.
magic. stop at the fisher boats, and eat a sanduich, or just wait the sun comes down, you won't forget this.
Beautiful water. Great way to enjoy the sights along the Bosphorus Straight. Made our way to the last stop on the Asian side and hiked up to the castle ruins. Gorgeous blue water. Very relaxing!

At the juncture between two continents!. Our Hilton Park SA hotel had a great view of the Bosphorus Strait. The afternoon we arrived, we enjoyed a wonderful snack - some fruit and cookies with a bottle of Turkish red wine - looking out our window and pondering the majesty of the Bosphorus. There is some sort of magic to it, forming the border between Europe and Asia as it does.We had many moments of sweet repose sitting in our hotel room looking out at the river. And we also took a cruise of the river, heading north and passing under the great bridge before returning to the boat's quay on the Great Horn.
Cheap Thrill. Consider picking up a fresh fish sandwich before boarding and then enjoy the neverending supply of hot sweet turkish tea
Inexpensive trip with a glorious view of the city.. Crossing the strait on the ferry gives one a view of the city like no other. A plus is that you're with the locals and not the tourists.
Amazing. Taking a boat and wathing two contient at the same time. Wow this is something you can not explain. Loved it.
Interesting. Very interesting. worth it a going by boat to see both sides of istanbul (europe and asia)
Better than Venice. Take one of the ferries up and down the Bosphorus. Visit the small towns on both sides. Or call a water taxi. Amazing blend of history and electric modern commerce.

No cruise in winter season. I had hoped to do the full cruise with several stops but they only begins in April. There are many short (2 hour) trips. I'd recommend the IDO tour which is a bus boat combo where you get to stop off on the Maiden Tower on the Bosphorus

Relaxing boat trip. Istanbul can be very exhausting because of the crowded streets, constant shouting and traffic's hell.... It's very pleasant to hop on the Bosporus cruise then and listen to the great audio guide on board while relaxing in the sun. Summer retraits and palaces are impressive and you'll get a mediterranean vibe eating at the fish restaurants at the end of the trip.
Cruising between two Continents. You must cruise over the Bosphorus to be able to say you have really visited Istanbul!
had lovely and interesting boat trip on the Bosphorus.. We were lucky with the weather and the commentary on the boat was just enough info without being annoying.
Good view of Istanbul. Even if your are a short term or long term visitor to Istanbul, a bhosphorus cruise is really a good way to experience what Istanbul really looks like and its diversity

A must see, but i hate these boat trips. Don't get me wrong, the Bosphorus boat trip is a must. You have to do it. But no matter where I go in the world i tend to get tired of the boat or ferry trip after a while. They tend to be toooo long
We swam across!!. Get training and swim from Asia to Europe in this exciting race across the Bosphorus

Taket it in the first day during sunny weather. If you want to see bosporus strait in a tour, i suggest to take the tour at the first day. As you will get your bearing on the city. Istanbul is very big with 2 continent. hence taking the cruise of bosporus will help you to see and check the list that fit to your interest. And more importantly, better go there during a sunny weather as whn its foggy and rainy, its a little bit difficult to appreciate the view..

Take the ferry!. I took the ferry with a couple I'd met on the airplane from the states, and we hiked to the top of the hill to ruins of a castle above the fishing village. From there we could see the Black Sea. The lunch we had at a restaurant just below the ruins was delicious, and the view simply magnificent. A day well spent!

One day trip. This time we used public transportation (bus). There are some beautiful villages on the European coast: Sariyer, Therabia, Ortakioy. There are many nice taverns and coffee shops on the coast. The other way to see Bosporus is by boat. The Turkish company of Turyol is much cheaper.
Totally enjoyable. Great insight into why Istanbul so powerful and important over the years,but wrap up warm out of summer!
worth a boat trip. We went on the Bosphorus on a cold but sunny February day. Very enjoyable and gives agood perspective on Istanbul. Should be lovely in Spring and Summer.
The Bosphorus. Before you go read a history of the Bosphorus and Constantinople/Istanbul. It makes that stretch of water a lot more interesting
Must for romantics :-). We spent our New Year's Eve at Bosphorus, atop a cruise with another 150 people on the deck. Unforgettable!!!

Easy to navigate. A 20 minute ferry ride, leaving every 1/2 hour and costing only 2TL takes you to the Asia side which is well worth visiting. Great street markets, excellent restaurants, and a non-touristy feel make this a fun trip. The ferry ride is quick, easy and the sights of Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, Galata Tower, etc. from the Bosphorus are great!

Trip along the Bosphrus Strait. Using a digital guide made the trip all the more interesting having information seeped into you as you travelled along. Then stopping at the small village of RUMELiKAGAGI at the Black Sea was a delight with a walk up to a tower giving great views followed by a meal of freshly fried battered sardines in an outdoor restaurant was wonderful. Just enough time before the return trip. Perfect on a bright sunny day.

It's is o intriguing to sit on a restaurant by the Bosphorous. Imagine sitting between two continents literally speaking! I'm intrigued and awed to know that I'm in Asia and Europe at the same time. Wonderful feeling if you're experiencing it at the Bosphorous Strait

WOW. This is certainly one of the very best way to see Bosphorus and Istanbul. There is a beautiful city view which helps you to understand Istanbul's culture, history and even clues about the future. It’s a nice MUST ride and a very relaxing attraction. It has lots for both youngs and eldes. DON'T forget your camera. The only thing you have to take consider is the weather. Try to select a dry and sunny day with a clear view. You will take lot's of pictures. Simply Wonderful…
brilliant day. Caught the ferry to the end of the Bosphorus which took 1 1/2 hours had 3 hours at the destination before return . Saw some wonderful buildings and sights. Ate beautiful fresh fish .
excellent. Very nice strait, even in wintertime. Cruising is the best way to see Bosphorus. There are many clubs and restaurants along the coast.
beautiful .... beautiful city view from every where... a lot of buildings have stories to them. its better to have a guide or some information about them

A cruise or short trip on the Golden Horn are highlights. It wasn't until my 4th trip to Istanbul that I really got into the Bosphorus, but I'd say that's a must. The cruise is very, very enjoyable in good weather. Or you can just take the commuter-oriented Golden Horn ferry for a taste of the Bosphorus or just take the ferry to the Asian side for a short trip. Many choices, all enjoyable.

Like the guidebooks say - it's a Must!. We wanted to go all the way up to the Black Sea or at least as far as Sariyer as some guidebooks recommend but due to lack of time, we took a 1 1/2 hr non-stop cruise with Turyol Cruises for TL12 per person and were able to see the major sights along the river. It was a nice ride and relaxing and in my opinion, enough. The boat is ok (squat toilets) and food and drinks are available on board.
get the ferry cheap as chips. Where else can you go to Asia for lunch then sail back to Europe for coffee

Backpackers Bosphorous. We took the tour organsied by Backpackers and did the Bosphorous on the noraml ferry with the guide. The minibus arrived onb time, the guide spoke good English and was freindly and enthusistic, and guided u8s onto the ferry and explaoned as we sailed around. It was impressive, interesting and enjoyable. wortht he 25Euros, a great way to get your bearings.

Hold your breath. Difficult to describe. You have to experience this city with the sea through it. You can not be as lucky as I am who has studied 7 years next to it (Sipping the view every single morning with joy)
What a Cruise.... Superb view, great experience....our guide from Travel Shop Turkey, Mr. Hakan, had great knowledge of the buildings and sites on both sides of the Bosphorus...
A Must See. This will really give you an understanding of Istanbul's culture and history. We were on the ferry on an overcast day and it was still breathtaking.

Nice view!. I had a very nice boat trip through Bosphorus. It was terrifiс panorama of Istanbul with interesting stories from our guide. We was lucky to see many dolphins around our boat. My big advice to take this tour.
A great two hour cruise between Europe and Asia. This is another must to do in Istanbul. We can take the cruise every day if our time is allowed.

Have a Bosphorus cruise. Bosphorus straight divide Istanbul into two seperate portions. One on European side and the other one is on asian side. Bosphorus cruise is a must. A one hour boat cruise ride cost just 10 TL and tea is also available on board. The clear torquise water of bosphorus and the seenic villas, hotels and residenses on both shores were worth seeing. Summer retreat palace was also on asian side shore near Bosphorus bridge........

Tour of the Bosphorus. You can do it on your own by simply going to the ferries, but I decided to combine a tour of the Bosphorus with a visit to a very old mosque, the spice bazaar, Pierre Loti cafe on the Asian side, and Dolmanabahce Palace. It was a whole day tour offered by Turista, a fantastic tour agency, with lunch. Unfortunately a small snowstorm affected Istanbul that day and the next, but it was still worth the trip.

A nice ending to a perfect weekend holiday. After seeing most of the historical sights and hanging out in the cafes of Taksim, a nice ending to a weekend getaway would be to take in a cruise along Bosphorus Strait in early evening. It would be a good couple of hours just listening to music, taking snaps of the sights along the water's edge including a couple of palaces and some ottoman style houses. You can either do this on a boat offering dinner or just take in a ride to cap your holiday before heading home.
Lovely place to drive through, walk and dine. Splendid view and great place to dine. Enjoy bosphorous region, the bridge from Asia to Europe and very good restaurants by Bosphorus

Spectacular views - do not miss it. On a 2 hour round trip up the European side of the Bosphorus and back along the Asian side with fantastic photo opportunities at all times, we were the only 2 British people on board and many other nationalities tried to speak to us - we went on a Sunday when many local Turks use the ferry as a trip out.Make sure you use the 10 lira ferry - such amazing value and not the 20 lira tourist ferry. So many ticket touts try to sell you the more expensive outing and it's not worth it if you are remotely interested in the local people.Also worth using is the ferry to the Asian side - again not a single other British tourist and again amazing value at 2 lira each way. No-one spoke English "in Asia" but sigh language goes along way!
The link between Europe and Asia. A lovely cruise on the Bosphorus gives one an up close look at architecture especially with a good tour guide
dont miss it. this is one of the reasons we visit this great city i guess where europe meets asia, so do go here for sure

it just needs a good guide. it is a great sea tour that shows u the real beauty of Turkey, u really feel u wash your eyes... it just needs good guide to tell u each side stories and you are lucky if the weather is good to enjoy the boardsun... the feel is great that u are just in between two continentals indeed !!!

Take a cruise of the Bosphorus. Istanbul has to be seen at least once from the water. We took a cruise of the Bosphorus one afternoon, and a ferry to the Asian side another day. The ferries are super cheap at only about $1 each ride.
Lovely. Would advise anyone to take a more expensive trip with a guide explaining the lovely buildings on the Bosphorus.
Boat trip. We had the 2 hour cheaper boat trip and found it enough as it was cold. There are longer but more expensive trips which have stops included which would be more interesting.
A lot of sights and information in a short time. We don't normally take boat cruises, but our half day on the Bosphorus gave us a great intro to Istanbul.

Great views . . .. The line that divides Europe from Asia is marked by this busy international shipping route. The presence of large numbers of oil tankers passing through the city only adds to the sense that this waterway holds enormous historical significance. It is well worth a walk along the shore - especially in the dark.Also, at the entrance to the Bosphorus, just in the Maramara sea near the airport, you can see hundreds of ships waiting their turn for the narrow passage through the city of Istanbul.
Take a cruise!. You won't regret it. It's one of the best ways to see the rest of Istanbul.
Europe-Asia. Try to choose sunny day. Enjoy the boat trip. Nice pictures are guaranteed.
Take a boat cruise. A cruise on the Bosphorus provides a real sense of the city, and it quite beautiful. There's also a lot of history and some very nice views of the sights.
The deep blue sea.... I went into a tour in one of the tour boats that goes until the second bridge; the palaces, mosques, and extraordinary buildings in both margins of Bosphoro are breathtaking...

Ask your hotel. Very good trip. We were a bit confused because everyone is trying to sell you their trip on the Bosphorus. We asked our hotel and they recommended excellent trip that only cost 12 Turkish L
Lucky day. It was the first day of our trip when it didn't rain. We were happy to enjoy this wonderful boat trip.

Most relaxing cruise economically. We selected the Kisa Bogaz Turu, Short Circle Cruise by the Sehir Hatlari (public ferry organization) for 10 TL. You can ride inside, outside or on-top and enjoy the beauty of the Bosphorous. If you want the guided tour, pick up the audio narrative for 5 TL. I like the ride and the views while drinking tea without the sound.

Fun boat ride. You get to see the dolmapacha palace, Asian side, pass under the continental bridge. Great for families.
Ideal for taking pictures.

Beware of the seafood!. This is a brilliant tour to take. The docks are by the Eminonu station (accessible via the Metro or by crossing the New Galata Bridge). During the summer, they have 3 departures that cover the length of the Strait, giving passengers a superb visual tour of the Old & New Istanbul in the European side & the structures in the Asian side. You'll get to see palaces, mansions, little towns & locals (mostly kids) jumping & swimming in the Bosphorus. The bridges are all gorgeous as well. However, I'd like to advice travelers not to order seafood in the restaurants because I had food poisoning. When I went to a pharmacy to ask if it were a common occurence, the personnel admitted that food poisoning is not uncommon from eating seafood taken from the Bosphorus. Have fun!

Commuter ferry to Kadiköy. I've never been to the Asian side of Istanbul before. Crossing the straight by ferry was a nice and pleasant experience. I went to Kadiköy and walked around the central area, the fish and Istanbul-Armenian cuisine is a must! An extremely colorful outing!
Beautiful!. We took a boat tour through the straight and really enjoyed it. I would suggest trying to take one closer to Sunset for the views.

The Trip. Ride on a boat from the dock under the Galata bridge, only a short trip up to the second bridge (about three hours including a stop). The ride cost us 25 Turkish lira per person the boat was not very big but it was still very comfortable to climb around in the European side and down on the Asian side allowed us to take a look at the beautiful palaces (the Dolmabahce) and beautiful villas that are present on the banks of the Bosphorus
The Ferry. The ferry was very crowded but we enjoyed every minute of our trip. So much so that we repeated the experience 3 times!Ane the Asian side was intriguing as well as fun.
Boat Trip. We went on a whole day trip including the Golden Horn and Bosphorus Strait areas. Excellent value, even in the rain of ealry January 2012. Much to see on both sides of the water.
Read Orhan Pamuk .... ... in Istanbul Memories. The amount of shipping traffic going to the Black Sea is simply amazing.
Amazing. Took a tour.. while it was cold and wet (no surprise in January) the sites, the shipping traffic and everything was exciting to see

Take a boat tour - for a view of the city from the water. To get another view of the city take one of the many boat tours available. You'll be able to spot many of the tourist sights from beautiful perspectives and also see some of the lovely hills in the surrounding area. The boats tend to go at hourly time slots. Be sure to take an extra layer as it gets quite windy and could leave you feeling quite chilly due to the wind.

Definitely take a boat tour!. I took the ferry/boat tour and thought it was really worth the price. There are so many historical sites visible from the water and the audio tour pointed them all out for me.
float. Take one of the many cruises that go around the bosphuros. Great scenery but without a guided tour I never knew what I was looking at.
A Must Do. You must arrange a boat trip in the daylight to see Istanbul at it's best.
Worthy a go. If you have the time It is definitely a thing to do in Istambul.
where asia greets europe. the beautiful scenic buildings on both sides of the straits. the chasing sea gulls and the continuous flow of ferries make it a place you just dont want to leave.

not the first day. i choosed to begin with the tour to the end of bosphorus the first day as we arrived very early and we had to wait for the rooms at 1 oclock but as we were very tired ........so keep it to the second or third day .....but i liked the long trip to the end of the bosphorus not the short one we took the long one
Use the public transit. We used the local ferries-It was excellent!!Went to both the Prince's Islands and to the mouth of the Black Sea.Interseting historical perspective for us.

Too much about nothing. Maybe December is not the best time to visit the Bosphorus strait, I can agree. We went one of those tours (40 TL per perso. The boat is quite small but comfortable. We stayed on the deck in spite of the low temperatures. It wasn't raining, so it was ok.There is no information given during the tour and this is a real shame, as you don't know what you see...unless you have a good guide with you. I think these boats should have their own guided tours. Everyone would take an advantage of this.The tour lasts about 1h30 and that was more than enough. It went all the way up to the second bridge (Fatih Sultan Mehmet) that links the European side to the Asian side of the city and then it came back. The view is not really amazing, even if of course, seeing the city from the boat is always something good.I guess if you take a boat to go to the Asian side (Kadiköy) is more than enough and it costs only 4TL (round trip).

Delightful excursion. Boarding a sight-seeing boat for an hour cruise on the Bosporus made a delightful morning. Interesting sites and buildings along the shore and a glimpse of both bridges between 2 continents.

Bosforo bosforo bosforo!. It is wonderful stayng relaxed on the boat while on the river coasts all the best private buildings of the city move in front of you.Very relaxing and nice.You cannot loos a fish sandwich on the harbour with local people before or after your cruise
Take the four hour cruise!. The best way to appreciate the fantastic beauty of the Bosphorus is take the long cruise. Sit back and enjoy!
Worth to enjoy!. It's worth to take a private boat and go all the way almost till Black see.

Don´t take the tour boat trip. We took the public transportation boat that connects european part with asian part of Istanbul, paid 2 TL (compared to 35 euro which you pay for the boat trip), made basically the same way as the turistic boat, made beautiful photos and were able to get off the boat at the other side (while at the boat trip you just make a round and get off at the same place).

Amazing view. We were fortunate to dine in at two great restaurants during our stay in Istanbul. Both these restaurants gave a beautiful view of the Bosphorus Strait and the New bridge. Try getting to the sea side restaurants and get a table by the sea. IT was the most serene experience sitting and dining and watching the Ships , boats, Ferries and jelly fishes go by.....

Not to be missed. Every first time visitor to Istanbul must take a Bosphorus cruise to understand the layout of the Bosphorus to the Golden Horn and Sea of Marmara, the relation of the European and Asian sides of Istanbul, and to view the beautiful yalis and palaces along the water.
spend 6 hours seeing two continents. I'd take the full ferry ride again. Worth the $13.00 for a full day's cruise and a reasonable fish lunch on another continent.
take a cruise. Take a cruise on the Bosphorus Strait and admire the beautiful buildings on both sides of the shore

Bosphorus cruise on Turyol. very average tour, no way close to the reviews, have had much better cruise experiences, took the short one ( 90 min), the audio description was pathetic and inaudible. if you have to do the cruise, look at options other than Turyol

Take the cruise. We took the day cruise to Anatoli Kavagi. Nice trip. Not too long. It was nice to get off the boat and hike up to the old Fort. We had lunch on top, which was really nice on a nice day. Worth the trip if you have the time.

took the evening dinner cruise. dinner cruise maybe interesting with the boat skimming near the shore for a closer view of the sites but it does not compare to a daylight trip with a broad view of the strait and the Marmara Seathe lights on the bridges though are gorgeous at night (and of course will not be visible during the day)
A beautiful strait. The strait is clean but windy. It need about 60 minutes to explore the strait.
A must have done!. The view is beautiful! So beautiful.... Forever in your memory!
Bosphurus cruise very worthwhile. On a beautiful day it is the perfect way to see the City from the water. Strongly recommend it.

A ferry tour is a must for anyone visiting Istanbul!. A tour of the Bosphorus Strait is a must for anyone visiting Istanbul. We did do a specific tour through a private operator for a good 3 hours doing the day-time, and than later we did sail through the Bosphorus for our Princess Island tour.It is an amazing tour, and we did both of them during the day time (the return leg of the Princess Island tour was at night, but we were too tired to enjoy the sail and bothered more of reaching our hotel room at the earliest!).I guess if the weather condition would have suited us better, we would have loved to sail in the evening also, and take in the magnificent views of the huge Bosphorous Bridge which are beautifully lit at night. The Bosphorous Strait literally separates Asia from Europe, so there is this interesting fact to the ferry tour too.There are interesting views on both sides of the Strait, with some nice landscape to look out for. Specially on the European side, you can see the Gulata tower and the adjoining neighborhood which has historical era buildings.A word of advice: the winds are very strong out there usually, and it is strongly recommended that you carry an extra jacket or pashmina for ladies. If you taking children with you, suggest you take a ferry that has both an outdoor platform as well as an indoor covered area, where you can secure the kids from the heavy winds incase they find it uncomfortable.
Waterfront fascination. Also take the ferry up to Eyup on the Golden Horn and back (only 4tl return).

small boat, great views. we went on a small boat after meeting a "hawker" on the walkway near the Galata Bridge. He said the baot would leave in 10 minutes, which turned out to be more like 20. We did get a ride over to where it left, one selling point was that the capitan spoke English but there was no history or tourist descriptions. It was nice however not to be on a huge boat and we had the choice to move about and sit part of the time inside and part outside. When we got back, we did have to walk a bit further to go to where we came from.
Cross over to Asia. We took the quick ferry boat trip to the Asia side for 2 TL (about $1.25) and then another 2 to get back about an hour later. It was night and it was quite pretty.

Cruise between Europe and Asia. It's very interesting to navigate through a strait where we could see Europe on one side and Asia on the other. But the better thing are the views that are beautiful. We can see fantastic houses with wonderful views, palaces, mosques and castles. And it's pretty exciting to pass under the bridge that connects the two continents.
Take time.. The waterway is beautiful. If you have a day to spare take the ferry from galata bridge and go north to the black sea. It's cheap and fun.

Nice boat trip.. We bought the least expensive tickets we could find and were satisfied with the three hour ride. The quality of the "tour" probably wasn't as high, but with a guidebook in hand, it was fine.
Romance in the night. Unforgetable trip on boat during the night / evening

Must-try Cruise along Bosphorus. Istanbul tour won't be complete without this tour..For only 15 TL, you can get a fantastic tour (and see the Maiden's Tower, etc) You can start the tour in Ortakoy. Plus, you can also eat/drink some snacks in the ship, and take fabulous photos!
Bosphorus ferry ride. a ferry ride or cruise if definitely in order. catch the European and Asian continents on one trip and enjoy the splendid views. sunsets are magical!

Up and down the waterway. Next time, rather than take the two hour trip with multiple stops, I would definitely plan the shorter water tour. Take a tour guide with you so you know what it is you are looking at. There is no vocal guide on the boat.

Impressive with European Flair. We took a Bosphorus boat tour and was surprised at how beautiful the European and Asian sides of Istanbul were. Lots of beautiful homes along the water mixed with castles, palaces and other historical sites. Rent the audio tours to get a good understanding of what it is you are looking. We got off the water cruise at Anadolu Kavagi and hiked up to the Crusader Fortress there. It wasn't well taken care of but it's still impressive.
Middle of Europe and Asia. There are many palaces on the way to Black Sea but once you are at the last stop, you have to climb up to the fort to see and enjoy Black Sea

Don't miss a boat rise on the Bosporus. However, don't bother with the tours if you can avoid it. Take a ferry. The prices are much lower and you can get most of the information from excellent guide books.

Another Istanbul Must Do. We cossed it on the bridge on the ferry and sailed up it. This gives a different perspective of the city and the palaces etc are very impressive from the water - views that just can't be replicated from the land.

Public Cruise is Cool. We took the public ferry for tourist which takes you along the bosphorus strait. It was November, so it was not crowded. Our guide took us to the back of the boat in the covered cabin, so were just about had the whole section to ourselves. The seats are comfortable, it's clean, and they have a waiter for limited service items. It was a rainy day so we primarily stayed inside, but it was still a good price for the trip. We rode almost to the end of the straights, then meet our driver to ride back to Istanbul. We stopped at the Chorea Church on the way back.

Obligatory beauty and a bargain. How easy, how accesible and not costly at all. Do not book a travel agency trip on the bosposporus. You can easily book a trip up to the black sea, with a lunch stop included for a few euros. Another trip is one day to the Princess islands. Same story. Hire a bike and do not forget to have coffee in the café above the ferry terminal ....not a tourist in sight - cheap and good! Another ferry idea is the one from Karakoy just across to the fenerbahce stadion for example. When the match is on severla rides are full and the vollage across holds man shops and good restos!

Cruise the Bosphorus. If you have the time, take a public ferry ride up the Bosphorus. The round-trip ride will take approximately 6-7 hours (which includes a 3-hour stop near the mouth of the Black Sea for lunch). The views of Istabul and the fishing villages the line the shores are spectacular, and you'll be stunned at just how blue and how beautiful the Bosphorus really is. Take your camera and make sure your batteries are fully charged. And if you plan to enjoy the views on the top deck, take a sweater or jacket.

Right between Europe and Asia!. The Bosphorus Strait divides istambul from the European to the Asian part of the city. The boat ride is nice, as you see both sides of the city, great mansions and historic buildings. It is a great, relaxed way of sightseeing this part of Istanbul.
A river. Take a boat cruise and spend some time looking out at the sights.

Scenic. We boarded a boat to take a tour up the Bosphorus and back, and were a bit disappointed to learn that it wasn't really a guided tour and so no one gave us any information about the site names along the way or what we were looking at. The hum of the engine was loud enough that we might not have heard anyway if a guide were trying to describe the sites to us. It was a nice way to spend the afternoon, but if you are at all susceptible to sea sickness, you're best off to choose one of the bigger tour boats that won't rock so much in the wake of the other boat traffic.

Cruise and a dip in the water. We had no idea what we were in for with our Bosphorus cruise up the Strait. Totally enjoyed each intermediate destination and we went all the way to the Black Sea, where we anchored and I took a dip. (BTW, the currents are STRONG and the water COLD, but it's worth it!)

A relaxing day......... I spent about 1/2 of a day sailing the Bosphorus.Lunch was included, beverages also. Great photo opp. You really have a chance to view the best of Turkish real estate. We went all the way to the Black Sea, returning after dark to see the dancing lights on all the wonderful bridges. DELIGHTFUL.

Bosphorus Cruise. You will enjoy a cruise on one of the ferries plying the Bosphorus if you like to be on the water.You will see interesting palaces and other buildings along both the European and Asian side, as well as several bridges and a fort. Some are narrated some not. We had a private guide. I wouldn't have missed it, but it is noisy if you are trying to hear a narrative.
Beautiful and glamourous. Breathtaking and teaming with ships. Definitely worth taking a short or long tour.

Two Continents at a hand's reach. Europe and Asia, the Bosphorus in between and take a boat trip (can be choppy...) to give you this sensational feeling of beeing right in between the two continents, held one another by the impressive bridge that joins the two parts of Istanbul...

Beautiful at Night. We took a night cruise with dinner through Istanbul Daily City Tours. The Bosphorus is gorgeous at night. The buildings and the bridge are all lit up and it's quite a site. I would definitely recommend going there at night.
Breathtaking. It's a wonderful way to see both Europe & Asia and some beautiful architecture along the Bosphorus strait.
Nice if you time. There are very nice villages in the coast, if you have time can be a nice half day trip. Use the public boat it costs few euro and it is the same then the organized trp+€.

Overrated but fun. First of all, its highly overrated and expensive place to dine. But, it does have a charm. Stand on the bridge and watch the locals fish. Walk along the strait and try the rice filled clam shells and watch the crowded ferries. There's never a dull moment in Istanbul and Bosphorus is no exception.

Take any cruise!. The cost is relatively cheap. Try to take the cruise around the sunset time for obvious reasons. Not only will you have a fantastic view but you will hear the beautiful calls of prayer from the many mosques on both sides of the strait.

Take a Sunny Afternoon and Soak It All Up. Perhaps our best and most enjoyable afternoon in Istanbul. It was a warm and sunny autumn afternoon; departing from the pier [Bogaz Iskelesi], crossing the Golden Horn and rounding it heading north through the city and along the Strait to the turn-around 1.5 hours later was a movable visual feast, The shores on both sides of the Bospheros are mezmerizing: so many beautiful structures and gardens. The traffic on the water is continually fascinating, and the 1.5-2.00 break at turnaround point just shy of the Black Sea is good for a seafood meal at one of the open air, waterside cafes. Save a few Euros by bringing your own deli lunch and drink from istanbul and eat on the ferry or hike to a [relatively] secluded spot and have a picnic. The sunset return to istanbul (if your timing is good) is unforgetable.

Just Beautiful!. We stayed at a hotel on the Bosphorus and was able to look at it everyday. It is beautiful and full of constant activity. A boatride on the Strait is an absolute must! So much to see!

Not to be missed. One of the best things we did. Very relaxing! This is a nice change of pace after visiting museums and attractions. It was a nice day and took great pictures. It was informative and well worth it.

Turbulent Bosphorus. A Bosphorus cruise is a must when visiting Istanbul. Ocean liners, ferries, tankers and freighters, tour boats and a myriad of fishing boats make the broad access to the Black Sea busy, and the shore is lined with beautiful homes, mosques, Inns, and an enormous castle that guards this major waterway. The steep hillsides are lined with apartments, and in the background you can see the tops of the City's skyscrapers. On one bank is Europe, on the other Asia, and Istanbul is the only City that lies on both continents.

Get yourself a boat trip.. Took the one and a half hour boat trip up the Bosphorous river, stopping for 3 hours and then one and a half hour return trip. Had lovely seafood platter at the local fishing village for less than 20 Turkish lira. Nice views and a refreshing break, from city life, to experience the rural setting of Turkish life. A little cold in November but the inside cabin had fresh tea/coffee and central heating !. Beautiful apple tea, well worth a try.

Nice change of pace. I was here in 2006 but didn't have the time for the cruise. This time it was a beautiful day for it and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Didn't feel like schlepping up to the fort at the last stop so just chilled out near the dock with the dogs and cats.
Magic. You are between Europe and Asia, it is a magic feeling. The fishermen, the sounds, the smells, it is really nice. If you decide to take a cruise, be aware to take it in a sunny day better

Take the ferry - it's great value. Take the ferry or one of the small private boats if you want a less commercialised view of the Bosphoros. Day trip is very interesting but by night the same area comes alive and is very romantic. Make sure to take something to cover your shoulders as it can get quite cool on the water.
A way to get a sense of Istanbul's size. We went up the Borphorus on a chartered dinner cruise ... definitely a comfortable and delightful way to do it.
Relax. Bring your camera and read up before you get on one of the tour boats. They don't go over what you are passing and there are many palaces and castles that you pace by that have a great story!
Nostalgic Trip. I use to go through the Bosphorus in and out of the Black Sea as a young sailor. Try the trip on one of the private cruise ferries, it was great and good value.
Cruise was wonderful. We took an hour long cruise. Very relaxing, but chilly in November. Dress for a breezy ride going.

Catch a ferry if you get the chance. Love riding the ferry, including the car ferry across The Bosphorus. I love the water. And seeing how busy the water traffic is. Amazing views and experiences. And the bridges are spectacular. Do love this experience.

Enjoy the perfect sunset. It's impressive! There are plenty of boats connecting Europe with Asia and sunsets on the strait are something to enjoy from the light house island. A huge bridge links both continents and a subway will also be available soon.

Historic Waterway. Many options for boat tour - can be combined with land tour. A walk on the lower level of the Galata Bridge and a meal in one of the restaurants is the best viewpoint of the Golden Horn and the Bosphorous.
A river tour -a must. This river tour tells the story of the critical lotation of Istanbul. Wonderful and relaxing.
Boat Ride. Great seeing old and new together on this trip from the water side

Teaming with people and boats. A boat tour of the Bosphorus will help to give perspective of the European and Asian sides of Istanbul. The strait is a hubub of tankers, fishing boats, passenger boats. Fascinating to watch the straits themselves which are quite choppy and have a fast moving current.

great way to get perspective of both the Asia and Europe side of Istanbul. take the ferry across from the European to the Asian side and walk thru the market on the Asian side. Very cheap ride. Takes about two hours with stroll thru the mall and cafes.
Interesting one day trip. If you have kids along you can take a boat trip from Eninou pier and go up to the last village before the Bosphorus Strait flow into the Black Sea.

Bosphorus Strait. Take the cruise of the Bosphorus Strait and be prepared to take lots of pictures. The guides are wonderful and extremely informative! The sell drinks and snacks on the ferry. Also is you so desire, there are many wonderful restaurants along the coastline. Galata Bridge also offers many wonderful restaurants looking onto the strait!

A wonderful slow day to take in Turkey. We did one of the ferry rides down the Straight that stopped at a small town on the Asia side for lunch. It is a great way to relax and take in some views that many will miss. Great for photos.

Where Asia meets Europe... Bogazici, Bosphorus, is one of the wonders of the world I believe.. So many nice things to see... You can take a 1 hour tour from Kabatas port (leaves 10:30am) and have a short trip over the Bosphorous. Enjoy the beautiful old yet renovated houses (millions of dollars worth), beautiful parks, fishing men from the sea... Get your camera ready for the beautiful scenes.. This is a life-time experience.. you won't regret!

Miserable in the rain glorious in the sun. I went on two trips of the the Bosphorus - the first in the pouring rain which was a bad idea. It was so wet the windows were constantly fogged up and it was too miserable to go outside. Two weeks later I went on a glorious, sunshine filled day and it was magic.
If you like ferries ....... The ferries and the Bosphorus cruise are both wonderful. It reminded me of Sydney harbour with ferries whereever you look.
Be independant. Great. Take the ferry from Eminonu to the last stop up the Asian side then catch a bus back to Uskudar ferry terminal and see the sun set over the Golden horn on the way back. Ace

A different perspective of Istanbul. If you have enough time to work in a Bosphorus Cruise when you're visiting Istanbul, it allows you to have a great view of Rumeli Fortress, the Dolmabahce Palace, lovely homes along the water, and numerous mosques. We went on one of the Turyol boats which was inexpensive and lasted about two hours for the roundtrip. It was rather cool the day we went, but it would be wonderful with warmer weather--and a great way to give your feet a rest from all the walking in shopping in Istanbul!

Relaxing with good photo ops. We took TWO cruises. The 6-hour cruise took us into the Black Sea, with a stop at a village with an old fort high atop the steep climb. The view was beautiful although the steep climb was tough. The second stop was a beautiful village with fish stalls and a bit of shopping. Food on the cruise was good, loved this longer trip. Narrator told of sites along the route. Shorter trip took us to a restaurant, and our bus drove us back. It was nice, but we had been spoiled by our longer cruise. If you have time, take the 6-hour one.
Cruise Bosphorus. Nice to see, 1.5 hours is a bit long especially in the winter.

A geographic discovery. Like many we decided to take the commuter ferry from Eminonu to Anadolu Kacagi to see the palaces and towns along the Bosphorus Strait. The ferry stops several times along the way, but we wanted to see the Black Sea so we stayed on till the last stop. Just watching the palaces, bridges, and neighborhoods go by is fascinating but what really was amazing to me was watching all the commercial and fishing vessels that travel back and forth on a daily base. Definitely an experience that needs to be done. Once we got to Anadolu Kacagi the ferry stopped there for 3 hours and with time to kill we climbed to the top of the hill were we explored the ruins of the Yoros Kalesi which was a castle first built by the Byzantines. The view from there is extraordinary, you can see from the Black Sea, all the way down the Bosphorus Strait, to the Sea of Marmara. We took tons of pictures! After the ruins we walked back down to the small fishing village and enjoyed a great fish lunch at one of the restaurants along the port. The 3 hours passed really quickly and before we knew it was time to go back to the ferry. All in all it took about 6 hours for the whole trip, but it was an amazing day!

Ride the public ferry!. Cruise the Bosphorus on the public ferry leaving from Eminonu! Since it was fall, the shiop was less than half full. Beautiful views from the open top decks, warm views from the inner areas. Pick a sunny day, then tghis is a memorable cruise. Boat goes to Anadolu Kavagli, which has very little other than restaurants with aggressive pitchment. Recommend jumping off at Sariyer.... the ship stops for pickup the the return. Beautiful sunset over the city on return! Price around $13 for a day of delightful scenes.

A paradise for fishermen and romantic people. I walked through all the Bosphorus strait and i was impressed by the number of fishermen i shaw and also the boats that make the local tours.Although in some parts of the strait the waters turn to be dirty...

Worth doing. We took the trip starting at 10.30, which involves a 1.5-hour trip up to the Black Sea, where there's a 3-hour stop at Anadolu Kavagi, returning to the starting point at 4.30. We went in October, and it was cold on the boat, so take something warm if you want to sit outside where the best views are. Having a guide book of some kind will mean you get the most out of the trip, as there are many points of historical interest along the way. We had a Lonely Planet. To pass the time at Anadolu Kavagi, it's worth walking up to the ruined fortress (which you can't enter) for great views of the Black Sea, but it's a very steep hike, so only for the reasonably fit. I couldn't have done it in mid-summer. Back down in town, we went to a restaurant called Baba on the far left as you enter the port, where we sat by the water and had very good calamari and mezes.

Amazing. They offer a boat trip that costs 20 liras`per person but I dont recomend. It's full and very touristic. The best thing is to rent your own boat for 300 liras and enjoy the amazing trip to the Bosphorus Strait and see the asian side.
a nice cruise.... nice,took the ship from the old bridge and cost me less than the guides sell...a 1 1/2 hour cruise that u can relax and enjoy!

The boat ride, views of architecture and forests, just amazing. The boat ride, views of architecture and forests, just amazing.We took a tour with a guide. bus picked us up at the hotel. boat was heated and spacious with snacks.Views and stopovers were fantastic!

Panoramas of Istanbul. The public ferry gives visitors the chance to see many new sites (e.g. the various palaces, yalis/wooden summer retreats and bridges) at leisure on both the European and Asian sides. Plus, different views of the pricipal sites and the main mosques. Approaching the terminal at Eminonu at sunset was just magical - depend on time of year. Arrive in good time for ferry - becoming more popular with tourists as well as locals. At the end of the ride is a 2 hour stay with the chance to walk up to the Genoese Fortress and sample the local fish restaurants - the Yosun at the waterfront and the one part way up - same owner - are excellent, the latter having fine views.

A boat trip up to the Black Sea. Take a ferry up to the Black Sea where it is possible to hop off and climb a small mountain/hill, to find a lovely view (very romantic) and some ruins. While on the boat, make sure to sit outside on either side of the ferry, to get a view of the coastline. Very interesting to see the different houses. It was also fun to spend time between Europe and Asia like that.

Istanbul by Water. The transport system in Istanbul is first class in that it's plentiful and cheap. The ferries across the Bospherus form part of the system and they are a great way to view the city. As with the trams you buy a token and hop on the next one to come along.We didn't go on any of the longer trips but used the shorter crossings to zig zag our way up and down the strait. Next time we go we'll be venturing a little farther afield on the water.

hustle bustle. went on the bosphorus cruise. This you must experience. it lasts inbetween 1 and 2 hours. Lots of photo oportunities. Lots of beautiful mosques and old buildings .. the architecture is amazing..From the boat you can see both the european side of Istanbul and also the asian side..amazing

Take a boat tour, only 10 TL for 2 hours!. A facinating stretch of river, best seen on a boat tour. I was suprsed at the price being so reasonable. Only 10TL fr a 2 hour round cruise. There is a 4 hour one on offer, but to be honest 2 was enough!
Good and informative. It was good and get a glance of various parts of Istanbul through the Bosphorus Cruise. Good and informative experience!

Wonderful way to experience the Bosphorus. We tool the large boat opposite the tram station. Walking under the subway to the cross to the other end there is interesting road-side shopping. The tickets for teh 2 hour ferry we took were TL 10 (I think). The Ritz concierge recommended this over the night cruise and we think it was the right choice. The boat follows the right bank first with Ayasofia,Blue Mosque, Topkapi on the right. Get on the upper deck and get a seat. Have warm clothes. The crowd is pretty easy so even if you don't have a seat, they will let you stand at the railings. Carry some bread for the sea gullsGet the audio guide, the guide and the map are well worth it since there are so many buildings that you tend to get lost without it. The seaside homes of royalty and really nice and all are different. On the way back, you see the other bank with the Dolmache palaces.Plan this so that you are returing during sun-set. We saw the sun-set over the Blue Mosque and Sofia. It is a superb sight. In winter the sun-set was around 4:30-5.00 pmThe ferry leaves right opposite the Spice Market so you can go to the market before the ferry and then get on to the ferry
The best boat trip. Get on a boat trip and prepare to find amazing sights and authentic palaces by the sea
take a boat ride. we took a boat ride down the Bosphorus and all enjoyed that different view of the city, especially the Asian side of Istanbul

One of the nicest things to do in Istanbul!. The tour we took was pretty cheap (around 10 Turkish liras, equivalent to 6 or 7 USD). It was so cold, but who cares! we kept on taking photos and feeding the sea gulls that are pretty bold and ready to steal your food at any time! We toured around Istanbul and saw the lovely bridges that connect the two sides of Istanbul. We also saw the fancy villas that are built just next to the Bosphorus.
Loved it 2 continents right away!. Took the 1 day bus tour that goes all over istanbul city and up to the Bosphrous bridge that crossed over the Asia then back to Europe.
best is the sunset cruise on saturday. book your trip directly at the port, it is much cheaper than agencies through the hotel or leaflets
Good way to discover istanbul. Goood expierence to discover most of the good places in istanbul from sea.

A must do. I took the TDI full boat cruise on the Bosphorous. We started at 10:30 AM and got back by 4:30 with a 3 hour stop on the way and a nice hike upto a castle. It was an amazing boat ride which gives a great view of the city and also a nice tour between the european and asian parts of turkey. I had the DK eyewitness guide of Turkey which does help you relate to the boat ride. This is a must do for people visiting Istambul and if you do not have enough time there is a shorter, non-stop version of the tour.
Anadolu Kavagi. The trip was the best idea. But do not miss Anadolu Kavagi ... The view and the touch to the Black sea is unique.

Interesting experience. It was an interesting experience to be in 2 continents at the same time. Bosphorus strait separates Asia and Europe part of Turkey. We took the normal ferry ride from Uskudar to Besiktas and it lasted only for max 10 minutes. I guess its better to experience the Bosphorus Ferry tour for half day!The birds are everywhere, its beautiful and relaxing to see. We commute in the morning before lunch time. Its not so crowded and the weather is always perfect!

1.5 hr glimpse of the Bosphorus. Unfortunately we didn't have the 4 hours required for the guided Bosphorus tour. So we settled for the TL 10 pp unguided Bosphorus boat tour. it would have been nice if we had a bit of recorded explanation in a variety of languages. Since we didn't have the time, we were satisfied to have the chance to spend the 1.5 hr ride up and down the waterway, looking at the waterfront views. The tour was adequate (food and drink sold on board) for the price and the time we had. we got a glimpse.

Take a boat tour. We took the Bosphorus tour (actually a tour explains the sights, this was more like a boat making the crossing, no comments, no sight identification), but it was a different way of seeing the Asian side and the many beautiful "millionaires homes".

A sail on a beautiful day. Half an afternoon on the Bosphoris and Golden Horn was excellent. The Ottoman architecture on both the Asian and European shores was beautiful. It was hard to grasp just how massive Istanbul is.
A real treat. wonderful to be on the boat and stop at the end for lunch by the sea

The boat trip was pleasant, but it is not a must.. This channel offers beautiful views and I do think the boat trip we did was cool. Eventhough, It was so long and on the way back, we felt a bit bored (it lasts almost 3 hours). I don´t consider that a must, but if you have at least 3 days in Istanbul, worth it.

Cruise Along the Bosphorus. Taking a cruise along the Bosphorus is another great way to see more of Istanbul. However, be careful to ask the cruise salesman for a picture or a description of the boat, because not all cruise lines are the same.
Take the boat tour long or short!. Its a fun ride, but bring your own guide book as the english speaking tour guide they provide sounds as good as the kid taking your order at a fast food drive-thru.
where east meets west. take a boat, weather just 90 min short trip or the day long public ferry all the way to the black sea.
A piece of history. It was very busy but worth seeing just to put a face to all the history

A place worth visiting.. This is one of the few places on Earth from where you can see two continents. Standing on the European side you can look across to the Asian side and then, crossing one the bridges, you can stand in Asia and look at Europe.
